ZGGSjoDzw5knxiCY7G-pKA.text: I finally found a decent local Italian restaurant. The complimentary garlic bread served in the beginning put us to a great start.  The food was good but nothing special about it. The grapefruit juice I ordered was not what I expected; I did not enjoy it at all.. I'll be back another time to try some more dishes

1xTU_oNq0Xx0N7GA4zEykw.text: Great service, good food, live music, lots of parking and excellent decor.  Nora's Cuisine made a great first impression on me.  Good wine selection and full bar was another plus.  I definitely want to go back.

g3NMd3NE8D1hpgASa24gSw.text: I will definitely be returning! From the appetizer (steak bruschetta), to the yummy red sangria and the food that my family and I had.....AH-FREAKIN-MAZING! So tasteful, very nice atmosphere with servers who don't let your glass go half empty! Everyone was so nice and the atmosphere is romantic without the overkill and lovely ambient lighting! When you're excited about eating left overs....you know the place is one in a million!

bZhhZdb_kXTzQ8vBqPa0tw.text: Mmmm what Italian food dreams are made of. Delicious no matter what I order, I personally love the eggplant parm, the caprese, the garlic bread is amaze, the chicken piccata and the veal Milanese. Good service and vey good food.

ot8a2sqaombd-GQnRTqE-A.text: After seeing the response from the manager/owner I feel compelled to update.   Look, I'm not insulting your customers, I'm insulting your food. Actually, the description I gave was more a compliment because I could have been a lot more brutal.   It's kind of like The Varsity in Atlanta. If you like greasy burgers in cheap white buns, somewhat  average chili over an even more average hot dog, then it's your place! The place has been around for years and it has a loyal band of Georgia Tech alumni that would swear by nothing else. To them, it's comfort food and brings back memories of their school days - and that's great. It's been around for 50 years and it'll be there another 50 years... It doesn't change the fact that the food is crap but their customers will rave about how great it is.   I think it must be the same with your place. You have loyal customers, for whatever reason, but don't even begin to pretend that you're dishing out good Italian food, because you're not. Well, not to me you aren't. I'm comparing it to Italian food that I know to be good. I've been all over the world - including Italy - and I know the difference. Your food is no different to what you would get out of a Stouffers box or at an Olive Garden.

LmohSkcRPXZ12owlhIVOpg.text: Came here for an evening meal, not sure what to expect at all. First thing I noticed, LIVE MUSIC! Instantly liked  the place. Complimentary bread and even got a free glass of wine for checking in through Yelp. Fantastic. The food was similar to Olive Garden but seemed a little more genuine Sicilian taste. Will be back.

llaK_CFy74oiKm9AnvqAuQ.text: We ate at Nora's last night.  Customer service was excellent.  Food was really good, but their cheesecake was the bomb!  Best we've ever had!  Great dining experience.  Never felt rushed and had the sense they really enjoyed us being there.

77sHzGlERHrwitF4-U_ZRA.text: This place is so overrated.  What a disappointment!  We were sent here on some very high recommendations.  I just can't figure out all the fuss??  The garlic bread is a soggy sliced sub roll with butter and no real garlic flavor.  The fried calamari was terrible!  Soggy and greasy, no crunch at all and a pool of grease on the bottom of the plate.  The chicken parm was another disappointment.  2 small chicken tenders, a little sauce, a little cheese, a little pasta, and a pool of water on the bottom of the plate.  An Italian restaurant that serves pasta swimming in water??  C'mon that ain't right.  It's not overly expensive, but for the portion and the quality, it's still a rip-off!  Oh, and the parking is a joke.  I suppose its because the place is so crowded (no idea why), or maybe its the bar, or maybe the fast food place... whatever the reason, good luck finding a parking place.  No reason to give this place a second try.

pEvW2uv1m3OBlwXqaSS08A.text: I guess their one bad dish is the one I got...Chicken Parm.  It was tiny (definitely not $13 worth of chicken-I actually thought it was an appetizer).  It's not breaded and had no taste.  Their marinara is pretty bland, very watery.  I noticed most everyone on here gets a dish that doesn't involve their marinara.  Their garlic bread was good.  My son liked the Fettuccine Alfredo a lot.  The service was friendly, but slow to get the food to the table.  I guess I would try this again, but would order something different.  Do not get the Chicken Parm.

1IyUfblLdodQtu4KoVxbxQ.text: Unsure why this restaurant is rated so high.  The young boys who greet guests at the door and bus the tables were lovely and adorable but the food was really average or less than average.  I visited Nora's many years ago and was disappointed but after hearing so many positive things, I decided to go back - eager, hungry and with an open mind.  I figured I must have visited on an "off" night before.  Nope.  Quite mediocre.  Food quality seemed greasy and cheap.  Fried Calamari:  Greasy but certainly edible (2.5 stars) Caprese Salad: Mozzarella (5 stars), tomatoes (less than 1 star) Tortellini with Vodka Sauce and added chicken:  pretty tasty (3.5 stars) Garlic Bread:  Tasty but cheap and I am huge bread fan (2.5 stars) Chicken Parm - terrible, way too salty (1 star)  Soda: crisp and bubbly (5 stars) espresso:  strong with great flavor (5 stars)  Ambience: bustling, a bit noisy because they are so busy, jubilant crowd during baseball game on bar TV, pleasant staff....This is a regular ol' family restaurant.

-nDBO8HjqmEu1GK0OKzMgQ.text: I recommend making dinner reservations b/c this place gets super crowded! Can't be mad about it though b/c the food here is delicious. ;) I like to try a different pizza and pasta every time I come here, especially for lunch to avoid a crowd.

v7BHAljxHpkFvhEPhlMHwg.text: This little Italian place tucked away in West Las Vegas is absolutely awesome.  It's a decent drive away from Las Vegas, located close to Spring Valley.  As the others have said, the Garlic Bread is absolutely spectacular, just the perfect touch to any meal.  The food is quite authentic and will not disappoint.  The meatballs were extremely tender and the pasta was very fresh.  For any coffee lover, the expresso here is very good as well.  There isn't a single thing on the menu that I would shy away from.  As for the environment, the interior is quite cozy and good for a time out with friends or maybe even a casual date.  The noise isn't too loud nor is it awkwardly quiet, which makes it easy to catch up and maintain a conversation.  The service was good; however, at peak times it seems like they are understaffed.  The wait can sometimes be long if you don't call in advance for reservations.  Nonetheless, it is worth the wait.  Also, the parking lot is quite small, so you have to plan some time in advance to get a space or to park in the surrounding neighborhood.

HU0qsRNkAKWNQ8ZNksVN0g.text: Food was good and reasonable. We shared a mozzarella caprese salad. The mozzarella and salad were wonderful, but the tomatoes sub- par. The beau had orange ruffey and enjoyed his meal. I had shrimp scampi, not bad, but it doesn't compare to Cheesecake Factory. We shared a chocolate souffle. Who serves souffle without vanilla ice cream? But if they did, it would be the best I've ever had, hands down! Its so sweet you'll either need a glass of milk or some ice cream (hint hint Nora). The service for us was below expectation. Trey was Inattentive to say the least. I could see him leaning against a wall by the bar instead of checking to see how the food was or if we needed anything. They had a band jazzing it up at 9PM, which certainly set the mood. Overall I would return. The food was good and we paid under a bill for two.

l3-ldtlVwMZXswNmk6VfZg.text: We had our food to go so this review so I can't speak for the dining in experience. We came across this place on one of those nights were nobody feels like cooking and after attempting two other Italian places that were listed as open on Yelp but turned out to be closed, we found Nora's.   Al Prosciutto Pizza - 4 Stars. Think a combination of regular run of the mill pizza with better ingredients. The crust wasn't super thick or super thin, def. not the artesianal-type but not chain-style either, rather just a nice middle ground. It had very little - basically no sauce or cheese as the first layer. The crust had been brushed nicely with olive oil and perhaps a light dusting of parmesan and large slices of sun dried tomatoes. The arugula and Prosciutto were added after baking but while the pizza was still hot, giving the greens a nice bit of wilt without being mushy, then more parmesan sprinkled on top. The only down side to this pizza was just too much garlic, and we actually like garlic, but this just had a bit too much. Deduct one star for that. I wouldn't want to have eaten it on a first date! If we ordered again we would just ask to hold the garlic. Other than that, great pizza. We had plenty of leftovers.   Spinach, Gorgonzola and Farro Salad - 4 Stars. The farro was nice and tender and topped with a generous portion of fresh spinach. The salad was rimmed with large slices of fresh, firm tomatoes and topped with crumbled gorgonzola. The salad losses a star due to slightly too much dressing for our taste. I would ask for dressing on the side next time, but other than that, a really nice, fresh and simple salad.   Rigatoni Special - 4 Stars. I wouldn't likely order this dish again, but that is because I don't happen to care for most of the meats in it, not that is wasn't good. The pasta was cooked to a nice texture and the sauce had a good flavor. A nice red sauce with just enough oil and spice to give it a little kick. The amount of meat in the dish was generous and the meatballs were flavorful and tender. The Italian sausage slices were what you'd expect, but if that's a flavor you like, then you'd be pleased. The sauteed green peppers were sliced very thick, making it so you could really taste their flavor as opposed to be little diced pieces you might miss in the dish.   Pasta Fagioli Soup - 3 Stars. I didn't care for this dish so much. I felt it was lacking in a bit of taste - maybe some salt or something. It had a generous amount of beans and pasta, and the pasta wasn't mushy, so I'll just chalk this up the fact it just wasn't quite my thing, not that it is bad per-se.   Bottom line, the place was pretty good and the prices were right. We'd definitely eat here again and check out some other menu items.

bPaUIU7R6nHEPn1BctfDHA.text: 3 visits to Nora's Cuisine this week .......love this place. 10 minutes off the "strip" and a world away from the plastic bullshit that is Las Vegas. The food is absolutely first class, the service is terrific, the noise level is low, pricing is so reasonable. Do yourself a favor , escape the Vegas tourist traps, try Nora's, you will love it

ZD9F55u556W9qw78PDZcPg.text: Really delicious home-made tasting Italian food. The garlic bread is amazing. Wine is pretty good too.

Oxui4_SErXlRnR-vdVReUw.text: Nora's is legendary for Las Vegas. Every local tells their friends that this is the spot. I think it is for a few specific reasons. Food quality is always good and the dishes are consistent. Sequence and consistency of service is always on point. it is always busy. Everytime I have went, there is a small wait (not bad) because they are busy turning tables. Their operation is very efficient with scheduling. The price point is very afforadble and of course they are the home team favorite. They are the underdog off the strip. All that contributes to the fierce loyalty they receive from their customers. I would even dare to say they are like the Rao's of Las Vegas. No, they don't have a 3 month wait and their tables aren't owned by certain families and you have to get approval from them to sit there or anything silly like that, but you might want to be prepared for fisticuffs if you say anything negative about this place in certain circles.   I joke. . .  I checked in and they gave me a comp glass of wine. I made the entire table check in and they gave a comp carafe! Score! Winner! Winner! I think it was also because it was my girls birthday.  I only gave it 4 stars because of the atmosphere. I know they tried a second restaurant and it didn't do as good. I think that was probably because it lost some of its mom and pop charm that the original stores oozes. I too would have some hesitation on doing too many upgrades in order to not disturb an already successful business, but there has to be a happy medium that can be achieved where the design of the space can be more indicative of their food quality.   The lighting does not have enough highlights or shadows in the room. It is all diffused mid-tones so nothing stands out. There is no contrast on the walls. The ceiling has some ornate feature that I couldn't really make out. I like the pizza/app guy at the front as you walk in and a long bar inviting you to start there, but other than that the chairs and tables and lighting threw me off making me want a cooler atmosphere but it would not deter me from going there time and time again. The vibe was a little ho-hum. What about a little music in the background? Doesn't have to be themed to italian, adult contemporary could work too. I understand music is a big commitment as well. In addition it will also increase the overall ambience of the room and I noticed quite a few people that have most likely been going there for years (perhaps decades). They won't like the higher noise level, but it will most likely increase the length and purchase of the customer visit.  Ok I am rambling. The place is good. Eat there and love it.

F7N-dnEa7DX-yhjZb0l-Xg.text: easily the greatest bruschetta ever.  The warm crisp bread with a soft dense center is topped with the perfect blend of sweet tomatos and olive oil and herbes and all around magic that makes it undeniable.  Already craving to go back and I just ate there last night.  The yelp offer of one free glass of wine also tops off a perfect round of plates.  I got the tri blend tortellini with the vodka sauce that was definetly solid and nice.  (i might have added a few veggies like peas or carrotts to it, but the dish was still great)  and then got a tiramisu which was a great blend of flavors as well!

5kOXfOh6FvW2J7GzMxf4CA.text: My family & I really enjoyed this place. We had the shrimp scampi which was amazing. My hubby really loved the sauce used for the shrimp scampi. His exact words were "this sauce is so good I want to drink it" lol. And he honestly is not someone that compliments often. My daughter had the cheese pizza which was also really good. She's 7 and also made a compliment about how delicious it was. I had the linguini and clams it was pretty tasty except my hubby got the angel hair pasta with the arrabiata sauce and after I took a taste of that we ended up switching. He liked the linguini and clams better and I liked the angel hair and arrabiata better so it worked out very well. I just wanted to try something different. My husband had a cup of coffee and he said it was pretty good which is also rare for him to compliment restaurant coffee because he uses a French press at home and he swears they make the best coffee. We ended our meal with tiramisu. I have to admit as a tiramisu fan I didn't like the way it was prepared. The lady fingers were very soggy which ruined the entire flavor of the dessert. I am still giving Nora's 5 stars though due to the fact everything else was great. We will for sure go back whenever we're on that side of town.

F8qr4QupiFkBKP_mqaQjkw.text: This place is great! We came from CA with the kids and we are coming back! I don't care about any reviews this place is awesome.  Great food, great service, I might just drive back from LA for the food.

IH3LA9agWLC-dESdqJxdbA.text: We came to Nora's after reading the reviews on Yelp.... I live in. Orange County Ca.....New York & London and Im 3rd generation in the food business.... I consider Las Vegas to have the finest restaurants in the USA..... So.....in that light.... I was quite disappointed with the meals we ordered at Noras.... Scarpetta......El Molina and Ferraros are all 3 head and shoulders better than Noras.... Atmosphere.....staff and service were all very very good and Noras.... Food quality excellent.....BUT execution in the flavor department......was lacking.... I was disappointed.....they could be a 5 star Vegas based restaurant.....but it isnt  now.....

Qlo5vu2190j6OkqbbEEsmg.text: Nothing special at all. We ordered a LARGE Crazy Alfredo dish and paid $23. It was very small and tasted average. This was not worth the money. The manager assured me that it was the right size (although she couldn't see it) and I'm left feeling very disappointed.  Of course I won't go there again. I certainly didn't taste anything exceptional which I would consider before voicing my complaint. That will be my first and last experience with Nora's Italian Cuisine.

rnEv2bY8kwG7xj13HADHgg.text: Our team from work visited Nora's for our Christmas party for thr first time this year. It probably won't be the last. Our server Nina gave great service despite our continual sarcasm, loud talking as to not hear when she was taking our order, and unique requests. She had some great bussers also who were diligent in refilling our drinks. I personally had the rigatoni special and it lived up to the name, paired with the complimentary garlic bread which Nina made sure there was always plenty of, it was a great lunch location. I'll probably be back on a personal visit before next year's Christmas part.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rigatoni special lived up to its name.

4WG9V6gUIntIRUdxw76log.text: It is a great place to get your Italian food. Everything about this place is high quality: the relaxed atmosphere, delicious food, prompt and courteous service. Every item we tried was wonderful, every visit memorable.

8_vBEco9zOk-dR0AcKQ1zQ.text: I've been to Nora's multiple times and I am a lifelong fan of pappardelle noodles, but ...   My most recent dining experience tonight left me both angry and disappointed.   1. No one likes a cutter. Our reservation was at 7:45pm and we checked in 30min earlier,  but apparently that was not enough for the hostesses who chose to seat a couple that not only checked in AFTER us, but WITHOUT RESERVATION. Not cool.   2. Third times a charm to cook a steak? NO. Medium rare does NOT EQUAL well done, but the server quickly offered to re-cook a new steak. Again, medium rare does NOT EQUAL rare- the second steak was not only unappetizing to look at, but also extremely red on the inside. At this point, the MANAGER came to CONVINCE us that it was the right cut and the right level of doneness. Third steak...AGAIN- it comes back medium well, but everyone has finished eating and it has been over an hour since we sat. For better or worse, we seemed committed to this third steak.  Not cool, I know what medium rare looks like and shouldn't have to be convinced/almost bullied into accepting it.   3. Check up on us. If you and other members of your party have ACTIVELY VOCALIZED CONCERNS/COMPLAINTS about the restaurant YOU ARE MANAGING, I would recommend checking on them to assure no other problems or even to offer solutions to fix problems. No manager in sight after initial conversation. Not cool.   Overall- expect good food, but know there is a long wait and apparently inept staff from my experience tonight.

rIR4joMbDMyDhu1rLP539A.text: The service was impeccable! We will be back for sure. We enjoyed the photo booth. We did the tasting menu and it was delicious. The ambience, views, and openness of the venue was a plus.

OFrp-IyuwuTGdFQupT0vcw.text: Wow! What an amazing experience. The wait staff was amazing and the food outstanding. Highly recommend this restaurant!

CrLAapu5qfjatqhOGVW44g.text: Excellent, excellent food - and even better service! We had a house salad for the table, and a bottle of the Chicanti wine (both were delicious). For my main course, I ordered the Rigatoni Special, with meatballs, sausage, onions, bell peppers, and tomato sauce. It was delectable. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the noodles were just the right amount of al dente. Our server / waitress was incredibly attentive. Not once was my water glass less than half full, and whenever my wine glass approached empty, she was there to pour me another from the bottle. Thank you, Nora's! We will definitely be back again.

1YWg7199oI4Vh9BA4Suvow.text: The best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  Environment: The inside is beautiful. After moving into their new location roughly a year ago, the interior finally lives up to the standard of the food which they serve. The restaurant is bright and open with an abundance of seating ranging from indoors, to a patio, to private rooms, and to a full-service bar. Each section of the restaurant has its own drawing points so I am never disappointed where I am sat. Interestingly, my favorite place to dine is up at the bar. It is clean and spacious and allows for easier conversation if you are on a date, however when I come with groups I opt for a table. Additionally, the open kitchen is nice and adds some ambience. Finally, there have been a couple times where I have come in during the evening sand there has been a live band which adds yet another classy touch to the restaurant.  Food: If the restaurant itself wasn't so nice, it's the food which has me coming back every time. Everything I have tried here has been excellent. I have tried various appetizers such as the grilled octopus, fried calamari, arancini, and the clams and each one has been delicious. For the main dish, I never miss ordering the rib-eye steak and the fettuccini carbonara. The steak is always cooked beautifully with tons of flavor, and it pairs perfectly with the creamy pasta. Additionally, their garlic bread Is phenomenal. They serve it complimentary and are very good about grabbing you more once you finish yours. We usually go through about 5 baskets during and before dinner and always take some home too because it is just that good! Their cocktails are nice too, and I have tried several them but I always end coming back to their house sangria which is the best I have ever had. It tastes so fresh and fruity without sacrificing being too sweet.  Service: Service is up to par with a classy restaurant as I mentioned before the waiters are always eager to get you anything you need without being invasive. Additionally, when I have sat at the bar the bartenders are very personable and helpful with recommending drinks and dishes and making conversation throughout the meal.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone I have recommended has loved it just as much as I had, so I will be back again and again and again!

_kCwaijPgwG1TBxVzZspTg.text: I used to go to this place years ago when they were a quaint restaurant and now they have expanded into a bigger more upscale place similar to their other location in Summerlin which closed. Their food is not as good as it used to be but still good. Great Ambience and service is good too! I do recommend this place to everyone!

YAYQ8oX-UszhXPmbydaXXQ.text: Excellent food. The pizza was great with a nice crust and the cheese was amazing. We got the salami with a antipasto salad. The dressing on the salad was one of the best vinaigrette's I have had. Would definitely go back especially to try their pasta dishes which I saw being served to other tables and looked amazing.

tM1_vhmtEef3qDsFM560NA.text: We love Nora's! The lemon drops are phenomenal. They light a lemon slice on fire before adding it to your drink. It's pretty cool. The Arancini are amazing! It's a fried risotto ball served with marinara. Arguably the best thing on the menu. Tonight I had the Alla Nora pasta and my husband had the ribeye with truffle fries. The pasta was great and was a huge serving. It had piece of eggplant baked on the top that wasn't mushy like eggplant tends to be. The ribeye was okay...my husband like it but fell in love with the truffle fries (again, a huge portion). Food isn't cheap but it's worth it. We will continue to return for date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KIlwDTpeVBUK2LDu6A_HFQ.text: This is my new favorite Italian spot! We had the fried calamari and linguine w/ clams - probably the best linguine with clams I've ever had - the sauce was really flavorful and they gave you tons of clams! Bug shout out to our waiter (I think Don)...we told him we had a show to catch and he got us in and out in 45 min (w/ dessert). The service was fantastic and food was awesome! I'll definitely be back next time I come to Vegas!

9z994rBaKL2cjg_70UwxxQ.text: Great food, start to finish, we will be back many times, thank you

eUjcFktsXhZqKWfJht8fcQ.text: First of all, they do take reservations online which I highly encourage to do. The restaurant was very busy even though it was a Wednesday night. Jessika was our server and she gave great service. She didn't make us feel rushed when we took forever and a day to look at the menu. She was very informative when explaining the menu and was very friendly despite how busy it was and how busy she clearly was.  As a starter we ordered the pork belly. It was tender and melted in our mouths, however the edges were a bit burnt so it would have been perfect without the burnt parts. As the entree I ordered the crazy alfredo but I asked to substituted the pasta for angel hair pasta. My dish was delicious, the only thing I wished was that I rememebered to ask to have it without the jalapenos. The shrimp portion was generous and I enjoyed the creamy sauce. My husband ordered the rib eye. The first parts of the steak was cooked medium well rather than the medium rare he had asked for, but as he continued down the rib eye it was cooked more toward his liking. His rib eye came with truffle fries, which were mostly eaten by me, haha. We had to get our food taken to go. Jessika did mention that the portions were fairly large, but when she said that I didn't know she meant it was enough for 3 meals. No complaints though. It means no cooking the day after which is always a plus for me. For dessert we had the chocolate lava cake with some kind of pistachio sauce. The center was perfectly gooey and went deliciously with the sauce. The reason why I put 4 stars for this experience however is because the section we were put in was with large parties and they were really loud. I felt like I was yelling so my husband can hear me talking. When we come again, I will remember to make a note on my reservation if we can be in a quieter spot in the restaurant.

pORMDd0c4uH6Z0XBMSxd2Q.text: Good Italian food at a reasonable price since it's off the strip. Will definitely be coming back again.

xDJAlFApzGfI4YDmgaTX1Q.text: Excellent food and presentation!  I had always heard great reviews about this place but never actually made it out there until this past weekend.  I'm definitely coming back and bringing clients!

T7Z0K2mGCZ2MYC6TkeHXKw.text: Nora's Cuisine has been seen as Las Vegas's best kept secret since opening in 1991. I recently was let in on that secret when I was on West Flamingo with a strong craving for Italian Food. When I walked in I noticed the decor of dark cherry and textured paint on the walls. My first condo was decorated  similar so it felt very inviting. The limited seating also made for a cozy dining experience.  We were brought some complimentary garlic bread almost immediately after being seated. The aroma from the bread was intoxicating but when I bit into the bread the grease was too heavy that I felt it on the roof of my mouth. I've had better garlic bread so I just moved on to the Caesar Salad. The Romaine lettuce was crisp and lightly coated with homemade dressing.  Honestly the croutons that topped the salad were much better than the bread and the Caesar dressing was perfect.   I was torn between the Chicken and Veal Parmigiana so I asked the waiter his favorite out of the two. He said he preferred the Veal. When I can't decide sometimes I ask for the waiter's advice as a tie breaker but it doesn't always go so well . I'm happy to say this time the waiter knew what he was talking about! The veal was tender inside with crispy outer breading. It was served  over a tasty marinara sauce and topped with a healthy dose of mozzarella cheese. I also tested my husband's Baked Rigatoni which was made with a meat sauce, rigatoni, ricotta and mozzarella cheeses. My impression at first bite was it was too salty. It tasted better the next day.   On a sweeter note we had the Oreo Tartufo for dessert. It was a ball of cookies and cream ice cream covered with a hard chocolate shell. It was big enough to share and small enough where you wouldn't  feel sorry you ate it. It was sinfully delicious!   Nora's is great place for date night or a family dinner. The portions are generous and the service is excellent!

w_ynrhzNIeiTESNLWLakdg.text: My wife and I went here on NYE 2017. Sebastian was our waiter and did such an amazing job it prompted this review. If you have the privilege to go here and be served by Sebastian you will have a phenomenal experience. Food was awesome. Cannolis are the best in town. Whiskey Sour was the best I've ever had. I will be returning over and over again!

V1_ecxqzOBLqEXyXbqcDTg.text: Went here last night for dinner, didn't know it even existed until then, a local took us here and wow the food and service were spot on.   We had a big party so we were only able to get family style but it was great.   Bruschetta was probably beat I've ever had, the pasta was great and the lamb chops and veal were delicious.   Service was the best, the manager even came over to say hi and check on us.

YEnPLpuNKK0uF89btl45Vg.text: Got some takeout from here today..  Ordered the Crazy Alfredo Caesar Salad Calamari  Everything was pretty good, but honestly nothing really stood out to me as craveworthy.  Crazy Alfredo was pretty good, a TON of meat. Pretty rare that you run out of noodles before protein, but I was left with a pile of chicken and sausage after all the noodles were gone. Flavor of the sauce was decent, tasted like a bell pepper alfredo sauce.  Caesar salad was a bit disappointing. Not bad by any means, but it is pretty hard to mess up a caesar salad. The dressing was just a bit too creamy for my liking and didnt have that tangy salty flavor Im used to with caesar salads. Could use some shaved parmesan too.  Calamari was just good, pretty basic dish. The sauce was interesting though.  The main downsides were an hour wait for pickup even though the restaurant wasnt exactly packed, there were plenty of open tables. Price was a bit steep, came out to $50 for an entree appetizer and salad. Also I specifically asked if the meal comes with garlic bread and was told yes, and they forgot to put it in the bag.. pasta without garlic bread is just sad..  Probably wont come back here for a while to be honest, just nothing to write home about, and so many other places with better tasting food in Vegas for much cheaper.

NyCNgm20W487YP-ZhBpujA.text: When ever i am Vegas, i make an effort to go to Nora's Italian Cuisine.  Its a quiet oasis off the strip for good ole italian food.  The antipasto salad is one of the best.  The pastas are excellent and well proportion.  I rarely have room for dessert.  but i try that's for sure.    Do not be intimidated by the strip mall location.  once inside the doors, the restaurant brings you back in time to the local italian meals that i remember my parents take us for a special night out.  Make sure you ask to be seated the same room as the bar - a bit more atmosphere on that side of the "house".

jbmKIcdJTSJqnCZ7xkIihQ.text: We had a group of three and ordered the crazy Alfredo, cheese tortellini, and chicken marsala. I had the Alfredo and it was really good. The noodles were perfectly cooked and all the crazy ingredients were wonderful. I also tried the bourbon rabbit and couldn't believe how good it was. The bourbon had a really distinct flavor. My wife had the tortellini but unfortunately wasnt impressed. The noodles didn't seem like they were cooked long enough and were tough. Our friend had the marsala and has been here several times. He loves it and said it was good as usual. The setting was really nice, a little nicer than casual but not dressy. There was also a 4 piece band that was playing live music which really added to the atmosphere and made it that much more relaxing. Lastly the smells when you walk in are unbelievable, it smells so good my mouth was watering. If not for the tortellini it would be 5 stars.

J5U-vnFTM9MgV6KZ8YCpVA.text: Food was okay. My cousins chicken was really bland. I had the lasagna and I feel like I could of bought a frozen lasagna and it probably would have tasted better. I won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iJRTnqT4oJp0cEhDINwLsQ.text: Amazing food and service! Our waiter Sebastiano was on top of it! Can't wait to be back and bring family!

ShuF_9lKcJ3EmWnbnDsxDw.text: Maybe I had set my expectations too high, as I really enjoy a good Italian-American meal, but my dinner left me a little disappointed.   The place was packed at 6pm and even with reservations there was a wait, a less-than-friendly hostess and long waits between courses once we were seated.  Entrees were served so brusquely that even though I immediately noticed I was missing utensils the server had turned away without a word. The food was good, but not great and the noise level was rather loud.

klzEi1DqZaSw9XnG26z5EQ.text: Unfortunately I've had much better Italian food and service at other restaurants. My friend from out of town and I were both craving Italian food for her last dinner here! We stumbled on Nora's from Yelp and decided to give it a go. Like I said, I've had better service but it wasn't the worst. I will say the restaurant staff did keep up with refilling our waters, which was awesome! One of my pet peeves is when servers are not on top of water refills..I drink a lot of water while I eat.   So onto the food...hmm. Well the garlic bread was good. Hot and crispy! The first basket is free which is nice. Maybe I'm just stingy, but I was just a tiny bit annoyed to pay $2.50 more for another basket of bread. We decided on mozzarella sticks for an appetizer. They were hot and tasted like any other plate of mozzarella sticks. Tasty but nothing special about them.   My main dish was the most disappointing :( I was stuck between trying their Alfredo sauce or their pesto! I asked our waitress which one she preferred, and she just suggested I do a creamy pesto sauce to have a little of both! I thought...oooh perfect! When it came out it smelled amazing and looked like it was going to be a great dish. I took the first bite, it was okay..then I took another and was I a little confused if I liked it or not. As I kept eating all I could taste was pesto and maybe a tiny bit of cream sauce. And the pesto sauce just did not WOW my taste buds what-so-ever. I honestly took at most 10 bites and was over it..I was hoping for a wonderful Italian dinner here, and didn't find it. Instead of trying another dish, I will just try another restaurant. Sorry Nora's!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy pesto rigatoni
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella sticks!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread! Only the first basket is free

KEE6Ir_00sL04mVPPhaxYg.text: I was introduced to this place by my manager (who's previous boss came here all the time). At first I was a little startled when she said Italian food - as I'm not much of pasta person. I had came here for a special dinner and I must say - the italian food here is one of the best! The crazy pasta and the spaghetti were cooked to perfection! The crazy pasta had a little jalapeno kick to it with chicken, shrimp, tomatoes and bell peppers. The spaghetti with red sauce was cooked perfectly. It looks plain at first but the taste wasn't strong and had the right amount of basil and cheese. In the beginning, the appetizers were filling and left our party having to stop ourselves for more. Although I had to take a lot of food home I had to make room for dessert - the cannolis were the best part. This little tube of sweetness was the perfect ending for an amazing dinner! If you are looking for authentic Italian food stop by at Nora's! Make sure you call and reserve a spot for a slice of Italian heaven!

ggJQqHIYb_6XPu8-6wX3-g.text: I was really looking forward to eating at Nora's based on reviews from various media and on Yelp.  Expectations led to disappointment.  Had lunch there today, ordered calamari, pizza, and angel hair with meatballs and marinara sauce.  The calamari was the best part of the meal, actually very good.  However, the pasta and meatballs were bland, sauce did not taste like any marinara sauce I have had, and the meatballs did not seem to have any type of seasonings.  On the opposite side, the pizza was so salty, could only eat a slice, and there was something missing that I just couldn't put my finger on until I got the bill.  That's when I discovered that the Capricciosa pizza we ordered was not what we received, instead our waiter, Travis, brought us a All 4 Stagioni; considering all the stuff on the pizza, no way could we tell what they were serving anyway and seeing our bill it all made sense about why the pizza tasted so different than what we were expecting.  Then to top it all off, the coffee we asked for never arrived, but the bill sure did!  Look, the place is nice and airy, very clean, and maybe there are other things on the menu that may be good.  But first impressions are important, and my impression is that in Vegas you better be good all the time, not just some of the time, or first time customers like myself will not return, and I won't.

AYQyR51emkqeXwULpYDL6A.text: Great restaurant!  We came about 5:30 on a Friday and was asked if we had a reservation, but we didn't.  They still sat us down, but asked if we could finish our meal by 6:30 for the next reservation. We agreed as long as they could have the food done fast too. They said no problem.  And they did.   I ordered the Caprese Salad for an appetizer and of course filled up, so I didn't have much room for my main meal. I got the Crazy Alfredo following the advise of my fellow Yelpers.  It was Yum!!!    No room for dessert, but still finished my beer. I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese Salad

1ysy8XXqoWwWw6kkcnzuNg.text: It was my first time here and it was packed! Man do they need to expand that parking during lunch hour. It made me feel like their food would be good. When I walked up to the hostess she informed me that my company didn't have a reservation. I was a bit confused because my DM had made one on 3 days ago. I had to wait for my DM to get there and come to find out that our private room had been booked at the wrong time. It was a little difficult to conduct our meeting since we didn't get the private room but they did a good job clearing people around us. The food was pretty good and they comp us free dessert. My overall experience was good except for the part where we had to convince them that they forgot our reservation. It would have been nice for them to apologize for the mix up and possibly had a manager looked in to it. I would recommend this place on a personal day but would we hesitant if you need to make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fettuccini alfredo

w5G-D-WgT0qLuJl4GMMNsw.text: Yelpers are right again!  Stopped in for lunch around 1:30pm on a Monday and couldn't believe all the cars in the parking lot already. Good sign! Sebastio was our server and he was so nice and checked on us at the right times even offering to refill our bread basket (loved that!) We ordered pasta fagioli soup, different than I am used to but everyone has there own version but good. We ordered lunch portion spaghetti and meatball (with one meatball $6.50 plus $1.50 for an extra meatball). Our lunch was very good. I loved the sauce and the perfectly cooked pasta. I want to go back ASAP to get a full size dinner entree because everything looked excellent! Check out the ribeye pictures on the reviews it looks better than some steakhouses! By the way, I was told to make a reservation if we come for dinner as the place is full and without a reservation the wait could be well over an hour.

LXvhqe-yPG79kWzbFnR1PQ.text: If you know you're going to Nora's make a reservation at least a day before.. otherwise you'll be eating pretty late or waiting a long time. Otherwise, the bar is first come first serve. I actually prefer the bar because service is better and more prompt. Besides, the drinks here are AMAZING! My personal favorite is the Sicilian mule.  Location: The place is always busy, if you're going to relocate, why not make the restaurant larger to accommodate more people instead of having people leave due to the wait or if you call to make a reservation, not have any availability until late the night of.   Food: All the food I have tried here has been good. The fettucini carbonara, crazy alfredo, and wild boar pappardelle are great options for pasta, I also liked the Nduja pizza. They also bring out a basket of garlic bread to start, and don't be shy to ask for more. For dessert, the cannoli is soo good- I really enjoyed the mascarpone/ricotta filling.    Service: Like I mentioned before, the service is good at the bar, but at the table it can be hit or miss. Sometimes the server is attentive but sometimes you'll see them come by once in a blue moon. I've also come another time when one of our orders was not properly made, and when we spoke to the server and manager about the issue, neither handled the situation well. For a "classy" establishment, customer service should be top notch. Remaking the food is a must, but the dish should have been comped or at least provided some form of discount since the one person in our group didn't end up getting the remade order until AFTER we were almost finished with our meal.

7A98yHLhmC0oYVHH9caYAQ.text: Great food and service was spot on. Started the meal with a bourbon bunny. Had the Antipasto Salad with my friend who started with the house Cabernet. I had the wine with my ribeye for dinner. Great ribeye. My friend had the veal cannelloni. Great dish. We finished with the cheesecake. Awesome. A very good meal. The wine was perfect.

m8KT7pjMhO20BRGIxGSPPw.text: Service was pretty bad, where my family and I had waited 15 minutes before getting any attention, and they weren't busy enough to warrant us being ignored. The food was good, but our actual server served us less than the other waiters around us, who were responsible for giving us our bread, water, and napkins. It was probably just our server, but at the same time, what kind of place allows a server to give such minimal service?

LzEUhXcopG8lgbnD7qwIuA.text: So I'm a Vegas local and huge foodie. Took my girlfriend there as she had never been last weekend on Sunday night. Sat on the bar side because we wanted the music to add to our experience. Took 10 mins to be greeted by our server(male) and was rushed to order drinks and apps. Rest of experience was like we weren't even there. Waiter wasn't busy, a non caring attitude, and all around a bad server. I'm in the business and I tolerate a lot but no excuse for this server. Talking to his busser like he was below him. I wanted to say something but my girlfriend wouldn't let me.   Only reason I gave Nora's a 3 star rating is because the food is always amazing. Hopefully they don't take this server to the new location! Ruined our date night...

vNviwQ7JdCvKivseYVT1Gg.text: Love getting away from the strip and Nora's is a solid option!  All the traditional dishes and some of their own unique dishes. At least 1 large and 1 smaller private dining room.  Authentic Italian at reasonable prices without the tourist crowds.

MqJn4bliBp9nZvZIhDrh4A.text: Get some hostesses over 18 or IQ Over 50 and you might actually have some semblance of something more competent than a Chinese fire drill.  Especially when having a reservation.    Good thing food is decent or this place would be a one and done.     Bar mixologists are well trained  a positive.     The  hostesses were a solid zero tonight. Look at other reviews.   The hostesses are killing you guys.  Find someone with experience.

IJxu07fLdP_SDSFdQRqknA.text: i LOVED the old Nora's - Garlic bread that will knock your socks off, family style food with flavor!! - crowded, noisy, AWESOME...  -- the New Nora's is fancy, really beautiful with plenty of parking, and the place was packed. -- there is where it ends, Food was salty, garlic bread was meh - Service was good, with attentive waitstaff, but food was very slow to show, Soup was salty as well, and pepper bombs (peppercorn) floating at the bottom.  I MISS THE OLD NORA's

Gw7nfjSpec4FnwKk5bLgMg.text: We love this place I have been here on many different occasions. My sons 9th birthday, we bring Everyone that visits us to this place because of the great food. We shall see you soon Nora's

UqIx9i-ILN5xOZC4VdaO6w.text: While visting Vegas, my boyfriend and I wanted to try a nice local Italian place off the strip and found Nora's.  The atmosphere was very nice.  Our waiter was very courteous and attentive. The items on their menu had traditional fare and some other authentic plates as well which offered a good variety! I had the Veal Cannelloni al Bosco  which was nothing I've had before.  I thought the sauce was quite delicious, but the filling was a little dry.  My boyfriend got the Chicken Parmigiana.  The sauce was full of flavor and not watery.  However, the chicken did was not crispy, but instead a little soggy, so that was disappointing.  The portions were pretty good compared to your typical huge vegas portions.  If we come through Vegas again, we will probably stop here again! :)

El13j0hbAwLsJ0-blO3t0g.text: We really loved it. I looked on Google and find it. Happy I did. My mom and I shared the salmon and it was really good. One of my twin son had the cheese ravioli and loved it. The other twin had a pizza. It was really yummy. And last- They are very friendly and patient. Our server was lovely.

HklJVysAxcLVfgQwwjkUXg.text: My boyfriend had booked our dinner reservation on their website. He stated that it was our first time there and it was for my birthday. We arrived and were asked to wait while they got the table ready, not a big deal. We were seated and then proceeded to sit at the table for 10-15 before any one even acknowledged us. We eventually had our server come over who apologized for running late. She was going to take just our drink order but we had enough time to order our appetizer and dinner in addition to our drinks. We didn't want to risk not seeing her again. I got the Sicilian Mule (Moscow Mule) and my boyfriend got an Old Fashioned. My Mule was outstanding, could have used more Vodka but that's just me. My boyfriend thought the Old Fashioned was too sweet due to them adding an orange slice in addition to muddled brandies cherries. We got the garlic bread and the mozzarella sticks. Both were absolutely delicious. I got the seafood pasta which was great and my boyfriend ordered the primavera. We found ourselves unable to fully enjoy our meal for to it being unbelievable hot. Both of us were sweating like we were outside. We asked our server if there was a way to turn down the air, fully expecting them to say no. The server returned later and stated that it didn't go any lower, which I find hard to believe. We ordered the Oreo ice cream for dessert. The little kid in me expecting a small candle in it, since my boyfriend let them know it was my birthday, was crushed when it didn't come. Just the dessert by itself, no candle or cheesy little message saying "Happy Birthday". We were so disappointed by our experience of the environment and experience that it just didn't outweigh how good the food was. I have to say I was super disappointed, even more than I usually would be just because it was my birthday.

NWZe-MSHLlYFpVJlJY2u_Q.text: Nora's Wine bar...There is not enough praise that I can give about this place.  It is my wife's and I most favorite place to eat at for italian food.  We come here about 2-3 times a month.  The atmosphere here is always friendly, people are kind and its a great hole in the wall for locals.    Usually when I go I get chicken Marsala but replace the spaghetti with Alfredo Carbonara.  The procuitto is simply amazing.  They're appetizers are really fresh and all items are great.    Bottom line its a great place to go for some italian food with a good atmosphere.

WoLUk_zvBUwXvD8J5j7uzA.text: I love this place for all types of Italian food. The pasta servings are very generous and incredibly tasty. The sauce and spices they use, along with the fire brick oven make for amazing food. My entire family loves this place. They have an excellent wine selection as well.

zGPPNCOWk7mfSBRvNsKyew.text: Crazy Alfredo was very tasty, although a bit smaller than i would expect for 25 bucks.  You get 1 basket of bread for free - only got 4 small pieces of bread that was more or less burned.  Waiter spent 20 minutes straight talking to the table next to me and ignored me more or less.  I think he liked the daughter.  Thank God for the bus boy who kept bringing me drinks.  Overall well worth the hour long walk from the strip.

CKFZdF88zD-olavYKsGntQ.text: We waited for 45 minutes to get seated, so ended up just sitting and ordering at the bar. Given we did walk in around 7:15pm, dinner peak hours. The two hostesses were super sweet and friendly regardless of some of the rude guests. The food is always so delicious and worth the wait! We love to order the linguini with clams and calamari. The garlic bread basket is so tasty as well. One of our all time favorites to eat at for Italian food.

nMyZTesntc0xbh6Qhy9IzA.text: Just try this crazy alfredo pasta, you not going to be dissapointed. They also have full bar and great collection of wine. Stuff making atmospere very frendly and life music make it romantic, i dated my gf in this restaurant and we're very impressed. Very good restaurant, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!

2-E-h4KzeWEwom1H9YOW1g.text: This was a great find through yelp! We were looking for Italian food and decided to give it a try. The food was flavorful but not too salty or sweet. My dad loved the spaghetti and meatballs while I got the rigatoni special. Seemed like a place where a lot of locals go when they're looking for authentic Italian food. The hostess and servers were courteous. Will definitely come back the next time we're in town!

Mip8S-0PCzE3c9IlZaKcBA.text: Have loved this place for years.......is always great......yum,yum,yum.!! For people that give a bad review......suggest you try again,or quite simply,you don't know good food.

f0dcRo8iHg9a-ArP1i4CtA.text: Good food but service sucks. Unless you look "Rich" you'll get great service. Very very rude

L853qJluWvVakkQ-V5daLQ.text: Came here for my anniversary on the recommendation of a friend who had been coming here regularly for years. So glad I did. Let me add our voices to the chorus singing the praises of the Crazy Alfredo, which was amazing. The blend of flavors on this dish is excellent and understandably their most popular dish. Everything else was excellent, but the flourless chocolate cake (make sure you preorder it!) deserves special mention. I'm not even a chocolate lover, but the molten center combined with the pistachios in the sauce make this a wonderful treat. A great meal, and great staff and service. Make sure you make a reservation, as the secret is out and it can be hard to get a seat otherwise at this off the strip gem. Will definitely be back here the next time I'm in Vegas.

zxqtKypNdeyKBXHotmVygg.text: Have been recommended this place by friends and not far from my place. Went w my kid. The table where we were seated was very small and cramped. in the bar area. Was around 5.30pm. The lemon clams were over steamed. had the lasagne and eggplant parm which were average and a bit on the oily side. Wine however compensated. Not the most friendly or responsive staff. Apparently smiling not allowed.  I may try again.

2N1ZJChiC-RJvAqJ9UxurA.text: Pretty good and consistent . They use good tomatoes which I appreciate . Floor was slippery but looked clean . I liked the pizza I ordered . My wife got the veal , it could of used a few more whacks with the tenderizer but flavor was on point .

FPai32p0JsJXqsStytlEWg.text: The cheesecake was one of the best I have ever had if not the best xD.  Their prices aren't too high and the service is spot on.

L-C6RXphJLkIyvVViXFD0w.text: Nora's is AMAZING! It reminds me of a restaurant you'd find on Arthur Avenue. The food is out of this world and the service is great! I love the ambience, it's very old school Italian. The fettuccine carbonara is my fave and their sangria is so yummy!

DBww5NYuQlPhp2SM3o1tzA.text: went there for our daughter's birthday-food was delicious as usual, service was fine

CM4nFU8lDR1gyCQIgo_Yyg.text: My wife and I love this place. Great food, drinks, atmosphere and service. We will be returning here I wish it was in a better location.

NwViO7FltDKz0WjmQTAxWA.text: Food was delicious. Service was not good. Wait staff was not friendly nor attentive. Never came back to ask how everything was. Never came to see if we needed refills on our drinks. Never asked if we wanted anything else.  I could see if they were extremely busy. But it wasn't. Again, food was amazing, which is why I gave 3 stars.  Will I go back? No thanks.

Kz5Xp3ipAbsL4R3BjxbaSQ.text: Went for an informal business dinner. Everything was so good. The staff was good and the overall ambiance was good. A nice diamond in the rough

3ZAFbDAsg-s92bmnO8N8fw.text: I don't like the new location.  The tables are CRAMMED together and everything is made of hard surfaces so the place is very loud.  There is always a wait and but there is like 10 square feet for everyone to wait in so it's extremely uncomfortable.  At dinner, you can hardly hear your dinner guests and end up yelling over the  ambient noise.  Of course the food is good and draws a crowd but there is good Italian food all over town nowadays; why endure all the aggravation?

oA0HHEl_wxjyxJ9FjskJOQ.text: My husband has been to Nora's a couple times before it moved to its new location and wanted to bring his Italian wife here for dinner because he thought it was fantastic. The new venue is larger with a bar in the middle and dining rooms on either side with separate rooms off those areas. We were seated in the far room off the dining room with a large party with kids. Not what I envisioned for a nice dinner with my husband for our first night in Vegas. Not to mention, the server was so busy that we just got a nod acknowledging that she saw us but sat there quite a while before we decided to ask to be moved. There was no other option, so we sat at the bar and it was the best evening because of it. Even though the volume in this place is extremely loud, sitting at the bar allowed us to hear each other and we were entertained with the mixologist Alex working her magic. My husband and I started out with cocktails that we wouldn't have ordered because Alex made everything look mouthwatering. I had a fantastic strawberry basil drink that she was kind enough to tell me how to make as she was doing it.  We were given a choice of garlic bread or regular bread. The garlic bread are strips of very garlicky and buttery bread, something I couldn't eat as it was too saturated with butter for me but my husband had no problem.  We ordered the grilled octopus appetizer and it was one of the best grilled octopus I've ever had. Plentiful and grilled to perfection with a nice char. My husband had the wild boar pasta dish which was full of meat in a savory tomato sauce. I opted for the salmon piccata which was cooked to medium, so moist and flaky. We enjoyed a couple of glasses of red wine with our entrees as well.  Alex was attentive and provided very good service. Although this is way off the strip, it is very popular with the locals so I recommend making reservations. I don't know if I would go back again because of the loud atmosphere and the hassle of trying to get a different table when we were unhappy with being stuck in the back of the restaurant with a large party, but I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and the drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar pasta dish
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus Appetizer
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon piccata

43NHh7J5F8MeySVgbc9tUg.text: My second time here, and I think it's even better this time. So happy to see a local business do so well! The quality of the ingredients is at the heart of this menu and it shows. Great spot for indoor-outdoor dining.

E5OFd7qymd0uqbOwJo02Pw.text: This was the best meal I have had in a long long time. We ordered the calamari for an appetizer, and it was cooked perfectly. The garlic bread was delicious. The sangria- best sangria I've ever had. For my meal, I ordered the cheese tortellini with alfredo sauce and it was to die for. Our table had a tiramisu for dessert that was the final excellent part of our meal. This restaurant went so far above my expectations and was beautiful with amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi, Cheese Tortellini (Tri-colored), Or Cheese Ravioli with Alfredo

nP7tKYvA4Y2Wtqs2avDb8A.text: I haven't come here in a while but this was my favorite Italian spot when I was living in this area. They moved closer to the street but they're still in the same complex on Jones and Flamingo. The new restaurant is much nicer and more modern looking with more capacity as well. However, it seems they kept the same layout. There is still a bar on one side of the restaurant so you can sit and have a drink while wait for a table. They have some very fancy signature cocktails so make sure you check out their cocktail menu. The service and the food are still great just as I remember. The ambiance is classy and cozy. It is good for both date night and family dinner. I will come back more often and definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a good local Italian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uwmLw2GHH4suIK1TSr10Ew.text: Wish I could've said one good thing but the truth is the truth this place sucks even from their other location. It's just so unpleasant the food isn't what it looks like yet alone authentic servers are nice but when you ask for a wine bucket for sparkling  water they act like it's all good and ignore you ; finally when they bring it after being disconnected with the meal it's a full watered down sparkling water melted ice they wanted to put the bucket on the floor!!! My father in Law loves his baked ziti but what does a  86yr old poppa know. Sloppy food over drowned sauces . Generic garlic toast bread hotdog rolls . Not original good Italian bread at all WE'll STICK WITH CAFE MASTRONI's

RwzGPCRf1mylrF91nYIHrA.text: A step up from your normal Italian restaurants like OG with home town Italian flavors and pastas.  The ambiance makes you feel like you're back at grandma's house with the rest of the family on a Tuscany countryside.  We had several different dishes and all were very tasty considering I'm not a pasta guy.  Def a step up from commercialize Italian restaurants, but not as pricey as Maggiano's.  Why only 4 stars... The cocktails were good but small in size and the desserts were ok to good at best.  Would recommend making reservations like we did unless you like waiting for 30 mins to an hour at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QT2AUaXuWQYZHv0ihGMvtg.text: My boyfriends and I New favorite Italian spot! Their spicy muscles are my favorite thing on the menu. Can't help but order it every time!

eMJt4dLC22BgRJD2mO0kPg.text: I haven't visited Nora's since they used to be in the strip mall just west of their new location, but man, have I been missing out!   Their new (I say new, but it's probably been there for years) location is very spacious! A bit echoey due to the high ceilings and tile floors, but if you manage to get a room to yourself, then you'll definitely appreciate the privacy! Try asking for one when you book a reservation.  As for the food, Nora's has also been exceptional, and they continue to defy expectations! The Garlic bread was dangerously addicting, the calamari was perfectly fried, and not overly battered. And the Veal Marsala was sublime! The veal was tender, the sauce was just the right thickness, the flavors were spot on.   Overall, if you're looking for a nice place to take a loved one, reconnect with friends, or even explore on a first date, Nora's will not disappoint! Be sure to make a reservation, because they WILL get very crowded!

gEffHEiF_g4motd3r9LMJg.text: Some of the best Italian food I've had anywhere and a pretty legit bang for your buck as well. I usually order comfort food type dishes and they never disappoint for around $15. Classy yet still casual ambiance and great service. Once you get your first taste of the complimentary G bread.. You'll be hooked.. It's so good most places would charge you for it!

9pjjx7GKEpbhaiBOUVeyXw.text: First time trying this restaurant and I absolutely loved it. I am a pasta lover and both pastas we ordered were so tasteful. Sebastian was our server and he was so nice and helpful. Definitely will be going back soon!

5hnZJo1YJzskNuvoybB4Cg.text: I love Nora's! Several of my friends used to work at Nora's when I was a teenager so I was always there eating the food and eating what they brought back to the house. I basically lived off Nora's for a significant amount of my 19th year of life. Thanks for that Nora's! Gio used to sit me down and feed me pasta with meatballs and a sausage shaped like a penis - thanks for that Gio :D hahaaaaa  Good times. Their food is honestly delicious. They just opened a new location next to the old location and I'm so happy they did because they made the restaurant bigger which was needed, and they did a beautiful job with the new place. It's a wonderful environment to dine in.  I hear Gio is turning the old location into a pizza place, which I could not be happier about because I love their pizza. The Snow White pizza has been a favorite of mine in town for 14 years. And I'm a huge pizza lover with very good taste in pizza, when I say pizza is good it's very good. The service is always great as well. All in all a truly wonderful restaurant that has served this city for a very long time.   The Melrose pasta is my one of my favorite things on the menu. Love you Nora's! I need to go back so I can take photos of their food to add to my review! I have none! Sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow White with extra ricotta

DtQsZUy5YENPDopP-vn5OQ.text: The food was great. But the service was not the greatest. A bit slow and from the atmosphere they are going for I would expect that the wait for drinks wouldn't take over 5 minutes. And that the servers would know not to grip a plate from the rim and use the bottom. Either way, a good alternative to Olive Garden.

qvmOBoEtLgP7r1gdYgv1Og.text: Absolutely amazing!!! I ordered the tomato basil pasta and switched the penne for angel hair ( my fave) and I couldn't be more pleased! We sat at the bar and received excellent service and amazing drinks from Rudy  If you're in Vegas please make this a stop! The live music was amazing too!!

--sA-PFiMFmdi-EQRioGpQ.text: I called to make a Mother's Day reservation around 11AM the Tuesday. They need to get on Open table or something because whoever this girl is that took my reservation, repeated it wrongly about 5 times before "confirming" --- "4 people for 2PM on Mother's Day Sunday".. only for me to call for confirmation as I'm driving to their restaurant that they don't actually open until 4 PM. I tried initially to make an online reservation and their system said if no availability then call which I did.  Now I'm scrambling for Mother's day reservations as we are trying to drive somewhere to eat. Sucks.

7LuNT3GOyg8KEObbqrZHdg.text: Funny how a town so often associated with Italian culture can be lacking for good Italian food.  Not here!  Nora's is a True hidden gem.  Delicious food, fair portions, reasonably priced, and good service all make Nora's a winner.   For anyone that thinks Olive Garden is good Italian, do yourself a favor and come see what good food really is.    It does get busy, so I'd suggest making reservations.  For those that walk in, the bartenders are attentive, so that wait is not too bad.

iUehrsSxvnExIig6JG-sEg.text: Never disappoints! Best local Italian spot in Vegas. All their food and drinks are delicious!

GtR-PIzmzJzKTP0c8aHD4A.text: I've dined here several times before and have always ordered the Melrose. Tonight it's my first time ordering take out and to my disappointment. They forgot those precious little pine nuts on my pasta. My Melrose doesn't taste the same tonight. I am so disappointed. I think I will stick with dining in only.

Yp5Xi9mtlzr63YGKLwT8AQ.text: 4.5 Stars for Nora's. We went out to Nora's for dinner on Friday night. Got there around 5-530pm with a table for 5 adults and 2 kids + baby. We only had to wait about 5 minutes to be seated. It started to get busy right after we got seated. No kids menu but they did give my children a fresh pack of crayons to color on the paper cover on the table. The garlic bread is amazing! They use fresh garlic and it's pretty strong garlic flavor on all of the pieces. I ordered the rigatoni. It was fantastic! Covered in fresh mozzarella and 5 scoops of ricotta mounds on top. Tasted fresh, just wished the pasta would have been a bit more al dente but it definitely wasn't overly soft or mushy. Impressed that the iced black tea was fresh brewed and had great flavor. Most places, if it is fresh brewed, have a coffee taste or its old. Nora's cold black iced tea was delicious. The pizza was super good and the small size we ordered had atleast 8 descent sized slices. My 5.5 yr old and 4 yr old shared the pizza with my MIL who only ordered a salad. We still got to take home 4 slices for left overs. My MIL said the pizza was super good, I didn't try it but from the looks of it it looked awesome and cooked in a stone oven. Our whole table thought the food was great... except our extremely picky grandma. She ordered some type of soup and that was it. Our server was the best! He tried to help our grandma get something else but she said it was ok. The soup to her didn't taste like how she likes it... like Olive Garden . I think the servers name was Destefano. He truly was one of the best servers we have ever had anywhere and also had a lovely accent. All of the men who had served our table were polite and quick at serving or refills. I don't know how much the bill was but it was less than expected. Very posh clean atmosphere but not stuffy or snooty. The prices are very reasonable and comparable to other Italian restaurants. My husband and I will definitely be back, especially without grandma  the only reason it wasn't 5 stars for me was because 1. The second order of garlic bread didn't make it to our table until we were almost done 2. They forgot to bag it up for us to take it home and 3. The bathroom faucets were cool in theory but grossed me out. The hand dryer is attached to the faucet. The germs get blown right back onto your hands. I did appreciate that they offered paper towels in lieu of using the dryer. Super excited to come back for a date night for the husband and I to try other dishes and possibly some alcoholic beverages.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My leftover rigatoni, delicious!

jvxI06bf7A8GbaYORpqrwQ.text: Service & food were not good!! I recently ordered a full tray of lasagna for a family get together. I asked for a 4:45 pickup time. I got there at 4:45 and I wasn't given my pan of lasagna until 5:15. I saw the manager walk past me about 5 times and not once did he apologize for the wait. My guests were arriving at 5:30 so needless to say I wasn't happy. I ended up getting home at 5:35.   The lasagna was not good! After I made a comment to my family that the lasagna didn't taste like I remember it, they all starting chiming in with more comments like: "it tastes like spaghetti O's"...what's that weird herb taste"..."I wasn't going to say anything but it's not very good". I had 14 adults over and they only ate 1/2 of a full tray. A full tray is supposed to feed 15 people, so you know it wasn't good. I will not be back to Nora's and I have been going there for over 20 years when they had their smaller location.

LoQzsXxgKllyq2j_uLt3Dg.text: Sit at the bar and let the super courteous gentlemen take care of you.  They know exactly what to pair your wine with so let them treat you.  Awesome experience throughout!

ltWmc8moa88WEtJ0AeL9cA.text: Fantastic Italian food a few blocks off the Strip, and definitely worth the trip. We ate at the bar and our bartender made some excellent drinks and provided great service. Grilled vegetable appetizer and their very garlicky breadsticks were tasty. The veal, alfredo pasta, as well as the pesto pasta had excellent flavors. All at a fraction of what you would pay any place near Las Vegas Boulevard. Definitely recommend for anyone visiting Las Vegas or any locals who live in the area.

dqMtrsIjlsNaKS3hHjkmNg.text: We were swinging by Las Vegas for a quick weekend getaway, so I reached out to Philip T. for some Italian recommendations in town. Nora's was one of the off-strip suggestions.   I tried to reserve a table in the Yelp app, but they didn't have that service available. Tried OpenTable, which had the restaurant on the app, but it didn't take any reservations. WHAAT! So third time's the charm, right? Called the restaurant and they said that they are fully booked and wait time could be up to an hour and a half. But we had to be there to put our name down. We were determined to try this restaurant, so we drove out there and was met with a packed parking lot, and a bunch of people gathered outside the entrance. We put down our name and were told to wait nearby. Luckily, we noticed a couple leaving the bar area, so we snuck in and found two perfect spots smack dab in the bar. WIN!  I started with a Pilgrim's Passion to calm the nerves and ease the appetite... Gin, St. Germain, passionfruit puree, topped with a sprig of fresh mint. So smooth, so fresh.   We ordered a plate of Mozzarella Caprese as the appetizer, which came with complimentary garlic bread. The fresh mozzarella with the EVOO drizzled on top was a perfect start to an Italian dinner. Paired with a glass of red and my cocktail, it opened up the appetite for a pasta dish.  We ordered the Melrose with shrimp... Linguini, creamy basil pesto sauce, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes topped with roasted pine nuts.  and... Eggplant Parmigiana with mozzarella, tomato sauce and side of spaghetti with tomato sauce. The dishes were huge, and we quickly realized that one entree would easily please two people.. but hey, we're in Vegas so we smashed down as much as we could.. but boy, was the Melrose heavy. The creamy sauce made it rich, and really heavy. It was so tasty, but I threw in the towel after 5 minutes. The Eggplant Parm was really tasty, with soft breading and basil tomato sauce, it was definitely our favorite.  The service was very inviting and prompt, and everyone seemed to enjoy the food and ambiance. It's definitely a place we would return to on our next visit in Vegas. And thanks to Philip T. for his awesome recommendations!

awmzu4FBHBghpzMtRLW4XA.text: My godfather recommended this place. He's lived in Vegas for 16 years and took us here. He ordered us the anti pasta salad for us and recommended the seafood dishes. I'm not a huge fan of seafood if at all so I stuck with the pasta dishes. They have so many classic options and twists on classics as well. I decided for chicken Marsala which was really good. One of the better ones I have had. I will say it comes with a side of pasta but it was weird that it came with red sauce on top. Typically when I order chicken Marsala the wine sauce is served over pasta. The garlic bread they bring out is outstanding and we could have eaten that for an entire meal. The dessert was good too, we got the chocolate lava cake. The vanilla sauce is just so good.

gSR6_WzaSdvpj7_B9tsPyg.text: Finally made it to the new location. Let me tell you it's beautiful and the staff is just as good as before. We will be back. We also tried a new red wine tonight and it was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xQ2lGwaV364QwQhNAU9CSw.text: We actually had Nora's catered for our holiday party - so my review is strictly based on the food as I cannot speak on the atmosphere and service of the restaurant. The food was pretty good though, so I'm sure I will be updating my review at some point in the future to comment on the actual restaurant!  The food that we had catered was the Chicken Parmesan, Meatballs, Fettuccine Alfredo and Penne with Marinara.   The chicken Parmesan were smaller than I have typically had, but still delicious. I think it's because I am used to restaurants pounding the chicken flat and Nora's seemed to just cook the chicken breasts as they are. No big deal though as they were still flavorful.   The meatballs were average sized and also had a good flavor to them - lots of red sauce, yum!   The fettuccine Alfredo was great! The sauce was not to thick nor too runny - perfectly creamy and flavorful! The penne seemed a little dry to me for some reason though.   Overall I really enjoyed the food and am looking forward to stopping in for dinner one night!

4u9uaJ6KMXjHJ8hvBK_Rfg.text: Amazing food.  Amazing service.  More than reasonable prices.  We were running late for a show after Uber driver got lost which made us late for reservation at Nora.  They were very understanding and sat us as soon as they could. The waiter was excellent.  We had two apps, four drinks, three entrees, and soda, (and excellent garlic bread strips).   Bill was $120, which was amazing considering the top notch food.  We would HIGHLY recommend.  It's about a ten minute ride from strip (we came from MGM Grand).

jcoI8ZQQhlqMKwLI8LdNDA.text: This place had a great reputation but after moving into their new building I noticed they have become more corporate and cut expenses on food quality.. bummer

Kjp9i5YxZPX1Xo6QGD0Ncw.text: The free garlic bread is garlicky and yummy. We've never had a bad thing on the menu and we've tried a lot of them. It's a must try Italian restaurant and we always bring our friends and family from out of town. They also have great private rooms.

r8FPbz47XUb8XBct3kXBEA.text: Love this place! I'm not too crazy about Italian food but when I crave good pasta, this is a great pace to be! The exterior and interiors lookVery rustic and modern at the same time. Food is spot on! We came here for my dad's bday dinner, and my fam loved the food!  Chicken fettuccini Shrimp Melrose Chicken cafrioci Margherita pizza with garlic White sauce pizza with spinach Calamari Mozzarella sticks Nora salad Tiramisu Cheesecake Bread pudding  These are stuff we got! I had the shrimp melrose pasta and it was 5/5! The free garlic bread was so yummy! The Nora salad was very light and different. It has a sour zing to it that is very good. Calamari was amazing with the sauce!!! Love it! I'd definitely be back! Also, my servers were all amazing! Love this place and will recommend it to all my fam and friends for sure!  PS always make reservations! This place is hella busy!!!! And always be on time because they can only hold reservations for up to 15 mins from the time of your scheduled reservation

ewQUBWm4ChNWKDs85MhQ4w.text: Amazing service with amazing food !!! Very reasonably priced menu. I had the cheese ravioli with Alfredo sauce was the perfect flavor. And the cheesecake was the best I've ever eaten. Definitely coming back again.

Although it is super noisy (I blame the floor) we had to wait till 845 for a reservation..which turned to almost 9., but I think it was so worth it! First the garlic bread came so promptly and our drinks too! We had the Nora's salad which was so good! I tried the veal parmigiana and my friend had the chicken parmigiana. So good!
