-qYLcLdfmpuWQ2roifhVLA.text: Dined here on Feb. 22 2019  First thing, MAKE A &*(&ING RESERVATION. I couldn't find a parking space here b/c this place is BUMPIN'.  Dining experience: I was apart of a party of three and was told the wait would be an hour and 15 to an hour and 30. As we met the hour and 20-minute mark I went and asked the hostess how much longer/where we were on the list. Without even looking at her list she told me "probably another thirty". We waited about another 20 when we were finally escorted to the outdoor patio. If was freezing.  We were told that they could bring in another heater if it was too cold. I asked for one right away. I'm 6 months pregnant and they put us outside on a frigid night. The waiter came, made the comment of how cold it was and asked if we needed another heater. I asked for one. Still no heater. Drink runner came with drinks, commented on how cold it was and asked if we needed more heaters. I asked for another heater. Never got a heater.  If I would've known that asking when my party would be seated would end us as literally the only party out on the patio I would've kept my mouth shut and left. 6 months pregnant and out in the cold *check the weather for that night it was very cold*; nothing says awesome dining experience when your nose is running and frozen as you try to eat your pasta.  On top of that, their live band members were walking in and out of the zipper flaps to move in their equipment so what tiny bit of heat the patio would build up from their space heaters on the wall would just leave every few minutes. So needless to say my dining experience was the worst.  Food: AMAZING. I ordered a caesar salad and the Primavera. For that alone, I DO want to come back and try this again. Fingers crossed for a MUCH better dining experience and will definitely update review when I do.

rm5tk-KfdLj5IAokOe2ykQ.text: I saw this place on yelp before coming to Vegas and I knew I had to try it. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and we were immediately greeted by the bartender Michelle, she was amazing and super friendly! Anyways we ordered the calamari appetizer which was very good. For our meals my boyfriend got some seafood pasta he said it was pretty good.  I got the shrimp scampi which was also really good. The portions here are huge, we had a lot of food left over but we didn't end up bringing it home with us since we had no microwave in the hotel room.  I suggest either coming here on a empty stomach or sharing a dish with someone.  We definitely plan on coming back next time we're in Vegas which will hopefully be soon!

W4FPfFS0gqKnkT1yxFlCtw.text: Seeing the great reviews and my grandma and uncle's praises about the restaurant before my arrival led to high hopes for my visit here. I had actually been to Nora's twice in the past and remembered really enjoying it the first time but felt ambivalent in the second. However, I arrived at the new location and was really impressed by the new exterior and interior decor as well as just the overall increase in space of the restaurant.   Unfortunately, my experience as a whole did not mirror my expectations one bit. For starters, my grandma had informed me that she had made a reservation for 11 am on one of the days we were in town. Because we decided that we would rather have Italian food for dinner, I called and was told that there was no reservation for 11 ( and in fact, they do not take reservations for lunch! ). I'm not sure where the miscommunication took place, but not to worry since we were planning to go in later that night anyway.  We arrived right before our reservation time of 4 PM and were asked to wait while our table was getting set up. Not sure why it wasn't set up already, but no worries. Waiting for a minute or two is fine, of course. However, one minute turned into two turned into five turned into what seemed like at least ten minutes. No one seemed like they were in a rush to get us seated, which was a bit annoying. If that was the case, what was the point of making a reservation?  Finally, we were seated and all was fine. Nothing exciting took place between getting seated and getting our food ( except that the food seemed to come at a rather slow pace which was strange considering that the restaurant was mostly empty at this hour ). We ordered a Calamari Fritti, Truffle Fries, Shrimp Scampi, Frutti di Mare, Crazy Alfredo, and the Rib-Eye.  1) Calamari Fritti: This was actually really good. Perfectly crisped and flavored. Good sauce to go with the fried calamari. Would definitely recommend this. HOWEVER, when we were given the bill, they charged us $2 extra for this. The waitress told us that this was the price and when we showed her the menu, the prices did not match. It is fine if it is supposed to be $2 more; however, please update your menu to reflect the same. The staff did not seem to be pleased in helping us fix the error and, in fact, made us seem like we were a nuisance for asking for it to be changed. When there are pricing errors, it is not so much that the customer cares about the difference in price, but simply the principle that everyone is accurately charged for the food they are getting.  2) Truffle Fries: Overly salty and not very much truffle flavor. It's overall okay, but not the best that I've had. Wouldn't really recommend. The only reason I got it was because I had been craving it a few days back and was happy to see it for a decent price at a restaurant. Wish it would have satisfied that craving better.  3) Shrimp Scampi: I didn't have much of this but my grandma and uncle both ordered this and liked it. Too buttery for my taste and not salty enough ( which was surprising considering how salty the fries were ).  4) Frutti di Mare: Also not the best that I've had. Again the sauce was a little bland, and considering that this dish is usually very flavorful in other places, it was severely lacking that night. Not sure what could have been done to make it better. Definitely some more salt would have been a start.  5) Crazy Alfredo: This dish sounded amazing on paper ( and some of the reviews seemed to agree with that ), but I did not like it at all. The flavors didn't seem to marry well together, and it was too heavy ( which I suppose I should have expected with an alfredo dish ).   6) Rib-Eye: This was definitely the highlight of the entire meal. The meat was very well cooked and flavorful. If I had to go back, this would be what I would get. It's a bit confusing because the menu has an option with fries and another with roasted potatoes. The fries option is $1 more than the roasted potatoes, and that was not the one that we wanted, especially since we had just ordered a side of fries as it was! Nonetheless, out came a bowl of fries. Now, this is just what I've experienced at other restaurants, but usually, if a party orders fries, the waitress asks if we still want it since one of the entrees comes with a side of fries that's the same size as the one we paid for. This was never brought up, though they were at least accommodating enough to bring out a side of roasted potatoes instead ( which took another fifteen minutes at least ).  Overall, didn't really enjoy my experience here. To get the bill took what felt like eternity and our waitress just disappeared on us for most of the meal that we had to flag down other waiters who were confused as to where she was. In additioit seems the online menu and the in-restaurant prices do not match. I am not certain if it is supposed to, but it doesn't seem to be a reliable source. I don't believe I will be going back again sadly.

bjpR1X2Qs3fJpchYd8TuGg.text: Last night, Saturday, My boyfriend, friend, and I went to eat at Nora's. I was excited to eat here and expected a lot. We walk into the restaurant and the new set-up is beautiful. I pass by the restaurant every day on Flamingo on my way to work, and the new location is much nicer, aesthetically, than the old one. So, I decide to take my friend here as a special occasion since she is visiting from out of town.   Anyway, this was our first time eating here. We had reservations at 8:30pm. We arrive at that time, and get seated shortly after. The hostess gives us our menus, and we wait for our server. We were right by the entrance to the kitchen, so there were many workers who passed us. No one came to greet us. At about 8:55pm, still with no service, we literally had to track down our server, who seemed reluctant to help us when we approached her. She didn't even acknowledge that we've been waiting. There was actually no greeting or introduction at all. Just, "Can I get you something to drink?". We ordered our drinks and food from her at the same time.   I ordered a Hitachino white ale, water, and angel hair pasta with arrabiata sauce and sausage. My boyfriend ordered a diet, water, crazy alfredo pasta, and a calamari appetizer. My friend ordered water and fettuccine alfredo.   After waiting for a bit longer, and still nothing on our table, the server came back to tell me they are out of the beer. So, I ordered a sangria. Meanwhile, my boyfriend goes to speak with the manager. He said the server is newer and he would expedite the order. After this, the food arrived in the following order: 1) my sangria, 2) only two waters, 3) the calamari, 4) the diet (after re-requesting), 5) the third water, 6) the complimentary bread, 7) the main dishes.   The food, itself, was tasty but nothing spectacular. I enjoyed it, but for the price - not worth it. The portions were decent. The food presentation was good. However, taste-wise, it was like any other Italian restaurant. I would say, the food rates a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Honestly, it wasn't something I would come back for, even if the service was good.   The service made this experience a poor one. When service is this poor, the manager usually does something about it. I was a server for years, and a comp of some type is usually offered to the guests. Nothing. After almost a half-hour, we had to sequester our server to come help us, and when we previously waved or tried to flag down anyone else, they ignored us. Most likely, because it wasn't their section. I mean, c'mon, at least attempt to rectify the situation by offering us a second round of already-free bread or something.   The restaurant was busy, and it was a Saturday night. However, there were a good handful of people, bus boys and servers, who were quick to clear a table once the party was finished. Like, I'm talking, immediately after guests left. So, busyness or lack of help was not an excuse for not assisting us.   Our bill came out to $81 for the three of us. I rarely ever leave less than 18-20% of the taxed bill. Last night, I made an exception. The food was okay. Service was terrible. I do not recommend this restaurant and will not be returning.

G_oKL1ITmS5ASToD3mfIFA.text: We were seated promptly We did had a longer than usual wait between the appetizer and our main course  Food was tasty  Had : Crazy Alfredo was pretty impressed with twist they gave with chicken, sausage, shrimp and jalapenos

VrIpVVKy4ewqKebfPOScxA.text: Like I said earlier, I came to investigate the hype.  Unfortunately, the wardenis not a big fan of pasta so I had to go solo cause Yolo.  Not too mention, the place is pretty close to the office.  I opted for the gnocchi with vodka sauce after learning that crazy Alfredo is only offered at dinner.  Also. I been seeing gnocchi at at the world market and contemplated making it at the crib.  Because it primarily consists of potato and basically a dumpling, it is rather filling and pretty heavy.  The vodka sauce was excellent and the good came out in a flash.  Let's not forget about the fresh garlic bread....whoa!  My garlic gauge is enhanced so I love how they load it with butter, seasonings and garlic, and lots of it!  The server was very accommodating as well and assisted with activating the closed captioning feature so I could watch ESPN's Around the Horn.  There was a minor mix up when paying the bill however, where the waiter charged me for the couple eating next to me.  No biggie, but I sure can see others having a stroke over it.  I still broke him off as if the mishap never occurred.  The ambience creates a True modern Italian experience and the speakeasy lounge music was a nice touch.  The decor provided a cozy feel and the dining area is closed off to the world, giving you that presence of intimacy.   I am definitely coming back again, especially during dinner too complete my investigation of the do called "crazy Alfredo."  Maybe I can convince my partner in crime to come with, but until then, it might be several solo dolo trips for muah only.

Cgwip8S6j81c1Ozry2vvPw.text: The food here is great. We started with a house salad which was a nice portion. For entrees we ordered the popular Crazy Alfredo and Rigatoni Gorganzola with chicken. Both dishes had great cream sauces and were delicious. Finally for dessert the chocolate lava cake. I normally dont care about dessert but this was bomb. We ate at the bar and the service was on point. We will definitely be back.

TXjSm6lCUYMNYoGOn5OmZQ.text: The atmosphere is cozy, got here around 5:45pm and were seated immediately. Christmas theme but not over the top, very classy. Food was amazing, starting with the garlic bread. Yum! I had the "Crazy Alfredo" and it was delicious. She got the vegetarian white sauce pizza and really liked it. Coffee was good, they gave us cups to go. The server was really busy but they had back up people so we were rarely waiting for more than a minute or two. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because the parking is horrible. They share a lot with several places and we had to drives round the lot a few times to find a spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White sauce vegetarian pizza
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo!

tCzxIfIMCprQkIYQiQ4g5A.text: I'm not an Italian food aficionado but this is hands down the best Italian food I've ever had. Great atmosphere and service. Perfect to impress a date or to impress clients for a business meeting. Huge bar with a lot of good wine. Michelle makes the best drinks. Only ask her to make your drinks. You won't be disappointed. Plus she's super cute ;)

CrPDgFLNBgLeWQx_Zi-P0A.text: This place have the best pizza in town! I keep taking my friends there. Great costumer services. They get busy around dinner time so I will recommend to call ahead. Five stars!!!  keep going back there every time I feel like having a good pizza.

V_17Aj3tJ3kZ4jaV67uhjA.text: Once again Nora's delivers. Every time I am in Vegas on business or otherwise i have to go to Nora's. Recently opened, their brand new location is conveniently located very near their original location. Their new location is beautiful and well layout out. Their menu has expanded to include foods cooked over a wood grill which are amazing and the quality of the food is terrific. The staff is always friendly and eager to please.  Keep up the good work Nora's, I will see you all soon.

h_FRnJHxNQzCCFjfmg5X3Q.text: We've been going to Nora's since 1994 and have never been disappointed.  Their new restaurant on Flamingo just two blocks away from the original is awesome!!  They have the same great menu and the same wonderful staff in a gorgeous new building and have added some outside patio dining as well.  If you liked the old Nora's you'll love the new one and if you've never been you really have to try it.

2sAa5ajF26pqL3LuZHIz2Q.text: If this place were closer to where I live in Las Vegas, this would be on my list of places to go every week.  Very good food, energetic atmosphere, nice alcohol selection.  The best Italian place I have found in Las Vegas thus far; I am not into eating Italian food out too much as my wife and I do a decent job cooking it at home, but Nora's is worth the doe.

--QaxO__PTcqfAo8uPkrVw.text: First timer here and a non-local. Location is in a small stip mall, fairly large restaurant. Greeted and seated very quickly as I was eating alone. (I think they may prefer reservations because they do seem to have a lot of clientele). Obviously I chose this restaurant due to a yelp search, yet it was the garlic bread pictures that won me over was looking for something traditional versus garlic knots. Only ordered a glass of malbec wine $10 and a house salad $8 and Arancini $8. Food came out quickly, literally 5 minutes. Yet I didn't receive my complimentary garlic bread for a bit, asked a waiter about it and then got it. Salad was very good and fresh tasting, not even a huge fan of tomatoes yet they were very ripe. The House Italian dressing was very tasty. The garlic bread was definitely just what I wanted, very buttery and tons of garlic on it. Can never have too much garlic in my opinion. The Arancini was flavorful but I do think maybe it could have  been a little warmer/hotter, and possibly deep fried just a touch more so that when they are laid over the tomato sauce they wont get soggy as quickly. They were slightly breaking open due to them absorbing the tomato sauce liquid. The server suggested a Malbec wine, it was indeed a very good choice. They staff was always around to take care of your needs. Would definitely come back if I'm near in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The total. (GB= garlic bread, which is free for your first basket)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini and house salad with Italian dressing.

B55IxOCR4HvTxTxz94aYJg.text: Nora's is one of my go-to spots for friends visiting, and each time everyone is always impressed.  It's close enough to the strip for friends to meet up which is always a bonus.  The flavors are great and very rich.  Most of the pasta choices are heavier on the cream-side.   My top choices are the veal, chicken mt. edna, and the crazy alfredo.  I would not come here from the pizza though.  It's not bad, but just ok.   Great for sharing and large crowds, and the prices are just right!

xezqwjBVpqcVa-GPnDrwBw.text: Totally love this place!  My family loves to get the back private room every year for Christmas.  Their appetiser platter is the best!

rvqhrjW9aR9NfXbR6aTJug.text: Our first time here. Salad, soup, eggplant, wines, bread, and on and on. Awesome atmosphere and food. We'll. Be back.

6EAGSPi1EWyG_UnALYZW1A.text: Why eat "Italian" on the Strip when you can mosey over to a locals place? I've eaten at Nora's multiple times on multiple trips now - I am as big a fan as ever.   It's in a strip mall (what isn't in LV?) - and the decor is average. What kills it is the food. Their meatballs make me cry. The pasta isn't cooked until a toothless person can easily gum it - it is al dente like pasta is supposed to be.   The arancini (Rice Balls) is very tasty.  As others have noted, you will not leave here hungry. I am famous  (infamous?) for being able to finish my food and any others' leftovers - not here.  I worked at a family owned checkered table cloth Italian place which has since closed - if I lived in LV, Nora's would definitely be at least a weekly ritual.

TnV67gkG9g1hOBt0sHDNkw.text: Worth the wait! Wonderful vibe. Great staff. It was crowed but like I said worth the wait...Had the chicken Alferdo and my cousin had angel hair with pesto.  I definitely recommend this spot if you're in sin city!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g06CBCNOcHdGDwujlXhM-A.text: Great food, friendly place and real authentic.  Meatballs yummy and antipasto deliish!! Teramisu and canolli's wow!

HBFqFlfoEZ6YiLSS2MrcLw.text: Great dinner and service. We had the Rigatoni Gorgonzola and Chicken, Linguini with clams, a vegetarian pizza and whole wheat penne with Alfredo sauce.  Everything was great.  We ordered the red sangria that was really fine.  I'm not a big sangria fan so I wasn't expecting much.  I usually think of sangria as cheap red wine with soda.  I was pleasantly surprised that the sangria was made with good wine and beautiful fruit. Overall a very nice dinner.

cw8vn1AILOE0be2yMDrvCw.text: I was recommended to go to this place for a long time and when I finally did I have to say I was fairly impressed. I ordered the veal Parmesan and my friend order the pork tenderloin with roasted red potatoes. The veal was really good but I have to admit the pork tenderloin that my friend let me try was even better . The roasted red potatoes were unbelievably tasty. Great Italian food and not pricey at all. Definitely going to go back

FikVojnlS0Yx9aoKyIc__A.text: Nora's is my favorite Italian restaurant in the valley.  I've eaten in many times, picked up food and pizza to go, and recommended this place to many friends.  The restaurant is decently sized with two dinning rooms on either side of the kitchen & main room, adequately lit, and is warm and cozy.  The service has consistently been genuine and friendly.  For starters, the garlic bread is delicious.  I always have to remember to stop eating it so I can save room for my actual entree!  That and I don't want to smell like garlic on date night. The gnocchi and vodka sauce are a delicious combo.  I'm a meat and starch kind of girl, but that dish is so good on it's own I don't even need to throw in anything extra. The crazy alfredo is crazy huge and packed with so many ingredients and flavor.  This dish could probably feed two people. When it's a special, you MUST order the osso buco.  It's much more pricey than normal Nora's items (~$35), but it's soooo worth it.  It comes with a little spoon for the bone marrow, which is absolutely delectable.  This is my favorite dish in the world, and it nears perfection here.  If you're an Olive Garden/Carrabas/chain Italian restaurant kind of person, give yourself a well deserved real Italian meal and go to Nora's.  It doesn't disappoint.  Date night seal of approval!

E2IPTMtS_2o6hw52ONTo-g.text: Snow White pizza with Alfredo sauce so good. You have to add the Alfredo it doesn't come that way ..

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow White pizza add Alfredo

NqETWsFD3JYREtHg0QwjTw.text: This place was a great find off the strip. Great service and friendly staff, delicious food and even a nice jazz band to seal the deal. I highly recommend this place if your looking to get out of the crowd on the strip!

T8u1lhPHu7oKg4VV30BjLg.text: Excellent and good priced. Came here with the family amd we all enjoyed everything that they had to offer. Good selection of wine and beer, as well as appetizers and entrees. We hadthe regular cesar salad which fed 4 of us, mozzarella sticks, yum, and the portiins of the dinner meals were huge....if we werent staying at a hotel we would have packed up and ate left overs for our drunken state later that night!! Overrall we will definitely be back our next visit to vegas!!! A must go italian restaurant!

iC_YsMb2KS1a1DiXkqn7yw.text: There is an awful problem in Las Vegas finding decent neighborhood restaurants.  The restaurants on the strip are expensive and the neighborhoods tend to have strip mall national chain foods.  I thought Nora's might work out but it didn't.  The prices are high for the quality of the food.  Any place that uses pepper as the main seasoning may have a problem with the quality of the meat.  The service is dreadful.  We waited over an hour and ten minutes for our food.  I have never waited that long in my life for dinner.  The waiter disappeared so we couldn't find him to inquire as to the delay.  We were not offered even a drink or bread for our inconvenience.  And it is loud, crowded and cold.  We will not be returning.

cd7ACueFuDBa6k5UMngsyQ.text: Nora's is one of your not-so-secret neighborhood gems residing in a nondescript strip mall on the corner of Jones and Flamingo. it seems as if much as been written about this place and opinions vary. Mainly, it seems like an issue of expectations. So here is what to expect and you can decide for yourself if this is going to make your dining rotation.   Nora's is really the combination of two suites in a strip mall. The room to your right will have a band at 9pm on a weekend night offering smooth jazz or whatever is Italian restaurant appropriate. The music is not too loud and you can either enjoy the music in the background or sit nearer to the band if that is what you are there for. There is also a semiprivate room for about 10 if you are having a little party. The other dining room is just a dining room. I didn't eat there, so I can't really say what the experience is like.   Service. I will get this out of the way since this is where they lost a couple of points. The service was by no means terrible, as we were seated on time, food timely and drinks filled. It was just more of an intangible indifference I felt, as if I was not supposed to know about this place. Maybe everyone was in a bad mood because the night was cold and they were missing out on the Pacquiao vs Cotto fight. Or maybe you need to be a regular for a little warmer service.   Anyway, I just desire warm, friendly service with Italian food. It just seems appropriate with pasta. Just like I expect bad service from the best Chinese restaurant. Not a big deal, but this prevents this place from being remarkable.   The interior design is nice and they do good job of providing a good atmosphere. You will forget that you are in a strip mall.   Food. Obviously, that is what we are here for. Firstly, by no fault of the restaurant, I ordered the wrong dish. Rare mistake. However, having said that, I believe that carbonara should be a wee less salty. Granted, this is from the perspective of a guy trying to limit his salt for health concerns. However, it is rare that something is so salty that I cannot finish it. The first few bites were delish, but got increasingly harsh as time wore on. Personally, I think that the prosciutto itself would lend enough sodium to flavor the dish nicely, but they went overboard by salting up the sauce.   Shrimp scampi appetizer = good. Nice large shrimp, good sauce that goes well with the garlic bread. Speaking of which, the garlic bread was okay, with a home made kind of feel, if you like that sort of thing.   Dessert. Somewhat limited choices, but the tiramisu was satisfactory with a nice wet cake to it. Ladies should have no problems here.   Wine. An excellent selection of by the glass in case you are drinking solo or otherwise cannot take on a full bottle. Mostly Italians and California wines. You can go budget for $6. I got a couple of glasses of Regaleali for 8.25 each.   What you must compare all this with is the fact that most of your pasta dishes range from $10-20, dessert is $5 and tea is $2.50. The scampi is mildly pricey at $13.95, but it was still worth it.   I think it is unreasonable to expect some sort of mind blowing experience. Really, Nora's is a nice local restaurant for a casual meal with a lady friend or perhaps a decent group gathering. Good for conversation, a generous serving a pasta and perhaps a nice bottle of Italian red for a reasonable price. You can stroll in here with a sportscoat or dress more casually if you like (maybe leave the jorts behind, though). So don't expect the world and just have a good time.

h3NCUzLiWsNfB3yhNF0pmw.text: I brought my wife here for a special meal.  I mean, after all, the reviews were very kind and so I figured it would be a nice place to come. They sat us right away and I was expecting a nice Italian dinner.  The waitress was very nice, however, the food lacked completely.  My wife and I both ordered fettuccine alfredo, and I'm sorry to report that there was absolutely no taste in the food.  There was no garlic, no flavors that you would expect in a (expensive) Italian meal.  When the waitress asked how everything was, we were very honest.  I explained that there was no flavor in the food, to which she apologized.  She brought terimisu (sp?) out complementary at the end, but again, even that lacked flavor.  I hate to say it, but Olive Garden has more flavor, and we despise going there!  This is my suggestion - go to the grocery store, buy your own ingredients, buy a bottle of wine, and have a stay at home date with your partner.  Not only will it be cheaper, but the flavors you can create yourself will beat this restaurant any day.

JwDmpvo3TLUo0KdNG0OmkQ.text: One of the singular worst meals I've ever had! Flavors ranged from bland to completely tasteless. There is more flavor in a can of Chef Boy R D or Spaghetti-o s, and I wouldn't feed that stuff to my dog.

yswgzgPZ3yNYBORiDD2XeQ.text: We recently returned to Las Vegas and went back to a favorite in years past, Nora's. The food and atmosphere was a wonderful as before. Our waiter, Anthony, was professional and delightful. Our server Kacey also made us feel very welcome. I think that Nora's is one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas. My favorite dish is Alla Non which is a huge portion of eggplant/meat sauce and pasta. Its delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant, and ask for one of Anthony's tables, he takes good care of you as does Kacey. Good job to Nora's for great employee's and even greater food.

WU95uvN6nRID_UZ-jwXvuQ.text: I feel bad for giving 1 star at this place because it is one of my mom's favorite Italian restaurant. But me and my boyfriend went here and ordered calamari, pizza, and clam linguine. The calamari was ok, not that much flavor and their marinara sauce looked weird. The pizza was ok too, it was bland no flavor at all. The clam linguine disappointed us the most! The dish was swimming in water, filled with chopped up clams (I bet it's not even fresh) and it was really really bland, no flavor at all! Worst clam linguine I've ever had! And the service was slow too.   We were really disappointed at this place and we're never going back. Just a bad dining experience over all.

STdM60yAbMwSf5sxh1oplw.text: Great atmosphere, delicious food, nice collection of wines and wonderful service. The music and service were great and for a Tuesday night the place had a lively feel. Most of the patrons looked like they knew their hang out and food place. I saw the stage for probably live music. Hopefully, on a weakened I'll try to go back.

MG1bO_gM3GYNJtlj74BhQw.text: Every time I visit this restaurant, we have a good time.  Last night I went with my clients and cousin and it was a good night. Started with a round while we sat at the bar waiting for others to arrive.  Bartender, excellent service.  Ordered apps but got sat early so they transferred our apps to the table and we started eating.  Ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir from Sonoma, didn't really taste how we expected, that's why the 4 stars.  Other than that, our entree's came out cooked to perfection, a little too much jalapeno in the fettuccine though.  Over all good experience.  Notes:  Bartender and waiter, excellent service and prefessionalism.

gbirmEziPftw7T-ayYryHQ.text: Went tonight based on a recommendation and we were pleasantly surprised! Delicious. Everything we ordered was very tasty and you get significant portions. Garlic bread is awesome. The antipasti salad was great. The crazy fettuccini and chicken marsala were on point. Great service and family owned. This will be our go-to Italian spot from now on!

leIPHYMRcZq_SMSsmtlLvQ.text: Great place in Las Vegas for good food at a reasonable price.  In the past i ahve had the Crazy Alfredo and Shrimp Scampi both were great.  This time i had the Frutti Di Mare it was great.  The Antipasto is very good.  All the portion are generous.  You won't leave hungry.  They had a special Osso Bucco special that a couple in our party had that they said was very good.  Overall i try to hit this place everytime i am in vegas.

uyl6_xa1CdglTqxdinPwjw.text: The food was really great, it just wasn't what I was craving so I left a little disappointed. I feel like it's my own fault because I ordered the wrong thing.   I got the baked ziti, which was great. However, I was in the mood for a really yummy meat sauce and this dish was mostly ziti. My husband got the "crazy" Alfredo and thought it was good, but said he would get it without the sausage and jalapenos next time.  The wait was pretty long, they seem to seat you quickly with a reservation though. The service was not bad.  Order the chocolate cake with your meal, it takes 30 minutes to prepare. We didn't know that so we missed out.  It wasn't absolutely amazing, but good enough that we'll return someday.

VkONK4io2dTlZlZfrLrb4g.text: Its a Tuesday night and my friend are I are sitting in the living room watching reruns on TV waiting for our gal pal to come home from her errands. Did I mention we are starving? The lady friend left about two hours ago for some errands. What that really means is a full manicure and pedicure.  So the gal pal finally gets home and we head out for some good eats. We waste about a gallon of gas before be finally decide on Nora's Cuisine. I've never eaten here before but I've heard good things about it.  We roll up around 8:15 and the place is pretty full. The hostess nicely asks if we have reservations. We decline. We were then told the wait would be about 10 minutes or so. After a brief glance around the room, I noticed a lot of empty tables, Hmmmm...? 10 minute wait?  We finally get seated and the hostess apologizes for the wait. She explains that the dish washer is not working at full steam (insert joke here) and the wait was more for the clean dishes than an available server. I am always willing to wait for clean dishes!  The menu looked decent for an Italian place. It has all the usual Italian fare one could ask for. You can pull up the full menu on their website. We finally decided to start with the Calamari Fritti and a simple Caprese Salad. My two friends both ordered the Shrimp Scampi and I decided to go for their best seller, the "Crazy" Alfredo.  The Caprese Salad came out first. We just wanted some greens, tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese drizzled with a light olive oil. We got exactly that. It was simple yet very tasty. Next out was the complimentary garlic bread. We started gnawing on the bread when the Calamari came out. I'm so glad we squeezed the lemon wedges over the golden crispy fried calamari because, at least now it had some taste! Ouch! The side sauce that came with it was pretty bland as well.  Out came the main dishes. The Shrimp Scampi looked pretty good. My dish looked awesome as well. How can you go wrong with the best seller? Well... To be honest I didnt read the whole description of the dish.   "Crazy" Alfredo - This best-seller features the classic fettucine Alfredo piled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp... (Honestly. I stopped reading here. I should of read on.) ...porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapenos.  JALAPENOS? Yes. You read that right. Now dont get me wrong. I love japapenos on my nachos or mexican food... But in my Alfredo? To be honest, it was too much. I picked them all out and it really did look like someone took a huge handful and tossed it in. Maybe I'm missing the 'gourmet taste' of it or whatever, but I can definitely do without it.  The dessert selection didnt look too exciting so we decided to pass on it. Our final bill came out to around $70 before tip. Overall just an "A-OK" meal. Maybe I just ordered the wrong dish. Would I eat here again? Sure. I'd give it another shot. Next time I'd try the pizza or another large salad.

suLVSI6rojvVtXvyqPI2Tg.text: I'm not sure if I had really good Italian food before but this restaurant was just okay to me. I felt like their garlic bread could have been frozen before because I could probably find bread like that in the grocery store. From all the great reviews, I was expecting freshly made bread with a rustic outer layer that you see all the top Italian restaurants have. I ordered the crazy fettucini that had everything in it. A little too much going on there. The pizza was good. Nothing will beat the East Coast. It was super dead and I was expecting the restaurant to be super busy! If you sign up for their e-club you get a free appetizer and dessert which is awesome! Our server looked like she was having a bad day on top of this. Maybe it was just bad timing. I'll definitely give it another try but not anytime soon.

CKjdYYFpadrLcufpwd9jew.text: Was looking for some reasonably priced alternatives off the strip and remembered to bookmark Nora's as a must try while in Vegas for 4 days. Probably the best meal of the entire trip. Everything that was said here about the food is all accurate and True. The portions are huge, enough to be shared family style, a small salad for 1-3 can still feed 4-5.   Service was very friendly and generous. I made reservations ahead of time based on the reviews that it can get quite crowded, even on a week night, we were seated in the dining room where the room was full of families, women on a girls night out, couples, etc, the room was alive and buzzing.   Had a lovely glass of Dr L reisling which comes in an adorable little carafe. WIth an unfortunate helping of parmesean cheese garnished on the dish of one of my lactose intolerant dining companions, they were quick to replace the dish with a fresh bash of non dairy product .   We shared the antipasto salad and bruschetta and indivdually ordered the linguine with clams, baked ziti and chicken erbe fini.  I had the linguine with clams with the white wine, olive oil and garlic sauce, excellent dish, plenty of clams, pasta served el dente, was too much of a serving, that I couldnt finish.   We had also earlier ordered the chcocolate cake based on the numerous suggestions here and it was a great way to end a very hearty meal. The chocolate cake has pistachio bits and has a brownie like crunch to it, but very ooey and moist on the inside.   The only sad part of the evening is that we were so stuffed and knowing we were going to be heading out to a party later on and that we're staying in a hotel with no fridge, had no way to savor any of the leftovers the next day.   I've had many of good meals in Vegas during my trips there, however this is a kind of place you want to go to when you're wanting to go where the locals go and stay away from the pretentiousness and drama with some of the high end restaurants on the strip.   Molto Bene!

H2QgwqE0_HlhtyztJshh5w.text: Nora's is an off the strip delectable Italian eatery in Las Vegas.  Located in a strip mall near an Arby's, it's a completely unexpected treat!  Last weekend my entire family (and some friends too) descended upon Las Vegas to celebrate my Grandfather's 90th birthday.  The big birthday bash was held at Nora's (a place my dad saw on the food network).  They seated all 40 of us on the bar side of the restaurant where we mostly took over the place.    Since our party was so large we had a preset menu all served family style.  Caprese salad, antipasti salad, garlic bread, calamari, pene with vodka sauce, eggplant parmigiana, chicken marsala, seasoned pork tenderloin with parmesan crusted potato wedges, tiramisu and canoli!  Oh my God I'm full just thinking about how much food I ate that night!  All that for $35 a person.  The food was excellent...especially the garlic bread, calamari, marsala, eggplant...ok all of it was awesome.    The service was ok, but considering the number of people they had to contend with, I won't knock off a star.  They didn't even mind when we set up the gigantic poster board display of Grandpa's past 90 years on top of their beverage service table and they let us decorate with birthday banners and trinkets.  They also didn't mind when my dad and uncle got into a brotherly wresting match and broke one of the sparkling water bottles on the beverage service table....they just came over and cleaned it up.    All and all it was a good time with good food and crazy company!  I would like to go back to Nora's to have the non huge group of people dining experience.  Plus I need to have more of that garlic bread, cause it was damn good.  Congratulations Grandpa on 90 years!

08ReORsyeJK80uWFWWcTIw.text: I am from the Washington DC area and I came to Las Vegas with my family for two weeks. Before this restaurant, I wasn't turned onto the idea of Italian food..but this place did it for me! The Pasta Fagioli was amazing and so was the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce. I had absolutely no complaints.  The cannolis and the chocolate cake were great too. If you are in Vegas, its def a must.

VArzMNITgPhKYVwLJD2PZg.text: Nora's is one of those restaurants that you never forget.  I went with a friend while visiting Vegas from a recommendation from a valet at our hotel.  We wanted a locals place with good Italian food and Nora's blew us out beyond our expectations.  For starters we had an antipasto and minestrone soup.  Both were delicious.  For my entre I had veal scallopini, which was tender and delicious.  I love garlic and Nora's knows how to use it properly, not overwhelming, but definitely there to enhance the True flavors of the veal.  The ambiance and friendliness of the servers made the experience totally enjoyable.  I highly recommend this restaurant to any visitors who want to get off the strip with it's exhorbitantly pricey restaruants and experience the way Vegas really is.  Down home and offering quality restaurants at reasonable prices.

bMVF0zpnXt28HmAwEk_wiQ.text: We love the food.  Great atmosphere.  Good selection of Grapa.  Staff is very friendly.  A little on the pricey side

IGIA7PLQONXSp4ulRQd-3w.text: Marla was a wonderful server. On top of everything even when the restaurant was packed! Amazing food and great atmosphere!

0mQPtezfwy8pHxgRh0sNGQ.text: My daughter and son in law took me here for my birthday and it was the first visit for all of us. We had a reservation made the day before but when we got there we had no table and had to wait about 15 minutes. Why make a reservation ??? The receptionists were not welcoming or very friendly however the wait staff was efficient. We tried several appetizers and all had different main courses and tiramisu for desert. The food was good but certainly not great and definitely not worth driving all across town to dine there. We tried it but we won't go back !!!

BMf0M1Yyup7ysbUGu3zLeA.text: We had a large party at this restaurant and least to say our experience wasn't pleasant.  Our server barely smiled the entire time and didn't anticipate our needs. The drinks weren't refilled and there was an hour wait in between 1st and main course. The dessert was served 7 minutes before we had to leave the restaurant. The manager had to remind us in a very unprofessional way that we have to leave at the exact time because they have to prepare for the next party.   The food was excellent but the bad customer service from the manager down to the servers made our dining experience in this restaurant very unpleasant. Will I go back or recommend this restaurant to anyone? Not a chance!

bTfptl5czA2T9iEsMr5cww.text: Love this restaurant! The food and service are always top notch.  As always, we start with the antipasto salad and the arancini. Recently we thought we would try the osso bucco. Wow! Topped the meal off with the warm chocolate cake. What a fantastic meal!

mLRL1iKUzx8Ufr1t1I3Ijw.text: As a frequent customer, I don't know why it took me so long to write this review! The food is unparalleled. Definitely try the red sangria! The new location is absolutely gorgeous and mostly the same friendly staff from the old location! Service is always exceptional. I'm always recommending this place to family and friends.  If you haven't tried this place, it is a MUST!

uOnVi7z5MZbytX65W1d1IQ.text: THIS PLACE IS AHHH-MAZINGGGGG!! We were referred by a local and we were quite impressed! The restaurant isn't too far from the strip, plenty of parking, exceptional service (our server was very attentive), and the food is delicious! This will be our go-to Italian restaurant when we are in town! Thank you soooo much Nora's Italian Cuisine!!!

ZzOGxBPRGjCqBL279nLAGA.text: I am writing this review as I enjoy leftovers from dinner earlier tonight.   The Nora experience ...ahh where to start... From the moment you step into Nora's you feel right at home.  The restaurant has this indescribable homey feel to it that just puts a person at ease. There are two rooms to the restaurant, without having made a reservation, we were lucky enough to be seated immediately in the room by the kitchen. Their ceiling is very unique and is decorated with Trinacria ornaments which is the symbol of Sicily. Our server was nice enough to give us a short history lesson...pretty interesting.   The garlic bread...ahhh the garlic bread...I could probably eat three baskets myself. So thin, crispy, and buttery....ahh AND GARLICKY...so delicious. The first basket is free and every additional basket is 2.50...which is smart of them because it is just that addicting. I can see people going off on the garlic bread and call it a day.   I ordered the Chicken Carciofi in attempts to be "healthy"....I figured that chicken breast can't be that bad for you...eh.  The order is served with pasta, fresh tomatoes, artichokes, and capers. The chicken was so moist and the flavors were just MMmmmMm...perfect...not to salty and just right. Pretty much blown away at first bite. Very generous portions, which explains why I'm stuffing my face with pasta at 1:30am... Such a bad idea blaghhh...Body will hate me for eating all these carbs before bed.  Friends got the rigatoni special and cheese raviolis which were great as well but I was pretty overwhelmed with my Carciofi to really enjoy theirs.  We also got the calamari and mozzarella sticks as appetizers, but I wasn't really impressed with either.  Really great Italian food at very reasonable prices without sacrificing service. Our server was very attentive and informative. I will definitely be back to try the crazy alfredo. It is probably a good idea to make a reservation next time to be seated in the main room.  Guaranteed to put you in a food coma.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5PiYg1ZaKBeEO6m4qoifew.text: The parking lot is small. Our server seemed like she was only paying attention to half of the table, like she would walk away and we weren't finished talking to her. Horrible because we were there to celebrate a birthday. Based on experience I'd rate them a 3 because of the tiny salt and pepper shakers, I mean come on even Olive Garden has salt and pepper grinders on the table. Also their grated cheese is in those glass bottles that you would expect at a casual pizza place but not at a nice restaurant. They get a 4 because the food was good but I'm not in a hurry to go back.

ldr9AmsBK_ozzt4H5OU-Lg.text: I can't speak highly enough about this restaurant. I've been here a handful of times and thoroughly enjoy myself every time. The food is amazing, the service is perfectly acceptable (especially considering they're usually packed!) and they have an excellent selection of food and drinks.  My favorite entree is the Frutti de Mare, but you honestly can't go wrong with menu selection. The Osso Bucco is phenomenal as well, although they only have it during the winter. For drinks, the cappuccino martini is wonderful, as is the sangria.   I love Nora's, it's absolutely a favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti de Mare &amp; white wine sangria

p7SQtvhKagHrqeKCG3NPnQ.text: Bait AND Switch......  Reserved for a Wednesday night dinner at the newly relocated Nora's.    Reservation process was a complete hassle and I should have taken notice early on.  No Open Table and Nora's on-line website booking system unavailable.  Telephone call resulted in a "we're not open message" without any option to leave a message.  Repeat call resulted in a long hold for a live attendant to accept a reservation.  Reservation offered was 15-45 minutes adjacent to requested time, which I gladly accepted.  Arrived just a few minutes before our 6:45 reservation to a jam packed waiting area filled with mostly angry patrons.  Second sign I should have abandoned the reservation.  Checked in with the hostess and proceeded to wait 45 minutes beyond my reservation while witnessing two things exclusively:  #1, patrons simply abandoning their reservations and departing; or #2, patrons waiting 30-60 minutes beyond their reserved / promised time, while complaining amongst themselves and / or to the hostess stand -- all to no avail.  I've dined at Nora's many times in the past while visiting Las Vegas.  Things have changed for the worst and I won't be back.  I understand issues and circumstances arise.  Communication goes a long way towards mitigating unforeseen matters.  Issues / circumstances were not the issue, its simply they way Nora's chooses to do business.  Oversubscribe, overpromise, and under deliver are the new norm and this customer votes with his wallet.  Hostess sat us, 45 minutes after our reservation, without so much as an apology.  Loads of outstanding restaurants in Las Vegas.  Many of which appreciate your business and honor the very basics, such as a reservation time.  Nora's has run its course and we won't give them another opportunity to showcase poor, poor execution.

0zeDWx_EIDs53dwp0M78kw.text: Since Nora's moved to their new location, there has been a major parking issue. The parking lot is too small; there is an inadequate amount of parking spaces. My husband and I were forced to parallel park on the street next to the restaurant at 5:30 pm on Tuesday night, Dec. 6th, 2016, which led to us getting into a frightening altercation with another motorist.  Although the food is excellent, we will not be returning to Nora's restaurant until they resolve the parking issue---either by expanding their parking lot, or offering valet parking.

yqtcHferavugjdUQstddfw.text: Our date night started a bit questionably here but was quickly turned around into a fantastic dining experience. No need to get into details but we noticed a few small things that were a bit "off" when we first got seated. However from the second our server showed up until we left we had an excellent experience. The food was phenomenal and the server gave a few excellent suggestions for a beer and app. Overall we were very happy with the experience and will be returning.

P4EEu73vkoEtvltSl7khcw.text: Maybe it was because it's Friday night and very busy, but the service was less than adequate tonight.  My first martini was served in a very small glass and our waiter was not very attentive. Waiting to see how our food is.

eqUO6Zr-hPYeTdToK1F6fw.text: The only thing I formerly didn't like about Nora's was the location. They got rid of that place and have a nice, new, facility about a block away. Same great menu, in an an awesome upscale facility. I am a fan and I will keep coming here.

rRX0_xVqCLKjDLkUTN84Mw.text: This place looked very promising, came in with the family hoping to get a great Italian meal. Service was very very slow, took a long time to get a server to the table. Once the server came and we ordered it was all on our own from there, didn't get checked up on too much. Main issue was the food, the pastas were mediocre and didnt really have much flavor or anything worth raving about. Wouldn't recommend for lunch, if you're okay with going to the strip for some Italian food go to Grand lux cafe or somewhere else, this place just set the expectations high and exciting but didn't provide the flavors or the quality of service we were looking for.  Disappointing, server wasn't too nice either or helpful when it came to me not liking my food, sassy

bbUQ5NHewBiQbWSSdxsgZw.text: Wife and I stopped in for lunch on Wednesday. The food here is delicious and the service was excellent. We will definitely come back again. If you haven't tried Nora's before I highly recommend it.

Mei7uKL8LouKqN0Gvz5yeQ.text: A little disappointig, with all the good reviews and as busy as they were I was just expecting more. My daughter and I arrived for an early dinner at 4:00 and the place was kinda busy, by the time we left at 5:00 it was packed, and it was midweek!!! That's usually a very good sign. We ordered mozzarella sticks for an app and they were soggy like I assume frozen ones from the store are and it came with an extremely small side of marinara sauce. The meals were ok, chicken parm and ravioli, nothing to exciting but ok. The service was excellent...

sVNQ8CKamXCd1DOB2c7bdQ.text: Talk about bust...we have driven past this place a thousand times and thought how it stands out in an otherwise run-down neighborhood.  So tonight, we stopped by, which may not have been the best idea, given that it was Father's Day and they appeared to be slammed.    We were seated at the one remaining table outside.  Our waiter came right over and got our drinks quickly.  Appetizers (calamari and salad) took about 20 minutes to come out.  Our bread, which was promised about four times, arrived in about 25 minutes.  Our table was cleared and then, we  waited for our dinners.  Thirty minutes later, another waiter came to our table, as I guess we were just sitting there with blank stares on our faces, and asked if anyone was helping us.  At that moment, our food came out.  We were fried after sitting outside for an hour in the heat, even with their misters, and were tired and annoyed it took an hour for our meals to arrive.  We had them box it up, cancel our dessert, and we left, about 70 mins after arrival.  I couldn't stomach the idea of sitting there for another hour.  Or whatever it was going to be.   My husband order a chicken pasta dish, which he tasted and said was good.  I had the gnocchi and vodka sauce ($17.50) which tasted like...well, tasteless mush.  It literally had no flavor and the gnocchi waswater logged or something.  That meal was tossed in the trash, as it was completely inedible.  I wouldn't give that slop to my pets.  I don't think I'll give them a second chance.    Two stars for our waiter. who was at least friendly (although who would also disappear for long amounts of time) and the ambiance, which is really nice.  Minus three stars for the mediocre food and the ridiculous wait times.

f2slNZJJYg_Z7YyXw14aYA.text: Same as Usual, excellent service and wonderful tasty food. Stopped in after work to grab a quick beer and a bite at the bar. 5 StRS is just insufficient a rating.

P6URRFtG1-JJ7Le7IF-Bvg.text: Just all right, but maybe I ordered wrong. Called to make a takeout order and girl says it will take about 35 minutes. Im driving in traffic and get there late in 45 minutes and still had to wait 15 minutes. It wasnt even that busy, but having to wait over an hour for a take out order is pretty ridiculous. The arincini was great, but the crazy fettucini was disappointing especially since everyone says its so good. The portion was huge- enough for 2-3 people, but sauce was watery and mostly filled with sausage. I only got 3 pieces of shrimp and some chicken. I love Italian food so maybe I will come back and get something better.

uSDf7Wod7AR9baxFD0e3GQ.text: I have been a Nora's customer for as long as they've been around. Finally was able to visit the new restaurant and have lunch with a girlfriend. Just a beautiful restaurant (Congratulations)! Great service... William was our server, he was so awesome! Besides the great service he gave us girls time to chit-chat and didn't rush us out we felt very comfortable taking our time hanging around drinking our wine at the table. The food was excellent as usual, I love that they offer the half portions! Highly recommend for a nice relaxing lunch to catch up with the girlfriends.

6n_b0STdRUGPseGpyl-Xsw.text: Nice to eat where the locals eat. Try the Crazy Alfredo... now thatz-a-spicey-a-meatball!

3cRwd0q0DqhhELnzxl5RDQ.text: I love this location, the Osteria in Summerlin is a little different, still good, but it doesn't have that hole-in-the-wall family style feeling. I'm Italian and I hardly like Italian food in restaurants but this place is my only exception. Try everything! And visit the bar too, they have some amazing mixologist's.

BlHJmF72GI8nNyZM3UNlCQ.text: I heard about this place on a local radio station. They were mentioning the top pizza places in throughout the nation. Nora's took first place and of course, being the pizza lover I am, I had to try this place. After finally planning our Vegas trip I said we had to try this place before we left to see if its really the #1 best pizza in the USA (San Diego took #2 woohoo). We got there exactly at the time they opened to beat the lunch crowd. At first it was empty, but immediately got packed for the lunch hour.  We already know what we wanted since we had browsed through the menu on their website. After being seated, the bus boy offered us water along with any other beverage. A few minutes later, our waitress greeted us with fresh garlic bread (Which was to die for!!) We started off with a Caesar Salad then ordered our pizza. We went for the Snow White pizza and added mushrooms and prosciutto (per hubby's request). I must say this is probably the best pizza I've ever had. The ricotta on the pizza was so fresh it would melt in your mouth. The dough was just perfect. Not too heavy, not too doughy, not too thin, not too thick. I'm usually not too crazy about prosciutto, its just too salty for me to enjoy, but this one was perfect!! It had the right texture, not too chewy or salty. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and I can totally see myself coming back if I'm ever in Vegas again.

u6xOQgU6G8Uoru99BnhcaA.text: Great food, reservations are a must, bar gets over packed and it is near impossible to get a seat.  Also make sure you sit in one of the side rooms and not near the kitchen.  Food is grea and alone would be worth four stars,but the service is suspect at best, and being beyond packed is what bugs me about this place.

05GFDQevBpQ-uj6sVO__kA.text: They start you out with a basket of perfectly toasted garlic bread. I ordered veal parm. They served it as a bone-in chop and it was perfect! I had a nice bowl of spaghetti as a side dish. The pasta was done just right with a great marinara.  Great food, good prices and it's away from the Strip. Highly recommended.

MIanUe_B-cge7OdsbTAxzw.text: I had eaten there many times with the same friend and after an absence of many months the two of returned. The waitress recognized us and gave a friendly greeting. I asked for chicken erbi fini and the waitress said it was no longer on the menu, but it would be no problem. So far so good.   When the chicken came it was a bit over cooked and I thought the spaghetti sauce not up to par, but it was still pretty good.   It was my friend's turn to pay and he gave the waitress his credit card. She returned and apologized and said since we hadn't been there in a while she would have to see his ID. My friend was not put off by this, but I was. I would have been very annoyed if that had happened to me, especially if I was bring someone there for business and they recognized me as a returning customer and still wanted to see my ID. I left not eager to return. WHEN I MENTIONED THIS CREDIT CARD ISSUE TO MY FRIEND MUCH LATER, HE TOLD ME THAT HIS WIFE INSISTS ON WRITING ON THE BACK OF EACH OF HIS CREDIT CARDS, "PLEASE DEMAND TO SEE MY ID." So, I think what happened is that the waitress obviously didn't look at the back of his credit card, the cashier did and just told the waitress w/o explanation to check that customer's ID. This goes to show how it can be tough to please in a service industry such as a restaurant.

HlfYlaQz5ZhRis20hIF8xw.text: The Veal Parma Entree is amazing.  That is my go to dish every time I am here.  The garlic bread is terrific, the only problem is they cany keep your bread basket full as your group will surely eat the bread faster then the servers can fill it.  I love this place.

G6PbBxpJHQauXQRwDIq73w.text: Come hungry! The garlic bread is delicious and the entree portions are huge. Excellent service as well.

JTWB7W4GR2V3rTnsKxm66g.text: Chicken soup was average. Pasta was average. Price....moderate. Only compliant was when I called they said the wait was 35 mins or reservation. The reservation soonest available was an hour away from the time I called. When we arrived it was only about 35% occupancy. I give it a 2 1/2 star average.

4-vIXtyWsYZoV5FB4FUXNw.text: My buddy and I returned from hiking in the Great Basin National Park and we both were craving eggplant parmesan.  Checked here on Yelp and found many good reviews for Nora's.  I will now add my own glowing review.  Food came piping hot and delicious.  Both of us agreed on how good it was.  The cannolis were also great and huge.  It would have been perfect if the place had cheaper in-house wine by the carafe.  Al in all, the culinary highlight of our trip.

kSIjsnsMj56GL6QG7sW0gA.text: Mi familia and I rarely go out for Italian food. Mainly because my son only eats cheese pizza and my daughter angel hair with butter and Parmesan cheese. What? I'm gonna spend twenty bucks on that? Sorry kids, no. We're eating in.   But we were on vacation. My buddy read up on this place and convinced me to join him and his family. And I'm glad I did.   Yeah, the kids got cheese pizza and angel hair with butter. Man, are they REALLY my kids? When are they gonna expand their palates? But the rest of us went for it on the menu and I have to say I was fairly impressed.   The garlic bread they drop off at the table is warm, chewy and garlicky. Nice start. And they kept it coming.  Me loves that.  Lots.  Hands down best calamari I've ever had in an Italian restaurant. The accompanying sauce wasn't just boring ol' marinara, it was a nice, complex side that went well with the light and crunchy squid.   My buddy ate all the tentacles.  Solid house salad. Nothing amazing, but good, fresh ingredients and a tangy dressing.  Perfect soaked up with the bread.   The so-so. (There won't be a bad category). The chicken parm was on the small side. Good enough, but not outstanding. Don't order it. Same for the special veal chop. It looks impressive and the price isn't bad - 28 bucks - but it didn't make any of us at the table scream  "Mangia, mangia!"   The good. My son's cheese pizza.  Really awesome crust and blend of cheeses. And made for a good breakfast the next day. My wife had the pesto. Perfect. Absolutely perfect. And my linguine with clams? A ton of clams and garlic, nicely proportioned. I cleaned my plate happily.   I'm a former waiter and I have to say, the service was pretty good. Apparently, the night we went, the place got slow, so they let a few servers go. Then they got slammed. While we did have to wait, the waiter and bus staff kept their cool, never running around like chickens with their heads cut off. That showed professionalism and didn't ruin our dining experience.   Though on the flip side, why didn't the manager just call up a waiter? Tell them, "Get your butt back here, we got slammed!"   That happened to me back in the day.  Finally, the bill came. And considering all the food we had, I thought we got out of there cheap. We didn't drink much alcohol, but nine people were stuffed to the gills.   Grazie, Nora!   Ciao!

KPmiaiygtJMSbIkAjVDtig.text: I love ordering their pizza for lunch, & I like that I can order by the slice & take it to go. I've been going here for years, absolutely love it!

yxE42U01IalmTC-NgAkWCQ.text: Food delicious but it is already 45 min after our reservation & still sitting in waiting area.  Don't know if worth the wait.   Seems like if you know the staff you will get seated earlier.....finally seated @ 8:45 & when we complained all we received were excuses.  People were coming in & getting quoted an hour without reservations...... 3 minutes after we were seated, couple seated who just walked in.  ............waitress & manager helped to correct situation, were very nice unlike the hostess' which thought their lame excuses would fool the customer.  If they would have just been upfront & honest, we wouldn't have had a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time still waiting for an 8 o&#39;clock reservation.

1B44fH4EKzJU99bJOJwFeA.text: I'm not from Vegas but a friend that used to live there took a group of us here for dinner and i thoroughly enjoyed it, esp getting off the Strip and going somewhere that is just your typical good family Southern Italian restaurant, much like i'd find in my town.   i thought the service was great (waiting on nine young loud women for a pre-bachelorette dinner can't be easy, but the general boisterous atmosphere helped) - our waiters told us about the group menu option since we were a group of nine, and that made things so much easier. thus, we were able to eat family style and we tried a variety of reliably good dishes, including gnocchi, veal marsala and meatballs. for $22 per person, it was a great deal, esp given the amt of food we got.   my only complaint about the food is the tiramisu - it was just way too mushy and watery.

gci6BfW2MH0xeC014t1LVg.text: So my family and I decided to try to do a place of the strip this weekend and saw the reviews for Nora's and thought we would give it a try.  We had reservations at 8 and did not get seated unit 8:45.  When we sat down it seemed we only had one waiter for the half of the entire restaurant.  Even though she was very friendly it seemed like they were very understaff. Never once got asked if we needed a refill or another drink.  Can not complain about the food however it was very delicious.  So all in all I probably will not come back due to the fact that it is a $20 cab ride and the service was not great at all.

SRd05HjaSJjoey7ZKmbh5Q.text: Pretty dang good food here!   Called a little a head of time to make reservations that night. We pulled up to a strip mall, next to a bowling store.. OK so the outside wasn't fancy, but as soon as you get in the doors you understand why people aren't scared to return. The interior is decorated very upscale, except for the white paper table cloths. Our party walked in around 6pm and the place was packed, already people waiting for tables to be seated.. As soon as you enter the restaurant a wall of deli shes garlic smells make your mouth water. As we waited the few minutes, we got to enjoy watching the cooks, cook in the kitchen, which is placed right in the middle of the restaurant. We got seated near the bar and got to watch all the locals sit down and wind down. It looked like they had some fancy martini's if your into that kind of stuff..   As soon as we sat down we were served a huge bowl of garlic bread, no extra cost. And they didn't skimp at all, I mean this was a huge basket of really yummy garlic bread. Our wait staff was on their game this evening, filling glasses of water, and refilling the garlic bread basket a few times. We also ordered a small salad for an app. The salad was no where near small, it feed the four of us.   We all ordered our food, someone got chicken Marsala's, another got the lasagna, and I got the Alfredo Carbon. The portion sizes where huge, and the food was great! We all had enough leftovers for a second meal, which we nicely boxed up. Nicely done Nora's! Still feeling stuffed! :)

SIncCL-Bnp3VyBMWiZ_EJQ.text: Great dinners, excellent waiter, very poor bartender. Bartender took a very long time taking our orders didn't seem to care

0yV9Uet8SzCDRSAj016eYA.text: The food was ok. The highlight of the meal was the molten chocolate cake with pistachio anglaise. However, it came 20 minutes after the meal was over and it was pre-ordered per their request. I understand that it was made fresh but being a chef I know they had plenty of time. What should be the restaurants bread and butter  the red sauce  tasted like watered down Ragu. The place is also a fire hazard you can't even get to the bathroom because the tables are so jammed together. Nora's used t be much better and they can do better.

c-HDlGr9oRAZDJe9wnGcmA.text: Alfredo pasta is out of this world! Good ambience. Live music. Garlic bread is good. Highly recommend.

II7NdPounPvPYz9c6SXifg.text: This place is  really bad. A can of Chef Boyadee would be better than this crap. The linguini and clams were awful, they had the texture of sand and rubber. My mother in law had the nasty cold lasagna. The cheap tasteless bread  was the highlight of this dump. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!

IigFcSyHsL1JT4uhSyDKmQ.text: Delicious food & wine! Loved the shrimp scampi appetizer (abundant garlic!!!), chicken soup was second-to-none, and the Spinach Cannelloni entree was melt-in-your-mouth divine!

uyLC_r-1tV759TxBJKOEzQ.text: Hey!  Whatever happened to the old Nora's?  A few mos. ago we rec'd. lousy attention at a late lunch because the server was more enamored with the men at the bar than the room with only 3 full tables when we arrived.  Also, getting garlic bread appeared too much for her.  So, let's forward to yesterday when we said let's give it another chance...  Three of us arrived around 3:00 when the barroom was busy with a few parties, so we were seated in the main din. room.  We ordered house salad for 3, spaghetti & meatballs, pesto pasta w/broccoli & the rigatoni special.  And we waited.  And we waited for the main courses.  We had to ask for the garlic bread (good tasting).  The salad arrived with little frozen-like cheese niblets and we were very surprised the server didn't ask if we wanted Parmesan for the pastas, instead putting a little jar of it on the table.  All the food was decent & that's not the complaint.  The service is, once again, & we had the feeling the parties in the bar were  more important.  Unfortunately, Nora's has no happy hour, and drinks (at all times) are $7 for all beers, & wines starting @ 8.  So, though their prices for pastas are reasonable enough, they sure make up for it on the drinks.

m_yIojHdGEYTV1JXKSGzpg.text: The best Italian food you'll find in town. Even when it was a tiny little place with 5 tables! Gnocchi is and will always be my favorite!

syKV17ZbIky0qxvhHokQgg.text: Wow found this place by accident and was surprised how good the food was! Me and my gf went here after we got disappointed by a place a mile away.  The staff was super nice pleasant and server was on top of everything. Great wine selection and lunch menu offers lots of choices.  Very responsibly priced and the ambiance was pleasant. We came here for lunch and was advised to make reservation if you want to come here for dinner.  Will definitely come back here again when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G7JsB0nms8q1c53BHReZnQ.text: Nora's has been on my list of places to eat for years now. I finally got the chance last night for a birthday celebration! Walking in, it has an old Tuscan feel to it. It's dimly lit, bar is situated in the middle, and it gets pretty noisy. Our server was great! I think his name was Don. He kept our drinks and garlic breadsticks full! Speaking of the garlic breadsticks...omg they are the best thing ever. And they're complimentary!   Onto the food!  Calamari: Yum! Fried and seasoned perfectly. It wasn't oily at all! I really enjoyed the sauce it came with. I'm not sure exactly what the sauce was but it tasted like a marinara and it was a nice change from the typical creamy, white sauce most other places give.   Grilled octopus: I wished it had more of that char taste I was looking for. The texture itself was nice but it wasn't the most flavorful dish. I would probably skip next time.   Lasagna: omg so. much. cheese! I did wish it had more meat sauce (l like saucy lasagnas). This is definitely not for someone who's lactose intolerant. But then again, who takes that seriously? Lol kidding.   Crazy Alfredo: I really enjoyed this dish! It has a nice kick of spice from the jalapenos. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the dish had the right amount of sauce on it.   Osso bucco: this was so tender! Comes with mashed potatoes.   Ribeye (came with truffle fries): We asked for it to be cooked medium and it was perfect! It had the nice char and wasn't chewy at all. It comes with a side of truffle fries which I am all about!   Most of the entrees could be shared, such as the osso bucco and crazy Alfredo. They're huge!   Overall I do recommend this place. It's nice that it's not on the Strip and the prices are reasonable. The food and service was excellent. Only thing I wasn't down for was the noise level. It gets LOUD. I found myself shouting a few times across the table...but I don't know if that's saying much because I generally have a small voice haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Fritti

XLz8-A0CXPDcFFl0RZ9hHQ.text: I like Nora's. I've been there twice now and both times I've had really good pasta and service. There are quite a few things to chose from.  I like splitting a large salad with a friend and we each order our own entrees. I haven't been disappointed yet.

ECz5Fg3yHCSTSsH7T_HcbA.text: House salad was ammmmmmmmazing. Chopped mozzarella was super good. Truffle fry was sooooo good as well.   Pasta was just ok. The noodles itself were salty. Overall, every dish was very good.

mmKrBGo70pXAOkRLyzLlQg.text: Wonderful Italian food. Fresh and just really good.Pasta Primavera is my favorite.service is great and friendly. Took some home and lunch the next day was great too!!

-2Bem0cGoYjgFCaX726yNQ.text: This is another one of my favorite restaurants in town -- again, I've come here many times but this is the first time I've actually written a review for it. Nora's is off the Strip, and yet it feels more intimate than most, like you're visiting family or friends for dinner. Little wonder why this place is always packed -- get a reservation if you can! And ask for Don, Anthony or Sebastian for your server for great service!  Anyway, I ordered some items that are different from my usual for the purposes of this review -- starting with the arancini. Crisp on the outside, fluffy and cheesy on the inside -- and with the marinara and basil, it's perfect. I also got the spinach and farro salad, which was also light and paired perfectly with the arancini.  Even if you don't order appetizers or salad, you receive some garlic bread at your table. It takes a while for it to arrive, but it comes out fresh and with plenty of garlic -- which I like since I like a lot of garlic on my garlic bread.  For my main, I got the pappardelle Luisa -- pappardelle pasta with sausage, leeks, sundried tomatoes and white wine cream sauce. It was absolutely delicious, and the sauce was surprisingly light! It was perfect for dipping the garlic bread into, as well.  Normally I don't order the dessert I got -- the spumoni -- but it was warm enough out that I wanted something cold. It was actually refreshing, and I could taste each different layer. The pistachios added some nice crunch to the sweet, as well.  As I said before, this isn't my first time here, nor are these my usual orders ( hello, mozzarella caprese, warm chocolate cake, and antipasto salad ), but this was just to prove that everything I've had at Nora's is delicious. It really just depends on what kind of meal you want or what you can or can't eat -- but there's something for everyone there, and I hope you enjoy this place as much as I do!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle Luisa. 5/5!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their complementary garlic bread. 5/5
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni. Normally 3/5, but 4/5 because it was hot out.

m9L-WZhmbND5hqse_ILEUw.text: I love nora's. This was my second time going my friends and i all ordered something and shared. the portion sizes are pretty good. I would say almost every dish is shareable for 2. I did not care much for the eggplant parm, because the way it was fried, you could barely taste the eggplant! The tiramisu was not what i was expecting either a little on the smaller side so i personally wouldn't share that. But all that said still feel this is a great restaurant and I love the new location, the atmosphere is very classy.
