9uFQXOy1xpLtF8c_m4IbVQ.text: DONT GO HERE!!!! USED TO GO TO OTHER LOCATION FOR YEARS. WILL NEVER RETURN HERE.   Liz was a horrible server; rude and unprofessional   We made a reservation months prior, confirmed the day before only to arrive and find out they'd booked another reservation in our place. (Even when we arrived 45 min early) Liz was smug and tried in no way to accommodate us.   Our food arrived cold, we Sent it back and it came back COLD again. HORRIBLE.  Dayton tried his best to fix things for us but they were just SO BAD.   Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY

mJAIr1AJ0k7JKj7C8Nh8Xg.text: Really good with great service! Our drinks were delicious, everything was brought out very timely. The whole staff was very friendly.

9BhqLaibJYxrZkJiEcTTuA.text: A great Italian restaurant with all the classics and some house specials. The food was great. The server was attentive. It was a little loud but was still able to carry a conversation over dinner. Would definitely recommend if u want Italian cuisine.

grn03VGZgWoggT8ZJUXHUw.text: This was my first time dining off the strip. One of my family member had been here before. The decor was on point. I loved the color scheme and layout. The bar was well lit and beautifully designed. When we sat down to order, waitress promptly took our orders. Everyone in party was satisfied with our food. Quality was good. Portion was big. Price was reasonable. We'd go back again. I'd actually rate this 3.5 star. 4.0 star for food.   3.5 star for service since it took forever to get our waitress to bring out the birthday cake then our check. When I passed by our waitress on my way out from the restroom, she didn't even bother to say Thanks or Have a Good Evening.

T_H-jf4PqT7NxP7gOUwErA.text: I came to Nora's while I was in town for work. We hosted an event in their private room upstairs, with its own bar and patio. This is away from the strip, but from what I hear a local favorite and now I know why. The food was amazing! Please make sure you order the Arancini (spell check), I promise you will not be disappointed. I am still not exactly sure what is in those little balls of deliciousness, but it was a tasty treat. Everything I tried  was very good, which make me feel like you cannot go wrong with anything you order there.   Also, I really do appreciate the staff who went above and beyond to meet our needs and help make the event successful.   I am sure I will be returning here when I come back to Vegas, whether that is for fun or work.

P0-vaHTMevVWIdbGV79G3g.text: The customer experience was less than ideal.  The hostess station was like being in junior high with 3 giggling teenagers ignoring customers.   They sent a text to let us know our table was available ( I like to put my phone away and enjoy my dining experience).  When we asked about our table, we were ignored and the teenagers continued to giggle and flirt with the bar staff even though our table was available 25 minutes.   Did I mention we were 3 seats from the hostess table.  Our complaints fell on deaf ears with out an apology or acknowledgement from management.  Shame on this level of customer service.   That being said, the food was great.  Get your act together

sOSxepdmPBcxkVF6PmWzXg.text: Not sure what's giving this place so much attention.  Honestly, the food is very bland. I had the Crazy Alfredo, which was okay at best. My husband had Pesto Pasta which was also very bland. Our waiter Marla, was very inattentive. I feel like the bussers seemed to pay us more mind than her. Since we came for a special occasion, they earned the extra star for the free dessert. But honestly mediocre at best. I will try it again, to see if it gets better.

gVVtHUgJeBoQGfxe9BV9BA.text: Another great meal at Nora's! We come to Las Vegas every year for a restaurant show and we love to eat Italian food. This year was even better than last year. We had the Antipasto Salad, Pasta Faggioli soup AND Prosciutto Pizza as an appetizer. They were all delicious!  For dinner (yes, we ate more!), we had the Veal Parmigiana (amazing)and the Pork Tenderloin alla Siciliana. The pork was served with roasted potatoes and breaded, roasted tomatoes. In addition, we had the Alla Nora- baked spaghetti with eggplant, meat sauce, and pesto drizzled on top. We loved it. Yes, we ordered way too much food but we wanted to taste a variety of items.   The service by Ramon was fabulous- friendly, brisk, and efficient.

sMUFWDWUWclywmD8Lk2jjg.text: Love this place. The service was excellent and the food was so reasonably priced! We ordered a lot of things and couldn't believe our bill was so low. And, what delicious food. We had plenty to eat and some to take home, and none of it went to waste. I posted a few pictures if you want to see what we had. This place is popular for obvious reasons. We'll definitely be back.

2Ah_7FMAAb3QJnG8QVKleg.text: I finally got to come here and check out the hype of this place..... I've herd about it for years and finally was able to experience it   We were greeted an seated quickly ..... they had live music which was a nice experience to see and listen to while enjoying your dinner   Our waitress took our drinks I ordered the mule it is my favorite :) and it was delicious of course   I was regular I was having a hard time choosing between a few dishes so I just went with basic and had spaghetti and meatballs my friend had the crazy pasta ( I'm not super sure if that's the name lol ) you get bread and butter before I always try to stay away I never want to get full :(   My spaghetti and meatballs were good definitely gave me a nice portion and the meatballs were big which was definitely nice I sadly didn't try my friends dish but they said it was delicious we both had left overs to take with us   I want to return to check out some the other dishes

L8BvEsXfNCSHQ0XR727ggg.text: Good service and good food killer combination! Always packed on the weekend it is almost impossible to find a parking spot and they a huge parking lot . Recommend to make a reservation ahead of time .

vfTpNfAxQ07OKOztbZ43_A.text: I can't even begin to explain how amazing this place is! Every time I come to Vegas, this is my spot! It's an amazing local spot off the strip and away from all the ruckus! The food is outstanding, and authentic! Do yourself a favor and stop in next time you are in Vegas!

kWZqJjnfjhYAqzifzwCT-A.text: The food was excellent. I would have given it 5 stars, but I found the waitress unfriendly. Think her name started with an M. I looked around and it seems the wait staff wasn't very friendly in general. There was a man in a suit who may have been a Mgr and he walked around appearing just as unfriendly. He didn't bother to greeting us or see how our experience was. This seems to be the culture at Nora's. The hostess in the front greeted us with smiles going in and out.

agUzx5lW4DcgfCB5JhE06w.text: Amazing Anniversary Dinner  They are open until 12am which was a plus for us.  Then the fact they had plenty of tables and a live band was really nice. The food was tasty and the beers were cold. They had a large wine selection too. We ended our meal with dessert and it was delicious. Thank you to the server and staff for making our Anniversary special.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you for making our Special Day even more special.

Nh4Rw5zVeuWwz-oXBlhJgg.text: First visited Nora's last year and enjoyed it very much. Sadly my follow up visits have been unsatisfactory and I won't be hurrying back. The food is good but the service has been poor the last few times - they seem chronically understaffed for the crowds that they know arrive every night. They also somehow manage to rush you and yet make you wait at the same time which is no easy feat. Perhaps our waiter was new but after we declined dessert he brought our bill, even though we planned on having another cocktail and espresso. Portion sizes are generally too large with the exception of my Chicken Marsala which I swear was 3oz of chicken and about two mushrooms sliced up. I'm sure my lack of patronage won't effect their bottom line but because we eat out frequently I am often asked about places to go; sadly Nora's is off of my recommendation list.

c4jgoBphJCH-JKLck2Ynxg.text: Sadly my experience last night was not as I had hoped. I chose Nora's to get a visiting friend off the strip for some local flavor.  Now, this isn't my first time to Nora's, but it is my first time to the new location. The good: we changed reservation times a couple times and they were very accommodating, I requested a table outside, they gave it to me (though I waited a bit for it to be set and when walked to the table found that it was not set up). Wine-Great list of options!!! Top notch variety and selection. Ambiance-social, upbeat and warm. Now the bad-well not BAD-but "off": First waitress made a point of rebutting my stating they did a nice weekend brunch here-I'm sure her intention was good and did so to provide me accurate information, it's just how she did it... She then came back and said she'd be handing our table over to another waiter (ok?)-but offered to get our drinks...we gave her the order which was delivered by another waiter...just a bit odd. The food-normally, pretty good, last night not so much. We ordered the steak bruschetta to start-both of us tried "sawing" through the over toasted bread-and when trying to bite it-guaranteed trip to the dentist for a broken tooth. I ordered the linguini and clams-the pasta wasn't buttery and brothy like I think it should be and half of the clam shells were empty :-( Also, I had to ask for a bowl for to remove the clam shells from the dish once I had eaten them. Nearly half of my dinner was left on the plate and that's not like me! When we were finished we were handed the check and weren't asked if we'd like dessert... Like I said before, this was an odd experience at Nora's who I had always put in my consistently good bucket....last night they were removed and placed in the "roll the dice" bucket. Bummer.

3Ip5GcERZwn2u49RiZnAtw.text: Mom and I had dinner here recently at their new location. Even with a reservation, we waited about 15 minutes for a table.  The place was packed.  The one downside - it was super, super noisy.  They did not sound proof the restaurant well.    Our waitress was a bit busy too and did not come by as much as she should.  But the food was tasty and worth it.    i started with the House salad - Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes.  Good toppings, and you never can have enough cheese.  Mom had the Pasta Faggioli soup.  She said it was very  good.  Lots of veggies.  For entrees, I had the Chicken Carciofi - Bone-less chicken breast with fresh tomato, artichokes, and capers. Served with linguine.  Mom had the Veal Parmigiana - from the leg, served with spaghetti and tomato sauce. We both liked our meals.  They were good sized portions.  Good sauces, good cheese.  The garlic bread is good too.  Definitely a good family style Italian restaurant.  It is quite noisy and very busy but it was a good experience.

T6lx57pIZpjSmIGNGlKo6A.text: We came here for lunch and it was busy.   Your basic Italian eatery but nothing jumps out at you, with good portion and value.  We will come back to sample other lunch items.  Their large party booking guidelines are a bit rigid to our liking and sweat over when there are many other restaurant choices.  Heard a lot from our friends about this place's humble beginning to become this free standing beautiful building.  Hope they will do well.

sokPhJ0DNMYONx7bAnZFTQ.text: We came here today for lunch. Took awhile to get our order but that's because the bartender was also acting as a server. I had a cappuccino (yum) and the chicken Marsala with a house salad. My husband had the pork tenderloin. Both were so yummy! Perfect! I also really like the ambiance in here, white marble bar and brick interior very classy. Just found a new Italian spot without strip pricing!

vQ5wI9LqhqFCT8b8ZFrVjg.text: I've heard so many good things about Noras but I was kind of disappointed.  For starters, their muscles appetizer was way too hot with whatever pepper they use.  Secondly,  their chicken ceasar salad was actually drenched with dressing, the chicken tasted so very good but had to drink water after every bite because it was as dry as sawdust. Finally the best meal at the table was the crazy alfredo and boy is it flavorful,  there are so many things going on it was just super tasty my only complaint about it was that the sundried tomatoes tasted like they had refrigerator burn, had to pick around them, bummer because it would have really complimented the meal.  That's  that

3NHIPgdUn9kQBEeDcejJMg.text: Reluctantly gave Nora's another try after a not-so-amazing first visit, and glad I did. Danny and Marcelo pulled out all the stops to make sure everything was on point this time around.  My friend and I were seated promptly at our reservation time and both opted for a Strawberry Daze each since they were so good before. A beautiful batch of arancini came out on the house, and was quite delicious as well. While I was tempted to give the alfredo another go, I chose our server's recommendation of the Chicken Carciofi. Super delicious if you like the flavors of lemony capers and artichoke. I must add that the dinner portions here are huge, but I was happy to have leftovers to enjoy later.  Housemade tiramisu hit the spot to close out a great dinner. Staff was attentive, attractive, and kind. Atmosphere was upscale chill without a touristy Vegas strip feel, which I really liked. Cool environment for a nice date or just to catch up on the latest goss with a girlfriend without feeling rushed.

9BVEjhnV_pz6sGXJGKf4CQ.text: Overall the food is ok and the service is friendly. But this is an Americanized version of "Italian cuisine". There is no such thing as "crazy Alfredo" or "spaghetti with meatballs" in Italy. And you certainly never see a huge plate of chicken or veal parmigiana served with a massive pile of spaghetti on the side anywhere on the Boot. Nevertheless the place was packed as it surely appeals to the hungry masses looking to overeat for good value.

F0Er4u-OfYaUUi6IzIS_GA.text: Elite Italian for a pretty solid price. Alla Nora is a great dish with great eggplant.

hyFeL7HGH_HwdJkcsooPPQ.text: This was my first time at this larger location. A Tuesday night and it was crowded! Make reservations when you go. We got there around 8:20pm and their first availability was 9pm. The location is easier to see since it's close to the street. They have a nice outdoor seating area with misters. And there are benches inside and outside to accommodate guests waiting for their tables.   When we were seated, the first thing I noticed was the noise level. It was quite loud. Hard floors, high ceilings and open layout made it a little playground for all the sound waves! But it got quieter as people trickled out. The service was nice and attentive. Food came out in a timely manner.  We had the grilled octopus and calamari as appetizers. Both prepared well, but the octopus had more flavor. I had the Crazy Alfredo which I enjoyed because it was a touch spicy. I guess I was in the mood for a little kick! It had shrimp, sausage, chicken, mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes and jalapenos. Overall, a pleasant experience, but nothing that really stood out.   They also have a private room which would be nice for groups.

gLPODZ6OF7A-lcLFscV9gA.text: Not that great ,I think it's over rated  & cannot figure out why it's  difficult getting in ,maybe thats by design , everyone wants in to someplace difficult getting into ? Maybe ? ? Gnocchi had a dark thick ala vodka sauce it was like paste ,wasn't fresh  at all.  The clam sauce is made with Manila clams , eh. I wouldn't run back.

zEMo7O8SncJCVLYUDMcosg.text: Had dinner at the bar last night with my wife and Norm was our bartender. First the place was packed and he got us 2 seats at the bar, had a drink and then ordered dinner. We each had a salad that was great followed by a rack of lamb and veal. My lamb was perfect and the veal was so tender. Norm suggested a wine for us that went with both of our meals. There is a reason why this place is so busy and I suggest you eat at the bar and ask for Norm.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of Lamb.

PaKco0GhNar2MDV37pTOEg.text: Amazing!  My best friends had their birthday dinner here. The parking is pretty limited. We went around 630 and the lot was pretty packed. Also it's in a strange location. I couldn't find it at first I was expecting it to be a bigger restaurant but I don't  judge.   We decided to grab some drinks at the bar first. Lemon drop, bomb. Rose sangria, bomb. Moscow mule, bomb. That witchcraft drink, don't get! made me grow some chest hairs!  Finally seated, our waiter was amazing and very good looking I might add. We started with calamari. Very good, the sauce it came with was to die for. I ordered the Veal Cannelloni. Oh my gosh it was one of the best things I ever tasted. I honestly didn't know what veal was when I ordered it but it was amazing! My friend got the Frutti De Mare which was amazing also. It had a very seafood taste to it very different from my Veal dish but I loved both.   They brought our tiramisu and a Canolli for my best friends birthday on the house. And that Canolli was heaven! It had pistachio crumbs and that just made it perfect. The tiramisu however, I've had better but doesn't mean it was good.  Must come back and I highly recommend!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal

7fWrs-QlXtRiAu3P2XqicQ.text: Love this place and so do many repeat diners.  A vast array of Italian dishes passed down from family.  I noticed that many entrees were incorporated from the Summerlin Nora's.  An all time favorite, the Wild Boar Ragu is always a winner.  The Antipasto Salad is so delicious and an easy dish to share.  There beautiful new building is sure to please with more room than their old restaurant.  Same great service, beautiful bar and outdoor seating weather permitting.

V8R8XWuwbfRCXEWD-l94lg.text: This place is A++++. Have driven by and seen that it is constantly busy in the evenings so I have been dying to try it. Was not disappointed and honestly was completely blown away. The salad, garlic bread, pasta, and dessert were all absolutely top notch! The service from Marla was great and the whole experience just made my week. When I called ahead i was told that they were very busy and I wouldn't be able to get a reservation for a couple hours. I figured this had to be a great sign and just showed up in person. Shortly after having a drink I was offered a table on the patio near the boce ball court. My only regret is that I didn't try some of the pizza because the ones I saw coming out of the kitchen looked incredible. The staff at this place is amazing literally every single person I spoke made me feel so welcome!

cVPWNZ7img8GAsvTa3preQ.text: An amazing Italian place!! I was extremely happy with the food and service. A great place for a date night or a meal with family and friends. They have patio seating available. The garlic bread is bomb!!! The plates are generous, and can feed up to 2

8kwhZR_T9-9KsRFCnBOjOw.text: I'm shocked to know people like the food.  The service is better than the food.  I've given it a chance and I have gone three times not by my account but due to Birthday dinners invitations.  The presentation is nice but there is no flavor to the food whatsoever.  I have tried three different meals including desserts and I can't understand what people are talking about.  I think there is more hype and people have different taste buds and apparently it's boring.  Sorry, I won't be coming back I have had better.  I gave it two stars and not one because it's the food that counts and at least the people were nice.

gfaj2VQ_Mvz9geN9QQfqIg.text: We used to go to Nora's all the time and just tried the newer restaurant and was very disappointed. We ordered steak, pasta Nora which both came to us cold. The bread was soaked in butter and the fries were extremely salty. Very disappointed with the quality of food.

eSGkL2ut4HHM9M15jUfC7A.text: Came here while visiting from out of town.  Best meal in Vegas trip.  Group of four had tale in kitchen area which was awesome.  Could hear live music, awesome.  Food, was great great great.  Heavy on garlic in some dishes but in a good way.  Nothing was to complain about.  Price wasn't expensive.  We had appetizers, four entries and some dessert and three bottles of wine and it wasn't too expensive for what we had.  I hope they keep the tables in the kitchen at the new location.  Not to miss.

-ROXE_3McJwjDcRYWtl69w.text: Visiting Las Vegas from New York City and I'm very DISAPPOINTED!!! While I was eating dinner with few friends we saw a cockroach walking next to our table, I obviously lost my appetite and couldn't finish my dinner. We asked to move outdoor because at that point we could no longer sit inside. We ask to speak to the manager "Joe" and explained to him the situation. His replied was "it can come from the kitchen, from people and anyone could bring this with him", I was shocked by his answer and was really offended to see a manger who isn't willing to take responsibility for it, I feel bad for the owners who pay someone to take care of their place and instead they ruined it. He gave us the coffee on the house. It was really embarrassing and the way he treated us was really rude. Would never recommend this place or step foot here ever again.

gkFC02JeeMlGTZ1kCIVM6w.text: Just want to say one thing in the middle of earring the dinner we saw a cockroach next to are feet after we eat are food we showed the manger the picture and we show the waitress the moving cockroach we  talk to him and he was so rude to us about it he said well he can come from people that walk in or from the outside we told him yes but what do you mean you don't take responsibility for your resturant he said to us good night and the Coffe is on the house lol

Vgd83Tvs5tQWXR2Md0Txhg.text: Expensive!  The pasta is not handmade, and the quality of food was not good at all..  Very Disappointed..  the antipasto and garlic bread are good!!

eas5TEVCS7tH_27lxbq8Dw.text: Nora's is exceptional. Food and service are awesome. Sebastiani is the most attentive and professional server I have ever had the pleasure of knowing. Also kudos to Monica, Matthew and Joe. I wholeheartedly recommend Nora's.

5p1rgHjQvMWZ_9qKmXQwMQ.text: The food was gorgeous.  The restaurant was gorgeous. The waitstaff was gorgeous. It really is a five star restaurant.

MyB3FOjRFBafTjrprlqB7g.text: We are fairly new to Vegas and have heard people here and there mention this place called "Nora's". Everyone raved how great the food was and how the atmosphere was so relaxing. One night we had family in from out of town and had done the strip places and the local place we frequent and Nora's came to mind. We called and the recording strongly suggested reservations. Seeing that we were in the car with family heading that way we were concerned. When we got to the restaurant we were quoted an hour and a half wait. It was full. We put our name down and asked the hostess if she would mind calling us when we were closing in on our table. She said they normally didn't do that but she assisted us as a favor. We went to Sams and then she called shortly after. We got back and we're seated promptly.  The food ... is ... AMAZING DELICIOUS FRESH GENUINE UNIQUE ... I could go on.  It was moderately priced and worth the pricing. Service was top notch. Servers tag team all tables to ensure a smooth dining experience.  We will be back. Treat yourself and make time to visit Nora's.

3guNXn8GqEE9TyGALsXDnA.text: There isn't much to look at from the outside. I probably would not eat here if I was driving by. But my friend recommended this place to me. So I decided to try. The food was wonderful and the prices were a welcome surprise from the high priced food of the strip. Nora's is a traditional, local Italian restaurant that serves quality, authentic Italian cuisine. The only bad thing was that we had to wait for our food for about 40 minutes. The chicken marsala was excellent, the garlic bread was perfect. A small band played background music, which was nice and not overly loud. It was so nice that the people sitting around you and having dinner were speaking Italian. You feel that you're in the right place.  So if you're looking to get off the strip and the high strip prices, Nora's is a very good choice.

IkmvKAFG7tw5S07QbM-_tw.text: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. The food is delicious and truly authentic in terms of Italian taste. The decor is nice, waiters dressed lovely. I must say however,  as a resident and frequent visitor of the restaurant it is extremely busy so beware of wait times to exceed 2hrs. In addition during these busy times the front door host staff really struggle with the intensity of the traffic and tend to be really rude, short, curt and out-right offensive. Instead of greeting you or welcoming you to Nora's what you will tend to hear as you step up to the host is "the wait time is....." in the most frustrating tone imaginable. I spoke with the manager on duty in one of these instances who apologized and explained it was really busy which I understood and advised him that good customer service can never be undermined despite the greatest of food. I am a local and choose to come here also during the slow times of day when Nora's is pretty empty and tourists are out enjoying Las Vegas therefore my money and my business really matters. He again apologized and explained he would speak with the hosts. You decide, if you come in the evening between the hours of 6-10pm expect chaos, long wait times, limited seating as you wait, rude hosts and great food.

zSmIzIx2IY0nze0sGbs5_w.text: Had my father and step mom in town for the holidays and asked what cuisine spoke to them for dinner.  They said Asian, Mexican, or Italian.  Told them take them to Nora's for old school Italian.  Dad said best chicken parmigian he has ever had!  He is 75 years old and has enjoyed many chicken parmigian in those years so to hit the best ever mark is quite an accomplishment.  Thanks Nora's for a great family dinner.  Great food to accompany some good family fellowship.

dXxH3UPSMh_1zWFj4ayq4A.text: We were looking for a nice Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and Nora's did not disappoint. Portions are large and service is quick. The waitress stopped by the table several times before the meal was delivered (the restaurant was almost 90% full) to check on our drinks and make sure we were happy. The meals were outstanding and since my daughter is vegan, they added more vegetables to her meal instead of meat. We will be returning here the next time we take a trip from Los Angeles.

gq2bz_YvKrUmAQhinZrjjg.text: Nora's is a hard place to describe.  One thing I can say for sure - Nora's is very, very popular.  It recently moved from a strip mall location to a large, stand-alone building down the street, and even this larger space is packed every night.  Beyond that, I don't know if Nora's set out to be all things to all people, but it very nearly succeeds in reaching that goal.  Is Nora's a local hangout, family-friendly, with reasonable prices?  Yes, it can be.  My wife and I are locals, a couple of miles from Nora's, and we consider it to be a neighborhood joint.  You can get a lasagna or cannelloni for about 15 bucks, and leave full and satisfied.  (One thing about that family-friendly part - there are usually families with young kids in the dining room, and not all of them are, shall we say, well-behaved; so it can be kind of noisy in there.)  On the other hand, is Nora's a high-end, destination restaurant that draws tourists from the Strip?  Yep, it's that too.  And if you want Nora's to be a $$$ restaurant you can certainly start with the shrimp scampi appetizer at $17 and then have the veal chop at $40.    My recommendation is to go with your favorite pasta dish.  Most recently, I had the Crazy Alfredo, which is sort of a paella made with fettuccine instead of rice, and was quite good.  I have also enjoyed the veal cannelloni a la vodka, and the fettuccine carbonara.  All of the pasta dishes I have tried have been rich, rich, rich, even for Italian food, so you definitely don't need multiple courses.  But if you do choose a starter, I would suggest that you stay away from the pasta faggioli - that was a dish I didn't care for.

UIvV_XV6cs76IYDx-dW-sQ.text: Really great italian food with unregrettable garlic bread, the kind that goes home with you and you wake up with garlic breath the morning after. I had the veal marsala and the veal was cooked perfectly. I wanted extra pasta to soak up the delicious sauce.   If you are looking for authentic italian food at reasonable prices, Nora's is the place to go.

PbnG670m3lkzSdEO7ftBsA.text: Nora's is a great establishment that provides great Italian food if you happen to be in Vegas, I had Chicken Alfredo which was great! The have a huge menu with many choices to please everyone.

MVhOkJMq_STt_IJSDgoNRg.text: Long time fan of the old noras. Went with a group of 8 last night and was very disappointed for the second time at the new location. Couldn't get a table until after 8pm. Had to walk a block or so because of inadequate parking. The food isn't the same anymore. We didn't get our food for an hour. The manager told us that we should have ordered appetizers and that way the wait for our food wouldn't have seemed so long. I can't blame noras for wanting to expand, but i miss the old place and think they may have bitten off more than they can chew.

oUUA7EzXA3WaCuqmCmGFLQ.text: Ok  I'm Italian From NJ I know how to eat I'm insanely critical of Italian restaurants  This is easiest the best hole in all of vegas.  This is better than a lot of places in Little Italy NYC  Didn't care for the shrimp scampi And chicken Francese isnt offered Hard to get a reservation and parking blows But the food is great You can tel why they are crowded  I won't let anyone serve me but this kid Nick who wears glasses The way he serves me and my clients when I bring them here, it's like we are being hosted in his own home.  He had us ordering all sorts of things even alcohol!  This place is a gem

_TmRlIMTIiw0PXzsA-24pA.text: My husband had the pork tenderloin and was disappointed that it was overcooked and sliced with the grain, the combination making it less than tender.  The accompanying baked tomato and grilled potatoes were very good, but there was an overwhelming amount of arugula piled in the center of the plate. I had the veal parmesan, and it was burnt along the edges.  When we told the waiter what we thought, he didn't even offer us a  free cup of coffee as compensation.   We've been to Nora's many times and I'm worried they've gotten too big for themselves.

HI6AROLIDUzCSZJcN6x9_Q.text: Best pasta joint ever. I been to their older location before they've moved to their new hot spot. Hands down my top 3 places for Italian place to go.

75uQPIyJbshmTWApNQCRNw.text: The staff is wonderful... They all have personality which is something that just goes with genuine service. The food is amazing as well as the wine selections. My favorite thing they have is probably the arancini. Delicious!

R8TmG56QNEh2vGR7wY-N2g.text: Food was good, but the old Nora's was much more cozy!  The acoustics are bad and the noise level is like a cafeteria... No barriers to elope.  Very loud.  To many good Italian Restaurants... I will try elsewhere.  Good service!

4i32NeM1qZPw1aTAcVRNhw.text: It might be a landmark,  but it is way too noisy...my suggestion would be one of their private dinning rooms or outside.

R8egAUI9GRvtTgTxRZucxg.text: Wow!! This place deserves five stars but I took one away due to the location, which isn't too great!!  However, the food here is spot on and delicious!!!  You'll love the ambience with the old crooners singing in the background..  This place is legitimately Italian!!  You've got to give it a try!!  The food is five stars all the way!!  You'll love it!! Journey on Yelp peeps!!  :-D. Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti w/meat balls- Yummmmy!!

1kSl-L_wO_vzNVDizoD6kA.text: Overall 8.6/10 atmosphere 8.5/10 service 8.2/10 food 8.8-8.9/10 value 9 It's hard to impressive me for Italian food But I think this restaurant is top 3 Italian restaurants in Las Vegas at this price!

yeQgH4qmydLwniyLDGxaKA.text: Big disappointment... Was a big fan of the old Nora's and finally checked out the new one.  I had the El Diablo and Clover Club at the bar which were both exceptional.  Bartender service was very quick and friendly also.  Had been told that we could be seated early, but the reservation time came and went before we were called.  We ordered the a bottle of wine, veal cannolini a la vodka and the chicken marsala.  The old Nora's had the best chicken Marsala in the valley in my opinion and I am from a small town in upstate NY where they have some of the best Italian food in the US.  The wine was awful.  We didn't even finish it, but I blame myself because I chose it.  The veal was mediocre, but the chicken marsala was very dry.  I sent it back and was very quickly brought a new plate.  This was also very dry.  I choked down what I could because I was hungry.  The side of pasta was a saving grace.  Anyway I will never be going back to Nora's.

A-Uw-U7I0jMxPuDCI0lg7Q.text: I  have always rated nora's 5 stars, but last night for the first time there i ordered linguine aglio et olio (garlic and oil) well this is not at all what i was expecting, it appears they used jarred minced garlic-- gag !!!-- terrible-- one would expect to be served this at a small highway dinner or cracker barrel--- not at nora's. is it that much trouble to take several cloves of garlic, slice them and roast them in olive oil for three minutes pour over the pasta ad some parsley---come on man--- it sure left me with a bad taste in my mouth for this place. sorry nora but you dropped the ball on this one !!!!

DyiD7RbR7zuEjlDS-ee9PA.text: We came to Nora's again this year and they did not disappoint. Everything was right on point. When we come to LV next year Nora's will be our first stop yet again. Freshness, quality, quantity, value, and service. No need to go to a restaurant with a certain chefs name attached where you will pay 40-50% more for items that simply can't match Nora's daily effort. Try it once.

OMnBN0hW2HQy09ApQsrMHg.text: The food and hostesses were fantastic, the bar was friendly and comfortable. I'll definitely be bringing the rest of my family in the future since we've been looking for a good Italian restaurant.

Y6EtAWm75EieQ67tCKq_8A.text: Excellent food, good service, family run, nice atmosphere, authentic, enjoyable for any size party, quite dinner out or group of friends & family

fZPCVNXQlW-U3KwG5BQczA.text: Always great, everyone I take compliments the food From dinner to the great lunch specials you can't go wrong

oH1kDYcNhlGkY4slLq4iYw.text: Wonderful service, yummy food, great atmosphere. I had the baked rigatoni, added meatballs and substituted vodka sauce. It came out just as I ordered, and was absolutely amazing! I reheated the leftovers later that evening, lo and behold it was even more delicious! In my opinion, you really can't go wrong with this ricotta laden baked dish!!!

luN0Qlm_gSjs6OEUC0FHUg.text: If your looking for flavorful Italian food, Nora's is the spot! My cousins were visiting from California and happened to be craving delicious Italian food. I recommended Nora's and couldn't be more proud I took them here. They absolutely loved it. Customer service was great. There was a wait but it went by so fast! On Fridays and Saturdays they have a live band playing music which I find ideal! Oh and their red Sangria is REAL sangria. Tastes strong but delicious especially if your trying to feel good =)

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MaWwc-2Yy5g8YE6HdxMwcw.text: What happened to this place?  The prices, food, and service are NOT what they used to be!  They garlic bread is half of what it used to be in portion, and in taste.  The sauce was brown, and bland. It was not the fresh red sauce we used to get.  We are both literally, and figuratively sick to our stomachs.  Both of us are sick now.  I've been burping up the sauce, and we both had deuces wild, if you know what I mean!  I had been going to Nora's for more than 20 years!  NEVER again!  Disgusting!  I should have gone to Roma on Spring Mountain.  We paid dearly for that mistake!

WbVcujwcFzZ6wqz8x4YFmQ.text: We tried this place a couple of week ago & were delighted.  It was a busy Friday night, but were seated within minutes of our reservation time.  Waitress came right to the table, and took our orders quickly.  Food was very good, and pricing reasonable.  Will be back soon.

LKZgpxUMzhd3jLLZehwA6w.text: Food is delicious and fresh! Cozy environment, hidden treasure. Nora's is by far a favorite-a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White vegetarian pizza-well done Nora&#39;s!

lJmOCVHLvxfJrVz-DlVQSg.text: Do yourself a favor do not go !! The food is pathetic !! And the service is even worse !! I really don't have anything good to say I'm sorry !!

YUIssyE_fOzRkcaNcnY-RQ.text: Food and service was excellent. Had the crazy fettuccine, arancini, mozzerella caprese, and bread pudding for dessert. Would highly recommend this spot as well as all of these menu items. First time visit and will definitely go back.

CDmS_QVCGm1wL4N955NUng.text: We ordered Calamari, Lasagne, Linguini and Clams, and Shrimp Scampi for lunch. While the food was good, we faced a few logistical issues while ordering and with our order. We wanted the lunch portion of the Linguini and Clams which was priced at $9.95 on the online Lunch Menu at the time of the order. However, while placing the order via the phone, the hostess on the line said that there was no lunch size for the dish. I let her know that she should ask management to take that off the menu to prevent further confusion. After picking up our food and driving back to our hotel room, we noticed that the Shrimp Scampi had no linguini! It only had shrimp and sauce! We called to let them know, but all they could say was that we could go back for another Scampi dish. We would have liked a refund since the dish was $19.95. Unfortunately, our flight was later that day and we could not make it back to the restaurant. Hopefully they update their menus online soon to make sure the price of all of their items are accurate.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi with no linguini! :(

klyx5dyntASDdgijgx3luQ.text: I love this place. I love their italian antipasti salad. YUM! :) Our server was very attentive. I can't wait until they open their new location.

Q5GLDJjG3O5czSjY3UdU6w.text: Great Italian food!   The 2-for-1 sangria was great just for checking in on Yelp, but the tortellinis in vodka sauce were the highlight of my experience. Delicious!  I'll definitely be back next time I'm near the Strip.

96TZJ1A675m2xXyTBV8HOw.text: Absolutely one of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Simple but delicious dishes! The Gnocchi alla vodka was stupendous and the spaghetti and meatballs wonderfully good... Yummy! Service was great. Nothing bad to say about Nora's. I can't wait till my next Vegas trip so I could get some more!!!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto balls... Love!!!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi alla vodka.. Yum!!!

KB_jsFmeyIJ7WLQb2HhLXA.text: Just had a wonderful dinner at Nora's. This place is always busy and for good reason the food is good and the prices are reasonable. The atmosphere was great in the bar and the dining area. Our server could have been a little more attentive to OUR needs  rather than huddling with two other servers by the cash register but all in all a very pleasurable experience.

meD7F8jYTpFXCKM1z6wufA.text: I got an email from a person from Nora's telling me that they don't have beef and what I ate was actually pork.   Sorry for the mistake. Though I must say, it's rather telling that it was a mystery meat situation.

thz9HwDOypoCvhsM9EujLQ.text: I moved to Las Vegas around a year and a half ago from NY and had been  in search for a taste of home. Thank you Nora's, I now feel I have found it. This is most authentic New York style Italian restaurant you can find outside of Little Italy in NYC...From the crafted cocktails to the apps and entrees down to the cannoli and espresso, I have yet to be disappointed. This is one of Vegas's Crown Jewels and I'm positive that we can all expect the same quality of fine food and service at their new location...

yateD4GklX81ZG_wOzP_FQ.text: Our experience at Nora's is always different. Consistency is the issue. My husband and I normally go to the bar and have a beverage and dinner. Michele is a great bartender. Always on top of things. The 2 male bartenders can't keep up and will walk past an empty glass or empty bread basket until you ask. I specifically asked if I could get a dish with marinara sauce instead of meat sauce and he assured me I could. Came out with meat sauce. He offered to change it but meanwhile my husbands dinner gets cold. The food is normally very good no complaints about food!

MDvR-k_U3m75cvitVT2rgA.text: We found this local place solely based on the amazing high reviews on Yelp. We were very satisfied and my only regret is that we didn't have a refrigerator in our hotel room to bring home leftovers (hugs portions!). We made a reservation (highly recommended) this place gets packed. There is a bar to get a drink in case you need to wait for a table. We started with the bruschetta (very delicious) and salads. Word to the wise: the small size portion of yet salad is plenty to split between two. I ordered the carbonara which was so delicious. Lots of prosciutto and the sauce was perfect. We also got yey chicken Milanese. This is the only reason I don't give a 5 because the Milanese wasn't great. Not pounded thin enough at all. Got the Oreo tartuffo for dessert. Def try it!  Parking can be challenging. We had to drive around the lot a few times before finding a spot. We will def eat at Nora's again when we are in town.

T2VWo0cDoFRHAeIoeHE4bw.text: AMAZING!! My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary and our food and service was top notch. Highly suggest the crazy pasta, calamari and the cheesecake! Overall just a great spot for good food and awesome atmosphere! Will definitely be coming back!

6dHBde_lvin7xlEa3loYjg.text: came here for dinner with a large group expecting nothing, but i left feeling very full and very happy with everything.   what i ate: - mozzarella caprese (app): delicious caprese. fresh ingredients. very tasty.  - pomodoro bruschetta (app): very fresh and garlicy on top of tasty bread. while very good, i was nervous about eating more than one and getting too full - garlic bread: soooo garlicy and buttery and delicious. i was starving when i got to the restaurant so i think i inhaled about 1/3 of the basket. left my mouth super yummy and garlicy. but beware this bread basket! the more you eat the less room you'll have for other delectable treats - antipasto salad: i know this is a salad, but dang, it's a filler. plenty of cheese, ham, salami, olives. very tasty italian dressing - penne w/vodka sauce: suprise dish of the night! that vodka sauce is UH MAY ZZING! so addicting. the leftovers were pretty good the next day too - chicken parmigianai: very well cooked. not too heavily breaded. the chicken was still moist and juicy - pork tenderloin alla siciliana w/arugula salad, garlic red potatoes: the pork was good, but it got kicked up two notches when paired with the spicy, citrusy arugula salad. the garlic potatoes were so perfectly roasted, though i wonder, did they flash fry these suckers cause they were so crispy and addicted. probably due to being drowned in oil? shh, it's okay, just keep eating them. - tiramisu: dessert to get! so tasty and perfect. not too soggy, not too cream. this was soooo good. i wish i had more room in my stomach to keep eating - cannoli: tasty, but id rather have more of the tiramisu - house sangria red and white: omg, BOTH were so tasty. not too heavy on the wine, not too sweet. just a perfect pairing. (yelp check in FREEBIE: buy one sangria or house wine, get one FREE!) the bartenders were pretty annoyed that we all used the app to get the freebie, but no shame. the sangria is great! the white one was much more refreshing, but i preferred the slightly richer red wine  pros: - service: we had a very large party, but the server was great. he tried to keep on top of things as much as possible, despite having to juggle so many of us - FOOD: everything!!!! i ate was so tasty and delicious - live music: when we went on a friday night there was live music in the bar dining area. i cant really remember what kind of music they played, but it was relaxing and nice... but, due to the loud music, it may be difficult to have a conversation with your date if youre sitting in the bar dining area - prices: very very reasonable for all the food offered  cons: - only 1 bathroom for each sex. i was there for a few hours, and every time i went to the restroom there seemed to be a wait.   would i come again? sure!

C8exHGl4YloIiAF7QHBJQw.text: A nice Italian restaurant off the strip that offers good and affordable food.  We ordered the classic Caesar salad, pasta puttanesca and carciolla pizza. Salad had a pretty good serving size for the price. It was good, but just had a tad too much dressing. The flavor was delicious though.  The puttanesca had lots of flavor in it. I liked the crunchy green olives that were incorporated in it. My bf liked the pizza a lot but it was just average for me. I've tasted something better. The pizza had ham, artichokes, black olives and mushrooms. I was not a fan of their pizza crust.   The service was pretty slow for a Thursday night. The restaurant was probably 75% full.   All in all we will probably be back since I wanted to try their antipasto salad and Alla Nora. Saw those from the other table and it looked pretty delicious.

oIZhx9bVu2DVTxLDN36f_A.text: Nora's is great value however the service has been going down hill.

-5114KLhY9L9a9YYVLWvnA.text: Never heard of it before....  Apparently this place is a "hidden gem" of Las Vegas.  Tonight, our Food was good. Service was ok... Nothing to write home about there! I will say the Snow White pizza is exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow White!!

re3ijkp7BHUvogNk_JgYJA.text: A real gem. Can't say anything bad for this place. All the food was magnificent - the pastas, pizzas and the steak.

-otDURgmb_tcJabChNM0Fw.text: ALRIGHT NOW, this was just super good food.    We got sat towards the back where the server station was, but wasnt going to let that annoy me.  Bernadat was our server (thats how it was spelled on the receipt, so sorry if it was spelled wrong), and she was super amazing and a doll.  She was super attentive.  We started with the Noras salad (nothing special), but it was good.  He got the baked chicken parmigiana and I got the chicken alfredo.  He really enjoyed his chickem parmigiana, and the best part it was fried.  It was pan seared in a pan and the sauce and cheese got put on after.  Just different and super delicious.  The alfredo was delicious, but I didnt care for the chicken so much in it.  I did order a side of meatballs, (this was just ok, I wouldnt order it again)  We also ordered some drinks that the servers had made up, its in the cocktail menu on the first page.  He ordered the toasted coconut which was AMAZING and I ordered the pilgrims passion, it was super good as well.    We ended the meal with a tiramisu, which was ok.  Other then that, service was great.  Everyone knew where to be and when to be.   The 2 hostess seemed a little lost, but that didnt ruin anything.    I would like to sit on the east side of the restaurant next time we come.  It seemed a little more quiet and intimate.

Ygt7nU1pFnetHad7gyaOvw.text: It official! Garlic bread is addictingly scrumbdillyicious!!!! Had the rigatoni special, good enuff But I like dishes that go POW ZAM ZING! So I'm gonna see whats next on the menu  Atmosphere is nice n casual, service nice and attentive, would u like more garlic bread? Why yes thanks! Overall a pleasant experience and will be back for more!  Mangia!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni special w meatballs sausage onions n peppers!

J3jLX0W5-qqQzylFmdCQMg.text: Wow just amazing , great service truly a great family restaurant . Looking forward to their new location .

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

efODbpN3uUr2NIdCr6D40g.text: Nice place when we got their yes it was busy so they offered us to sit outside and we agreed. Not bad but would of really liked to see a  view instead of the parking lot. The food is very Delicious 1 plate is enough for 2 people. Great service would recommend going there again.

qSGzZlPvNq6dGJtsur4hLw.text: Consistently  good. We've  been  coming  here  for  12 years and  have  never  had a  bad  meal. In a town  replete  with  Italian  restaurants, Nora's is a standout. A local place  with  a  loyal  following, probably  due to  the  excellent  food  and  reasonable  prices.

Dta_eCaNAerK55fM-sMkMw.text: My bf and I have dined here twice in 2 weeks. Love the atmosphere, service, value and delicious Italian! The first time we went was on a Tuesday night and waited an hour for a table for two. Very busy and happy for them! ;) they take reservations an hour after the time you call so just call ahead!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Melrose pasta with added shrimp Delicious!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni with chicken and gorgonzola

3BsAoN-u7NoT29vd80NTRw.text: Okie doke, I've ate here twice, had the Lasagna and Chicken Parm. Both times I wasn't impressed. Lemme start by saying in my opinion, great Italian food starts with the sauce. If the sauce is plain or has nothing memorable about it then fahgettaboutit.  So steps in boring Lasagna and (non breaded?) Chicken Parm so bland that I'm pretty sure I could make it myself. My GF and her mom had the clam pasta dish and neither raved about it, finished half or asked for a to-go box. Afterwards me and my gf went for drinks and then... secret pizza; if that says anything. This wasn't the worst meal ever, especially with the lemon thyme drink, but I wouldn't go back here with so many other options in Vegas.  0/2 -service -prices (expensive) -atmosphere -food quality  +the "Lemon Thyme" drink was good +proximity to the Palms (lol)  Ok had to say at the end that this place stays packed and theres alot of great reviews. But I seriously tried twice people! Twice!!!   Maybe its just me

vIY3KQRa6PA86FVUDlorUw.text: Tonight me and my boyfriend celebrated his birthday dinner here it was so amazing from drinks to the food! everything was great enjoyed it all! Definitely will be back soon!!!!  Server was Marla :) she's great

T9ZKYyqhAKRc-8QYpOHhtQ.text: Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in Vegas. Everything on the menu is amazing and service is terrific!!!!

xaXQCGUQbbmc0vFqonlotw.text: One word... Amazing! We are from out of town and found Nora's on Yelp and decided to give it a try. It was a fantastic choice. Wonderful atmosphere, incredible bread, and outstanding food, and a very reasonable price! (I highly recommend the Pasta Carbonara!) Our waitress, Nina, was also very personable and very efficient! She went above and beyond to make sure we had an excellent experience. I highly recommend Nora's to any local residents and/or out of towners. (And ask for Nina!)

ZNxGuwzsMW0sphmMs_FAkQ.text: I'm am shocked this place has an average 4 stars. We were highly disappointed, the only things that saved the night was the free glass of wine with Yelp check in an $10 off coupon I got for my birthday.  Not to be a nit picker but my food wasn't up to par so I might as well complain about the dirty with sauce table cloth as well. Otherwise the restaurant itself was nice. Lots of room, it really filled up the longer we were there. Our waitress was average, she helped with questions but otherwise wasn't very attentive.  We were given some small pieces of complimentary garlic bread to start, it was average, nothing special about it. I'm a big fan of Arncini, so we ordered a plate to start. Ick! I ate one and didn't even want to finish that one. It had good crunch but the taste of the inside was not appealing, I make Arincini at home and have had it many other places and this was the worst I have ever had. We didn't even finish them or the bread and my husband is a bread fiend.  On of the menu items I saw had gotten lots of good reviews and states its a best selling dish was the Crazy Alfredo, I love Alfredo and wanted shrimp but also wanted to try something different so I ordered it. The dish was piled high but it didn't seem like Alfredo sauce, it was more like they threw Parmesan or mozzarella in the pasta, it actually started to harden as it cooled. The spice of the jalapeno wasn't over powering which was nice. Disappointed there were only 2 shrimp in the dish. Tons of sausage. The fettuccine tasted like box pasta. My friend got the same dish and was disappointed as well. Her husband was the only one that was pleased with his dish which was the Chicken Mount Etna. My husband got the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce and added Chicken. OMG! I felt so bad for my husband, his gnocchi tasted like wet balls of wall paper paste, no taste, and the sauce did nothing to help. We've had gnocchi before also and these were very heavy and gross.  I just wanted to get out of there, I can't believe I wasted by birthday dinner on Nora's, I will never go back or recommend it. My husband wanted to give me to give 1 star but my dish was at least edible.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arcini
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

SXBPnflRYs7FRttqMn9AMQ.text: 22 years ago my favorite Italian Reataraunt closed. Since then i have never found a place that used quality ingrediants, with recipes cooking techniques that were worthy of my effection. Today, i found Noras..she holds crown.

bYCINxUo5hBeLmK5Z0dXgw.text: Tried multiple pastas and pizzas. Every single pizza that they make, it tastes great, flavorful, nothing to complain. Their complimentary garlic bread is amazing, do request for cheese on the top for extra, it will make it even better. But I am not really a big fan of pasta that they give us. Seafood pasta - I am not a big fan of seafood, happened to try that because my girlfriend loves seafood, she said that it was good.  Gorgonzola & Mushroom pasta (forgot the name sorry) was really unique in flavor, it was really flavorful with interesting tastes.  Chicken parmagiana - Chicken was really tasty, I don't know if it was not supposed to be crispy for the chicken part, but what threw me off for this pasta is, it is not really flavorful, no tastes into the pasta by itself, it was very plain in my opinion. Tomato sauce was not very special at all, I felt that it tastes like a spaghetti sauce that you maybe able to get at Walmart. I guess I just chose the wrong menu.   If I include everything to rate this place based upon my experience, I would still give 5 stars, great atmosphere with amazing staffs. Just needed to choose the right menu. Price is reasonable too, so I would definitely come back to this place every time I am into Italian Food.

AkstMPKm-G_F1hg-_UgXmg.text: I first tried this restaurant nearly 5 years ago when I only lived around the corner from it. I haven't lived in Las Vegas for years now, but every time I am back in town I make sure to at least get take out from here. Really solid Italian food at reasonable prices. The pasta is always cooked perfectly, the sauces are delicious, and the garlic bread is delicious (and I don't normally eat much garlic bread). It gets really busy, I suggest making a reservation whenever you go.

78SHqdJrb-skO8Qlh_a7_A.text: This could have been a 4 star, even 5 star experience if it was based only on the food. Delicious, except for the bread (not so good....)!  But having a reservation really didn't help at all.  We were seated 20 minutes after our reservation.  The dining room next to the bar was noisy noisy noisy.  Took all the ambiance out of the experience.  We ordered a bottle of wine and waited over 15 minutes for it to be opened and poured.  Our server was very unconcerned about us and barely looked at us the few times she stopped by the table.  We had better service from the bus boys who really tried to help.  It was a special night for us, our 33rd wedding anniversary, and we felt shuttled in and out.

m2sy5o_8RrMHGGzpHpUozQ.text: A very, very good Italian restaurant with excellent service.  We started with a mozzarella caprese salad.  The mozzarella and tomatoes were fresh.  I had a frutti di mare which had an ample amount of sea food and a rich thick sauce.  My wife had a custom made pasta dish, also excellent.  The service was excellent and the prices quite good for Las Vegas.

2-YGEMvSQPH2G_HPphSnFw.text: Went to new location for our annual big dinner party. Unfortunately new is not good. No longer same charming place. We were there for 7:30 reservation and didn't sit until 8:45. No apologies just attitude. Service was not the same. I am no longer a fan

ScWnw7Y6cBtrmSY4qFZBLA.text: Went with a party of five and the food and service was top notch.  All the food was tasty and the cheesecake for desert was different and good.

e18_pgNFOdvCOY5tAe8EbA.text: YUM! This place is great. Make sure you go to the new location and not the old. It was super busy on a Friday night, so I was glad I made a reservation! Super cute location with an awesome wine fridge against the front wall. I got the special, which was the pappardelle with wild boar...amazing. Cant wait to come back!

_clgv8-5jS5YrJWC_GY-iA.text: Made reservations probably about 3-5 days in advance but when we arrived the hostesses could not find our reservation. It's pretty useless to make reservations. I also don't think they knew what they were doing, little did they even try to make an effort of communicating between hostess and guests. We ended up going to Casa Di Amor on East Tropicana. Which I highly recommend! Service was excellent! Staff was friendly and fast. Food was better! Plus, live music!

XNhc0R0cx6PZaNkHBGZgXA.text: My husband and I ordered food to go. The place was packed at 5:45pm on a Wednesday when we went to pick it up. If dining in I would suggest reservations. We ordered gnocchi with vodka sauce, lasagna, and a side of meatballs. It came with a small loaf of garlic bread that we both could have done without.....way too much garlic for us. The gnocchi and lasagna were nothing special but the meatballs were excellent! Overall prices were pretty reasonable. Might try it again.

LgS2GjSpKw2XNymW7tHn0g.text: Amazing pasta!!! Live music on Friday night. Tastes very authentic wouldnt even notice this place was here, its kinda hidden in a plaza.

OsCtj7PckEEHNYOBOk3PwQ.text: Always busy. Full of locals. Two good signs!  Nice bar, good food, low-key vibe. Strip-quality meal without the strip headache and prices!!  Pro tip: their version of the Moscow Mule is called the Sicilian Mule and includes Italian liqueur limoncello instead of lime juice. Might very well be the best Moscow Mule I've ever had!

uMBUGkm8UjWgqCJMQEtbfw.text: Wow best Italian food ever!! Had the crazy fettuccine alfredo and carbonara! Get off the strip and try something so worth it!! So affordable too!! Will be a regular here!

PtvHcQYVGmBNzmSsXOYbdA.text: My wife and I had lunch at Nora's today I ordered chicken Parm and my wife ordered steak with salad. My chicken Parm was over cooked and the gravey tasted like it just came out of a can. My wife ordered salad dressing on the side. The salad was served on the same plate with the steak and the dressing.

krngMxSWNxmylXW3Q5wLnQ.text: I've been here on quite a few occasions and I have to say that I've never been entirely enthralled by this place.   The food is just ok, nothing amazing. The pasta is generic and not particularly flavorful. A little on the overpriced side as well. I enjoy the garlic bread, which is pretty good. I have had some very good baked ziti, so that's been the saving grace here.   The service is ok, but I get irked at having to wait for a table here. There's always a long wait. There are better Italian restaurants in town and there are worse.

oyvHbWwQPO9c4TSgM9XeVA.text: Not usually looking for Italian- especially for lunch- but what a nice Friday afternoon surprise! Have to check it out for dinner soon

CrNnd5UeoIXMuMJwEGN6qw.text: Oh m to the G. This place was Fire  Norman the bartender was thee best. On point times 10. Yumm.

ZM-xTffUCnc4eJQN7QvvcA.text: This recent visit we had a big birthday party celebration. I tried the Lemon Clams, they were great small clams with the butter sauce. Then, tried the Calamari with the amazing with the sauce. The Shrimp Melrose was the wrong order I ordered, the Crazy Alfredo was what I wished I ordered instead! The Shrimp Melrose was too saucy for me & Crazy Alfredo was hands down the best pasta.   Our server Don was amazing & accommodating and surprised the birthday celebrant and us with tiramisu which was amazing and decadent!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Bread
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine Cellar

5ZYBI4wzT8mW5y0OK4C85g.text: I was super excited to try out Nora's on a friend's recommendation and had a booked marked for awhile too. Came for dinner and it was packed. Was greeted right away and informed us of a 15 minute wait. However, they were able to get seated in 5 minutes, so that was a plus.  The ambiance and decor is classy and charming. The wine room with the ceiling to floor window is their highlight. Wine barrels repurposed for the chandelier lighting over the bar area was clever and unique. The wine menu was made of cork. How appropriate! With all this attention to detail, I was a thrown off by the butcher paper on top of the dining table. I know some Italian restaurants have them and give you crayons ( if you have kids? ) to doodle on, but we didn't and they were kinda in the way. The paper was folded into half and it made the table uneven in parts so I had to move my drink to the more level part of the table. There is a white table cloth underneath it, so it would have been nice to do without the paper overlay.   Server was very prompt and friendly. Complementary garlic bread came out first. It was soft, had real chopped bits of garlic on it, and buttery. Yum! Was hoping the rest of the meal will just be as good. Ordered the fettuccini alfredo, spaghetti and meatballs, and mozzarella sticks. Mozzarella sticks were safe. The garlic marinara dipping sauce was above average. The fettuccini alfredo was very basic. It needed salt and was swimming in butter. Felt that it should of been creamier. It could of been better. Spaghetti and meatballs was underwhelming. Meatballs were moist, but needed more seasoning. The sauce didn't have a robust flavor that comes from a low and slow cooking methof at all. The red sauce actually looked very plain. No flecks of Italian seasonings or pepper in sight. These 2 dishes are simple, but when done right it can be amazing and these were not. It was simply just ok.   The atmosphere is upscale casual. Details in decor are thoughtful and chic. Pricing is very reasonable. Would be good for a first date without breaking the bank or to watch a game at the bar without the rowdy crowd of a typical bar. May give this place another try in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fettuccine Alfredo.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft garlic bread.

8VozB3UMS4Up0zQErcTN_w.text: The two most important staples in my opinion for an Italian restaurant is there Alfredo sauce and their tomato meat sauce Nora's Alfredo is good nothing crazy special but holy crap THIER TOMATO SAUCE TASTES LIKE STRAIGHT UP SPAGHETTIOS in a can I'm not kidding I thought it was just me then I had everyone at my table try it and they all said the same thing! Sucks since a lot of their dishes have tomato sauce it limits what i would order haven't been back since

b5lclzbtzsLqmY2EqQzfBQ.text: what an awesome restaurant and the bartenders makes great drinks! very relaxed environment and good for dates or family outing! worth the price! the salmon is always perfects and moist!! i'll always go back to this place! haven't been unhappy once.

QAS8hXkCWGyrz3Qt9N8u6A.text: I am from NYC and a friend of mine recommended me to Nora's restaurant in Las Vegas. I stopped by with my family hoping to have a nice Italian meal. We ordered a lot of things on the menu . The sauce tasted terrible I literally could not even eat it. That night I was waring a brand new polo shirt $50 shirt. The waiter was serving a table near me and spilt a whole cup of coke on me with no apology. They ruined my brand new shirt and did not offer to get me a new shirt or any type of compensation for my damaged property, even tho my family racked up a 300 bill for food that was horrible. Food is disgusting to say the least. I would not recommend this place... stay away.

R7STKfuBGhwWwzbI_YSFYg.text: This is the best Italian food found outside of Rome! Skip the Strip and go visit Nora's stunning new building on Flamingo!!   This place was actually the first restaurant recommended to me by an Uber driver when I moved to Vegas over a year ago, and at that time it was still in the little strip mall up the street. It was my favorite then and it is my favorite now.   The food is to die for. There really aren't even words to describe how perfect this restaurant it. The quality, for the portions for the price cannot be beat and you'll always go home with leftovers that still manage to taste as delicious as they did hot out of the oven!   The wait staff was professional, knowledgable and attentive and the food came out hot, well-plated and absolutely delicious. (Although I almost could've dined on the pre-dinner garlic bread alone!)   My one and only complaint was that, when I made my reservation online, I specifically put in the notes asking for a "quiet table," or one with a nice view, as this was a (very promising) First Date. To my disappointment, the Hostess placed us right by the door and next to a party of 8. Fortunately, they arrived towards the end of the meal, but the restaurant was not packed and it was a shame my request could not be honored, or even acknowledged.   Not to worry, the date still went very well, and I'm sure we'll be back for another one in the very near future!

7Qd1TKErzeh0KF4d97d9cQ.text: this is probably  the most annoying place in the whole town of las vegas nevada.  i am so sad that i did not choose to have my dinner at mastrionis.   always an amazing experience.   my experience here at noras this evening was awful!!  the chef was banging something in the kitchen soooooo loud that i could not hear myself think nor my friend speak to me.  .   noras awful!!!!    mastrionis amazing!!!

0bz8N8NoTD48gSLGN154vA.text: Great Spot!!! Off the strip, but worth the trip. The food was excellent and the service matched the food. I recommend reservations, we had them and the service was smooth with no waiting.

dIRmKRrLcIfCp6vfqwNH0Q.text: If I had written this review several years ago when they were at the older, smaller location it would've gotten a 4 or 5 star. I loved it then. But I hadn't been back in a long time because it is far drive from where I live. I found out they moved into a nice larger building so I was anxious to go, so I talked my family to take me for my birthday. I had heard they were quite busy and should make reservations, so we did. And good thing cuz they were very busy. We got our table and it was very loud in there. Could not hear any of our conversations we practically had to yell at each other.   The service was fine and it was nice they gave me a free dessert for my bday. But the food, was just average. I got a steak. Wasn't bad but nothing to rave about. My husband got the chicken marsala. It was kinda strange that everyone else's meal was pretty good size but his chicken was small and dinky. And the side of pasta was as bland as could be. This is an Italian place. Shouldn't it be amazing.? My husband did love his old fashion though.   So bottom line... it's just not worth the drive for me. There are 2 amazing Italian places near me that I would rather go to.

DJRpX7J8cmAKYddDdc2zPw.text: Saw this beautiful restaurant while being driven to the Aria the other day. Was so surprised when friends invited us to lunch today and it was this same restaurant! Our Las Vegas friends said it was their favorite Italian restaurant and now I see why! We were seated in their private room which was cozy and perfect to catch up with friends we see yearly. There were 5 of us for this visit. We all ordered wine from their great selection and all were great. Our server was FANTASTIC! Very knowledgeable about the wine and dishes and most accommodating to all our requests. The food menu is great with a wide variety of Italian dishes  sure to please everyone. We all ordered different dishes and all were perfectly cooked and presented. Very generous portions as well. Very nice dessert menu and the cheesecake was perfect!! A must visit for us on our next Vegas trip!

5iubjGZaB-eNCuHjqqLJaw.text: Amazing!  Taste, Service and Ambiance is what to expect.  I thought this was just a typical over dressed Italian restaurant but it is just perfect.  Thank you for a great experience!

lTwIw4Oby4vtkMWVUZjamg.text: I've always enjoyed my visits to Nora's when they were in their old location, and was excited to check out their newer one as I had heard some good things after the move.   We made a reservation for 7:15pm and were seated promptly. The server immediately came over and asked us for our order, I thought that was a bit bit strange as we had just sat down. I ordered Wild Boar Pappardelle. I've had this dish here once before and it was just as good if not better than the first time. We also ordered Pasta a la Nora and spaghetti with clam sauce. They were busy (as always) and I felt they weren't as mindful as they usually are, but the only thing that seemed to suffer was a delayed drink refill.   The one thing that rang out to me was that this new location was much louder than the previous one was. From what I recall the decor seemed a bit softer in the old one, and this one is more bare and the sounds seem to overtake the location and I could barely hear my dinner mates sitting right next to me. Overall it was still a enjoyable meal and night out.

2vCOVPvyKGzqfl-KYFX0DQ.text: Nora's was amazing!! Hosted a celebratory dinner there with my family. We had great service all around from the hostess to our server. We got an antipasto salad to start for the table(delicious) we all tried different pastas all were unique and full of flavor. We went on a Friday night it was super busy, but the service was still spot on and the busy atmosphere was cool to be in. Plus on weekends they have live jazz music which was a nice surprise. Hard to find good Italian food in the city that's not to expensive and great quality. We will be back again. Thank you Nora's for a sweet night.

Mm24hLeXGhD5VJ2z9ZunFA.text: ordered a salad and asked before hand if there was any cheese on it and Ellie informed me that she would have the cheese taken off. picked up my order and cheese is wrapped inside the salami rolls. then when i called ellie back to explain i have a dairy allergy she THEN informs me that the salami rolls are pre made. thank you for wasting my time and making me order somewhere else for dinner. Please inform your customer about the menu just incase they happen to be ALLERGIC. and i didn't even get an apology! smh

-vudH-Sh693vTjGm7U0bQQ.text: We are locals and my husband and I for years frequented the old Nora's. We loved the food and the ambiance. The new location which is not as intimate however the food was still great. Regretfully because of our recent experience we will not be going back-ever. We ordered the calamari appetizer which the server brought to our table. The dish wasn't hot, it wasn't even warm, it seemed to have gone from the refrigerator to our table. The server apologized and when he returned with it, yes it was hot but it tasted like it just came out of a deep fryer. Now the main dish. My fruiti  de mar which is one of there signature dishes was just a plate of spaghetti with two mussels, and two or three shrimp. It use to contain an ample amount of seafood including calamari. Very disappointed. My husband's dish of veal parmigiana was just run of the mill. Too bad, we use to love this place.

DCpMz4YGCrkwOFBLpRUF_A.text: Great restaurant -- glad I stopped in.  Really good food, great service, and a nice restaurant with plenty of parking.  I woke up in my room at the Flamingo with a completely out of character hunger for Italian food.  I briefly considered a chain at a nearby hotel, then gave up and was headed over to Chinatown instead (where I eat most of my meals when in Las Vegas, and have never been disappointed.).  Browsing Yelp for what is open in mid afternoon, I found Nora's, and decided to try -- thanks to Yelp I've found a great new choice.  I had the arancini appetizer -- quite good -- and then the baked ziti (recommended by the server).  My iced tea was never empty, and finished off the meal with a great cannoli.  I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini appetizer

Gvb4Qel032kfnc1s-EZGHg.text: My absolute favorite restaurant! I am Italian so we have s hard time finding good Italian. This place is absolutely delicious! The new building an atmosphere is gorgeous! The prices are very reasonable and they even have live entertainment. A huge selection of wine the place is always very romantic. Be sure to call and make reservations because you may not get in it's always packed in the evening.

syhgRDALOqTF10FfjfxyTA.text: Great food. Classic Italian theme restaurant with great ambiance. Fast and friendly service. Cold beer. Lots of parking. I would go back

4xGD8Xk4OxVBUh3O5YVXgQ.text: I've been going to Noras for years now, and when they announced they were moving to a new location down the street (last year) I was worried.   I've seen so many smaller restaurants ruined by "upsizing".  Unfortunately it happened at Noras too.     First the new location, while beautiful was horribly designed from a noise perspective.  You literally cannot hear people across the table from you...when I leave I sigh in relief because the din of the dozens of conversations at once has ended.     I mentioned this on my first dining at the new location to the manager... I work in the studio sound business and I recommended Paul Tan or Acoustic consultants.    I noticed this trip one wall has tapestries on it, but they need some Rockwool (Roxul) or sound soak behind them.   We're not talking a bunch of money here....a few thousand bucks for a noticeable reduction in noise.   Though if they really did it right, it could cost close to $25K for maximum reduction  Nora's, the noise IS hurting your business.   Once the newness of the new location is gone...people like me may not come as often.    I love your food please call an acoustic consultant... you'll get 2 stars more from me if you do.

3XYpeUoPJNmdnrrGSv5dDA.text: Nice classy, Italian restaurant!  Delicious, authentic Italian food!  As a party of four, we wanted to share and taste different dishes since it was our first time here.  We had an antipasto salad to start with.  Absolutely yummy!  The waiter brought us delicious garlic bread!  Our main entrees were veal marsala with a side of spaghetti, linguini & clams, and spaghetti with sausage.  Dessert was a slice of tiramisu and a mixed berry-topped panna cotta.  All so good!  Love this place and will be coming back!
