Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice of tiramisu

KmrjtYRlDTJgAJaklZ5M9A.text: I've been to Italy - this is authentic.  I love that the restaurant is family owned / run and has been in business for over 40 years.  A friend recommended the restaurant to me and 5 of us (3 who had never visited before) went to dinner last night.  I'm glad we had the foresight to make a reservation.  Even at 5:30 the place was packed.    Everything was delicious - from the antipasto salad we shared (the regular size was plenty) to the individual meals we all selected.  Chicken marsala, shrimp scampi, alla nora, spinach cannelloni, and linguini and clams were all fantastic.  Let's not forget the garlic bread.  Wow!  Every one of us took a box home and were too full to indulge in dessert.  We did have a couple glasses of Moscato d'Asti, Tintero "Sori Gramella".  It was great.    The host staff and our waiter were professional and friendly.  Service was quick and attentive.  I've already recommended the place to a couple of friends.

NU0mlAJ7Vg0mqs7RIG4rVA.text: Terrible! Gnocchi was mealy and disgusting! Angel hair marinara pasta for my child was $12, over cooked and under sauced. Veal chop was $40 and had no value as it was butterflied and pounded as thin as a frisbee. Manager Adam didn't seem to care and just kept glancing around when we voiced our complaints, he hightailed it out of there and left us with a huge bill for less than mediocre food. Don't waste your money.

b26fCnzLXlOrA24OEHhynA.text: I sat at bar. Instantly greeted and taken care of. Food was amazing! If you want Italian food in Vegas, this is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just some complimentary garlic bread to start!

NLBYhCPQKZwjwljKJ0-zdw.text: I really wanted this to be a five star review but unfortunately Nora's is not good, the food is just not good!! I have had this restaurant on my bucket list for years to try and it did not deliver. We were a party of four and we decided to order many different dishes with hopes of taking leftovers home ( thinking that the food would be well worth eating twice)   - first thing we received complimentary bread toasted with "butter" and herbs. Tasted artificial - not fancy at all.  -Calamari was ok, a bit greasy, sauce was tasty  -Pizza was ok I guess, nothing special  -Lasagna was a huge disappointment- it's dry and the meat was questionable???  -Chicken parmesan bland, no flavor!  -Pesto pasta with chicken and vegetables needed salt!!   Mind you it's not a very pricey restaurant but it's still around $20 a plate...not to mention $14 for a glass of house Cabernet not out of a bottle but out of a tap??? Seriously I saw them filling my glass out of a tap - like beer! I couldn't believe it! I wanna say it's a first and last time for me...

cXa66KUdPIXFgtKOE41M9Q.text: This place is beyond delicious. The fish was the best one we have had. The pasta dish was also amazing. We will definitely come back. There service was also great, very attentive. Drinks were pretty strong but it was perfect for us.

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2OLUCIUB_O6JDyCEVh3Utg.text: Aside from really good garlic bread and Calamari Fritti appetizer, I had the okay Arancini appetizer and Crazy Alfredo pasta entree.  Crazy Alfredo brought back nostalgia from back in the day of having it at Mac Shack. However unlike Mac Shack, Nora's Crazy Alfredo made use of pickled jalapenos instead of fresh, which overpowered the taste of alfredo sauce. The portion I got was good enough for two meals!  Also heads up they have a band playing and the noise level inside the restaurant was really high! I had to shout to talk to my friend on my side, let alone across the table!

2clLdzeBsolxP-FeePpabA.text: This place was great!!! Customer service was outstanding. Very prompt and friendly. No pressure and very knowledgeable. I got the pizza and my wife got the fettuccine chicken and it was very good. The setting was perfectly lit. Very romantic.

8xNMTSGFIOwtQsUFHDp8pw.text: So glad a local recommended this place! One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. We arrived just in time to have no wait; by the time we left, the place was packed. The service was outstanding and the prices pretty reasonable.  We started with Sicilian Green Olives that were delicious! After we tried the Spaghetti with Meat Sauce and the Farm House Carbonara, both were cooked perfectly and very tasty.  I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm House Carbonara

apcoriilxISv3mKnmQN-_g.text: Just to be totally upfront: I took a star off because the person who was in charge of refilling waters was fairly OBSESSIVE. I couldn't take a single sip of water without them being there within 60 seconds to refill my water. A little breathing space would have been nice.   Walking into Nora's, it's clear why this place is so popular. It's beautifully decorated, with a separate bar area, individual private dining rooms for groups, and a stylish feel. I wouldn't call it intimate, but it does seem like a great date spot!  We were seated within just a few minutes of arriving, but it wasn't busy at all. We were there before the dinner rush that I'm sure this place gets. I ordered a small salad before my meal, but even with the "small" it was so big that I had leftovers for the next day. I ordered chicken piccata and my boyfriend got the lasagna. My chicken piccata was so good! Flavorful, perfectly cooked, and served with pasta. The lasagna portion was huge!!! He couldn't eat the whole thing even though it was really good. They also serve complementary garlic bread with your meal, which was delicious and they were kind enough to give me some to take home with the leftovers.   The service was good, though overwhelming as previously mentioned. The server was friendly and professional, and thankfully maintained a normal check in schedule. The water person was way too much though and eventually just annoyed us.   Overall, a great experience at a good price. I'd like to back for sure!

7GfehFNdZLqUYc7CgeW0Aw.text: Were from Oahu, Hawaii and visitng my cousin who brought us here.   Greeted with a warm and friendly smile, seated within 5 minutes.   Appetizers were delicious, salad "for the table" was perfect, and the bottom less garlic bread hot and fresh out of the oven was the bestest!   Our busser, Yair was excellent!   Our glasses never went more than half empty, and we never had to ask for refills.   Plates were taken immediately before the. Next course.   Our food runner/expo was on point.  Our entire table got our food at the same and hot.  We all ate to our heart content.   Yair, packed up our left overs for us, and even some of their yummy garlic bread to go.   Greeters !   Server .   Busser, Yair !   Food Runner !   Food !

bibrsf5t7bdHof3zkVTOPA.text: Love Love Love You Nora's  I've never had a menu item I didn't love! Favorites include antipasto salad, eggplant pharm, grilled branzino, grilled salmon, cheese cake, any pasta dish is amazing and cooked perfectly al dente.  You simply can't go wrong here.  They do Italian right.  The wine list is fabulous, they have a wonderful happy hour.  The service is stellar!  Make sure to make a reservation just to be safe.

3XNQuy2duKfNY7TDvEt2hA.text: Excellent food, wine & service! The garlic bread is wonderful & the arrabiata sauce was very well done with amazing flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Caprese
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bryant chetta al Pomodoro

AfIMVFgv3TOpAOTwz7KTBQ.text: It was my second night in Vegas and the next day I would have to change hotels and start the "business" part of the trip so I wanted a nice dinner. I was ready to go somewhere on the strip as I had several recommendations but I checked Facebook and someone just posted to go to Nora's and that it was a Lyft ride from the strip. I took their suggestion and very glad I did.  It was definitely my best dinner while in Las Vegas. I started with a glass of wine the garlic bread and a salad then lasagna. At first I thought the salad had too much dressing from the appearance but after eating it, it was perfect and so fresh and delicious.  The garlic bread was an added accompaniment to the salad.  Then came the lasagna. OH MY FREAKING GOD!! It was amazing. Now I know why my friend said they choose LV to travel to in order just to come here.  I will definitely be back the next time I return to LV as it is bookmarked in my Las Vegas collection. Make sure to take the time and eat at Nora's when in LV.  Thanks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RQ0cvgfzEj6w7uxnJSZ4ZQ.text: Very enjoyable evening at Nora's.  The restaurant was very busy and we came without a reservation.  A brief wait at the bar and we were seated in less than 30 mins.  The apps and entries were very well prepared and presented.  The staff was superb.  Being new to Las Vegas, we are trying new places and Nora's will most definitely be in the rotation.

1YNka4zIPbf6Kl1AIit1_A.text: Tonight's the first time we eat here to celebrate my cousin's birthday and it was her choice. We had a great dinner and great time. The service was excellent even though the food took a bit long to come out but considering the restaurant was pack. My Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken was superb. We'll definitely be returning soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t get enough of this garlic bread. Yummy.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo

fxKl9kVbKDynBg-qQxtjHQ.text: I made reservations for my husbands birthday. We were seated after a brief wait. Server gave us bread which had way way too much garlic pieces on it, so much garlic that later that evening both my husband and myself got stomach aches about an hour after our meal. I used to go to Noras when they were located in Summerlin and it was great...Im not impressed with this Noras now! The steamed clams were good but needs to be served at a hotter temperature then we received. Our main courses were just ok. We wont be coming back to Noras there are too many better restaurants to spend my money at and get better food to eat.

ax1HGlhnrhVT9NGUJSMvoQ.text: The atmosphere and decor is REALLY nice. They have a great looking outdoor area which would have been cool to check out. The food was prepared very well and the prices were reasonable. Not the cheapest, but the food definitely deserved the premium. It will be very busy, and very LOUD. Tuesday evening and there was a wait out the door for HOURS - get a reservation. The Veal was great though the portion was a little small. Otherwise I would say it's a great option for sit down Italian if you're on that side of town.

OHar2Fcyo4Q6MWuR2qsv5g.text: Been coming here for at least a decade & always consistent delicious authentic Italian food.  Love the renovations & bigger space. The Caramel rimmed Apple Martini is divine & smells like an apple pie.  Come expecting to be full for days after.   Four baskets of garlic buttered bread, two bowls of linguine w/ or garlic shrimp scampi & meatball app, I was satisfied, but was talked into more pasta.  Pasta alla vodka, meat lasagna, veal scaloppini, wine & to top it off tiramisu!     Highly recommend all of this in this order.   Absolutely A+.  Ma & pa's w/ live Italian music.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi mmm that Garlic!  Side of Linguini.

iQY3-9jE4Oh4S30UO3vqJw.text: The food and service was top notch. Casual dining with a sports bar added. Way better than you're neighborhood Olive Garden. Calamari, mozzarella sticks, Cesar salad, fruite de mare, tiramise, spumoni, brioche bites, and the garlic bread to die for. Will definitely be going back! Don't eat Italian that often. This place has changed my mind!

deR5GdznIoR5NFhQtjVjFQ.text: We recently visited Nora's with our friends. The experience and food was average. The hostess had a cold attitude. No smile,  didn't feel welcomed. They made us sit down and did not even lay the napkins and cutlery . We had to request for it once appetizers arrived. Main course was served all cold,  meat had no flavour . The worst part is that their service and food does not explain me why this restaurant menu items are priced on the higher side. To top it all they do not serve fresh grated parmesan once the meal is on the table.  Bummer! We were given stale geated parmesan cheese in a glass jar.

ocfqAManAjX4CCISyRYpfQ.text: Love it! The Original is the best! I enjoy this menu better than the summerlin location

sQ8W5X4rnHJteEKZm3gG3w.text: Good old style Vegas atmostphere. Bustling with people, the bar was packed and everyone was extremely friendly. Bartenders were understandably busy and they make a mean lemondrop martini.  We were sat right on time (I would highly recommend making reservations). The waiter was friendly, again,  busy so he was in and out and doing what he does, not a lot of personal interaction as with the bartenders. I orderd the Chicken Erbe fini - spaghetti with herbed chicken breast. Spaghetti was good, good red sauce, not watery and full of flavor. The chicken was a little dry and not as much flavor as I would have liked. My date ordered the lasagna and after sampling some of that, I should have ordered the same. Hearty, full of flavor, strong cheese flavors, the meat sauce was excellent. Baked of course, and very rich. The garlic bread was good as was the mozzarella sticks, both served piping hot and a great way to start the meal

LoFdj8W89Lr5fjzLgBRw-g.text: My coworker recommended this restaurant for my sister who was hosting a pre-wedding dinner for her son.  She wanted a dinner which was reasonable and comfortable for 35 people.  WALLA!  Who would have thought the food was FANTASTIC the drinks were SUPERB and the Ambiance was wonderful.  I want to go back to Las Vegas just to eat at Nora's again.    I can truly say I have never had such wonderful Italian food.  Apple Martini's were a big hit also. Thank you to the wonderful family who owns Nora's.

YEICMQYIwQexLaeUUbnb-g.text: Yelp had great buy 1 get 1 Sangria deal which was great for girls night. Loved calamari, caprese salad, and basil penne pasta. Good price great food!

qpNnDU4BYvGqI-OMdmRi1w.text: Great place.  We had a lovely meal.   We had an extraordinary halibut dish.   I had chicken marsala.  Kids had lasagna and pasta carbonara. We also had calamari that was divine.   Service matched the food.   Why anyone would go to a chain restaurant with this jewel in Vegas? Beats me.   Just superb!

lVX5hMEsY836NzPP2Qo6hg.text: Nora's - ate there once and no-mora! Food was fair, not great at all. Pizza - no real flavor to the dough, and ziti was half assed . If you want Italian food better than this you can find it at Parma 's  all day long. But make a reservation if more than four.  I'm Italian  - ate it all my life - don't set your expectations too high if you must eat at Nora's   Just because people say 3 generations of business doesn't always mean its good - I know some real shitty plumbers that have been in business longer!

5MKcKhHpNoXvnAn7y_MZhQ.text: Best Pesto in town, hands down.  Garlic bread is clinically addictive.  Is built into a strip-mall, so the exterior doesn't look like much, but inside is a great atmosphere, classy, perfect for a nice night out.  Occasional live jazz.  Be sure to reserve ahead-of-time - this place is always booked!

VAMGR92qnEjcvN_e5GDGFw.text: We went there with no reservation on my moms birthday, which I found out its reservation only. But they set a table for us and  accommodated our party. Staff was excellent but the food was even better. We have been here 3 times since.

tSJLXEQYmh1R7oYqVDjmBg.text: This is such a great place for locals and for visitors who are looking to eat off of the strip.  The staff is extremely friendly and entertaining.  They usually have live music on the weekends and the environment is romantic/inviting and not pretentious.

_pSq0sUubodawzeiIBxnNw.text: You cannot go wrong at Nora's  The Bread, the Ziti, the wine, the music!!!!!!  If you've ever opted out because of the undesirable strip mall location. Please think again!!!! Once you walk in you will be a fan for life! The food, service and quality are all wonderful. This place gets even more fun if go on a Friday or Saturday evening, catch the live music and hang out at the bar. A favorite of mine since the first time a friend took me!!!

S3jRu84E7UyfV46bxr_nlg.text: Great local hangout for Italian food. shrimp scampi - so good.  Will come back for more!

APvAtnqaXbY7zrV-A39Lig.text: Called around 3 and got reservations for 7:30.  Arrived a little early but we were sat within 5 minutes of our reservation time.  The place was very busy but worth it.  Service was pretty good and the food was excellent.  Started with the caprese  salad and then went with the chicken marsala.  Both dishes were very good.  The spaghetti with  the chicken was very good.  I really liked their red sauce.  Prices were pretty good for the quality food and service.

J3Sp2U83NKc47HBUyUlSLQ.text: I have been here several times (always for take-out) and have never been disappointed.  Their pizzas are delicious and so are the pasta dishes.  I love the ambiance: it's very casual and friendly.  The kitchen is right in the middle of the action and it's something you see as soon as you walk in the door.  The smells are outrageous and enough to kick the salivary glands into high gear!  On my most recent visit (4/19/14), I ordered the snow white pizza with prosciutto on top.  The pizza was delicious and the crust was perfectly crispy and very tasty.  I also ordered the Rigatoni Nora and the Baked Rigatoni.  Everything was delicious...I'm still dreaming about the leftovers from the next day and how good they were!  Next time, I intend to take some friends with me and eat in to truly enjoy this excellent restaurant.

QZDkhyBBCN7MxkTkSnWEWg.text: Every time my family and I go to Vegas, we would hit up this hole in the wall spot that has built upon its success by delivering authentic Italian dishes using the freshest ingredients. The prices are reasonable and portions are fulfilling. I've gotten the Chicken Mt. Etna which is two chicken breasts stacked with oven roasted tomatoes and deep fried vermicelli. Though quite heavy, the taste was marvelous. You can't go wrong with their Crazy Chicken Alfredo, as well as their Four Staggioni Pizza. Great ambiance, and a nice and fully stocked bar. Nora's is certainly a spot to take a date out without leaving a dent in the wallet.

shB69gLThFdD1TDo200XuQ.text: We have never been disappointed here and always make it a point to order the crazy Alfredo as one of our entrees. The osso buco is fab. Won't find better Italian food anywhere. A little noisy and a little away from the strip but worth it.

zOJnx2tXwUTuEUZlnvH6Fw.text: Love this place. One of my favorites in town. Service is always wonderful and baked ziti is amazing everytime! It can definitely get crowded and that's a good thing!

VvzCiHMVNbAZwJgT-WeAjw.text: Their vodka sauce is to die for.

H81GALust_uj69_5ls8-iw.text: The rigatoni is my favorite.  I've also had their pizza.  My spouse likes their eggplant.  They are consistently good. Customer service is excellent.

RD_wz2tuC_HPAYnkZwTePA.text: Good place to get good food, I got the crazy Alfredo and it certainly was a good helping of it.  The bread was also really good, I'd have come again to try other items so I could give a more detailed review but from what I tried the food was good, service was great.

b-FI4_vlLTLBoyMddBqeOA.text: We visited the new location last night for an early dinner.  The dining room was full before 5pm and tables were only available for reservations.  So, we ate at the bar which is very nice.  Unfortuantely, I had loud just married guy who thought he was at a club and  an older woman who was wearing my moms cologne on my left.  The Crazy Alfredo was very good and I would return just for that.  I tried a Moody Tongue beer however the bartender didnt know what kind of beer it was...?  I would come back to try other food but make sure I had a reservation.  Lastly, I would put a nicer sign on the old building stating that they have moved and announce the restaurant coming soon.

FD3TT4w9KfaIX9BlBw4kwA.text: I am so disappointed in this restaurant. The only dish I liked was the octopus appetizer it was very well prepared and tasty. They seem to be very busy but their food is substandard. I had to send my pasta marinara side dish back because it was inedible! The eggplant parmigiana was covered with such a thick "cheese" when scraped off, the eggplant was hardly there. I would not go back. Beware, for a local restaurant, I am not sure people know what good Italian food tastes like.

5S_sflAHTPh-D2Uuj_8Vbg.text: Wow! This place is darn good!  New building and location .... much better!  Great food and value!  Nice break from the Strip. Check this place out ... great service (family), great food, great prices for the quality, good atmosphere!  4 Star!

hphYNAhUCe12kXo8RJ3TnA.text: Wonderful food. Wine list extensive.  4 star only because we had to ask for a server. Once he came over everything was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GRGxfpUT3ZsjWPn7ChCHpQ.text: One of the best italian restaurants in Vegas! I've tried their white wine linguini clam pasta, wild boar and rigatoni pasta... All of them were amazing! Their bread and service were remarkable as well!

eQfjtTMAlWTuGsJnOWpv0Q.text: I've been taking my fiancee to her favorite restaurant Nora's every year for her birthday since 2013.  It is simply marvelous!  The most delicious Italian cuisine I have ever tasted!  The portions are quite generous and not enormous so you'll more than likely be able to clean your entire plate from the appetizers to the main course to dessert!  The staff is kind and attentive and they really make you feel welcome.  The last two years we've gone, we've ordered their famous Oreo Tartuffo dessert which is a cookies and cream scoop of ice cream covered In chocolate shell with Oreo cookie crumbles and I think there's even some mousse with it too!  It's absolutely one of the tastiest desserts I have ever had!  Highly recommended!

v4fyY7LH7g4iEunA13zLnA.text: Finally found it. Unreal service and incredible pizza / pasta dishes. Will be a routine visit going forward.

oW770zk8Kg3xbOcYZH_B1g.text: I get the lunch special spaghetti with a side salad. Their garlic bread is very good. I love the music they play and the service is very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wxdKAEmSszrtvbblAslprw.text: Years later even after moving to a bigger location, their service is still the absolute worst in Vegas that I have ever encountered. I've lived here my whole life and I will never patronise this place on my own accord. Their food is loaded with so much salt that my blood pressure skyrockets and I'm thirsty beyond normal. And why on EARTH are the negative reviews on here "not recommended?"  They are absolutely truthful in their rightful scorn.

cyfKHJasSILMn6BABYAnMA.text: My favorite restaurant of all!! Celebrated our 22nd Anniversary tonight with our 2nd son's close friend & his wife (We lost him in March). They just purchased their 1st home as well....there was no better place to take them rather than Nora's.  The service is awesome, atmosphere is spectacular... their new location... WOW!! Most of all their food, anything you choose, is out of this world!!! Thank you once again for hitting it out of the park!! This was Matt & Lindsay's 1st visit, I could assure you they will be back

3BtjCZ7UgRzIZcsIlIZq6w.text: What a thrill to enjoy Nora's outstanding cuisine, with our favorite waiter Don, at their New Location!  The new facility is excellent, very nice, but not gaudy.  Don once again was everything a great waitperson is.  He was attentive, but not excessive.  His service support staff is always watching for needs, but they don't hover.    I don't get to Las Vegas as much as I'd like, but when I do I always enjoy dinner at Nora's at least once, twice if we can.  Last Wednesday was our first in the new facility.  We will go again later this week.  Thank you Nora's for keeping your outstanding menu cooked to perfection, employing a staff of excellent quality and friendliness.  The new facility just adds to our enjoyment.

SIQMge1fCwaUKGZJ0aPbvw.text: They have a nice variety of items, the food was wonderful BUT either we went on a bad night or it's typical for the food to take 45 minutes? Could be that the server forgot to ring it in OR the kitchen crashed. Whatever the case, it's not exceptable.  My other issue was too many tables crammed into the restaurant. There is not enough room for that volume. The table next to us had 10 people around what should be a table for 6 MAX. One poor woman was right in the walkway with barely enough room to walk past her.  I was quoted 45 min to a hour wait...that was more like 20 minutes. (Maybe she ment  the food would take 45 minutes.) Quote times should be more accurate.  VERY disappointed a manager or key wasn't walking around checking on the guest or was even sent to our table, my body language spoke volumes of how upset I was getting. I've worked in the F&B industry for 25 years, and I can say, I've had a better experience at an Applebee's and that's 1 step up from fast food. I may give it another shot because the food was GREAT....when it finally got there. I will also make sure I make a reservation, even on a Wednesday night.

bYZVtPJ0LIaR0Nk5um9LLg.text: The best marinara sauce I have ever eaten.   The garlic bread is delicious.  The lemon vinaigrette is also delicious.   What I don't expect from fine dining are tomatoes on the mozzarella caprese  unripe and cut thin making an otherwise beautiful dish just cheese ( ask for ripe tomatoes cut thicker to balance the mozzarella).  The house salad was uneventful 90% lettuce.

Wv6K_6Vcry-cdrhv9jK9dw.text: The "Rigatoni Special" is so freaking good! The savory sauce is to die for...By far the best Italian spot in Vegas. "Crazy Alfredo",  and "The Chicken Parmagiana" were also very good. A must when here in Vegas if your craving a little piece of Italy! Enjoy!

iyIZdOvlDxLKlVp8Izvcvg.text: We love it here. The food is excellent.   HOWEVER, even though we made reservations we had to wait endlessly for a table. We thought the new somewhat larger location would alleviate the wait problem, but I guess they just can't get organized. We may not return because of this.  After waiting with a crowd of people who had no reservations, near the door which was continuously cold & uncomfortable, we were finally seated last evening.  Still, until I saw that the manager (who was at the bar with other patrons) happened to notice that we were sitting there without water, bread or anyone acknowledging us or coming to the table,  a waitress magically appeared.  That was about 10 minutes.  To top it off, after the long uncomfortable wait, we were seated near a large noisy birthday party - a few of them were actually toasting above my husband's head.  I was waiting to see if they'd spill wine or food on him. - Private Parties?  Make them take a private room.  So, we'll give it one more shot because of the food and  as usual I will make reservations.  If it continues that they can't alleviate the uncomfortable long waits, we will avoid coming here despite liking the exceptional food.

OD_-S8Kw3KlM1c2Opi7F_A.text: Many find this the finest Italian restaurant in town.  I think it is a little above average. Had the Penne with Arabiata sauce. Very bland. Nice atmosphere is why I'm giving it 4 instead of 3 stars

6XPSzrnMUbVf827ciHPh6g.text: Nora's is the best authentic Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Their new location is beautiful and the place is always packed. The service is outstanding!

Usfw1CHitfVWrX3ZfTYseg.text: I have read all the reviews on Nora's since they have re-opened at a new location and so I decided to try it.  Used to go to the old location and most of the time it was OK....   Went there last night and I'm sorry to say the food wasn't as good as it should have been.  The Chicken Marsala was OK, nothing special, tasted the same as all the Marsala dishes I order at other Italian restaurants, nothing special to set Nora's version apart.   Also ordered the Eggplant Pizza which was terrible, the egg plant was burnt and the pizza crust was un-chewable, sent it back and ordered the Eggplant ala Nora without the Pesto on it.  Again the eggplant was overcooked so it tasted burnt which isn't exactly a treat, and it was just an average dish of spaghetti with sauce and then topped with burnt pieces of eggplant.   The food isn't fantastic, it is just regular Italian food you could eat anywhere and pay less for.  I don't go to a restaurant because the building is new, that is not what I am paying for, I am paying for a fantastic dinner and I didn't get that.  It was below average but priced above average.  More detail should be given to the quality and preparation of the food.   It wasn't worth my going there because I didn't enjoy myself nor did my companion and we had terrible indigestion for the better part of the evening after dining there.   There are many Italian restaurants around town that can compete with Nora's and the food is more enjoyable, prepared correctly, and not as costly.   I don't understand all these great reviews because I looked at the food coming out of the kitchen (not just what I ordered) and it didn't look like it was anything special.  I just think people are so used to going to Nora's that it becomes a habit and they go not for the food but because they are used to going there.  Sorry Nora's, your new building is pretty, but I think the quality of your food need improvement!!!!

0L_0L8ILVUCyVrohIhHHkA.text: Great fresh and well prepared food. I had a chicken dish lightly grilled with artichokes and light sauce. My daughter had fettuccini. Nice. We will come back Service was super friendly fast and attentive

yHWonJnOkP2pq8_5O-KYNw.text: Came here for my birthday dinner and the service is fantastic as well as the food they are so attentive to you and they also allowed my friend to bring in a birthday cake to surprise me. I really recommend this place if your looming for a nice place to have dinner or even a special event

SIbeTdRSlLtPEpDtkz9JUA.text: CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!!!!  Order the chocolate cake - you have to order it with your entree so it's ready for dessert.  Mere words cannot describe it's deliciousness.

gZ8H0FJF9Gmfys9B2wxK3Q.text: We went to Nora's last night because it was recommended to us.  We were SO disappointed!!  The food was nothing special - I had the Frutes di Mar & my husband had the shrimp scampi.  Neither was what we expected and neither was very good.  The service was also awful.  Our glasses went empty for a good 10 minutes and we were not there when the restaurant was full.  We won't be going back.

kykwg0wd7pusrSIOGklavw.text: I love this place so much, I took my mom for her first time my 10th. The service is five stars and the food is great I will always choose Nora"s for a nice dinner with my honey or even just a nice place to go for no reason at all.

SUykvmy9DRJqjioyIX50Ng.text: This place is a bit of a surprise for me.  The location is horrendous for what the interior has to offer. I took in this surprise in sheer delight because of how much Nora's Cuisine reminded me of San Francisco. Don't judge a book by its cover. The ambiance is pure magical. Nothing beats the pace of a well ran restaurant. It's like watching a well orchestrated opera. I haven't even touch upon the food yet....Let's just say for my pallet this is rated in the Best of the Best category.  Score for Las Vegas

v1pioMIEPAXVHBx544PFbA.text: Went here on a recommendation and had a great meal. Frutti di mare was terrific - ask for it spicy! The fettucine alfredo with shrimp was also good, though it could have used more garlic. Can never have enough garlic!  Very good wine list, well priced with great variety. Food was yummy, service was professional and the evening was great value compared with the top rated Italian places on the strip. I look forward to going back and trying more of the menu.

OPr2T7b2YKdOtAzbD1FyCQ.text: Food was good (Baked rigatoni, cheesy yum. Soggy garlic bread, eh). Our server was on top of things and very attentive. The only thing that rubbed me the wrong way was was the hostess. When I told her we didn't have a reservation she kind of got an attitude. Granted we arrived at 6 pm on a Friday night, but still... The place was EMPTY when we walked in. She told us since we had no reservation we could sit at a tiny table next to the pizza oven area or a hightop table next to a stage. We opted for the stage table and luckily, no band played while we were there. Even though they got busier while we were there, there were still plenty of tables, and no need to be treated like we couldn't be served due to no reservation. After my husband talked me into not walking out, we enjoyed a nice meal and a really nice server. While nothing completely blew me away, (Let's face it, Vegas is not known for its Italian food) the food, price, and our server were good enough that I might go back again. AND, I'll even be sure to make a reservation.

gHIuPhq9jzO9dEUyC6ep-A.text: We were staying nearby with no car, so we walked over after yelping it. We got a table in the kitchen and were treated well. Great pasta, the scallopini was a bit salty for me, but I generally don't use salt, so I may be over-sensitive. The waiters were nice and friendly. This is a well organized place that obviously has been doing it right for a long time.

ZKUFQXwgnH00NEU8EisOvw.text: Four people dined at the restaurant which is a very busy and popular place. We ordered basics. One pizza Margherita, chicken parm, chicken Marsala and shrimp over linguini.  After waiting an hour to be served, all three chicken or shrimp dishes were served cold. The chicken parm had two small pieces of chicken, the chicken Marsala was covered with brown goop, and there were only two shrimp on the plate. The pizza was served hot but the dough was soggy and under cooked.  This was a long time to wait for poorly prepared food.  While this place is popular there are much better local Italian restaurants.

u0yIHKwBRPXYG_B5Q4UYlQ.text: Great Italian food and at a decent price.  Here is the major problems:  1) the food is good but they could drop the price 2 bucks an entree. 2) the appetizers are so overpriced it doesn't make sense. 3) the service is terrible! absolutely terrible.  Unfortunately the two times I went there the service almost made me walk out. 4) there are some good restaurants in the area and they need to step it up. 5) the place is too narrow.  hard to get around.

U_2InHSq9XdKNeQCinbZvA.text: Far and away the best Italian food in Vegas. Amazing food and great prices. The way Italian food should be. They are a model that all Italian restaurants in Las Vegas should strive to be as good as.  The best garlic bread in the world. The most amazing Arrabiatta sauce on the planet. This is not only the best in Vegas it is the best I have ever had. You cant get better than Nora's Family run the way Italian establishments should be. Great service, amazing wine selection and full bar. I am always nostalgic when the sons were servers and Nora'was in the kitchen cooking long before they expanded twice.  I miss the 4 tables they used to have but happy they are doing so well now. A place you have to try. If you don't like Noras you don't like Italian food. WARNING: Garlic will seep from your pours for days. All worth it but be warned!

rxCEkVbQy3xKMy4ZLnaA7g.text: I think the hype is what killed it for me.  Having seen Nora's on TV and reading all the positive reviews, I expected the best Italian food in town.  Especially since "this is where all the chefs go to eat", as per the Food Network.  We wanted to order the pasta puttanesca but the bartender insisted we order the house special pork chops.  So it was fried calamari, some kinda fried risotto balls with saffron, and the aforementioned pork chops.  The calamari was typically mediocre, the same kind you'd get at Cheesecake Factory and the like.  The risotto balls were decent, though there wasn't much cheese or saffron in it.  We felt like tools for listening to the bartender about the pork chops though.  It reminded me of Kitchen Confidential where the chefs try to push out the last of old meats on the customers.  At least the garlic bread was good, but they charge you for any additional baskets beyond the first.

dszJRU8QNHVL9rEoyA5Yxg.text: This place is delicious. A little far from the strip but worth the drive. I recommend Penne a la vodka, baked rigatoni and their cannoli for desert!

kcBAn-jMkjOqH9nBD5XAFQ.text: Noras is like my second home, here in Vegas its hard to find a place with good food.My friends and I will come here about 4-7 times a month, the staff is amazing and welcomes you like your there sister, drinks are heaven, and for being a vegetarian the eggplant is the best, i mean the best! out of this world.

BNxHi3YClkWG11e9F2xw0A.text: I was in Las Vegas over the weekend for a half marathon - so naturally I needed to carb up pre-race. My friend found Nora's through Yelp and the Vegas Yelpers did not steer us wrong! What a delightful place. The ambiance was much more than expected for a strip mall, and the wait staff was pleasant and the food was SO good. The garlic bread was addicting and we had two family-style salads which were delish. I had spaghetti with eggplant, ground beef and red sauce for my entree and it was very good. The only very small hitch was that we traveled with a vegan who wasn't able to eat the pasta because it's made fresh with eggs. For us non-vegans, that was a big plus! For the vegan, he ended up with a small pizza with some red sauce and veggies (no cheese) and a salad. Still pretty good!   Although I don't get to Vegas often, when I do I hope to make it to Nora's again. Enjoy!

2_3TWcC9JzuQ4qdGi3k2aA.text: Worth every penny! This is my 50th time and They have perfectly maintained consistency in both service and quality of the meal.  It is very laid back and a great place to have a long inviting meal with everyone- even the customers tend to be very nice at nora's.  Don't change a thing, we always look forward to lunch or dinner at Nora's!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch at Nora&#39;s. What is with the ceiling??

Z22Lh3Ruf673xu37nS8-GQ.text: The food is absolutely amazing. No reason to go to an italian place on the strip when Nora's quality of food, preperation, and price are perfect. The calamari is just right, the free basket of garlice bread is a perfect addition as well. The main courses offer such quality and variety, and the servers are spot on. DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.

xFE2vqOZJBpt9q7YkV0xRQ.text: Great food and pretty reasonable considering Vegas.  Loved my pasta dinner and the service was great.  I would go back but probably ask to sit in the dining room instead of the bar.  Salads are  large so share.

8exRcCLO-ya83MkBqPZxTQ.text: The food is TO DIE FOR! Great Italian! Crazy Alfredo makes me drool just thinking about it! If you haven't been here then I urge you to GO! AND BRING FRIENDS BECAUSE YOU WILL LOVE IT! Friendly service, beautiful romantic setting. AAAHhh!

8PCO7Ltx7GRufuA0mcuiRQ.text: Dined here the evening of 3/9/10 (Tuesday).  My fiance and one of my best friend's had a reservation here at 8 PM.  The place was PACKED!!!   I could not believe how utterly busy this place was on a Tuesday night.  We arrived at 8PM and still had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated.  Upon sitting down at our table we were immediately served with fresh, hot and oh so yummy, garlic bread.  Our waiters were super friendly.  For appetizers, we started off with the mozzarella sticks and calamari.  Both were very delicious!  We split the small order of the antipasto salad which had: Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes, and rolled ham,   provolone,and salame, served with our homemade Italian dressing.  It was soooooo good!!!  I ordered the Fettuccine Carbonara, my fiance ordered the linguine and clams and my friend ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce.  Every dish was outstanding!  The portions are huge,  you will definitely have left overs.  Service was also very fast and efficient.  We will definitely go back!

1OD_EzpewLlVln4sMzYZVA.text: There is nothing better than trying out new authentic italian restaurants. I googled this place the other night, never heard of it and decided we'd try it out. As soon as I walked in, the feeling of a fine, classy, sophisticated, elegant italian place is the vibe you get. Not to mention, for its "space", it's adorable. Nice bar, live italian music playing and a good amount of well-dressed people have let me know this is a decent place. We didn't have to wait very long which was nice. While we did wait, we were able to watch the cooks preparing authentic italian food. When we sat down everything was formal, almost as if we were on a  spot on the strip. Though the room started to remind me a little bit of an office building, the decor made up for it as the ceilings were decorated and the walls were dressed as if it may be your own grandmothers dining room. Cute.  I enjoy when the servers are wearing vests because I know I will get the quality I want. But downfall was the server took a long time at first. The complimentary italian garlic bread is a bit buttery for my own diet but the fact it wasn't just a basket of butter packets and bread made this place a little different then the others & also, the fact that it had fresh, chopped garlic on it  as well made up for the too much butter .When we got our dishes the food was perfect and just enough. One of the dishes we ordered was the 'Alla Nora' and I'd recommend it if you like a robust meat sauce (bolognese)  with breaded eggplant - fried. Comes with spaghetti obviously. Not bad if this is one of their signature dishes -assuming. For the lack of perfect service the girl made up for it by bringing us a complimentary dessert. Or was it because we told her it was our first time there? :) Either way, Tiramasu is definitely not my type of dessert but its the thought that counts. I'd recommend this restaurant for a special birthday or a romantic, quiet dinner. I would definitely come back to try out something different on the menu since I was satisfied with the other menu items. I'd recommend this place also with another couple or a date because it's definitely one of the more intimate places to go, even if it's just to have a glass of wine and listen to the live italian music.

QVXgHivqlHHXeC9jUNjy1A.text: Went last night with friends.  Our table of 6 was ready 15 minutes early, ambience is very nice with a jazz band performing live after 9 p.m.  Service was very good except for the fact that each couple was served at separately rather than get help to bring out everyone's course at the same time.  As to the food, the steak bruschetta is very good as an appetizer but the caesar salad was terrible.  Hardly any dressing and very little parmesan cheese with no fresh pepper as a topper.  My wife ordered a chicken alfredo with boiled chicken and small portions compared to the mound of noodles with little sauce.  Her chicken was not seasoned at all.  I ordered the veal marsala which had great portions but was way overseasoned to the point I was chugging water and the spaghetti was not that good.  Dessert was tiramisu which is good but a little sweet.  Pricing is certainly the best part, our dinner was $83 for the 2 of us which included wine and dessert.  Liked the free glass of wine at check-in but we left underwhelmed considering the number of restaurants here in Vegas.

Phbj_6F_mg9zFc-1iN5gkA.text: The bartenders do a great job of keeping one nice and toasted before other diners arrive. The garlic bread is good but i wouldnt call it the best i've ever had. That goes to Parma but i'm not here to compare places i'm here to review this one. So lets do it!  I was already pretty toasted by the time we sat and ordered the food. Free glass of Chianti with yelp check-in so we all cashed in on it.   I ended up ordering the Crazy Alfredo because in my boozed up state i completely forgot about the Osso Buco they also serve.  Regardless the Crazy Alfredo is pretty damn amazing and damn crazy. It's got A LOT of things going on for one dish and A LOT of pasta for a decent price.

TwJ1PxIRHpKuOf_pF6phXQ.text: My favorite item on the menu is the most simple...Penne with Tomato and Basil. We've been a customer since they only had 6 tables in the middle section (and did mostly take-out) 20 years! This is our go-to Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and where we take all our out of town company.

9ZAmAQ21WhYgIA5cJEW7Gw.text: Been here twice, second visit was yesterday. People raved on the crazy alfredo... Not a fan. Must be the pickled flavor for the pickled jalapenos? I got shrimp scampi which was amazing! The servings are enough for whole meal to have later. Calamari was perfect. Bruschetta was ehh. Not a fan of super thick large bread pieces. The tomatoes were wonderful. Cannolis were insanely yummy. Chocolate cake was too rich for my taste. They get slammed, so set reservations!

d3-P3mdgYBNhfzYJCLKNNA.text: The Food is fantastic! The staff is very personable and make the experience that much better! I highly recommend locals and visitors of las Vegas visit this restaurant for food and drinks they will never forget!

x0L07IC58GCpCBXXQgOYmw.text: If I could assign"zero" stars I would. Absolutely horrible. Service......bad. Food.......worse. No attention at all is given after you're seated. Had to get up and find my server for a knife! Had to get up and find my server for drink refills. And I still left 20% grat. Used to frequent the original Nora's back in the 90's. They lost their way from those days. But the place was packed so I'm sure they will not change. However they will go forward without my business or that of my friends unless they do change. ASAP!!!

v4a3Mf5lLYzvKDkiqEq2Jw.text: I've been coming to Nora's on and off for at least 8-10 years and it is always consistently good.  I love this place for lunch and is extremely reasonable for lunch ( ribeye steak with a salad for $12.95) is a steal!  The chicken marsala is great as well as the garlic bread.  I would highly recommend a reservation for dinner!

bBkoF1TwVJUjo0PfZtAAng.text: A+ food and drink.. Real home cooked Italian food, the whole experience was inviting..Will definitely return , whether with a date or with the family.

5TamwpnoOGRjqVuJyaN_PA.text: Great food , great atmosphere , service was also very professional .... Bartender Rudy  did a great job mixing cocktails n interacting with guest.... Arancine was tasty , farro salad needs a lil bite more to work on it , linguini with clams good ..  I will totally coming back to try something different ..!!

lmfhNivU1dFAgEfataAWEg.text: Thank you Nora's Italian Cuisine!  Everyone in our large party said the food and service was terrific.  The staff was quick and efficient.  One of our guests quipped "outside of NY, this is the best pizza!"  We may just have to make this our annual dinner place.

ROFYTpSWbFc9J9y0qIutRw.text: Everything about Nora's was an amazing experience!  We walked in, were seated right away, and the staff was very attentive to our needs.   Checked in on the Yelp app and received a glass of wine! Free wine = AMAZEBALLS!  Started off with the house garlic bread. It was very good. You could tell this was homemade, not some frozen loaf coming from a distributor. Just that principle of not having frozen cheap appetizer had me already falling in love.   Then we moved to the bruschetta. It came served on a large slide of soft bread. This was some of the best bruschetta I've ever had. It was not your average sampling, this is what I've been missing my entire life.   My entree was the rigatoni gorgonzola with chicken. Similar to the bruschetta, this was done right! The pasta was perfectly textured and consistent throughout. The sauce on this was heavier than my liking, but it fit very well with the dish. The biggest surprise here was the blue cheese on top. I've never heard of pasta being topped with blue cheese, but I fell in love with it!   By this point we were stuffed and ready to fall asleep in our carb coma.

RxGBMX17p3d-M-gQiMo_LQ.text: The food is amazing, I can honestly say this my favorite authentic Italian food spot,

x9KQiOZ4fA9k1jIP0KNfXw.text: The food was fair.  Over baring with garlic and I like garlic.  Six of us for dinner at 5:00pm.  Three said food was okay, but not great.  The other three did not care for the food.  Been to the "old" place few times and food much better there.  The worst part about the pl be missing ace is the noise level.. Okay when arrived, but at 6:00pm you could not talk across the table.  VERY poor design with no sound deterrence.  Worst than t he old place.  But, if you like a very loud and noise place - enjoy.  The place was packed, so I might missing something.  I would like to see a small salad with the food.  I would like to try it again in a few months, but there is no way my wife will go.  Shrimp scampi worst dish for our group.

hzHVhYZS203DUztO_gjoRQ.text: went to the new location after going to there old hole in the wall spot many times in the past.  good ambiance and same tasting food was my experience.  price seemed about the same as well.  this has been my go to spot for italian/pasta and will continue to go here as their food is fresh.   only reason for 4 star is their service.  its been inconsistent in my visits starting with the host up front then servers.  most servers have been ok but with the new location and a new look, i hope they focus more towards the experience of customers to match their excellent food.   seafood linguine is to die for!  their mussell appetizer with their garlic bread is another killer combo.  my toddler loved the cheese ravioli

2K-q4cDai5akHWwZ-nSTsA.text: The food was great but the service was terrible!! The bus boys were sweet but the waitress was incredibly rude  She was very impatient and would just walk away from our table before we could ask a question  Everyone at the table spoke about how bad the service was  At bill time I put the money in the check folder and she took it away and then came back and asked if I needed change! Of course we did - it was really uncomfortable

iaESv-JfK5fArbPXbsZGYA.text: Mix of about average food.  Pasta isn't fresh, they buy it from somewhere.  The tiramisu was very good.  Friendly servers though slow. Not worth going out of your way for, and good luck finding a cab to get out of there.

yPAZmMUgZUoGSnXmmeEVBw.text: Stopped by this place 3 weeks ago to check out the new location. There was over a hour wait so we left, made a reservation and came back the next week because I wanted to see what the big deal was about this place. The service was ok, nothing special, but being so busy it wasn't a big deal to me. The food was outstanding, and very affordable. My wife and I had different veal dinners, and were both excellent. Good wine menu, overall was a great experience and will def be going back.

8C5tgVRSW7uMJfiZfaKG0w.text: Great food!  Ask for penne arrabiata- it is the best sauce you will ever have!  I get it with a Nora's salad.

rI9XY1KALL8Mq0g01lfc6Q.text: Another great place to eat with great service and awesome customer service. Pricey but worth it. I recommend the anti-pasta salad. Call ahead for reservations so you won't have a long wait.

yM46sVocYiDBDOqgloyJhQ.text: Excellent food as always. We used to make it an annual restaurant to visit when we're on this side of town. May have to increase the frequency.

xk14KNAtElomAJaHOjCuTw.text: I've been to Nora's multiple times and the food is fantastic. Not too fancy, not too casual, just good solid Italian food that is not ridiculously pricey like you would find in the tourist corridor. Make a reservation if you don't like waiting because this place is almost always packed.

H9cIOrTA9ghrHddbd1l1RA.text: This spot came highly recommended by my coworkers. I could tell that most of the diners here are regulars. It took me awhile to get here since it's a bit of a drive from home for me.  We arrived at the start of dinner service and found that they were already getting busy. The hostess was quick in getting everyone seated. Our waiter was quick to greet us and get drinks started. He was friendly and professional. There was never a long period of time without him checking in on us.   The garlic bread was really good. It's definitely meant for True garlic lovers, but this is why I liked it. We passed on a second basket because we didn't want to get too full, but I regretted it later.   I started with a House Salad and my husband started with the Caesar Salad. Both salads were very good. I really liked the house Italian dressing and the large portion of cheese on top.   For my main entree I had the Crazy Alfredo because this was the dish recommended to me by all Nora's fans. The dish lived up to the hype for me even though I think this was my first alfredo dish in at least 10 years. The sauce was delicious and I loved the combination of chicken, sausage, shrimp, jalapeno, cheese, and mushrooms. Definitely a yummy combination. The portion was enough for two people and could definitely be shared. I'd also recommend sharing since it is such a rich dish.  My husband ordered the Veal Parmesan. He thought it was good, but not the best he has ever had. I tasted the red sauce on the spaghetti and didn't care for it.   The food overall was pretty good and I'm excited to give them a try when they build their new restaurant. We'll be back to give them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad &amp; Caesar Salad

rUdZJMIac2RWDimeIxjfoA.text: Busy busy Saturday night! Well worth it! The service was phenomenal, food was fantastic! Everyone enjoyed they appetizers & entrees. My chicken parm was delicious! Huge portion! Waiter recommended  the peanut cup cocktail. OMG! A must have. I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm was so delicious!!

TlBWtnRjVaXKiKvNdnP1ng.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I love that it is local and not on the strip. I have been here many times and will be back for many more.  The service this time was good. Nothing out of the ordinary but nothing bad either.   They start the meal off with garlic bread. It's so good it can be hard to stop eating it.   This time I started off the meal with a resiling. It was good but very sweet. I was kind of surprised because it was sweeter than I though it would be.  I then decided on angel hair pasta with vodka sauce. I like getting thin pasta because it makes it less filling and rich. I really enjoyed it. The portion was good so I was able to take it home for dinner the next day which I always consider a plus.  For dessert we decided to get the tiramisu. I had never had it here before and was so happy we finally decided to try it! It was amazing and I will need to continue ordering this in the future.   In the past we have also tried the peanut butter martini. If you like to drink your dessert then omg you have to try this! So yummy and satisfying.   This is a must try in Las Vegas!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauvignon blanc

Y__owoA2wg59rRqmBfzgzw.text: Incredible food and very excited they got their own building, the eggplant Parm is incredible! And it's huge, I could easily share it with my partner, (which I did today with the Chicken Parm!) it's GUD!

SCevDyoV_8hhjU1k1yUo_w.text: I love Nora's. I've been to so many Italian Restaurants but I've only returned to Nora's several times. The food is awesome, the atmosphere is awesome, love the new location, the service is outstanding. Every time someone from out of town comes to visit, I take them to Nora's. For those of you that's never been there, I highly recommend adding Nora's to your bucket list, you'll be glad you did. Thank to everyone at Nora's for the superb experience every time.

K7TJSGlOELSTVLVbcJ53hA.text: We went to Nora's to carb load before the Death Valley marathon, and we weren't disappointed.  The restaurant was tastefully decorated and the food was amazing.  The bread had so much garlic that if you wore a piece on a chain you could keep away the werewolves!  One of our guests had the Crazy Fettuccini and thought it was great.  The Primavera was yummy and so was the linguini with clam sauce.  We need to go back because they make their own cannolis too.  The dinner was a perfect start to our weekend.

Cw93ClbEbMwDT7lG-jVgXA.text: Nora's was an unexpectes surprise. When I choose to eat out I almost never choose Italian. I'm glad we did.    When I arrived I saw how packed the parking lot was and but we had a reservation and we're seated very quickly. So be sure to reserve a table. The seating is quaint but comfortable and the decor has a nice mix of old trattoria and fusion bar. The staff was friendly and attentive.  We started with the caprese, calamari, and bruschetta. All were delicious and the complimentary garlic bread was a warm and we'll flavored.  My entree was the wild boar pappardelle and it was by far the most amazing thing I've eaten in a long time. The flavors perfectly melded together with a tiny bit of acidity which complimented the boar beautifully. I have only good things to say, definitely will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar pappardelle. Delicious!

FKqmPqOOxoDJK2mK_-ceNA.text: Nice late dinner with friends, food was good, service very kind, drinks awesome good sugestion from nicola my server, my busser the small asian guy was very attentive, ambient was ok. One big dissatisfaction is the manager a dark skin guy with a suit , welll my friend i try to get your attention for a question about the drinks but you IGNORED US!! That is what i hate from managers they think their job is just looking around like a clown!!! My friend you are supposed to be friendly and kind with the guests but instead you walking around like a big AHOLE!!!!! I was about to make you a nasty review but the crew in the floor and kitchen don't deserve that because of you!! Mr manager.

cNLsGaBry90zQb7tfCFOeg.text: Man oh man the pasta here is so delicious.  Reservations make it so much better so make sure you do that.    It's a great place for a casual dinner, birthday celebrations and banquets.  The parking lot is too small for the size of the restaurant, but there's plenty of street parking.    They offer garlic bread which was really good.  I had calamari and it was the usual at any Italian restaurant.  I tried the melrose shrimp with half chicken and half shrimp.  My dish was really good and really creamy.  Every thing that went into my mouth was fat girl heaven.    Downfall, with a really cool place like this they didn't offer freshly grated Parmesan.  I don't understand this.    The service was good and I really want to come back if I'm in the area.

YXevPdadVQ4Zo2zpeecp6A.text: Upscale classy Italian restaurant setting. Brought my lady on a date and we were blown away with the first impression. 100000x better than Olive Garden that's forsure lol. If you want amazing fine dining service with one of the best Italian dishes you'll ever taste, you gotta check this place out. Make sure to bring your date here. ;)
