br4gwDja77e2Qrao17ooXQ.text: Wow!!! The food was amazing! We came here our our daughters bday. A Thursday night and it was packed . The parking lot was full and you had to park on the street on a weekday! Thank goodness we made a reservation. The service was excellent from the waiter to his partner who kept the water coming, and cleaned the plates each time. I ordered the eggplant and it was delicious. My daughter ordered the shrimp scampi. I tried and it is the best I ever had, I will def be ordering that next time . My wife ordered the baked rigatoni , excellent . We were served tiramisu for her bday! Class act all the way around.. we will def be back. The garlic bread for the table was awesome! Big chunks of garlic on the bread, toasted to perfection. The place was packed the entire time we were there and did not let up.. wow!!!! Thank you!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TPDhgoSq6x59l_VlTn0nEA.text: After hearing everyone rave about this place, my man and I decided to give it a try. We came in at around 9pm for two of us and it was a great start. Nice atmosphere, live band, it was very comforting and welcoming. The server, Kara came to greet us at a reasonable time. I ordered my drink and couple mins later we ordered our appetizers. Our appetizers came out really quick and the server came to take our entree orders. She helped me pick out my entree and everything was going really well until afterwards..... our food didn't come out for 40 mins. (Literally.) Not sure if she forgot about us but I know for a fact that the table next to us sat down quite after us and they got their meal way before we did. I understand if there was some sort of a mistake, kitchen being backed up, etc but she avoided our table until our food came out. She would walk past our table to check up on the table next to us but not a single word to us. I wish she could've came up to reassure that our food is still being worked on or SOMETHING. After long wait, the food was good.. but not outstanding. It definitely was not worth the wait and the poor service. We expected so much better for a nice fine dining restaurant like this.

5MZ9VY8pirFPbi-Yn2Zz9w.text: We tried Nora's last night for the first time. The ambiance is really great with bricks, white lights and white linen. We had a great waiter Sebastian that was very knowledgeable and courteous to our needs. I'm not sure I can say I was in love with the food though, but I will say maybe I need to try again. My husband wanted risotto but they only have risotto balls. He ordered a margarita pizza large which was $18. Where he may have gone wrong is he ordered extra sauce and we both agreed it was too much. His bad, I think normal sauce would have been how he liked it. I ordered the baked rigatoni do it arrived way too baked. The inside was very dry and it was a ricotta overload. The dish was not deep at all so the ricotta being dry from heat soaked up any sauce. The meat sauce wasn't very meaty. In fact I didn't taste too much meat. So may be I ordered wrong and again the place is affordable and nice enough for second chances!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-SjlqSHy31_TiQDsfuvCrw.text: I wanted to like this place....I wanted to LOVE this place. Everyone we talked to about "the best Italian said "Nora"......Upon walking in, we were immediately greeted by the front desk staff, we were sat right on time for our reservation. That's just about where the good ends. As soon as our servers gets to our table of 2, we are not greeted....simply asked if we wanted a soup or salad. At this time we ordered a bottle of wine with our appetizer, shortly after ordered our entree. Finally we ask our server if our bottle of wine will be out soon. She told us it should be almost ready (mind we have been waiting 30 minutes for 1 bottle for 2 people). Five minutes later the server comes back ask "What did you even order from the bar?" Our food came at that time, so we then said we no longer wanted the bottle. I'm not sure how you forget your tables wine? A $150 bottle especially. The garlic bread was burnt and the pasta was really not even worth calories. We then ordered desert, the Panna Cotta and a Peanut Butter Cup cocktail (best thing at the restaurant). Our server did try to make up for her mistake by bringing us 3 deserts comped....Yet she never brought the Panna Cotta that I ordered. A restaurant can have mediocre food and have good service and still be worth the visit. A restaurant can have mediocre service and excellent food and still be worth the visit. However, bad food and poor service are a combination that doesn't mix. Our visit to Nora was nothing short of counting the minutes until the meal was over.

gmr0BGNYE53OQ38sCjXtGQ.text: Wow. Twice in a week  So me and my half decided to go eat over therefore time  after heard about their branzino fish and how great it is .  Amazing place the vibe is great .  Bit loud but kinda flowing with it ... We had to come back for that fish again but this time we finished with amazing desserts  (chocolate cake is crazy good ) Just earned a good customer

S28a4G54U4UB2mGko58qvQ.text: Great food and wonderful drinks. Out waiter is second to none. Thank you Sebastia for making our visit the best.  We will be back Bill & Robin

TMSK5_tJj7laTkuu1y5MdA.text: Nora's used to be one of my favorite restaurants in town and definitely my go-to for Italian. But since the change of location... it hasn't been the same.  First, the parking situation was horrible. On a Wednesday night, there's no parking... people were parking in the dirt or the plaza across the street. There is always a wait.  Most recently when I went, I made a reservation a week ahead of time for a party of 12. We arrive on the dot and ended up waiting 20 minutes for the table, only to find the table to be very cramped for the large party. The service was horribly slow. We had to ask multiple times for the [delicious] bread. We waited probably around 1 hour for our main courses... which came out dry. We ordered a good variety from pasta to fish to fillet mignon to osso buco. Nothing was prepared right. The meat was over cooked, the pasta was oily and you can tell it was sitting under the heater too long cause the sauce was dried onto the plate around the edges, and the flavors were just not there.  I understand this place is busy, but the server just never seems to be around. They never seem to have the beer selection from their menu.   Only redeeming thing is the busser was always around to ensure we had water and drink refills.  Anyone got good recommendations for a new Italian restaurant? I'm open to suggestions at this point.

m7Am45_camZyzIkxRwC19g.text: Classy italian restaurant that'll knock your socks off.      Went on Sunday 12-20-15 at 6:30 with my yelpy friend Jamie P.  She was nice enough to make us reservations and the place was packed so I'm glad she did that! We had 4 adults and a baby in our party and the hostess threw a hissy fit because she said the reservation is for four....not five people...so we'll have to wait.  I was thinking can't we just pull up a high chair to the table?  The answer was no.  Ended up being seated about 7PM and no food on the table until about 7:40 but that's the *only* puny little complaint that I have.    $95.83 got us a small 4 Staggioni pizza, a margarita, a whiskey sidecar cocktail, an appetizer of clams, a house salad, a chocolate cake, two coffees, and a ginger ale.  The table and napkins are real white linen and the table is covered by white paper.  Crayola crayons were brought out for my boy which I thought was cool (none of that cheap-o Rose Art shit).    I originally wanted the Branzino but they were out :( *sad violin noises*   The clams were hot and fresh and the menu says it comes with 12 but I swear there were at least 2 dozen in my bowl.  The menu says  "12 Manila Clams, Evo, Lemon Parsly" and I'm pretty sure that's not how you spell parsley and shouldn't it be "EVOO" if they are trying to say extra virgin olive oil?  Whatevs....it was $14.95 and the clams were hot and sweet and wonderful.  I only had one that was sandy but the rest were awesome.    The 4 Staggioni pizza had pizza sauce, sausage, pepperoni, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella, and olives.  The small was $15.45 and worth every penny.  I loved the puffy crust and I'm enjoying the leftovers today as we speak.    The chocolate cake must be ordered ahead of time (at the time you order your entrees) and was a steal for $6.50.  It is a rich, soft centered, Valrohna chocolate cake adorned by a vanilla sauce and pistachios.  Valrohna is a type of rich chocolate heavy on the cocoa side.  I absolutely loved this.  It's making my mouth water right now just thinking about it!   With Olive Garden being the only other italian food I've experienced, this place blows it out of the water.  It would be a great place to take a date or family members that come here from out of town.  I liked it a lot!  And I liked the good company even more. *wink wink*

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake. Just do it! 12-20-15
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee and ginger ale in cute little bottle. 12-20-15
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian margarita and whiskey sidecar. 12-20-15

gXoF2z2RFwr_KuarAeuDoQ.text: Super super disappointing dinner. I've been eating at this place since 1999. I always always always loved this place. I am a hotel concierge so when guests ask me "what's the best local restaurant off the strip?" I always have recommended Nora's.  7/6/18, I took my very lovely clients from overseas right after they landed because it was the wife's request.  I took them to Nora's twice before. The hostess was very nice and we got in on time at our reservation time. But a mins after we met the horrible server lady we knew she is not good  at all. She NEVER EVER smiled.  She was very short and didn't even suggest anything and so unfriendly. We all felt the same vibe from her that she doesn't want to take care of us and want us to leave as soon as possible. When we ask to take pics, she showed us the face that " why the hell are you asking me, I have better things to do." We all felt really unwelcomed. I have never had this bad service not even fast food places. Our white pizza was amazing as usual. The fried rice balls were amazing as well. But my favourite mussels was already not hot at all so it was not good at all. I didn't want bother her because every time she was at our table, she was not pleasant. Nobody refilled my water AT ALL all night. She didn't even offered us desert or coffee.  We wanted coffee but we really couldn't take it anymore. We really didn't want to see her unwelcomed face any longer.  This ruined my client's first night back in Vegas. I talked with a manager( Asian guy) and he said " Well, maybe she was just overwhelming. " Huh???? His eyes were looking at somewhere else entire time while I was talking to him. He made me even more upset after sharing about my experience, because I could tell he didn't care at all either. Heeven said hello to other customers while i was talking to him.  Definitely the worst experience at the Nora's since 1999. And I don't think i will not recommend this place nor going there for while. Just really horrible experience.

axmgk7twiB-MH5iZLHHLgw.text: This has become my favorite Italian restaurant! It's a pretty classy restaurant, which you won't be able to tell from the outside! Our party was however the youngest and least dressed up because it was a last minute decision as our first choice place was closed for the day. We really didn't know what to expect as it was our first time. If they didn't have a dress code, they should, because everyone else was dressed really nice and seemed like they were there for some kind of special occasion!   We came here around 6:30pm and beat the dinner rush! Didn't take us long to be seated. I really didn't know what to expect, because outside it didn't look like much, but on the inside, it was like WOW. It was really nice, there are three parts to the restaurant, the middle is where you enter, you can see some people working on the pizza boxes and such and a hostess, the right is the bar area with a lot of seating and the restrooms are located there. The left was the main dinning area where we were seated.   The restaurant is family owned which opened in 1991 (the menu had a bit of history on it when you first open it). With the yelp check-in you get a complimentary glass of wine, with any order. Which it came in a decanter (see picture) and they pour some of it into your glass after they place it on the table.   It took us quite a while to order, well myself really, the guys already knew what they wanted. When we finally ordered, it took a while for the food to come out, but when it came out it was HOT, fresh hot out of the oven / stove. Out of our group we had the Rigatoni special, Crazy Alfredo, and al la Nora. Oh we also got a small basket of garlic bread, which the first one is free, and if you wanted more it was about $2.50 (I'll confirm again next time I go).   The Rigatoni special contained sausage, meatballs, onions, pepper, in a tomato sauce, it was very good. Everything was cooked very well and contained a lot of flavor in the meats. I really enjoyed it and it filled me up fast. Though I felt there was more meat than there was pasta, for some this is a good thing, but for myself it isn't. I would still recommend it!   The crazy alfredo contained both meat and seafood, which looked good, but I didn't get to try it. And the al la Nora was a baked dish containing spaghetti, eggplant, beef, tomato sauce, and some others ingredients (I don't remember all of them) which my other friend enjoyed.   I can't wait to go back and try one of their pizzas!!

8JXter14cc4NRe95A-CWxw.text: If you are in Las Vegas, you must stop here!  We ate here last June and are eating there again this upcoming Sunday.  I am disappointed in myself for not remembering to write this review sooner.  The food, atmosphere, wine selection, and prices are crazy low when you you think about what you spend when staying on the strip.  This has become a staple for my company when we are here on business.   From the exterior a Non-Local would not think much of the restaurant because it is located in strip mall.  HOWEVER, trust me when I say this is probably some of the best Italian food in the Las Vegas Area.    The Chicken Mt. Etna was unlike anything I have ever had (and I live just outside of NYC).

_-5uy43uBqqCFvUInXbN8A.text: The decor was nice, our server Will had a very handsome beard and a keen wit, though he was a bit tall for my tastes.  He drew a robot on my wife's to go bag (because the dishes are so large and she likes robots), which I really saw as going the extra mile to ensure guest satisfaction. The bartenders didn't seem to be fans of straws but my wife pilfered one before leaving the bar for our table. Our server Will encouraged her to recycle her last straw which really showed a lot of responsibility for the earth. I could see voting for this man in the next four years, though he politely withheld his political views. He recommended the cannoli and I must say the cannoli came and kept coming. The Pinot noir was delightful with blackberry notes and a hint of old Italian leather belts, like grandpa used to wear.

NBD8aM6mlsYaP2XU_TaXJg.text: Chose this place because its my daughters name...Nora who? The food is phenomenal, atmosphere relaxing, my server Donald was top notch, absolutely loved the music playing. I will def be coming back here hopefully bring others so they can have a great meal and experience

C3BPFMDCXYdB6i3BwI_Pcw.text: Just had lunch at Nora's I decided to have the lunch pasta with meatball. The red sauce was perfect and the meatball was tender and tasty It put the place near my house to absolute shame. Service was good food was great and price was decent what more can u ask for Nora's is my go to Italian restaurant from now on and that's high praise from a NY Italian. You must try if you haven't yet.

SkWMVFywoNt6vRte-tgd8Q.text: One of my fav italian restaurants in town. This place always feels like home. Great bartenders as well especially Gaston. For special occassions we always get the back private room.

-5YNqdIOb09NP8dIn80PTA.text: The portions were fantastic, thank you. We got the lasagna, rigatoni, meatballs, etc. Salads were so big and everything was fresh. The garlic bread was great. For 8 people, it was a feast. We highly recommend this place. It made for a perfect Christmas Party at our office.

DbX3xjfdxP9eJ2k-QdhYUA.text: We have been coming to Nora's for years, but for the last two the service and feeling when dining has gone down hill.  We made reservations three weeks ahead and still were told it would be a few minutes.  30 minutes later standing in a sea of backed up guests we were now told the people at our table decided to have dessert.  What does this even mean?  We were then offered the bar or the patio.  Being our anniversary this is not acceptable.  Nora's used to be a fun place, but it seems they have gotten too big for themselves, they have stopped caring about the customers.  I guess they have enough so why be bothered.  They need some kind of actual system for reservations that works.  On New Year's this also happened but it was worse because 5 tables that had reservations after us were sat first, looked like they forgot us at the bar.  The food is definitely not worth the aggravation and other reviewers are right if something is writing they just shrug and don't care.  Bye Nora's, there are too many restaurants in Vegas to worry about this mediocre mess of a business.

L_Boh2CbMGzpG24wP5Pkag.text: It's hard to find Italian food being raised Italian, and knowing how to make the dishes from scratch. This place is the only place I go for solid Italian.   Well ran, food comes fast, Nick one of the servers is very professional.   My brother in law got an over cooked ribeye they swapped it out, and I tried a piece, and it was melt in your mouth.  5 stars, great place!

3amt5dNpN8KnckSNWILZkg.text: Food is excellent and atmosphere was excellent. The only issue I had was the lighting. The lighting was low where we were sitting, but it was romantic, I just could not read the menu from where I was sitting. The webpage does provide in detail the menu which helped for me because I knew what I was going to have before I went in.

9yOgZUS1hCaS3mm2_EQQkQ.text: We tried the new location last night, and we were very disappointed. Atmosphere was amazing and service was great. Food was a huge disappointment. Thinking we will give it another try in the future. Hoping it was just because everything is so new.

QyDzUz0hNNYDU15bNYUk9Q.text: We have been customers of Nora's for years at their previous location and always enjoyed the food and the service.  We have recommended this location to many. Our first visit to this new location will be our last. We visited at around 3pm on a Thursday. We were seated quickly and that was the last quick thing this afternoon.  I'm not going to give the details but the service was sloooooow. I had to get up to ask to get acknowledged. 1.5 hours to get out of there. Kudos to Isabell the busser who was on her job and assisted in serving us.

PwASC96-kRx6AuMzMaOHRg.text: New location and building, same great service and food! The crazy alfredo is my go-to dish every time. Happy to see the new spot packed as usual. Well done!!

kfU5Hqjc5lKQGcYWb-VPvA.text: Fantastic local, authentic Italian restaurant. It gets really busy so wait staff can't be very attentive but the food and drinks are great. Free cannoli on my anniversary really made our evening. Try the wild boar pasta if it's available.

1BdIjcmdKurZLNRXoVLuGg.text: I have been here many times. Always consider it as treating myself when ever I come here.  Have no complaints.  Sometimes I come back the very next day.  Don't bother ordering the steak.  Isn't worth it.  But everything else is amazing.

KH-RMkw_k21Ztw5YXBVuSw.text: In the top 5 Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  We have been going here for years and never are we disappointed.  Good wine selection, great food. We only wish they had a Henderson location.

mD3W03eh1FHRYsFjdPap1A.text: I have eating here several times and enjoyed it every time. The food is fresh, the service is professional and friendly and the prices much cheaper than any Italian place you'll find on the Strip.

07wnd5frUJvFgmCVgRmGRA.text: Dollar for dollar, the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Sometimes crowded and sometimes noisy, but mostly weekend nights. Lunch is most suitable for business. Even the bar is a fun place to sidle up to for a glass of Tuscan red. Make reservations.

hfC3IIdS8yPNNY066OyDWA.text: Always good !  Tried the pizza for the first time - excellent!!!  The only problem was no room for all of my angel hair and vodka sauce. It is packed every evening so make a reservation or be ready to wait.

NTq26WLNUxlcrZgasQhYXQ.text: My Favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, everything is great. Prices are awesome.

mssp3Y80ij8G3wODo1WRSA.text: This is by far the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! I've been going here for years and never disappointed. Many colleagues that I have brought here make sure they stop when they are in town. It's really more of a Sicilian type food. My favorites are the crazy Alfredo, and Osso Buco. I've even had a great ribeye there but the right chef needs to be there. Try this place and it'll become your favorite.    Reservations are highly recommended!

2oR6BX9xlK5jg5Fh4C5ChA.text: We've been going to Nora's for over 20 years.  We've watched them expand...then expand again.  I absolutely love the new place and the new decor...very classy...yet some old school Italian touches...with a bit of Nora's history.    Nora's food is consistently delicious. We've tried practically everything on the menu.  The lunch menu is very good too.  The food is always fresh and the service polite.  This is a sure thing for great food at a fair price.

YtxV_YNhRTnUhLcpLFOXxw.text: Def was not impressed here at all.   We sat in some weird side room with really bad lighting and like 4 tables total. The rest of the restaurant was lively and busy and had live music, nice decor and was decorated for Christmas. But for some reason, this room seemed like a late addition that might be used for private parties but had no ambiance. Totally underwhelming and odd that the restaurant wouldn't follow through with the same design in this other room.   The service was whatever and the food was mediocre. The appetizers were good but the gnocchi with vodka sauce was 17.50 and wasn't anything special. My husband enjoyed his pasta, but not enough to return.   I've wanted to come to this location for a while but hadn't had the chance. And now that we tried it, I think there's way better places. And I'm sure sitting in that lame little room was a factor.

8w49y8bS23PhgnLEGDDbIQ.text: We were vacationing in Las Vegas and were invited to dinner by our good friends that live there. I was interested because the restaurant has the same name as me.   It was a short drive from the Las Vegas Strip. Our GPS alerted us that we had arrived. There was plenty of parking for a 7:00 PM reservation on a Sunday evening.   We walked in and it was bustling with people. Our friends had already arrived and the host seated us immediately. The table was in a separate room where we could see the Main dinning room through the big glass windows. You could probably have a nice private event or special occasion in that room. It's a beautiful space.  The beverage menu had specialty cocktails with detailed descriptions. The mixologist really put a lot of thought into those selections but I went with the well vodka which I was told was Titos. Hey I was very happy with that. Everyone else chose there beverage of choice.   We started off with the tender grilled octopus appetizer and a lovely hand tossed Cesar salad. That and 2 cocktails were filling me up so I ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer as my entree. The other entree selections on our table were ossobuca, frutti di mare, and chicken marsala. Everything was very tasty, not over cooked and well presented. We finished the evening by the four of us sharing a light tiramisu for dessert.   The staff was very attentive, professional and efficient. The decor was dark wood with beautiful big windows and etched glass. Very beautiful!

k2EsOF0XJm6kfBD-RfQy_Q.text: Delicious food.beautiful outside scenery and seating area. My boyfriend and I went there randomly and we were considered dressed down.If you plan to visit this place dress up a little.It is very classy and elegant.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon drop cocktail

hFch7FXwLn-LlrqyjBUMXQ.text: Wow. Came for the branzino, but even the house garlic bread was impressive. Hot, buttery and toasted to perfection. I've driven by this place for years and we finally decided to give it a try after we had heard they had great branzino at a decent price. Anthony was our server and he was on point. He even offered to help filet my wife's sea bass if she was uncomfortable with all the hidden bones. The cocktails were amazing and the wine list was pretty impressive. The ambiance is nice and casual. We will definitely be stopping back by. I gotta try the chocolate cake!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aAMgSMDIFN4N7gc7EySUXw.text: I'm so glad we finally got to try this place. Great customer service from the hostess to our waiter and servers. Food was just as good as I imagined it to be. From the salad to the main course to the dessert. I ordered the Salmon Carciofi. So delicious! I highly recommend if you like capers and artichoke because there's a lot of it. Everyone in my party ordered something that they all loved as well. You can tell the pasta and all ingredients are fresh because none of us had that gross bloated feeling that most pasta do!   Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone!

ZPmmMylX4synZAQkXYazwA.text: I love this restaurant !  I had a good time and me and my husbands tummy were happy .  Our waiter was nice and kind !! Other all stuff were also nice and every body worked hard   I definitely wanna come back and try other dishes !!  Thank u

HaMoUSaCC2C-WUfcn2nYog.text: Catered retirement lunch! The sausages, vodka penne pasta and eggplant parm were all delicious, as well as the green salads!

2dIcdF17HKnH4drnuvRHjQ.text: I'm giving 4 stars mainly because we've been to Nora's before and had fabulous dinners. My bday dinner last night, was worth 3 stars, unfortunately.  We ordered some calamari and bruschetta for appetizers. Gold stars there! Then main course comes.  I had frutti di mare which was outstanding!!! My son ordered a small pizza (it's the size of a medium at other pizza places). The husband and other son both ordered chicken marsala, which comes with a side of spaghetti and tomato sauce. There were 4 small pieces of chicken on a huge plate, which was NOT cleaned, meaning splashes of the sauce were all over the plate. The tomato sauce tasted like it was out of a can and not Nora's delicious sauce that we liked in the past. The marsala sauce, we felt, was not cooked out enough. I don't know, it could just be an "off night" for the marsala entrees. My son and husband ate the chicken and some of the noodles but it just wasn't the same dinners we had before.  The reason we came was for my birthday and when we made reservations, this was specified. The girl taking the reservation said they will do something special. I said, 'Wonderful!". Long story short, I didn't get anything extra. No scoop of ice cream or anyone singing me happy birthday. Maybe things have changed since the last time we came but it's little things like that which make people want to come celebrate special occasions there.  **Yes you'll see I've only checked in here once because this is the first time I'm here since joining Yelp. We've come to Nora's numerous times when they were at their old location, off of Jones..

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign outside

P_xRQYQL9Ez2l7esIFaRAQ.text: They used to have a much smaller location like a minute down the road.  Honestly kinda miss that place.  But the "new" location is very nice and classy.  Service has always been on point each time I've been there.    I'm a creature of habit.   I basically get the same thing every time.  They start you off with garlic bread which hits the spot soooo hard.   Love it, plus it's complimentary.  And I know it's just garlic bread, but damn it's tasty.     Next I split the truffle fries ($5.50) which whomever I happen to be eating with.   The sauce the give you is delicious and I always have to ask for a bonus sauce.    For the main course it's either the cannelloni with ricotta and spinach or baked ziti (they use a different kind of noodle but basically same stuff).  Both are really good.   This place Is very borderline 5 stars.  Love me some noras.   Prices are reasonable and portions are solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you don&#39;t get the truffle fries, you aren&#39;t really living.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary garlic bread.

DlZdtr2da8NaNSbmpkcaDw.text: Nora's is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. It caters to an older crowd but the decor is very modern and sophisticated. There's always a wait so either snag a set at the bar or make reservations.   I've come here multiple times and get pasta every time. Their penne with vodka sauce is delicious and creamy. The pesto is very rich but a whole bowl of it can be too much. Their wild boar perpedelle is also wonderful but sometimes can be on the saltier side.   My favorites are the pasta all Nora ( basically spaghetti bolognese with eggplant) and their rigatoni special but I sub the tomato sauce with vodka sauce for a creamier richer taste.     They also offer complimentary garlic bread to go with your meal and the garlic bread is delicious. Sometimes I'm guilty of filling up on that too quickly but thats ok because I'll have leftover pasta for the next day!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar seating

JkJrApSFQL8yOLo04HOcdQ.text: Decor - 4 star Food - 2 star Service - 4 star Satisfaction - 3 star Wait time - 4 star Price - 3 star  The restaurant is very clean and the service is very good from our experience.  We had a large party of 12 and the waiters and busser were attentive to our needs.  This is my 3rd visit to this restaurant.  I have ordered the rib eye twice.  I was not impressed with the rib eye on my previous visit but wanted to try it again to give them the benefit of doubt.  This last visit I ordered the rib eye medium-rare.  When I cut into the rib eye there no pink it was more medium-well to well.  For $35 I expect it prepared the way I request it.

IVMK3OcG--ov5zHG17crHw.text: Came here with family and shared a couple appetizers (caprese and truffle fries) and I ordered the shrimp scampi. My drink was fantastic and quite strong. The scampi was ok but not my favorite. It was a busy restaurant and a fun atmosphere. As an out of towner, it was a nice place to visit with family.

seYfShReQLekRz4AOi-vqQ.text: Nora's has become a major disappointment.  This used to be among my favorite restaurants in the city and ever since the move to the new location it has not been the same.  Especially the past few times I went.  The vegetables and salad dressing were extremely oily.  The sauce to the chicken marsala is good but doesn't taste as good as it used to. The pizza was downright awful the last time we tried it.  On a positive note the garlic bread is still amazing.  Every couple of months I venture back hoping it goes back to how it used to be but I am about ready to throw in the towel.  It's just not worth the price for what has become very average dining.

-0qpniX2YEYlm07astmP7w.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas! Nice atmosphere and good service. Beautiful bar and great bartender! Nice place for birthday parties ect,,

NPZT7oLJyfiBUVwd5cKKtA.text: I love this place best food ever. But really upset they don't have Diet Coke or Diet Pepsi anymore.

6ntz6jEv39W93QMMyIlOmg.text: Great food and unbelievable service from Jessika. I had the Canneloni and my server recommended the meat sauce which was the perfect blend of tomato and meat. The cheese was great and the texture exacting. My wife had the Melrose, it was also excellent. The atmosphere was great. The music was a little loud but not too bad. The best part which is hard to say was the service from Jessika. She was super friendly, conversational, informative, educated on the wine/dinner menu and made great recommendations. No need to eat on the strip if you want fantastic Italian food. Come to Nora's I will be back for sure the next time I am in Vegas. I would say if we were in Chicago I would have a tough time  choosing between Rosebuds and here.

betTItQZlqOBYbQBDRrBbA.text: Where to start , we arrived on time at 8.15pm gave our name to  the hostess she said nothing and turned to two other girls behind the desk and started chatting amongst themselves , we asked for a table outside it is now 835 we have waitefd for 20 minutes ,to be seated .The waiter was very nice, my husband and I both ordered I asked the waiter does the salmon piccata come with any sides he said no it's just on a bed of spinach I said is there any chance I could just get a little plain pasta on the side he said sure we received a meal and I was charged $9.50 for a very small side of spaghetti with nothing on it except olive oil and garlic . upon receiving the bill and seeing the extra charge of 950 for spaghetti with nothing on it we were pretty shocked there are dishes on the menu with a side of spaghetti so I assumed that my dinner would also come with a side of spaghetti .  We asked to speak to the manager just because of the principle of the fact ,she came to the table she looked like she had slept in her clothes and said to us what do you need we explain the situation and she said I don't make the price its Miss Nora and I said do you not think that's a little excessive to asked for some spaghetti to be with the chicken piccata and she said I don't make the prices it's Miss Nora but if you want I can take it off I said that's not the point the point is my husband paid $16 for his meal linguine with clams  And I was being charged $9.50 for a small side of spaghetti with olive oil. We have been eating at Noras for at least 10 years and I am here for the magic show and my husband joined me for the weekend this is not the same restaurant I'm not sure if the owners sold it to this new company but it used to be very family oriented and the people that worked at the restaurant were fabulous now the restaurant is being run by a group of 20 year olds including the managers go  does not have a clue. What happened in Nora?  We will not be returning

2L9hSZRy1s5d04raHQzdcg.text: I've been going to Nora's for 25 years and have watched him progressed from a tiny little room with approximately eight tables to the Beautiful restaurant they have now in Flamjngo Ave. The food is always excellent and consistent and they have an excellent selection of wines. When you can not only survive but thrive in Las Vegas as a restaurant for over 25 years, you must be doing a whole lot right! And Nora's does every night.   After nine months of being open in their new place I finally tried it out on a Tuesday night and to my delight I had to wait. On Tuesday! Like I said they must be doing something right

YPpcfjIRWCi0HKYer7IIgQ.text: Great food at reasonable prices. Finally they moved down the street to a much needed bigger location.

Bm6d5SX1Eleml_-F4_DSZA.text: Have been there 3 times for business dinner and consistently good food and service.   Usually get the salmon n pasta.  Always great.   Atmosphere good and always packed.  Great place to get a great dinner or lunch.

gk2nchQYSN-RVryufgqtMg.text: Absolutely incredible!  This place was so good.  Crazy Alfredo was probably the best Alfredo I have ever had and had a nice kick.  Totally full of flavor and load with chicken shrimp sausage sun dried tomatoes and other stuff that brings it all together.  The marinara sauce was really good as well.  Garlic beard come right out of the pizza over and the Caprese was a good way to start the meal.  They have an Orchard mule seasonal cocktail was so outstanding complements the start of fall perfectly.

W2BZ5Vg3xrzkiIEm1XQ_hQ.text: This restaurant was amazing!!!  We had Chicken Marsala, Melrose Pesti, Alla Nora, Cannelloni....  Every single bit of food was amazing!!  We had drinks and recommend the Italian Mule and the Il Fragolino... Also amazing!!!  Ambiance was beautiful.  Waiting staff was attentive and friendly. Best start to our Vegas trip for a 21st birthday!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

63t59itWmNxJVImU1bpW2w.text: Steak and arugula bruschetta, Tigers blood cocktail (not available last visit), Rigatoni special.  Excellent musical choices to round out the atmosphere!  The ambiance here is amazing.  We always sit in the dining room where the bar is located as opposed to the seating area located where the kitchen is or the far side.  The food is absolutely delicious.  On our first trip here, near the end of the meal we were approached by a lifelong New Yorker who had moved to Las Vegas later in life and had NOT found an Italian restaurant worthy of frequenting UNTIL this day.  He asked us if we enjoyed our food and of course we did!  He then told us this was the only Italian restaurant worthy of a New Yorker.

PZU23rprbRZyJ6bCUuC32A.text: Highly suggested italian place to go to when asked among people on yelp and friends. So decided to try this one day when trying to decide what was for dinner.   Located on the north side of flamingo, a little east of jones, came here on a Friday Night around 630 PM. The place was pretty full but luckily i guess we got there before the dinner rush so we got our table pretty quick.   A LITTLE NOTE : uhh i think this place may have or rather should have some sort of dress code... i think we were the most underdressed table in the entire restaurant.. me and my friend were ok but my other friend had a bright blue t shirt.. lol uhh id suggest to dress a little nicer for this place...   The restaurant is family owned. opened since 1991 starting with 12 seats ! quite expanded since then.. restaurant decorated with family pictures i believe which is nice.   We were greeted by the server and got our drinks pretty quick. We had noticed that with a check in on yelp, you get a complimentary glass of wine :D   After we ordered, it took a little while before the food came and we were starving.. they gave us some Garlic Bread which the first batch was free, but if u wanted more, i dont remember it being that expensive. It was yummy ! pretty much pieces you'd see if you split a loaf of french bread in half, baked it, and cut it into 1-2" pieces down the split loaf. it was slightly baked.. I LOVE GARLIC BREAD ! their's still had a soft center with the exterior crust still being crunchy but not hard no wont pierce the inside of your mouth.   When the food came... its was piping HOT !! i had the alla nora myself. which was a baked spaghetti with eggplants, ground beef, pesto, tomato sauce and cheeses. When i "broke through" the top, oh man there was a lot of steam ! not complaining ! very good thing that i rarely experience ! all the ingredients were fresh and seasoned well. egg plants were slightly fried but not over fried so still quite juicy and moist but soft. tomato sauce was fresh and delicious. sweet, tangy but savory?   My friends had the rigatoni special and the crazy alfredo. i didnt really get to try either of them but im pretty sure you'd find a nice review on here somewhere. I tasted the veggies of the rigatoni special. Very fresh and sweet. Not overcooked so they still had a nice bite to it. The crazy alfredo looked delicious. Packed with various ingredients all with a creamy alfredo sauce ! i wanna get that next time !   But all in all.. great place.. highly suggested. reservations are available if needed. would suggest to all who ask and take more here :D

N8-usBTqcw6xPVPYTxe0JA.text: Cucina italiana and great customer service! Food was amazing! Bartender was really nice! Highly recommend this restaurant! Will be back again!

9rk-RAizLcYjc6vgdWP0vg.text: Last day in Vegas so figured that Vegas has a lot of good Italian since there not much back home. Through yelp, found this place. Gave it a try. It was lunch hour when we arrived so the restaurant was busy. We had spaghetti meatballs, rigatoni and I ordered crazy alfredo. While waiting for our order we were served with garlic breads. It was unusual as it was the first. Normally restaurants would give you a plain bread with butter or some kind of dipping while waiting.  Loved loved the garlic breads. It was cut into a bite sized and it was yummy and crispy. Not long afterwards came our menu. Mine sure look a lot lol...it's crazy alfredo with chicken, bell peppers, shrimp minus the sausage. It was rich and creamy...gosh....I'm in pasta heaven...it sure a class of its own. Kudos for the chef who cooked my yummy pasta. Halfway I was full but I know I gotta finish and savor it as I won't be able to taste it again in the near future. So I made it and licked the plate clean. Before we left we ordered cannoli. It's been a while since we had it in New York and yeah a big giant cannoli answered our prayer. It was filled with chocolate chips on one side and pistachios on the other. It was enough to fill all of us. Yeah...we left with a full belly and happy smiles Thank you Vegas for the great food we had it beat all that expensive buffets that being served everywhere in those casinos esp bellagio. They got a very bland Asian dishes. Only good for steak and desserts...urrgghhh...

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy alfredo. Must try. Very yummmmmyyyy....

XA5WY7G2CDh1wKLloX_6Vg.text: I have been coming to Nora's for probably the past 15 plus years and have never had a bad experience. Glad they opened the new larger location, but reservations are still highly recommended no matter what day of the week it is. I love the caprese and antipasto salads. For pasta, the Alla Nora is probably one of my favorites. And their specialty cocktails are amazing! They also have gluten free penne pasta. Nora's is my happy place!

myY5hs7v1wBafQFju8IdWg.text: This place was a breath of fresh air, and in Vegas, you can use all the fresh air you can get.  Imagine my surprise when after paying $20 for a burger and fries on the Strip (shame on you, Smash Burger), I treated myself to a first real veal parm dinner for $18.95 at Nora's. And it was pretty damn good, too.  The veal was cooked perfectly, and it came with a side of spaghetti, cooked al dente.  Perfect.  The sauce was not the best I ever had, but then again, I was not cooking it in the kitchen myself.  Making matters better, the basket of garlic bread was never allowed to run dry, nor was my iced tea.  The service was fantastic and pleasant.  Smiles all around.    The short lesson here is that if you are willing to move a few miles off the strip, you end up in a different, and much better food universe.  I would go back to Nora's in a nanosecond.

5FdQNdjc5E5HEf5d4AbJKA.text: Since I last reviewed Nora's two months ago, I have been here twice more, and each time it just gets better and better.  Wonderful food smells of pizza and other Italian delicacies strike one's nostrils as soon as the front door is opened; the friendly service has remained generally excellent regardless who I was served by; and the food has continued to be piping hot and always delicious.  I now realize that the Veal Parmigiana is as good and tender as the Veal Marsala; the Garlic Bread is consistently delectable (my group of 4 polished off 2 baskets); and the Chicken Soup is on the same high plane as the homemade Pasta Fagioli.  On my latest foray I enjoyed Antipasto Salad, and could barely finish half of it.  I look forward to eating the remainder later at lunch today.  Topped by chunks of fresh Mozzarella Cheese, folded over curls of tasty ham mixed with leafy greens, ripe wedges of red tomato, black olives, pepperoncini, and more, all coated with a dripping light Italian Dressing, beckon.  The Chicken Soup, which I was smart enough to order as a bowl rather than a cup, contained thin lengths of chicken just as I preferred, mixed with cooked celery and pieces of tomato, swimming in a hot, very tasty chicken broth.  It took many tablespoonfuls for me to finish it all, and almost ruined my appetite.  But not quite!  With considerable effort I also finished off a large cheesy and tomato sauce-covered medallion of Veal Parmigiana accompanied by smoking Spaghetti Bolognese with mushrooms added, as I had decreed.  Diane got a requested bowl of extra Alfredo Sauce to ladle over her Veal and Penne Alfredo at no extra charge.  Here one can have whatever the tummy desires!  For good reason, Nora's will remain one of my several fine, go-to Italian restaurants in Vegas!

I didn't see my Gnocchi on the meu, but when I had asked the waitress they were able to whip up some Gnocchi with creamy pesto sauce and I was more than thrilled with the taste! We will be coming back very soon!

blJIn2eOKeK9ErvynmE0kQ.text: I work at the tattoo shop across the way, and although I've never actually dined within the restaurant, I order pick-up every now & then.The woman on the other end of the line is always so sweet & helpful when I call, and because my "usual" (angel hair w/ creamy pesto) is attached to my name + phone number, placing an order is a breeze.  It's usually a 25-35 minute wait, which is totally cool with me, I know how busy it gets around dinner time... For real though, this place is always hoppin' with hungry folks! gMMUh2tFvgEqYzLRDSlyAg.text: Amazing!! It was already crazy at 5:45 on a Tuesday, so make sure you have a reservation! We had a drink at the bar while we waited. My pour of wine was generous and Hub's mojito was delicious.   We started with bruschetta pomodoro and arancini. Both were delicious! The arancini were crisp, but not greasy and came out to the table piping hot. For our mains, Hubs had gnocchi ala vodka which he enjoyed. I had pasta carbonara, which was prepared a bit differently than classic carbonara, but was delicious!! The pasta was nice and al dente, which is always appreciated.   One of the things that impressed me on top of the delicious food was how well run this place was. They have quite a large staff. Hosts/hostesses/servers/bussers/food runners. Everyone was on top of their respected positions and everyone worked effortlessly together. A very well oiled machine, management should be very proud of how flawlessly the staff here executes. I will definitely recommend Nora's to anyone finding the self in Vegas.

QVP3MieIywwujgZFtFw1_Q.text: Great food! Amazing service! I was here a month ago we sat in the dining room which was not the vibe we're feeling sitting at the bar... super casual yet elegant... Michelle (bartender) personable, engaging, funny and very attentive...  Coming back for sure ..and definitely sitting at the bar!

n5WNTqhq4A0i_zQ1TDs5zQ.text: I used to come here ALL the time when I lived in the city, it was THE best low-key Italian restaurant off-strip. When I visited recently with two friends I had been raving to about Nora's for months, we were all super-disappointed. Sad to say, the service has gone supremely downhill over the last few years. We arrived and waited at the bar for our reservation. Then they sat us at a table in the bar, DIRECTLY next to the stage. It took practically years for us to get any water, then the musicians started filtering in. A tip jar was set up literally in FRONT of our table. My friend complained to the server about moving tables and was given a flat-out refusal. I then went to the hostess and complained, and we were moved to a spot next to the kitchen. The food took about an hour and a half to get to us and we were practically begging for water from anyone who walked by. Food was ok, I've definitely had better, and I don't think I will be back :'(

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y6Zfc_5Gii-CrUX2wlohzQ.text: I was excited to try this place because it's Liana's favorite Italian place when she lived in Las Vegas, so Dennis, Liana and I made a trip to Nora's before our flight out of Vegas. I usually review a place mostly for its food quality, but Nora lost a star due to its extraordinarily bad service.   Let's start with the food first: 1) Pomodoro Bruchetta (3 stars) - but unless you're hankering for it, I say skip it... for tomatoes on toast, it's not worthy $7. 2) Truffle fries (4 stars) - very truffly, crunchy and delicious, but over the top salty. 3) Garlic bread (3 stars) - not bad, not great... it was made better by olive oil 4) Alla Nora (3 stars) - the eggplant was really dry, crunchy, bordering on hard to chew. The meat sauce had good flavors, but the spaghetti is also crunchy and dried out on the edges.   5) Primavera (4 stars) - it's like a garden exploded on a plate. It's good, but after half of the plate the oils felt over powering. 6) Pappardelle with Wild Boar - not sure, since I didn't get to taste this dish, nor did we have a discussion about it... Dennis finished it, so it can't be bad.   The pages of the menu were a bit sticky, that should have been our first warning, but one never really think of such things when your tired butt hits the seat. The bar service was actually reasonably good, other than the placemats being wet. We wanted to sit at a table, so as soon as one became available, we switched over. The first napkin was a bit dingy in one corner, but once reseated, there was a second set of napkin/silverwear combo, so I didn't say anything. My bread plate was coated with a thin layer of grease and a chunk of dried food on one side - had to ask for another one. Within 5 minutes of sitting down, we realize we were against the stage where the band (arriving in at this moment) will be playing. After being brushed behind the head with the cello, I got up to the hostess and asked to be reseated. She looked me straight in the eye and said "no - the table that's available is already taken." BY WHO? No one was there.   No apology.   I return to the table and me and my table mates sat stunned for about 5 minutes. At which point a man walks over and pulls a chair from our table and set up a tip jar right at our table. Liana about flipped out, and got up once again to request a table switch... this time asking a different hostess, and probably raising her tone slightly.   We were reseated in the kitchen area with annoyance from the staff.   Again, no apology.   We had no water refills for 15 to 20 minutes and while the bus girl was responsive when we were able to flag her down, we were already rather displeased. The food was abysmally slow.   Seriously, I am so irritated typing this review that I want to give them just one star, but I'm being judicious.   I would not come back and I would recommend you don't go at all.

3pB4H7zJbEe7B0jf2FEjFQ.text: Really 2.5 stars  Very disappointed. It's been a while since we ate at Nora's. Used to be regulars. Food is not the same as it used to be. Sauce was bland. Marsala was salty. The anti pasta salad is still very good. Ravioli could have been better.    The service was mediocre. Never came to refill water. Very slow.  We had to ask to get dessert.

2ROui8txqa-3N-dkwQuVJQ.text: Not my neck of the woods but glad we came. Eggplant parm was good, not too soggy. The husband got spaghetti with meatballs. The food was just okay but I would never order from this restaurant again.

R19ehB_EbBAs5DHfmotpww.text: All that and more.... Ask for: Kara!  Outstanding waitress.  Seriously.  She killed it.   We've been waiting for months to go to the new location on W. Flamingo. Now the food is really good. My boyfriend and I ordered a medium (16') white spinach pizza with shrimp on top and the crazy alfredo pasta. I've never had such an amazing white pizza!   Everything was delicious and it was big portions. We shared our food and didn't even get to finish. I'm so excited to come back and try the other things on the menu!!

_K5KaiLg5_mRSuBF1V8hcQ.text: Our server Matthew was amazing! Great service and food! We will be back soon. Thank you!

4RYActTHmF5WU8xlDcbiuQ.text: My friend recommended Nora's for dinner this past Sunday night and I was impressed.  Highlights: - Large portion sizes. I got the rigatoni special with sausage, peppers, onions in a spicy tomato sauce. It was delicious and probably enough for a lunch portion the next day. - Complimentary Garlic Bread. Not only is it complimentary, this garlic bread is delicious. Could not stop eating this. - Prices were very reasonable in the $15-20 range. Definitely a Vegas Italian restaurant locals can go to on a weekly basis. - Pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and had a great bite to it.  - Calamari was really good. Portion size was larger than I expected for a seafood appetizer. - Plenty of parking out front. However, this place gets packed quickly. - Make a Reservation. Expect to wait 15 minutes after your reservation on busy nights.  - Good Music. They had a few string musicians on Sunday night and it was a great complement to the food. Appreciated that.   Overall, would definitely head back to this next time I'm in Las Vegas.

qO8ayqTfvfAV16VdaXOCNg.text: Came here with a friend the other night for dinner and had a very pleasant experience overall.  Ambience-- Upon entering, I felt as if I left Las Vegas and was teleported to 1950s Manhattan. Very classy and cozy.  Service-- Service was on point. Our waiter was attentive but not overly so. Water and wine glasses were never left empty until we were done.  Food-- Normally, I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but damn does Nora's make me want to change my mind. The shrimp scampi I had was flavorful and generously portioned. The shrimp itself were cooked just right and also very large and plump! My friend's veal marsala had great flavor to it as well. The highlight was probably the juicy, crispy amazing garlic bread. Wish I could have some right now!  Nora's is a great local spot that is suitable for families, friends, and especially dates. Too bad it closes so early!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi on deck!

27ubN1EMvdWidUs_79QIaw.text: First time here for us ~ and most likely we won't be returning~As its a bit of a drive for us and we just didn't enjoy the food that much.    It's a nice, diverse Italian menu and none of the 4 of us ordered the specials so that could have been the issue. The Arranchinis were pretty good but I couldn't recommend Nora's based on our experience     They are in the process of building a large new restaurant about 2 blocks away so we obviously have missed something ~ the 2 stars were for the cocktail which were quite good and our server was knowledgeable & pleasant.

jHgwlMPd0cPDJQpliykRww.text: Love this place! Get the linguine and clams. The garlic bread is delicious too.

LWRDUqhWKDf4uwpDi976eA.text: Good, NOT Great. NONE of the pastas are fresh. Too bad. This would set Noras apart from average. If you REALLY want to be recognized as one of the best Italian restaurants, MAKE FRESH PASTA. The "boxed", processed pasta noodles renders the prices a bit high for average pasta dishes. Furthermore, my dish was completely over-sauced. The creamy pesto sauce, while tasty, had my pasta drowning in sauce, rendering the dish not as great as it should be. My dinner partner had Carbonara. Be warned this is NOT a traditional Carbonara (alfredo sauce - really!?), so the dish was a let down.  And yes, the pasta was a bit "gummy" (no, not al dente either), on both dishes. The fried calamari app was excellent. The gratis garlic bread wonderful. Service was good, not great, as the restaurant was very busy during holiday season.  You know you are going to be packed, so why didnt management staff properly!? We waited forever for our dishes.  Lastly, the "pre-order" chocolate cake dessert was nothing special and our table wondered why the hoopla over pre-ordering it? Its not that worthy. All in all, Noras is just OK for a local, neighborhood place. Because of a recent rebuild, of course it is a wondrrful atmosphere. Yet, the final disappointment, was in the fact, when we inquired, that we were also hoping for a nice happy hour offering, with cocktail and appetizer, and pizza specials at the bar area. Noras offers none. What a missed opportunity, Noras! Would we go again? Being unmemorable, not so sure. You may have been great before your move / expansion, but your newness may have blinded your ability to be what you once were. There are many, many better, neighborhood, off-strip, family-owned, Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. This is just a "maybe" place. You CAN (and should) do better, Noras.

HPnPFa_A49k0TIuoxYH8Fw.text: This eatery is always consistent, genuine service and always a delight when having lunch or dinner here. This Italian restaurant crafts their dishes with fine ingredients and simplicity.  Each appetizer, entree and dessert is admirable and all the dishes are perfection.  One of my staples is the Arancini, on occasion I've had two orders and made that my entree:)

_LVhx8WxIP_mNLDZZo9ztg.text: My best friend requested two things for her birthday: 1) To be surrounded by her friends & 2) To eat at Nora's. Luckily (for me) she got both!   This was my first experience at Nora's, and WOW just isn't a big enough word to describe it.   Employees? Fun, playful, attentive, offer their recommendations on menu items. Atmosphere? Clean, dimly lit for great ambiance, colorful, busy (it was packeddd on a Thursday night, yet the room didn't feel crowded or chaotic.) Food? Not just the best Italian food I've ever eaten, but some of the best FOOD I've ever eaten in general! Wine selection was great. Appetizers were hardy. All menu items were not outrageously priced (as you would expect them to be for a meal of this quantity AND quality.)   Yes. Just, yes. Go now. I highly recommended it.  If there is a line, wait. I promise it'll be worth it.

CcFGACwS4PlFBOd4nxmKPw.text: Went in for lunch this past Monday y to celebrate a friends birthday. The food was pretty bad. The pasta in linguini with clams was way under cooked and I just about broke a tooth with a clam shell. My friend sent back her veal, it was so sugary sweet. The replaced her dish with a tasteless eggplant. My friends husband asked her to bring him octopus do she orders it to go. When she got home all she saw in her to go box with 4 little pieces of octopus with an old looking wilted salad. She paid $20.00 for that to go dish. I called the restaurant to speak to the manger he was unavailable so I left a message. He hasn't returned my call. We were very disappointed.

fOLiAucPAq_hc18okSs9_Q.text: Exceptional drinks and food!! Service is always great!! Not very expensive for the quality of food you get and the type of restaurant it is! Highly recommend this place for a casual date night dinner!!

n3A2X6HVf6_q3b-jc4xiJw.text: I have been to this restaurant twice and both times I was pleased with the food. The first time the service was a little slow, but the second time was great. My biggest complaint (and it might just be me) is the restaurant is a little noisy.

4Ju0BWFDmMHjM81b-y60rg.text: Flavorful Italian food, beautiful atmosphere. Definitely make reservations for a Saturday night. We opted for dining on the patio in order to get seated immediately and the staff was so accommodating by making sure the heat lamps were all on. Our waiter Nick and busser Anthony were the best part of our experience. Impeccable and personable service from start to finish. Definitely left smiling and will recommend Nora's.
