4ov4n0msmUxc0IPkJT6l3A.text: Absolutely awful.  I've heard nothing by great things about Nora's so was excited to finally eat here.  First off the parking is terrible, had to circle the lot a few times to find a space.  The garlic bread was amazing (only reason for even one star).  Next we got the rice balls, they were served cold and the rice wasn't cooked.  I ordered the Chicken Parm, I noticed it had a funny taste.  There was no way I could eat it so I sent it back, I asked the waitress if they put fennel in it and she said no, they put mint in the breadcrumbs.  I have never in my life had Chicken Parm with mint.  The ordered the Chicken Marsala, and again, not your normal Marsala, it was very sweet and the sauce thick, tasted more like molasses than Marsala.  Needless to say, we won't be back.

K6juQODLv31ObNweIHD-oA.text: Awesome food, VERY difficult to get in to. Generally when I get home on Friday night at 6:00pm, we still have to wait until 8:30 to get a table. However, definitely worth it. Last time I had baked rigatoni something or other- ah-mazing. And the canolis...mmm.

CuGjTYJsoPuNqFqHGXFINw.text: Anthony @ the bar is amazing!!!  Gotta try his Milagro peno martini! Well that and everything else we tried.  Good vibes, good food food, great drinks, great service!!!  I'll be back.

f7E1C4q1pLqOMsjmfynifw.text: Love this place. I go to Las Vegas quarterly for business and eat here every time.

jXpge7Z27nqm0iAY3AGOUw.text: Don't get there often enough! Food is wonderful, wine too!! LOVE their spinach/farro salad.

nJu2SQsPQRIyLkfTMLmQjQ.text: Whenever I'm headed out to lunch with coworkers/vendors, and people are in the mood for Italian, two places come up as suggestions: Pasta Mia and Nora's.  I've been to Pasta Mia quite a few times and well...whenever these decisions come up I'm always rooting for Nora's.  Now maybe it's because I grew up going to places like Olive Garden and Macaroni Grill, but for the most part I've never "craved" Italian food for the better part of my life.  Nothing against those two restaurant chains, I've had good family celebrations there, but the food never hooked me.  Well, my opinion of Italian is slowly changing after visiting Nora's repeatedly.  I started out with fettuccine, spaghetti, etc. and all those other dishes that most places serve.  What really won me over was their Melrose Pesto.  I've had pesto before at other places, and there were times were I was gagging it down.  I'd given up on the green sauce, until a coworker brought back leftovers of their Melrose Pesto at Nora's.  I ate it the next day for lunch, and immediately knew that I had to try that on my next visit.  I was able to do just that this week, and here I am anxiously waiting for my next meal there.  Also of note is the skill of the bartenders.  They make some well crafted cocktails, and outside of Downtown Cocktail Room, this is the only other place that I trust to make me an Old Fashioned.  Nora's makes it to my list of repeat eats.

S0PgefwrV-RM3u_FGqBwJg.text: I love Nora's.  The food is always excellent.  I work very close to this restaurant, and I would recommend going for Lunch, as the Dinner prices are a little expensive for my taste.   The restaurant is very very loud.  The service is OK, but the food is always excellent.  The Chicken Marsala is Awesome, The Chicken Carciofe is Amazing, The Baked Ziti is very rich and decadent, if you order it split it with someone, as you can't finish it due to it being so rich, but it is delicious! For a lighter fare, order the Orange Roughy lunch, it is pan seared with Oil & Garlic, and has a light crispy crust and is served with a small house salad.  If you are looking for a romantic quiet italian restaurant, Nora's is not the place.  If you are looking for a small local italian restaurant with excellent food, You will love it!

ln9H-MVT0Ri7WLOd95vkkw.text: Boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. It was AMAZING. Garlic bread was to die for and so were our dishes. I had the Rigatoni Gorgonzola and he had the veal. Both of is were satisfied. It was my first time dining at Nora's but this might be one of my fave places already.

6ryIJdZQHzOHMUuK25tSPw.text: Check-in via Yelp, and scored 1 FREE house wine! Nora's garlic bread is AHhhmazing! The "Crazy Alfredo" caught my attention! This best-seller features the classic fettucine alfredo piled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp, porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapenos! Yum! Nora's Cuisine entrees are mighty huge, one entree can serve up to 2 people!

2O2mEtnxdPffwEE-Gpg5NA.text: AMAZING!!! The Seafood Misto is a major tongue-gasim, simply scrumptious and a super satisfying split, SERIOUSLY!  It may be that I have a very fond memory, that is now associated with dinning at Nora's with my Mom.  The first time we went here over a month ago, was after we went for a consultation for a tattoo, then today, we went to get them, WoooooHooooo! They came out fabulous by the way.    Anyway back to the Misto!  Which is all we've tried, besides the salad and bread,and it is out-of-this-WORLD!   Make sure you save most of the garlic bread, to dip in the sauce of the dish, ooooooh, awwwwww, mmmmmm, I tingle all over just thinking about it, yum yum yum yummy!    OK, sorry I'm back, :-) So, we split a salad and the Misto, and that's the PERFECT lunch! It's one of those meals that you get to remember hours later, and wonder when you'll get again. Something so delicious that you don't want to eat to often, for fear of it losing it's appeal.    Oh yeah, if you don't  like garlic, this isn't the dish for you ;~D

CZQCp0wjj3oqH3Qxv_k8nA.text: We always visit Nora's when we come to Las Vegas. It is a nice alternative to something in the hotel and the food and service are always great.   I opted for the "Crazy Alfredo" on my last visit and it was decent. I still prefer their Vodka Penne over most of the pasta dishes there. The place has a decent selection of wines by the glass as well.   The antipasto salad is pretty good and plenty for two people to share as a starter.

4peY9dGS-wCI6s4_jkAO4A.text: It's hit or miss. Been here 10 times 8 out of the 10 it was excellent. Service was good, food was great. I guess it just depends on who you get. I'll keep coming back hoping that the two times I went and got bad service was a fluke. Try the crazy Alfredo!

nvCTETUx9jHCLtCcbK_Iow.text: I have been going to Nora's when they only had one suite and Nora was serving the meals.  I love there food, especially Nora's salad.  The only downfall is that I wish they would grate their parmesan fresh.

Ix2V0XXucYTgdSoHKiwYVw.text: I'm a fan.  Love this place because it was off the strip and an old school Italian restaurant.  Did not care for the garlic bread.  It wasn't warm and tasted alittle stale to me.  We ordered a large antipasto salad which was amazing.  My husband got a huge plate of raviolis, large bowl of spaghetti and we shared a pizza.  They were all delicious.  Service was great and the prices were affordable.   We'll be back the next time we're in Las Vegas.

KtB0lSFxxmQgWzr9JmRx6g.text: Handsome staff (lol), delicious food, patient with big parties, delicious Italian food. 9/10 would go again.

lNo9pRDkfUEReEaLkMlwAA.text: This is a True local gem.  We found it during a downpour.  The food is a delight.  Very authentic and beautifully plated.  This service was absolutely impeccable!  Foodies everywhere need to try this gem.  We all had different items ,  Chicken Marsala, Veal Canneloni and the Crazy Alfredo.  All were perfectly prepared.  This place is also child friendly.  The servers are so kind, providing crayons and making sure the wait isn't too long.  I highly recommend.

ntzZIxC1YPdlKh5DeHgNXw.text: For some reason locals love this place.  I am not one of those people.  I've eaten many a meals here and always wondered why it was so busy.  The one thing I do like is the live music.  If you long for old-school vegas stop by the bar and listen to the band.  Eat dinner somewhere else first.

AgWdQFnQDcJN3uzaP8eP_g.text: This is my favorite Italian place! Doesn't look as fancy until u get in. It's nice, quiet (sometimes they have a live band), food is DELICIOUS!!! Good sized portions, very flavorful, great atmosphere.

dYva7rRLWIQFi8tnw6iz2w.text: Best Mom & Pops Italian Place in Town.  I've been going here from about 7 yrs or so...The Best Garlic Bread...Rib Eye Steak for great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye for lunch ;D hands down
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous garlic bread ;D

uxvlI2ns52a353Oy-1AgUQ.text: I am VERY picky when it comes to Italian restaurants, but this place is the best!!! I always get something with an alfredo sauce, and it drives me nuts when it has been sitting even for  a short time, as it starts to dry up fast. I have been here twice, and it was 100% fresh, and the flavor was great!!! Price was good, since it was off the strip, yet the quality and flavor still beats the higher priced places. Service was amazing, just be sure to get a reservation. All the locals know and it fills up fast!

PeE8dg0qY32hDhV8QWCkJg.text: Always happy to dine at Nora's. The new place is nicely appointed, the garlic knots always desired and the food tasty.

8D6eMRWxGbkOi2U80m7pOQ.text: We have been going to Nora's for years.  The food is generally good, particularly for the cost, but the service has gone way down since they moved locations.  Last night we arrived with a large group, only to be told that they did not have our reservation.  The hostess was completely unapologetic and acted as though we were just imagining the fact that we had made a reservation and not that Nora's may have lost it.  We were then told that it would be a 30 minute wait, which actually turned out to be 90 minutes.  And when being seated, the hostess was again rude and unapologetic, slamming down menus and silverware when she had to set the table again because it wasn't the right size to accommodate our group.  Our server was very nice, but slow and inattentive.  I'd be hesitant to take a large party here ever again, especially if there are children in the group.  The front of the house staff just isn't knowledgeable or professional enough to deal with something like a lost reservation.

SZnK9DpZh06gE4Ix28rxnA.text: I love Nora's! The food is always good and service Is great. The crazy alfredo is my favorite. My friend had the eggplant parmigiana and she loved it. Their Moscow mules are delish. I recommend to always make a reservation since they are always busy. Definitely my favorite Italian restaurant in town.

tBnOlMogL5z4m-0Cz643kg.text: My Family and I have been visiting Nora's for a few years now and we loved the place. The way it was an old mom and pop type of place had a very appealing draw to it. Old school pizzeria with an added sit down Italian restaurant attached. Not over fancy not over bright a nice welcome relaxing place.   It was my sons 18th Birthday and he decided to return to Nora's. But at this point they had moved to the new location. I'm not sure what I was expecting but this wasn't it.  Its way to Modern for my taste. high ceiling fancy this fancy that, It lost its down home appeal. Was not warm and inviting at all. the staff even seemed to be stuffy.     We ordered our apps and they came out on a timely manner, and where ok.. I think part of them sat on the pass for a it as they where warm at best.  Items you would think would come out with certain dishes we had to ask for exp. ( ordered sauce for the bread but no spoon to dish it out with.) Large salad to share yet no extra plates for the salad i guess we where suppose to use the app plates which had sauce all over them.    After Looking over the menu we noticed there was nothing listed for kids. So we asked or sever if there was a child menu. She told us they did not have one but we could order small pasta or pizza..  Who doesn't have a kids menu?     Our main dishes seemed to take for ever to come out. When they did again half seemed to have been held at the pass under warming lights. They where on the drying side and not as hot as they should have been. I had the Chicken parm, it was very tough and on the edge of drying out. The Breading was soft and tasted like rye bread.. The noodles that came with it where way to al dente like the where rushing to get food out..  The food was also very lacking in flavor.. I use to love the old school tastes here, its almost as if they went to cans and boxes. other pastas in out group where the same not cooked enough and lacking a good portion of sauce. so barley covered the noodles.      The staff was friendly but not warm. They where moving tables much like any other fancy place in town it become numbers not family. They have definitely lost the good old home feeling which we so liked..      I doubt I will return, have had better food at Olive Garden to be honest compared to this visit..  Congratulations Nora's for stepping into the uppity fancy bland like everyone else's restaurant.

yce-nfJYTggjfpkCNc30KQ.text: This place used to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants in town. I have to say I changed my mind since they moved in this new - and upgraded - building. This new facility is a great place. They did a good job with the decor. But let's get to the main thing for a restaurant: food. This is an Italian restaurant, and my pasta was overcooked. It's the second time I go there bringing a large party with me, and I have to say the quality is not as expected. I don't know what changed when they moved, but I'm kind of regretting the old location now. OK, this one's bigger, brighter, bolder, but again the food is not as good as it used to be. The staff is very nice though.

M1Q-nrxkcJqy8HqvAQxM6g.text: I have been to Nora's twice now and both times have been great. The food is always delicious! This time around, we asked the waitress for some crayons and she totally got them for us. My friends and I colored the entire table top. Yes, we are full grown adults, but why should the kids get all of the fun? Plus, a good coloring session is always a good time.  I have had their gnocchi and their pizza, now. They've done one thing wrong though... they've kept the restaurant in Vegas. There should definitely be a Nora's by my house!!

Q3s0YdzIl4ONsgqPSwDssQ.text: Delicious every time. Great environment and service. Anytime someone visits from back home I make sure we make a spot by Nora's!

ybot8D3BcVixFqCC8HbJNg.text: This is supposed to be the best Italian in Las Vegas . It was a huge disappointment. Party of 7 reservations at 7:30 on a Saturday night ; we waited 25 minutes past our time for them to squeeze us on a table that fits 5 comfortably. Ridiculous. Then the lighting was that of a cafeteria scene. This is supposed to be a nice Italian restaurant. Not McDonalds . It was noisy. We might as well of went to a buffet for the ambience and the food quality. Food was greasy and had no flavor . Terrible experience.  Won't try again .

vRjq85Sz6bI2vryVaQak2A.text: Worst meal and service I have ever experienced here! I've been coming for years including the original location and this is for the first time it took for ever to get water - we got a drink order after our appetizers, and the calamari was cold,  the pizza crust was hardly warm, the branzino was cold and I had to ask for olive oil and sea salt 3 different times from 3 different people before I finally got it!! When the manager Joemar came over to try to help he was rude and asked what I wanted even though I just told the waiter that I wanted the pizza warmed up - terrible all around!  The manager does not belong in the service industry.

vbjhxdIs0v-a-kjEoMySlg.text: This place never disappoints! I've been a frequent flyer since I was young. The new location is beautiful. FYI they literally have the best steak in town (steak at an Italian joint?! Try it!)

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another great birthday celebration at Nora&#39;s

MGVdEDQXlkM65XmALmYY1Q.text: Nora's is a great place for any dining occasion (e.g., birthday, anniversary, date night, dinner for one, etc). The hostess in the front was not pleasant. Understandably it was very busy, but that should not warrant an unpleasant greeting. Hence the 4 star rating I am giving.  However, the food here is excellent. It is worth the money you pay. The bartenders were professional, and very attentive. Our waiter was great and very knowledgeable of the menu. We were low on water, and had to ask for a refill which again is understandable at a very busy restaurant. Nonetheless, our party had a great dining experience. I would definitely return to try other items on the menu!

2YAxr11RQAbdV9h6m2OVNw.text: We been coming to Nora's for the last  7+yrs since they been in the last location.      Customer service has been a hit or miss throughout the years so has the food.  It however never stop us from STILL coming to this restaurant.  We seen individuals that lacks customer service.  One in particularly, Manager.  He was more polite as a server than a stuck up manager with no personality.  But I guess sometimes "titles" get the best of a person and seems as if they no longer need to be hospitable.  Their lack of professionalism just shows enough that I guess sometimes a place of establishment just has to settle for what they can to fit the title.  I also want to call out on a female server who drop my husband expensive name brand glasses off the table and nonchalant basically said "oops" rather than apologizing for her mistake!!  .... Many more I would love to call out, but I rather keep it short n simple!!!! .... Would I STILL recommend this place.... YES,  I still would recommend this place to others even if the customer service needs improvement!!!!!

OtwkmUU6gfQD9VZYpeLKRg.text: Went in for a biz lunch today. New building Is nice. Need more parking   It was 130 when we ordered and it took 45 minutes for 1 sand which, simple salmon and veggies and a chicken Marsala  The salmon was way over cooked! Crispy on both sides, tasted like they dumped a whole shaker of salt and the veggies were just dropping in oil. Entire plate was disgusting.   I did mention it to the server but, didn't want to make a scene in biz. I had only a few bites. It was clear when the server picked up my plate that I didn't eat it.   After leaving I called to inform a manger so they could do better next time. After being out on hold and then hung up on (by accident,I assume). I called back and asked for a manager. I was told there wasn't one there, he had stepped out. So, I left a message and told them what I wanted to discuss  It's now 930pm and no call back.   The Decision to never return or hold another biz meeting there has been made  Too bad :-(

UIgIh2vfUMnozXlJz9vTxw.text: Ambiance is awesome. Service is phenomenal. The food was above average for me but I feel like I may have ordered wrong. I got the rib eye steak with truffle fries. I sent back the fries for being too salty... which for me is nuts because I love salt. The steak was perfect but a little heavy on the char in places. The crazy alfredo is one of their specialities but it is not great. The pasta was perfectly cooked but the combinations in this dish are not complimentary. Again, I will give it another chance because I feel like I have to try the other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with truffle fries.  Crazy alfredo.

qSmvrjVY_eLSOyhFXMRZHg.text: Nora's is my go to Italian spot. The food there is amazing. I even had them cater my wedding rehearsal dinner. Today I tried the shrimp scampi appetizer and loved it. You should definitely dip the bread in the sauce. Service is great but it can get crowded during peak times.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi appetizer

MCFe4rD_k7gy5axbAAK1Mg.text: I had the Penne pasta for my entree and the Tiramisu for dessert. Everything about the restaurant was perfect. The service, the atmosphere and the food was superb and worth every penny. Cozy yet classy, professional, attentive wait staff, not having to wait forever for your food and never having to flag down anyone for a refill. Cost wise, it was about 110.00 for lunch for two people but it was worth the money as it was the best Italian restaurant I have been to in a long time. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes Italian food and is looking for a nice night or afternoon out.

8B6QpfEcZ6IEtn0_-H7gJw.text: Love their new location as always service, food and drinks were exceptional.the fettuccini sea food plate just awesome ,they are also one of the few restaurants in town that carry bols gin. Always a great experience

v1RU5uMMZCE3KTSyZjLyuQ.text: I just had one of the greatest restaurant experiences here this past weekend and I had to update my review because of it.   Nora's is a more upscale Italian restaurant and now they finally have the location that expresses how great they are. This family owned restaurant serves up great food with amazing customer service.   Food:  For all the carb lovers, this place is a must go! You start off with some amazing garlic bread! This is made with fresh garlic and grilled to perfection.  For starters, their salads here are AMAZING! They have the greatest antipasto salad I've ever had with a rolled up cheese/meat combination thrown into a great, fresh salad  The crazy alfredo is the best item on the menu (and quite possibly the best item at any Italian restaurant). This is a must try!!  For desserts we had the luxury to try the cannoli and Tiramisu. Both are five star and must at this restaurant.   Service: we went on one of the busiest nights (Saturday on Valentine's Day weekend). And with that, the service was phenomenal. With a reservation, we were sitting down within 15 min and our appetizer was at our table within 5 min after ordering.   I must acknowledge 2 people who went out of their way to make my Valentine's Day that much better! Jessika and Dayton both WENT ABOVE and BEYOND to make an amazing experience.   Price: $15-$20 per entree. Our bill was $61 for 2 people (but we did get appetizers).

n72sp_e1LNVRMuQ-4U7lHQ.text: We ate here with my son and granddaughter back in early July.  The fruiti de mare was sooooo good that I told my wife that I wanted to have it for our 48th wedding anniversary!  Hopefully they will have an opening this Thursday afternoon so we can come back and  I can have this dish to celebrate our anniversary!

HyVUy6ZyfrhKaDqJthAQbQ.text: The new Nora's is great ambiance.  Kenia is an awesome server  Food is good but not great. Took a long time to get food.  Better than some.  Not as good as others.

C502YGwKkvCc6X3dJNTFVw.text: Best of Las Vegas in 1996, 2001 and 2009.  On my menu....  Trying to keep track of what someone else is consuming is a pain. I'll just recite what I had yesterday...  Garlic Bread (*** Complimentary) Unlike other patrons of Nora's... was not overly impressed with this Garlic Bread. We had two to three re-fills, and each refill was not consistent with any previous refill. Bread not up to par with the rest of the meal...  Alla Nora (**** 1/2 $10.50) Spaghetti, Eggplant, Ground Beef, Tomato Sauce, Pesto, and a variety of Cheeses with a light layer of Breading on top thrown together into a Bowl and baked until the surface is lightly crusty. I told you I was going to have this entree on my next visit! Did not disappoint!  Carafe of Sangria (****) Sangria is supposed to be the Wine Punch of Spain... what is it doing on the menu of an Italian restaurant? The Red Wine was light and dry... but in Nora's version the Fruit, either sliced or chopped was missing or in small supply. Would have been more refreshing with more Fruitiness.  Service was business-like and efficient... and distant. My favorite Italian, where I live, the owner is quite a bit friendlier and attentive... and hand-kissing towards the fairer sex. Maybe I didn't notice it on my first visit, but I was sitting on one of the outside seats of the table.... and caught my attention very quickly. Waiters a little too brusque for me... maybe they weren't Italian!  We got to Nora's around 5pm to 6pm, and there was no problem getting in and, most importantly, no waiting! But... after we got seated, the rush of diners started.

YpRuJcZqWgp7D_ovi98B6g.text: This is a great restaurant. We had an anti pasta salad, calamari, and four different entrees. All expertly prepared. Great service.

FwtDbex7KZ6bYCt-jXJs5g.text: I love the new location. They did an amazing job with the decor and the floor plan. The bar area is beautiful. I can't wait for the upstairs to open in a few weeks which will consist of a lounge and private dining. The food is the same incredible food as the old location. Congrats to Marcelo and his family. You did a great job

ifPpTHOp2-qbN-4s96H2Hg.text: So delicious! I recently had dinner here for a friend's birthday, which consisted of a smorgasbord of different appetizers.  Usually, I am quite the picky eater and though I'm open to trying different dishes, it's rare I enjoy everything.  This was one of those rare occasions!  Shrimp scampi was my favorite, but the caprese salad (buffalo mozz - oh so delightful!!), focaccia bread, garlic bread, antipasto salad...it was all amazing.  The service was fantastic as well; so were the espresso martinis we had for dessert.  Next time, I'm trying a full meal.  Thank you, Nora's!

DsKX-kWqAYOon1k9gy1RcA.text: The service was ok. I came in with my family of 8 and unfortunately,  everyone is our party had an upset stomach from the tomato sauce in the dishes. Luckily,  I had the chicken which came with salad. That was delicious.  I recommend them if and only if you don't have anything with their tomato sauce.

fbj4p7BxIwvqpKoSwyvDYQ.text: Great night At Noras. music was great. Great friends , Dinner,  Music and dancing. Fun fun fun

sYtUxOdN4p9tKsD-p2E0Tg.text: I'm from New England.... which means I am an Italian cuisine SNOB. Fearing mediocre quality in the heart of Vegas we searched and searched for good Italian food. By referral, we found Nora's. Thank God (we visit often). Needless to say we have visited Nora's many (did I say MANY?) times. It is fabulous. Get a reservation and go hungry. Everything from the bread basket to the Crazy Alfredo is delish. Went with my husband and 2 friends, they all dream of, ordered and LOVED the Crazy Alfredo. We all started with Caesar's salad (great!) and I had the Cannelloni. Holy, cheesy delicious yumminess. I am a picky eater, more of a "many small meals throughout the day vs. 3 large(r) meals", I cleaned my plate, licked it clean. Prices are as crazy (good) as the alfredo! Go. Don't tell the tourists though, this is a GEM of a locals spot!!!!

CjlUgnoM4xpYEE-AZ0r0OA.text: I love this restaurant. The food was amazing and our server was fantastic.   So the reason for the low score is the extremely rude hostess. An older blonde hair lady. Who stood near our table clicking her pen or flicking the pen cap while very loudly speaking that she needed our table table for a six top.   We were  a party of four who ordered drinks apps entrees and desserts.  We were there for two hours.  I have worked in food service for a long time and I think this behavior is completely unacceptable.   Basically this woman ruined the night. That is the last memory I have of your restaurant.   Not sure if I will be back there are many great spots in this town that I can spend my money at.

-S0r9d4OyoZwDbs0bsIYWw.text: Too long  of a wait food did not worth the wait , Veal was too dry on top of  dry spaghetti  noodles .

uLuVQnrxcfqUR20j5vrEQA.text: It was my first time visiting this restaurant and I only have great things to say. Baked Rigatoni was exceptional. I've never had ricotta this creamy. We will be back next time we're in Vegas. YUM!

dE18eU4wseiq6vr0zMeyJg.text: Our dinner last night at Nora's was our fourth since we discovered it about ten years ago when we asked an Italian employee at the Venetian where to get great Italian food in Las Vegas. He said quite assuredly, "Let me tell you about all the restaurants in the Venetian." Then he leaned in and whispered, "Now let me tell you where to go eat. Nora's."   His recommendation was a good one!   Our first visit to Nora's was probably our best experience - the flush of "first love" for what was at the time a little known, truly "mom and pop" venture located about four miles off the strip and tucked behind an Arby's in a strip mall.. There were four of us, close friends, we walked in on a Friday night without reservations and ate in the bar...which may even have been the only eating area at the time...where we had a wonderful pasta entrees, shared appetizers and desserts and with bottle of Sicilian red wine and the entire bill was just about $100.   Time marches on, Nora's has been discovered (even it seems through a visit from Food Network - alas).  Reservations are not only recommended but essential.  The wine prices have gone WAY up. The menu seems to have been pretty static for each of our four visits to Nora's  and while our meal last night was good, and we still recommend it to those who want traditional Southern italian food, there are so many options now in Las Vegas for Italian fare that our visit last night may have been our last to our "old friend". (One of those options is Nora's Wine Bar, owned by the "sons of Nora".)   The low point of the meal for two at Nora's last night was the antipasta.  Nora's preparation, with Italian deli meat, canned black olive slices and grated mozzarella on top of blandly dressed lettuce, just didn't "cut it".  But the linguini friutti di mare that followed was wonderfully prepared with succulent mussels, clam (not in shells), shrimp and calamari rings and tentacles (yesssss) in a well seasoned red sauce. A glass of Barbara and a glass of Nebbiolo plus two desserts (espresso tartufo and cannoli) brought our bill to about $75 which we thought was a good value for the quality of the meal and the friendly service.   The yelp reviewers who have cheered about the chocolate cake are right...the Valrohna chocolate cake with the molten center that is served warm is delicious. But the espresso tartufo, coated in a chocolate shell, and the cannoli are both worthy contenders.  The tartufo may be among the best we've ever had of that dessert option.   We noted that on a Tuesday night in a bad economy, Nora's was still doing gangbusters. all tables full by about 8:00 in a mix of what seemed to be local regulars and tourists like us. The enduring popularity of this little place is well earned.

sV95HjoXWsHlFj96OVkDLw.text: Best Italian food in Vegas!!!!  10.0- Arancini balls are amazing. You can't just eat 1. So addicting  10.0-- fettuccini carbonara with chicken. Alfredo sauce was great!!! Best that I have ever tasted. Very authentic and fresh tasting

e6UTwduDYz_h0U-TAX3dXQ.text: I'm on to your trick Nora's. Telling people that their is a 20 minute wait and then seating them within 10. In all seriousness, they are jammed packed.  With the crowd coming to eat in those numbers on a Thursday, it is impressive.   Little events were off throughout the dinner, but the food was good enough to overlook them. A wine/cocktail menu was not presented until I asked. A talk with Robyn L. a while ago had me searching for the Pilgrim's Passion. Ordered that for my friend and I got the Berry Explosive. Both were amazing and worth the $9. It took some time for them to come to the table. I wouldn't have noticed if the waitress didn't come to apologize, so that was nice.  The garlic bread came out to tide us over. Surprising that the basket had about ten pieces in it. All were heavy on the garlic. I could smell it when brushing teeth later that night. Oh baby, does that turn you on? They ran the gambit in texture though. Some were burnt, some crunchy, while others were soft and drenched in butter. Most were edible and enjoyable. Dinner is more fun when playing roulette with free items.   At least there was no losing in dinner. I had ordered the Alla Nora and it was a bountiful feast. A pile of spaghetti topped in meat sauce, eggplant, and cheese is thrown in the oven or a salamander to give a nice crust. My friends were also as happy with their Tomato Basil Pasta and Crazy Alfredo. Packing most of the dish to go home, I am looking forward to tomorrow, because I always enjoy cold pasta for breakfast.

4F-ZIqh_Inp3-oapNouVyw.text: Great atmosphere.  We came on a Saturday night, there's a live band playing easy listening music.   Their famous dish here is the Crazy Alfredo. Which is a fettuccine in Alfredo sauce with other red sauce ingredient to arrive at the perfect combination of the two sauces.  Nothing fancy about this place, but the food was good.  Check it out if you're looking to get off the strip and pay non-strip price quality food.

odHsyQffFHSmvfoiP2_12A.text: This place is great.  I thought the prices were pretty fair.  I got the Linguine Calamari and it was fantastic.  I am such a sucker for fresh squid.  Attentive service and overall good experience.  With prices like these, I will be sure to make my way back here.

BFwbraKdyuJOJJkNCfX3dg.text: GREAT FOOD! Very nice yet casual place. Really enjoyed the garlic bread and entrees we all had. One of the better local restaurants in Las Vegas! Suggest trying it out!

MHpxtxDLTMariafJ01hXJQ.text: Will absolutely be back. Highly recommend!  Called midweek for a same day reservation. They said 9pm was the earliest. We showed up 30 minutes early and they sat us promptly. 5 star   Didn't care for my table that much. It was a small 2 person table against the wall crammed next to a stage. But we had a table, and the place was packed.. walk ins were being told long wait times, so I cant complain. In the future I might request not having that table again.  4 star  Wine list was solid and sure to have something for most people though I wish it had a few more options in the 100-200 range. 4 star  After I ordered a bottle of amarone it arrived with a decanter and the waiter proceeded to open it. What shocked me was the battery powered aerator that was used during the pour from the bottle to the decanter. Our first course was tomato bruschetta. The nice thing about mid age armarone for me is the way it opens up over the meal. The acidity would have paired perfect with the ripe tomatoes, and later on, after it sat for 30 minutes in the decanter, it would have opened up perfectly for the main courses. I didn't get to enjoy that experience. What I got was a wine that tasted like it had just been through a blender. 2 star  Tomato Bruschetta was decent, but I wasn't a huge fan. The baguette was fresh but had been soaked in way to much olive oil. The tomatoes were cut too large to eat on a baguette without falling off and I never got the flavor of garlic, basil and pepper. Not to say there wasn't any but for me it was bland. On the positive side my girlfriend highly enjoyed the generous portion of tomatoes, almost twice as much as you would normally see on this type of dish. 3 star  For the main I ordered the crazy alfredo and it was amazing. Packed with mushrooms and peppers.. pasta just right... topped with awesome shrimp... the sauce was perfect! This dish is divine. 5 star  She had the spaghetti and meat balls. The meatballs were enormous and very good but the noodles were served soft. In an Italian restaurant, we were expecting al dente. It wasn't spaghetti either, it was more like spaghettini. Overall a decent dish but I had higher hopes. 4 star  We pre ordered the souffle for dessert. NOM NOM 5 star  It was so good it has inspired me to create my own yelp award. I will call it the Nom Nom award and reserve it for dishes that are so good they make you slow down when eating... enjoying the moment while making cavman like noises with your partner in between the omg this is so freaking good stares you share. Yea, its that good.This dessert is 5 star plus and wins my first nom nom award.  Service was excellent. Staff was busy but not stressed out, everyone was happy. With a full house and a line almost out the door this is a rare combination. Our waiter was prompt, friendly and serviced the table properly. Our wine and water stayed full and the table was kept neat by the busser. 5 star  Over all a solid 4 with potential for more when I go back and sample their pizzas and other offerings.

JCJ7witSdHxf1NLwFXbsEw.text: Amazing food, great staff! LOVED this place! We wanted to eat good Italian food off the strip and we found it with Nora's! Located in a strip mall (take a cab if from out of town), the setting is not fancy (yet nice) and we felt as if we were taken care of by the best. My husband had the Carbonara and said he hadn't tasted one that good since being in Italy! The pizza was excellent and there are a variety of choices. We noticed that this place was frequented by local returnees, always a good sign (especially since many were obviously local Italians!).  Will definitely return.

jWJyyWyJzXuW9UnfkSGQwA.text: This is one of my favorite places for Italian food! The calamari is the best that I have had in Vegas so far. Two things make a great calamari, the way it is cooked and the sauce for dipping.The crazy Alfredo is the BOMB! Only down side is that the crazy Alfredo is a very greasy dish. Usually I add in a salad to help balance out the guilt of this dish. The bar is always hopping as well as the rest of the restaurant. Also one of the best BBQ chicken pizzas in Vegas. Perfectly balanced with BBQ sauce. Lots of great dishes to choose from, only problem is that it is hard to choose. Great service with a smile.  Can't say that I have ever had a bad meal here. This place does tend to get busy, so I usually do orders to go. Definitely makes life that much easier.

isSYkrGRSs5GSvoj_aCSqg.text: Not for the chicken marsala 'though it was good too but definitely for the garlic bread to the caesar salad, the sauce and meatballs....yummy!

PuduZJ3pm96EpCvnf4afpw.text: we had reservations at another place but ended up here on a tip from our cab driver....Thank you MR. cab driver! the food was great and the prices are moderate ( way less than any place on the strip) the crazy alfredo and chicken gorganzola pasta was AMAZING and the chicken ceasar salad was great too...The service was good, but i recommend reservations...we got lucky since it was just two of us.

szS90sZtQ-wMCEeQnaxe8g.text: The food was well priced and the actual location wasn't too bad.  My wife had the spaghetti and meatballs and I had the lasagna.  Both were really salty.  Probably won't go back.

szh6hqxgopS0XAI6quyM2w.text: If you are from new york, philly, boston. san fran or anywhere else where great southern italian food can be found at every other streetcorner restaurant do not eat here.  you will be disappointed with the bland sauces, overly garliced dishes and awful desserts.  A total waste of time and money.

RlF1PV_uEuR8hgpbB3M9kA.text: Oh how I am going to miss Nora's!!! Just moved to New Mexico and we made sure we went to Nora's a few times before we moved! This place is the BEST Italian in Las Vegas! My boyfriend and I love this place! We no longer need to look at the menu because our favorites are so amazing! My usual is the Baked Ziti and he loves the Crazy Alfredo! I know I will never find another Italian restaurant like Nora's!

5-80f8l0uMz_HZXxoXb3sQ.text: Nora's is a wonderful Italian restaurant with authentic, delicious food and a great staff to match. Family and Friends gathered for my Mother's surprise Birthday Bash. The 40 of us were comfortably seated in the Bar area which was able to accomodate all of us, we were able to mingle and move about without bumping in to each other..The service was excellent, Mari-Jou, (owner) made sure every detail that we discussed was executed perfectly. Will was our server and we couldn't have asked for better !  He paid so much attention to our party that not one bread basket or glass of water went empty..he was so very sweet to my Mother..he went up to her and "wished her a Happy Birthday" and asked "if there was anything she needed as she was the Guest of Honor". We were all surprised to be given "leftovers"..all wrapped up and marked with the name of the contents in each container..what attention to detail !!  Now the Food..we enjoyed a 5 course meal consisting of The Best Calamarie  we've ever  tasted , Antipasta Salad, which I've never had before and will have again, Pasta with the most delicious meatballs,Chicken Marsala, Eggplant Parm and the most delicious Pork Tenderloin (with yummy Roasted Potatoes) I've ever had !! The Tiramisu and Cannoli were to die for !!  I just recently got together with my Family and the subject of "Las Vegas" came up and all agreed that the next visit to "Vegas" has to include a trip back to "Nora's"

0nPwg6rOxYoxsR3D_rmlZg.text: I had heard so much about this restaurant and was really looking forward to going there. However, our whole group was fairly disappointed by the experience. The prices are reasonable, but I expected so much more on the taste of the dishes. I ordered the gnocchi and my husband had the alla nora, which is supposed to be one of their specialties. Both of these dishes were just ok; they weren't anything special at all. The tomato sauce on top of the gnocchi honestly reminded me of Chef Boyardee. The house salad that we ordered was also nothing special. The only good part of the meal was the pesto that my sister ordered. The service was inconsistent. The guy who brought our drinks and bread was very friendly and nice. However, the waitress and the person who dropped off our entrees were indifferent. The woman who served our entrees basically just dropped the plates on our table without a word or smile. The restaurant was super busy, so I don't know if it was just our table that wasn't having a great time, but I was expecting so much better from this place.

Tyox7pEii7Df-Vzp-p_cgA.text: I had dinner here a few nights ago with my best friend. We had not made any reservations but the hostess was kind enough to get us in. We sat and immediately a server approached us. He didn't offer a tour of the menu but he did ask if we had any questions. The server was pleasant and respectful. We got a nice Cabernet by the glass I asked him to bring me what he liked. I got a salad as my appetizers i think it was called greens and Farro. The salad was crisp, but a little salty; all balanced with the dressing. I also ordered the filet with roasted veggies it was amazing!!!! Hot and buttered no sauce needed ! We were so full we had no room for dessert. Thank you Nora for the delicious meal !

XBCfaell3VS-gDAvbS8QPw.text: Solid place! The service definitely gets 5 stars and the food itself a 4. I wouldn't say it's the best Italian food I've had, but the service was incredible! We mentioned to the waitress that the pasta was a bit salty and she was quick to suggest a replacement for us and didnt charge us for it. She also gave us complimentary coffee and cappuccinos with our cannoli. The cannoli was quite hard, but the filling was creamy and delicious. I would also say the calamari is some of the best I've had! We would definitely like to come back and try some more of the pasta options and tiramisu.

39g5N-LoqfNq-SSZL69c3A.text: The food was delicious!!! Joe and Mathew took great care of us!! I would recommend this place to everyone who wants a good Italian meal!!!

KZfDZN8UZnAF6YEvTs9McQ.text: Nora's has been around for a long time and prior to the past two times I have eaten there, it was always consistent and good. I am not sure what happened after they moved to their new building but I am just not a fan anymore. Sometimes when a place moves locations, something about the old kitchen doesn't travel with them. Sadly, I have eaten here twice this year and both times were a let down.  The service is still great but the food has become very mediocre. I always recommended Nora's to others for a great Italian meal, now not so much. The wine list is still outstanding with so many top wineries featured and options. The atmosphere is on trend, lively and enjoyable.The new space is open and also features patio dining always a plus in Las Vegas.  This particular time we joined friends to celebrate our anniversary since we all got married the same day. I ordered the Chicken Marsala with a caesars salad and hubby ordered the lasagna. It wasn't that my entree was not good, it was just very ordinary. All that was featured was the chicken, marsala sauce and mushrooms. Some garlic mashed potatoes would have been nice along with some carrots. I guess I was looking to be wowed but it didn't happen. Perhaps I made the wrong choice too. My husband said his lasagna was nothing outstanding either which surprised me as Nora's pasta dishes have always been very tasty. Dessert was a nice treat from Nora's and appreciated by both couples!   Maybe the two times I have dined here this year have just been off nights. I don't want to say I will never come back but this place has just moved down on my list of recommendations.I hope the old Nora's comes back some day with the tasty dishes of the past.

Y3usLTUnB8lFSPVmHIMYjQ.text: Great service and food was awesome! I'm so full I can barely type this out  Free  unlimited garlic bread (so good) huge portions by the way!

TKE0NQeorP09Rt2bleMI9Q.text: Finally got to experience Nora's and was NOT disappointed! We came in for dinner on a weekday and thankfully had reservations because this place stays BUSY.   They have an extensive menu and wine list, so it was a difficult choice to make, but we started with the antipasto salad to share then I had the shrimp primavera as an entree. The antipasto was delicious and HUGE and was accompanied by fresh herbtastic bread. I was nearly full before our entrees arrived! The shrimp primavera was out of this world and they vary the price by the number of shrimp you would like in it. Portions are sizable and my husband and I could've easily just shared an entree after that salad.   I'm giving it 4-Stars simply because they are heavy handed with the butter/oil in their pasta and that kind of gave me a stomach ache :/

F6Ci5RzWZipV5R8gfU10Uw.text: This spot was recommended to me by a Vegas local and it did not disappoint! I'd suggest making a reservation because even though it's off the beaten path of the strip it's still a hot spot. I love a good sangria but this may have been the best I've had in a while. Started with Cesar salad and real garlic bread. Yum! Baked rigatoni and chicken parm get two thumbs up! Didn't have any room for dessert.

-c56L1tcTr63C9BoWkNutA.text: I never understood spending millions  of dollars on the restaurant interior design, and hiring an amateur chef that offers you tasteless grilled octopus with sliced celery, the one who puts blackened seasoning on perfect fresh fillet of pan seared halibut, the chef that does not understand True al dente texture of the pasta, the chef that serves you the sauce when you immediately realize that he is not using parmiggiano reggiano but some cheap nasty version of American parmesan.  The chef that starts his ragu with food can rather than fresh vegetable base. The guy that drizzles aged balsamic over some lettuce like my 6 years old niece can't do the same thing. I mean, i just had to get this out of my chest, its so frustrating spending money in a restaurant whose dishes don't have any produce quality nor proper culinary principles behind. Come on....juliene celery sticks with octopus???

DawacMEwrGCqF97pYjmT8Q.text: BRAVO!!!! So yesterday my wife and I got married and had our reception in their second floor private room. What a fantastic decision this was....food was amazing and the service even better! We both truly can't thanks Nora's and there staff enough for all they did for us. You're our new Italian spot, see you again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

odogvzYIX1gVB-4QvvgV4Q.text: This place is so cute inside and out.. There is a live band playing, indoor/outdoor eating and they have little private rooms for private parties.   It was my first time eating here and I really liked. We had a party of 10 so they placed in us a private room with a tv, music and lights we could control.  When we sat down they gave us baskets of garlic bread to hold us over until we got our actual food. I ordered the gnocchi in vodka sauce and it was delicious. The price of food was fairly cheap  $12-$25 a plate depending if you got meat or not.  I really like it and it is for sure one of my favorite Las Vegas italian spots!  Update: still love this place and Kara is the best waitress. Very attentive, polite and social. She was able to handle us weirdos. That's always a plus. :)

VfOSpwls8Q6YRoovGL8WeA.text: Excellent service - great food. My friend Denise treated me to Nora's for lunch today. We split the house salad (which was huge) and had bruschetta for a starter. We should have stopped there, because the portions are quite generous! But we didn't; Denise had the veal and I had the lasagna. Both were great. I'm sorry I didn't snap pictures if the good as Denise and I don't get a chance to get together often. You'll only see the bag with my leftovers Great company and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jmNYu90FKSDDPMvM3kkztw.text: I was glad to be back at Nora's after almost 1 year without visiting. I'm glad to see them succeed and moved to a bigger location. We called on a weekday and they had a table. When we arrived we were surprised they were not packed.   The Restaurant: The new location is wonderful, it's a nice big building with outdoor patio. They have private rooms for family or corporate event, bar seating, outdoor and regular seating. The interior looks traditional, casual and cute. I used their restrooms and they were extremely clean.    The Food: The food was amazing! Better than what I remembered! We all got cocktails to start. I got a "Pisco Sour" I know this is an Italian restaurant, but they make really good pisco, we also got beers and "Old Fashion." Our waitress brought us some "garlic bread for the table" and got our orders. We decided to start with an "Antipasto Salad" they are family style, so it was big enough to share for the 4 of us.  For main curses we had:  "Chicken Marsala" it come with spaghetti on the side, delicious marsala sauce and chicken cooked perfectly.  "Rack of Lamb" delicious lamb in a special sauce cooked to your request served with veggies.  I had the "Frutti Di Mare" linguini with shrimp, mussels, calamari, clams cooked in a flavorful marinara sauce. My plate was spectacular! I love it! It was too much, and I couldn't finish it.  I switched to wine when the food arrived, the waitress recommended a pinot noir to pair with dinner.   The desserts were just OK, honestly nothing too special. We had "Tiramisu" and "Bread Pudding"  The Service: Although we had a great experience food wise, we are all considering going back because the service that night, were they didn't have many customers was super slow! It took us about 2 hours! She barely checked on us and when we told her we wanted some dessert it took her about 30 more minutes. At the end when we requested for the check we just decided to stand up and pay to the casher because we were afraid it would take any longer. It's a pity because like I said the food was better than what I remembered but honestly after a long day working you want to enjoy dinner without crossing the line were dinner becomes a painful wait.      Overall: 4 Stars excellent food but the wait became painful and kind of ruined the experience for us and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Pudding

WhQ73bnOQMETx1LvaHhHfQ.text: We have been dying to eat here for a loooong time! Having a hard time getting a baby sitter so finally we just said, "Oh well, let's just go anyway!" So last night my husband, my 2 year old, and I at last had the pleasure of eating here!  We came in knowing what we wanted.... The Grilled Branzino! Listen up seafood lovers!!..... This is the BEST fish I've ordered in my life! I was in my happy place this entire meal! It's a whole sea bass grilled (the way they do it in Italy, Greece, Israel, etc) don't ask me why but for some reason it's really hard to find fish served this way in Las Vegas.  Our son got pasta and he too was happy with his meal, LOL! We ordered the marinated olives as an appetizer along with a white wine from Sonoma,CA (forget which one it was but it went really well with the Branzino)....we got espresso at the end of the meal.  Our food was excellent, our server was super nice, everything was lovely! 5 full stars you guys!

TSebqgHhVJCRQ10-r5dTnQ.text: Beautiful new location still on flamingo! Large parking lot. Great and spacious outdoor seating. The bar seating area is nice as well. For some reason last night I feel like we were in New Orleans for a second, with the music and the ambiance! The staff provide and excellent service and are extremely polite.  We ordered the large antipasti salad. Honestly it could feed 4 if you share! I loved it! Very generous portion, tasty and refreshing. We shared a tagliatelle alla carbonara. It was the closest italian carbonara I ever had! It made my night :) We came around 9pm and got a table right away. I know for sure that you need a booking even the restaurant is spacious.  The cave a vin gives a lovely view if you have a table by the bar. Beautiful new location, the decor is gorgeous! Well done! I you like a great date night with excellent food, you found your place

ZbJaWamQQSeKlgHFPEPqBw.text: My husband & I decided on an impromptu date nite and being that I'm living a carnivore lifestyle we decided on Nora's after hearing how great it was. We didn't have time for reservations and really didn't want to wait either so we figured will walk-in & see. Place was busy, but we were greeted at the door by hostess and advised next reservation wasn't until 8pm, it was 630.. but if we wanted to wait she could get us in like 20mins but seating outside was right away. Being that it was hot I didn't want outside but after 10mins of waiting I said WTH, lol. It turned out really nice- misters were on, there was a light breeze so win-win.  Our waiter came, Adam was his name.. got our drinks nothing fancy water & soda, our appetizers- I had clams (I kno not really Carnivore-ish but I missed them) and hubs had pork belly w/beans.. omg both dish were amazingly delish! For main course I had a rib eye only rare and hubs had chicken parm. Got our meal, looks great but my meat was not rare, it wasn't even med-rare, it's was more medium.. I don't like to complain but we are talking about a $32 piece of meat here.. soo I Nonchalantly mentioned to Adam it wasn't rare when he came over. He immediately said I'll have the chef make another. He apologized like crazy, then the Manager Gabriella (?) came out & she apologized as well after she mentioned Adam had spoken to her. My new steak came out, still not rare but atleast not over cooked, more like medium to rare in certain spots if that makes sense. Lol. Anyway again Adam came to check and I shook my head to say no but that I wasn't going to send it back. I would just deal with it and that it wasn't his fault. Gabriella came back out feeling so bad, again not her fault. Adam surprised us with dessert, a beautiful tasty cannoli which really wasn't nec along with our bill which was adjusted, again not nec. Having worked in the restaurants biz myself growing up I know how waiter/waitress are blamed a lot for cooks/chef actions. Nora's kitchen went above & beyond with their customer service. I give it 5 stars because despite the little mishap from kitchen, the customer service was outstanding & so was the food to be honest. We will definitely be coming back! Thank you Adam & manager Gabriella for making our 1st time a memorable one. Keep up the great service! Ps- The busser/water guy was great too, we never had to ask for drinks, he was on top of it!

Au5RTYr5ou2Ak41O3L09Zw.text: I dined here for an early Valentines dinner with my love on Tuesday. I made a reservation for 7:30 on Open Table. We came in and the parking lot was already full! Restaurant was full and that's how it is every night so I suggest you make a reservation. The restaurant is beautiful and there are separate dining rooms to eat in. We were seated in the far left dining room I am hoping to come back and sit on the right side where they have their wines stored. Our waitress Kenya was very nice and made sure we had everything we needed. We loved the bread served and started with a small antipasta salad. Perfect size for two! We ordered the sangria to drink! Very tasty! For our mains, we ordered the chicken Marsala and the crazy Alfredo ! The CRAZY ALFREDO is a 10! The chicken Marsala was good but not as much as the pasta. For dessert we ordered the Pannacotta which we devoured. Loved this meal and restaurant would come back over and over.
