symDvnEjgzCL_TSdO0eJsg.text: Came here with a client during lunch. Heard a lot of good things about the place, so I was excited to try it out.   The location has plenty of parking spot, and the interior was definitely pretty roomy. We came in right at 12 and it was pretty packed. But we were seated within 5 minutes. I ordered the farm house carbonara (pictured below) and was fairly happy with the taste and portion size. The garlic bread they were serving was good as well.  The reason why I'm putting the rating at four is because the wait for the food was a bit ridiculous. I understand it was pretty crowded but it took us about 1.5 hours to get our food after we put in our orders. If you plan on coming here for lunch make sure you don't have a meeting to get back to because you'll run the risk of missing it.   Other then that, overall happy with the food and services provided.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NSIZIwDNxOTCOAvr9UxMiw.text: Our first time at Nora's was last night and we had an amazing experience that was guided by our incredibly capable and attentive bartender, Giambrone.  He guided my wife expertly to the perfect glass of wine for her taste, and then worked with the Chef to customize a dish that did not contain dairy.  My wife was blown away by the flavor and ingredients of her meal, pictured below.  I had the baked rigatoni and I wish I was still eating it right now!  Five stars easily!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Rigatoni
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dairy free sauce customized for my wife

fPh0tav_BPtuEXEGEFIzZg.text: The octapus appetizer was so soft and charred perfectly. The garlic bread is so fresh. I love the real garlic on it makes it top notch. Our drinks were on point. The pastas we ordered were great. Add mushrooms to the alfredo sauce and it makes a world of difference. Over all the food gets 5 stars. The only downfall was the wait and service. From the time we ordered our food it took about an hour and a half for it to come. The waiter never asked if we needed more water. So I asked for more water and never received any.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Idk what this was but it taste great
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Add mushrooms to your alfredo it&#39;s a game changer
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu &amp; Cheesecake

BOW4FBN7k3wT7dUn9xPMeQ.text: Took my hubby here for his birthday. We both cannot believe that after living in Vegas for close to 15 years we've never been to this place...  Our dinner was very good! He had steak and I had organic chicken (even though I didn't care too much for the accompanying vegetables I still fully enjoyed my meal). Chicken was cooked to perfection and absolutely delicious! Our appetizer (rice balls) was excellent. They have very good wine list as well.  Chocolate cake/souffle type dessert was not on their dessert menu, but I'm glad my husband spotted it on the table next to us. You have to wait 15 mins for it to be served but it was well worth the wait!!! My husband would liked it to be more hot but as to my taste, it was perfect!! I wanted more!!! It was chocolate heaven.  Our waitress was extremely pleasant. Wish I remembered her name (she was tall, skinny blond young girl). Our waters and drinks were never empty and if we needed her, she was always around. But not to the point to be annoying and overly attentive. Very pleased with her! My only suggestion is to have more options for the little ones. There were a lot of families with kids, including us, but pretty much the only option for our son was spaghetti. Which was very tasty for just pasta with butter. But still.. Maybe they have good explanation to why they don't offer it.. Anyway, I would recommend this restaurant and make sure you make reservation. It fills up very fast!

EQXUrO5q0cXMNkNCAM9I6A.text: Another great experience at Nora's! Came here with my boyfriend at 8:00pm still really busy but there was space at the bar. Table for two they said was approx 40min to 1 hr wait, but the tip is to sit at the bar and eat which is first come first serve.  Service: (6 stars out of 5) 6 stars for Michelle our waitress bartender!! She was very attentive and really funny. Awesome service way above average. Make sure you get her! Nails were also on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This steak was supposed to be medium rare.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uneven cook. Also can you spot the ribeye cap? It&#39;s very small and barely there.

aVCSAN4L1CrYwecLR1u8XQ.text: This restaurant was very extravagant in style and customer service. It was packed therefore me and my guest had to eat at the bar and I can honestly say I could not tell the difference from the table service and the bar service. I order a chicken Alfredo and my guest a crazy Alfredo and we both loved our meal and the service, we will definitely be returning back

EXOws2ltGvd-2Ukw1xSURQ.text: This was a great atmosphere with delicious wines paired with fantastic Italian cuisine. Mathew, our waiter was informative in making sure we were happy with our choices. Nice bar area and atmosphere to enjoy as well

RoKMfhOTYa6WEuIX55kTAA.text: Best Italian food in Vegas. Not quite up to NYC standards, but not bad. Nicely decorated bar, cool open kitchen & comfortable restaurant with good service.   Food:  great clams app, free Garlic bread with meal, Veal chop (VG) , Veal Parm (just OK), pork belly app (Excellent) , Octopus app (VG), wines by the glass (fair price and decent pour).   Can take a group with reservations. Good pace of service, didn't rush you. I'd go again.

WuOE5avT6XNfcAxeYb3zIQ.text: Nora's Nora's let's see... I was thoroughly irritated with my first visit here because of a combination of things. For starters I was invited here on a date and reservations were for 7:15 PM. We weren't seated until about 7:45PM. I was on the verge of just saying you know what this isn't cool and walking out. Of course as soon as this almost happened we were called to our table. What is the point of a reservation if you can't be seated on time or at least within a reasonable grace period after that? The two hostesses working seemed overwhelmed and clueless. Oh but I wasn't alone in the not being seated for a reservation fiasco! There had to be about 3 other parties that were also waiting to be seated and inquiring frequently since we all couldn't pile up in the doorway.. Who would've known that this place would be jumping like this on a Thursday night? Anyways...  We were seated and immediately greeted. The server was cool nothing much to say about him he did his job. Usually when you ask somebody if it's there first time and they respond yes you start off with some possible suggestions..  Whatev...I guess that's not apart of the job description though. Moving on to the food.   Appetizers:  House Salad (Romaine Lettuce, Mozzarella, Olives, Onions, Tomatoes, Pepperoncini, Homemade Italian Dressing)  Mozzarella Caprese Salad (Tomatoes, Basil, Rosemary-Garlic EVOO)  Entree's:  Crazy Alfredo (Fettucini, Chicken, Sausage, Shrimp, Porcini Mushrooms, Mushrooms, Roasted Bell Peppers, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Jalapenos)  Chicken Carciofi (Tomato, Artichokes, Capers, Linguini, White Wine Sauce)  Conclusion: The food overall was pretty good no complaints on that. If you love pasta then definitely you can't go wrong with the "Crazy Alfredo"! My Mozzarella Caprese was good as well. My last complaint which cost them another star was the fact that when we asked for to go boxes the waiter brought them back and gave us the wrong damn to-go boxes. Nothing like getting home from dinner with somebody and finding out that you got the other persons food. And in my case this was a date..so imagine how awkward that was for me?.. Eh I may try again who knows....

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Caprese Salad
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

D_dtxw7Bjb0Jm_mjl5sUMQ.text: I have to start backwards, with the leftovers:  Rigatoni with Chicken in Gorgonzola Sauce.   Not my dish, but my husband's.  It became mine the next night, after he went to a dinner-included activity and I delayed my own dinner until I returned hungry from my own evening out.  He sat at the table, hyperventilating from the aroma and the seductive memory of the the night before ;)  But I didn't let him have one bite! It was even better the second time; some of the fat from the cheese melted away, and the flavors melded together even better.  When I finished, I tried to figure out how soon in this holiday-heavy season we'll be able to go back.  Two days later, and I'm still jonesin' for that dish.  It was a while in coming: two previous attempts to make a reservation got shot down, but on a Tuesday night we were "allowed" to dine at 9:00 p.m., and found the place mobbed.  Incredible.  So why not five stars?  After all, the house salad that we shared was pretty damned nice, too, even though I don't eat olives or pepperoncini.  But Herb does, and when it was served we thought they had mistakenly brought us the large size.  And tasty, complimentary garlic bread was a delicious touch.  The service was terrific, too, with our waiter available when we needed him, but not overly obtrusive.  We were, sadly, disappointed in the Chicken Marsala.  Perfectly pretty spaghetti accompanied it, and the chicken was very tender and juicy.  But the sauce was overwhelming sweet, overwhelmingly drowning the chicken, and frankly, the portion - compared to everything else we had, and saw on other tables - seemed very skimpy.  I can't remember the last time I disliked this dish, except maybe in a New Jersey diner.  I also found the prices to be all over the place.   There's something for everyone, but if you're on a budget, many items seemed priced too high.  And that goes for the award-winning wine list, too - wine prices are steep.  Our total bill was reasonable, but we're not big eaters and usually don't eat red meat or seafood.  I can see why Nora's has such great ratings.  I recommend it highly, and will go back as soon as possible.  But for me, that fifth star is elusive.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala with Side of Spaghetti
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni w/Gorgonzola
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small house salad

h1VlyGf8l6UoUG-ZLvJJ2A.text: By far Noras is the closest thing to the real thing!  My husband lived in italy 3 years and he says finally he was able to have a real pizza.  call ahead they are busy

LPQk0MNr847xS60UuWTK0A.text: The new location is much bigger & food is on point. Nora's loves garlic in their dishes. Great local Italian cuisine!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di Mare
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic &amp; Shrimp White Pizza

evAClNIt12UKA4eFnqXQbA.text: One of my favorite places off the strip tucked away in reseidentials. I love this place. You gotta order the crazy pasta! It's crazy lol. Calamari, pizza, canolis are just some of the goodies on their menu. Service is immaculate! So attentive server's, try this place out you'll thank me later

oxyV1HtmS75VYXXJRFj7VA.text: What a great find. The wife and I came here for lunch this past weekend and was pleasantly surprised. The decor was far more upscale than I had thought so I felt a little under dressed. The layout and ambiance was perfect and the staff was absolutely great. The wife and I ordered their Spaghetti and Lasagna and finished it up with a cheesecake and to be honest, I believe they under charged us because the final bill was a lot lower than even marginal restaurants. My wife and I loved this place and definitely will be coming back.

PKhE2_My5D1hTPoRC74LWA.text: Pasta was not so good.  Heard great things before they moved to this new location.  Tried several items.  All not so great.  The garlic bread they serve was prob the best thing on the menu   Will not be back   Maybe it was better before they moved and expended.  Pasta used to be made fresh from the owner (older lady)   Now pasta is not made fresh.

DnizCoaIcMQt2fk_h1LsUA.text: Just plain simply good.  I've been missing out on not coming here. Prices are definitely worth the size, taste! Bartender guy super cool friendly and attentive

C2rIlglgS0lE6SQCZhSKoQ.text: Nice decor and setup - with the central bar breaking up the large space into smaller rooms.  Food was excellent - flavorful, moist, not too salty, and deserts not too sweet - and presented nicely. Dishes are pretty big, so in retrospect some of us could have shared, but it was better to get to try more.  We had the chicken caprese, the sea bass with arugula, the homemade tasting sausage with broiled vegetables, and a side of roasted potatoes (necessary for the sausage), downed with chianti. For desert we had the gelato layered cake,  tiramisu, and cannoli. All very good.  Yes, none of us like pasta, so we were happy that there were so many non-pasta options.  My only complaint is that the tiramisu, which, although perfectly soft and moist and light-rich balance, didn't have any coffee flavor. I enjoyed it anyway because of its other qualities.  The waiters were very attentive and easy to call if needed. One injured person in our group needed to change the (too soft) dining chair for a harder one from outside, and they did it quickly.  Definitely coming back.

RC0zSvhHM3gDFOdc_nWGBw.text: Came here for the first time. Was unable to make a reservation at the time we wanted due to it being so busy. We were able to get a table for 4 at 8.30 pm. The place was PACKED. Hardly any parking and every single table was full. Very little waiting area near the hostess booth.  However, we were seated right at 8.30 pm, so that wasn't a problem.  I ordered the Frutti di Mare, which is mussels, calamari, clams, and fish over linguini (red sauce). Big disappointment on the mussels. There were only 4 and they were very very briny and fishy tasting, leading me to believe they were not fresh. I'm from Southern Italy. I pretty much started eating mussels out of the womb, they shouldn't taste like that.   The calms were un-shelled and mixed in with the pasta. I would much rather have them in the shell. In the sauce, you lose the flavor of the clams. Overall, pasta was cooked well and sauce was good. But for $22, not worth it. Calamari tubes are really cheap and the plate was loaded with it. They need to knock down the price of this dish.   Our waitress did not bring us water, even though we asked multiple times. We all left parched.  I'd like to come back and give this place another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di Mare

Am0CC4GrxRM6cWguDRRHUQ.text: This was my first time at Nora's. I don't frequent Italian food as it is a little too heavy for me sometimes and when I do I usually just go to Maggiano's or Brio, but upon a recommendation I came here. It was definitely a great choice.  The ambiance was very nice, upon entry it seemed very classy and upscale, but don't be fooled--the prices are very affordable. We were greeted by very sweet hostesses and seated immediately.   The menu is not too overwhelming. There were a lot of options, but not too menu that you don't know where to look first. It's also nicely sectioned off hy what kind of dish you are looking for--meat, seafood, pasta, etc. As an OCD list maker, I appreciated that.   The food was absolutely amazing. I ordered the crazy alfredo and was blown away! I love my food spicy and the one thing about pasta is that other than red pepper flakes added after the dish is served, it is not usually spicy. This dish had jalapenos in it and while I am not a fan of jalapenos, I thoroughly enjoyed the spiciness it added to the dish.   The only reason why I am giving it 4 stars is because we waited quite awhile for the garlic bread to come out. I had previously looked up Nora's on Yelp and had read that their garlic bread is the best in town so I was anxiously waiting for it. Which by the way is completely TRUE. BEST GARLIC BREAD OF MY LIFE!

HbawPDLGd2_qrD4TlNR-ew.text: My Sweetie and I celebrated our 15th Anniversary at Nora's.  It was a great choice.  Our anniversary fell on a Thursday, it was very busy.  However our server Don did an outstanding job of making us feel special.  The food was delicious.  We were both very pleased with the food service and atmosphere.  We plan to visit Nora's each time we are in Vegas.  I had the popular dish crazy Alfredo, however I asked for gnocchi. Can I tell you that entree was to die for.  I wish I had a plate right now! There are not enough words to describe my pleasure.  As soon as we walked in the fresh herbs and Aroma fragrance the entire place.   We literally observed  a customer  swiftly  walking to the restaurant as we parked and thought oh my this place must be the bomb.  Also did I tell you our server Don was the best.  Nora's was perfect! You must give it a try.  I have already told a few of my co workers to try Nora's when visiting Vegas.  Please tell Don we said Hello

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A4rtaEBVsFHc6BFK0aCz6Q.text: Today was my first visit to Nora's, but it won't be my last. Wonderful, relaxing atmosphere, great music, and delicious food with very generous portions! The cherry on top was having Jon Snow's doppelganger as part of our wait staff.  Free eye candy!

YA3dQFPtJHhQ9BMc4LIcYQ.text: Sebastian is AWESOME!! The food, people and atmosphere are excellent!! Ask for Sebastian's section as he takes great care of you and he will help you with the menu too. I LOVE their desserts and cappuccino!! Of course the food is delicious too. Their patio is nice with the beautiful sky in the background. Make sure you go here when in Las Vegas!!

WEQvfgldIHV9i-HoEK0k0g.text: Recently dined in with friends for dinner. This place was exquisite! The restaurant is a stand-alone off of Lindell and Flamingo. Indoor and outdoor seating, bar plus private seating options. Ambiance is rustic and warm. A great place for a nice date or fancy birthday dinner. Menu options are plentiful. Price point is reasonable for the quality of food and service. I had the Pappardelle Luisa which is a house speciality. It is probably the best pasta I've ever had from the fresh made pappardelle to the alluring white wine sauce. I could literally eat this pasta everyday for the rest of my life, it's that good. So glad we dropped in. If you are feigning for real Italian cuisine, or planning date night, Nora's is it.

wRyTRFpwvRMPIHdPtut46g.text: This place is so good!!  It's like old school Italian in Las Vegas should be. Everything I've eaten there has been amazing. It's always a great experience to dine there.

73Hqu1CnrJdpR6BIQY0XHg.text: Some of the best Italian food in town! I don't care for pesto but friends wanted the pesto pizza, so that's what we ordered. It was sooooo good! I walked out of there so full, I was in pain but well worth it.

Q8NslD1XGALynRAjJOFR-w.text: Have lived in Summerlin for 14 years and am a total foodie. Ate at Nora's years ago before Yelp and had a great meal. Super excited to try the new location for my 22nd wedding anniversary after having tried all of the DTS restaurants and nearby restaurants in the Summerlin area, i.e., T-Bones, Vinter's Grill, Andiron, Echo and Rig. While the food was pretty darn good (enough to overcome sending back the Veal and Molten cake because they were too cold), the biggest bummer was the service. She made no attempt to help us celebrate our anniversary or remedy the not so perfect temperature of the food. And the only reason I am even writing this is, they forgot to bring us our leftovers!!

sw6UyzXlmhU0f1cRkjrOPw.text: After many years, last night was the first time I've ever been disappointed with Nora's.  I ordered the rib eye as an appetizer, medium rare.  It came out well done and had a weird chemical taste.  The crazy alfredo was dry and the noodles were undercooked.

hwszu49mzhx_fxZmwlwHZQ.text: Food was amazing as always I have been a loyal To Nora's since they opened and would recommend hen to any one for a great dining Experence .

krH9guCNdH33zA2AKIeRPA.text: MUST BRING A JACKET, the place is SO cold! 4 of us attended. We ordered the Wild Boar, Chicken Parmigiano (which is hard to mess up), Chicken Marsala, Chicken Alfredo. The boar & Parmigiano were too salty. Our service experience was horrible. Had to flag down our waitress multiple times to simply get drink refills. We came in at 8:45 & didn't leave until 10 mostly due to the 30+ min wait. Also had to flag down a server to get our waitress for our checks. She put the wrong items on the checks & put the wrong items in the bags. We pretty much serviced ourselves for the entire dinner, the only thing that was actually done for us without having to ask was to get our food brought out to our table.

sVq4hVZIsc4_RgT8Kp6VIw.text: This is one great Italian restaurant.  Food was excellent.  Service was excellent.  I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant for a great dining experience. It is advisable to make a reservation.

fmXpM51i4VaCqKmMB9dQng.text: As soon as you walk into noras you get wonderful aromas of garlic and beautiful ingredients coming from the kitchen. I had the linguini with clams as well as chicken marsala, the pasta was perfectly cooked and the flavors were well balanced. The garlic bread is to die for! Now for the sangria, it's the best I've had in awhile and for 8$ it's a perfect size. I can't wait to return but, for my first time, I'm impressed! I wish I had pictures to post so you can eat with your eyes First!

ewTBKQgYQS0ZUuaxyT99dw.text: Amazingly delicious!!! Every we ordered was so so good... the filet I ordered was cooked to perfection, salmon my friend ordered was supper tasty, the pasta dishes absolutely amazing... and let's not forget the drink literally every single drink we had was so great... I highly recommend everyone try this place when in Las Vegas

yYAusT0azx2iQPi_-FY-ug.text: This place was amazing. I ordered the salmon piccata . My husband had the rigatoni special. We both loved our food. The server was very nice and efficient.  The prices are good. The wine was great, I highly recommend the fried risotto balls for an appetizer. We came here to celebrate Valentine's Day. It was such a nice dinner. I highly recommend coming here. We made reservations just to be safe and got seated right away.

PsGjbQFnpof_yvMO1iY32A.text: This place was super good. The atmosphere was very live. Not too noisy but busy. The staff was super friendly and made jokes. The food was really good even though I don't eat much Italian food. The sangria was amazing. Some of the best sangria I've had. The complimentary bread was good too.

G-dZaNHEBKjtT9aoxix_WA.text: Um so this is by far some of the best Italian food in Vegas. After the first bite of lasagna I almost cried about the amazing flavor. This is becoming a go to place for lunch for our team at work. We will definitely be back. Between myself and my coworkers we have tried a lot of what is offered on the menu. Another key feature is the bread, trust me you won't be able to get enough. The service is always friendly and fantastic.

QenoVCjnI24bLd9aEuI1gg.text: I'm giving 2 stars because the food was good but service was lacking and i had a 645 reservation but wasn't seated until 810! Asked the hostess multiple times what the hold up was and she said we were being sat in private room but a friend of the owner insisted on being sat in there so they pushed us back! This is completely unacceptable!  A manager never even came to talk to us and once we did get sat the server acted like she was irritated and was barely around. Definitely won't be having another special occasion here

UAutQicUZIAXOcik2KuYtw.text: This is now my new favorite Italian restaurant. Every dish we had here was amazing!!!! The bruschetta appetizer was great (even better if you put balsamic vinegar on it). We got 1 free basket of delicious garlic bread. My main course was the Alla Nora and it was incredibly flavorful. It was spaghetti meets eggplant parmigiana. The meatballs were perfect! The gnocchi with Alfredo sauce and chicken was on point. The bathrooms were super clean too which is a big deal for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ZbUFHh4ajonJOTCheWVrw.text: We went to the new location for dinner. The atmosphere was great. Service was great. Unfortunately the food was not good. Chicken Parm was tough and my eggplant parm was mush, either over cooked or over ripe, either way it was bad. We will give it another try in a month. If it's not better I hate to say we won't go back, which would be such a shame because the place is beautiful.

Nh2yvCacys9ILjeUzEusTA.text: Upon moving to Vegas 2 years ago, this was one of the first places I heard about when I asked around, and I have had it bookmarked on yelp for a long time. My bf and I tried coming here on Valentine's Day, but it was too packed and we agreed we would come back another time.  We went last night and let me tell you it was not worth the hype. We were very disappointed. The waitress was non existent. Never asked us if we wanted anything to drink, and when we did we couldn't find her or anyone to flag down to ask. So we never got drinks other than water. The time from the appetizers to the food was so long, at least 30 minutes.  "That's okay, it'll be worth the wait", or so I thought.. but the sauce tasted like it came out of a can.  It was not good at all. Not one of us (party of 4) ate our meals and no one even asked why. Then we were just sitting around waiting for someone to clear our table, ask if we want dessert, give us the check, etc. no one ever came. My boyfriend had to get up and go to the kitchen where the waiter/waitress stand with the cash register is and ask for our check!!! Yes he had to get up and get his own check because no one ever came! I can't believe I was excited about this place. We left extreme minimal tip, and even that was being generous. I don't like to pay for service I don't receive. I will never recommend noras Italian cuisine to anyone, in fact, I will tell people to stay away from it.

ZhDRxcj72b4i3zckri4OSw.text: Their new location is beautiful. We were a big group and service was still great and food arrived quickly and together.  Starters weren't the best I've had... They were just ok. I love Italian food but that was more American Italian...  We had Bruschetta, caprese and grilled veggies. All nice but nothing special.  For an entree I got Alfredo ravioli which was really good. All my friends food looked great as well.   I recommend the gnocchi

ndLFRwixteTy4eLFdL6xNQ.text: The best Italian you'll ever have. Their food is incredible, their portions are huge and their staff is friendly. I wish they were in Los Angeles.  My favorite is their carbonara. They also have a delicious calimari with a pesto-red sauce. And their garlic bread is to die for.

kTyqevcxKakFn7eeF3WL5Q.text: After all the hype I expected the food to be really good. Maybe it was an off day but my eggplant parmesan looked good but it was very bland with no garlic, Italian flavor at all. The side of pasta had about two tablespoons of sauce, also not flavorful. My husband's sausage did not taste like sausage, also not flavorful.   It was very noisy and you could hardly hear each other. But the waiter was very nice and accommodating. May give it one more chance on the patio.

7iykzCpojM-kz0V3gxkQsw.text: Very disappointed with the quality of the food for the price. I got super watery spaghetti and I just was not thrilled with not only that but the service had to ask the waiter for five different times for extra napkins and just not great anymore such a shame.

17qcrzkUwalWB_RMQdHHJA.text: I had the Eggplant parmigiana. Not so good. It had a weird taste and unevenly cooked.

Pw7abrqTIOMeA3X-bj_Dqg.text: The food is delicious and I love the staff.  It took longer than usual to get our food in the new location but I just contributed that to the fact that it was a bigger crowd and perhaps the chefs are just adjusting to cooking for more people at once.  I'm addicted to the veal Scallopini and they make it gluten free if you ask. Be sure to sign up for their email club and get their olive appetizer for free.

cjKrBsjKUMDYD248JsFwWw.text: Another local Vegas gem hidden in a strip mall! I've eaten here several times and order take out occasionally. Sauces are amazing, pasta al dente, and it's all fresh. I love that it's an authentic restaurant but offers a variety of delicious dishes not found at most Italian places. Huge fan of their Farro salad!! Chewy & healthy!! The Arrabbiata sauce is spicy enough, so good that I get it with angel hair.. Yum! Nice cozy ambiance, great fir a date!

fT_ZKg75PdDnH4hIEMXQhg.text: In all the times we have visited Nora's we have never had a bad meal and we are Italian and no good food. Jo-Mar is a Great asset to the success of this restaurant because he Loves what he does. Always a gentleman when greeting you at the door or coming to say hi to us at the table and smiling away. I love the Frutti Di Mare and it is always a wonderful dish with plenty to take home. My wife love the Alfredo and a few others too. We got a Pizza appetizer one time and even that was a great pie. You will never get a bad meal here, believe me.

O6GlnCbghOagb85HzqscJQ.text: The food was good however, I made reservations 4 hours prior to going and when I got there my reservation was not ready which didn't fly by me.   Also as soon as we sat eventually the waitress didn't seem to customer friendly and when she asked to see our ID's for alcoholic beverages she said that she couldn't tell the difference between the IDs (assuming she thinks all Asians look alike) which also bothered me because the initial issue was lingering.   I like that they give you an extra glass of sangria with the purchase of one and as long as you check in.   Keep in mind I reserved a dinner for 7 because it was one of my family members birthday and I wanted to take her out.   When dinner was finally served everyone got their food except me! Apparently they just forgot to put it in.   When I got the final bill I noticed she didn't charge me for certain things I'm assuming cause she knew I was upset.   Fortunately I'm not an asshole(excuse the language) and still tipped her about 18%.   The food was great I enjoyed my meal, two calamaris we ordered for appetizers. The portions are great I guess personally the restaurant didn't give me a positive vibe.

JJcEYucjjASIWhb2zwJ7Tg.text: Horrible food! We've been there 3 times so far, the first 2 times were tolerable, but we picked up some Fettuccine Alfredo and a vegetarian pizza. My husband had the pasta and it tasted like it's been prepared in a fish frying pan. My pizza was easily the WORST pizza I have ever had and I've had some bad pizzas in Las Vegas. The tomato on the pizza looked like they have dumped old cans of tomato on the pizza. It was tasteless. A few hours after eating we both started having terrible stomachaches and coughs. Felt like the food has bleach in it the way it was burning through my colon and throat. I'm never eating at this place ever again, 33 dollars down the drain.

CNfrE99HIXNZD1ddSnVmnA.text: This restaurant needs to be on an episode of bar rescue!!! Someone please help them! I've been waiting for my food since 7:13pm it is now 8:10pm...

WHlvwNmc1vkPcXq9uMw_8w.text: Storefront location hides a very good place for Italian. I waited short time for a table and was asked to be patient, my server had to catch up.  I thought, here we go, crap service, but he dropped 4 checks in quick order.  At his suggestion I ordered the calamari ap and rigatoni special for entree.  Calamari was crispy and good, the sauce better than average. This sauce is what keeps this from being a five star review.  The rigatoni was fantastic! Pasta was perfect, sauce great, and meat perfect.  Add excellent service and Nora's will be seeing me often when I get to Vegas.

H_drblNBK4QJLRSby38UWA.text: Took my love here for din din on last night in Vegas. Would of went to Rao's in Caesars but had little Buster with us and wanted to be able to leave him in the car safely. Nora's is the kind of Italian restaurant that you would go to all the time if you lived in Vegas. Just looking around at the packed house you get the feeling that none of the diners are from the hotels. Had a decent veal parm plate. If I would change anything I would stop the use of the salamander.  The hot plate warning when the server delivers the plate has almost always been the first sign of a mediocre meal. This case was different as the veal was delicious and the melted cheese a velvet blanket of goodness. Can't wait to try it again next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper uncle Eddie?

xisdLmlZssVL0ZPnovPsYg.text: Just absolutely stunning cuisine. Most authentic Italian Food in all of Las Vegas. Went in for the 1st time with a friend who recommended this place for our date night. Have to admit was a bit skeptical being from Bensonhurst Brooklyn. Was blown away by the food and was pleasantly surprised by the live jazz band they had performing (Saturday night). I will definitely be frequenting this establishment

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Caprese Salad
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live Jazz at Nora&#39;s Cuisine Las Vegas (Saturday night )

SruCnjHPZ1h4QzOI6KXTzw.text: Very cozy, friendly staff and affordable prices. Love the atmosphere and the food are awesome!

sBgNo8TzbP3HzBM2NE3i-Q.text: Nice Neighborly Vibe and Good Food.....  Pros:   Good portions and value.  Friendly atmosphere.  Not far from the Strip. Cons:  Perhaps too popular?  If you want fancy, look elsewhere.  Ratings: -   Overall:    4 -   Food Quality:  3-4 -   Food Quantity:  4 -   Menu:   4 -   Wine List:   3 -   Service:   5 -   Fancy Factor:   2 -   Neighborly Feel:    5 -   Smell:    5 -   Cost:     4 -   Value:     5  My wife and I, along with 3 other couples from San Jose, traveled to Las Vegas to meet another couple for the husband's 65th birthday.  Friends had a strong recommendation for Nora's from people they trust, so the group agreed to have one of our 3 dinners at this restaurant.  Although we stayed in a hotel along the infamous Strip, Nora's was only a 10 minute cab ride to the west.  As many Yelpers have noted, it's not a fancy place from the outside...and not exactly on the inside either... but some of the best Italian food we've found was in similar surroundings ( like the late lamented Gaetano's in the LA suburb of La Habra and some in our hometown of San Jose ).  We had reservations for 10 people at 915 PM on a Thursday evening, but when we arrived at 9 PM, it was packed.  No surprise according to plenty of reviewers.  But the guy handling reception duties, servers  and even other customers waiting for tables were in a good mood.  Is everyone in Las Vegas a comedian ( or trying to be )?  By the way, there was one promising sign of a happy meal to come.  We all know how big promises can lead to big disappointment, but I've noticed...at least with Italian restaurants...if it smells good in the parking lot, it usually tastes good later on.  Nora's passed the smell test.  Patrons were slow to leave, but one table left at 915 PM so some of the staff rearranged things and our group got into their chairs by 925 PM.  A bit late for me ( I typically start dinner about 7 ), though we were on Vegas time. Although we shared the room with a party of 20 celebrating a birthday, there was no cramping of space for us or several other tables for 2 and 4.  Age has its benefits, but short-term memory is not one of them.  Details on the food have faded into a haze ( maybe from the casino in the Mirage.  What a hell hole! ), but longer lasting impressions are important, too.  The menu was quite large and varied with many favorites recognized from the lists of Italian restaurants in neighborhoods around the country.  Question was...how well did Nora's handle the job?  First thing on the table were loaves of garlic bread.  I usually can't resist that stuff, especially is it's half decent, and it was really good that night.  Or maybe I was just starved.  Either way, after a basket of bread and part of my draft beer, I began to breathe as if the waiter brought a dose of smelling salts.  I'll always remember my mother saying "don't load up on bread", but it's a hard habit to break.  Friends passed around several salads, though since I'm not a sharer, I kept my plate behind a moat of utensils.  That's just as well.  I need my own salad every day...and it was quite good.  Nobody at the table voiced any disagreement.  My entree was eggplant parmagiana, which as a "chicken-fish" vegetarian, I seem to order a lot of the time.  I'd give it an 8 on a scale of 10.  Not bad!  Good size, texture and tomato taste.  The side order of spaghetti was also respectable.  My wife's chicken marsala was good, but she thought the sauce was too sweet.  I can't remember what our friends had, but nobody raised their hand to complain, at least publicly. By the time we finished at 11 PM, our group of greying baby boomers was a tad tuckered, so we bypassed dessert and called cabs for the short ride back to the Mirage.  We split the bill evenly among the 5 couples and each paid an astoundingly small $44 plus tip.  That's a lotta food in a high priced town.  Service was friendly in a good-natured, smart-alecky way.  The oldest member of the staff I spotted was in his 30's, so it seemed like a bunch of neighborhood kids...the family?...running the restaurant and having fun doing it.  You almost felt like a regular after one visit.  There must be tons of Italian restaurants around Las Vegas, but if you need to get away from crowds in the big hotels, Nora's is a solid choice for eating within a decent distance of your room.

hK2_TpJnMMAKJU0gvAqkpg.text: My wife and I went to Nora's because her sons were regulars there.  We were suppose to meet them there as they were treating us to dinner.  We got there before my step son's did and tried to tell Nora's we were in their party but was greeted with disdain.  They mistreated us so poorly we almost walked out.    Soon my step son's arrived.  When Nora's saw who they were, they changed their tune.  All of a sudden, we were okay.  That didn't sit well with me.  I can't tell you if the food was good because my appetite was ruined.  Note to Nora's.  Since that happened, we have never been back and that was about ten years ago.  You should have treated us with respect like your regulars because we could have been new regulars.  Now you lost a potential regular and your old regular.

7YnZtcCbSNcXqb-kmtGxlA.text: Nora's is one of my favorite local spots of Italian. It's always crowded at night so I recommend making a reservation. Their food is so delicious and anything with ricotta cheese is my favorite!

QuTzDTKxh_VRZ7ve6IHsxQ.text: Service is always great and the food is awesome.  Truffle fries was a disappointment as it was recommended.  The veal and salad lunch special was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sangria!!

yDDZvU4oifE-wD63eMUP1w.text: We waited FOREVER! Not only did we wait for a long time to receive our food (other tables seated after us got their food first) but we also waited for our check for a long time. We were temped to leave because there was no one around. The food was decent but definitely not worth the wait. I can honestly say I will never return here or recommend to anyone.

P4JNJB47h2qv0tjDJAwuow.text: Spaghetti Lunch Special. Yum ! Can't beat it !  Everything is good on the menu.   Great wine bar. Full bar also.  At night they have live music in their parlor.  Definitely, a local favorite for me.

xj7UwWK0lFDlXoTsWQpoNw.text: If you want Great food and impeccable service, you need to check out Nora's.  We will definitely come on our next visit to Las Vegas.  Looking forward to seeing the new location when it opens.

rZNJbGbaHcjku_86EH-4IA.text: Excellent Italian restaurant!  I highly recommend, but be prepared to wait or make reservations.  All items ordered were outstanding.

e62kWuEhinhwXZn8GOqURQ.text: Great food, great service, outstanding live jazz, wonderful atmosphere.  The open kitchen and well appointed bar completes a place that feels so good for entertaining of just relaxing with a good bottle of wine and friends.

PF9znFXmack2zNZjHKFLiw.text: I think the thing I love most about Nora's is that it is a little bit casual and a little bit dressy, oh and the food! The tables are covered in white linens and butcher paper which gives it a formal feel without the pretentiousness and cost. Whenever my parents are in town we head straight to Nora's to appease my Italian loving dad.  The Italian food is hearty and delicious. Every table starts with a basket of crunchy garlic bread. The pieces are covered in garlic and a good size, so you won't feel so guilty about eating 10 of them. You want to order an appetizer, either the mozzarella caprese or an antipasto, trust me they are both seasoned perfectly and hit the spot. My current favorite pasta is the Rigatoni Special, I mean it has meatballs AND sausage, you can't go wrong! I will say that I have had the lasagna and I'm not such a fan. It wasn't really special and I'm pretty sure mine is better. My husband always gets the Pork Tenderloin alla Siciliana. The pork is melt in your mouth tender and the side of potatoes really puts it over the top. My dad is a sucker for their giant bone in Rib-eye, seriously it's giant so bring your appetite. The pizza is just as good as the pasta, but I always end up ordering pasta. Oh and be sure to pre-order the chocolate cake, you want the chocolate cake! It's so melt-ey and molten-ey and lava-ey, all the -ey!  Nora's is really the best bang for your buck when it comes to Italian food in Las Vegas. The prices are good, the ambiance is great, and the food is fantastic!

_2CANAAiNBcZyaUBCiSBkQ.text: Some of the best Italian food I've had in a while! Husband and I decided to try it out for my birthday on Saturday and definitely weren't disappointed. The wait wasn't very long and we enjoyed 2-for-1 sangria (check in on yelp!) at the bar while they got a table ready for us. Everything we ordered came out quickly and was hot and delicious! We will definitely be back!

cOh0yKNmIXqUy_A9PAZRqA.text: New favorite Italian spot! The food was absolutely to die for and the best glass of Moscato I've ever had!

a3M84jOjG-4dRBTZ2VSA7g.text: We were introduced to this place by a business friend and now we take business friends there when we're in town. We've never had anything bad here.

O_zxIW3SiHUDUJypafUoJA.text: Great evening at Nora's.  Don't forget to make a reservation...like us.  Quick service at the bar and we were able to grab a quick bite.  Service was amazing!  Started with the Caprese salad.  Mozzarella was fresh and great flavor.  Split the Crazy Alfredo and it was wonderful too.  Perfect portion for two.  Special attention from the owner put the exclamation mark on the evening.  We will definitely be back anytime we're in Vegas.

DHVcfaV_1TjGEKCDU8dlsg.text: Nora's never disappoints! The food is consistently outstanding and the quaint atmosphere is comfortable and appealing. Chicken Carciofi was soooo good. And their cheesecake is to die for!

B-ExQpQ-oaaOJB3Khq_Exg.text: Love Noras, outstanding food, cute little place and a great value.  Try the antipasta and crazy alfredo.

DPepn4dvCnmplSFhK0TEng.text: The food here is awesome...like, seriously awesome. I've tried several of the dishes and haven't had a bad meal yet.  Also awesome: the wait staff. I find that here in Las Vegas its hard to find good service (which is odd because I would have thought the opposite) so I love coming here to dine in because its always a very pleasant experience. Ask for Anthony or Don they are both fantastic and friendly servers. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because their dining rooms are extremely crowded when busy and it feels very claustrophobic in those situations. It won't stop me from going back though!

tBxuitFGD42V6pu5x5XjjQ.text: Intimate dining, thus need reservation or you will wait. Food was excellent, service was pleasant. Prompt service, did not have to wait more than 10 mins for food. Drink refills were very timely. Prices were reasonable. Only negative, garlic breadsticks were not very fresh. Other than that it was a good experience.

MJ_-TL62BUPQCS_lWALuIw.text: I still like The chicken alfredo at carrabbas better but The pizza here was great along with The service, Check in And you get a Free glass of wine (And it's actually good!) will definitely go back. Bring a sweater because they keep it pretty cold in there!

1M4VkNpgV_fnHTbwCsNNMg.text: Best Italian Food Ever.! Local spot..! Only eat here if you want really good good...BW

rX5GaRXUnIMi-nHaW_ncOg.text: I have been eating here frequently for over 10 years.  I had my high school graduation party, wedding rehearsal dinner, and countless anniversaries/birthdays/family dinners here.  Sometimes this place can be packed for dinner so I definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time.  They give amazing garlic bread before your meal comes and they have the BEST antipasta salad and cannolis ever!  My mouth is watering while typing this...

HQD4bWOrbTBOe9dZUKOgmw.text: This has become our go-to local spot for Italian.  It's always packed - so reservations are highly recommended, although we went the first time without, and they found us a table by the kitchen (which was really pretty interesting). Food is great.  The Pasta Fagiole is a lovely starter, and their Signature Salad of Spinach, Farro and Gorgonzola is my new obsession.  Hubby had Veal Parmigiana - one of his new favorites.  The pasta is lovely and fresh, and the garlic bread is absolutely wonderful!  (Bring breath mints).  A reasonable wine list rounds out the evening, and the tiramisou haunts my dreams.

CGa9_EnrYhKvtfC4yMxu_Q.text: Been here twice with a party of 10 or more each time. Everyone loved their food (especially the crazy alfredo) and Bryce knows what he's doing...great waiter.

DAqe4biiqraPUm0aRRc6Vg.text: This restaurant is outstanding!   We were visiting Las Vegas from Florida and were staying on The Strip.  Fortunately we had a rental car, allowing us to drive the 3 or 4 miles to Nora's.  Located in a strip shopping center with limited parking, we never would have guessed that this place would be so good.  The food and service were top-notch and Sinatra was playing in the background.  The garlic bread was delicious, as was the Arancini appetizer, a risotto and cheese starter.  Some of the entrees were so inexpensive that it made us think twice for a moment - $10.50 for a large portion of eggplant parmigiana.  Others in our party ordered chicken, veal, and pasta dishes.  All were very reasonably priced and a nice break from the touristy places in or near the big hotels.  We loved Nora's and will absolutely return the next time we're in Las Vegas.  Thanks to Yelp for the favorable reviews!

dwAC78lPjZ63uD9zLVaUWA.text: My wife and I were doing a brief get away in Vegas. We can only handle one or two nights of all the Strip has to offer, and were really wanting something more mom & pop'ish. We found this place on Yelp and saw several great reviews. We decided to give it a try.   We made same day reservations and they seated us within 5 minutes even though we were running a little late. When you walk in you're hit by a great smell and the place feels like a happening local food spot.   We had over-eaten all weekend a weren't terribly hungry, so we ordered a little lite. We split the Veal Marsala. Incredible sauce and great meat. It was the best Marsala sauce we've ever tried. It came with a side of spaghetti that was good as well. We also had a bowl of pasta soup (Farmagiano?) that was huge, hearty (filled with beans and pasta shells) an was great. I had a gratis glass of house red via our friends at yelp and we were out the door for $30.   If you're looking for a friendly, home style change of pace from the big-ness of Vegas, and are craving great and affordable Italian food, do yourself a favor and check this place out. Highly recommended.

ggqkmFkEKkEJVXSYtuWRew.text: Good food at a reasonable price :) also when the restaurant starting getting busy, so did our waitress. We really didn't mind, but she came at the end and gave us tiramisu and apologized if we had felt forgotten! :):) it was really sweet.

D0g6m8l0FkKL6S3u7SFEew.text: When your diet allows for Italian and carbs, this is the best place. I love eating at the bar, when there's room of course. The bartenders are cool.  Pasta Nora is my favorite dish. Spag and meat sauce in bowl, covered by eggplants, and then baked to crisp-up the blanket of eggplants thats covering the pasta. Oh so good.   Good selection of wine as well.

YZG-cMV5zvbCd1Is7AbNLA.text: Good service.  Intimate warm setting. Good food.  Caprese was great.  Impressed.

GqN6dIyif-2-q59g7hhD3Q.text: Good but busy and food a tad bit salty.  They are usually short staffed so food is slow to come out, but okay on drink refills and break.   Prices are fair.

mOJcP7yWlVmF34Hp6FHV0Q.text: Their on-line reservation system can create problems. We made reservations on-line and it was submitted and seems fine until we arrived and had no reservations. They explained that since that time wasn't available it automatically made the reservation for the following night??? They did fit us in. The place was busy but dinner took us 2 1/2 hours. They messed up the cocktails twice. When asked where they were, she went back to check and never came back. The manager (not sure since he didn't his position) came over to ask if there was anything we need and I explained how my cocktail never arrived and that I had asked our server about it. He said he'd check. I said that if it was up already to just cancel it since the wine that we ordered should be arriving soon. Never heard back but the wine arrived 15 minutes later. Unfortunately the food didn't. When it did it was good which is normal for Nora's. Then the computer system supposedly when down and our bill took another 20 minutes to get to us. Overall, not a good experience. As the events continued to spiral out of control, the server nor the night manager ever came over to keep us updated nor to just say sorry for the missteps. The front of the house doesn't seem to have a good handle on what's going on or maybe they don't value their customers dining experience???

-G_fL5t4SR5viFA4ar_G6w.text: Sat an hour after our reservation. Appetizers took another half hour to come out. Never had water refilled. First round of cocktails made at the bar were outstanding, second round at the table were awful. Food was pretty good, but the whole experience would not make me want to come back.

dpxJzCScblpMthck_07Egg.text: I went for the 1st time today. All I have to say is WOW! Our food was delicious some of the best pasta I have ever eaten. Better than most of the Vegas Strip pasta places. I will be definitely making this my goto place.

nPVTCT2bpo0cwPWTGi1iDQ.text: My experience at Nora's was great! It was my first time here, but a lot of my friends had recommended the place to me. We had the octopus (grilled, delicious), arancini (fried risotto balls with tomato sauce), carbonara (creamy, perfectly cooked pasta), and the veal canneloni (fresh pasta, veal was amazing). The only gripe i had was the rib-eye we ordered was not salted enough, but I happen to have a saltier palate. Overall though, with the amount of food and drinks that we ordered, the meal was surprisingly affordable. Will return!
