4x96hZeFmMqicAaBehYFnQ.text: Not very good but not bad either in some areas. Our server was great. My lasagna was not fresh. You could tell because the noddles were losing there color n it was like eating mushy French bread. My wife's spaghetti and meat sauce tasted like the sauce was burnt or that taste it gets when cooked over and over again as my dad would say (he and his brothers own Commini's restaurant in Trenton, NJ before they sold it and taght me that).  The Italian sausage on the side I asked for was good.  My daughter liked her linguini and clams and I tasted it and it was pretty good. Her desert was good too.  My cheesecake was very disappointing.  It was no bigger in diameter than a planters peanut can n only an inch thick n 1/4 was icing and another was the crust. All i could taste was the crust. The coffee was watered down and did not taste like Lav Azza (all I drink at home btw) but more like Folgers so Idk if they actually serve Lav Azza but it was written on the cup so we think they are supposed too.  I won't go back and will stick with the authentic Italian one we found on eastern ave in Henderson.

KtvE34DOJb0oEFSFsYnkLw.text: I literally have no complaints about this place. The food was FANTASTIC. Everything from the drinks to the apps to the entrees was delicious! Even the garlic bread that comes to the table was amazing! I had the penne a la vodka and added some veggies...it sounds basic but somehow they took this average dish and made it amazing! Our server was very friendly and service was fairly fast. Will go back every time I'm in Vegas!

X0kwzMCNbPRmdIl5InAMxA.text: Reservation:  7:15 pm Seated:  7:35 pm Out of the Restaurant: 9:37 pm Party Size:  3  This place is definitely a local spot. The food is decent but the service is so, so slow. My family and I ordered salads to start and then we got a  pizza and 2 pastas.  Salad:  I had the Caesar and my mom had the house. Way too much dressing and cheeses on both.   Pizza and Pasta:  The pizza was ok and the pasta again was nice, cooked on point but again way too saucy. Almost overwhelming.   Service:  We were a table of 3. We did not order anything complicated.  We did not leave until 9:37 pm. It took almost 50 minutes from the time that we finished our salad to get our entree. Absurd!  The waitress did come by and say it would be just a few more minutes however that's just nonsense. There was a large table of 12 that they needed to serve before us apparently and that is why the wait was so long. We were about 5 minutes from walking out.  Management seemed to be more focused on the locals at the bar as opposed to getting the food out. Disappointing.   No one should have to wait that long for decent if not average food. Quite disappointing considering all of the '5 star' reviews. Not worth it.

3fHzB9fDiKXlxJKu1Q5T7w.text: Get the Crazy Alfredo. It was excellent!  My wife had the Melrose and it was just as good. Great service from Marla, thank you!  We'll be back for sure!

Q10ubAkUajDS_P8L2hRGPA.text: Gr8 westside Italian restaurant w/good service, fine food and classy ambience.  Pasta dishes are amazing and nice selection of salads, appetizers and entrees.  Bar is fantastic w/full selection of spirits.  Nice patio dining and indoor tables give you privacy.  Intimate dining rooms for groups and meetings.  Can have wait time and parking lot is not big enough.  However, family friendly and generous portions for leftovers.

55_2iANI99y68nWPPxE83w.text: Food was average in my opinion despite ordering the chef's recommendations. Service was okay. Was seated next to the kitchen which was an absolute disappointment. Would not recommend.

Pt0aLlcjRty_lxXYu0mHCg.text: I came here with my family for my birthday dinner. Found them on yelp, trying new restaurants. The ambiance and decor was amazing. Our server was very attentive. We had truffle fries for an appetizer, and they were also amazing. The bread is made to order and fresh. All of our food was beyond expectations. We will definitely be back.

8klyQdRdC441KqSiEL-2_w.text: Tip: their pasta is huge so you can share it with someone else.   I like the chocolate cake it's really yummy. I'm not sure how they make it but it's def a must try.   I'm not super impressed with their pasta but the pizza is good. I always get the calamari for the appetizer and like it all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari, really good.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with meat sauce, it also comes with mushroom. Not too good so I won&#39;t recommend ordering this.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake with pistachio

vS_6AHYMPTFwcyENeJisjg.text: My girlfriend and I visited Nora's for my birthday dinner and I found the food to be "wanting". We began our night with the Arancini and in all fairness they were outstanding! The main courses were only mediocre at best. I had the veal marsala, which the meat was over cooked and the wine mushroom glaze while providing excellent initial taste had a horrible bitter finish. My girlfriend had the Frutti De Mare which the pasta and sauce were very well done but the seafood was cooked too long which resulted in rubberized morsels. Overall it must have been an off night, I will go back again, but was not impressed with my first time going. On a side note the wait staff was top notch and very attentive.

vTTRCApv5oH7IueRYo8FAg.text: Delicious food, big portions, restaurant is beautifully decorated and staff is always friendly. We love the calamari, frutti de mar, crazy alfredo and fried chicken.

CdmonGbD1ln69T8NNlpvBw.text: Most sad to write this review. This is my second time at the new location and will not return.  I have been a frequent diner for over 10 years, loved the old space and the controlled chaos and of course the food. My first experience was better than my latest. Food seemed to be the same quality my first go around. This time, not so much ... salty, 3 small average meatballs and not the 2 delicious meatballs that were standard. Our waiter was awesome upon arrival, but was over worked and distracted by the end.  He told us he had to pull our appetizers and plates because our entrees were ready and continued to be rushed throughout the remainder of the night.  My husband had puttanesca and said for the record it was really good.  However, even the house salad was different.  Super sad day for me! I loved this place.

vLSzSS6SiMxOnxlb3Mpjuw.text: Great variety and quality Italian food  Gets you off the Strip and serves you great quality food

I-rHuW5F0TG10tm3oPK3lQ.text: First time at this yummy Italian place. I sat next to a regular, and he told me to get pasta with vodka sauce or to get the Melrose. I went with the Melrose, which is a super rich pesto dish I got with chicken. It was delicious! Full of pine nuts too! I could only eat about half of it. When I come back to town, I'm bringing my husband there!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melrose

j3I7X4836QAm6BknF0ydRw.text: Best Italian in Vegas. Good quality food for slightly better prices than the Strip Restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Boar Pasta: Spectacular! They stew the meet and mix he gravy with a little bit of tomato sauce. It dissolves in your mouth!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capresse: although is not Buffala, the plate was very good. Good quality mozzarella, and plenty of green to accompany.

AInjmYjeAPQvOnGZp22TIg.text: So far this is one of our favorite Italian restaurants that we have found in Vegas.  My husband loves the Scampi: huge prawns in a lemony garlic butter sauce.  Establishment appears to be a locals hangout....excellent service...I would definitely recommend reaervations.....solid memorable dinner!

ilYx-2lwpgErbXUJoQColw.text: This is one of the best Italian places in town! They always have amazing food and great service!!!

dlBLq-a2WDxbaBv049rlgg.text: I've been wanting to try Nora's for quite some time. Made reservations for two. Had only a five minute wait for the table. The complimentary garlic was delicious. Ordered the steak bruschetta for appetizer. It was basically overcooked Philly meat....disappointing. Had the rigatoni Gorgonzola with chicken. It lacked any sort of flavor and the chicken was rubbery. Maybe I needed to try something else. It was quite busy. Also they had bread pudding on the menu which is my personal favorite, again I was underwhelmed. Service was lovely though.

QttxebULvcIkFc5n9mDnRQ.text: The uber driver's navigation couldn't get us there, but Google came to the rescue and we made our reservation.   We were seated immediately and our server, Ed, came to greet us with a smile. He made good recommendations and we were pleased.   Starters were tasty. The shrimp scampi was very good. Lots of tasty garlic bread to sop up the sauce. Would I make the bread crispier? Yes Did I eat it? Yes Would I order it again? Yes  The Mozzarella Cambrese was fine. Cheese was on the edge of grainy....not awesome, but fine.  The Osso Bucco was outstanding. Tender but not overcooked. Delicious and sumptuous.  The crazy alfredo was excellent, although a little stingy with the protein, but still, quite tasty.  Veal Parm was solid.  The surprise of the table was salmon piccata. As dish that would be easy to mess up...they didn't. They married those hard to meld flavors into something special.  While I have no need to return to Vegas this year, if I do...we will return.

3x6gpQQYIpCyquHAeS7GXg.text: Meh, this place is alright. We tried to make a reservation but the lady on the phone was unintelligible so we just went and had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. We sat in the "kitchen area" which is not a great place to sit due to all the servers constantly going back and forth.   Once seated expect the server to make a concerted effort to get the table to get a salad (which are $11.50 to $17.90). The unaware diner might get the sense that they come with dinner as the servers never really let on that it doesn't and you have to pay for it.   Of the 3 dishes our group got I'd only recommend the Fettuccine Carbonara which is alfredo sauce, ham & prosciutto. If you're on a diet you may want to steer clear though as there is some serious fat in this dish....we took the remainder to go and after being refrigerated the fats all solidified into a hard pasta-brick. Hmmmm.  The Alla Nora is over-rated. For one thing the spaghetti was overcooked so bad that I could never twirl it into a forkful...the spaghettis would simply break so I had all these tiny sections I had to fork up. Plus it says there is eggplant in it but I couldn't find any...? Meh.

x2BiaJF4kxy10Y69HovYkg.text: I hate to write such a bad review but I have to. It was my friends birthday and we had a party of 10. Our reservation was on time which was good but they sat us at this round table. The chairs were touching each other and the silverware was touching the next person. Not only were we touching legs but we couldn't even open our menu without getting in the space of the next person. When we asked the host staff to move us and that fitting that many people at a table was really uncomfortable, she said to us: We always sit large parties here and there is never any problem. She basically made it seem like we were crazy. The server agreed that they were crazy for sitting us all at that table and went and spoke with the manager. They basically said we would have to wait until another large table opened up to move. We ordered a few bottles of wine and waited for a table. It took them 1 HOUR. tables were opening up next to us, they could have put two tables together to accommodate us. It was clear they were irritated that we wouldn't try to eat squished together.   Once we got the new table, we got a new server who never came to the table. We had to flag down other staff to ask for water or whatever we needed.  My food was burnt. The list goes on.....  Terrible experience for a birthday. The old location was amazing but now its like all service has gone out the window. very sad to say.

hXwiX1sE6Xn81EU00UmH7Q.text: Nora's never disappoints, food is always amazing! But they should train their young hostess ladies.     My party of 5 was told that our wait was going to be around an hour, but we had to wait 1 hour and 45minutes. (We would've gone to another restaurant if we were told that the wait was going to be nearly 2 hours.)     While waiting in line, we saw several of parties of 2 who came in after us getting sat before us, but we waited thinking they were taking a long time to make a larger table for us. But NO, we were cramped into a 4ppl table; the same-sized table as those parties of 2. We spoke to the manager and he kindly comped our appetizer and salad.     Anthony, our server was attentive and professional, and he made sure we had a great dinner after all.        (I do not know the name of the manager, but if he is reading this, i would like to say that I'm sorry if we ranted too much and gave you one of the hardest nights. We were very hungry and upset. A five-star review is for my apologies.)

iYqfvw0dlTTdoI2uVjS9Tw.text: Excellent service and amazing food. While on business 3rd night in Vegas, we decided to have dinner at Nora's. Coworkers choice, she's been here before. New location, warm feeling and great ambiance. Ordered ice tea for drinks and they kept refilling our teas and all without asking. The bread was a bit overwhelming with the garlic but still fresh and good. Ordered a house salad before the main dish and it was just the right portion and delicious. Main course was whole wheat penne pasta with pesto sauce. What I loved about this place was that our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. She even offered to go light on the oil in the pesto sauce which I'm thankful for because it was perfect. The cannoli dessert was so good that I finished it all. The only reason  for the 4 stars was that our waitress was a bit MIA. We only saw her once during our dinner and when she brought dessert she acknowledge that and told us the dessert was on the house. Everyone was friendly from beginning to end  and it's easy to see why the locals come here. The restaurant does get packed. My recommendation is you make a reservation before hand and leave room for dessert. Thank you to our server's for the great service. My recommendation, make a reservation before you go to the restaurant and leave room for dessert. You will thank me later.  Location isn't to far from the Rio and worth visiting. Bon Apetito!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Cannoli
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole wheat penne pasta with pesto sauce
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad

cXoO4TPGLnDFFt7RNjvxGA.text: When we to Las Vegas we always look for off the Strip restaurants. We found a gem in Nora's Italian Cuisine. The food, service and cost of the meals were great. I would recommend reservations and you will not be disappointed.

FEcdnxRxeQ8MsnMbMPAToA.text: We had to come twice to get it this super busy restaurant. The first time we couldn't wait the estimated 1 hour wait so we tried again the next night and arrived shortly after 6pm. We got seats at the bar but 20 minutes later a table opened up so we were able to move. We ordered the House salad which was more than enough for the two of us. It was quite tasty with tiny mozzarella cubes, firm tomatoes, lettuce, olives and peppers. Our entree was the Crazy Alfredo which was a great combination of sausage, shrimp, roasted red pepper, and chicken. We had pre-ordered the chocolate cake. If you love lava cakes then this is the dessert to order. We shared all the dishes and were overstuffed. Don't eat too much garlic bread if you want to make it to the end of the meal because you will want to eat everything. We will definitely visit again the next time we are in Vegas. I would give this 4.5 stars....it would have been 5 if the wait isn't always so long.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake - save room for this dessert...similar to a lava cake...crispy on the ouside and super moist inside.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo - sooo good!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad - good for sharing. The tomatoes were super crispy.

tLTpd3DHvPvWBBX2SDzfGw.text: Great restaurant for a large party. We had a group of sixteen and they didn't miss a beat. Great food, atmosphere and service. Fan for life.

BEpWGImnRIK7tnPoJPLAew.text: This is our favorite Italian eatery while in Vegas. It gets quite busy so reserve a day ahead.  The food here is very rich in flavor and you won't be disappointed!  Service is on the mediocre side but the food will bring you back

BlzNFGlEeWZDuO99AQzttw.text: I have dined at the old Nora's location several times before, but this was the first time I went to the new location. The place is very nice, sad to learn that the patio on the upper floor was for banquets only, I felt it would be a perfect place for a happy hour (which Nora's does not offer).  As usual the place was packed, but we were seated right away, Anthony, our server was great, he answered all our questions and when we tried to order too much food, he directed us to cut a few items out (which was a good thing since we couldn't finish what we ordered anyway.)  The only complaint, we weren't  finished with our starters when they brought out the entrees. It did not ruin our meal, just a little "rookie mistake". Thanks we will return perhaps for a bit of afternoon vino and some bocci ball.

0gY97YOT8L6-9ZMVtP7wTw.text: Thank you for a great dinning experience on Valentines Day!!!! our reservations were for 4:15; They had us seated with a smile and ready to go at 3:34.  The dinner, wine, coffee, desert  was of top quality. The pricing for 3 dinners was spot on, and it was a pleasure to leave a tip for our servers A well worth 5 star review.

6SnTyi0mkf0LDf0NDEh5lA.text: So two lesbians walk in an Italian restaurant right? Lol...  The hostess looks at us and says "Yes, can I help you?" No smile, just attitude. 20-30 minute wait for a table so we opt for the bar. Bartender wasn't very attentive - asked us what we wanted to drink but didn't even give us a menu. We order a glass of wine which took ten minutes. Mind you we're at the bar and everyone else was already taken care of. The bartender comes finally and says she "spaced out." We finally order food and it takes half an hour, meanwhile the two other couples that say at the bar 15 mins after us already got their dishes. We only ordered a bowl of spaghetti - nothing too extravagant. The food finally arrives; there's hardly any sauce, the meat is burnt, and the noodles are stale. Long story short - the service was terrible and the simplest dish was horrible. We paid for the $8 glass of wine and went to Olive Garden.

pI3XMeyacDYJYihohWFTMA.text: Most people while visiting Vegas tend to eat in a restaurant right on the strip or in their hotel. However, my friends and I decided to venture elsewhere and jumped on Yelp for reviews. This is when we found this little gem.   We called ahead and made a reservation and was seated promptly upon arrival. They gave us a seat outside and even though it was 100 degrees that day, they had these little cool fans pointed our way so it didn't feel bad at all. My favorite thing about this restaurant was that it just felt like an Italian restaurant instead of being a flashy place to eat in Vegas. The crowd was a little older and there was a band playing music as we dined.  The servers were attentive and the food arrived promptly. We ordered the fried calamari to start which had a nice crunch to it. My main dish was the Primavera which was good. Everyone seemed to enjoy their dish and portions were big so we all had leftovers to take home. If I'm back in Vegas one day, I would check this place out again.

69Yoe2aEmGX_mPAYnBLrlg.text: Great food fun atmosphere I hear that Nora's is more moving to a larger location I hope the move doesn't change the place much. I love there food I had chicken Marsala and it was so tender and flavorful. Nora's has a great wine selection and large variety of menu items at a fair price. Save room for the in house made Italian desserts it was so good.

AcYl4el5QorZAKsVgLtQWQ.text: My buddy and I misjudged the walking distance from The Palms to Nora's on a 100+ degree evening. The entire walk over we were hoping for the best and that the food would be worth the trek. Nora's delivered just what we were craving. Garlic bread starter went down quickly and we ordered another basket (the first is on the house and any subsequent basket is on you). We had two amazing and large-portioned entrees: fettuccine carbonara and chicken parmesan (you can add any sauce over the pasta you want - I ordered the meat sauce).  The service was excellent. Friendly, attentive and quick servers supported by bus boys, drink boys and cute hostesses. After gorging ourselves, we decided to Uber back to the casino. Once Nora's moves to their brand new stand-alone location, we hope to be back on our next visit to Vegas!  (Also, eating off the strip is so much nicer. Supporting local restaurants has always been more rewarding and delicious!)

Z1rIhyj89J9OYcEZUFsutA.text: A great place for family and a quite night away from the strip ..  you forget you are in vegas once you are in there ! Not a bad thing when you want to enjoy great Italian food in great company with a glass of wine ..  !!

wgqoxk2X16HO99MiQWGg9Q.text: I have to say the food here was very mediocre. Decent house salad, great calamari, but the rest is just ok. Salmon was overcooked, we had to return our dessert because of how old it was, and the pasta was decent.

ZUzJarWt894PqK3wtpdQkw.text: Sadly the last couple of time I have been here it the experience has been underwhelming. Slow or busy the service just wasn't what it used to be.  The servers and the managers were too unprofessional and the servers were too sloppy and they looked miserable. Last two times I visited I asked simple questions about the menu and twice the server did not know, nor were they able to get an answer. I celebrated my 30th birthday here and that was my last good experience over four years ago. Sad to report this.

hvxf-730pvFlZ5cXmENyhw.text: The garlic bread is delicious.  Order a side of marinara to dip it in and you'll look like a real Italian.    The Crazy Alfredo was packed with shrimp, sausage, chicken, and half a dozen other items.  And it had just the right level of spiciness to complement the many other flavors packed into it!    My dining companion was looking for something simple and ordered the gnocchi with  marinara.  He enjoyed the dish immensely.  This is one of those hidden gems that will put smiles on visitors' faces forever!

cmmIUHTNKHw4X7sPuhLIcg.text: My friend took me to this place since I was visiting town and what can I say, amazing! We had made reservations and the staff greeted us and immediately sat us down. The service was excellent and everybody was very attentive. My friend had lasagna and I had a shrimp pizza (I added alfredo sauce) and they were good. Lasanga was not all that, but the pizza was on point. Definitely try this place.  Cons: was a little too loud for my type of ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pizza with Alfredo sauce and tomato! Simply amazing

jyczxNrmxm05GqmSLC35Fg.text: Went to Noras last night at their new location.  I have to say I was extremely disappointed. Way too loud inside as the music was blaring!   The service was beyond horrible.  We were seated at our table for about ten minutes before anyone ever came over to greet us.  No busser came to the table to provide water or take a drink order.  Once we did order our server came back only  once to ask how things were.  The food was not nearly on point as it used to be.  The marinara sauce that came out was luke warm at best.  Very very disappointing since we have loved Noras in the past.  Will not be returning.

7xBRbcw2WazpRD-oF4npPg.text: Italian food is tough to get wrong, but also tough to get right. Nora's gets it almost right, but I don't find it to be the local legend people make it out to be.  The complimentary (well, uh, the first basket at least, which is pretty miserly!) bread is pretty good - flavorful and crisp, and buttery on top. Just a little burned on the edges too, which helps. The appetizers and entrees, while tasty, just aren't rich and robust enough to be legendary. The pasta has never seemed particularly fresh to me, and the portions are pretty tiny. Still, it's good, hearty Italian food - just a bit generic.  Last time, I was daring and tried the Chicken Mount Etna. Don't repeat my mistake. Its flavor is more Chinese than Italian.  Lastly, a couple of non-food-related critiques:  1. Service can be inattentive at times, but they get pretty insanely busy so it's excusable.  2. Try and avoid the obnoxious band. If I want live music, I'll go to a concert. 2a. It's loud as hell in there, even when there isn't a band.  3. They partake in possibly my most-hated restaurant ritual - having empty wine glasses on the table upon arrival. Prepare for an awkward moment and a subtly disappointed waiter when you don't order wine.  When you're in the mood for no-nonsense Italian, Nora's can certainly hit the spot. I just didn't find that it lives up to its reputation.

N5NoaQy59JE7gdlB7dsVkg.text: Such an amazing iconic vegas off the strip spot!!! Had the calamari and anti pasta salad... had truffle fries but no sauce served with them... staff said out of ketchup.. but overall new Nora's is great!!! Can't wait for patio next time!!

I6Y_--cG71-gCaOfM6ZXrw.text: Great place! We got the prosciutto pizza, which was absolutely delicious! I dragged my grandmother despite the fact that she said she wasn't hungry and she had 4 slices!

wSHkUdqExiB-UZA3RUq4nw.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been going here for over 12 years and still look forward to every trip. Great quality and affordable!

NLBv2dKmUs-twdG_jo_P_A.text: Awesome food. Great service! Other reviews mentioned a long wait, that was not the case for us. Atmosphere and music set this place apart. Will definitely return.

_4m4TvYncvO3Tyr-3rTUAQ.text: Noras has been my favorite Italian restaurant for  the past two years. My husband and I had not gone for dinner in probably 6 months. I was craving my favorite Fettuccine Carbonara all week so we decided to come for dinner last night (Friday, June 19) for our anniversary. Unfortunately the food gave me food poisoning. We had to cut our "date" short since I had the worst stomach pains. I know for a fact it was my food because I didn't eat most of it and brought it home. Today my husband had my left overs for dinner and now he has food poisoning. I'm not sure if I will be returning due to this recent experience. We also had calamari as an appetizer and that tasted great.

VkXhJHibMlfCkYz9emCYkA.text: Just tried this restaurant in the new building,seated behind the host station as you enter don't ever sit there.had the rigatoni gorganzola with  chicken it was ok service was ok panna cotta with fruit was ok the food wasnt like wow I'd like to try there lunch there pizza .

udBNPBe5CRZGCzE-ZyFzTQ.text: First time there was for lunch. The smells were fantastic, reminded me of places in NY and Boston. Great service, menu included many segments, pasta, seafood, meats etc. Moscato and Cianti was exceptional. Appetizers and entrees were delicious, gnocci alfredo and veal marsala. Will be back.

e-zuEDCRKpLvON4zpGWFhA.text: Beautiful new location and the usual good food.  Service was the absolute worst...shame on Nora's.

2tluskXNMphriMZvVkuaoQ.text: Loved it. Good pasta. Make sure to try this place, its as good as anywhere else.  The scampi was great. It was reasonably priced.

poocuMGhUCNaA18dMFu3Lg.text: Soooooooo delish!  Smells wonderful as you approach the doors of this hidden gem.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you, this is wonderful, friendly authentic Italian!  Decided already this will be among our favorite dining spots.  We topped by for an early dinner prior to a show, the place was filling fast on a weeknight, so call ahead to reserve your table!

HPVVpLx_mucoiKRPxzct9w.text: Best have a reservation as this place is always packed. Tasty Italian fare & good service... we will return some day.

VEFLHFSr26c_FqXWJeQs8g.text: I've been here a few times over the past 3 years and it's been consistently good! The wait staff is knowledeable about the menu and very happy to accommodate any special requests.   For Appetizers I've had the Calamari which was deliciously seasoned and served with a tasty blush type of tartar sauce however I asked for a side of marinara that was gladly and promptly brought to me.  The Arancini were tasty and nicely seasoned. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with a good amount peas, meat sauce and mozzarella on the inside. The presentation was beautiful with basil leaves on top and served over some marinara (which was way too skimpy of an amount but they'll gladly give you more!) My friend and I had the Eggplant Parmigiana and Veal Parmigiana both of which were delicious. The eggplant was breaded and fried lightly with just enough marinara and melted mozzarella on each slice. The veal was tender and well seasoned as well.  They've also got a nice wine list with  reasonable prices. I also like the way they redecorated the dining room with multicolored ceiling tile and the Trinacria. This place is always busy so I'd suggest a reservation especially if you have a larger party.

rcqJKikg0A1hX93QlDDbog.text: In the quest to find an Italian restaurant that can be a staple in my weekly diet, I have had to travel across town to the corner of Flamingo and Jones in a strip mall to find a hidden gem called  Noras.   Appetizer: The ,arancini  are stuffed deep-fried risotto balls  This is the perfect appetizer that you crave.  Main Course: Make your own pasta dish with your preferred pasta, sauce, and add-ons.  ie. Linguini with arrabiata sauce and chicken.  Dessert: Did not try dessert.  Will explore in my future visits.  If there are any 5 star Italian restaurants between Noras and Henderson  please let me know.

Of7flqYxv8JkBExNOYy7DQ.text: Love Nora's! It's tucked away in a non-descript strip mall and doesn't look much from the outside. Once you step inside you're greeted with the enticing smell of roasted garlic and fresh baked pizza.   The salads, pasta and dishes are all fantastic, you really can't go wrong. The fettucini carbonara satisfied my craving and I had plenty to take home. I highly recommend Nora's for a casual lunch or dinner out. It's family style and a bit noisy, but definitely will not disappoint! Buon Appetito!

yQIx1YUDzoV1n0ksb8ia5Q.text: I am back! My first experience at Nora's was great! Me, the hubbs, and his mother all went to grab lunch - and seeing how Moises loves pizza, and him seeing their yelp reviews we decided to try it out. The service at the time was very attentive and classy. Drinks never went dry, they let us know of the bread charges - when some places don't.   The pasta dishes felt home made, pizza and the crust yummy. My boyfriend is from Brooklyn, so he is a bit of a pizza snob, and loved this. We loved the garlic bread, it was toasted good, fresh garlic on top.  Not only did I love the food, moderate prices, but I really loved the atmosphere. It gave the good old Las Vegas vibe, with Frank Sinatra playing in the background. It's a part of Las Vegas, not a lot of appreciate - but I felt it in here, that is love.   I marked down a star because we came in the next day for dinner, and the service wasn't that attentive like it was for lunch the previous day. It was pretty packed, so I'm not going to knock on them for it.

3HPNnuzjFpM0p-v5VKT4rw.text: Don't wanna be ANYWHERE near the strip and want Italian food?  Come here! Great atmosphere, private and romantic.  Their Fried Calamari is amazing.  Traditional Italian courses galore and the service is good.  I would totally return.

6jDMG8YHnSiK6s6KZ8qJNg.text: Being second generation Italian, people ask me where my favorite Italian place in Vegas is, and Nora's is it.   But not the whole menu.  For me Nora's is about one thing, and that thing is the eggplant parmigiana (and the cannolli).  I'll get to the parm in a sec, but definitely start your meal out with one of Nora's family style salads.  We get the house salad, and even the generous portion is polished off easily by a group of four.  The garlic bread is a take it or leave it thing.  I've taken people here who thought it was great, and others thought it was okay.  The garlic ensures that you definitely need a breath mint after just one slice, and if you plan on locking lips with someone later on you may want to pass on it.   I've eaten in Italian restaurants all over the country and they serve the best eggplant parm I've ever had.  Thickly cut with a meaty texture, fried to perfection and topped with a generous portion of mozzarella cheese, then popped in the oven (or salamander) it's to die for.  Maybe they put a little too much cheese on top, but I'm the type of guy that says you really can't put too much cheese on anything.  Also I'd get a side order of meatballs, they're top notch.  If you don't like eggplant I'd go with the baked ziti. It's served a little different, with balls of ricotta covering the top of the ziti.  The pizza is solid, but not NYC style, so if that's what you're used to, just order the eggplant.  They do make a white pizza which is kinda hard to find in Vegas. I would not order the chicken parm or the chicken Marsala, it's not made the way people are accustomed to, and besides, I told you to order the eggplant, so why are you looking at other menu items?  At the end of your meal I deplore you not to leave this joint without ordering cannoli.  They're just like momma made 'em, crisp shells filled with a sweet but not too sweet, creamily delicious ricotta, topped on one side with pistachios and the other chocolate chips.  I've also tried the tiramisu, which is very good, but takes up precious cannoli space in my stomach so I usually don't order it.  For me, going to Nora's and not getting the eggplant is like going to a steakhouse and ordering a side of veggies.  This is my go to place for some just how momma made it eggplant, meatballs and cannoli.

4Nb1HIAyaAdRBuwuiTlzgA.text: Great go-to spot for reliable, well-priced food. The garlic knots are my favorite. They have good happy hour deals.

WAku5E0UDqFEQl6ZbaYVbA.text: This rating is based primarily on my food server. I have been to Nora's before. Even to the old location. Our waitress, whom according to the receipt, Nina, was very un-warm and  un-welcoming. She did not greet us cheerfully, she did not ask us about appetizers. I had to ask to start with one. Her demeanor was one of discontentment, almost like she "got stuck" with our table. Maybe she pre-judged us because we had a 9 month old with us, I don't know. My mom asked for lemon in her water, which she did not get. When she refilled my wife's tea, she only refilled mine about 3/4ths of the way. When the main entree came and she was removing the dishes, my mom said "oh my fork" and went to grab it, my wife witnessed her roll her eyes to the other staff member who was helping put the entrees down. Several times I saw her run her forearm across her nose to wipe it as she came from the kitchen. She never asked about desserts. She just had a subtle arrogance in her demeanor, almost as if she were somehow part of the family who owns the restaurant and she can do as she pleases, she kept going and chatting with the staff and sorta every now and then looking towards us. At the end, my mom asked her if she would take a picture of us and her reply was "can I clean the table first?" A few seconds later she did try to smooth it over by saying "oh I like a clean table." But her overall attitude was just rude. She wasn't busy running around with other tables to make this request a hassle. Overall food was good, and hostess was good, busser was good, atmosphere and new building and location were good. Just not her. However, my wife told me she did smile and wink at my wife at the end...

blISXuA7KMCVnMAAupCYyQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to visit this place based on all the yelp reviews - I didn't find the food particularly appealing.  The salad was over dressed the pizza was something you could find at a nearby Domino's but the server was great! She was very nice and accommodating.   The tiramisu is okay too... there was just not anything particularly memorable about this experience.  It's worth a casual visit any day but by no means would I take someone here for their birthday.

b0jeyB1KvmlibM2wu4MDVw.text: We were looking for an Italian restaurant that wasn't crazy expensive, and we found it. From the outside, Nora's doesn't look like much, but don't be fooled. The food is easily the best we had in Vegas, and was really reasonably priced. I had the Alla Nora and will be dreaming about it when I'm back home!  The atmosphere was decent. We were there late on a Friday night, and there was a jazz trio playing. Very cool, but way too loud for the small space. It was difficult to hear my husband over the music.   I will absolutely come back here the next time I'm in Vegas. Great food for a great price at a fine family establishment.

q1a-iE6AOD7J3ReTkBQGig.text: Only had one dish for lunch today, so will reserve my five star review for when I have a proper meal at Nora's, but I was there long enough to know that the staff was friendly/professional, lots of space, the ambiance reminds me of old-school Vegas, which I like - and the dish I did order - the linguini with pesto and zucchini was delicious. Warning - the portion, even for the small, was pretty large imho.

AIkWW-FnPRna1Qip0Oggyg.text: I love this place!!! The ambiance is great, with live music on the weekend.  I had the bruschetta and rigatoni gorgonzola both were great.  The rigatoni chicken was so go I didn't want to eat it all because I wanted to eat some later to enjoy it twice.  Get here early or make reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Chicken Gorganzola
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta with steak and arugula

VlxioQ5_jW3vQJ4AOtxTKA.text: Went there on the advice from a waitriss and was very pleased, found out you should have a reservation though, but we got in no problem. special was a little high priced but well worth the money. This place is still cheeper than a buffet on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BqZ3ID-IyTxnx-zub4rSgA.text: Nora's was recommended to me by a local, while on a flight. She said, "if you want the best food in Vegas, go off the strip to Nora's."  Finally made it there tonight and it didn't disappoint. I had the Salmon Piccata, which was fantastic. Cooked just right and paired well with spinach and capers. Great flavor. Also had a caesar salad and garlic bread and both were great. Got the food to go, so didn't experience the service, but the hostesses were very pleasant and helpful. The restaurant had a really cool vibe to it.

VnI6PizCmfranEeKu8WArg.text: Unimpressive location and storefront, but definitely one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. No wonder they are rated the Best Unknown Restaurant in Vegas.  Crazy Alfredo - flavor bomb: so creamy, seafood flavors mixed with mushroom flavors and a good spice.   Lasagna - perfect moisture and balance of sauces. You can really taste that ingredients are great quality  Olives for an appetizer: LOVED those. Soft and flavorful.  Spinach farro salad: a good light salad.  None of our food was disappointing, so good!

0Uc08nUCDbjNyfQcmm6g1g.text: Nora's a Las Vegas staple!! It has been around since I was a kid. Me and my family have been going for years. The food is always great! If I am wanting Italian food this is one of those spots that will definitely be considered, it's is in my top 5 Italian restaurants in town. Though the chicken Marsala doesn't come close to my uncles it is one of the many I've tried that comes close.   I used to love getting the zeppolis for dessert as a kid. They are fried pieces of dough with powdered sugar sprinkled on top. If you've never had Zeppolis definitely give them a try. You won't be disappointed.   If you have never ate at Nora's I would give it a try if I were you. Very tasty Classic Italian food!

kTEhCmWZIasQX3Oqk4WdeA.text: I've never eaten off strip before in Vegas so this was a first for me. I attended a wedding reception here and it was very well run. Service was superb. It always seemed like they were filling glasses and bringing out new food. I loved the baked rigatoni and the cannolis. I definitely would come back again!

_PYyzREb9EqsQWCgvCdwJw.text: Nora's offers great atmosphere but be patient, usually a wait to sit down at one of the best Italian restaurants off the Strip.  I like their tomato sauce and it's pretty kid friendly.  Prices are good too.  Love Nora's!

1T_efSdIijgYQlbbfC05LA.text: Ordered take away Spaghetti & meatballs and extra serve of garlic bread - said it would be 45m (at 8.30p), so I thought I would give it a go due to the great reviews. Kids were sleepy so I went in 15m later to see if it would happen to be early and luckily it was ready for pick up - 30m more and it would've been cold.  Got home and found a small box of pasta with two meatballs.  Luckily I ordered extra garlic bread (1st one free) because I would've still been hungry!  Pasta and sauce were average - meatballs were tasty and garlic bread was too garlicky...the kind that leaves your breath humming for a day hahaha and I am a garlic lover!!  Sad to say I probably won't be back, but had to try - just too many other options.

chE0gT1V8lBpybYlyJXy4Q.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant! I've been here a few times already and have brought friends who fall in love with the food just like I have.  I went to Nora's a few nights ago with a friend who also shares my love for Italian food. We made a reservation for 7:30PM (I highly recommend making a reservation!) and were seated within 5 minutes. We had the calamari fritti and a regular sized house salad with Italian dressing to start. We also received a basket of complimentary garlic bread to nibble on. These starters didn't fill us up which I was happy about because I was waiting for my main entree!   My friend had the chicken parmigiana which had spaghetti, tomato sauce & the chicken was not breaded (like you see in other restaurants). I got to steal a bite and the chicken was tender & juicy! I had the Alla Nora which consisted of spaghetti noodles, eggplant, meat sauce with pesto and parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. The eggplant seemed too crisp, but all of that put together just works!   The restaurant that night was busy and loud. To me, that felt like home.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUM! The Alla Nora &amp; the Chicken Parmigiana!

zmgPVvBlN2t0elTG4DEIaQ.text: This place is amazing! I had the Crazy Alfredo and it was out of this world. My daughter also has the same dish and said it was the best Alfredo sauce she has ever tasted. My wife had linguine and sausage. The sausage was really great! Both tasty and spicy. My son-in-law had the shrimp and he loved it. This was first time and we got our food as a take out order. We will definitely be going back and eat at the restaurant next time.

FTy9UPm10b7sCOf4SNhiQg.text: Had dinner on sunday night. Great experience, atmosphere was perfect runners were fast and attentive. Melrose pasta and branzino was . Deff recommend to everyone check this place out!! Can wait to go back.

5aGPe2gh6bBC4718nDkQoA.text: My all time favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas but don't be fooled by the outside. I've never had a meal there that wasn't awesome but my favorite of all is the Chicken Carciofi.  The service staff is very friendly, the bartenders are cool and the atmosphere is that of a comfortable local hangout that's your go-to place to relax and have a great meal at a reasonable price.

YLdAygVvDeuXX_aw8vrlKA.text: We went to Nora's on Friday because of all the wonderful reviews.  We had a reservation, but when we got there they made us wait until "they fixed the table".  After about 10 minutes we were led to a table.  We saw there were 5 other tables in the section already set and empty.  Our table we were led to didn't have all the silverware, where the others did.    After being seated, we saw a group of three arrive, with an elderly woman who was using a walker.  They were made to sit in the lobby for about a half hour, until the people at the table next to us left, and that table was cleaned off.  That was with the 5 tables still empty.  We ordered, and I ordered the "Crazy Alfredo".  It was described to be loaded with jumbo shrimp, chicken and sausage.  It showed up with two shrimp, two pieces of chicken, and some sausage.  It had a tasteless alfredo sauce on it, that was just warm starch.  My wife had Chicken Marsala, which I tried a bite of, and found it to be much too sweet.  Our waitress came by to take our order, and that was the last we saw of her.  Someone else brought out the garlic bread, (which was just ok), and the meals.  She did come to bring us the check and we decided to pay in cash rather than wait for the seasons to pass, and her to return to pick up and deliver a credit card.

gWo7Sn4Gpc9ldsUMC0lQTg.text: Family style Italian done right is fun to enjoy with a large group.  I got a chance to dine here with 15 other colleagues.  The food was good and we were provided very attentive service.    One of the others ordered appetizers for the table... and I think we went overboard on appetizers.  We tried the Arancini, calamari, antipasto salad, and mozz caprese.  Everything was executed nicely... but by the time dinner came I was already nearly full.  The table was also scatterd with wine selections... the wine list is pricey but everything I tried was wonderful... sorry, I didn't order the wine so I'm not sure what brands were chosen.    I ordered the pork tenderloin for my meal.  It was packed with flavor and crunch.  I only ate a couple of bites, but I would completely recommend this dish for others.  And it paired nicely with the perfecly exucuted old fashions that I was enjoying.  Dinner was spot on... everyone left satisfied, stuffed with full bellies and flushed with wine and booze.

gLI3to_oWIoZT_rasiFBMQ.text: Absolutely worth visiting if you haven't already done so. The new restaurant has a great deal more room and the food is still amazing. Can't get enough of the antipasto salad. Yes, I'm from Chicago and I said salad. The baked rigatoni is excellent as well. About to steal the girlfriends leftover pork tenderloin. It is 5 stars all around. Call early for reservations. Always busy

M4YbVsv0v5Ir3HCD3q9Tnw.text: Stood in a line for 15 minutes while everyone stared at the hostess on a long reservation telephone call. It seemed like there wasn't enough staff at the front or with the servers as I observed. I've been here one previous time, and the lack of customer service along with the average tasting Italian food is not worth it.

a3PeeMXDcLXzZSNDQY3lFw.text: The food was A-OK, but the fact that I'm struggling to remember it shows that the experience to me was very middle of the road. I had the Veal Marsala, and it tasted like Veal Marsala. The sides we ordered for the table were tasty, but it was pretty much the same story - the calamari, truffle fries, and garlic bread tasted like calamari, truffle fries, and garlic bread. Though I appreciated the service and family business feel, it was difficult for me to understand the accolades, and as others have mentioned, the Strip has many excellent (though pricey) Italian restaurants.

DAos2c4JY2ICnycPQqRb2Q.text: We had heard stories of noras having some of the best pizza in town so we decided to try it out, we tried a white spinach pizza, with ricotta, parmesan, and mozzarella, also we added pep, and onion.......boy this pizza was awesome, one of my favorites, excellent flavor and only twenty five bucks for a big 18 in, we are definitely coming back, super gourmet quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at those fat cheese chunks!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super bomb beast!

WkCmb8vmfvn-8kFfa9QRCA.text: Barely contained chaos would describe the atmosphere at this very loud restaurant which we recently visited on a Saturday night.  Understaffed, crowded and noisy would be another description. The saving grace would be the food which is pretty good.....for Las Vegas....but would be mediocre at best when compared to what you you might find in NY or San Francisco.  We started our meal with complimentary garlic bread -- way too much garlic -- and kind of soggy.  We then tried the Caprese Salad which had very good mozzarella but very pedestrian grocery store tomatoes. We also tried the lemon clams which were in a tasty lemon butter sauce, but about a quarter of the clam shells were broken and to be safe, I did not eat the contents of these particular clams. The kitchen should remove such broken shell clams before serving.   For entrees we tried the Chicken Carciofi, a pretty good dish full of chicken, artichokes and capers on linguine. We also had the Puttanesca which was tasty although full of green olives instead of black olives which I have found to be milder and better suited for this dish. The portions were enormous, a negative in my book.   Service was spotty as it seemed our waiter was a bit overwhelmed covering two tables plus a birthday party table with 14 guests.  The appetizers came out very quickly though, but we were put off when the entrees arrived when we were only halfway through our appetizers and when we were finished with our appetizers, the appetizer plates were not removed from the table.   The wine list is pretty good.   Zagats rates this as the third best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas which may be correct but only serves to prove that Las Vegas is indeed in a barren Italian culinary landscape.

EZjiQ7TA2bQWv5CDM08PEg.text: The food, the wine, and service are always amazing! This is definitely my go to Italian spot.

ctvsqAdQILWmPjF5lEubGA.text: Went with a friend and we weren't disappointed! New digs and it is gorgeous! Food, service and ambience were great. It was very busy on a Sunday night but the waiter we had was very attentive. Outdoor and indoor seating available. We started with the antipasto salad, calamari and arancini for appetizers and did family style for the main dishes so we could taste a little of everything. We shared the wild boar parpadelle, crazy alfredo & pork tenderloin. Crazy Alfredo had a zip to it which we liked and not too creamy. Tons of leftovers but there were only three in our party. We would definitely recommend to friends and come back here next time we are in Vegas!

anGT6pBdd6C-doh3unDgwA.text: Great food ..!!  Ok service ..!!  The new location is convenient to get to.  They are a little scattered when they get busy.  Good to see the same quality of food ..!!

Q022F3PsYb7MrHvT7w7c-w.text: All I can really say is Wow!!! The food is great, the best Italian food I've ever had, pizza is wonderful. Anytime I'm in Las Vegas I will be stopping here!!!! Better food here than anywhere I've been on the strip. A local friend told me about this place and I'm so glad he did. With so many places to eat in Las Vegas you can get lost but this one is worth checking out. The place is always crowded so you got to expect to wait some but great food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom pizza with chicken, tomato, spinach, broccoli, no cheese, I can&#39;t eat cheese.:-)

RAcpQmz_SrVE37yrq_lQJg.text: Service really really sucks. Food was great but overall experience left us with a bad taste in our mouths. Came here with a party of 5. We sat outside and ordered drinks and food. Food came out and drinks came out before our utensils. We had to ask 3 different people until we finally saw our server to let her know about the utensils. We also ordered 2 bottles of wine and the server just dropped them off without opening them. She walked away expecting us to have our own wine opener. Manager excused it as her being new. I guess common sense isn't part of the job application. Came here to celebrate but left very underwhelmed. The old Nora's has way better service than this place. Sucks so bad.

2ELmLEHC4EkoMJbCIDwY0w.text: My favorite Italian restaurant ever!!! I have been going here every week for over 3 years now. Everything I order always taste as good as the first time. Family owned and intimate. They are moving to be bigger location this year because the place is so great. I recommend this restaurant to everyone who loves Italian or just great food. Prices are unbeatable. You can go to an Italian restaurant on the strip pay triple and still be hungry and the food not have any flavor. I can go on and on. Just try it out!

PRVrYI6L4gQAR2fRA-GFoA.text: Great authentic Italian cuisine! Started off with the calamari that had a side of tangy sauce on it. Great choice. Also got the house salad, which is definitely shareable, and the shrimp scampi. Again, all great choices. For dessert, ordered the tiramisu and the limoncello shot. The tiramisu was amazing! Best I've ever had! This will definitely be a go to place every time I visit Las Vegas!

UW7pzrq3wkpjIVK6dAAQ2g.text: Amazing food and top notch service. I took the Rib eye and side potatos and it was delicous!! If you on a biz trip and want to impress your client, take him here

yRw04DIe6ei6HHd90ZInPg.text: I went to Nora's for a special dinner for prom. Very disappointed...I heard nothing but great reviews and when we arrived we not only waited 20 minutes to be seated even though we had a reaervation, but we didn't get our food until 40 minutes after ordering. Reservation at 9 and food arrived around 10:35. We wasted so much time sitting and we were so hungry we filled up on bread and by the time we got our meal our appetite was gone. I was disappointed with my order, for it was not worth the ridiculous wait. I understand if it is busy, but the resteraunt was not packed by no means. I liked the inside but not the service at all. They offered us a free dessert. How about no dessert and you just discount our bill ? So much time wasted. We are not going back.

eMgvV0Bix_wcYDOKSYetyA.text: It was my first time trying this place and I was kind of surprised by its location/interior. I thought this place was pretty good but not as amazing as my friends made it out to be. It was very crowded, so they must be doing something right... The food was good, but not unbelievably out-of-this-world. The breadsticks were so good (honestly my favorite part of the meal). I had clam linguine which was pretty good but slightly too salty. For dessert we had tiramisu and cannoli and I preferred the tiramisu. My friend really liked how many toppings were on the cannoli.  The issue I had was that the waiter seemed kind of excited for us to hurry and leave. Maybe because the place was so packed. I didn't think he was rude but I did get the sense that we were slightly being rushed.   Anyways, the food was pretty good! All in all I had a good experience.

34icXoIHVlUpHDbqx9DYrA.text: Love this place and try to come whenever I am in town.  The service is excellent and very attentive.  Had the antipasto salad and it was delicious. It is big enough for 3 people.  Had the veal Marsala and the veal was cooked perfectly.  My son had the lasagna and it was good as well.  My husband had the veal chop Parmesan and he thought it was adequate.  Will continue to visit when in town

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal chop Parmesan
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Marsala

o7A8FgtPfpw_-f1SrrNEqg.text: Management cannot manage the larger site. Reservations not working to manage the crowd. Wait is up to an hour WITH a reservation. Food was OK but not worth the hassle.  Not returning unless management can get a handle on the wait.

ExyPK6-EMVsizSRBr7O-zQ.text: Love Nora's! Been coming here for over 5 years, even after becoming vegetarian, is still a good place to hangout! Love the fact that they can accommodate my 'needs' Crazy Alfredo is just as good without meet :) the only problem I have is their garlic bread, totally addictive! :)   Must try the Lemon Drop Martini!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It only comes with one caramelized lemon, but I&#39;m special :)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Puttanesca

58D0hvYs1s6hmFwe18-gAQ.text: The food I tasted here was low quality and did not taste freshly made.   After sitting down, the garlic bread was brought out right away. I spit out the first bite because the bread tasted days old and was soggy. I asked the bus boy how the bread was made and he said Nora puts the spread on in the morning and then they bake it. If any type of spread is sitting on bread for hours it will still have that soggy consistency no matter what you do to it. He said he would bring us another batch and it would be crispier. It was crispier, however, it still tasted old and even though there was plenty of seasoning it had minimal flavor. I ordered the alla Nora and my friend ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. My pasta was baked in an oven and came out piping hot. They need to cool this pasta before they bring it out to customers because it's impossible to eat for at least 10 minutes. The first bite I had was awful. The eggplant was soggy and the tomato sauce tasted like it had come from a can. The tomato sauce reminded me of the one time in my childhood when I tried a friends spaghettios. My friends pasta was better than mine and for an Alfredo the sauce was lighter than I had expected. The chicken was okay but it would have been better if it was grilled and the pasta was mostly clumped together. I called over the manager to tell him I could not eat my pasta and about the other issues I was having. He apologized and expressed his embarrassment for the situation at hand. He ended up comping our meal and sending us home with a free dessert which was a nice touch.   Nora's just needs a complete face lift and some level of sophistication.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alla Nora
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and broccoli
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy/old tasting garlic bread

zPl1o5HKl8jtwH8MZx_BNQ.text: When I went there was a hour and 15 min wait, clearly this place is popular. Sat at the bar and was well worth it, got a whole basket of delicious garlic bread. Most authentic Italian cooking I've had in years, the portions are huge.

eDxxKYp-hQo70Lkkfs73ng.text: Overall we had a great meal. The bus service was great and the food was very good.  I had tomato basil with penne and my husband had chicken parmigiano. My dish was excellent and was very fresh tasting. The chicken parmigiano was good but the chicken was a bit overcooked.  Everything else...bread, olives, and antipasto salad was great.  The only other issue was our waitress.  She had somewhat of an attitude and was not friendly. There were others in our party ...we ordered wine..it took a while to get that served.  And when we reordered..it was not timely.  The main course took a while to be served after the salad. The atmosphere is great and we had a reservation and we're promptly seated. I discussed the issues we had with the manager and he apologized. We will come back again.

nriv36f9Y7ks08dDXj6uyA.text: Nora's Salad ain't no joke.  Roasted bell peppers, fresh lettuce and homemade dressing.  Great flavors.  Really good.      Although I am not a fan of alfredo or gnocchi, if you're into that, my friend swears by the alfredo gnocchi.  I tried a bite but it was too rich for me.  In the defense of Nora's alfredo, I have never liked alfredo sauce anywhere.  I had the lasagna and thought it was better than Chef Boyardee.  I wouldn't say this is the best Italian food in town, but it is worth a visit.

NiitFwKE3Do4eXnJe9-Hmg.text: I had lunch today at  Nora's.  It's been on my foodie list for two years.  While Italian food isn't my most favorite cuisine, I do like it.  Now?  Nora's has made me love it.  And if I have anything less in taste than what I had today, I will feel sorely cheated.  For lunch, the menu is quite extensive.  I settled on the individual Nora's salad. Field greens with roasted green and red peppers in a lovely and light balsamic vinaigrette.  I also ordered the appetizer of Arancini.  These are four crisply fried balls of deliciousness.  Inside is saffron risotto, peas and mozzarella.  The base was a tasty and authentic tomato sauce that was definitely not Ragu-esque.  I wish my stomach had more room because I definitely wanted to try another dish.    I will definitely keep Nora's on my Vegas foodie rotation.

BkxFTcTAafRKb5bPJkxFAQ.text: I really don't know where to start as I had heard this place is incredible! I read many Yelp reviews and some were great and a few not so great.  So, here goes.....I made a reservation for two at 5:45 on a Tuesday night.  We were welcomed by the hostesses and sat immediately. Our server asked for a drink order and I had read that the sangria was good but not enough fruit in it. The server asked if I would like to sample it before ordering a glass.  I thought that was top notch customer service.  It was a red sangria so I opted out and ordered a glass of Reisling. I normally don't order wine, but I thought I would treat myself.  The other member of my party (my 17 yr. old grandchild ordered a diet Coke).  Before I continue I would like to state that the server and waiter's assistants were incredible and my grandchild's drink was refilled at least 5 or 6 times.  We were brought complimentary garlic bread and it was delicious.  After we inhaled the first basket, our server asked if we'd like another and we couldn't resist.  We ordered the crazy alfredo that I had read so much about, and the server told me it was the most popular dish on the menu. That item was $22.95 which I consider pricey for pasta regardless if what is in it.  In addition I had always wanted to try bransino (a whole small sea bass) and decided to treat myself as it was pricey for my wallet at $28.95.  We also ordered a small white pizza that had beautiful mounds of ricotta for $13.95. Cutting to the chase.......The bransini was very dry and no flavor even though there was a spring of rosemary and a lemon wedge or two inside. The dish was served with a mound of dressed arugula salad which was the 2nd highlight of our experience.  The crazy alfredo was dry, the sauce was rather brown in color than your every day alfredo that is white.  The pizza was the highlight of the meal and the least expensive item. Our entire bill was $84.22.  We didn't finish the meal and brought home the pizza and pasta. I left a hefty tip for the pristine service.  I am going to make an authentic alfredo sauce to add to the pasta for tonight's dinner side dish.

-VIdWDckHVaind0qntMhmw.text: Best place to have an Italian food, listen to live jazz music, meet great people.!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a4gghT3ykR8sMLliVjFoyQ.text: Excellent food and the wine is superb! The hosts are young and arrogant and my rating would have been 5 stars if it wasn't for that. There is always a wait but for good reason. This place is fantastic

8jN6_hrrPrOEVMSx_gTf7Q.text: Was so looking forward to our dinner at Nora's. I was disappointed.  I emailed my complaint and never heard. So turned to Yelp. Food was not particularly good. As a meter of fact it made all three of us I'll. service was poor. Took forever to get waited on as well as seated even though we had reservations. We have eaten here in the past and the good was great. What happened? New chef? I am sad to say we will not be back.

TYtLXr135euJlsdn9a_Anw.text: We sat at the bar at 7pm on saturday and it was getting busy. Bartender was our server and he was just not interested in paying any attention at all. We could barely get him to take our order. After that he basically stopped serving us. Bright spot was that the food was outstanding. Both pasta dishes came out very hot, fresh and full over flavor. Loved the food but the bartender killed the experience

CEgnWuE_nenmy8gNotSVhQ.text: Took my parents here while they were in town based on friends reviews of the place.  Service is always a main concern for me and I definitely felt Nora's exceeded in this area.  I believe our servers name was Bryce and he was helpful the whole time.  Calamari appetizer was great.  I ordered the crazy Alfredo and wasn't overly impressed, but it wasn't bad by any means.  I'd order something else next time probably.  My parents ordered the carbonara and a penne dish and both loved them.  I personally didn't like the sangria...something tasted really off to me but again my parents both enjoyed it.  I had the Oreo dessert and they got the pistachio cannoli...both tasted  excellent but my parents found a piece of plastic in the last few bites of their cannoli.  The server ended up taking it off the menu for us.  Kind of a subpar experience overall in my opinion.  I want to like this place and would probably give it one more shot.  Everything would need to go right from the service to the food the next time though for me to make Nora's a repeat place for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rH6aqElevEze-9Y03JhbWA.text: Was in vegas (woohoo) and went here for dinner with my bffs fam. With a reservation it was about an hour wait... :/ but we were finally able to sit down and eat! I ordered the chicken fettuccine alfredo. It was good. no complaints I just enjoy the sauce to be a little thicker.

jvZB2iT6MNSiJrkx5q0YGQ.text: Been here several times and each time I didn't leave disappointed. The bar area is kind of tight to move around it but its tolerable. My favorite time to go is the weekends when they have this 3 man band play.  They play oldies from Sinatra to some modern music too. My goto dish is the linguine w/clams or the Fruti Di Mari.  Good stuff!  Plus their garlic bread is good too.  Aside from Olive Garden this is the only Authentic Italian place I've eaten at in Las Vegas.  I will try more... Check this place out... you might like it!!!

4g8MB4QfArzNwgfIG1Dpgg.text: Phenomenal food, service and ambiance.   My gf and I double dated with another couple here late on Friday night. I was a bit worried to sit down for dinner after 10:30, but my worries were quickly dismissed upon arrival.   There was a band playing some jazz music in the room to the right and we were seated far enough away from the band to where we could talk but still hear the music faintly in the background. I was very happy about this because sometimes loud music blaring in my ears can be a turn off during dinner time. I like conversation, what can I say.   I discovered that upon checking in on Yelp, I received a free glass of wine. AMAZING! Our friends ordered the sangria which they could not stop raving about! I highly suggest ordering this if you love sangria because it is some of the best I have ever had.   We began our meal with an order of Arancini. I've never heard of or seen this on a menu before, but when my girlfriend saw them she went nuts. They looked like meatballs but were fried balls of risotto, cheese, peas, and meat sauce. Incredible! I could have eaten ten of them! Our waiter also brought out a basket of garlic bread and I thought it was excellent.   We opted to share the special for the evening upon our server's recommendation, which was Chicken Mount Etna. This dish was really unique. I have never had anything like it. The chicken was cooked perfectly with some mozzarella cheese and peppers and was served on top of crispy, fried, angel hair pasta (think ramen noodle texture?) with a balsamic sauce/reduction and topped with onion strings. Strange combinations for an Italian restaurant, but REALLY REALLY GOOD. I cannot stress the deliciousness enough. It was a perfect portion for us to share, but I couldn't resist ordering a side of penne a la vodka (I'm a sucker). Their vodka sauce was delicious!   For dessert, we pre-ordered the warm chocolate cake. I'm not a chocolate cake fan, but my gf loved it as did the rest of the table.   Our server was amazing. My drink was never empty and he made some really great menu suggestions. Even though we were one of the last tables in the restaurant because we started late, I did not feel rushed or get the vibe that they were waiting to go home. Everything was perfect.   I recommend this spot for a date night, dinner with friends, or any time you want some home cooked, reasonably priced, off the strip Italian food.

7zbcgvdNYmzm1JmopWGFzA.text: My husband found this place and told me that it was one of his favorite Italian restaurants and that we would have to go the next time we were in Las Vegas together. Well, that time recently happened, and he was RIGHT! The food was delicious! He had the rigatoni special and I had steak sandwich for lunch. We thought that going there for lunch would be not as busy, but it was pretty full with the locals enjoying their lunches too! I'm looking forward to going back the next time we're in Vegas for sure! Will try their pizza, but I have no doubt it will be good! Clean restaurant too. It's not on the strip, but not everything good is there, remember that!

_ZhCU9t2S-Xz5woFcboYYg.text: We had our rehearsal lunch here for our wedding and have been going back since. All the food we tried was good, staff was on top of things for a large party. Every time we have gone since, the smell of pizza gets us every time. Love the white pizza, garlic pizza. Was a little bit disappointed by the halibut. It was good but I thought for the price it should come with some pasta or mashed potato, not just the fish and spinach. Otherwise, the Italian food we have had here we enjoyed and the prices are fair.

c2-hGGYsAsXqevAORL902Q.text: So, not the best Italian, like others claim it is, but still really good. I am totally in love with the ambience in this place. It's dark and they play oldies music like Sinatra and Sammy. I ordered a lasagna and it did have a bit too much cheese in it for my liking, but it was good. The staff was a 5-star.... super nice guys!  The entire time I was there (work dinner), I was envisioning myself coming back, sitting at the bar, drinking red wine and eating yummy apps. Yes, I will go back & have to do this.

D8l88MvToI8_kP2JO9OV3A.text: Wonderful food, service and atmosphere! If you love Italian food this is a must do. Very busy but they accept reservations. Great for a romantic dinner or an evening out with friends. We will visit again and again!

y52OyiUxC0sHkxBL23hUUQ.text: I was hoping for a better experience at Nora's because it is a popular, independent, family owned place, generally the kind of restaurant I like to support.   There were three of us and we had a reservation for 7:30 PM on a weekday evening. We were quickly seated and given menus. The waiter kept prompting us to order drinks but only one of us wanted a glass of wine. We received a small basket of garlic bread which was OK. It was quite a while before our food order was taken and by the time our food arrived we had been there for 50 minutes. Two of us had the "Crazy Alfredo." The third person had the pasta with broccoli. That dish was so salty as to be inedible and was sent back. It was another 15 minute wait for it to be replaced.  The two of us who had the Crazy Alfredo both thought it was OK but nothing special. Same opinion from the person who had the pasta with broccoli.  Around 8:30 a female vocalist and her male musician accompanist began performing from a small stage at the front of the room. Mostly blues and song titles from the 40s & 50s. That was enjoyable.  Menu prices here were average for a restaurant of this caliber. Drink prices seemed high. A glass of "house red wine" was $9.50. Sorry to say, but there was just not much here to draw me back again.

_OfizyoOA6aR3bc07lOjCg.text: I've been to Nora's quite a few times. I like Nora's most because you can go there on a date or a casual meal. It's my go to place for Italian food on the west side of town. The menu is good and the price is fair.

xzzU97Z4CQbpMKvz6yhvBQ.text: Food was excellent! I had the Melrose, which is linguini in creamy basil pesto with sun-dried  tomatoes and zucchini. Delicious. Service was great. The waitress was very attentive. Made our bread sticks seemed bottomless.

Y4tevrVuFGgBLjFpILI_Sg.text: Nora's was recommended to me by several of my patients so I gave it a shot. We made a reservation for two at 7:30 but showed up at 7:00. They got us right in. The staff was awesome! We asked them for dish recommendations and we ordered exactly what they said. It was all delicious! I will bring the rest of my family back soon.

CpdoOf744J2cAE-oxmeXOA.text: While visiting family in a nearby neighborhood, we stopped in after finding Nora's on yelp. It did not disappoint! The service was wonderful and the food was great. We had a gluten free penne, the baked rigatoni and a rigatoni special. Everything was delicious.

7Iwj_t4CGpwUpjj1W8WmZg.text: I came here for the first time with my family  after reading the rave reviews. Has the management changed recently? We had a horrendous experience. The server took orders and brought food to tables seated after us and took an eternity for our food. My girlfriend ordered the house salad and calamari which she enjoyed. My mom and I ordered the spaghetti which was way too salty. The server knew we didn't like the food and service so she brought us complimentary ice cream which was nice of her but I still won't come back here. There are plenty of Italian restaurants in Las Vegas that will offer you great service and food.

LjeRVz6YjngzhzhdUgrUgA.text: The waiting time and congestion to dine there has improved since they moved to a larger space, dining has been consistent. Food is great and service needs a little push to compliment the food. Over all a wonderful experience.

64Y6K8A0gAQY8y-bM4TXqg.text: Looking for phenomenal home style Italian food? This is a great place to go in Las Vegas. My favorite is the linguine and clams in white sauce. My husband stands by the broccoli penne. Don't forget to save room for a homemade cannoli!

N8sVFvRULwBnjOW7sooHfw.text: My favorite Italian restaurant for the last 11 years! This a local hot spot! Newly designed and fresh service staff! Rudy is my all time favorite bartender! Best martinis of my life! I always get the penne al la vodka and I've never been disappointed! I've never had a bad dish here! So glad they changed the garlic bread... it is better than ever! And they are open for lunch.... soooo good!!

8u16nZ8OeaSkX9EwzWjyaQ.text: Las Vegas Review Part II of the "Losing Money, Spending Money and General Hubby Eating Freebies Back At Home Tour".  Friday night in Vegas, it was my mom's choice for dinner and she is a Vegas local, so of course she didn't want to hit the strip, or have a buffet, or deal with the traffic and valet at the hotels.    Nora's Cuisine is a mid-size local Italian restaurant, that appears to be popular.  They had live entertainment, which I found to be ok, but definitely geared towards an older crowd (and hell I'm older now, and it was still too old for me!)  The portions are large but I found the prices to actually be on the high side.  Let me explain:  Italian food usually is larger portions and usually is on the cheaper side, excluding Northern  Region Italian and some pricier ingredients, think Marscapone Cheese, Veal and Fresh Seafood.  I ordered a fairly basic salad and spaghetti & meatballs, both really standard with basic and cheaper ingredients.    While both dishes were large, the salad was again, basic, could have used more mozzarella and other than a few olives, tomatoes and onion, was overpriced at $7.95.  Highlight of salad was the homemade ranch dressing which was delicious.  The spaghetti & meatballs was again large, but the 2 meatballs were more on the smaller to medium size and you were really left with quite a bit of pasta.  I did not detect any veal in the meatballs, and the seasoning/ingredients was not quite there, as they were not soft and tender and appeared to be missing the requisite amount of cheese.  I found service to be lacking, I had to ask twice for a simple refill of iced tea and I also had to ask for parmesan cheese as a topping for my spaghetti & meatballs.  The waiter seemed stressed (too busy perhaps) but that's not exactly my problem, is it?    Side note:  My mother had made reservations, we were on time, but we still had to wait about 15 minutes.  Overall I would recommend Nora's, but I don't know that I would make it a for sure Italian destination when I'm back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Bread Sticks , wow packs a garlic punch!

-BQnvNQCVG3shxU7VYl2lg.text: Love the ambience, the food not so much.  The food "looks" great but...  If nothing, it's nice that we have a lot of Italian options - after all, we need a lot more average restaurants to make the bell curve.  They might have had a better chance if they knew what al dente means, but I get it, it's all United States thing...

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach White Pizza - Ricotta, spinach, romano, and mozzarella

ljZam9gUtOhELOJ_aI1FoA.text: This is by far one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! The restaurant can get really busy but I can see why. The garlic bread, one word: Amazing. It really complimented the salad we ordered. I ordered the baked rigatoni and, just wow. I finished half of it because that rigatoni really fills you up! Sadly, I forgot the leftovers over there but hey, at least I had some of their delicious food. I made room for dessert and got the Oreo Tartufo and it was amazing! I devoured the whole thing! If you're looking for excellent Italian food, you should definitely take my word for it and come here!
