Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The baked rigatoni I ordered. It was so good I forgot to take a picture before I devoured half of it.

TNXlrSY8tqMGr72O-x-lhA.text: Nora's in three adjectives: fulfilling, quaint, and poppin'. If you're on a diet, don't come here. Healthy portions and butter and oil go unspared here.  I love the service, all the waiters/waitresses are good looking,and the food is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasto salad

MxKSAuLS9IP6qPgaCNa3Vg.text: Nora's deserves 10 stars for sure!!!!  Best Italian in town, I've been going to Nora's for over a decade and am never disappointed!!!  The staff is great and the food is what you expect and want out of an Italian restaurant.  The osso bucco is one of my favorites along with their lemon drop martini!!  The bartenders are all fabulous and know how to handle the crowd as they are usually serving a full house from open to close!!!  If you are planning on getting a table best bet is making a reservation otherwise you can usually find a couple seats open at the bar.

W1f6c90d8_gP9zR_DPqwSQ.text: Went to lunch at Nora's...first time being there. The place was packed and the parking lot was packed too. We had an assortment of appetizers and all were delish. Ordered the sausage it was delish. Casual atmosphere, service was good but the food was really good! Lunch prices in the mid range $12 on up depending on what your ordering. Will have to go back soooon!

2XLt2nP46s_5_Ju_h0pFaA.text: I definitely liked the Ambience of the old Nora's much better. We asked if we could dim the lights considering it felt like we were in a baseball Stadium but guess they couldn't figure it out. The food was good but they definitely changed the way they cooked the ribeye on the menu. The old pan seared ribeye 1000 times better! Are server was really good ill definitely give it another chance after the tweaks are worked out. Don't fix stuff that wasn't broken   Ps. Management fighting right next to our table by the kitchen with his co-worker saying he's going to fight you outside is what gave you three stars

5ix0lXsYI_e9dBULt926aA.text: New Location , same great service and solid Italian food at reasonable prices. The new place has a great vibe and atmosphere with an open kitchen and a great bar. It get's very crowded early and seems always busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lam chop - very tender !

r8tdjGQ-y8tNL9lVb_Ny6g.text: I've waited a long time to try this spot out. A locals favorite for sure. I wasn't disappointed at all. I was beyond impressed by the atmosphere, quality customer service and especially the good. I highly recommend it. My family and I will be coming back frequently,

ZhATGak3WGBV8-E_fcrXxA.text: Loved it! Best Italian I have had in this town in the longest time. Very romantic atmosphere, lovely music and the service was superb! I had ordered the angel hair with meatball to be simple and the sauce was soooo good. The meatballs were tender and flavorful. My husband ordered the frutti di mare and it was absolutely delicious! Very impressed and will be back for date night soon.

9u44f2WO-wtbvqbnBbX-jQ.text: This place is amazing! I have a friend who is not a pasta fan. Took him here and he loved everything about this place!  The staff are very polite and very knowledgeable of their menu.  The calamari is exceptional!  Have never been disappointed in a single dish in this place! I recommend trying something new to you everytime you come! You won't be let down.  Their veal Marsala and frutti de mar are amazing!!!!!! Oh and that Branzino! Ughhhhhhhh, SO AMAZING!  I can't wait to try something new next time!

83D-ZJ44qCnurSJdS9TOkw.text: Great food and service! Had a date night and the menu is very reasonably priced and our waiter Dayton was very friendly and professional. Will be coming back for many more date nights.

hYUQGpSvqyqmWNbwllVNHg.text: I took my girlfriend here because I had heard good thing's about this place, and we wanted to try and find a new spot for Italian cuisine. While I was quick to be seated as I had a reservation, we were greeted about 5-10 minutes after we sat down by our server. She took our drink orders, and we got our drink orders rather fast. Fast forward it take's our server about 20-30 minutes before she came back to take our dinner orders, and even longer to get bread.  I ordered the chicken parm, while my girlfriend ordered the gnocchi. We are fine up to that point no complaints, besides the long wait, we get our dinner and first thing we notice is that my girlfriends entree of gnocchi is literally just the pasta with tomato sauce. They put no cheese on it. I flag down the server to get cheese. She brings us back a parmesan shaker. (What italian place does this?).   The meal ended up being horrible, she couldn't even finish half off her gnocchi. The spaghetti that came with my chicken Parmesan was completely stale, it tasted like it had been sitting there for the last two hours.  All in All we wont be coming back, this is a sorry excuse for an Italian restaurant, and wont be referring others to this place.

78N17C99pSKlLqA-w9DDIg.text: Great classic Italian cuisine!  I used to work around the corner from this place and ordered out all the time because they had amazing spaghetti and a great lunch special and after a few years I ended up back here for a lunch meeting. Nothing has changed. The food was just as good as it always had been and the service is also always great.  The one negative for me is the ambiance. It's a very plain looking place and there's not much to it. Once again this is a place I would love to makeover. The food is always key for me and service is next so I still highly recommend this place for classic Italian dishes. Some of my favorite items are the antipasto, chicken Milanese and spaghetti with meatballs.

P7HFhx4rfpd5849UlYgQSA.text: Another amazing Meal at Nora's.  Food was amazing and the staff was very attentive.  We tried the rigatoni and it was perfectly cooked with the pasta sauce having an impeccable balance between sweetness and acidity

V2ZhA4JQN12NajDEubU0aQ.text: I met friends from out of town for lunch earlier this week.  As always, Nora's did not disappoint!  There were 5 of us and we ordered a large salad that was enough to serve everyone at the table with seconds.  Ands, it was very good!  I ordered one of their menu's "Lunch Favorites."  It was the penne chicken broccoli pasta with garlic and oil.  It was excellent.  One minus--there wasn't enough garlic taste for me.  One of the others at the table ordered a large pizza with pineapple and mushrooms--the pineapple being a first for me.  It was such a pity when there were three pieces of pizza left over and she couldn't take it home with her.  She was winging back to Canada the next morning.  I made the sacrifice and took one for the team.  I brought the three pieces home, had one for dinner, and have the other two frozen for a lunch treat!  Tip to Yelpers---go out to eat with out of town friends the day before they're flying home and you might get some take out for the rest of the week.  I have been a fan of Nora's for several years and I highly recommend the place to anyone looking for good Italian food with a really good atmosphere and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza with pineapple and mushrooms.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne chicken pasta.

5frXa-xU3KPQJdmNg5o6RA.text: Went to Noras for the first time, and it was DELICIOUS! The lasagna was my favorite and the chicken marcela was out of this world and man those breadsticks are addicting so be easy with them. I cant wait to go back and try more things, especially dessert! It does get really busy though so if you don't call ahead or have a reservation it could be a while waiting.

gLld0KP-dSRj0bqq5uDJdw.text: I hate rating places based on service but here goes. So the bread was good. After 10-15(I'm giving her the benefit of the doubt)minutes of waiting for our server to come take our order we left. Literally watched her check 3 tables 4-5 times. Would've saved or something but we were seated outside.

aj5SJAV_ZLBJcRUee8puAg.text: I visited Nora's last night for the first time, having heard wonderful things in the past about its food.  The food did indeed live up to its reputation- however the overall experience was highly disappointing due to their 1. losing our reservation; 2. Having cavalier attitudes about their mistake; 3. Lack of urgency to "make it right"; and 4. Inattentive service at the table once we were finally seated over an hour later.  Additionally, I had purchased a gift card (which was used to pay for our dinner), and the process to purchase the gift card was archaic.  Overall, Nora's needs to place more attention on customer service- particularly at reception- if it hopes to maintain its customers.

_2SMBhFc5MPhns5Y-hlGew.text: Went in with my friend at lunch time sat on the right side of the bar waited ten minutes for a server who was rude and quite obviously didn't want to be our server. Food was adequate at best. Spend your money somewhere else .

7_qTS2dqgoH-TyYi9EdxBQ.text: Great restaurant.  We had a large party and were able to reserve a room. The service was excellent.  We were not hurried through dinner. There is adequate parking to include the overflow lot.  A full bar in house. The food is great, well prepared and presented.  The flavors were varied and excellent.

s_NrmjxhyK40nOzQpm_OzA.text: Great 1st experience. I had the pesto gnocchi and some pretty amazing cocktails. Sat at the bar...  Michelle was the best, so sad she's not there anymore!!! :(

nbIu87RnQbJwyxqVDPUL3w.text: We enjoyed this location. The food was excellent and the service was prompt and courteous.

FB4F5wzvisFfjFAF3m7Q3A.text: We went here on a Friday night and enjoyed a good meal. Hubby had a baked pasta, and I had their pasta special with chicken, shrimp, etc. with Alfredo sauce. Both dishes had tons of pasta!   Hubby's dish tasted really good. I liked the tomato sauce. My dish was eh, for me. All of the meats were good, but the sauce lacked flavor for me.   We ordered desserts: a chocolate thing and the panna cotta. Both really good. The coffee was incredible!   The service was nice and prompt. We'd return to this place.

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubby likes their sofa choice!

m4RE3WCSDdsbPGbsF7XXQw.text: Recently my wife and I, along with some friends, stayed at the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino on Flamingo (See my detailed review). My buddy asked a local to recommend a good Italian restaurant. Without hesitation, Nora's was the choice. Since it was only a couple miles west on Flamingo we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed.   Our party of five arrived at 4:30 on a Friday and the place was already busy. However they were able to seat us in about five minutes. Great start. The server, whose name I wish I could remember, was wonderfully friendly. In fact, every one who worked there had a wonderful disposition while hustling to provide great service. We were very impressed.   The dishes ordered by us included two dishes of spaghetti with marinara, one with sliced Italian sausage, Linguini and Clams (clams both in the shell and mixed in with the pasta), Spinach Cannelloni (my choice), and cheese tortellini with marinara. We also ordered a house salad served family style which was wonderful. There is also strips of garlic bread served with dinner.   All the dishes were raved about. The servings were large without being ridiculous. My wife only was able to eat half of the Linguini and Clams, but since our hotel room had a mini-fridge she was able to take it back for a late-night snack. My Spinach Cannelloni has (of course) spinach, fresh pasta, ricotta cheese, mozzarella, covered in a tomato sauce. I was a little nervous about the tomato sauce but I needn't be. It has a wonderful flavor that complemented the stuffed cannelloni. Delicious!  Next trip to Vegas we will be back. Without a doubt one of the best meals we've had in the city in our many years of coming. Prices are also very reasonable for what you get. Great food, great service, great dining experience!

Wkjx9AKpPynrsUHb3TPb3w.text: I've been seeing this place come up over and over again on Yelp. We finally decided to give it a little taste.  First of all, make reservations. This place is a madhouse on a weekend night.  Secondly, prepare to wait awhile if you don't.   We were starving after driving and waiting for an hour. So you'd think everything would be amazing. Eh, it wasn't.   The service was bad. Not horrible, just way under good. We could barely get her to stay at the table without her wanting to walk away when we'd tell her one thing. So that was sad.   We had --  The risotto balls. I don't know the actual name. They were...meh. Really cheesy. But the marinara was delightful.  Spaghetti with meatballs and marinara. Meh. The marinara was delightful...hahahahaha.  The crazy Alfredo. Meh. I don't know. Nothing about it stood out.   I will say this -- the pasta itself is super good. Like, excellent good.   We also had some really good Malbec. For the full bodied, non sweet wine lovers, try Amancaya.   This is the highest rated Italian joint in town. I don't agree.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious.

tlbvxFl1P8iEPg-ncOZIMw.text: Visiting from Chicago and Nora's was highly recommend to be by a friend in Chicago.  The food is delicious and the service was awesome.  Anthony was our waiter and was fantastic.  Next time in Vegas we will be back.  Pizza was awesome as well as past.

bE6hODKWFDRaqHlICpRxrQ.text: This place is the kinda place u wanna come to every time you're in vegas. Inside is super nice good for dates or group parties. Waiters here are super friendly and very attentive. Can't go wrong the pasta ala nora or my favorite the crazy pasta. Truffle fries and calamari is a must too and save room for their canolis. You'll thank me later

lyJ_ilyg1dpjv9LGJHrp8Q.text: This is a place I got taken to by frequent diners of this establishment. They talked it up, and it lived up to the billing. Great food, and all parties left satisfied. I got the lasagna which I will recommend.

LBq44Ukzx-zcRDer1I4Jdg.text: We were craving Italian & wanted to try somewhere new so we jumped on Yelp to help us find a place & Nora's came up a couple times. It was Friday night around 5:30pm so I called to see I could a reservation on short notice bc we have a 1 year old and by 9 she's not very pleasant to be around. Lol. The next Res wasn't until 9:30 but for a party of 5 was about a 30 min wait right now. So we drove over & was told 30-45 min wait. As soon as you walk in the place smells amazing & you are greeted to an open kitchen right in front of you & the dining room to the left & bar to the right. It only took about 20 for our table to be ready.   We ordered to Yelp recommendations, crazy Alfredo, shrimp scampi dinner, chicken Marsala & eggplant parm. The complimentary garlic bread is delicious & even their plain white bread is tasty (for the baby).  Everything was so good & the portions are huge. We had left overs for each dish. You can easily share one dish between two people. We will definitely be coming back but will know to make reservations.

zRswS9sfEChNI7ZsAWSzeQ.text: Poor service and very average food.  Red sauce and is basically red water. I had the veal parmigiana (typically one of my favorites). Bland!! No flavor to the veal or red sauce. Even the pasta was bland. Smothered it all in parmigiana and red peppers.  Did I mention the device? Horrible. I've had better service at outback.  Here's the topper! My wife gives them about 800-$1000 a month in lunch banquet business. And the manger that know her by name couldn't even say hello. Just stand there watching his staff struggle and stare!!

igl5H7Z85nfR99Tfe67a7w.text: Great atmosphere. Don our server very polite n courteous   Food was very tasty. Basic menu with daily specials. But again very flavorful. Friends recommended this place   Will definitely come back to try other dishes   2nd update. It's been 6 months later. Back in town, one of the favorite places to go.

srRDGn818vJPk59bGeKEjw.text: Excellent food and excellent service!  Took our parents their as part of a gift and they loved the food!  They aren't kidding when they say the lemon drop cocktail is good, it's my favorite!

J86FCvMXy8AlkSBfJouC2w.text: All I have to say is " Forget about it"! This place is Great ! Beautiful new building, all the workers enjoy the new location. Service is great , food is authentic & excellent ! Didn't want to give my Las Vegas secret away, but here it is, Enjoy !

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All I have to say is &#34; Forget about it&#34;

NeIoLTRc_AYnlEqgQfzZ8w.text: Finally.  After a good 6 years of knowing about this place, really ever since dining at the old/extinct location on Rampart/Charleston like 20 times, it was about time I came to the original.  As I understand, they've expanded onto the original.  What used to be a pizza kitchen with 3 tables, went left, and went right, and now has 3 distinct rooms with 3 distinct different feels.  When reserving a table, make sure you specify.  The family room (quiet and better for families), the casual (still 3 tables, attached to the kitchen), and the ritzy (connected to the bar, very nice, and hip).  PS.  One little TV in the bar doesn't quite cut it.  (1)  One free Sangria with Yelp check-in with 1 purchased.  A $7.50 value, giddy up.  Could be more fruity and less sharp.  (4.0 stars)  (2)  Pasta alla Nora ($12.50) -- It has everything I wanted.  Pesto, meat sauce, eggplant, and pasta.  I added a meatball for $1.50, and it exactly fixed the spot.  Huge portion.  (4.0 stars)  (3)  The Melrose with Shrimp ($17.50) -- a creamy pesto sauce with sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, and medium-size shrimp.  A little heavy-handed with the sauce, but better than not enough.  (4.5 stars)   The service was nice, but wavered between unavailable and forgetful.  Overall, this place just makes me happy.  It would totally be my everyday place if I was local.  For out-of-towners, if you are looking for an easy-peasy spot away from the strip, this is your place.

yNqoSJ2oj1skN1dMwVHx1Q.text: Been here numerous times.  They always out do themselves with service and the food.  My go to for business meetings, when I have family in town, or a nice night out with my husband.  Thank you for being the best!

hFNnAqtBhDsQyBm9nuu0eA.text: I have dined to Nora's on numerous occasions, from the old location off of Rampart to the new location on Flamingo. Excellent food, wine and service. I will say though, I do miss the intimate setting and ambiance that the former Nora's on Rampart gave.

ygA9_7POjg27h8Qo_AOvWg.text: GREAT GREAT pizza at a fair price! LOVE their version of baked ziti. Old school bar. Wonderful pleasant hostesses and terrific service staff. A small stage with live music on Fri and Sat nights. HIGHLY recommended.

VUqHULqIG0OhAxioypwN8Q.text: Really good food! I had chicken parmesan and it was the best! Service and food were both great.

DWMRK6TJLSGkNLEVN8sMlw.text: I consider myself a Nora's expert.  I have a hard time paying a lot of money for Italian food, but Nora's is the right price point with quality food and interesting drinks to boot.  Food: Get yourself some of the fried risotto balls for an appetizer to go along with the complimentary garlic bread.  My favorite entrees are the Alla Nora and any pasta with the vodka sauce.  My husband likes the linguine with clams.  I know that one of their "famous" dishes is the Crazy Alfredo, but I'm here to tell you that you can pass on that dish.  Too much stuff in there and the flavors don't stand out because they're all competing against each other.  Drinks: Original and handcrafted cocktails at the full bar.  Of course they have a substantial wine list also, but I'm a cocktail girl.  Those bartenders know their drinks, and can make a wicked Sazerac.  Service: There are two dining areas and a private room that you can reserve.  The private room does have a fee to reserve it, but you get this amazing appetizer platter that is enough to serve around 12 people.  I've never had a problem with service at this restaurant; they are wonderful (my favorite waiter is Will, a tall and handsome drink of water!).  No other Italian place compares.

VSvnDBi4sGZ2pssWocEFOA.text: Best Authentic Italian in Vegas!  Heard about it from friends and on Food Network.  Great atmosphere & super attentive and friendly wait staff.  Their lasagna & scampi are out of this world & on occasion they have different chefs specials from time to time.   Have been 10 plus times now & looking forward to many more.

ANQZUuCFIpK0AnI448sa7w.text: There are togo many other phenomenal reviews on Yelp to go over them all again. Great service, some of the best most imaginative yet  classy cocktails I have ever had, and food comparable to the best places I've eaten in any city.   So, to summarize; excellent cocktails, great Italian food, classy, classy, classy.

D2U8KFy-aHPMNZuXqsJN8g.text: The right side Dining room is greatly decorated and the bar is as well, but the left side of the building dining room looks like a third grader decorated it.  HOWEVER, put that aside because the food here for the price is a great deal.  When you walk in, your senses come to life with some great Italian cooking.  I have only been there for lunch, but having said that, I would love to try the dinner menu.  The lunch specials are very well priced and the quality of the food is above average.  The staff was friendly and very attentive to your needs.  I would definitely come back to eat again.  Reasonable prices and good quality food.

Or3jwgRxhdjhy91wP79D4Q.text: We ate dinner here after attending Penn & Teller on a Saturday night. The restaurant is about two miles from the Penn & Teller theater, in a strip mall. When we arrived, there was a live band playing, there was a dark ambience, and the restaurant was about half-full.   The tables were covered with what appeared to be butcher paper, which I thought was a little odd. When I got my menu, I was surprised by the number of choices. I opted for the special, called the Mt. Etna Pasta, which consisted of pan fried angel hair, chicken breasts, potatoes, peppers, and a balsamic reduction, among other things.   When my dish arrived, it looked like a volcano of some type. I didn't know where to begin. It looked odd to be certain, but I reserved judgment until I had a chance to taste it. I must say that it is one of the tastiest Italian dishes I've had in the last 10 years. I devoured the dish despite its large size, and left a happy camper.  The prices were reasonable. The band was just okay. The butcher paper table was a little bit tacky. The service was good. Overall, I recommend this place to anyone that is not desperately trying to impress a first date. Get to know the person a bit, THEN take him/her here and tell them to get the Mt. Etna.

KlbOUzv3Xior9oRj62JZlw.text: My husband and I consider this our romantic date night spot:) Great food and drinks every time, and we've been loyal customers for almost 8 years! Love Nora's!

wErADDP9_r_jIHAkfPDvbA.text: This is one of my favorite local places to go and eat lunch with my friends and family.  food has always been really good. The service is the only reason I am giving it 4 stars. The service has always been either really good or well, not so good sometimes. The free yelp offer was good. They bring u a very decent Pinot Grigio for the wine. Our server was not bad. He could have been a little more attentive to us tho. Sometimes it seemed he would kind of disappear and I had to go find him twice. Overall a very good restaurant. I would come back here.

5DuOLYOj_pVsOVfOPhoeLw.text: Nora's has been my favorite italian restaurants for years! You really can't go wrong here, it is italian comfort food for me. The sauces are all so delicious, I never even liked Alfredo sauce until i tried it here. The calamari is some of the best i have ever had, and all the specialty pasta dishes and pizzas are great. The service is always great and the staff is so friendly. They have a great drink menu with many wine and craft cocktail choices. The deserts are to die for! my favorite are the cheese cake and the cannoli. Also the lunch menu is awesome and everything here is really affordable and amazing.

gtl2HOnACkfNxxzUw1X69w.text: I'm born and raised in vegas. I ate here when it first opened in the 90's. It def is not what it used to be "back in the day". Still good food but way too busy and long waits for service. Last visit march 2014. I guess if you want good service dont come here during peak hours. The night of my visit the patrons were pretty saucy and loud. I guess people feel this type of resturaunt is cool with drunk cackling bimbos and loud rambling.

FxA4uriJ2HGUhchHTtJNuw.text: Stayed at palms place nora"s is just down the street and is also well worth the cab ride from any where on the strip if you are looking for great Italian food. The veal was the best and the crazy alfredo is great This place is not on the edge of fantastic it is fantastic The drinks by rudy are made great ,he and all the staff are great .Stayed in vegas 8 nights was the best meal we had and 30% less money than all the others meals .

Q8Q_q99PRZq-Aupoo9u5Sw.text: I'm so glad my bf knows people that know great places that serve up good food.   Overall experience here is definitely four stars. Came here not knowing what to expect-- it was busy, small but had that feeling of authenticity, friendly staff, tables covered with butcher paper. Although  I almost felt out of place walking in here.My bf and I came here wearing  jeans, t-shirt and flip flops and everyone else looked so fancy. But we were able to be seated immediately without being given a hard time so I guess dress code wasn't an issue.   Service was quick despite of the traffic. We immediately started off with calamari which was excellent, and also the garlic bread--nicely toasted with some butter and ofcourse garlic. With the help of our server, I got myself a cocktail called the "berry explosion."And it was excellent, not too strong and was berry delicious. For the entree, my bf ordered the "Crazy Alfredo"--sausage, chicken, mushrooms, and shrimp. That was actually real good, I say better than what I ordered, which was the Orange Roughy with angel hair pasta. It was a wee underflavor and wow that fish was fishy. Not a big fan of it but yet again there's plenty of food to choose from and there will be a next time.   The place is not that cheap either. 70 bucks including tip for this dinner but it was worth it, minus the fish.. sort of. And we thought it was busy when we got here, but it was mad busy on the way out. They do take reservations and I highly recommend that.

-c8DQ36dyYr-LAeEWOMsEA.text: I absolutely love Nora's. With their sauce you can't go wrong with pasta and meatballs or lasagna.  Great classic cocktails and some of the best live music in Vegas.

VSn5SQ5UqahYecnEEptVJA.text: i wrote one on my phone but i guess it was for the actual check in...  checked in and got a free glass of chianti!  i ordered the linguine with red clam sauce. awesome! the clams werent in the shell so that was awesome! but that could also mean it came from a can. tien n and anthony m order pastas as well. pesto and i forgot the other one... we got two desserts. one was a canoli with chocolate chips and pistachios. ZAM ZAM! and the other one was a tiramisu type of dessert with ladyfingers. ZAMMMMM! haha  the customer service was great. theyd check on us every few minutes asking if we wanted more water.  only complaint is that the floor smelled like mop bucket water....

XbE2tHsmfizKpQ8y4UrMdQ.text: I made reservations for dinner here on a Monday night.  The restaurant was pretty nice and crowded.  They had Booker's bourbon at a good price which is nice.  I ordered the rigatoni and my wife ordered pesto fettuccine with chicken.  They were both delicious.  The pesto was rich.  The rigatoni might have too many onions for some.  Both dishes were in the A to B+ range.  The cost was very reasonable.

b5Bgvtn1ATv6LcBHT-dZLA.text: Woman at the jacuzzi said they make Italian like "mama used to" here. So I ventured out here to find out what my Italian mama would've made.  So I step inside and the first face I see is old baby blue eyes. It's too bad that this and a street name is all we got left of him in Vegas.  The hostess was distracted with takeout orders when I entered and I was left waiting for more than five minutes at the front. After I was seated, I was greeted by the server, who addressed me as "sir", which would normally be awkward for me but came off as polite in this instance.  My bread and drink came out relatively quickly. The bread was a garlic toast which was a little on the soggier side and not so garlicky.   I ordered the "crazy" Alfredo, which is the standard fettuccine Alfredo with jalapenos, sausage, chicken, and mushrooms. I guess somebody was eating pizza and decided the toppings would be just as well in a pasta. The peppers really did overpower everything else in the dish as it was hard to even taste the Alfredo sauce. The pasta was cooked correctly but the taste was not all that great.  The check took a while to come out so I would say that the service is inconsistent here.  I guess this would be the point where mama would hit me in the back of the head with a spatula for this review.

ZnLlmDdygt2DpGb_02r0PQ.text: The food is very bland in most cases, unless you get their old Steak and cheese sandwich (not on the menu anymore), and then all you can taste is the cheese. The chicken Parmesan is not breaded and is sitting in a tasteless soup. I have eaten here many times (not by my choice), and have never had a good meal. It is clean and has a nice atmosphere, but I would skip this place in the future

YX8ImxXK3wrGBAPLhLWx9A.text: GET OFF THE STRIP! Really, there is more to Vegas than Celeb Chefs and over priced strip restaurants.   Had the Calamari app, very tender, well seasoned. The Mozzarella Caresse was not the best i've had, but still tasty.  Highlight was the Crazy Alfredo think Alfredo Fettuccine, then add sausage, jumbo shrimp, mushrooms, bell peppers, sun dried tomatoes, and wait for it...Jalapenos.   definitely will be a return visit on the next trip out.

5hYFSUgXcst_Kc9G-2gQvQ.text: I have been here on several occasions. I've had some truly excellent dishes. Yesterday, however, was not one of those days.  I ordered the fettucine carbonara, a usually, well-balanced dish. They missed the mark yesterday. Where do I begin? The pasta was not cooked properly, some was al dente and some was close but under done...how do you do that? Perhaps they realized they didn't put enough in the pot and added some a few minutes later...? Who knows. They use ham in the carbonara. It was like they rolled up a bunch, cut it and threw in the. They didn't separate the pieces. There was so much ham I couldn't taste anything else. I spoke to the manager and showed him my plate. He agreed that there was too much ham in the dish. We didn't discuss the other issues. He asked me if I wanted it remade but I didn't. I had to go in search of a manager because I couldn't get the waiter to come to my table. No one asked me if I needed more water. No one came to inquire about my satisfaction with my dish. Had someone done so early on I might have had them remake it. As it was the manager took the pasta off the bill. I would have preferred enjoying my meal. Maybe I'll try again but at the moment I am undecided.

T9DdBjeIAOvibnk7mXKUaw.text: Has the Crazy Alfredo it's amazing! If you like pasta with a little spice you have to try it. I went on a Saturday so the wait for our food was a little long but if your into cocktails have a lemon drop and you'll be fine ;-).

ospb5l8aaIq5ZmXJBnHaRw.text: I've been going to Nora's for over 25 years. Great to see a nice family business succeed the way they have!  Great food for a fair price!  Keep it up for many more years!

r44fPPmTAzcIUCzKBXzywg.text: Every time I come here, I leave saying "why don't I come here more often?!" The menu is extensive and the prices are incredibly reasonable.   Most recently, dined in a group of four - we ordered a large salad (Antipasto) and the arancini to share. The large salad easily had two servings per person. Both were super tasty... And we easily could have had just that for dinner - we ended up boxing up all but three bites of our entrees (equally delicious) to eat for lunch the next day. I can vouch for the Crazy Alfredo, gnocci (and vodka sauce), Pasta Puttanesca and Rigatoni Special. Yuuuum.   Our waitress was super friendly and attentive (wish I could remember her name - sorry!) and recommended a great bottle of wine - and made no judgement about the fact that we told her we wanted to stay on the cheap side of the list.  Go, go, go!

2Y6WTuqnhKeuiGik7Gny2g.text: Food and service were excellent. Had the eggplant Parmesan and veal scallopini. The servings were very generous and the price was reasonable. I would definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

jNdU_q70s3pCkgNyeFghig.text: This is the BEST Italian food in town, although I seem to order the same thing when I go.  The Crazy Alfredo!  What a dish!  Their garlic bread is amazing; always hot and crispy with the perfect amount of garlic and seasoning.  If you're a fan of Caesar salad, their dressing is great also. The atmosphere is very authentic.  My wife and I sat in the bar area on a weekend evening.  They had live entertainment.  I felt like we had stepped into a scene of "The Godfather"

gEehMl3FIpIShe-Cl5BKng.text: so good we went 2x. Highly recommend it if you're in Vegas for a great italian meal at reaonable prices

L54jTzPIFCPvrZOLoIpLzQ.text: This place was awesome! We loved the food. The calamari was delicious and their antipasto salad was perfect. Loaded with meats and cheese. We were satisfied with our main dishes, but the group didn't seem too impressed. Maybe we just loaded up on their delicious garlic bread :)  The only issue we ran into was that we had taken a cab to the restaurant and were unable to find a cab for 5 people to take us back. The restaurant has an agreement with a cab company that only has cars.

EbzjKDzv4zQQeZBPdh34-Q.text: Once in awhile, I have a craving for Italian food.. and when I do, it has to be GOOD Italian food.. so I come here!   Nora's is a cute little restaurant in a plaza that is just Bleh.. but once you walk in the doors, the smell and the bustling waiters invite you in to their little world. There's always a busy bar with patrons eating and drinking on there, as well as 2 little rooms that are always full of people happily enjoying their food.   I've ordered a couple of different things here but my all time favorite as to be the clam linguine. I have asked the chef to make a "pink sauce" each time, which is a combination of white and red sauce, and it's delectable. The flavor is great and the chef is not cheap with his clams! There's a ton in his dish and it's worth every penny.   The breadsticks here are also very very good. It's made with real garlic and really hits the spot. The first basket is on the house! But I always order another basket :)  The white sangria here is also a good choice. A few sips of that always makes my night fun.   I will keep coming back. See you there!

klDltTi7dC-wedKaYu8pPQ.text: We came to Vegas to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday and chose to eat here. It could not have been better, the service was attentive and helpful, the food was so good we mentioned it even days later. When the server found out it was my daughters birthday she insisted on bringing out a beautifully plated dessert. All in all great experience, not one negative thing about it. Thanks to everyone there!!

nqnhu5mm8e2oSrS6C6wASA.text: FOOD: Ok  SERVICE: Poor... Very poor.   CLEANLINESS: The appearance and cleanliness is very good.   Beyond the above, this was our "wish we can hop in a DeLorean and go back in time to avoid this place" experience. Just a note: it's fairly long, which is why I already put the key things above. So read beyond this if you'd like. If not, I totally understand.   This was our wedding anniversary. At our hotel, an employee recommended this place to us. We do have this one other place we absolutely love, but I'll get into that later.... So, we decided to give Nora's a try.  We made reservations for four.  Upon arrival, we were seated in a timely manner. But this is where things came go a stop....That's exactly how it felt from the moment we were seated.   We waited. Waited. And waited. Finally, someone asked for our drink order. Another stoppage moment. Waited. And waited. A waiter, I think Sebastian or Sebastia, hurriedly comes to our table and repeatedly apologizes for the long delay. Oh yes. This dude was very aware of our wait. He went on how he has to cover the other side of the restaurant. Not a few tables in the same section. But the other side that you cannot see from where we are sitting. Apparently, he's the only Italian speaking waiter and this large party on the other side who spoke Italian, needed attending to.   Okay. Our only thought was "So, why doesn't management or the owner step in?" Why don't they be proactive and have someone cover his tables while he attends to something they are unable to do?"  Makes sense, right? I mean, if he has to step away because he is the only Italian speaking waiter, this will take time away from his other customers. This was not done. And boy did we pay the price.   Here's the deal... we waited ONE FULL HOUR till our food arrived at the table. Yes, you read that right... one hour. I even told him "do you realize your repeated 'sorry, but you have to do something else' had us waiting for one hour?"  And I kid you not, this was his answer... "I'm so sorry." I don't know what was more sorry... choosing Nora's or this guy's attitude to put on a disappearing act followed by the only line in his one-man show: "I'm sorry."  I mean, it was that bad!    In Los Angeles the stereotypical thing is that many waiters are  "actors". So I'm guessing being in Vegas, Sebastia, has a desire to be a magician and one day headline his own show on the Strip. I mean, he has certainly mastered the art of illusion with his service. David Copperfield, if you're looking for a protege, this is your guy. I can vouch for his disappearing act.   In the end... Families. Couples. Out-of-towners. Newlyweds. Honeymooners.... we would not recommend this to anyone at all. This was a horrible experience for us. It didn't help that the food was just ok, too. But that service... by far the longest wait we have ever experienced. And the lack of having someone, whether it's management or anyone of authority to recognize this and be more proactive about the situation... talk about being complacent.  The respect for the paying customer: Zero.   So back to that one place we absolutely love.... There is a silver lining to this whole thing. You see, no matter how crazy or unprofessional these moments might seem at times, always know this: You have the ultimate decision to do whatever it is you want to do. So rather than making this wedding anniversary dinner at Nora's spoil our Vegas trip, the next evening, we decided to return to the place we love... PIERO'S. The host has always been incredibly professional. The servers: A whole different level of service, and I'm talking amazing service . If you were to peak behind you at times, you would notice another staff standing by to make sure you were attended to. You know how you sorta look around, and they catch this, then someone says, "Yes, is there anything I can get for you?"  And best part of Piero's... being this was our anniversary all over again - the host sat us at the booth they used in the movie "CASINO".  The scene where Robert De Niro and Sharon Stone sitting at their booth. Although the movie used a different name, this was the restaurant, Piero's.   Good luck to all. It is your money. It is your valuable time; especially to those from out of town, time is very short and you want to make the best of it.

E-2o0UZmDFWelsiGuEDvkA.text: I come to Noras about once a month. Every time my meal is perfect and the service is spot on. Simply put, Noras is THE place in Las Vegas for Italian food.

8FlQqvm0lmrPzP--WtKfqA.text: Love the garlic bread and rigatoni special! The lasagna was decent but a little bland. Big portions.

azEauWOrgkBDEqnCEUy7gg.text: Great service, quality Italian, awesome live band (Nat King Cole/ Frank Sinatra jams), off the Strip and close to home--what can be better than this?  I came here twice within a month.  It's intimate, yet fun to bring a small group of friends.  Reservations are recommended, because they are quite popular with the locals.    The calamari is a great starter (light in batter, crispy, yet not oily).  The Frutti di Mare with the spicy marinara is yummy if you like a whole lotta seafood.  All portions are big, so you can share between two people.   But if you like something light in taste and creamy and not too meaty... I recommend the Melrose Shrimp.  Creamy basil pesto, zucchini & sun-dried tomatoes, and linguini-- garnished with 3-4 giant succulent seasoned shrimps.  There are pine nuts added which gives it a nice crunch, but you can ask them to hold off on that if you're allergic or it's not your thing.  I really enjoyed their live band which played a lot of vocal jazz (New Orleans kinda tunes).  It was great vibe.  My friends and I had so much fun--we'll definitely be back!

qcDkB2s3UTrUlNjpGM6A_w.text: Didn't come here for a while! The experience is always delightful! Me and my wife came and forgot to make a reservation. It was BUSY!! We were told it will take 35-45 minutes in advance and decided to wait... We sat at the bar and had some drinks, the bar tender was very nice and served us well. We then proceeded to our table where our service was great, only reason this is not a 5* is the ribeye steak I ordered medium can well well done, the quality of the meat was top of the line though that's for sure...

9W09jyLpV3N7eceNz13vLg.text: I can't believe that it finally took me till last week to try this place. This might be the best hidden gem in the valley.  Listen.....just get the Spaghetti Alla Nora and thank me later.  I'm out...back to enjoy that pasta.

1TLfwu2gx8ZAu_sMdrFMAg.text: One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. It's off the Strip so the prices are really reasonable. I had the spaghetti and meatballs with whole wheat penne pasta and split a Caesar Salad with my wife. Good beer selection. She had the eggplant parmigiana. They have pizza too.

fUs4fnszuC_znMSV8gODDg.text: The food is great. Service was slow. A little pricey but nice atmosphere.  Make sure you have reservations or you will be waiting.... It is definitely a place to go for the food! It's busy every night.

vtmhPHZsxvASaulH321Hrw.text: Dinner at Nora's was a hit! We made reservations which I would definitely recommend, because the place filled up quickly for the dinner rush. The service was very good and the pacing of the courses was right on track.  Arancini and calamari were both cooked perfectly and were delicious. Nora salad was not my favorite, but I'm not a big roasted pepper fan. Garlic bread was delicious. They also have a full bar with plenty of specialty drinks.  I had the gnocchi in vodka sauce which was tasty but I wish the gnocchi's were a little more firm. Other dishes ordered at the table were eggplant parmesan, angel hair with meatballs and linguine with clam sauce. Everyone enjoyed their selections and the portions were just right.  We topped it all off with chocolate chip & pistachio cannoli for desert and cappuccino.  Overall, we had a very nice experience at Nora's. It's a little bit pricey, but not bad considering what you would probably pay for lesser quality food at any of the Italian chains. I will definitely be back and would like to try their pizza.

YOopLNGa8Sc2vFC8dfwAkw.text: I came here from a recommendation from my boyfriend as we both travel a lot for work. I read the reviews and saw many people rave about the vodka sauce. I am a huge fan of vodka sauce as it may be my favorite or close behind meat sauce. I have tried several Italian places in Las Vegas, and none of them have very good vodka sauce.   I enjoyed the gnocchi with vodka sauce and it was amazing. I think it was one of my favorite vodka sauces I have had. They give you fresh garlic bread which was used to soak up every last bit of the sauce. It was that good. The gnocchi were perfectly cooked.  Nora's is really busy, even at 8 pm on a Monday night. I sat at the bar and the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing gnocchi with vodka sauce.

CH4dMP9sabmJ8igd1PuqXg.text: We were at Nora's years ago before they built and opened this Nora's. What an experience - sat at the bar which we prefer but there is plenty of seating.  Rudy, the bartender, is a real bartender, not just someone who draws beer and mixes Gin and Tonics. There are fresh herbs at the bar that are used in cocktails. His service along with Michele were awesome! Oh yes the food - outrageously great! Fairly priced place not far from the strip. We were there on a Monday night - can't imagine how busy they are on Friday's and Saturdays. Highly recommended.

6jzLrw2OI0rVci1zJRtFWQ.text: DL and I were promised a free breakfast and a $100 Visa gift card just for "touring" some new Time Share units and giving our "opinion".  An offer we couldn't refuse.  After 1 1/2 hrs. of unrelenting, hard sell, we left the sales office feeling even $200 wouldn't have been compensation enough.  The only good thing to come of the grilled-over-the-coals experience was the salesman's recommendation of Nora's.  We decided to take the Visa card and go there for dinner.  All I can is, "all's well that ends well", and it all ended very well, indeed.  The salesman has redeemed himself with  us!     We're barflies and love to eat and drink at the bar.  It's a great place to sit if you don't want to be rushed or have your dinner tete a tete constantly disturbed by well-meaning waitstaff.  Love Nora's white and gray-streaked, beveled marble bar.  Elegant.  You could slice cheese on it!  I like my Manhattan's chilled to almost frozen and I told our friendly bartender to "shake the hell out of it."  He shook it all up like Elvis and poured it into a thickly frosted martini glass.  Peeling the lemon was a show in itself.    Our first order was a tower of veggies--zucc., eggplant, Belgian endive, all topped with two fat slices of red bell pepper and arriving perfectly blistered from its bake in the wood burning oven.  You could taste the mellow woodiness in every bite.  Each leaf and ingredient in the house salad was lightly coated with the most perfectly balanced and seasoned House made Italian dressing.  I've been trying for decades to make a dressing like that at home, and still haven't succeeded.  We finished the entire generous portion between the two of us--a first for salads for us.  We usually get bored halfway through.     The pizza was made with all imported cold cuts.  Flavor burst from all points on the compass with every bite.  It's the kind you can fold and eat neatly.  The crust, including the bottom, was browned and lightly charred and I saved a few crusts from the rim to have with my coffee this morning. The surrounding crust was surprisingly light to the touch even though it had the appearance of a dense peasant bread.  You won't break your teeth on it.  Nowadays, pizza has come to mean "salty, oily, and characterless", as in almost all chain foods.  Or overly precious and pristine, (think "white" pizza) as in many high-end bistros.  If you're bored with all that--you are in for a surprise.     We are relatively newcomers to Malbec and don't count ourselves among the experts.  We got the least expensive bottle and were well pleased.  It complemented and held its own against this hearty fare.      An interesting aside:  How do all the girls gathered around the reservation podium stay so anorexically thin with all those aromas and glorious visuals swirling around all night?  Inquiring minds want to know.

uJaaHG78HqzceScM-u4pIQ.text: Wow, originally I was going to give it a top rating however, yesterday (my 3rd time in 3 weeks) I got food poisoning.  The only food I ate was oatmeal for breakfast and then to Nora's for lunch.  Not sure what did it but both my wife and I shared the chicken Marsala, along with spaghetti, and a side of the chicken wings.  We both were infected last night.  We won't chance this place again.

P2E8SyMx1iJ0Dyo8YB9Vlw.text: Love his place for years!  Crazy Alfredo still my favorite. Prices went up a little bit. But all in all still the best on this side of the strip. Parking is very hard to find, even on a Thursday.

FbSHlkRf1EX9hPbmUVIQLw.text: I've been coming to this restaurant since it opened. There is no exaggeration on that. The old location used to be a tiny kitchen with only about 4 tables to eat at. They expanded twice and now have moved to a completely new location. I have dined in all the locations and have never been disappointed   Nora's is the best Italian food I have ever had. I have tried countless Italian restaurants and nothing compares. I used to complain that other Italian food was gross and actually wouldn't even eat any other Italian food for a while. Not only is it the best in Vegas, but it also holds as the best over many other restaurants in other cities.   Spaghetti and meatballs are a classic but the best I've ever had. Penne ala vodka is amazing. Penne with broccoli sauce and chicken (not on the menu but they always make it for me) is so good. Really I'm not even going to continue because everything on the menu is divine.   The Mauro family is amazing. They've always taken care of my family and I, and we are so grateful for that. Not only do they put out the best Italian food in Vegas, but even in their homes. Their rich Italian culture has been brought out in their loving natures and food-filled parties.   Truly the best Italian restaurant (and one of the best restaurants in general) in Vegas, backed up by one of the best families!!!

xYj1jJhLrQBOYIcIN7iMew.text: Came here to see a friend sing, and really enjoyed the whole experience.  This place has a wonderful atmosphere - both upbeat and intimate at the same time.  I tried one of the cocktails - it was on the stronger side, so I admit I didn't finish it - but the red wine I had two glasses of (by suggestion of a friend) was fantastic.  The food was also really good!  I had the eggplant parmesan (and much to my lament, I forgot to take a picture of it before I ate it) - delicious!!  This is one of the few places in town that features jazz musicians on a regular basis, so if you like that vibe, this is the place for you!

80mOtLYkdQLnjBA5fPmz9w.text: Very disappointed in the new Nora's. Waiter staff is not trained, because when we were there, waiters and waitresses were in a group talking where the customer can see.  We had a problem with a pizza which was cold and tasteless, and the manager never acknowledged our party.  Professional he was not!  Our salads had no taste, and the waiter was not very proficient.  Sorry to complain, but we never had these issues at the old Nora's, and this was our third time at the new Nora's all of which were not a very good dining experience. We won't be coming back and like the old saying, if it's not broke don't fix it,the old normal Nora's wasn't broke.The waiter presented our order to the manager and he never acknowledged our complaint,if he doesn't show concern to customer service how is the staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uivi5hUXyT4xGJ-LuWzYUA.text: I went there with my wife and our friend the decor is very nice the hostess was pleasant and friendly.  Our waitress an older lady seemed nice but not too friendly not really informative as too what was on their menu that we might want to try not asking if we want appetizers not letting us know about the special meal they had for the day.  The bus girl was very helpful and nice.   As for the food it was fabulous very flavorful and tasty because of the food i gave it a four would be a five but the service was so disappointing i would go again just to see maybe the service-was just a blip.

edunwfbNDS-LdYALNFSjlQ.text: Food good, I was too late to get my favorite rib eye sandwich. Pizza and chicken strips. Awesome garlic bread.  Lurch for a waiter.... I've tried to give this place a second, third, fourth...chance. What was once my go to, is no more.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always good

H6-5ZZKUotEVw1zFaeTTHw.text: Between 2 other friends, we had their Vegetarian Pizza & Lasagna. Delicious! Then we had this Cookies & Cream with Oreos dessert. That definitely hit the spot! I will be coming back to try out a few other menu items that caught my eye :) Thank you  Although this part isnt necessarily relevant, our server Anthony, who looked/sounded like a NY Italian was cute :) lol

iTbF_QCHTPbAyfa0VHTQUQ.text: Granted everyone loves Nora's. I wasn't impressed. We were seated immediately and received some menus. Our drinks were brought right away and our sever was very informative and helpful about answering questions had we needed to ask any about the menu. I decided on lasagna and I convinced my boyfriend to try the crazy Alfredo because everyone raves it was crazy good. Also because it has three different type of meat in it. We were brought some garlic bread but it had a weird taste to it. The garlic part tastes good but the bread had a off putting inedible taste I did not stand to eat. Our food took a while in my opinion but they were making it to order (I believe?) so I didn't really mind. We were brought our pastas and after being so excited I was quickly let down yet again. My lasagna had an overwhelming taste of basil. The crazy Alfredo was not to my liking. I thought I would like it but prefer a classic Alfredo instead. My boyfriend finished the entire plate of Alfredo which means he loves it and doesn't even like Italian food unless it's seafood. The meatballs I ordered in addition to my lasagna because I was unsure if it came with meat because the menu didn't state of it did or not, we're tender and flavorful and I did enjoy the one that I ate. I would give this place another chance and order something else. I just wasn't impressed with what we ordered but the service was great and the fact he ate the entire bowl says a lot. I'll be back with an updated review.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite part of my meal even though I only finished one.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna. Overwhelming taste of basil through the entire dish. Not the best lasagna I&#39;ve had. Not the worse either.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo. I didn&#39;t like it. Boyfriend loves it and ate the entire bowl.

Ww3gSHOmSFzF8x0ITxPW_A.text: We have coming to Nora's for years, even when they had their small restaurant in a strip mall. Outstanding Italian cuisine, great service, wonderful atmosphere. The pasta dishes are all wonderful, and we've tried just about everyone. The wild boar with pasta is great, as is their desserts. The new location is a little noisier than the old facility but the quality and quantity of the food didn't change.

6Y4c9bkFP9hGk3o8OUybLQ.text: We went a couple weeks ago for a friend's birthday.  At first I was leery of how good this place could really be because of it's location.  It's in a crappy little strip mall kind of tucked away where you wouldn't see it unless you were actively looking for it.  I was so pleasantly surprised.  The place was packed, the hostesses/waiters were nice, there was a small jazz band playing, we were seated promptly (we had a reservation - HIGHLY recommend booking one) & the food/drinks...oh god it was all SO great.  Here's a rundown of the food we ordered:  Appetizers:  - Garlic Bread (1st basket on the house - it's so good, you'll want to pay for another basket but don't be tempted to fill up on bread!)   - Arancini (so good!)  Dinner:  - Alla Nora (This was my order & it was SO good)  - Pork Tenderloin alla Siciliana  (My friend's dish - it was excellent)  - Chicken Parmigiana (The birthday girl's dish - also very good)  Desserts:   - Oreo Cookie Tartufo (This was good but VERY sweet)  - Salted Caramel Panna Cotta (**THIS WAS MY FAVORITE***)  - Tiramisu (Good! I like a little more cookie to cream ratio but very good)  I was so impressed by everything about this place that I'm taking my honey there tomorrow night for an early valentine's day dinner.  It was the first place I thought of when I was asked if I wanted to go eat somewhere...make sure to check it out if you're in the area & want some delicious Italian food!

XWyC_Z9E5e-yRhOd32Uhdg.text: Bestest pizza ever.! One of my favorite italian restaurant in vegas. They also have sangria!

D8iA2f0h49-h4PDCYf8SdA.text: The garlic bread!!! I could end this right here right now and tell you just to go there for that, but I wouldn't be doing my due diligence. The second most important thing I can tell you is MAKE A RESERVATION! I was very lucky that I have a friend that lives in Las Vegas and was able to recommend Nora's as well as warn me to make a reservation. When we walked in we were sat immediately thought there were a bunch of other families standing there waiting for tables I assume were just walk-ins. We had the mozzarella sticks as a app and they were pretty good. For dinner I had the chicken Parmesan (very good) and my husband had a chicken dish with pesto that he said was absolutely phenomenal! Unfortunately, we were not able to eat it all because the portions were substantial and we were also unable to doggy bag it because we were from out of town. I wish we had Nora's here! If I find myself in Vegas again I will most certainly come back here!

kxmlC74G2l93F4a0YpH7Lw.text: I enjoyed the Veal Scaloppini and panna cotta for dessert. It was a busy night but our server did the best she could with all the tables she had. I would definitely come back!

Kb-bZEAWRQzB0_cC4sZ3-Q.text: Greg and I sat at the bar and were served by Michelle, who totally rocked!  Chicken Marsala and Chicken Parmesan were awesome!  Great food and awesome service!  Can't wait to come back!

Eql9Gmswt9zQ1uiPvdwSrw.text: Chicken Parmigiana was awesome.   Great  customer service all around.   The environment was a little loud.

EnzooRSMeNHaIDLfCt3UwA.text: Were visiting the Las Vegas area for some fun.  We searched for an Italian restaurant and found Nora's. Wow, what a great meal and value. Our server Adam suggested a couple of dishes for my wife and I. They were both awesome! We will definitely be back.

Y_FbIaoS09XMKib1ajxfow.text: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  So far everything we've tried was good and would recommend this to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n6rQOcLSUPdszSWnXknhHQ.text: I'm probably the millionth person to say that this is my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. The ONLY problem about this place is the wait time. So call ahead, make a reservation and have some courtesy to show up on time to enjoy one of the best meals you're going to have in your life. If there is a wait, hang out at the bar (a friend of mine, Angela, works there and is super awesome) until your table is ready.   Once you get your bite into ANY of their food, you'll realize that the wait was worth it. Definitely try the Veal Parmigiana with Meat Sauce! The portion was huge! So it's probably better to hit up this place with a lot of your friends and family style it so you can have a dose of everyone's plate. Second, Alla Nora. Third, try a pizza (you'll be surprised).   I'm not going to go in depth about this place because everything on the menu is honestly amazing, it just depends on what you might be craving that day. Service, impeccable. Ambiance, comfortable. Overall experience, WOW. Stop by and get a meal of a lifetime. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alla Nora
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmigiana with Meat Sauce
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Steak

AkonWOUjaRXEWSXv2b9VMQ.text: Had the steak and arugula bruschetta. I'd hardly call it bruschetta, there was very little sun-dried tomatoes to be found on my serving. The portion size for mine was more like an entree (I'm not complaining about that!) Wished for more tomatoes that's all.. Especially cause I to get it without the cheese (I'm dairy free). The green olives next to it were delicious, especially with the pickled onion. Other than that the steak was tender and the arugula was flavorful. I'd come back to the bar for maybe a different appetizer and def more wine! We were able to catch the last half of the Knights game at the bar, so that was awesome! Ps we won!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KJf-H7j_avQkca-MYVda_A.text: We absolutely love Nora's! The food I had always been top notch! I love the Salmon Piccata! The sauce is amazing. I always end up having the Salmon even though I go in determined to try something new. I'm always afraid to miss out on the Salmon. My husband is the adventurous one! He always orders something different. Thankfully, being a good husband he always shares with me  so I can honestly say everything we have tried is wonderful! The staff is great! They are always accommodating, friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a great night out this is it!

6kNStgBRFFcJNJ5K2quf3Q.text: Nora's is amazing! I absolutely love this restaurant. I went there for my Anniversary dinner for the first time. The staff is amazing and always there to help. The food is out of this world and I know my Italian food growing up in New Haven, CT-not quite Italy . I absolutely recommend this place to anyone that loves a very nice italian restaurant.

mp-7QbZIjm_V2NX0eEd_Cw.text: Incredible experience all-around! Great food, service and reasonably priced. Had the special rigatoni and added ricotta cheese, phe-nom-i-nal!! Busboys, hosts and our server Kenia were all on top of it! Anytime I come back to Vegas, I will visit.

ymwkoueFzMEbVYaoloohuA.text: I really wanted to love this place due to high number of reviews. Howeverafter eating here twice I've decided I don't believe in all the hype.  I ordered the crazy Alfredo on my first visit- wayyyyy too much butter/oil/sauce.  Chicken Parmesan- mediocre  Baked rigatoni - too much cheese I'm not a health freak by any means however I'm not impressed with how much sauce and cheese they use. I may try again..but not my first choice in Italian food

VM2IEg1WDSE3h0vjaKXDjA.text: This place is pricey, classy, and so dang delicious! Probably my favorite Italian place I've been to put in Vegas so far. It's filled with business men and brunching women so me and my tattooed friend felt a little out of place but that didn't stop us. We had a glass of moscato each, the steak bruschetta (SO AMAZING) and we split a pasta. Our bill came to around $60.   Our server was a little strange. We asked to change the sauce on our pasta to a vodka sauce and he kind of just said "well I like it the way it is but I guess whatever you want". We thought that was weird because we're both servers and we would never say something like that it comes off judgmental and what's it to you?! Then we asked him to split the pasta in two plates if possible and he made us feel we were asking too much. We said if it's too late no worries but if not it would be easier. He comes back and says "well the kitchen yelled at me but here you go". Again as servers WE WOULD NEVER SAY THAT. Why would you try to make the guest feel bad especially at a higher end spot like this where you're going to have pickier eaters. Maybe he was having an off day. Me and my friend ended up laughing about it but it was uncomfortable.   Overall the food is worth the shitty (hopefully one time) service. Maybe it was because he didn't think we would tip since we didn't appear like his usual clientele. Never judge!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo with vodka sauce instead
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and arugula bruschetta

YT3p5m2cU2Ic9F9CJpQjyQ.text: Satisfied my craving for Italian food.   Must order: crazy Alfredo. Creamy and delicious. I could not stop eating it!   Rigatoni special: pretty good.   Calamari: sauce was ok.  I wish I could try more but the portions huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expresso
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Special
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

AZspoFanp--a-W0wHWwVrg.text: Great food and good service. Really wide variety of options from drinks to food. We typically sit up at the bar...the restaurant fills up quick. Parking is also very convenient.

_34LGs8wm6j0UHaW5k2nAw.text: Wow. Amazing place! We sat at the bar with the bartender Michelle, she was amazing! She helped us out any way we needed and definitely made our experience worth it! It was our first time, we often drive pass this place and we arent too big on italian cuisine we usually stick to what we have already had. But i think this place will be oue new fave when wanting something different! They had everything i love! Calamri.... pasta..... steak.... and the garlic bread omg dont get me started. Delicious!! The apps were delicious fairly large, we got calamari and steak and arugula salad. We then got the tomato mozzarella caprese which i loved! Then we moved on to dinner, and i got the ribeye (of course).  The only thing that i wasnt fond of was that i ordered my steak medium rare, and came out medium. But not a big deal and i still enjoyed! My man ordered the krazy alfredo which had like, a bit of everything! Chicken, shrimp, sausage, and some veggies. It was so good! We had a great time and of course we couldn't leave without getting dessert. So we got the bread pudding. Im not a fan of it but my man loved it. We would definitely go back!! Thanks Michelle!!

RH7RiXooBtjSBhGAJw7n8A.text: Amazing food wonderful customer service the only reason I'm giving this place four stars is because I cannot imagine an Italian restaurant serving pasta and not have fresh Parmesan cheese. I am just blown away other than that I think this place is amazing and I can't wait to go back.

SIcmwT-aqBa4FtKibAUB3A.text: If you love garlic the bread is yummy.   We went to lunch there and the service, prices and food was good.

svd23o4YW_YkLpFubkDYiw.text: My family and I are not from Las Vegas, so our whole trip we relied on Yelp to help us find some great places too eat, and we came across Nora's... The great reviews got us here, there was only three of us.   We ordered  Italian wings, without parsley  Fettuccini Alfredo w/ chicken  The fries with Parmesan (forgot the name) And angel pasta with oils and Garlic  The portion sizes are great, and big! The only thing we did not really enjoy where the Italian wings, maybe it was the oil they were fried in, or just didn't hit our tastebuds right.  The pastas, and fries were absolutely amazing! We couldn't stop talking about them. Everything other then the wings were very enjoyable. However we only seen our waitress 4 times, to take our drink order, our food order, bring the food & bring the check. When we asked for stuff she would say oh she forgot.  I would recommend this for the great quality of food, but mild service.

HXxLQ5IUF298rDEiVOeNEQ.text: My husband and I went there tonight for a late Valentine's Day dinner. He'd gone to Nora's many times with his family, this is my first. I was a bit apprehensive at first because I have the worst luck in new places. But that has changed... The calamari was delicious. Our dinner was just as great but that's not the best part. I was absolutely amazed by the service we received by Justin and Kevin. These two young men took care of us like we were their only customers. We did not want or need for anything. Their service was 100% on point. These two are a great asset to the restaurant. I'm hoping the owner sees this because these two young men are phenomenal. Thank you Justin and Kevin.

qesplAYXCC6lm8b5o2LFNw.text: Great food and service. The ribeye was outstanding. The fish, pasta and chicken dishes are awesome. This is a keeper.

yumrTMg4gta_R3vhY08Uxw.text: While vacationing in LV, this was recommended to us by our Uber driver. Best meal I've had in Vegas in awhile. Fresh and authentic. Large portions. Incredibly reasonable -salad, 2 entrees, 4 amazing cocktails and 2 desserts only $104 (before tip!) Slightly off of the strip but well worth the trip!

u4UT1h9YD-Xkfkh1_X1G1Q.text: Came here for date night with the hubby, what an awesome place. The atmosphere when you walk in sets the tone for the night. The menu doesnt have pages and pages of items to choose from, which makes it an easier choice. The cocktails....were phenomenal. They used fresh ingredients including, herbs and more. I ordered the magical mist ( I think that was its name) and the strawberry daze. It was everything I wanted in a cocktail, not just a booze with a splash of juice one people try to pass off. The food.... top notch. Hubby and I shared a house salad, arancini and the spinach cannelloni. It was the best food, so flavorful and light but filling. The garlic bread was delicious also! Now, the service... out of this world. We got to have Don for the night and he was welcoming and helpful and so nice! He never left us waiting for stuff and yet didnt make us feel like he was over watching us. He was fun and seemed to really love what he does. The others were awesome too always clearing our table and smiling. Some restaurants, the servers are no where to be found and are unhappy. Since we left Nora's, we havent stopped recommending it. We have decided this is for sure our once a month spot.

C6fB1zJxDu-B7PFkZ2Fj9w.text: Wow O Wow this place is super good.  Norman the bartender is great and the food was awesome.     Try this place now.

x_m6uzvqsRqzN_4CmFEaaA.text: I give Nora's 5 stars! Been going to Nora's since their old location down the street and I can honestly say I haven't been disappointed! The food is amazing, price is even better! Not very expensive at all! Service is always great so no complaints there! I'm not sure how long they've had live music but they have that going on now too! One of my favorites restaurants in town for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e7Z4FM3XwCHh3Tq7tfd97A.text: Love this place! Every time we are in town we make sure to come to Nora's and escape the strip!!  Our favorite is the Crazy Alfredo, which is spiced with this Alfredo sauce with chicken, shrimp and sausage! Lasagna is ok but we've had better! Love the antipasto salad is the bomb, tons of pepperoni cheese, olives with a wonderful house dressing! For those of you who are gluten-free they have gluten-free penne pasta too!

7UpGq1Fqkzx1Bx8NsR4cAg.text: Outstanding Italian cuisine at Reasonable prices.   The Chicken and Veal Parmigiana were great.   Our friends had the steak Gorgonzola special Anne loved it.  We were too full for dessert but I am told the Tiramisu is exceptional.  Maybe next time!!  You definitely need reservations in the evening.   Parking is also at a premium, so you may need to drop off your party and park up the street.

sEhJpVeyLZLAIG3C-kBX5Q.text: Family owned and operated....and AWESOME!  Friends brought us several years ago, and we don't visit any other Italian places since. Pizza is great, and my favorite...the Baked Ziti is YUMMY! I crave it at times. We've tried several items, and not a bad one yet. Also be sure to get the Antipasto salad!

rJLhbujfn4wOuW4mxbDfZQ.text: First, the service. This is the reason I'm knocking a star off. The girls at the front desk weren't very nice.  The server was ok,  Fortunately for Nora's the food is great. We ordered the mama salad (I think that's what it's called) and chicken rigatoni. Both were very good, lots of flavor, and high quality.

TYAK75Hb2hcluuBufCu-qQ.text: Great food! Random location (in a strip mall) so it may not look appealing but it's awesome! I visit Vegas a lot and wanted a great place to eat with non-strip prices and this place was it! Highly recommend!

XxTZHZ4lWVzeMMz3hFk6ig.text: Don't be fooled by the strip mall pizzeria "look" to this place. I'll admit..when I walked inside...I still sensed "spaghetti joint"..leave your preconceptions in the parking lot! Its not fancy inside..but this spot serves up some terrific cocktails..excellent food and very professional service. waiters seem to work in teams...and they are very friendly and efficient. had a cocktail called a  cable car--capt. morgan mixed with  orange curacao. absolutely delicious. my son had an old fashioned....wife and daughter split a nice bottle of pinot grigio. for openers we shared mozzarella sticks...very good. 2 of us had the veal parm.....the other two had the shrimp scampi. we all gave our meals very high grades. Best part of the meal are the prices....incredibly reasonable. we all split some decadent dessert. Ok..so its not romantic or intimate...but if fantastic Italian food is your goal....you have found yourself a gem in the desert! Mangia!

sp5wkHnM3gJEXAOLh6drFA.text: This is theeee Best Italian Restaurant and Bar in Las Vegas... To start the mojitos were the best I ever had!!  the sangria a must !!!The Crazy Alfredo  and egg plant parm is always "solidly consistent like the service!!! I also always love the garlic house bread and the chopped antipasti salad is phenomenal!! You will never be disappointed eating or drinking at this perfect restaurant...make sure you make a reservation... I just had another 5 star dinner tonight... You need to try the outstanding Moscow Mule and they serve the best Mojito west of Havana!! Food is always so consistently delicious!! The service is also the best in town!!  The live music on Friday nights with Naomi Mauro singing jazz is always super talented and sophisticated.. She is a fantastic Vocalist!! I look forward to their brand new restaurant opening up in August!! Blessings and Congratulations to Nora's and the Mauro family!!

uBF8K0vh9V6oHn-OSez6AA.text: This place... First time here... Omg. I had spaghetti with meat sauce. It was so amazing.  Complimentary garlic bread is solo good. There was 4 of us. We all had something different.  They agree with me.  Definitely coming back.

yjTzygBK7TEzAYUzfEMRLA.text: Great service and food!  Love it for date night!

z3Eimd-nxQdpTrodAUk6dg.text: Found this when searching on Google/Yelp for best Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas and preferably wanted something off the strip.   Saw pictures of the Crazy Alfredo dish and knew we had to go there.  This play did not disappoint.  My husband had the steak special that was so buttery and tender.  My son chose the homemade chicken tenders-he really enjoyed it.  I had a Caesar salad to start that I have to say wasn't very tasty:/.  Very mild flavor.  My crazy Alfredo pasta dish was TDF!  Probably one of the best Alfredo dishes I've ever had!!!!!  Overall we give Nora's a 4 out of 5 because of the Caesar salad missing the mark for an Italian Restaurant.  Our family is already planning our next visit to Nora's when in town!

mfsC5OgmOtuGP64MES3C8w.text: This place is a hidden gem!!  Great little Italian restaurant away from the strip.  You've gotta try the crazy Alfredo if you like hot and spicy !  This is a must try place and prices are extremely reasonable.  Portions are a lot as well

6RmDWoQ5cR8V8JKUrPZWXQ.text: This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in town. I love that they are family owned. The service is always exceptional and their prices are very reasonable. Their baked rigatoni and white spinach pizza are the best I've ever had, anywhere. I've eaten at many of the overpriced Italian places on the Strip and none even come close.

PddZ6x0Qjt_ydiAyGhMqUg.text: My husband and I are frequent Vegas visitors and were looking for some authentic Italian off the strip.  Look no further!  We had a fantastic experience, all the way from customer service to our delicious meals.  Our server was Don, who was so pleasant that we couldn't help but smile when he came to our table.  Also, the whole staff was very accommodating when we showed up early for our reservation and were more than willing to call us a cab when our dinner was through.  Definitely a go-to restaurant for us when we visit Las Vegas again.

olgc22UZOgJ8XzMXqCtKhg.text: When in Vegas we make it a point to dine at Nora's.  Yes, Chicago has many wonderful Italian restaurants, but Nora's is a treat while on vacation (usually around my birthday).  I suggest making reservations as they get quite busy especially on the weekends. They start you off with a basket of garlic bread, so delicious!  When I was there last I had the Osso Bucco.  It was probably the best I have had in years.  It was tender and just plain phenomenal!  Had to pass on dessert, ate too much of the main course!  Definitely a place be a regular!

lZjNyJV-I4GiYFiM9u84CQ.text: This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. My family and I have been going here for years and my husband and I even had our rehearsal dinner here. Everything from their dishes to the drinks are great.  My personal favorite is the baked ziti. You can never go wrong at Nora's.

XAoB2WXh4invixcjmLijYg.text: Bleu Cheese Stuffed Olive Dirty Martini.  Arancini.  Crazy Alfredo.  This place is one of my all time favorites.  I always make time to visit when I'm in Vegas.  Great service.

fETKPyms3SM6LivA-_GKrg.text: I went to this place while in town for a convention and was pleasantly surprised at how great it was. I ended going there again my last night in town. The Crazy Alfredo is easily the best pasta dish I have ever had, and that's saying a lot. The garlic bread and Ceasar Salad are delicious as well. I haven't tried anything else but I can guarantee that you can't go wrong. Service was great and the atmosphere was relaxed and would be a great place for a quiet romantic dinner. Also, a nice getaway from the craziness of the strip. Will be making this a regular spot of mind whenever in town from now on!
