EdloQQBfCiIjJWydCO06VA.text: Second time to this restaurant; I think this is a nice little local hold-in-the-wall place that offers quality food that's in the Spring Valley area.  I don't think this is the best Italian restaurant, but if you are in the neighborhood, give it a try!

g7DOYc0_gmS0xgQyCkgM2g.text: Great food and atmosphere.  This is really good Italian food for lunch or dinner.  Make sure to make a reservation if you're going for dinner, as this place gets pretty busy.  Also try some of the specialty cocktails.

CMIweoelukTwW_PFSjcWKA.text: The place is very casual but fantastic food...I am a born and bread NEw Yorker and to find such fine Italian food out in Vegas is unreal!!! I had the Veal chop parmigiana which was out of this world!!!  Food 5 stars decor only 3...but that is not what this place is about.

MW-w0r1gqbFO0znVXQ4P_g.text: Love this place!!  Great food ,friendly staff and pleasant atmosphere.  The Osso Bucco is so.e of the best I have had, and the pasta dishes are always perfectly prepared!!

UgtjZzt6rLWaqQIh2-mhKg.text: Nora's was somewhere I really wanted to try while in Vegas. I read reviews that the vodka sauce was to die for. And it did not disappoint. Our service however was lacking.

eoAlQCQ8DSuTzxH-qbrz4g.text: Better than good, both cocktails and food. Very easy parking (which for Vegas a definite plus). See Adam a mixologist if the first order for the cocktail of your dreams! Great veal and pasta dishes, avoid the chicken catchatorre, had to send it back; but the sausage and pepper replacement was delish. One if the few Italian Ristorante's that has a veal chop, which I'll try next time. A definite Plus is a delightful combo and singer to entertain on Friday and Saturday..

_R_jTs8O9V7ghuL2Hi7cuA.text: Yum!! I've been here years ago when this place was still at their smaller location, it's nice to see how far they've come and how much their restaurant has expanded! This new location is beautiful, like I can imagine hosting a special event here. Believe the hype - the garlic bread is the bomb! We also got truffle fries and calamari for appetizers and calamari was great but the truffle fries could have used a little more truffle.   For our main course we got the alla Nora, Carbonara, chicken parmigiana, and crazy Alfredo. All were sooo delicious and very generous portions - all but one of us had to take our dishes home. Our server was so nice and professional and we never had our water glasses empty throughout our meal. They have a very nice bar and a good selection of draanks that I plan on trying next time! I really want to come back soon to try their pizzas it looks great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari and truffle fries
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. farmhouse carbonara, try this!!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alla Nora

bhmnWYr-qSrgWMsKvCcqww.text: I am truly baffled by the high reviews & long wait times for this establishment. I see the parking lot regularly full, and it has been recommended to me from multiple people.  I decided to try it with a friend one night for dinner.  For the price (Roughly $40/ for a soft drink, a shared appetizer [caprese salad], a meatless entree [spaghetti w/ marinara], and a desert [some kind of Oreo concoction]), I expected a tasty Italian meal with *at bare mimimum* the appeal of one from Olive Garden. I was disappointed by this expectation.  For reference, I'm from NJ, and am pretty descerning when it comes to Italian food. With a high percentage of Sicilian immigrants, the region I was raised in has some of the best Italian-American cuisine in the country. Every place I've lived since, it's been a struggle to find really great Italian food that didn't come with a hefty price tag... That being said, it is such a nostalgic comfort food for me that I can eat lower quality/priced versions pretty happily.  At about $40 per person, I would consider this a mid-range meal. So, as I stated earlier, I expect *bare minimum* the quality of food & satisfaction level of eating at an Olive Garden as my gauge... Not an incredibly high mountain to climb.   On a positive note, their atmosphere is lively & fun, and the service was fine (hence two stars instead of one). However, it fails to matter, since I find the food inedible.   The caprese salad was bland & forgetful at best. The marinara (a staple of many Scicilian dishes) was overly sweet & had a similar quality to the sauce found in a can of Chef Boyardee. The spaghetti was very think & over cooked. The oreo dessert was waxy & unappealing. Even my friend's lemonade was off. I've eaten frozen microwave meals that tasted better.   After working in the restaurant industry for decades, I have quite an opinion on food quality & dining (you probably couldn't tell, b/c I tend to mince words). This may be a heritage Italian restaurant in the Vegas scene, but there are so many better ones at this price point, it's absurd. I won't add insult to injury in this review & name places that are much better, but I've been happier eating mediocre baked ziti from the pizza joint down the street than the food I shelled out $40 at Nora's.   If you grew up eating Prego & canned pasta as a kid, I can possibly fathom why you would think this represented good Italian-American cuisine, but I heartily disagree. If you're as descerning about it as I am, and like NJ/NY joints you probably won't enjoy this.

CehYrWnO4MZKpJz2pO_gOw.text: Now I can see why this place is a local favorite! You can totally feel the family-type ambience right when you walk in so you know it's going to be a good dinner. Also, the smell, everything smells and looks so yummy!  For starters, my coworkers and I shared the fried calamari. I order the frutti de mar in the white sauce and ate at least half a loaf of their garlic bread, it was so garlicky and buttery and oh so yummy! I honestly don't know how I manage to eat so much pasta after all that bread but my pasta was too good to pass up. If I could use one word to describe the food here, I would say its comforting. The food here is totally made with love.  Overall, the hype is real for this place. Check it out if you ever want to eat where the locals eat and not spend $50 on pasta in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti de Mar in white sauce
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f-ap85m2BYoA5eE4sI6xvg.text: This might be one of the nicest Italian places that's off the strip. I was pleasantly surprised by the size and elegance inside, as I did not expect it from the outside.   Their garlic bread is a 7/5 amaaaazing. I think it's by far the BEST garlic bread I've had. And I'm talking, even compared to that Texas Toast action from the supermarket.   I had high hopes for the crazy Alfredo, but ended up finding it to be good, and nothing exceptional. Their wild boar spaghetti was definitely mind-blowing and I'd absolutely get that again if I were to go back.  Service is great, and definitely a nice date spot with your hunny.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar bolognese
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

TXeunCw4M-J3tuu33ASA3g.text: Came here between lunch and dinner to beat the Valentine's Day dinner rush. My husband was recommended to try this place by some of his customers.   We ordered the calamari to start off with because we love love love calamari. And these were delicious!   As for our entrees we like to share so we got the Chicken Milanese and Gnocci with vodka sauce to share. The chicken Milanese was huge but I loved that it came with an Arugula salad. I enjoy getting some greens with my meal. The gnocchi was fabulous as well. The portions are pretty big so we got to take some food home for left overs. I forgot to mention they give complimentary garlic bread. I usually try and avoid bread but these were too good to pass up. So garlicy!   Lastly we ended our meal with a cappuccino and tiramisu... the cappuccino was on point but the tiarmisu wasn't my favorite. The lady fingers needed to be soaked in espresso more or something. Our server was so sweet and gave us a complimentary mini Cannoli to try for next time. And boy that was good!   Service was fantastic and the decor is very cute!   I would highly recommend if you love Italian food!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese with arugula salad
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu and cappuccino with complimentary cannoli
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary garlic bread

9td72PHClYsIg8yWCmt-IA.text: Don't skip on the garlic bread!  Nora's Italian Cuisine portrays a high-end style dining for Italian food. The restaurant is very clean and seems fairly new. It was my first time dining here, and based on other Yelp reviews, I was really looking forward to it.   Let me start off with our food - the complimentary garlic bread is delicious! Buttered, seasoned, and toasted to perfection. The Rib-eye sandwich was just okay. The meat was overcooked to well done after we had asked for a medium steak. We also upgraded to truffle fries - great choice for someone who loves truffle as I do. The Crazy Alfredo was good - not over the top great - but good. I wish it came garnished with freshly grated parmesan instead of powdered. The tiramisu had a lot of potential and I really wanted to love it. The flavor was there but the cake layers were extremely dry. If the cake layers were moist; it could easily be one of my favorites.  Our waiter was a nice young man - but I have a slight feeling he may have been new. He came to the table twice to ask me to repeat my order. Our food took over 45 minutes to get to the table, which may explain the overcooked steak, but hey...what can you do? I was also left with an empty water cup for almost 15 minutes. Having nothing to drink is my ultimate dining pet peeve.   I am glad I got to try Nora's Italian Cuisine but something tells me I do not need to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Special - Certified Angus Beef Rib-eye Sandwich

fh8O4L8EGUfPrCjA3NoDDg.text: Very very good Italian restaurant.   Everything that comes out of the kitchen looks fantastic.

8n6iM64HHOtZycm08j8JbA.text: The aroma and the flavor of the food reminded me of my recent trip to Italy.  If you are in Las Vegas, and you like excellent Italian food, Nora's I. C. is THE place to go. It is always on my itinerary.

LvVf6o6OkFr4lXeHJ-cjtQ.text: Come hungry! Or make sure you have a place to take your leftovers.   We were visiting Vegas and wanted to get off The strip for dinner.   I had heard of this place serval times in my many visits to the area but never got a chance to get there until April.   It did not disappoint.  We started with the Caprese. Generous portion great tomatoes. Sometimes Tomatoes can be pretty flavorless but these we fresh, crisp and delicious!   I ordered the chicken pesto pasta. I'm pretty picky when it comes to pesto and Nora's was top notch! After the appetizer I just couldn't finish the dish. Not sure I could have anyway.   My friend had the chicken Alfredo and she felt the same. Absolutely wonder tasting dish but just couldn't finish it.   The portions really could be shared. The prices are really good for what you get.  We were both sad we had no way to store and reheat for another day.    This will be a must on all future visits! Next time we are coming hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Caprese
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melrose Pesto (Chicken or Shrimp)  Spaghetti, Linguine, Fettucini, Penne, Rigatoni, Angel Hair Chicken

MKrqyiz95HWYOOrDTuTPeA.text: Exceptional in almost every detail. The best way to express how much we loved Nora's is that we cancelled or next night's reservation at a celebrity chef restaurant and came back to Nora's... and I had the exact same dish (gnocchi in red sauce with mushrooms and a whole sausage).  This dish was not on the menu, but our server Shelby assured us that they could do exactly what I wanted and they nailed it!  The Fettuccini was a perfect al dante with the Alfredo light and flavorful.  On day two, my wife went for the pizza and it was fantastic. The building is modern, inviting, and very clean. Our only complaint is that it is a bit loud.  Not crazy loud but it made our conversation peppered with "what did you say." The Bocce Ball court just off the patio is a nice touch.  Nora's will be part of any Vegas trip we take.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom Pizza
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Sticks
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZCta1kZU48NRsBm1YyJIQQ.text: Great traditional Italian-American restaurant. The appetizers were very yummy. I ordered the puttanesca (I'd never had it before). Probably should have stuck to something more familiar. It was ok but apparently I don't like anchovies. Not their fault.

Uh_Xl0VzqOEcYZLU9cV6Ew.text: Awesome old school Italian food in Las Vegas :) Their new location is much better too!

jSuew6chIEaVvRZN7Kgv7w.text: Food was amazing!! Everything was absolutely delicious! My water was refilled before I even asked for more water and waiters were nice. However, I noticed we didn't get our breadsticks, I had to ask 3 times until they finally brought it out. Which bothered me because that should come out first. Second, I had asked for a soda a few times and they kept on forgetting so of course that I had asked for a few times as well.  Overall place was beautiful!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wat4YClbUq1xhleZR-uEYw.text: My rating would actually be a 4.5, but because of the service I'm going to give it five stars. I apologize I do not know the name of our server but he had a shaved head and could not be any nicer and attentive to our memorable dinner. We had a reservation and we receded immediately. The hostess greeted us and made us feel quite welcomed.  Water, bread and wine service was on point.  We started with the octopus appetizer, it was really good however it was not the best I've ever had so I probably would not order this again.  Our salad we chose was Noras salad which was quite delicious the lettuce was extremely fresh and all the vegetables had full flavor.  The highlight of the meal was the pizza. We ordered the one with everything on it well done, it was crispy full of cheese and extremely satisfying.  For dinner my nephew had the egg plant Parmesan with a side of spaghetti and my brother had the linguine with clams. They both enjoyed their meals.  For dinner I had the veal chop Milanese. That preparation is not on the menu but I ordered it and they said no problem. I had it with a side of spaghetti with pink sauce. The pink sauce is over the top it's loaded with fresh garlic and chopped tomatoes. The chop was tender however it was the second to the veal chop I had at Antonello in Santa Ana, CA.  We were honestly just too full for dessert. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a business meeting. I really enjoyed it and I would  come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus and Nora&#39;s salad
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Veal chop, served Milanese style served with spaghetti with pink sauce.

sL9Bt8iUoawMuT9k-tlrAA.text: HIGHLY recommend! The food was delicious, one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. The garlic bread was so good. The service was great, they constantly checked up on us and brought us refills. Good portion sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my half eaten plate of yummy food

12wvldvCLOaIP3N0amgd2A.text: Celebrated Valentine's Day with my love and this was the perfect place  we enjoyed the garlic bread, a house salad and an appetizer first. For dinner, I had the Chicken Marsala & penne lunch portion & it was delicious! My Guy really enjoyed the Chicken Parmesan with rigatoni! To top off our night we had to have the Cheese cake & the gelato!  Our waiter was fast & friendly. We'll definitely go back someday

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Cake &amp; Gelato
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do you think he liked it ?

oHQnr790Y3PlMvZosznctQ.text: I love going to a great local spot because that gives that restaurant a uniqueness and rarity in this city. There's also a lot of restaurant chains in Vegas too, so I like to root for local restaurants. Let's start off with the bread that they serve. When you start off with delicious garlic bread, the only thing you can do is look forward to the rest of the meal!  Our table of 7 decided to make it family style. First off comes the Al Prosciutto pizza. Delicious! A right amount of lemon, a good amount of prosciutto on the pizza, excellent start! Afterwards, our pastas came in. We ordered the alla Nora, spinach cannelloni, and the Melrose.  I love how they put quality over quantity, every bite was worth it. I loved all of the dishes, especially the crispyness of the eggplant on the alla Nora.  Ending off the night with the warm chocolate cake. It's a different take of your traditional chocolate cake, but man, do I love a dessert that is not too sweet (no sarcasm). The service was amazing too! They know what's good, and they kept our water glasses filled throughout the whole meal. Considering on being a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm chocolate cake (order ahead of time!)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alla nora
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach cannelloni

Hp9OBbhNXYCqdEYM3mvvUg.text: Really liked the atmosphere.  Service wasn't the best but ok.  Had eggplant parmesan.  The eggplant was good but I'm not a fan of the sauce.  It was unfortunately also on the spaghetti.

7dQne9et3PnoCgJ_HmSrtA.text: The Best Italian food we have had in a Long Time! DELICIOUS The Staff is Really Nice & Helpful!  They moved into a Much Bigger Building But Honestly it's still not enough space It is Really Hard to get in there to Eat Even when you have Reservations Because the secret is Out & It's So Crowed But So Well Worth the Wait! The Sauce is Homemade with bits of Beef & garlic We have been back 4 Times since our 1st Visit & We are Very Picky Highly Recommend! The Only Thing is that  I Wish they Would Open Up one in Henderson

Y69XeNEr9QQAvRxUmbmtuQ.text: This is an excellent restaurant. Great for family, friends, and date-night. The service is always very good. The food is delicious. The Pork Tenderloin is a family favorite, as is the antipasto salad. Make sure to get reservations and good directions so you can easily find this cozy restaurant.

H6uz-_U-95JgUuQupzwQ1w.text: Yuck!  I visited this place with a friend after a number of people recommended it to us.  Food was inedible!  We ordered a salad that was wilted and drenched in bottled dressing, pasta puttanesca (which we figured no one could screw up - but lo and behold, they destroyed it), and a veal dish.  We had to send the veal back because it was so tough and chewy, they very graciously took it back to the kitchen, but sent a new one to us that was just as terrible.  We didn't eat hardly anything and then left without even taking the food home as it was that bad.  We couldn't figure out why anyone would recommend it.  I do have to say the service was very good, but that's the only redeeming thing we found about it.

cAYhPUZqL28gziZfit2ocQ.text: Great food. I leaved in Italy four years and it felt like being back   Wonderful

p8Z3GxGyweG-9p1J1Cb4QA.text: Had dinner at this place last night. Sat in the smaller room. We had 9 pm reservation ( place closes at 10 ). Room had 6 other tables with guests dining. Waitress took our order. Asked for bottled still water, they brought ice water. We order cheese sticks, spinach salad and 2 entrees. They coursed everything out, cheese came first, a while later, the salad. They were ok, nothing special. As we were finishing our salad, we noticed the room got empty.  Then immediately the entrees came out. From this moment on, the waitress started to rush us. She never checked on us on the cheese or salad courses, then she appears abruptly as we were eating our entrees and asked 'how was everything. Should I wrap these up?' Well, we were eating still, so we said no. Barely five minutes after, she came back and asked ' all set? Should I wrap these up'? My friend let her wrap his entree, as I was still eating. When she returned with his food to go, she picked my plate and asked if  she could wrap it up. I let her do it. I was upset by this time already. My friend asked about the chocolate cake, she said takes '25 to 30 minutes.. I have a cheesecake..' We said no , just the check. They probably would have thrown us out if we had ordered the chocolate cake.. Mind you that we left 9:55, so technically, they were still open. I ate there before and loved it. This time, the garlic bread was the only great item. My pasta was flavorless, my friend entree has so much cheese, it was all we tasted. Cocktails were ok, nothing special. Won't come back.

jWlB_RmxrDaM64o38XIBTg.text: Took parents for anniversary/birthday celebration on Xmas eve.  Arranged ahead of time for Chef's seafood menu and was offered wine pairing with meal which we opted for.  Seafood meal was incredible 5 course meal, huge portions, delicious. Was extremely special evening.  Not cheap but great value nonetheless given outstanding food and wine and very attentive service. We'll be back when we next visit Sin City.

A01o3LbagWvPGYrNEGbYiA.text: on vacation in vegas, got sick of buffets so i looked this place up, i think it was on some food network show, regardless it was tasty.  i got the nora alla, a baked spaghetti with ground beef, pesto and eggplant on the top, perfectly crispy and delicious.  my wife went with pasta and meatball, in their really good house red sauce, one of the better meatballs i've tried.  we also ordered calamari and a side salad, which were mediocre but not distasteful.  we would go back if we were ever in vegas again.

UBx-PR6W1QGWFzOl4ZPDDw.text: looking for good italian (without spending your entire paycheck) in las vegas was a bit difficult, but with the help of good ol yelp! i think i found it!! :) nora's was just as good as all the reviews i read! we had family in town and we were all craving linguine with clams... i decided that i didn't want to spend $35 on the strip for that so decided to go to nora's on flamingo (down the street from the palms) we were very pleased with the experience! as soon as we walked in, we got a big whiff of that yummy garlic aroma! that was the sign *this is going to be a good a$$ dinner* there were 4 of us and we all ordered something different just so that we could get a taste of the different dishes on the menu... first came the garlic bread! DE-LICIOUS! then the ceasar salad came out, great amount of dressing! not too much, not too little!  linguine and clams, shrimp scampi over linguine, crazy alfredo and pepperoni pizza were to follow... we were all very happy with our selections! the clams were small, yet plentiful. the pizza tasted very fresh and oozed with cheese!  we are all definitely big fans and coming back to nora's when we have that italian food craving! i highly recommend this place for good italian food at a reasonable price!!!  BIG THUMBS UP!!!

ds9Iys_zsEgsf3Muqg6qAQ.text: My boyfriend ate here last night.  It was still very crowded for a Thursday night at 7:30 so we sat at the bar.  Anthony was on top of it and greeted us right away.  My bf got the veal (wah I tell him veal is not pc but he won't listen) and I ordered us calamari to start and Anthony recommended the alla nora to me over lasagna.  We were started with garlic bread which was good though it was covered in butter... straight to my ass. j Straight to my ass!  Second and third pieces... no control whatsoever.  The calamari was also amazing!  Perfect amount of crispy texture and the sauce they serve it with I had to ask for a second ramekin- I wanted to drink it.  I debated taking the ramekin into the bathroom so I could lick all the marinara out of it but thought if anyone saw me take a ramekin into the bathroom they'd think I was a weirdo.  Ok trying to maintain some class I stopped eating the calarmari.  I'm a little person so I was already full at this point.  I took a few bites of my dinner when it came but was still full.  There was a piece of crisp basil on top of the alla nora that I was in love with.  Next time I go to Nora's I'll ask for extra basil leaves like this!!!  Obsessed.  Alla Nora had a parmesean-basil type of grantinee over eggplant, meatball and spaghetti.  I loved it.  I tried some of my bf's side of plain spaghetti which was also very good.  I mean it's weird bc something so basic as spaghetti I don't generally find good but this was.  I did not try my bf's veal but he was very very happy with it.  He is straight-up Italian so he just loves Italian food.  We eat at Mezze near our home a lot and we decided it's a close call which is better but Nora's wins.  I ordered a cannoli to go but wished the chocolate cake had been offered at the start because it takes 20 minutes to make and I didn't read that on the menu.  It was the only chocolate dessert.  The cannoli has chocolate chips on half of it so I guess there is that.  The other half has pistachio bits on the cannoli btw.  I saw a lot of coffee drinks going out and I was dying for one but knew I wouldn't sleep if I got one at that time of night.  We both can't wait to take his parents there!

ME6fKr-4qcafs-Tvf9PKtg.text: After exposing my tastebuds to the disaster of Roma Grill, I had to reset with some more Italian.  A local had suggested Nora's so i gave it a try.  Great choice!  I was there on a Saturday night and the place was packed.  I was in town on business, so decided to eat at the bar.  Met a lot of nice local people who had been going there for years.  The bartender was friendly and I sampled a couple of different wines from their excellent list.  There were many good choices on the menu but I settled on the pasta Alla Nora, which was excellent.  I would have tried the meatballs but they make theirs with beef and pork and I prefer the beef and veal recipe.  The salad was excellent and they accommodated me with a side of broccoli.  I can't wait to go back to try the pizza, which I understand is excellent.   Nora's has a great family restaurant atmosphere, the staff is pleasant and the decor is comfortable.  I will be back!

vJtnETPs_LpLGdUT12TRDw.text: love the joint!  'nuff said, let's eat

f3jzPTi9p2OnQaa5a-QlRw.text: I don't live in Vegas anymore, but during the time I lived there I frequented this place at least a few times a month. Awesome food. You have to sit in the back at the bar for the best experience. The bartenders are awesome and remembered me every time I came in. The staff that tended to the front room was OK but not the same atmosphere as you get at the bar. The live music nights were always good....another reason to sit in the back at the bar. Great local spot away from the awful strip. Good date night place!

KRHbYXwaNdO_1qTxQ2qISA.text: How did this place get a 4 star rating? The food is mediocre at best. The tomato sauce is lame. The eggplant parm had a bitter after taste from the skin that was left on. It was smothered in poor quality cheese that stuck together and binded itself to the food in a very unappetizing manner. The spaghetti it came with was nothing special. The house salad I could have made better at home and the dressing was not memorable. The garlic bread was overcooked as was the pizza ordered by someone else at my table. The crust was burnt and they still served it?! What the heck? Did not even want to try the dessert. Came on a recommendation and left knowing I would never rely on the person who had recommended it for restaurant selection in the future. Wasted my last meal in Vegas here! Darn.

KH-z3QLIcRDcARPZa1SV_Q.text: My favorite Italian Place in town. Cheaper then the strip by far. Make a reservation as this place is always busy. My favorite is the Frutti Di Mare. The Crazy Alfredo is also very good.

wGa4-jNbIRCLaFCOagHeZA.text: By reading the other reviews , I am guessing I went there on a bad night. I see lots of people complimenting their marinara sauce, so it can't be that bad.. but the one I was served was either the end of the batch of they ran out and had to use some baught in the store. Their pasta were very bland, nothing out of the ordinary, store baught pasta are just as good. The worst part, to me , was their garlic bread. i refuse to believe that what i was served is what they normally serve. I look, and tasted, like frozen garlic bread from the store, only with more garlic and more cheese added. I had a garlic taste lasting for days after that one.. Like I said , after reading the other reviews, something must have been wrong when I was there , was the chef off ? maybe they didn't receive some deliveries ? Maybe they had tons of cooks calling sick ?  I am not sure , but I will have to come back , for sure it won't be as bad..

gZAV_c_mD2_DPjvmmJM0Ww.text: Overall:  Fantastic food for the price, a great find off the strip. From what I've heard, this is where Vegas chefs to go eat :)   Ambiance/Location:  Strip mall, but worth the drive off the strip. When you walk in you see chefs making pizzas which sets a nice tone. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to see the end of game 4 of the NBA finals :) Typical dim lighting of an Italian restaurant.   Food:  Fantastic! Per our waiter's recommendation, here is what we ordered:  - garlic bread (one basket complimentary) - fresh soft bread, tasty, crispy  - House salad - the regular portion was split between 4 people, but if you're big on salad you might want to get your own. A nice blend of lettuce, mozzarella, olives, pepperocinis, tomatoes with a oil and vinegar dressing.  - Alla Nora (with angel hair pasta) - hearty red sauce not too tart or overwhelmingly tasting of tomatoes. The eggplant was breaded and fried adding a crispy texture. The ground beef did not overwhelm either. My favorite of the dishes we had.  - Mt. Etna - chicken with multiple layers of tomatoes, fried onion strings, on a bed of red potatoes in balsamic reduction -- chicken was a bit dry, but good flavors  - Chicken Carfucio - the flavors of the capers and artichokes rule this dish which is overall pretty light and allows the fresh tomatoes to balance the dish. This dish is more about the separate ingredients merging than about the sauce (which is mainly oil and garlic)  - Crazy Alfredo - rich and creamy with multiple fun additions including jalapenos! My mom's favorite, and it was indeed a dish to be ordered again.  - warm chocolate cake - you need to preorder this (when you order dinner) and we got 2 for 4 people, which was perfect. I've had others which were creamier and had a more molten center, but this one was unique. the cake was a bit more coarse but very flavorful, and it was topped with crushed pistachios which added a salty crunch, and surrounded but a white cream sauce. I'm used to eating this ala mode, and I think ice cream would also have paired well with this.   Wine list: extensive both by the glass and bottle.   Service:  Friendly waiters and busboys, we had to ask once to get our water refilled though.   Price:  Entrees $12-20, Dessert $4.50-6.50, Wines from $7.50/glass

k8_BXKHTwaWvqnvM8-nR-Q.text: All I have to say here is I love it love it love it!!  Try the manicotti.  THE BEST!!! The prices are decent, the atmosphere is ok.  A bit of a small place and if you go on Friday or Saturday nights make sure you have a reservation.

cPq5RXYEaU9xCKYRUFvJMw.text: my boyfriend and i went here for lunch and we were impressed with how well kept the restaurant is.  the atmosphere is perfect.  the food was extremely tasty and we even left with leftovers when we ordered off the lunch menu.  the prices are great and so is the calamari!  we will be back when we're in vegas!

8csAQ03D4LKO5ZVK3kVSOg.text: This place was referred to us by a freind, who is a local, and boy where they spot on, especially when he recommened the Anti-Pasto Salad. Yummy garlic bread.  We had the Spaghetti and Meatballs, and the meatballs are excellent!  Full of flavor, moist.  The Antipasto Salad is super fresh, crisp romaine lettuce, great deli meats.  Sadly The Chocolate Cake was a bit disappointing for us.  I think it had like nutts and and lemony sauce, it just wasnt quite our cup of tea.  But their Canoli's, OMG those where some of the best i've ever had, very very good!  We visit Vegas often and so far we've been back twice( in 2 months) .  You just cant beat their prices and great food.  We'd rather eat at a great local place like this then pay the over-rated and over-priced fees of a lot of the restaurants in Casinos or on the strip.

d9eijB7i7cBJFgqEurCOzg.text: Whenever we go back home to visit the parents, this is the first place we hit up for excellent pasta and pizzas.  I love the Pasta Ala Nora and Chicken Marsala!  The service is excellent here... a definite must!

syyxrZdlbRJMWZJooF4EBA.text: a little slice of heaven in a not- so-great location....but don't let that stop you from enjoying the friendly service and great food - everything we had was wonderful, especially the service - the rice balls were divine as was the chicken with artichokes and linguine with clams....don't miss the cannoli's for dessert......and a bargain to boot!

3LG5aaDIO4MbghDgVJDhXQ.text: My friend and I went out to try this place for the first time after having it recommended to us several times. It's was FANTASTIC. Our waiter Sebastiano was so sweet. And whoever was working the grill was on point! Will definitely be going back.

DvdefaMrturVlHHNi8Z6FQ.text: This place is nothing special. It's on the same level as Macaroni Grill or Applebee's. :( Just costs twice as much; has super slow wait staff; not enough parking; and dirty dishes; and serves Italian dishes that don't satisfy my cravings.

xMgFwUiESlWYL5Nrinxqkg.text: Horrible service ruined this much anticipated experience. Made a reservation. Arrived 10 minutes early. Was able to see tables needed to be cleaned however no staff around to do it. Waited over 20 minutes past my reservation time to be seated due to no clean tables. Waitress treated us like an inconvenience however once we only ordered water for our beverage, I could tell by the look on her face that she knew it wasnt going to be a big ticket meal and she was annoyed. Waited another 15 minutes for bread. When she finally brought it she practically threw it on the table while walking by us. A different person brought us our food. She only followed up with us after a different person took our plates to bring us our check. Didnt even ask if we wanted anything else or dessert.   I was hoping a manager would be circulating the room to ask us how our dining experience was. No such luck. I witnesses a short Asian guy in a grey suit running back and forth in front of the cooks but he NEVER approached a guest.   My impression was this would be a classy place however the hostess is wearing nothing short of her work out clothes. I would have thought the hostess would have at least been dressed business casual or put on some real pants, maybe a pair of slacks but I guess this is the poor standard for Nora's.  I am a full time uber/lyft driver. I get tourists asking on a daily basis what are the good local restaurants. Once I saw Nora's had moved into their new location I thought I would try it out. I brought my Nephew who was visiting from out of state to try it with me. He is a waiter while finishing his last year of college. He was even disappointed with the service.   I will not be eating here again. I will definitely NOT be recommending any business to Nora's. Too much competition in Las Vegas to waste my time to give them a second try. Its a shame they opened this beautiful location however forgot they are in the service industry.

4l5bTgmPjIGLCtOnBFif-w.text: Food and service were excellent it's a little loud but that's to be expected on Valentine's Day Decour is pretty cool are you my friend shrimp scampi bangin arancini Fire haven't had the Oso Buco yet and the wife got the Branzino Not sure of it yet but everything else is been great highly recommended trust me I'm a chef. And I slept at a Holiday Inn last night.

wjj11P8uLsJ93Xm0x5EP1A.text: We were there for dinner Sunday evening. I had the Cannelloni and it was very tasty...  The sauce and filling were delicious.  The service was fabulous and everyone in our party of seven each enjoyed their meals a lot. It was our first time there - and we will be back.  I had a comment and they emailed me back the next day.  Yep - we'll be back.

4Qy4CmYpcsy7i_vnez5e5A.text: What a beautiful NYE dinner! Great service and so delicious!! Sebastiani and his assistant, Marco gave us beautiful service. We enjoyed ourselves immensely thank you!! We will definitely return!

NXtoD9NpzbpB58H7Lw8C2g.text: I know the food is great at Nora's. Been going here since they had their old location. So we decided to go to their new location on a Sunday night. We get there and it's a packed house. The hostess at the front desk told us it'll be maybe 40 to 1 hr wait. So we're like okay, we'll wait. As we were waiting, we noticed that people who had reservations were waiting for almost 30 min for their table. Even the manager and the hostess were so frazzled that night they were giving each other attitude. We also noticed many of the tables were still waiting for their food. We even waited more than an hr. and the manager came to us and bribed us that their "$10,000" heating system outside was legit if want to sit outside in the cold. I don't care if it was $10,000 or 1 million. We specifically said we wanted to sit inside. So more than an hr passed. We left.  They have poor customer service and bad management.

2vo8GNaRnxhZMKD9Cno3Ig.text: This is the second time I've been to their new location, and it was so nice inside. I really like the design and atmosphere of the new place, and I'm glad they decided to relocate to a new building. It really sets to mood for Italian cuisine. We arrived passed 10 PM on a Friday night and they had plenty of seating. The hostess was friendly and seated us promptly. I forgot what our waiter's name was, but he was really attentive and friendly as well.   I ordered the lasagna and my friend got the ravioli with meatballs, and we shared a house salad. My friend said that her meatballs were cold, but the waiter put in another order and they were out right away. I usually order their specialty items which I really enjoy, but this time it was a little on the plain side. The lasagna was lacking a bit in flavor, however it was a big portion and I had leftovers for the next day. The house salad was good and fresh, although I prefer their Antipasto salad because it's huge and filling plus it comes with plenty of ingredients. Oh, and we also ordered the Sangria which was quite tasty!   Overall, it was a great experience especially since we stayed till after 1AM! And they didn't even rush us out or anything! There were still two tables on the bar side of the restaurant, and they didn't seem to be in a hurry to leave even after we left. I felt so bad because I didn't even realize that it was so late! So when I realized, I was so embarrassed and I immediately began to apologize the the staff. The staff was really nice and laid back, and they reassured me that it was completely okay because there were still customers eating and it's often the case that they stay very late to clean up. It just seemed like a regular day at the office to them, except they had such great attitudes about it. I presume that they have good management, because it really shows in their attitudes! If I could rate it with a 4.5, I would...I would have usually given a 5, but this time I felt the food was lacking that punch. Either way I just really, really like the new location...beautiful atmosphere, exceptional service and great food!

ExakzMvxIfUM8HEayu8fxA.text: We had the best time!!   Friday night, came in around 10:30 and there was a jazz singer with a band; they were great entertainment. The drinks we ordered were great Sicilian mule is definitely worth it! We ordered the prosciutto pizza and it was delicious. Also ordered Crazy Alfredo and it was great! Service was awesome! We could not have asked for a better experience. We ended our night with a cannoli which was also delicious.

N5COPJgJ-5s7bje3nW9Dyg.text: Went to Nora's for the first time May 4 2017 for my birthday .   Service : our server was good . Our reservation was at 9:30 pm on a Thursday so service was a tad rushed so they could get out of there .   Food : -the antipasto salad was average something you could get a basic deli .  - the osso bucco was great and the best part of the experience  - we had a side of rigatoni with the spicier sauce which was also average.   Overall :  The experience was  what can be expected from a Italian off strip restaurant not great but definitely not bad .

ZAeDIaE_Chu1vwF5RO-1mA.text: The pastas are great and friendly service. This last visit though I got the salmon piccata. It was drenched on oil and so salty. Barely any lemon flavor it was just so oily and salty I couldn't finish it there was literally half a cup of oil at the bottom of it. I'll stick to their pastas from no

T0gEFzvn05CT-_E7mvotOQ.text: Really nice atmosphere in both dining rooms, you can bring your own wine for a corkage fee and the food is very good

7jBGdJVVZkTuEaaejV3Cbg.text: Took guests there Friday with reservations, did not seat us in 45 minutes.  They have managed to change a great neighborhood intimate restaurant into a mess hall food court.  Avoid this place.

4L1PiiwH-okTRUA_cG7ZKQ.text: Great place &  great service from Nina but the truffle fries could have been better. Nina was very nice, personable & attentive. I had the pan seared salmon that was cooked to perfection. I'll definitely be coming back :)

YgAVUxoVv-zB3zds8qiBKw.text: Food is amazing. But...... Hostess is too busy flirting to seat anyone  and bartender is anywhere but actually at the bar. Food keeps this place going because there is no service. Be sure to carve out a large portion of your day.

z5DeIJqSTceapeaYf7Dn0w.text: Me and a few family members went here for lunch based on a friend's recommendation. The service was ungodly slow. They were good about serving drinks and bussing, but it took about 15-20 minutes before we finally got waited on. We didn't receive our meals until about 35-45 minutes later. UNACCEPTABLE!  The Rigatoni was undercooked, the Lasagna seemed to be overcooked and tasted like canned Ravioli, and the Chicken Milanese was rubbery and lacked flavor. I had the Veal Scaloppini which was good, however the Spaghetti noodles were not Al Dente. That long of a wait and the food wasn't even cooked right?!?!?!? I'm sorry Noras but you really dropped the ball today. Hopefully you can learn from this and improve your food and service.

OzD8XhRj3175Y7B1_Qed1A.text: Great Food! Great Service! I Love  the rice balls... The veal parmigiana with spaghetti is great as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3900eaKttiPvKjpLIBtxxg.text: Nora's is the B O M B ! ! !  Came to Las Vegas for a meeting and finished it off with dinner. One of the guys suggested Nora's.   The ambiance is excellent with very friendly staff. We were fortunate to be guided by Angela. She had a great attitude and was very helpful with our choices. Gotta say her personality was stellar.  We had a nice Pinot Noir that paired well with the baked Rigatoni Special & spicy sauce I ordered. It was sooooo delicious and comforting. Love great pasta! Love Nora's!  Absolutely will come back here again next time I'm in Las Vegas.

FIqfsbqiakbHvTYC0uKEnA.text: This is the best spot we've found in Vegas. Find Rudy at the bar and rest assured you'll be treated to  a unique and memorable experience! Wonderful food and spirits that can be found off the beaten path. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uNQsuNocAyZG83PNEK-NvA.text: Aaaah what happened to you?? This was my favorite Italian restaurant of ALL time. I am sad to say that I will have to find a new spot:(   I spoke so highly of Nora's, so when it was girl's night out, we had this place in mind. Parking can be a pain during the dinner rush because there are like 10 businesses sharing 50 spots. Make sure to give yourself some time for that. As for the restaurant itself, don't let the exterior fool you. The inside is nicer than the outside. To the right of the restaurant is the bar/lounge area and to the left is the more lit up family area.   Service was pretty normal. Nothing special, she was nice and did her job. The average rating goes towards the food. Like I said, this WAS my favorite spot until now. Let me explain why.   Garlic Bread: a few years ago it used to be thick slices of bread covered in butter with huge chunks of garlic right there staring at you. Bad breath for hours, but so good. Now, it's thin slices of bread with just garlic flavored butter. It's like something you could have bought in the frozen food section.   Appetizers: Cesar salad was pretty boring. And $5 for a few pieces of lettuce was way overpriced. The truffle fries were pretty boring too. Just plain French fries sprinkled with Parmesan. Boring all around. The fries did have a good crisp though.   Eggplant Parmesan: this is the ONLY thing I order off the menu. Pan fried eggplant covered with marinara sauce and mozzarella served with a side of spaghetti. Sounds good right? It was before. This visit I got a pile of mush. Maybe because they messed up my friend's pizza order so my dish was probably just chillin. Very disappointed.   All in all, I probably won't come back to Nora's. It still beats Olive Garden, but maybe I'll just stick with Bootlegger's from now on.

yYVjjR6gU-r7AZ8a6IwS3g.text: Dined at the original location several times with friends but never thought to do the check in or review.  Loved it then,  and i think i love it more with the new location.  Takes the ambience to a new level. Service is amazing as always...the antipasto is the best.   Nice for a intimate dinner or even to show up with friends. Hope you enjoy as much as i do.

0nYklyhyyzK_OzbnKFy2bg.text: Stopped for dinner tonight, heard great things about Nora's, at best it was ok nothing to get excited about. Chicken was dry and ceaser salad was wilted. Would not run back to this place, service was ok, our busboy Marco was outstanding though

NovOxKm-n8qC3V-OWwzPGA.text: Solid 3.5 stars and if and when I come back, I could see myself bumping up to 4. But I just dont think it's quite 4 stars yet. Service was good. Nick was our waiter and he was pretty good.  The food was good, but not amazing. I shared a house salad and the seafood pasta. They were good, OK, but not great. I guess I expected more. The place gets crazy busy, and I suppose they are better than some of the italian places here in Vegas, but truth is, if I want good italian, I cook it myself. But, I will most likely come back, and maybe, just maybe, it will be a much better experience.  Prices are good and service was good so that will garner a second trip! Maybe It's what I ordered.....???

iFkSK5emLy9xpAFE9gt92w.text: We went to Nora's for the first time yesterday, for a late lunch. The food is absolutely amazing! Best Veal Scallopini I've ever had! Ambience is very warm and appealing.   HOWEVER... The service is horrible!!!  First of all the hostess is more concerned with blatantly flirting with other staff members than doing her job.  It was almost disgusting to see.  We were sat at a nice table and waited for our server. And we waited and waited and waited. After about 10+ minutes a waiter shows up and asks for our drink order. No apology for making us wait. He brings us water and our drinks and disappears. After about another 10 minutes another waiter comes and asks for our food order.  Again no apology for waiting and not even a hello.  Anything we needed - like more water - we had to flag our waiter down as he couldn't seem to notice more than one of his tables each time he was in the dining area.  He continually disappeared and we were left waiting, for everything. We wondered if this was his very first shift waiting tables.  There were two busboys who seemed to be working very hard but some how never made it to our table.   So finally our food arrives. And it is absolutely outstanding! Service might be horrible but the food is most definitely worth the visit. Just don't go unless you have time for a leisurely meal.   Word to management: train your wait and hostess staff! And then manage them!! The food is fantastic but you are losing guests due to horrible service.

xSWOWuvWdngMc2RQxPzcHA.text: I have been here several times and it never fails to disappoint. We took a few guests and everyone raved about the food. The service was impeccable.

pI_ShgOSk9_xLC5UKxIxNA.text: With our server Angela was the best.. Really informative and willing to give her suggestions or recommendations. The food was delicious and the staff was on point. Classic Italian dishes new contemporary Flair.

nm5uvLq8huSKDjmkX47uVQ.text: Always delicious and the service was excellent. Try the Melrose pasta; linguine with a creamy pesto, sun dried tomatoes, zucchini and pine nuts. You can add chicken or shrimp too. They have a gluten free option on the pasta but only in penne.

UrFw4Rllw-UoL8WWmt6zuQ.text: The food is delicious and the atmosphere is lovely.  Every dish was great but the Eggplant Parm was my favorite.  The wine cellar is impressive.  The staff did not rush our party even though we stayed beyond their closing time.  A great night out

QxR7I043mayZUEaU6v-zKw.text: We went to this place for the first time tonight. It was very good food. We will be back for sure.

ayCQoP9-HDkNhVCzDjD--A.text: Great food. Seafood pizza was good, seafood diablo spaghetti was good, alfredo was good... I've had other items but can't remember.  I've been here maybe 3-4 times and one time the a/c seemed to be really kicking in. I'm not sure if a large crowd of people just finished, and the a/c was still working from the left over heat. But at the time I was sat in the dining around, there were only 3 other groups, with maybe 7 open tables. The waitress seemed to give us attitude for asking to switch tables due to the coldness. We asked to move before any of the food came out too. Oh well, maybe she was tired from the large crowd that might of been there before I arrived.  Out of 5 rating: Food = 4 Service = 3.5 Ambiance/music/noise/decor = 4

1I0aSRZ8SWj7vNgLOGzLvw.text: Fantastic authentic Italian food. If you are anywhere near Las Vegas and want a real meal, go to Nora's.  They had a salmon special when I was there and it was easily the best salmon dish I've ever had. All of the pasta dishes looked great and even the chicken noodle soup was home made and delicious.  The staff was very nice and attentive.   Don't be fooled by the location or the outside (it's in a strip mall) - this place is top notch and prices aren't bad either.  (Try the iced tea)

0mVZTwt4K7qQBfnQfW-CZg.text: We went in for lunch and I had the rib eye steak  sandwich and let me tell it was so freakin amazing. They are not shy with portion size at all. It came with a side of onion strings which were delish and some potato chips which unfortunately were not that great, saying that they were made on site, they tasted a little stale. Everything else even the diet coke was very good. We definitely will be back, my hubby had the rib eye steak it came with a salad it was the same price as the sandwich and my hubby says it was also very delicious. He could have went for an appetizer too, he loves to eat. Oh yes can't forget the amazing breadsticks very good as well.  Overall 5 stars. Apparently there is a line out the door we didn't experience that for lunch but we did notice they are building a Nora's restaurant on the corner that should be able to handle the larger crowds.

UJgBX5FGYQ4KJyiW5y2I_Q.text: The restaurant is very authentic Italian. The food was phenomenal and the wait staff was great. Jesseka Stephens was our waitress and was so polite and friendly. She had us laughing. We had a special request and the chef honored it without complaint. The restaurant is great for a romantic dinner as well as family. We came on a Saturday night but they got to seem very quickly. I would highly recommend the spinach cannoli  topped off with bread pudding for dessert.

HOUXKWv-NRBtBUb0eoP0iA.text: Based off the rating my expectation was not met. The shrimp scampi app was Delish. We also had veal and chicken parm. Sauce was not up to par - breaking was falling off and it was a bit dry

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YIyG7yOoxYpNjC77t1e1Aw.text: I really hope that the hype behind this place is that it once was much better and people are latching on to the nostalgia. This was one of the most mediocre restaurants I have visited.  We made reservations for 8:45pm on a Saturday night and the place was packed. It is located in a small strip mall and would be easy to miss. We were promptly seated and that is when everything started to go downhill. It took ~15 minutes to even get acknowledged and place our drink order. Their gnocchi and pasta are not made in house. I am not sure what would compel someone to pay $12 for gnocchi out of a package when I can get delicious gnocchi from Trader Joe's and toss in some pancetta for $5. I opted for their Frutti di Mare ($21) which was linguini in runny arrabiata sauce with an assortment of seafood. The husband had their carbonara which ranks among the worst I have ever had in the states. I am not even comparing this to Italy standards. While two of the three members of the party were still eating, one of the people's plates got taken away to be boxed up. Awkward. The server ignored our table pretty much most of the time and then rushed us out at the end. I would not come back nor recommend this place. It is all hype.

nus5mbytdLSwQVEmXlCsCQ.text: We never go to Vegas without visiting Nora's. The best pizza in my opinion. I don't have to ask for extra sauce or thin crust. They do it all perfect. The prices are great for the portion sizes that you get  The garlic bread is amazing. They bring the first basket to you complimentary. So far, I have not had anything there that I didn't love. Waiters are professional and quick.

WS5qpKzOBfU2FQOMjJo3kw.text: Well... I waited 3 years to come here and tonight proved to me that it's definitely NOT worth the hype. I'm Italian and super disappointed in the service here. The food took over an hour to come out and when it did... Not so great. They don't make their own noodles or meatballs. All ordered out. I can't be okay with a place saying they're an authentic Italian restaurant when half the stuff they make is wholesale bought. Don't waste your time and definitely don't sit at the bar... The bartender is super rude. Ciao Bella!

sKwt3MRwgLIhYCnIoFGRoQ.text: The most amazing Italian food I've ever had. Environment is lovely with music from the crooner era. I've been here many times and never had anything that wasn't delicious.

N9UG02wSxz0Tmrv7IAG0XA.text: Was anticipating a nice dinner at their new and larger location. Hostess area confused, not enough waiting room near front, and felt like I was at a banquet hall. Chain restaurants have a better layout. Waiters are great. Garlic bread along with caeser salad was drenched. My pasta dish was average. Took an hour to get our main entrees. They need to get their act together. Will not go back.

VSYF2T91z2F4zB2cQRoQYg.text: My cousin suggested dinner here and I'm glad he did. Good food, cute atmosphere, good service and I really enjoyed the live music that night. I'd go again to try some of their other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This dish was piled high!

cIk8zYOtWamxPSnJT6drcA.text: Espresso Martinis!?! Yes, ask for Norman. He makes the best drinks I've ever had. And talk about service, Nina is amazing!  She's pleasant and beautiful inside and out. The Snow White pizza and truffle fries were delicious!  Nora's has had a facelift with the new and improved location but her beauty within has not changed. Love it here always.

Dg_w8dSthTtg1l1SnBDFZQ.text: We ate at Nora's tonight on 2/18/17; It was a 60th Anniversary party. The food was good. The management was terrible. Did not walk us over to where the party was, I had to ask. The hostess had no idea, when I gave her they're name.  The party was 20 people, she should have known.  We had a problem with the service not picking up the empty plates. The manager walked by, I waved to him but I was ignored.  The manager never came over to ask if everything was alright.  When we booked this anniversary party, we said between 20 to 22 people. There was 20 people who came but we were charged for 22.  Because the bill was over $1200.00 we asked if they would remove the cost of the two they charged us. Management refused.  Even though a restaurant has good food, if the management & service is on the lower end of the spectrum it ruins the experience of dining at that establishment.  There we're other concerns that we're not mentioned on this review, that we're never mentioned when planning this anniversary party ahead of time.

IzYrDT3Zs-6Li_wuoU7xjQ.text: I have been to Nora's a few times now, the service is always impeccable. The first time I went I had lasagna and it was smothered in so much cheese, I barley picked at it. I did enjoy my soup & bread.   I made a return about a week later and opted for the Chicken Carciofi. I don't enjoy meals that are overly buttery, greasy, heavy, so I asked the server about the dish. My plate was amazing I finished every last bit. They won me over.

VxNYkXBU3OmXaGm5O0SmlA.text: We were there 3/27 Service was awfully, waited for a food more than an hour. Steak was burned. Waited for the check for 30 minutes, and seems like no one cared about it unless we asked 3 times. We never saw our waiter to asked for anything.

9sDcXEJjMP8mkuKzComCRQ.text: LOVED the OLD place. This new place, not so much. Poor customer service, food not up to par and too noisy. They used to pride themselves on an upscale bar, but no more. They've cut back on high priced liquor (Tanqueray). Too much attempt to Manhattan-ize when old place exuded warm family, great food, and in-style just because of the whole atmosphere.  Won't go there again.

bWd2lNHy30Q0MRboq0C9Ow.text: I absolutely love the ambiance here! The food is spectacular, the staff is very knowledgeable. The cocktail and wine list is legit. Try the osso bucco if you like veal, it's not on the menu, so ask your server if it's available for the day! Muah!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My desert, the marrow, excellent!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes on side, very good, i love truffles, these definitely had them!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ossobocco, not on menu, very good!

jGiY7QbPUYpU73eCBTYocw.text: This restaurant feels like one of the old world Italian restaurants in Little Italy, in Manhattan NY.  Very rustic and very cozy- it's perfect for a laid back date.  If you're looking for a fussy, hipster/trendy place, this restaurant is not it.  The restaurant was bustling when my date and I arrived, but we were sat immediately.  Somewhat annoying where we got placed though, which was a seat near the server's station.  They should move that table further down.  During the busiest hours, I'm sure it'd be annoying with servers going around you, "excuse me, excuse me, coming through, whoops."  Food was fine.  I've had better Italian, but the food is fine for its price.  Nothing mind-blowing, the pasta could be softer, but that's just my preference.  Other than that, the seafood and the sauce was spot on.  My date got just regular chicken alfredo.  She hadn't tried that restaurant (although it was she who suggested the place).  She also would've liked her pasta softer, so maybe it isn't just me.  If you like Italian food as much as I do, try this place.  Oh, and be seated far from the kitchen/server's station- it'll help you dine with no interruptions.

faLrMTYtMXXt4Urp0EBWOw.text: My husband and I had an early dinner at Nora's on Friday and we can't wait to visit again.  We are both bourbon drinkers and were very impressed with the extent of the bourbon menu.  Our favorite (Booker) was available and this bartender knew how to make a cocktail.  A very generous pour and $9 is practically a steal for this bourbon.   We started with the spinach salad with farro which was a perfectly balanced combination with gorgonzola dressed in a delicious balsamic vinaigrette. The mussels arrabiata had a nice zip to the broth and the mussels themselves were the largest I've yet to come across in Las Vegas.  We also had to try something from the Josper Grill and went with an order of the pork belly which was rich and grilled to perfection.   We finished with the rigatoni gorgonzola with chicken and we fought this morning over who was going to take the leftovers for lunch. In closing I must add that one of the hightlights of our dinner was our server Sebastiano.  What an delightful fellow and very attentive.

rbvIC3tmORaBZVLjq3AM2A.text: So busy!! Make a reservation. I ordered the cheese ravioli with vodka sauce and a side of meatball and sausage just to try. All of it was delicious and the service was great. The live music was a nice touch as well.

ENrIveIIBOcTx-pyEOP5ng.text: Good atmosphere, friendly staff, short wait, food was outstanding...!!!

qlODFrj0BOxu6IsSyYl-Qg.text: My experiences at Nora's have been nothing short of excellent. The food was absolutely some of the best I've tasted for Italian food, and the service was spot on. The biggest downfall of this place is that it's too busy!  My favorite dish so far is the fettuccine carbonara. It's not really a fancy or special dish, but it's one that I like to try at a lot of different places. The waiter even asked me if I wanted to add peas (which add a lot to the dish and is usually in it anyways).  I've also had the chance to try the steak and arugula bruschetta, the chicken mount etna, and the rigatoni gorgonzola. All of them were very good, though the chicken mount etna might have been better with normal pasta rather than fried pasta.

oEGf-NfB7RrRDbO9bFKksg.text: Yup! Well worth it  Great food - maybe really great  Nice wine list  Service is good but not great  Atmosphere is fair, but how about the food!!!!  Well worth the 3 mile trip from the strip.  Great experience and great value.  Fun stop.

H0mE7Lg45BiqXF8Vn1WesA.text: Tuesday night around 8pm, had a 15min wait (not bad for how busy they are). Got the house salad with balsamic vinaigrette and it was excellent. They forgot our garlic bread but once the waitress brought it, it was excellent too. I ordered the gnocchi with Alfredo sauce, and it wasn't good because their gnocchi is too sweet and chewy/doughy for house made gnocchi and I am a big gnocchi person--not worthy of comparison with Sage's gnocchi. My husband ordered the pasta primavera with Alfredo sauce and it was very tasty, highly recommend this dish for vegetarians. Taking off 1 star for gnocchi and one for the waitress being forgetful with aspergered behavior unless strictly business is her understanding of "service", as well as, rushing us a bit for no reason what so ever. She even grabbed the check book before we had a chance to go over it and pay. Will definitely come back to curb our pasta cravings and make sure she isn't our waitress--5'4 lady with her dark blond hair pinned up, in her 40s-50s, with black squared teacher glasses (she never gave us her name) who needs to get off her adderall!

bqHR2jDeoLnoK35wL8Ar2g.text: Love this place!! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. Truly a jem! Loved the menu selection and the alfredo is a must! cooked to perfection and absolutely delicious!

4zVK0CngYVnd4T1APJTrFQ.text: Had dinner here last Friday with my dad, his gf and his friend. I was so excited to try this place as I had heard so many good things. The food was really good - I had the chicken Marsala - probably the best I have ever had!  However! We all were surprised how rude the waitress was! I don't want to give her name, but let's just say she's older one with no smile- to start things off she ask my father first what he was having - my dad said you mean you want to start with her ? ( meaning me ) she didn't say a word and waiting for my dad to order. We all were like wow! Never had anyone do that before - usually ladies first.. She was ok with refilling the drinks but,  a chip was on her shoulder the whole meal. I will definitely come back and still recommend to friends ... But I will ask to stay out of her section!! all the other wait staff had big smiles on thier face ... Seemed to be just her.  What a grump!

clvX9mmp061s_gTRK34cqg.text: Very nice quality Italian food, I have been here a couple of times. First time I had Penne w/ vodka sauce. Good.. not great. Second visit I had the Spaghetti Marinara, better much better. I am a fan of their marinara. I am not a fan of how close you are to the other tables. I need just a little elbow room for my spaghetti dinner.

ieWEEi4UisOERcHPk12W0A.text: Best Italian cuisine I've ever experienced. Very elegant and very fancy. Thanks a lot to the General Managers daughter Ele for telling me about Nora's. Amazing and divine wine, and one of the most jazziest music I've ever heard. Also thanks for the food that was not even on the menu.

o3DVvthGCbvaTDbAP1sdDQ.text: Amazing! We walked in the door and the aroma tantalized our taste buds We ordered house salad that came with marinated olives and finely chopped mozzarella and the house Italian dressing it was delicious We also ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and a side of meatball and the chicken Alfredo The lunch portions are plenty large enough. The Alfredo sauce was the perfect mix of creamy and garlicky and the chicken was incredibly tender The meat sauce was delicious and the meatball was perfect. I am spoiled now this was the best Italian food I have ever had Family owned is always best! Thank you Nora and family for a wonderful dining experience

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo creamy sauce tender chicken delicious!!!

yTym7q8ztRrl05yqTNZ7wQ.text: Friendly staff, excellent atmosphere and delicious food!! The menu is varied and diverse, something for every palette. They even have gluten free penne, which is cooked to a perfect al dente every time. I recommend it with the crazy Alfredo, a delectable balance of creamy and hot. My boyfriend and I come back every time we're in Vegas.

0VM1Up3LWWNWkH_3dMpI8w.text: This was the first time visiting Nora's. The restaurant is very trendy and pretty!  It has great ambience !  We sat at the bar and really enjoyed our meals! The prices are excellent at lunch time!

Uj1Edx4GJTYJ6JVY8NLTPg.text: We made a reservation for a party of six the day before. We arrived early and only waited ten minutes to be seated. It was set for 6pm. We ordered a bottle of Merlot from Napa, California that was quite well rounded in flavor except for some sharp tannins at the uncorking. That worked itself out after letting the wine breath for about twenty minutes. It was vintage 2013 selling for $46 a bottle. Everyone at the table ordered pasta with red sauces. I ordered tomato and basil on penne with garlic and olive oil. I also asked for pine nuts on the side.      I digress our table also started out with a regular sized antipasto which I hear was outstanding. This was due to the meats being sliced into thin strips instead of full sized thin cuts. Therefore this helped bring out the flavor of the meat without it being overwhelming.      The garlic bread had a strong garlic flavor and was quite good. We went though two baskets of it while waiting for some of our other guests to arrive. This place is very popular and was almost full by six. The main dining areas are very loud and that makes it hard to talk. Other than that it was a very pleasant meal. I highly recommend this place. Other meals ordered were: Fruttie De Mare, Putenesca and Rigatoni. They all got raves! My meal made for a real bargain at twelve dollars and change. Definitely will be returning here.I really want to try the Mediterranean Sea Bass.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just inside the entrance.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y2mZpsOxFz7yMek89Xii7g.text: Very good Italian food at very reasonable prices!  I will definitely be back and bringing friends! I had the carbonara which was really good! Friends had crazy fettuccine which he says was very good and other friend had a spaghetti & meatball meal that he said was delicious!

Qvmhfdvfiw4POKP0aZII_Q.text: Great food, reasonable priced.  Great atmosphere. Always a safe place for both lunch and dinner.  I recommend reservations for dinner because they can be busy.  Service is good and food is very consistent.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating.  The only thing is the parking can be tight since it is popular.  I recommend trying it for sure.

pBIS9E9UeyCHKkuidD77uA.text: I think dinner was pretty good - we got the Crazy Alfredo and the Spaghetti with meat sauce. The spaghetti with meat sauce wasn't good at all, probably the least special out of all of the restaurants I've been in.  The crazy Alfredo was delicious and I highly recommend it. But I won't be back as service was terrible and it took us about 40 minutes to get our meal, and a good 15 just to get our bread.   Then it took another 10 to pay for our meal so overall... what would have been a solid 4.5 turned into a 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xSv32NvKvaYf9DxViu3v9w.text: Great spot favored by locals. Be sure to make  a reservation, as it was packed with a 45 min wait on a Wednesday night! Amazing creative cocktails,  very garlicky garlic bread (just the way I like it), delicious red sauce. Wonderful salads (enough to share). Based on the server's recommendation, I ordered fettuccine Alfredo with chicken... a mistake. Sauce was not creamy as I am used to, and was not even tossed with the pasta, albeit under the pasta in the bottom of the bowl. No Parmesan cheese offered as a topping. Taste, as expected not good... too oily and not enough creamy cheesy goodness Should have ordered as my friends, arrabbiata (spicy red) sauce. Still have it 4 stars, based on what my friends ordered...all good!

7zzY8sAVkPYRJN2_wahFag.text: Nora's never lets me down. I make it must to visit every time I visit Las Vegas. Everything is delicious. My favorite is the Lasagna and white pizza with shrimp. Don't forget to try the cocktails...sangarias are the best!

A1FEgcahDHc6Q_388jPl4Q.text: An Italian restaurant.  The portions are MASSIVE and are easily big enough for 2 people to share.  The ambiance is similar to an Italian restaurant kind of like Macaroni Grill but much nicer.  Service is friendly.  Complimentary garlic bread - Really good, 4/5 The bread is super good.  I believe only 1 basket is served per table but it's great.    Crazy Alfredo - $23 - solid 4/5 As noted above, the portions are massive on this thing & big enough for 2 people to share.  The pasta is solid.  Comes w/ chicken, sausage, shrimp, and jalapenos.   I'm not sure if the jalapenos are necessary but it's pretty good.  Appetizers worth mentioning - Bruschetta - Average, 3/5 Shrimp appetizer - average, 3/5 Caesar salad - pretty good, 3.5/5  Pizza - I didn't like the pizza.  The crust is extremely thin, which is what I like, but it was soggy and flaccid.  It fell apart when I tried to eat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp appetizer
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta appetizer

MH-hoyVaEmf6X2gwDa6TQA.text: In town for a tournament and was looking for something off the strip and easy. This place was amazing and completely not what I was expecting. I had a bone in veal chop on special that was out of this world. Others had the Frutti DI Mare and the Crazy Alfredo, veal etc.  Whomever had the nerve to give this place less then a 5 star review is foolish. The bar is on point, especially the Strawberry Daze and the wine was superb. I would and will recommend to anyone without hesitation. Had a large group and everyone had an amazing meal and great drinks.

hUsyQhnTL1fUy_l2bFmzmQ.text: Excellent service Delicious food Perfect place to go when you're craving an authentic Italian dinner  Thanks Noras for the experience   We appreciate it

O7ypOp3T98-mZrq-pzn2mA.text: Order anything you want. Everything we had was absolutely delicious. We has the pasta primavera, pizza and the bruschetta .

7Gbd3ioytPwD9AUOqrN1Gw.text: The white pizza was delicious left overs. The starter bread was excellent as well. Everyone else I went with wasn't as please

mtTzRzt1oUuxg1FPzG-GsQ.text: Had my birthday dinner here with a fairly large group. The atmosphere was great it was a busy Friday night. The food was large portion, my server was great and the drinks were yummy.

AQo9obypg9HH18jNwWwTEg.text: Really good food and atmosphere, the service has always been good at the bar so I definitely recommend for a good hip Italian restaurant

EYyh4uPwTrYaz_3_WqL9tg.text: Nora's was one of the places that I was told by locals that I needed to try. Nora's met all that I was told. The service was top notch (note I sat at the bar), and Alex was very educational on all the items that I could order. She was on point with all the wines and spirits, and even more so on the custom drinks that Nora's is known for. Antipasta salad was awesome, and the veal shank parm was killer. A lot of food, but killer! This didn't come with pasta, but I wasn't looking for that. Dessert was a brioche ice cream sandwich, and it was mouthwatering. The bread was soft and sweet, with an amazing hazelnut gelato.  I will be going to back to Nora's to enjoy more of what the menu has to offer.

Fkp6iWPfOUyzSKC41Pi5ZA.text: Our family had a wonderful lunch there. We used to dine in at their old location from time to time. This was my first time trying out this new location. Beautiful and clean environment- just the right volume of the background music to put you at ease. Cool technology Dyson facet/hand dryer device at restroom!  Loved the delicious food - antipasto salad was AMAZING! Lunch portion was generous with great price! We had the linguine with clams which was super tasty!! Fresh and homemade Italian food!  Special mention our server Ms. Cassie!!! Friendly and kind to my two little girls - 6 & 2.5 years old. She really made our family lunch so much more enjoyable because of her kindness calming down our little ones. I was impressed the way she agreed to mix 1/2 apple juice with 1/2 water to split between my girls - also lower their sugar intake. Brilliant!  A must try place for any occasion. Strongly recommend.

7Dcsof8Bwi7dSJqCvtglmg.text: Got the Crazy Alfredo and the Pappardelle.  So good. Best pasta I've had in Vegas living here 25 years. And not too crazy expensive.   Also got the Italian Sunset and their Sicilian Mule. I would recommend both, the Sunset is a stronger flavor but still excellent.   Hope to be back soon!

wH0G8ONwq8Kl4ovfe-beIA.text: Impressive Italian restaurant, always filled with the locals.  when you enter check out the wine wall on the right, very impressive. the restaurant was filled to capacity, they had a gathering outside as well. I went to the second floor for a private party, Awesome. they also had a private balcony, which has electric and gas heaters to keep you warm on a cold night as well as a cozy private room that could hold 30 to 50.  They hav an elevator or stairs to get up to the second floor. The restrooms have a sink with an faucet that also is connected to an air dryer, first time for me. Impressed with the appetizers and the rack of lamb.  Desserts were great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoles and Terimisu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto seafood pasta

FaEv0WidkrU3_fhzJYc7mw.text: This is the place you don't want to tell anybody about because it's that good. I've been coming to Noras for years when I was in the strip mall and so exciting to see them grow into their new location that is simply beautiful. The best thing is the recipes have not changed it is still amazingly authentic and delicious. Staff always very friendly and an excellent bar with excellent bartenders who make excellent drinks did I mention the alcohol situation is excellent?  We love this place and will continue to come back again and again.  If you were looking for the perfect place to take that out of town just to show them the awesomeness outside of the strip... Nora's is the place

esZI-eH0zGkJQCYIFrcTPQ.text: I'm not sure as to why I never tried this place before, as I am a huge fan of Italian food. I really liked the dining atmosphere and the service was great. Unfortunately, I forgot the name of my server but she was very attentive and did well considering I went with a huge birthday group. One thing I can point out is that my water always stayed filled. Most restaurants aren't too great with keeping water filled and I can be a stickler for that, but Nora's was on point. Before our meal we were served garlic bread and the amount of garlic was just perfect and buttery. The food menu had many various dishes to try.
