It was so hard to choose but I went for the Melrose, which is a linguini pasta with a creamy basil pesto sauce, zucchini, sun dried tomatoes, and topped with pine nuts. It was surprisingly very delicious. My group celebrated two birthdays and Nora's was able to provide a birthday treat for the birthday girls - tiramisu cake. The cake was soft, spongy and not too sweet. I also noticed as the night went by, they also had a band playing live music. Nice touch to the great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S35Zc-I0TNqEd22H1wz4Fw.text: Can't say enough positive things about this place. Food, services, ambience spectacular. I have made this my all time favorite restaurant and will be returning frequently. Thumbs up

fz5a4n8Bos71mjs7DpndkQ.text: Great Italian restaurant off the strip! Probably some of the best I've had in Vegas not on the strip.   Came here to celebrate a birthday..made reservations (highly recommended)..and was given an amazing table in a private room! Very nice setting.   The service was great! Constantly filling our waters and glasses of wine. Brought two nice bottles and it was $20 a bottle to open (but we were only charged for one..very nice!). The waitress was very knowledgeable about the food and had a lot of things to recommend for our big party.   Started with the large antipasto salad that was big enough to shared between 8 people..and had calamari also for the table! Very fried..usually like it less fried but still good. For entrees, ordered the rigatoni, cannelloni, linguini and clams, chicken marsala, chicken parmigiana, salmon, carbonara, and ravioli. All of it was incredible and had A LOT of leftovers! For desert had bread pudding and it was pretty good!   If you aren't in the mood for the strip and want a local Italian restaurant I highly recommend it. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Special
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini and Clams

guLzYXLfF3MRDB5TrrAhBA.text: Well, after a two year hiatus due to a few bad experiences after the new location opened, I finally came back to give our friends at Nora's another shot.   I'm so pleased to be able to report back with a solid 5 star rating! We got to sit on their lovely patio, where Don and his assistants took amazing care of us. Don had all of the personal service and menu knowledge that we came to love at Nora's.   In addition to all of their 'standard' menu items, I was pleased to see some exciting new entries including bone-in veal, and a large variety of fresh cocktail offerings. I'm very excited to come back and try the new stuff!!  Thanks Nora's, and glad to see you're back to the place I can recommend as the best Italian in town.

fNgUCjbG_s4O9fl47NOTMw.text: Their lunch menu is fab! Their service was also wonderful. Low carb at an Italian restaurant is easy at Nora's! Just say no to the good smelling garlic bread and no to the fresh Italian bread they also offer to bring you.  Ordered the pork and Greens and it filled me up. The pork was tender and not dry, the salad (dressing on the side) was fab with the mozzarella cheese in top. Service was fast too. Definitely will return

aXEp6YBHlIFSbB5S6Z0I4A.text: New location, same menu, and same great staff! The new location now has some patio seating, complete with cool misters to mitigate the Las Vegas summer heat. There are three dining areas... One with the bar and Wine cellar decorating the main wall, another with a more quite ambiance, and a private room. My favorite?...of course it's the one with the bar and wine cellars!  We came here most recently on a Tuesday night with a reservation...it was packed at 6:30pm, so I do recommend you make a reservation, regardless of the day. The bar seating is first come, first serve, and lots of patrons were waiting for a table to open up the entire time we dined here.  Our family ordered  Chicken Marsala with Pesto Pasta Fritti de Mar Salmon Carciofi Eggplant Parmagian Calamari Fritti Arachni  Once you're seated, they bring out a basket of garlic bread...so good.  We all enjoyed our dishes, especially my daughter who insisted on Nora's Italian Cuisine for the evening! The poirtions were huge, and most of us had some left over to take home.   When I made a reservation over the phone, the lady I spoke to asked me if we were celebrating a special occasion...I let her know that we were, and when we finished meal, our waiter brought out a delicious dessert of Lady Fingers with "Congrats" written on the plate. Everything he did came with a genuine smile, which made it all extra special for our family.   With new location, new decor and superb staff, I am loving Nora's, with something for everyone in the family to enjoy!  Thank you Nora's staff, you all made our evening so special!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Fritti

g4RCsQy7XRwsNeqERjqDyg.text: I love this establishment! We were sitting at the bar and being served by Norman who was doing an outstanding job. He was non stop making specialty cocktails in front of us which was impressive to see. I tried the Copper Rose and it was delicious, if they had this everywhere it's all I'd drink. I saw Norman making this smoked rosemary drink often and when he told me it's possibly the best cocktail on the menu, I tried that one even loving copper rose so much. It did not disappoint: It is SO GOOD. Flavor, little foam on top and you smell the rosemary with every sip. Just saw. Food is excellent here too. I loved the calamari fritti and the sauce that comes with is so good I asked for a refill:) I will be back here!

gJvWS_wK53SAmj6whhxS_A.text: Absolutely delicious. I had the veal cannelloni with vodka sauce and it was outstanding. We also had calamari and risotto balls as an appetizer (group of 6) and both were great. Everyone in our party thoroughly enjoyed their food. No complaints. Portions were good sized, even a little too large. Service was fast and friendly. Will make this a regular stop when I visit.  I also love that it is off the strip so the atmosphere is quiet and laid back.

tnHFEULzrgg4O-GSUYsMbg.text: Nora's had been on my "must try" list for quite a while and when our group decided to eat there, I was pretty ready for it. Now, I do recommend reservations as this place gets crowded quickly and stays that way. Inside Nora's, it nicely decorated with high ceilings. Be warned that it does get very noisy in there.  For apps, our group started with the Calamari Fritti and Mozzarella Caprese. The Calamari was perfectly fried and served with a sort of creamy tomato sauce. I'd definitely get that again. The Mozzarella Caprese was also great. I'd never had fresh mozzarella like that so it was a real treat. My entree was my go to for Italian restaurants, Chicken Parmigiana. The tender cutlet was perfectly fried and the sauce was amazing. The spaghetti underneath was also perfectly done. Service was excellent. Very attentive.  In the end, Nora's did not disappoint in the least and you can see why it's highly regarded. It's a beautiful space, has excellent service and the food is top shelf. I'd definitely like to return. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana ($17.50)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Caprese. So good ($10.50)

EwqypZsVvpZFhXhg6Dtg3g.text: This place stays busy for a reason! With all the food trends nowadays, it's reassuring to know that some "old faithful" restaurants remain -- places that feel special but also familiar.  My first time here, I had heard nothing but amazing things... and having a dinner filled with luxurious sauces and attentive service at a place at embodies classic Italian felt timeless. The menu is long with over 70+ items, showcasing a wide variety of Italian dishes, from simple pastas to lush seafood and meat creations dreamed up by the kitchen. (Did I mention complimentary to-die-for garlic bread?!)   Ordered: - CRAZY ALFREDO (fettucini, chicken, sausage, shrimp, porcini mushrooms, button mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, jalapenos) -- granted I held the jalapenos, but wow! The sumptuous combination of meat & vegetables bathed in a rich alfredo sauce proves that this dish is a classic for a reason!  - WILD BOAR PAPARDELLE (fresh pasta with wild boar bolognese) --  this dish showed off the kitchen's skill with lush sauces! The wild boar meat, tender enough to cut with a fork, was dressed with a delicate, velvety sauce on top of filling, broad, flat pasta noodles. - ALLA NORA (spaghetti, eggplant, meat sauce, pesto, parmigiano cheese) -- the combination of spaghetii and eggplant with chunky, fragrant tomato sauce seemed less upscale than the other entrees, but the melted cheese topped with pesto sauce gave it a flavorful charm!  On top of that, I paired my dish with their RED SANGRIA -- which had an amazing mix of red wine, peach and orange liqueur and mixed fruit.   We topped our meal off with dessert overload: BRIOCHE BITES (hazelnut gelato sandwiched between two sweet buns) and the PISTACHIO CANNOLI (pastry shell, vanilla ricotta, pistachio & chocolate chips). All I can say is that we left with full, satisfied bellies -- and nothing but good things to say. We will definitely be back... Thank you to everyone at Nora's for a fine Italian dining experience!   PRO TIP: Making a reservation is necessary! This place gets crazy busy and the wait times can be extensive!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best. Bread. Ever.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brioche bites.

JokEeOiu-aWOIx1Qiju2dQ.text: Nora's has definitely come along way since the good old days it was a hole In the wall.  The atmosphere is awesome and over the top beautiful.  The cuisine I think tastes a little less authentic since its moved to it's new location.  With that said, it still offers amazing Italian food at a great price.  I've been about 3 times to the new location and I'm sure I'll keep coming back.

DbsiZ-fYncV96l0lbH-qmQ.text: Looking to try something new in Vegas, leafing thru Yelp reviews saw Nora's and decided to give it a try.  While the Yelp app doesnt have a 'reservations' link, it does have Nora's website listed, and from Nora website reservations can be made via OpenTable.  Interestingly, I tried going direct thru OpenTable (so I could get points) and the OpenTable app was so awful, and didnt even list Noras in its' Italian directory! Anyway, doing it via the link anonymously worked fine.  Showed up 730pm (Saturday night) - the place was hopping, with a line, but we were seated on time by the friendly front of house staff.  Water quickly brought out, and, the waiter asked FIRST if we wanted straws (yay) which we declined.    Appetizers: Olives ($6.50) - about a dozen+ green kalamata olives with a little garnish; tasty, yes with pits, could have added other olive varieties i thought instead of just one kind. Grilled Octopus:  OMIGOD this was delicious - about a dozen pieces, beautifully cooked, lightly seasoned with garnish, very tender and yummy with smoky grilled flavor  We ordered individual dishes; my son Ben had Crazy Alfredo($24), wife the Melrose Chicken($17.50), and i had the shrimp scampi ($22)  My son and wife really enjoyed their entrees (the pesto in the Melrose, fabulous, and tender chicken); the shrimp scampi perfectly cooked, in a bath of buttery garlic broth i sopped up with the free bread, 6 large shrimp.  As far as portions, the scampi was the only dish I think an ordinary human could consume in one sitting (I did); the crazy alfredo and melrose chicken were enormous, so we took the remains back to the hotel room, which is not a good idea in Vegas where strip hotels have no refrigerators/microwaves.  I assume you can order family style here (we werent sure, and werent asked), probably next time we would order just two entrees for 3 people and go family-style.  Bonus green star - take home was earth-friendly, in compostable containers, in a paper bag.  The server monitoring drinks was superb, water and soft drinks filled at the perfect time.  Perhaps the only drawback here was processing the check; it took quite a while after we were clearly finished to be asked about dessert (which we declined, stuffed), and my credit card sat there so lonely for so long while our waiter was working other tables, I gave up and dug into my gambling cash and left the money on the table.  At 9pm there was still a line out the door, so perhaps they should focus a little harder giving people the option to leave quickly (but not rush them)  We had a delightful meal, loved the wonderful ambiance, beautiful table settings, great service, and very reasonable prices - and earth-friendliness.

wGnh9r3MsYSBafc-xKp2yg.text: Not too far off from the Vegas Strip is this gem.  The ambiance makes you forget you're in the desert.   The food will make you feel like you're in mama's kitchen.  The welcoming bar will make you want to drink!  The large patio will make you want to step outside to enjoy the stars.  Their food and service was excellent.  The house salad tasted fresh.  The chicken parmesean was on point.  The fettucini was amazing!  It had everything in it.   Even the complimentary bread would have been worth a price.  If you are looking for a great dining experience that won't break the bank, this is the spot to be.  I'll be back again for sure when in town.    I too enjoy a meal off the strip once in a while and I'm known for endless comps from the hotels and casinos.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu of goodness
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wine

0yhiUHD2qNFi-LUfvBisrg.text: Excellent Italian! You need to make reservations- it's that good! However, they took forever to bring our bread and when we asked for more they never brought more. Great ambience!

BgrYmJnOeXgQ_oZvXA1q-Q.text: Norris is a traditional Italian restaurant with all of the usual Italian dishes. It was a warm environment with large portions and definitely got our moneys worth of food. The orders are so large that you might consider splitting if you are not a Big eater. The corkage fee was only $20 a bottle which was significantly less than a lot of restaurants in Las Vegas. Plus the waiter waived it for the second bottle which was nice. If you're looking for a traditional Italian restaurant with good bowls of pasta and a casual environment And this is a good one. Definitely good for large groups and families.

K4DLio-PlDPDPd099MKZnA.text: Best Italian in Las Vegas hands down! Service is always great and food always hot and amazing! My 4th time there and will continue to return. If they ever have ossobocu on the menu get it! Best thing I have ever ate!

1NGiSlpx5iZ1erLizMHhTQ.text: We came here for a friend's birthday dinner. I'm not a fan of Italian food so I was not that excited, but I was pleasantly surprised. We got 2 appetizers: calamari and truffle fries. I think this is the best calamari I have ever had. They also had the best garlic bread. It was crunchy yet still soft enough it won't break your teeth. The pesto was creamy and rich. The shrimp was cooked well. My friends got the Crazy Alfredo and they also loved it. The birthday guy was savoring every flavor.   On a side note, I met the son of the owner at a volunteer event and I can say that they are great people as well! They are involved in their community :).

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Bread

mCpSiAN0xllSUvJLLFc-aw.text: Loves Nora's! Went with my mom and fiancee for my birthday dinner a few weeks ago. The portions are HUGE so beware of ordering appetizers as you already get garlic bread. Drinks are good, service was really good! Overall great experience as usual. Love the new location as it does justice to the food and service

vwt93CGaZ-0VZuaDOGYfOw.text: My shrimp scampi didn't disappoint. It was well cooked to perfection. The steak bruschetta was just okay as I think it's lacking the actual tomato, basil topping in it. Ours just came with steak and Arugula which is what's expected as that's what's described in the menu but nothing special to it. Garlic bread is fresh and delicious as well. Overall, it's a great experience. Friendly reception as well.

OiCE6i3Ds3e-Ibft3P3M7w.text: Yummy classic Italian food here and a welcomed short distance from the strip. Prices are decent, atmosphere is classic and comfortable.

gqQa24YmIvAknlYCna2RJA.text: Round tables clean and elegant. Staff was friendly and attentive replaced dirty plates, made sure glasses were filled.   Drink orders are filled Served hot garlicky and buttery bread  Appetizers:  Mussels Calamari  Shrimp  Mozzarella sticks   Dinner: Crazy Alfredo  Chicken parmigiana  Shrimp scampi  Alla Nora Rigatoni special  Frutti de Mare  The food itself was full of flavor and the right seasoning. The portions are incredibly generous definitely would do a share a plate. If not they'll make great leftovers. Went with a party of 6 3 guys and 3 girls and only 1 person managed to finish their plate.   By the time you're done with dinner there's no room dessert.

YwvnNSFYjS9901yLrkEtWg.text: Date night with my love .. the wait was crazy, even with reservations, for a weds night but the food was amazing and the drinks were out standing. Kinda small place but great service. The atmosphere is dynamic.

WqNp90ZKi8rxN1CSwRC3Gg.text: We went on a Sunday night.  The restaurant has two rooms to seat people.  In our room were two other tables.  We ordered our meals.  We got garlic bread, which was great.  While we were waiting for dinner it took the waiter a long time to refill our waters.  He was walking around and passed by our table a few times without checking on us.  Once we got our meals, which took a bit of time because of the large party in the other room, the food was great.  I ordered a cup of coffee, $2.00+, with desert.  We were very polite and understanding during the long waits.  I drank my coffee and waited for a refill and he would just walk by.  He came by once and I asked if I could get a refill and he was a little put out by my asking.  The real slap in the face came when the manager came by and I voiced my disappointment with out service with her.  I was polite and said I had heard such good things about the restaurant I was surprised at the service.  Her only action was to "give" us a calendar of their recipes.  Which I had seen her give out to everyone who came through the door.  The food was great however I won't be going back again.  There are many other places to spend my money for real local food.

uW3k6yMY73HxfbXjSsXevQ.text: One of my biggest complaints about Vegas is that all the restaurants are chain restaurants.  I go out of my way to find "normal" family owned restaurants.  We found Nora's and always impressed with the service and price at this Italian eatery that started many years ago as a pizza joint.  Even on a week night, reservations are recommended.  A typical evening will show you 5-6 different servers all focused on your needs...  One does beverages, one does bread, one takes your order, one does water, another serves your order...  And they communicate very well so you dont even notice that it is someone different each time.  The food there can be good to great.  The portions, generally speaking, are not huge but filling, but they are priced right.  For dinner for two, we plan about $40.  I have taken clients here for lunch, and have not been disappointed.  Saturday nights can get noisy as they have a singer who comes in.  This is a favorite date night spot for us, and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for some good, "real" Italian food!

5OPw2-Ig_L_itKG4w3pynA.text: Lasagna was ok but they killed it with tooo much cheese baked on top. not enough sauce either.

ueNFx1wZS6i3i_daQOptoA.text: First time coming here the other day. Was craving some Italian food and after finding it on yelp I thought Me and My boyfriend would give it a try. We came around 4pm, good thing because 30 minutes later it started getting packed! Hostess wasn't really a hostess, didn't really greet us or talk much as she was sitting us at our table but anyways, the server made up for that, she was great. We ordered the arancini & the house salad for apps and my boyfriend got a cup of the pasta fagioli also some complimentary garlic bread. The arancini was delicious I could've eaten all 4 myself lol the salad was yummy. The soup was kinda flavorless, needed more salt, and the garlic bread was great. For dinner I had the Alla Nora (Eggplant with Meat sauce & pesto) and my boyfriend had Rigatoni special (rigatoni, sauce, sausage, meatballs, peppers & onions). Only complaint I had about the Alla Nora is wayyyyyyyy too much parm cheese on it, like literally the whole thing covered and made it way too cheesy and salty. Next time I will ask without the cheese so I can put it on myself. My boyfriend liked the rigatoni, the meatballs were delicious. As for dessert we had a cannoli which was yummy and some Oreo ball icecream thing which was great. Will def be coming back again!

nTSKtZ5aAknlC67pHsMtAA.text: I love this place, this is my staple delicious italian restaurant.  Try the melrose shrimp, gnocchi, or the baked ziti, INCREDIBLE.  Go here, you won't be disappointed.  Great atmosphere, prices, and food.  Like rosemarys don't judge a book by it's cover, it is in a strip mall and looks unremarkable from the outside but it is great inside.

B2wrOaVSofdq1c5GhFsAjA.text: Had dinner with friends here last night and everything far exceeded my expectations. We had the steak bruschetta and spinach farro salad for app's and both were so delicious. We all loved our main courses, two of us had very picky specifications and they got both of our changed dishes perfect. Such an enjoyable meal. Then we shared their homemade cheesecake for dessert and it was to-die-for. Our server was good too, don't remember his name. Next time I am in town I will definitely be back!

eGrOnLVYrBxs_0COCUJaDA.text: My husband and I didn't want to eat on the strip as they are often overrated and overpriced. After looking into Italian foods (I wanted pasta) here on Yelp, we decided to eat at Nora's.  Pretty easy to find, but I agree that the exterior didn't really do its justice for what was offered inside.    PROS: The food was pretty decent for Vegas and for its price.  I had the "crazy" alfredo (due to my pregnancy hormones, I had to substitute the chicken for clams).  NOT BAD AT ALL!!!  The Jalapenos actually worked really well in this dish. The portions were pretty big. Had the warm chocolate cake for dessert...it was ok.  I mean, can't really go wrong with chocolate but I've had better.    CONS:  Had to wait at least 15 mins for a table even though it was obvious that there were empty tables around.  The hostess never offered an explanation as to the wait.  As she stepped away, a random waitress had to search for the hostess to seat us..as she wonders why we had to wait.   The lasagna.  My husband didn't really like the ricotta cheese...instead he helped me finish my pasta.    Though they mixed up my food (the substitution in my pasta), they seemed really apologetic...and the service was great.  I didn't get our server's name but he was friendly and actually took the lasagna off our bill (we didn't even had to ask!).  SO all in all, it was a good experience...yeah we would go back...I would recommend it to others...especially if you just want to casually dine off the strip.

js4H9rhvAHskTfXT1eopxg.text: Excellent Italian food, had the baked ziti which is a house favorite, my wife had one of the veal specialties which was awesome as well. For desert, I had the canoli and shared a tiramisu with my wife, both deserts were very delicious. Overall, I'd go again and recommend it to anyone looking for great, homestyle Italian food.

VPcy9xdqGjMiNjSmr5-CrA.text: Awesome.  My new favorite Italian place, with Chicago Joe's and Casa di Amore tied for a close second.  This place has the atmospere that many of the larger chains try so hard to achieve.  The in-house jazz band cranks out standards on specific nights of the week, but I'm not sure which nights they play.  Live music, great food and a friendly staff = A++

pow8WKqerwy2WI9KY4i73w.text: I love this restaurant! Definitely a nice escape from the chains like Maggiano's and Bucca di Beppo. It has a great casual, local feel to it without the strip's overpriced menu.  I loved my baked ziti and the garlic bread. The serving was so big I had to take some home. They were also kind enough not to charge me a cake cutting fee when I celebrated my birthday there. Cons for being in a seedy strip mall with bad parking.

Mvri7epVW9rBNAgLR8djxg.text: Sit at the bar and take in the old Las Vegas vibe. Order the Arancini and the Castiglion Del Bosco Brunello. Enter heaven.

rzgWvO3ArWi57wou3ujk9A.text: Unfortunately, I did not have a chance to try Nora's Cuisine due to a bartender that was so rude to my date and I, that we both decided it would be best to leave. We had arrived for our reservation early and was told by the host that it would be just a moment for our table to be ready. As a result, we decided to go into the bar and have a cocktail before dinner. After waiting at the end of the bar for a period of time with the bartender aware of us waiting, we watched the bartender clean the bar, talk with other guests and walk over to talk to the other bartender before he finally made eye contact with us and signaled us to come to him at the middle of the bar with a wave of his head. When we walked over, I mentioned, "I didn't think you saw us", to which he gave a rude smirk. Without any prior interaction with this bartender, we were at a loss as to why we were treated this way. Seeing how this was our first visit to Nora's, we did not want to chance sitting down and possibly having the same treatment from other members of their staff and ruining our evening so, we thought it best to just leave and have dinner elsewhere.

NI8e86f2U2BOnKudo5mMTQ.text: First time diner. I & wife had baked zitti. good taste, nice and hot. small portion imho. cuz had spagetti/meatballs, looked good and he said it was fine. his wife had the tortellini and she liked it too. i feel the portion size was what turned me off, maybe i expected to much. for a monday it was very busy and seems very popular. service was ok, nothing exceptional. overall ok, but when in L.V. i won't make a special trip to return.

_gMmjfQULLW68_xRstgctQ.text: Nora's is one of those places where I step inside and forget I'm in Vegas.  The house combinations are flavorful.  Comfort foods with portions that are oversized.  The tiramisu which is too often a let down at Italian restaurants; hits a high note and resonates here.  My only complaint is that there is no proscuttio e melone on the menu.

K-7h33Um-I-FC0wUfXwUuw.text: I thought Nora's Cuisine was expensive for what it was. For an appetizer, I tried the calamari and the taste was forgettable. For dinner,  I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken and that was good. They also had garlic bread, but I didn't really care for it. Something in my gut really, really wants me to like this place more. Maybe because the rest of the party enjoyed it or maybe I didn't order the right thing. We'll see if I ever make my way back.

6eYMqzHnWosuT-K5QhvGTA.text: I am completely satisfied with the crowd, music, ambiance and the special aromas that delight you when you enter this place. The staff was overall very kind and the dinner was excellent! The Shrimp Scampi dish was the best. The salad and bread was an excellent appetizer. The only gripe that I really have at Nora's was the wait staff. It seemed I never even seen the waiter the whole time we were eating and to tell you the truth if the waiter is not going to be on top of their game and they have the bus boy doing majority of the work they might as well stay at home. I believe our waiter will be fired in the near future if he keeps his ways up. Even after the bus person served us our desserts and toke great care of our family. I was surprised and irritated that the waiter took his time even taking care of our bill. Needless to say his tip fell shy of 10%. Times are tough in the economy. He should be so lucky to still have a job. Waiters in Vegas be aware people that work, meaning, the ones that still have jobs. They work hard for their money and when they go out they want excellent service. His butt was saved because of the great food and the Bus boy. Next time he may not be so lucky.   Sean

YF5Sxu24AL2nmSRDvLo3YQ.text: This place is actually a good even for the modern man. Not your tyical on the strip vegas spot which is good beause i really dont want to meet another couple from florida named dan and cheryl. It is definatley a local spot with your once and a while pop ins from vegas show people. i was in there couple months ago and saw holly madison, thats right the bunny. I get so distracted, focus.. best place to dine is the bar side for sure. There is a old school 3 piece band which plays everything from frank to nat king cole with a rare spotting of kareoke if you get lucky.   the food is pretty good, italian is tough from me because of my broken english family from the old country. i enjoyed there chicken plate that looks like a volcano or my aunts hair.. Goodfellas style! The appetizers are nice and everything is seasoned good. i think sometimes they get so crowded that they lose some of that love that goes into cooking. great atmosphere and great music. have fun! Buon Appetit

Ex_H_P5B7jldWHWgTM62gQ.text: A great place in Las Vegas. A locals favorite. Off the strip. Great wines, a good menu and very good food. Get there no later than 5PM for a table seat- otherwise you'll have to sit at the bar and eat- not the best place to enjoy their ambiance and food. It is crowded and if you wish to get bumped in the back by bar patrons sit at the bar.  You will really enjoy the food, it's a first rate Italian restaurant and harkens back to those in San Francisco or Boston.

GSIINmfDYKCatzJ_abjgtw.text: I could not be happier finding this restaurant on Yelp.  My family & I were tired of eating food in all the hotels.  Nora's was what we were looking for.  Great food, wine and reasonable.  Tip, reservations or go there before 6pm.

Tl0mYOk2-eyDQhS0tEsmyw.text: This is a popular long time local spot.  Food and atmosphere is great.  Cool small restaurant that feels very warm and welcoming.  Family share style salad, tasty bread, thick rustic sauce and you are all set.  Signature drinks are creative and good too.   Only thing I think needs improvement is the service.  Servers could be friendlier and sometimes it feels like it takes dinner forever to arrive.  The place is so enjoyable but the unenthusiastic attitude of the staff does not match.

9slvXu5M2aRJWXkVkHmn_w.text: Yummy!! Phenomenal Italian food.  I can honestly say it rivals Buddy V's at the Venitian.

KzNlF7nxFWnhLVvdR1DR5g.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  My family and I were at their new location (beautiful) last week.  We had Don as our waiter on the patio.   He is superb, polite, professional and personable.  Thank you so much to Nora's for staying True to yourself and offering fantastic food!

uvPcuxDFHcriwzNITinDbA.text: Made reservations and glad we did, this little gem fills up fast!!! Great service and great food! The pizza was one of the best we ever had in Vegas!! Definitely a place to keep visiting!

5q1giO82ySr96SzGd9e0-w.text: A friend told me that this was a very good Italian Restaurant & i have to say I was a little disappointed..they gave you garlic bread that was very hard. The calamari was a little chewy. The baked rigatoni was over cooked. The restaurant itself is a little outdated. I sat near the bar and they have this ceiling to floor curtain that look like it hasn't been cleaned in 20 years..The service was ok. I owned pizzerias and I made better Italian food than this so called really good local Italian restaurant..I am sure they will never see me again

eQnapysKrn1I_4balkId7A.text: A must for amazing authentic Italian cuisine.  Went with my resident Italian chef and he gave it a thumbs up.  The steak rivals those from steak houses.  The Cheese Tortellini is perfection.  I loved the spinich/ricotta cheese pizza.   The food is amazing, but the service may be a bit slow.  We went for 9:30 dinner on a Saturday night, the service started great then slowed... Had to wait on water refills and kitchen was slow, tough the food/wait is worth it.  If you go to Vegas and like Italian, this place is definitely worth checking out.

GUODGM6zHcrfa_yTQWug0w.text: Located in a strip mall north of strip. Best bruschetta.  Ravioli and chicken Alfredo were delicious.

jmBlXj6RekC474Shv0aQlQ.text: The only reason this is a three-star review is because service was sooooooooo slow. We had a party of 8 and it took almost an hour from the time we ordered until we got our food. The food was very good and the Sangria (both red and white) was delicious, but it just took too long to get our food. I had a pizza and was very happy. The sauce was good, the veggies were all fresh tasting and well cooked and the crust was crispy on the outside and chewy inside. I would definitely recommend Nora's to friends if they don't mind a bit of a wait.

rqbw7GMlxxnu5l6EEYiVsg.text: Nora's was a favorite of my husband and I for years, however, on the recent visit here, the service was horrible . Our waitress was rude and inattentive. On top of the bad service, the food was greasy and not as flavorful. Would not go back!

dpbsm-96juT_DJmIFxw5Tg.text: Not overly impressed. The entrees we ordered were all pasta and had a good flavor but that's about where the good stops. The complimentary garlic bread was nothing special and pretty dry, but this isn't what makes my review only 2 stars. The service was terrible. We were seated in the crammed kitchen area and 20 minutes of no one taking our order I nearly checked in to be like 'oh hi, we're your customers on the table by the door and we're hungry!' It got to the point where other servers that we tried to wave down would just put their heads down when they walked passed our table. Plain rude and frankly it was not that busy. There are definitely better Italian places in town for the same price or less.

saqKDLEScYNIRJqzrqR22w.text: Just tried the new location last night and the food is still my favorite Italian in LV but they really need to do something about the lighting, it felt as though there was a spotlight on us, very uncomfortable. The noise level is also an issue, we couldn't even talk to the person sitting next to us because the music was so loud. I do like that they now have outdoor seating so I'm hoping that if they adjust the issues with the lighting and noise I will be able to go back and give it a 5 star.

12aOCpCZP6HmTytKsEjkPA.text: Simply put, the best Italian food in Vegas and perhaps the west coast.... I only review the really good or really bad.  This is really good and a fair price.... Drive off the strip a couple of miles and head west on Flamingo past The Palms.  Make reservation in the weekend. They have the traditional faire plus great specialities.

pLRTdZeJs44nd9I1_kVvoQ.text: I don't know if I would drive all the way out there to dine here, but if you are in the area the food was very tasty.  Here are my gripes : if you check in on Yelp there's a special for a fresh glass of wine, well they didn't want to honor that for the Sangria, thought that was really cheapo of them.  Second complaint, my girlfriend ordered a grilled chicken dish [aka means healthy typically] it was swimming in olive oil. Like she was moving the chicken out of the oil. Third, the definitely don't have the best garlic rolls, while they are good, we ordered a side of tomato sauce to dip them in.  Morale of the story....Panevino is still my favorite Italian for a "locals spot" in Vegas.

VpVateaGefW7pjFxVQjMuA.text: This is my Favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. It's Great food and if you are able to get a seat it's well worth the wait. The only issue I've ever had is getting seated. Even with a reservation, you will have to wait. Clearly the food is that great

jn6iO5qDxgt7XX7ijVHRHg.text: Very good old-school Vegas restaurant. Growing up, my family became very familiar with the staff, and they made specials for me, even long after they left the menu.  Great staff, AMAZING classic food, and lovely ambience. I agree about the garlic bread, and the lasagna is also a classic.

9KGgYGAawbDZEUZX6eFk_w.text: We love this restaurant. They have live music on the weekends. The food is good, we would like to see some more vegetarian selections.

1ES6oJCdYbh_Xp1DfEantg.text: Only had the pizza here and the arancini ( and some of the crazy alfredo ). All were excellent. Flavorful sauce, great crust and topping on the pizza ( I had the "salami" pizza ). I will be going back for more !

Vp1CQstyMDaz3tMA6QqU6w.text: Food is really very very average here.  I feel bad writing a poor review as the prices and service are very good.  We were seated promptly and with a smile.  Everyone, the host, waiter, even the water guy were very cheerful.  Possibly the best service i've had in vegas.  But the food :(  Garlic bread - cold, really no flavor Side salad - ridiculous amount of olives Gnocci - really bland...basic red sauce  My friend had recommended this place and claims to really like it.  She had the Chicken Marsala and upon sharing a bite with her i'll be making her dinner next time because I think I can do better ;)  I would/will give this place another shot at some point because the service was very good.  I really wanted to like Nora's.

w9VEqQ3hgWFfaKaIfGK50A.text: I LOVE this place!!  We went with friends and had an array of amazing appetizers (Bruschetta, clams, rice balls, shrimp scampi, Calamari, to name a few)!! The wine was perfectly selected!!  We were so completely satisfied, we skipped entrees and went straight to the dessert!!! The Tirimasu is authentic and delicious!!! I can't wait to go back (tomorrow night)!!  The whole experience was great!!!

ObA040upbLgC9uZWcrO3eg.text: To start off we ordered the arancini and the pomordoro bruschetta and it was absolutely amazing the bruschetta was deliciously seasoned, nice and fresh, on a lightly toasted but soft Italian bread, highly recommend it! The arancini was absolutely to die for! Down to the basil it was served with, bellissimo! That alone got my five stars! Lol then we went on and order the baked rigatoni and the spinach and farro salad, OMG THE RICOTTA , on top of the rigatoni was the best! So creamy and fulfilling. the salad a nice balance of bitter salty and acidic favors . I was disappointed only at the fact I got so full cause I really wanted to try their canolis lol delish delish delish is all I can say!

QWdOZ934_JYg4DdDjdMHOQ.text: When in Vegas, I expect over-priced meals that are trying a little too hard to be memorable. Until this last trip, when the hubs and I needed to get away from the madness of the strip and stumbled across Nora's. Best. Decision. Ever. Loved the food--- but only for lovers of garlic and if EVERYONE participates! The meat sauce was literally the best I've ever had. And the fact that it's family owned and run? Bellisima!!! Brava!!!

OCiVY7QrdZUTG92823D-Mg.text: Wow! This place was great! Service was amazing and the food quality matched. I never had to ask for a refill or wait for our waiter to come, even though it was a packed house.  We were seated by the kitchen, which is open in the center of the restaurant. Normally I don't like being seated by the kitchen, but it was kinda fun watching how organized and fluid they were when working.   I ordered the huge ribeye steak (16 oz), calamari, and tirimisu for dessert. The calamari is a large portion and the dipping sauce was out of this world with a beautiful basil flavor. The steak was juicy and tender and flavored well. The tirimisu was good too. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, but I would encourage you to make a reservation to be safe because it was packed on a Monday night that we went. I'm sure the weekend would be a long wait otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tirimisu...Took a bite first.

AhMcyc6bjW2RH-ZHrNINOg.text: The food here is spectacular. Can get a little crowded like crowded but we were seated quickly after first being told there was a wait. Judy had the rack of lamb, cooked medium rare, huge portion, presented on top of cooked spinach. Complimentary garlic bresd as good as you will find. We also had friends led bronzini- grilled while so watch for bones.less expensive pasta dishes are filling and totally satisfying for spaghetti lovers. This is a fine restaurant. Service was terrific, parking lot a little small and puck a time to avid the wait. But once you get seated, you will be happy.

t3JNDVzcE2hmU0Dt3q8rlQ.text: I love this place! Their garlic bread is my fav! Very authentic! I always want something new each time! I have dined in, as well as take out! It's really a nice place for date!

MXis5Ll88wCLbpIITgGSNw.text: I think 3 Stars might be generous. There are some other fairly good Italian places in Vegas. The only thing good about this place was that the prices aren't too high.   The service was incredibly slow.   We had Cabrese salad - Pretty good Veal Parm and Egg Plant Parm along with Spaghetti with Marinara.  The veal was pretty tough and the sauce tasted tinny as did the sauce on the pasta. The same was True for the eggplant. It tasted like they either over spiced with something or we were getting flavor from the cans they used.

xsas160kEVDPlivGd1qeyg.text: I only want to have small bite and a beer, lady said no, we close at 11... I show her the time on website, still no service....

VGULcdxjGB9RlXTMd--9-Q.text: Very good food and excellent service. The staff was very nice and very attentive. Pappardelle with wild boar bolognese sauce was perfect. I will be back. Ps: food was reasonably Priced.

1HrROBwm91dYukndLmJqvA.text: One of my favorites, staff is always pleasant and the wine selection is nice and cappuccinos are yum.

Jpw6Ziwhv8CuEhuUZ8rtbQ.text: Nora's... mmm mmm mm. Very cozy/ classy environment. My husband and I did date night here. I had been once for a company lunch and I couldn't stop talking about it.. well they relocated and the place is GREAT! It is super packed so make sure you make reservations.. they give you a delicious garlic bread to start off.. and the customer service is good. I had this shrimp scampi and my mouth just waters just thinking about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UumHqD0AUIQB9OF1PXomMw.text: I've been to Nora's twice and had somewhat different experiences.   Both times that I went the food was very good. I've tried their gnocchi, and their fettuccini Alfredo. The gnocchi was very good, not the best that I've had in Las Vegas, but it was delicious. Everyone that I've dined with at Nora's has enjoyed their meal.  The first time I visited Nora's was with a large group, so I can understand that service was a little slow. The next time we visited with a small party the service was excellent.   The dining room is crowded but has great ambiance - exactly what you would expect from a nice Italian restaurant. Unfortunately, you may not be seated in the dining room. The second time I visited this restaurant was when my mother was in town, and we took her to Nora's because she wanted a nice Italian dinner for her last night in Vegas. We did not have a reservation, and we were happy to wait for a table. After waiting for a few minutes we weren't taken into the dining room but instead sat next to the bussing station and kitchen. There's a tiny row of tables behind the hostess station - it's noisy,  busy with servers running food from the kitchen, and warm. I realize that this restaurant is small and busy, but I don't think it's an acceptable place to seat diners at a restaurant with prices this high. It was made even worse by the fact that the only people sitting in this area were people who were more casually dressed. So, I guess if you would like a nice seat at this restaurant either make a reservation specifying a table in the dining room or make sure you aren't dressed casually. Either way, I don't think I'll be back. There are many places in this city to get good Italian food at a lower price point with just as much ambiance as you would get sitting next to the kitchen at Nora's.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Took Mom out for a nice dinner on her last night in Vegas and ended up sitting next to the wait staff prep area.  Bummer.

uFuyCab_p611Ck2qaRJZQg.text: What more can you ask from an Italian restaurant.  Nora's is located off the strip in a shopping plaza, where you would never expect to find this little hidden gem.  I made a reservation but my party members were late.  The hostess had no problems with this and I was seated promptly when my party arrived a few minutes later.  You walk into Nora's and you see a part of the kitchen immediately.  To the left and right are dining areas that are reminders of what you would expect at an Italian dining establishment: lower lights, intimate areas, cozy, etc.    We were seated and given bread.  We then ordered some wine and beer which was reasonably priced considering it is Las Vegas.  I had the house specialty seafood pasta with a caesar salad; all perfect and as tasty as expected.  The other members of my party had Chicken Parmigiana and an Eggplant Parmigiana.  Both were also great when I tried them.  The restaurant is very good in most ways, and I recommend it to anyone looking for quality Italian cuisine.  It just did not blow me away in any category to earn that fifth star.

J-OLa5MpPOLru6s6Q0f-Pw.text: Great service all around for my 1st visit at there new location. I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Location

_z0Oxd9XqYF9M4K51_IVIA.text: Pretty disappointing experience. Came here last summer and the food was above average but service was awful (they forgot to give us water the entire meal, upon reminding them). We thought we'd give it another try this summer for lunch, but again had awful service. We waited for a pizza for half an hour, and upon its arrival it was cold and undercooked. They must've forgotten to bring it out? We also noticed it wasn't the same quality as the previous year, almost as if it were from a cafeteria. They have certainly compromised quality in the past year. Waiter wasn't apologetic at all for the cold, late food. Either way we won't be back.

dzC92ke4Isu3IP5cFxgPBw.text: Amazing spot! Great atmosphere, reasonable prices. My boyfriend and I had the Sicilian olives and truffle fries as an app- delicious! I had the fettuccine carbonara for dinner, but substituted gluten free pasta. It didnt even taste gluten free! It was amazing. My boyfriend really enjoyed his veal parmesan as well. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sicilian olives

RiXlrTfgcseLhqN1tmEKzg.text: This was my second visit to Nora's in the past week.  We stopped in for lunch one day because we have heard from two people how good this place is.  Lunch prices are very reasonable and the food is amazing.    The lunch service was a little slow but I'll tell you what, the FOOD was worth the wait.  We got the Steak and Arugula Bruschetta as an appetizer and it was out of this world!!!   AMAZING!!!  They do bring you a small basket of Garlic Bread, the first one is on them the menu says and then $2.50 after that.  The bread is amazing but when you get a basket with just 4 small pieces for two people and then want to charge me $2.50 for another 4 pieces, that I may question.  I had the Rigatoni Special and the sauce, the sausage, the meatballs, OMG... we also a Nora special which is not on the togo menu so I cannot tell you the exact name but I was told it was the BEST they have ever had.  So since our experience with the food was SO AMAZING, we decided to go back last night and bring my daughter and her husband.  Of course we had the Steak and Arugula Bruschetta and they ordered the regular Bruschetta and both were again very good.  We also ordered the regular Antipasto Salad which we have had in a lot of Italian places and this was by far the BEST.  This time I decided to try the Chicken Parmigiana which you can get breaded or not and it was AMAZING..  The portion size was give me a to go box size which I did take home.  We also had the Veal Chop Parm, a $42 plate but I tell you what, the size of this Bone in Veal was so big, it came home and provided two more meals.  My daughter had the baked Rigatoni and her husband had the Snow White Pizza.  I guess he was having a Disney moment.    Both dishes were amazing and to go boxes were in order for those as well.  he ordered the medium pizza and it was big enough for 2 to 3 people.    They all wanted deserts and OMG, the cheesecake is to DIE for, no you won't die if you eat it but after all the food you might explode, the Cookies and Cream Tartufo was amazing, the Panna Cotta was WOW and then a Toasted coconut drink with drambui, and brandy was the topping on the meal.  My friend Frank from AZ comes here all the time and this place was packed non stop last night until about 8:30 then it started to slow down, but I truly understand why Frank says there is NO PLACE like this in Vegas for food of this quality.  Everyone from the hostess to the Manager last night were some of the warmest and friendliest people who ensured the place was running like a well oiled machine and they did an AMAZING JOB!!!  Many kudos to the kitchen and the entire staff, this is one of the BEST Italian places we have ever found her in Las Vegas and HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place and we will be back often, it is just that good.  They do not give military discounts but that is ok, this place is so good I will support them and so should you.  The prices are very reasonable and it is worth every penny.  I don't want to see corners cut to provide a discount and GOOD FOOD is worth paying for and this place is for REAL!!!!

Ff9_b6lSV_EEH_LY1uu88g.text: Ok, I heard Nora's had amazing food. I'll never know. My girlfriends graduation party was not only NOT seated 45 min after our reservation, but we were looked at as some low life second class folks as soon as we walked in because of the jeans and tee shirts, along with having a 14 person party. Last Friday the two female greeters made all of us feel very awkward. I got the feeling I needed to show them my Range Rover Keys to get seated faster. If you plan to eat here please come with slacks and not be to overly excited about a college graduation or you might be looked upon as Denny's type customers. It's ok, the other other Italian place up the road got our almost $1200 in business...

FqTObd3zCZNHwej86SWc2A.text: After eating real Italian food when I went to Italy a few years ago, I became an Italian food snob.  Good Italian restaurants in Vegas? No such thing!  Until I came to Nora's.  I got there before they even opened for the day and I'm glad I did as it got real busy around 11:30!  That's always a good sign.  We got calamari which was tender and crisp.  I got gnocchi in Alfredo sauce which was creamy and absolutely fabulous.  We also got the rib eye sandwich with gorgonzola topped with onion strings and homemade potato chips on the side plus a basket of fries.  It had huge chunks of meat and the rich and tangy flavor of the gorgonzola complements the meat.  For everything we got, I only paid less than $40!  The service was good.  Remember to check-in so you can get a free glass of wine.  The free garlic bread is great.  You can definitely taste the garlic which I love.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow White pizza (half sausage)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne alla Vodka

ueKa447twae15BNEzlVsUg.text: This place is not at all what you expect. Found this place on Yelp when arriving to where my gps is telling me where it is we drove by the restaurant three times not even knowing it because of the poorly lit sign we ended up calling to see where it was to found out we were parked right in front of it not even knowing. I expected to get some good home cooked Italian food... WRONG. If you can mess up the simplest dish like lasagna how can you really call your self an Italian restaurant. The service was incredibly slow seeing that they weren't even busy. We had to ask two different servers for our check because our waiter was no where to be found. Save your self the headache don't go to this place there's many many more Italian restaurants in Las Vegas that will live up to your expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v7nRyEDz6Zv7mRl0kdTTvA.text: Just ordered $70worth of food, $100 in gift cards and they would not let us sit at an empty table in the  bar to drink wine and await the to go order.  There were no two seats together at the bar.  A kindly couple moved over to allow us, two women to sit together.  Never been upset with Nora's before but this was shabby treatment.  We were not even offered garlic bread, we had to ask for it.  The empty table we were asked to vacate sat empty for the 15 minutes we were there.    While their food is exceptional, this treatment was shabby and rude.  I might never go back!!!

ynsoTdYolTRkuRZeQ9y8KA.text: The new building is beautiful but attitudes have completely changed.  I always loved Nora's when it was in the strip mall.  It was cramped but the food and service always left you with a good feeling despite the close quarters.  I think we are giving up on the new location though.  It started with a takeout order.       I had ordered a good amount of food including a chocolate cake.  "That cake takes like half an hour", said the person on the phone.  They told me to pick it all up in half an hour.  I arrived and the hostess seemed irritated by my presence.  She came back with my food sans cake.  "You know that takes like half an hour to cook", she told me about the cake.  Her tone suggested I was a dumbass for ordering cake.  My food sat on the host's stand getting cold while I sat and waited for cake at the bar.  The bar tender asked what I wanted and I told him I was waiting for cake.  "That takes like half an hour", he said.  Thanks bud.  I asked to speak to the manager and told him my beefs.  He was very professional and gave me a voucher for $30 off my next meal.  Cool.        Several weeks later my wife and I pop in late in the afternoon with the plan of getting some apps and cocktails.  We used to do this frequently at the old location.  We loved the arancini and calamari.  We sat at the bar and were unacknowledged for ten minutes despite multiple people behind the bar.  It appeared the person who's section were in had tables outside the bar that needed his attention and the other bartender was not going to bother with us because we were not in his section.  This just made me sad because, as someone who worked in restaurants for years, I really admired the teamwork and camaraderie at the old location. It just gave you a good feeling while you were there.  We were never ignored there.  We got up and left, if anyone noticed they didn't care.       The last time, still holding the $30 voucher, was around 5:00 last Saturday.  I approached the host stand, met with a rather curt, "yes?" from the hostess.  "Table for two please" I said.  She looked left, and then looked right at the half-empty dining room.  "It's going to be about half an hour unless you want to sit on the patio" she said.  It was about 110 degrees that day.  She cared more about keeping the sections even than getting people served.  As we left disappointed I told my wife, "I'm tired of holding on to this stupid voucher, I've had it in my wallet for almost six months."  "Just give it to someone" she said.  So I handed it to a dad in the waiting area and finally severed my maddening tie with this indifferent restaurant.

UEJlVuuPHYH0mRp9CfBl1w.text: One of the bestItalian restaurant in Las Vegas. And a lot less expensive than the strip. Great service too. The place is always busy, so make reservations

poq3iHRr2OzZ6dM6VDkyXA.text: There are some dishes that are fire and others that were just ok. We ordered:  Arancini - Fried Risotto Balls that were pretty good...like a lighter, less cheesier fried mac and cheese ball  Garlic Bread - Not the best but decent  Italian Wings - DON'T order these if you are trying to eat your entree...these got me full as fuck with how heavy they are....ok wings but they are heavy and will get you full if you eat these alone....  Fettuccine Carbonara - EL FUEGO! One of the best pasta dishes I've had in recent memory....  Baked Rigatoni - Not my favorite...and was bland...  Overall it is a very good local restaurant with high quality food at a reasonable price.

Kvfncfjqjpzc2PVamzOvWQ.text: This is my fourth, or fifth, time here. Once with my family, and the rest for business.    When you drive up to it, on the outside it's a dump; a typical strip center that's seen the better years behind it. Once inside, it's cozy, especially the side with the bar.   The food is excellent as is the service.  Great Negronis and a decent wine list at reasonable prices. In fact, all the prices are reasonable.   It's a homey place great for the whole family.   My favorite place in town is still Panevino, but this is my second favorite.   And the espresso is wonderful, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice ceiling
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool bar.

3Vkr9G2m3990BoTK7KSYzA.text: One of our favorite spots to go as a family or a quick get away without the kids ! Its decently priced, servers are pretty decent its alot busier then it used to be, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Their new location looks really nice but kinda miss some of the original servers that used to be at the older one.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tenderloin!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken milenese!

Zy4ivh_GE4bgVmmdyapl9g.text: This place is a hidden gem.  We came early so i can only give a review for the lunch time.  The food was fabulous.  The server was extremely professional and polite.  He gave great recommendations on food and wines that would go along with it.  At night he was saying that they have a singer and piano player.  I would have loved to see that.  I will be back for a dinner in the future.

jb1aToWHhlpY31Vt9qAiYQ.text: Went to dinner there for my birthday last night.  The food was excellent and so was the staff.  Could be the best Italian food in Vegas

XP4QE92eGxLd6mhjSgRwNw.text: We always loved Nora's but yet had a chance to check out the new location so we decided to celebrate Valentine's Day there. Made a reservation online. With the only options 4pm, 4:15pm and 4:30pm, we picked 4:30pm. When we got there at 4:20pm, not only the restaurant was full, the reception area was also full of people. When we finally made it through the crowd and get to the hostess, we were told that they just need to clear up a couple of tables then it'll be our turn.   After couple minutes into the wait, I realized pretty much EVERYONE around us HAS MADE reservations. I hate to assume they overbooked but I guess I'd never find out what really was going on. Because we left empty stomach after standing in the annoyed crowd after an hour. By the way, my husband did check with them one last time before we left. The answer was the same, "We just need to clear couple tables."  Well, my three stars are for 1. The hostesses kept their sweet smile on even they knew everyone was hating them. 2. They dedicated one employee to serve the waiting crowd sparkling wine and she always came back with more. 3. Our love for Nora's based on our past experiences.  So obviously we were not happy and really disappointed with this one experience so I decided to leave this review and only three stars. Hopefully the owner and the management will notice their overall rating is going south since they moved into this new location and do something about it. Check out other reviews if you will.   We will definitely go back in a month or two. That's enough time for them to fix the problems. Hopefully they will bring back the Nora's we've always loved.

REhQw-NYN_HEYljJqVmFHQ.text: What can I say besides how disappointed I am that my favorite Italian place in town, has gone down hill.  They turned an intimate hole in the wall restaurant, to a place that is now lacking in every area.  The food that was amazing, is now mediocre at best. To be honest, the food doesn't even taste the same. The attentive service that once was, is now gone, it took 20 minutes to get drinks (and I got water).  Mind you, when they finally brought out my water the glass wasn't clean and had lipstick stains on the rim. Cool. The seating is too close together, which makes it hard to move around the restaurant.   I might give it one more try, but all I kept saying when I was there was how sad I was that Nora's is ruined. They should of stayed at the old location.

M6UMXy14k8_QdHyw33cCUQ.text: This is a great little Italian restaurant.  The food and cocktails were excellent and the decor is beautiful.  Service was just average.  Bartenders seemed more interested in talking to one another than taking care of us.  Plenty of parking and I suggest getting there early to avoid waiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PsgSFkMUh7MtadoXQUcY1g.text: Our experience at the new Nora's last month at lunch was not pleasant. The restaurant was moderately busy, but kitchen production was very slow. Our server was literally missing in action.  But we went back a month later thinking our previously experience was only a one-off. The restaurant was NOT busy at all...lunch middle of the week. Kitchen production was again slow and our server was slow as well.  Though I rate the food at Nora's five stars plus, service is still a major problem. We won't be going back.

owaNUbFC1CX0ymwkUl4JAA.text: My bartender/server was the perfect bartender/server. I like to eat out alone usually a quick lunch or rare dinner because I am a single mom. An amazing cocktail and meal is how I splurge on myself and that is definitely what I received at Nora's. I ordered a Bombay sapphire gin martini and yes it came with those amazing soft blue cheese stuffed olives where little bubbles of oily fat dance on the top of your ice cold martini. (Magic) I enjoyed a roasted veggie starter and veal Milanese with a salad which was all so perfectly prepared and so delicious. I do have tummy issues so sometimes after I eat after not eating for a while everything hurts so much, and it's not the foods fault, but I was able to leave just as fast as I wanted to go suffer in the car. This was the most professionally run restaurant I have been to yet! Not one bartender flirted with me (believe it or not I came for the food, JUST the food) and not one bitchy side comment from a waitress. I've been to award winning restaurants in town and treated like something less than a paying customer. Not gonna happen here folks!

sfjE1fPT8A9kb0mbln70fg.text: Friendly.  Decent food. Reasonable prices.  I went there for a late night meal and just had a small plate so can't give it a fair review but no complaints  My friend that went with is a regular and really loves it.

eIJhuCjo5AziO2wzNj7Fxw.text: Just tried this  Place for lunch  Food was amazing  I used to go to the one one the rest side  In summerlin before they closed  This was worth the drive

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Food

WipZfTozPsXW6eNaS8NdRw.text: This is my go to for Italian never had a bad meal and the garlic bread when u sit down is to die for great atmosphere and very cool place to eat especially when the weather is good you can eat out side and great bartenders

s0y4NoWMbWzr5bJRLh8NYQ.text: This was the first restaurant I ever patronized in Vegas back at their old location.  Lets start off with the positives: the food.   The food is great! I haven't had a bad meal here yet. Their prices match up to the quality and the portions quite well. It isn't a cheap dinner, but it isn't outrageously expensive.   The drinks: great wine list, and great cocktails! The bartenders know what's going on here.  The negatives: THE WAIT!  I'm tired of the wait here. We've been here 3 times at the new location, and only once did we get our food within 45 minutes of ordering it. We waiting and hour and 10 minutes the last time we were there. That is unacceptable.   It's hard to talk negatively about a restaurant whose food you love, but I really just don't think it's worth the wait at this point. The service is WAY. TOO. SLOW.  Would I come back here again? Only if they can guarantee me I get my food inside 40 minutes from ordering.  Would I recommend this place to others? Yes, with the warning that they will wait.

dQw3SZBpDPsSrVyFdKM9pQ.text: This has always been a must to on my list when visiting Vegas. That was at the old location.  The new location is pretty but we were told a 20 minute wait and it took 1.5 hours to finally get sat.   The new place is so loud we couldn't hear ourselves or the waitress. It feels and sounds more like a sports bar than a decent restaurant.   The food was still great. The manager walked around in circles and never offered to help his struggling staff or inquire about anyone's experience.   I will probably return again when I'm craving a puttanesca, but sadly I am removing Nora's from my must do stops.

3AwjuknxDwLgy200mKVA-A.text: Came here for brunch on lazy Saturday. Had some excellent pesto pasta. The coffee is amazing and refreshing

e3Pp79pUMBdTZB94cRtNQg.text: Nora's is single handily the best Italian cuisine, and I mean authentic Italian cuisine! The dish I ordered was the linguine with clams  with the white sauce, I was not ready for the flavorful cauldron of deliciousness! It was loaded with clams and the sauce was majestic! Just tasteful! For appetizer we ordered the  fried calamari, it was fresh and delightful! I will sure be coming back for another delightful evening! Thanks Nora's staff and chefs!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with linguine

FzumNmu2O3VCxpc379JTpA.text: Very nice and clean. Food was great. Bathrooms were neat and tidy. Service was excellent. I'll definitely return when I'm in town.

sUq8ZtZh9b9_ll7A80whpg.text: We went here for our holiday party for work and WOW! Every single dish was absolutely full of flavor.  The Caesar salad was the best I have ever had and I eat a lot of salad!  The service was impeccable, and the place itself is stunning.  I will definitely be going back!

1XzPhUt8qDvTGvdK0PEX3w.text: OK, still the same. The best Italian restaurant in Vegas plus the best name. This time we were seated in a dining area, the room without the bar. We waited for the food for quite some time, they were busy so no sweat, I understand. We thought the food is the same, excellent! Note that from the promotional flyer/banner at the door, they're moving to a bigger location right around the area. We got confirmation from the wait staff, so the next time we're in Vegas, we'll visit their new location. I had my super-duper mouthwatering seafood pasta and hubby got his veal. We went with hubby's Uncle so he ordered Eggplant Parmesan and that looked delicious too. After the meal we were blasted by this cute chocolate dessert! *:)  Thanks Nora! You got my name and you stole my heart!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my delicious seafood pasta, my style!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate-attack! I tried a piece to have some peace!

eAb3TbcfWQmBMESznz5JKA.text: What a great find off the Strip! Excellent food reasonably priced. At 6:00 PM on a Wednesday night there was an understandable wait for a table. Being alone, I ate at the bar and was well attended to. Highly recommended !!

TLEzqQrWJdNCZE4NAS6MDw.text: Great food! Best Italian food in Vegas! Try the homemade tortellini with Alfredo. It's amazing! Everyone says they have the best vodka sauce they have ever had but I can't go without getting Alfredo.

NpyS2bKIjYYNuBJvt8MqhQ.text: Found this restaurant on a recent trip to Vegas. Great food and atmosphere. Prices were not crazy. We ate at a lot of places on the Strip but I thought this was the best food I had during the entire vacation. If you go, try the Lemon Drop martini!! It was amazing to watch the bartender make this specialty drink. It's not like any other one you have ever tried!

kJTdd9-PwBa_Saer5RJkOQ.text: Came in for lunch, had the seafood misto and antipasto salad.  Food was very good.  Service was fair, had to ask multiple times for more bread.  Finally came after we had finished.  Would try again.

BwhecVCKt0qDjMhJmYl6xQ.text: This place is sooooooo good!! Had the mussels for an appetizer. We dipped the complimentary garlic bread in the delicious broth the mussels were sitting in and boy was it a party in my mouth!! Entrees we had the linguini with clams and the alla Nora and both were phenomenal!!!  Dessert we had the Oreo tartufo. Chocolate heaven! Ambience was very authentic Italian and so was the food. Bernadette was our server and she was such a sweetheart!! Will request her when we come back. My only thing to say negatively is that it was freezing in there!! Literally like an ice box. I even had 2 glasses of red wine and was still cold!! We did ask Bernadette if there was something they could do about the temp and a few minutes later we saw a gentleman mess around with the thermostat. It did help but not much. No biggie though. Next time I'll just bring a jacket. Problem solved! Thanks again Bernadette and to all who helped make this a great dining experience!!
