Tzc_4P5G3CvnTE2q844_yQ.text: Nora's is my New spot for Italian in Vegas .been hearing about it for a while. went last week , nothing but good things , Excellent Food , outstanding service , and very reasonably  priced. Had the lasagna, Excellent , bur friends Had the Baked Ziti and It looked unreal. can't wait to try it  .

0_Vrqr_8YsVoAhGhoRyY1w.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. Have worked through most of pasta dishes on the menu but my clear favorite is the fettuccine carbonara. Generous portions. The Caesar salad is terrific. Come hungry. In fact, for many couples, splitting a Caesar and an order if pasta would be enough.

CqPBLn7ZQ2ue3kYUZ7ThAg.text: we've been going here for years, probably over 10 years.  always loved the food, the prices, and especially the large portions.  not any more.  our usual salad we order for the "table" was now half the size.  my wife's favorite pasta dish was also half the size.  they also brought our pizza that was burned all around the crust.  our waiter, Marla, who was great, as usual, but had no "real" explanation for the changes.  prices seem the same, but the portions are much smaller.  we talked to Nora's night manager, who left us with the impression he could have cared less!!!!

PMMGOGB4n5OgBOJth7pk_Q.text: Although it was a weeknight and Las Vegas itself was not crowded, a reservation was recommended -- and it was needed because this place was full or very close to it. All the customers were smiling and having a fine time. It was hard to choose from the extensive menu because everything sounded so good, and the plates of the other diners all looked wonderful. The more expensive dishes are gargantuan while the less expensive ones are merely huge.  I decided on pasta alla Nora since it is something I couldn't get elsewhere. It is spaghetti covered with meat sauce, cheeses, and pesto (which I didn't notice if it was present), then topped with bite-sized slices of eggplant and baked or more likely broiled. If you like eggplant, it's heavenly. It looked like a manageable portion to begin with; I actually breathed a sigh of relief that I wouldn't be overwhelmed. However, I ended up bringing half of it home with me; it was much bigger than it looked. My friend ordered the fettucine carbonara, and we both agreed it was the best we'd ever tasted. We both loved the garlic bread.  Before we ordered a bottle of wine, we asked whether it could be capped and taken home if we didn't drink it all. Our waiter had to go and check; yes, we could. The bottle we ordered was sold out, so he substituted another wine and reduced the price for us. Great service and a really sweet waiter.  I'd love to try the pizza as well as everything else on the menu. Delicious!

yE6QsC-AdmMUTdb_sVsRqw.text: Went here on valentine's day for the first time WoW this place is awesome I will be a regular here shrimp scampi is an A+

nQN2RrN1VP5sE5ciAaZEkg.text: Have been a regular at Nora's for many years. I really don't want to write a negative review but was highly disappointed with our experience last week.  Noras recently moved to a new location just a few blocks east of where they've been forever . Beautiful restaurant and excellent decor. Place is stunning . Had a 645 reservation on a Tuesday for a 30th b day party. Only four of us.  Wasn't seated until 700pm. Had to flag down the manager and ask why walk ins were being seated before us?  Eventually he sat us and bought us a round of drinks. Don was our server as he has been for many other visits and did a great job as always. Appetizers came out in a timely fashion 10-12 minutes but we waited a full hour to get our entrees. This is not an exaggeration . Manager Dan was apologetic and compensated our table with many rounds of drinks and a reduced bill, but that's not why we visit Nora's.  I did not want a free drink (was drinking sprite) i wanted to enjoy my meal.  The food is always spot on but they were not ready to open at the new building. The kitchen was buried , one hour for entrees is inexcusable.  He said they are working on getting ready for the Grand Opening which is in a couple weeks which made us feel unimportant.  That is why you run a play day and a soft opening with friends and family of the employees to work out the kinks before opening to the public.  It was an awkward dinner to say the least.  We will return eventually but not any time soon.  I put this on the owner of Nora's not on the manager or server.  Don't open unless you are prepared

-dbuXhpNSWcUP_loQZH9Mw.text: The best italian restaurant in town. My favorite angel hair with meat sauce. Great service.

qE1IXq3NQwvqM0Ad8RPoHg.text: If your looking for quality you can taste then Noras is the place for you. It's like a gem in a old strip mall.  Great food and pizza.

fO6poCk9ORp0Otawd07YCg.text: Of the Italian spots in Vegas I've gone to thus far (quite a few), this has definitely been the best. Off the grid a bit for tourists, but definitely an easy access location. When you see a restaurant in a strip mall, I think you're always a little wary, but this place definitely shines.   Staff was super friendly and got us seated fast (without a reservation). The caesar salad was fresh and delicious-- which is great, because I can't even count how many Italian joints try to pass off jar caesar dressing as fresh- ugh. The gnocchi with vodka sauce was super delicious.   Unlike the others, I wasn't terribly impressed with the garlic bread, but hey- you can't win 'em all :)

z4Dpa3g9ON2uRc4VQtHJBg.text: Everything about this place is amazing. The food, drinks, and staff are the best. By far the best Italian food I've had in Vegas, reminds me of being back home in NY. I can't wait to go back.

yzS9D_PyPndlcoftbWwpUw.text: This place is amazing!  It will be a dining destination anytime I visit Las Vegas.  It is off the strip, it is full of locals and it is perfectly priced!  The food is as good as it gets with unique Italian dishes and phenomenal pizza!   Highly recommend this restaurant.

2CNNwmx2yUFGU51ozzuN5w.text: I have been going to Nora's since I was a child and I have always loved it. They never change. (which is great) We try to sneak in for lunch at least once a month when we are in town. They are always very busy so be patient. Perfection takes time. The staff is always freindly.

0cfF8RYpELNfEYXAsMEPCQ.text: The food here was phenomenal! I had The Melrose which I highly recommend. The tiramisu was perfect. The wait staff couldn't have been nicer and were very attentive. Along with how great the food and the service was, the prices were comparable. I would've expected to pay more but when I got the bill, I was pleasantly surprised! The location was off the strip, which I liked as well. I would highly recommend this to anyone and I will definitely go back!

M6IETBCQzqMQq-tB7i6hHg.text: The absolute best place in Las Vegas for italian! I come at least once a week and have never been disappointed. !

KCvgKSEm1atBCT2_eQ9-MQ.text: Took my wife here for a nice date and couldn't have been more pleased! The atmosphere was great, food was great, and the price wasn't bad. If you like italian food and a cozy landscape, this is the place :)

04h-PkqIyAqCNKfnJFYjfQ.text: Best Italian restaurant in town...Ceasar Salad is to die for..garlic bread is delicious..house wine, I suggest red.  It's best make a reservation, the tables are usually all taken, the bars is full. This is local hot spot..everything I've had here is so good. I've been several times..

emmh95ZNqKPQbau1IDXfKA.text: The service is GREAT!!! Very handsome staff! The food is very good and a nice atmosphere.

XQzEylGQwZW8h9qhEF1Y2w.text: I have been coming here for the past 15 years and it has always been a good experience. Great food, great service, good value, and always consistent.  We dined there last Sunday and was very disappointed. There were four of us and we ordered the anti pasta salad, our usual. It was delicious and had been delivered to our table very quickly. Then it seemed to take forever for our entrees to come out and when they finally did, my entree (Alla Nora) was cold. Not even lukewarm. Everyone else's was fine. The manager was great, they re-made my order and when it was served it was piping hot.  I asked for the leftovers to be boxed and they came back with a bag which I thought had my food. However, when I was home and went to reheat it, it wasn't there. It was my boyfriends pasta that he didn't even want to take home. How disappointing the whole experience was.

LkO_vrR8jo4kgBXb4DrC_Q.text: Absolutely incredible. The garlic bread is to die for, along with the wings. I ordered the pasta fagioli, which was the best I have ever had. I also ordered chicken marsala. It had the most amazing sauce and I enjoyed every bite! This is definitely the best Italian restaurant I have EVER been to. I will be coming back soon!

icJ12Xqzntlkl2EPe32low.text: Hubby and I wanted a good Italian place and thanks to Yelp....we found it! I ordered the eggplant parmesan with spaghetti and they were cooked perfectly. The marinara sauce was excellent and the garlic bread heavenly. My husband ordered the linguine and clams and it was devine.  One of the best I ever tasted. We also ordered two glasses of sangria and it was wonderful. For dessert we ordered the cannoli. There are no words in the English language to describe the amazing flavor. The cream was made from scratch and was very light and not overly sweet. The atmosphere is pleasant and the service is great. The staff is very friendly. You can see the open kitchen when you walk in and they create amazing dishes in such a small kitchen. We will definitely come back.

Q_0CYHVTgqeKGp01JhkK0g.text: Favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. Chicken Marsala, aranchini, and clams linguini with spicy red sauce are staples.

9xXHPReH0hAzU_KcUBehMw.text: I've been coming here since high school....never a disappointment. Best hidden lil gem.

iW1iTaUZ2O5qglM9FvG2UA.text: Great italian food! The antipasto is a perfect starter and the linguine with clams is delicious! Favorite local spot.

kLUXJ_r4pVt5-zvb_4pKLA.text: Nora's is worth the trip off the strip. My family's been coming here for years whenever we visit our extended family in town. We eat at Nora's at least once. We always order the antipasta salad for the table and get our own entrees. It's the way to go to save a liitle money as well as not over eat.   Their garlic bread is pretty bomb. Just don't plan on making out with anyone after. The huge chunks of garlic will repel anyone.   I recommend the fetachini sauce or linguini because they're both amazing!  Call for reservations because it does get pretty crowded.

L48BO232iieG1K-h05YIVQ.text: I was happy with the prices here.  Italian restaurants can be pretty pricey but it wasn't that bad!  The service was crap.  The bf and I were at at this restaurant for a little under two hours and had food in front of us for about an hour of it.  The sangria was good and we gladly took advantage of the check-in offer of buy one, get one free.  :)  Bf said his food was cold and my food was subpar.  I honestly have found it hard to find good Italian food so in comparison to other Italian restaurants it was a little above average.  If you can cook good Italian food I would just stay home and cook for yourself. The chocolate lava cake was also very average.  In our young 20's and we were the youngest people there by far.

mWelDCE8KpgZSOGqmQUcAQ.text: I'm always looking for places where the locals eat - chain restaurants are the same everywhere (which I suppose is their appeal).  Nowhere is this more True than Las Vegas.  Everywhere a traveler goes is greeted by chains, cheap "bargain" places that scare me, or fancy culinary experiences that may be great, but not necessarily affordable by a family of four.  That's why it's worth finding what the locals like.  Nora's Cuisine is such a place.    Our first mistake was not making a reservation - its very busy on a Saturday night with an active, upscale bar crowd and live music.  We sat in one of two other rooms which was also very nice and not too noisy.    The food was quite good and very reasonable, especially considering that the portions were large and filling.  The menu was varied and interesting, so my two picky eaters were happy.    Make no mistake; I've had much better Italian food, but this place was comfortable, friendly, not too fancy (Jeans OK, shorts no), and good service for a decent price.  The next time in Vegas, I'll probably return.

RiAeGcHlJr3A5CMdsBWlaA.text: Had a great time! ! Food was sooo delicious! ..Party of 7 and everyone ordered something different, all dishes were excellent.  Service is great too, waiters are patient and attentive.  Highly recommended for something off the strip

c1p70Y_Zp-bbH3J0-Oxq-w.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Vegas. I have been going to Nora's since it was only the now middle room and it has been great ever since. The food is amazing it's a cute restaurant with great service. Everything I have eaten there has been delicious including- chicken Alfredo, Veal, pretty much any pasta is awesome! And OMG the pistachio chocolate is to die for!!! The best dessert you will ever have if you like pistachios and chocolate. You have to order it early because they make it fresh when ordered so I recommend ordering it right when u sit down to make sure there won't be a wait when you are ready for it. It's got a warm melty center and soft outside drizzled in the pistachio sauce. I cannot tell you how good this is. This restaurant has been my favorite for years and will continue to be as long as they keep doing what they are doing! There is also a room for large parties in the back that is really nice and the doors close if you want it more of a private party. There is live music on the weekends not sure about weekdays. It gets a little cramped but not too bad. Overall awesome place to eat!

A9skSW1XYfKphE6bnbY82A.text: I have eaten here a dozen times. Food is fantastic but service varies. Sometimes really good sometimes rushed but more often than not service with an attitude. This place is very small reservation recommended. They really could expand and still stay full. Food is so delicious it over rides any negatives.

CQKuueZC0JsdIxtTEK63zA.text: Ate at Nora's for the first time tonight. My wife and I were seated immediately around 5:45. We each had  dinner salad and an iced tea. The dinner salad was fantastic, the tea was fresh and delicious. We each had an entree. She ordered spaghetti and meatballs and I had linguine and clam. Each entree was perfect. We also ordered a side of green olives in a special oil, they were really great. I am hard to please, yet had no complaints. The restaurant was run efficiently and appeared clean and spotless. All servers were professional and friendly. We never asked for a refill and were offered more garlc bread often. My wife and I  have found a new favorite Italian restaurant!  5 stars in every category: service, atmosphere, food quality, and authenticity. By the time we left the place was full and on a Monday night to boot.

xvQ3al44zZK_rHpx-Agvbg.text: Good Karma! Great little place with a unique ceiling... Nothing like it in Vegas! The wine, pasta and the free sangria = zero complaints! Oh, and VERY cute male staff!!!! ;D not kidding...

wyBNbeBBw6g6DMFuqIDQ-Q.text: I heard great things about Nora's so we decided to give it a try.  It's literally in a strip mall on Flamingo/Jones. And, decor is nothing spectacular. I was, also, a little disappointed with paper tableclothes, but if the food was good I was willing to overlook it.  We sat in the dining room to the left of the entrance which had tables right on top of each other, so definately not a place togo if you want any sort of quiet or private setting. It was kinda loud actually, and we were very aware of the birthday party happening to our right and the party of 12 to our left.  They give you a basket of garlic bread to start (1st basket is free) and it wasn't very good...it seemed just like anything frozen you can buy at the grocery store.  We were never offered a wine list, which I thought was odd. Aside from this, I thought the service was really good.  We ordered 2 entrees...chicken parmesan & sausage rigatoni.  The chicken parm was an unbreaded breast with tons of cheese, and pretty tasteless. It was served with about a pound of pasta (literally). I make better chicken parm at home. The sausage dish was actually my husband's, but I did get to sample the left overs. He thought it was excellent.   For desert he had some sort of oreo ice cream dipped in chocolate. I had a traditional canoli. We respectively, gave these a B.  They had quite a list of dessert martinis, as well, and I couldn't resist trying the banana coconut cream pie martini. It was pretty small, but really strong, and didn't taste much like any thing except alcohol.  The entire check came to around $50 for 2 people.  Overall, Nora's was just OK. I probably won't go again simply because I think there are much better places to get an Italian food fix. But, atleast I can say I've gone.

B8vdmn-nCBpYQ7kpQlE4jg.text: The crazy Alfredo is really bomb!! If u really like garlic the garlic bread is pretty tasty too.

GBzG4ObZV3Cotbj29hw1wA.text: A friend from out of town introduced me to Nora's about six months ago and it's easily now my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas off the Strip. As an Italian who's lived in Vegas for 10+ years and has close family members living in Italy, I'm embarrassed and angry at myself for not trying this place years ago.  I was skeptical when I saw it was situated in a small space in a dingy strip mall, but my concerns were squashed when I walked in and saw how busy it was on a weekday night. In fact, I highly recommend making a reservation if you're the impatient type who doesn't like to wait (especially since their waiting area is extremely small).  The starters are all excellent with the Calamari Fritti, Antipasto Salad, and Steak & Arugula Bruschetta being my favorites. The entrees range from the Italian classics to the Crazy Alfredo, which is easily one of their most popular dishes. It features fettucine Alfredo filled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp, porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapenos.   The prices at Nora's are also more than reasonable, especially for the "basic" pasta items (cannelloni $9.95, lasagna $10.50, rigatoni $12.95, fettucine carbonara $12.95, fettucine Alfredo $10.50, pasta primavera $10.50, etc).   Whatever you decide to order, the food is exceptional and it's just as good or better than many of the Italian restaurants on the Strip. Nora's location and building may not live up to your standards, but the quality of the food will make you forget all about it.

DJzS01fHSbdtWvv_eDTilg.text: So we made last minute reservations for 7 p.m.  When we arrived the place is just the right size for a small family owned type restaurant.  We were sat right on time and our server from the get go was FANTASTIC!  The selection on the menu was great and so were the prices.  We started with calamari and it was so good.  Their sauce that they make to go with it was perfect as well (not just your typical marinara sauce that most restaurants use).  Their small basket of garlic bread was to die for.  My dad ordered a veal chop that was butterflied with the bone on.  THIS THING WAS HUGE!!!!!!!!!!! I ordered a linguinni in pesto cream sauce with shrimp and pine nuts. It was a little rich for me but was incredibly delicious.  We did try a tiramisu for dessert and I'm very picky about that particular dessert but it was home made and I think most people would really like it, I didn't care for it though.    My overall experience is DEFINITELY 5 stars and I'd go back any time.  It's a GREAT place for some good upscale home made italian food.  Just don't forget your reservations cause they are very busy.

NrTwO9AdRyyX55eB5GlOrA.text: You have many choices while in Las Vegas, so driving away from the strip is probably not the first thing you might consider...however the drive to Nora's is worth it.  We've tried several items on the menu and it's all good!!  Ask to sit in Matthew's section for excellent service. Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely and delicious Cannoli!!

81KkjwnDrExvA63EwDQQvg.text: This was the first time I eat here. It was a treat! The service was excellent! It was prompt and friendly! The food was great. The portions were large and prices were very fair. I will be back!

7wgFKKsVNHTbUd3JnYn1Uw.text: As a birthday dinner I came with my wife  The food came fast even on Friday night  We are very happy overall with everything we have Order and definitely planning on going back there again sometime soon.  Highly recommended

y1GiBxZkvLcAyOXMNN-fYA.text: This is about the best pizza I ever had food is so incredible good best Italian food ever it can get little busy but is worth the wait.

dHQJddyMIjl-fUqzSgTLsA.text: Frutti di Mare and Shrimp Scampi main courses were excellent. Very well done.  Service was friendly and attentive.  If I could critique Nora's on any one thing, it would be "charm." That *something* was missing. What happens at a lot of Italian restaurants is that after a certain period of time, the family goes new school. They're no longer hands on, yet want to portray the image that the grandkids are running around the restaurant and grandma's making meatballs. That's likely what happened here. The restaurant was only Italian in the food, but overall vibe was not that.  Great food. Great service. If anyone at Nora's who's been there for a while reads this, they'll know what I mean by "charm" and "something."

0jc_8flfvf62rzjX1bkA9g.text: The Yelp reviews enticed me to visit this place. Summary: Food was good. Service was absolutely terrible.  Very rude waitress.    My first experience, I came here with a date.  I ordered what appears to be everyone's favorite - the Crazy Alfredo.  I love Alfredo sauce. The portion served could feed two people. We ordered the Bruschetta Promodoro.  Recommended.  We moved on to the entries and finally desert.  Overall, the food was pretty good.   Unfortunately,  the waitress was very rude and provided exceptionally poor service.  If someone doesn't like their job - they really shouldn't put themselves in such situations.  From the time we arrived, the waitress appeared unfriendly.  Her demeanor left me with an impression that she was not happy 1. doing her job. 2. providing us service (personal problem of hers maybe?).  Both relatively polite individuals who didn't make any odd/uncommon requests for service.    I ignored her rudeness, since I was there to enjoy dinner with my date.  Naturally, I avoided any additional order or asking any questions about the menu options.  She made me feel so uncomfortable, I just didn't want her near our table.    On my second visit, we got the same person.  The waitress remembered me and appeared to make an effort to be friendly, initially.  Unfortunately, that was short lived.  Her presence was just negative.  You can just sense the negativity in a person - whether it is their dismissive facial gestures, or overall rude tone of voice.    Again, I have no tolerance for such people and pay no mind.  What bothered me more on this second visit is her crude remark.  Apparently, a term I used to describe what I wanted to order - rubbed her the wrong way?  She made a very rude remark that made me give her a quick look - but I smiled and moved on.  I don't come here to engage such petty people - I come here to enjoy good food with good company.  Unfortunately, this same waitress chipped away at my attempt to enjoy dinner with my date.   On my third visit (Italian is a favorite for many, and the food is good).  This time, my date insisted on visiting this place as she never had the pleasure of experiencing it herself.  So, I took a chance.  Long and behold - the SAME waitress for the third time.  No difference.  This waitress provides such poor service, I had to walk over to the bartender, order a drink and tipped him well.  He noticed the poor service being offered by the Waitress.  In fact, he even gave me a look as if he acknowledged what was going on.

gP2pBo2u9BHvVs1hEZyE5A.text: GREAT Italian place in Vegas!! Food is good and pricing is alright too. A little above average price BUT it's worth it. Ambience is your normal Italian place which is somewhat a formal look BUT a nice place to just hangout and chill with good food.

gGjM-BgNQvb62VCNXJpNpA.text: Food was great however our service was horrible. I would have given them 5 stars because the food was so good, but we had to ask 4 times over 40 mins with two different servers before we got our appetizer bread.   Then when it finally arrived it was barely enough for the four people at our table. Outside of this everything else was fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iTPrtvJk_aElpTLK6crBXw.text: Came here after a coworker recommended this place, saying it was her favorite Italian spot in Vegas. It's a nice little mom and pop type place.  When you walk in,  you come directly to the pizza order counter,  but we were seated to the left, which was a more private area, nice for dates, possibly. Frank Sinatra, Michael Buble, etc. was playing in the background.  On to the food. You start out with a complimentary order of the garlic bread,  which was amazing! Sooo garlicky, with fresh minced garlic. We had the fried calamari, which came out quicker than expected. Microwaved? Or maybe it was just because it was slow at the time. Either way, it wasn't as crispy as I'd like, but still enjoyable.  It was served with this sauce that kinda tasted like a roasted chile salsa you'd find at a taco shop, and paired really well with the dish.  For the main dish, I had the pappardelle pasta with the wild boar and red wine ragu. Oh. My. Poop. I loved it! The meat was tender and the sauce full of flavor. I had some leftovers and was actually excited to get hungry again so I could eat the rest of it.   I'm definitely coming back to try some other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle with wild boar ragu.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6ow298DSSmpnTXk_su9FnA.text: This place is really good the food is really Italian style feeling, the white pizza is just really so good it's so fresh and the staff is just incredible. The new location is so pretty and spacious as well. They do a fantastic job

48_-jp0lk8v1Il3wWdHMXA.text: We love this place.  Has beautiful atmosphere and great food. Plan on staying awhile,  they ALWAYS have a wait, just plan accordingly.  Rigatoni was to die for. Parking is kinda disaster.

Gw7PWJQA_SvUMNSqpeviAQ.text: I was here on a date. It was a great experience. Had the seafood pasta and it was super yummy. Great wine selection, but I feel like we should have went with another wine than the Ripasso we chose. Amarone next time?

P3TtxmnVjRvgjcv3RJErYw.text: Great food and excellent customer service! Every time I come in, The waitresses have excellent customer service and food is on point. Honestly the best Italian food I've had in Las Vegas!! I've had dinner here about 10 times and never once do I have anything to complain about. DON was our waiter and such a great guy , so friendly !!! Took really good care of my family and I !

BIkKL_U1jMMXpE8I8xjHmQ.text: Great renovation! Beautiful place maybe eliminate some of the tables sitting next to the kitchen made me feel less than special. That seat shouldn't exist. The food was delicious. I had a red sauce pasta recommended by our waiter. This place is really loud! The tables are way to close to the bar so I felt like I had to scream across the table. Also people are standing up around the bar area. Maybe as a courtesy to the table guest they should be politely asked to have a seat. There is a patio area can't wait to take advantage. 5 stars with hopes of serious change considerations. We will return..

ljTh7_h0Gff47QOnb1Imhg.text: So me and my husband were staying at the Stratosphere hotel off the Strip and being 8.5 months pregnant - I got a craving for Italian food.   Me and my husband looked into restaurants and the distance stated it was about 15 minutes and ultimately ended up deciding to go there. Yes it was further out but I couldn't make up my mind and figured "hey I'm starving. And indecisive so let's just go there before I start changing my mind".   Best dinner I've ever had in all my Vegas trips!  Which is about 10-15 times.   The service AMAZING! The food also amazing!  We enjoyed the whole time we were there!   It's so nice outside also.  It reminds me of a Olive Garden but nicer and food tasted more genuine/authentic.

RDxeTaLsHh0OzV9tMeQO4A.text: The girl who greeted & seated us looked quite confused as she was talking to me. I made reservations the morning of & didn't have problems. We were seated right away.   I ordered a sangria and the bf ordered an IPA. He said his tasted good & had no complaints. My sangria was pretty strong. I wish they had more fresh fruit inside but it wasn't bad. They give you a complimentary basket of garlic bread. Those were pretty tasty. I ordered the crazy Alfredo and he ordered some pasta with eggplant stuff on it. The meals itself were very good. However, it was almost an hour wait for the food. They were pretty packed so I guess it wasn't a surprise that it took a while but still... If I wasn't a little tipsy & I wasn't enjoying my bf's company, I would've been annoyed LOL. But the server was very nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo &amp; sangria!

2BGBkddLzSo_p9D_-XU7eA.text: Another great meal and our 1st lunch, usually here for dinner. Got to try the Italian rope sausage and the absolutely outstanding Seafood Misto.  Let's not forget to thank Joemar for the nice greeting. Our waiter, Rudy also knows his mixology, makes a perfect, Perfect Manattan.

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tried the steak bruschetta, you gotta try it. Seafood Misto was a 1st for us and definitely the last. Rope sausage was excellent

8z2tSPWJa8HStqr2mL9K3g.text: 5 stars for their sea bass so delicious even better if you compare to expensierbplaces and the pasta not heavy great taste really satisfied with the service definitely will come bac

sXQxQ2RQrHXCD5zeohdPmQ.text: Nora's atmosphere is amazing. You can either go casual or dress up. The food is beyond amazing and so affordable. Plus. They give you an overload amount of food. Seriously so good, my girlfriends and I go often to catch up and girls night.  Jasmine

99X8BFC34miOtOPXIr_1_g.text: We've been dinning with Nora's for over 17 years and we have never been disappointed. Whether for lunch or dinner, the food and service are wonderful.  It's always a pleasure to see staff that have been with them for years.  The only thing we would change is more live serenades - we miss it when one of the owners sons would give us Italian serenades (these were frequent at the prior location just a little a little West of the current NEW location).     Inevitably, returning family and friends from out-of-town always request a meal at Nora's.  Tonight, we had a party of 10 and we received the most attentive and perfect service from Daniel and Jacob.   A huge thank you to the staff at Nora's for excellent service and even more amazing food!    As for the food - excellent!  The baked ziti or chicken Marsala are my personal favorites!   My husband and children could not survive a meal at a Nora's without their garlic baskets.  You can never go wrong with a meal at Nora's!!!

_qUOPIzmrGj1nsSLu3kAOw.text: Best food and service ever! Michelle was hysterical and took great care of us at the bar. Stop in and grab a seat at the bar and get entertained while eating amazing Italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Michelle is the best! Great food, great service at the bar with Michelle.

AL-R6HJ6Fs8gaM_bKiCijg.text: I set up reservations for our party of 6 this past Wednesday. The place was packed, they seated us and we had to wait forever to get our wine order in. We were never asked if we wanted another bottle.  Also we needed to flag down someone to get more sparkling water too. We did get an apology from the waitress for the delay, but then we waited again for our main course. The food was ok, nothing special, tons of Garlic, but they never offered fresh parmigiana??  I have had the same experience twice now, so unfortunately I will not be returning.

22DDH-SQMNtU6YddeanmNw.text: New location still serving great food. My wife and I went on our first date at Nora's original location and we just celebrated our 4 year anniversary here at their new location. The ambience is great and the service was good but a little slow. We were seated right away but it took what seemed like 10 minutes before anyone asked us for drinks and apps. Our waiter was hosting a few large parties celebrating birthdays but once the waiter did come around all was well. I had the roasted octopus app. which I really enjoyed. For dinner I had the chicken Marsala, the sauce was sweet and chicken cooked perfectly. For dessert we had the chocolate Oreo tartufo, one word delicious! Overall w had a great experience and would definitely recommend to anyone craving Italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala, side of pasta and Alla Nora.

O6KSVJkyX2HR59foExoNFQ.text: GARLIC GALORE!!  I LOVE GARLIC in my food & this place is filled DERICIOUS garlic aroma!! I get a very mom & pop feel to this Italian joint... but like a back in the days mobster mom & pop shop feel where they would go to get a home style cooked meal. They 2.5 different dining area.... one in the right which seems more of a romantic mood setting while then left side is more of a bright lighting family feel & the center where the open kitchen is there are a few table but I dunno if they actually seat people there. The bar area is on the right side where it seems like they also have a stage for live performance music.  The staff look very professional & also carry themselves professionally in their vested uniforms.   ANTIPASTO SALAD $15.25 - this is the large size which feeds 2-4 but I eat this as a meal usually when I do take-out. Romaine lettuce, kalamata olives, onions, mozerella cheese, Ham & salami wrapped w/provolone cheese, & Roma tomato w/ Italian dressing. I crave this salad whenever I want a salad.   18" SHRIMP WHITE PIZZA $19.95 - white sauce pizza w/ diced pieces of shrimp, garlic, tomato, & mozzarella...  this pizza was PACKED w/flavors!! It was packed w/ little bits of garlic which was in every single bite.  GARLIC BREAD $2.50 - crispy outside but soft buttery garlicy on the other side. They give you a complimentary basket when you dine in & then additional order is $2.50 or when you do takeout.   I have tried other things here in the past before but only these items have really stood out to me...

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The open kitchen
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials board
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free first round of garlic bread then 2.25

en0n2sFg7iHZ9d_iGs60Bw.text: Had a reservation here for 8:30 pm but didn't get seated until 9.   The service was pretty good, especially since it was a Friday night. Our waitress took down our orders fairly quickly and other servers were constantly making rounds to fill water, which was nice. They have a live band playing on the weekends but we were seated on the other side so we couldn't really hear them.   The complimentary garlic bread was delicious! It had real minced garlic on it, not just garlic powder. It was my favorite part of the meal. I ordered the chicken marsala which comes with a side of spaghetti. The chicken was juicy and tender but the portion was actually pretty small. The side of spaghetti, which was was just OK, was bigger than the chicken.  It's not my favorite Italian restaurant but I wouldn't mind coming back again to try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting 3 legs and a head on the ceiling of the restaurant...it&#39;s from the flag of Sicily!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of spaghetti that comes with the chicken marsala
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken marsala

uG88zAEdBUQ9ppjMCeZr7w.text: Um.......YUM!!!!!!! I understand why this place is always packed. I've had the chicken masala, antipasto salad, the branzino, the crazy Alfredo, the lasagna, and the pizza, and it's all been consistent and delicious. The best part though, is the bartender/mixologist Adam. He makes the most amazing drinks and is super knowledgeable. He is one of the many reasons why we love Nora's!

5get25eUGMr7BTUVMA32pw.text: Being from the east coast, I expect my pasta to be homemade and the mozzarella to be fresh...Not at Nora's! Food is average at best! On par with Maggianos or Brios. The only reason I gave it three stars was for the bar.

YGottBUVDtaKH2wSLPVTVQ.text: Noras is one the locals favorite Italian restaurant. Their food is very authentic and delicious. The atmosphere is cosy and pleasant. This is one of those places where the servers would recognize you and make you feel welcomed. There are a lot of locals who frequent this restaurant and are treated like family. We ordered one of their most popular dishes, the Crazy Alfredo. The portion size is definitely crazy. You can easily share this dish with someone else. The pasta is super creamy and it comes with chicken, sausage and shrimp. I was very satisfied with this dish. However, the best part was the chocolate lava. It takes about 20 minutes to get it, but it's worth every minute. The dessert was soft, super tasty and thankfully it was not overwhelming sweet. The pistachio on top was a very nice addition to the dessert. Overall, this is a nice place if you want great food while feeling like your home.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion fruit purée

E5L3LI9i3MA7_5LYdxOR5g.text: We came just a bit before closing with a real craving for good Italian. They seated us happily, and didn't rush us at all. Our server was great, and the cooks made our food wonderfully.  We ended up splitting a chicken parm, the serving size was generous! It was crispy and thin, as it should be, and the sauce was delicious. We will definitely be back.

MCqn0DP93B2xPNxlPkIDoA.text: Local gem, similar to Ferraro's . Terrific ambience, bread delicious and desserts of tiramisu and spumoni ice cream fantastic. Spinach faro salad w/chicken was very good and lasagna was some of the blandest I have experienced. Noodles tasted doughy, meat sauce had NO meat and when I told my server Sebastian, he simply shrugged his shoulders. No credit given , no replacement offered.

xcUlYa4hbRNYvjsRHbh4Mw.text: We came to this restsurant for our 10 yeat anniversary. The atmosphere was great with jazz playing throughout the restaurant. The server was great, she was attentive witjout being overbearing. I loved the lasagna, just wished it had more meat or I could change it to sausage. My wife had calamari and som shrimp carbanara, she loved the calamari and the cabanara not so much. Overall it was great

fxgVVnAdcaF3bjpJYCWwEw.text: A had a few friends that recommended this place, so I decided to have my birthday lunch here. I was not impressed at all with the food. I ordered the pesto pasta with shrimp very bland and pizza with prosciutto (smelled bad). Expensive and not impressed with the food. Only thing that was delicious was the cocktail I ordered

0ctKV2BH4aVQ8_VXnRXbuQ.text: Googled good Italian food off strip and we stumbled on Nora's and OMG, so glad we did!!!! Food, wine and service were all excellent for our entire party of ten. Alfredo sauce was to die for and those red sauce lovers were also impressed! House Moscato was excellent! Our server, Nina took good care of us! Highly recommend.

ay9ZZ8e5VQ7dEKwop92n0A.text: The Restaurant was one of my favs ,. I was disappointed the eggplant parm was sliced so thin all you tasted was sauce & cheese . The sauce was too tomato tasting w/little flavor . Service was adequate at Best . The rice ball appetizer were the size of golf balls instead of the larger than meatball size they should be to at least savor the taste . We will give this place another chance as the chef might of been off & make allowances for an off night

dZRNbGNIE406VtvwnMCa2Q.text: Great food!  Had the Arancini to start, Alla Nora (pictured), the wild boar pappardelle, and finished with the tiramisu and Oreo tartufo. The garlic bread alone is worth the trip!

HbBCHxVmI_8t2D1_yR5DOw.text: I love the new place and it was my first time going with my girlfriend. Everyone is friendly and nice. Even talked to the manager that walks around and checks on the guest which is really nice. I order the ribeye steak and it was phenomenal! Had desert and their cannoli are amazing! Best in the town if you ask me. If you love Italian food come here it's great but it does get packed cause this place is really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very tasty cannoli
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak

GUeg0bdUpRmbsBiSwc3hxw.text: I went on a date with my girlfriend here because we passed by Nora's several times and thought it looked nice from the outside. I made a reservation for 8:30 on 11/4/17 It was already a late dinner but we took it because that's the only time they had available. We got there at about 8:15 and told the hostess that we are there for our 8:30 reservation... we weren't seated until about 9:10. It was ridiculous!!! At that point we wanted to leave already because we were so aggravated with the staff and their scheduling. I tried to ask the hostess about 4 times if we are going to be seated anytime soon, she answered    "give me a couple of seconds" every time. Our experience started off terribly but after we got seated things went alright. We both got different types of pasta and it was pretty good. But when I got close to the bottom of my plate there was so much oil I had never seen that much oil in a plate before, It was pretty gross. Safe to say I will never go back to this place again.

T_MWG-vdCYva1dP9hTyLqQ.text: Poor slow service, takes forever to get seated, to get water and bread..a disappointment !

52ovAGScvNOVbhxe8-Auvg.text: Omg what a great restaurant this is the type you know the food is going to be great! I was not disappointed at all wow the service by Sebastian was authentic and caring . The mussels were spiced perfect the pasta was great I will be back

pwiqIpefnbcaaZA3O-Bypw.text: Make reservations ! This place is packed !   Garlic bread was delish but don't fill up the portions are huge !   The 4 staggioni pizza was uh-mazing!  The crazy Alfredo not so much . Super cheesy with minimal flavor . I had to add lemon to zest it up .  Service was excellent . Grazie Sebastian!

_7YDgSPLX8cRWNdeb1rlhw.text: As you read this review I want you to remember the old Italian Mobsters and have the Godfather music playing in your head.... OK here we go..  This small, cozy, romantic, Italian restaurant is definitely one to put on your list to eat at. I was shocked of the lay out as it just didn't have the feel of a fine dinning restaurant I mean it felt like I walked into the kitchen of mobsters house! When you first walk in The front counter covers the open bar kitchen with a few seats then seemingly in a whole other room there is dining. Its weird but cozy!  The waiter we had did OK, I mean I have had better service I think he was new not sure but he got the job done!   On to the menu. Wow what a full menu with so many options to choose from! I went with there super Alfredo plate and let me tell you it was delicious. The sauce was creamy and full of flavor and the fixing in the Alfredo was like a pizza! It had everything in there and was a great mix too. I was a little concerned at first since I mean seriously was a combination pizza with noodles!! The plate was huge and was not limited on the goods inside. I barley could finish it but I couldnt stop eating!!  When it comes to Italian food this is a must try place. It will bring you the feel of a mobster paradise and fill your belly like your the Don!

JB7h0CbT-h4jJ1gIft99wg.text: Place was hopping for a Thursday night (make reservations).  Appletinis, wine and margaritas were stupendous.  Service was better than average.  Food was wonderful: We had a party of 6 and all were satisfied.  Started out with a antipasto salad--amazing.  Our table ordered spaghetti & meatballs, baked rigattoni, chicken parmesian and a fettuccine with mushrooms & capers..all pastas were fresh.  Can't say anything bad, wonderful experience!

x_8MRuAycJmwkxxv9eO2HA.text: went to nora s for diner and I'm italian from brooklyn. it was such a horrible experience. starting from the moment we walked in the door. service was horrible and the food was even worse.pizza was horrible to start.our drinks tasted like crap and the salad and main course was so horrible we have no idea how this place has lasted as long as it did.the only thing we could think of is vegas locals don't know any thing about italian food and this place will take full advantage of that fact. pasta and sauce the worst. how can you screw up eggplant.we wasted 100 dollars.stay away from this place as it has horrible food and rude workers

Gak6poVUNqEyr_tXYlAfFg.text: Brought my son and bro for first time. As usual, best Italian food around! Only complaint , we shared dishes. Crazy Alfredo had two shrimp and there was 3 of us! Other than that Bomb.com!

0FeB1QZL62iwe1pXPam3Ug.text: Love the atmosphere. The chicken alfredo is by far the greatest in town! AMAZING!

tWvod1M_bsURQTbgGgBSnQ.text: The manager reached out to me about my previous comment, which is very pleasing. Assured me it was an isolated incident so I returned with friends from out of town. The Crazy Alfredo was bomb! I missed that so much. Our experience was 5 star! Food like always was perfect, service as well. Manager appreciated me coming back and showed us, by taking care of our appetizers and first round. This just shows you that when an A+ establishment get a bad review and reach out to you, it speaks much louder. He completely restored my faith in Nora's and I will be returning soon!

0tMzlIqNp5DTXXRkmz3qrA.text: I have been coming here since it opened.  I love the food here well the pasta.  The pizza is not really my thing here because the crust gets soggy.  But the pasta is amazing.  The antipasta salad is amazing I cant eat certain types of meat that are in it but I still get it anyway and just pick them out.  This place does get busy so you should make a reservation.

VbU8BepVX-aD_WGHmngucw.text: Pros: Food tasted good, service was prompt (probably need reservations on a weekend), dinner comes with bread sticks (dipped in olive oil?), staff was friendly, abundant portions (lots of doggie bags). Had Caesar salad (meh), Crazy Alfredo (tasty but oily),  glass of wine, and a cannoli (very good).  With tip: $52!!! (One person).  Cons: Place is really noisy. No real parmesan cheese, but rather the cheap stuff you get at Pizza Hut. Waiter will suggest a salad, but does not tell you it is extra.   For $52 I expect a better dining experience.

fEtvHl3SkOvykVcRcHggZg.text: Really 4 1/2 stars. Complimentary garlic bread. Amazing. Very garlicky (I love garlic). The pizzas are huge but great for leftovers. Antipasto salad with house Italian dressing was very good. I tasted my friend's pasta Carbonara which was quite good if a little salty. Very nice atmosphere & decor. You forget that you are in a strip mall as soon as you step in the door. Very professional yet friendly staff. I will definitely return next time I'm in Vegas

IsfvMkP78gCsDjLc4RgeXg.text: I've been coming here for many years and it's just as wonderful today as the first time! Always have stellar service & delicious food...especially love when they have piano players!

OXQsGv1-EhupEI3mCtxRSw.text: Loved this place.  Ordered the Baked Rigatoni...Delicioso!  Went in on a Saturday night as a walk in for a first date...did not disappoint.  :)

b4w245deusGN_dP2ydQgMA.text: The garlic bread basket was nice and a promising start to our meal. We had Tortellini Alfredo and Chicken Marsala. The Alfredo sauce was ok, not the best...it lacked a depth of flavor but the tortellini were delicious. The Chicken Marsala was very flavorful but the spaghetti with tomato sauce that was served with it was mediocre and the sauce was a little tangy. The service was really slow, they were slow to refill our drinks, slow to get us the check, slow to pick up the check.

YVyCkTcvb5rp8fTTvG3cOw.text: Always excellent...! The service and the food is great. The atmosphere smells great. I didn't need a reservation and i waited 12 minutes... Not bad... Great date place. San Genero event was in town and Nora's was still busy..! That is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wjUcHxn6LNXIlwYEGGgskQ.text: We ate here last night.  If you get there before 5 your seated right away, after 5 reservations are a must or you will wait a while. The prices are extremely reasonable and the food is excellent.  The service I felt was rushed but there were a lot of people waiting to get seated.  We will definitely be back.

AnSkgDLaUHqPEX6aUoYy-A.text: A Vegas local recommended this place highly and said, "You will have the best Italian in Vegas."  We rolled the dice, since you never know, we ended up with snake eyes.  From the poor service to horrible food, I have no idea why this place has four stars.  Waiter rarely around, other server brought wrong course to our table, no apology a third random server over head my complaint as I was asking for our server to fix the issue and brought us the same salad with additional toppings.  A bus boy dropped plates and drinks where liquid got on me, waiter laughed it off and only checked on me as after thought. Pasta not home made and I am skeptical about the sauces.  Long story short, don't believe the hype, all flash no substance.  A few reviews have said this place isn't good, I am always concerned with those reviews, but in this case it is a fact.  Save your money.

jcFXIh-xwr4-_c6ZiVzLcQ.text: Always great atmosphere, wonderful service and authentic food.  I make sure to go every time I am in Vegas.

gTGustutBnqwn2-wZj6sng.text: I didn't see my MIL and GIL on my birthday so they wanted to take me out to a belated birthday dinner. I have had this bookmarked for quite a while.   We were given a basket of garlic bread while we wait for our order. MM! I am a garlic freak so I was taking the garlic off everyone else's slices since they like it light on garlic. You can also request plain toasted if you don't do garlic.   The BF had cheese ravioli w/ alfredo- the raviolis are fresh made in house and were very good (I took a bite of course, tee hee) and the sauce was thick and had good flavor.   Mom had the lasagna- she's been wanted lasagna for weeks and she was very happy with it here. It had little sausage bites in it instead of just meat sauce and cheese. She's a light eater normally, but she tore into that!   Grandma had spaghetti and meatballs- she liked the meatballs here a lot and they did look quite good.   I had the chicken mt etna- it wasn't bad, but I think I ordered the wrong thing. The individual components were good- chicken with peppers and cheese and balsamic together was nice and chicken was juicy, the onion strings were crisp and the seasoning was great, roasted potatoes good. There was angel hair that was crisp to like a uncooked top ramen consistency which is a bit odd and between all these layers was a bit much. I ate the onion strings and some of the chicken. I can see some people really liking this type of stuff (I ordered it based on the Yelp summary on top of it being mentioned in reviews), but to me it's the classics here that are standouts and can't steer wrong with a solid plate of pasta.  I ended up asking for a side of linguini with vodka sauce. I'm so glad I did because it really changed my dinner. The sauce was superb and close to the vodka sauce at my favorite Italian place in LA I've been going to since I was a kid. I got my bread and wiped that bowl clean! The BF tried some and he is now saying we are going back for some of that!   The quality, taste,portion to price ratio is fantastic here. Most pasta dishes were around $9-11 with specialties in the $14-20 range with a few meat specialties from $22-30. That's like Olive Garden prices and leaps better. Very reasonable compared to a lot of other Italian places in town. $60 +tip for 5 dishes and drinks is not bad at all!   Our server was very attentive, personable and polite throughout. He kept checking in without being obtrusive to dinner conversation, filled drinks half full, had good pacing for boxes and check that we didn't wait for any need. We ended up chatting with him and he's actually a busser who they sometimes let serve. Casey should be a server as that's some seriously great service!  Way better than some of these seasoned jokes around town. He gave me a tiramisu even to top off the  birthday dinner (for those curious- pretty good, heavy on the coffee notes so a dessert for those who love their coffee).   Despite what I ordered originally, this place is great for the classics and service is great. Definitely coming back and sad I haven't tried it sooner.

HScG6TQqVeTFwiJAO6D-7A.text: I was recommended by a friend to eat at this restaurant.   There was quite a few people eating. And place looks rustic.  I wanted to try one of their appetizers, but they ran out.  I was disappointed.  My entree was good, but not great.  I cannot eat anything spicy and they sprinkled it with a hint of red peppers, even though it did not say spicy on their menu.  Certainly pretty average Italian food for me.

cGdUJG9O5iizDtT6ZE1NhA.text: This is easily my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I love that it is a locals restaurant. The bar is a great place to hang out and get some wine before you eat. If you plan on going during dinner time I would recommend getting a reservation first as they are pretty busy.   The food is great and has not yet disappointed me. I usually get  the gnocchi with vodka sauce which is my favorite. The Ossobuco here is also amazing and I highly recommend it.    The service here has always been great even on the busier nights i've been there. The also do take out orders which is awesome when I want great Italian food after work. I just call when I get off and pick it up on the way home. The Pizzas are also supposed to be good but I have yet to try them. I do see a lot of people ordering them for take out when I am there.

mkg1lKuLVHppzsgTaWwkvQ.text: This restaurant is a place our family has frequented many times. We hadn't been there in about 2 years. It has become a lot more casual then it was previously. We had a 6pm reservation, and we were seated around 6:30. The food was very good, nice size portions, and good service. Unfortunately we told them when we made the reservation it was a birthday, and again when we checked in. They did nothing. Yet they were celebrating other birthdays in the restaurant. Extremely disappointing. I like Noras, but it used to be better.

SqwCIYbzrViLRi8MFYQ1Lg.text: Nora's restaurant is always excellent, the antipasto is the best in town.food is always delicious, however not happy they charge if you want a second basket of garlic bread and they do not serve cream for the coffee.

PfgtcYe6KX95wx2thviPnA.text: By far this IS the BEST Italian restaurant just off the strip. Don't let the outside of the place fool you. It looks small and somewhat uninviting. But once in side, great atmosphere. Very clean with cloth tablecloths. Excellent service!  The wait staff are well versed on the dishes. Your water glass never stays empty. Food portions are decent sized but not over the top. Absolutely wonderful. We will definitely be back!

mfbbkmKITv11ZAcCagBpuw.text: We had garlic bread and caesar salad to start. Followed up with Veal Parm and Chicken Erbe Fini. Total bill was $40. Food was good and it's a decent value compared to other Italian joints in town. Although, I didn't feel it was special enough for a repeat visit.

s-uRGDmHOiGj9tL6E7qKNQ.text: I swear, people have the most disgusting palates in Vegas.  I ordered the "Crazy" Alfredo (advertised as a "favorite").  Crazy is right.  Expired chicken, overcooked rubbery shrimp, and it all tasted like it was cooked the previous week, stored, and microwaved for service. My wife ordered spaghetti with meat sauce.  How can you screw that up?  I don't know how you can, but Nora's did.  The sauce was watery and the meat chunks so small it can literally be drunk and not chewed.  Seriously, my wife almost went across the street to Smiths to pick up a bottle of Progresso to put on hers.  I tried this place once about a year ago and figured I'd give it one more chance.  Never again.  This place seriously needs Gordon Ramsay to do his Kitchen Nightmares show.  It screams outdated, lack of standards, and absolutely disgusting food.  There was one semi-redeeming quality - the store bought bread they served was loaded with roasted garlic.  That was pretty decent.

h38D6Z0ClQ2PXNMRWn1zyQ.text: Nora always impresses me !   Wish the place is located somewhere with better parking.Their food is always great and priced right.

kW16rOf7ym91d2VwUdN4VQ.text: Excellent crazy alfredo wife loved chicken parm Trey was great waiter

EA0Uou1pg0tx5L06wxqldA.text: Amazing italian food! I keep coming back to this place, because I can't get enough. The service is great, and never waited long to get a seat. I am a very pleased customer.

db67hSZdhcz2--KNjS6W0Q.text: A friend took me here a couple of months ago, and I loved it! It kind of reminded me of something that would be in New York or San Francisco.  The crowd was very hip, young and fun.  I loved the live Jazz music, it set just the right mood.  I ordered the Caprese Salad, and my friend ordered this dish that had angel hair pasta, shrimp, pine nuts and zucchini.  It was to die for.  I would definitely recommend taking your date to Nora's...something about the food, wine and music could set anyone under a love spell!

5h-dWXcjZj1i3AKiA8BFeQ.text: My brother introduced me to this place...very good food.  Southern Italian from what I understand.  I ordered the Linguine with Clams...very good!  My bro loves the Pasta ala Nora and the Orange Roughy dish.  My dad ordered the Chicken Marsala and he enjoyed it.  We also ordered the Antipasto salad which was yummy, with lots of fresh meat on it.   The service was very good...they were very attentive. From what I understand they used to be smaller and then when they were featured on some show and got more popular they had to add on an extra room to accomodate all their new customers.   I seriously felt like there was a little old Italian lady that cooked our meals for us...so yummy:)  Make sure to make reservations...we went on a Tuesday, made reservations, and we still had to wait a bit!  Oh, and it's located in a shopping center, behind an Arby's!

3d8kf4DbIQJJ_lW5t--_2Q.text: We'd been looking for a mom n pop italian restaurant and this one hits the spot! Yet another classy, yet casual place.  The service was great and the waiters very friendly. The food was delicious as well - for an appetizer, we ordered the bruschetta, which was light and very well done. For the entree, I ordered the Alla Nora and my boyfriend ordered, what I'm assuming was the special for the night as I do not see it on the menu.  The Alla Nora was a wonderful combination of eggplant, cheese, and pasta, baked and topped with herbs. I remember his dish as an amazing pasta dish that had a good amount of vegetables, but what stuck out was the gargonzola that was mixed into the dish and was blended into the sauce.  I had expected this to be too cheesy and creamy, but it was just right.  And how can we not top of an Italian meal with a dessert of Cannoli?  Not only was the presentation beautifully done, but it was delicious.    Price-wise, the restaurant was very reasonably priced and I'm sure I'll be going again in the near future.

fjQu2RL64YwPPBJpneS7Ig.text: great!! have only been here once....you instantly sense the history and tight-knit family that runs the joint...this place is quaint and warm...i saw it on the food network the other day too! i had the shrimp scampi which were HUUUUGE and really really tasty with tons of garlic and linguine!  vegas is the only place (besides tahoe) that i feel has great, fresh seafood for being so far away from the ocean!!  good prices, good service, good vino, good atmosphere definitely worth a visit!!

DQEdFIJqLDFudOXNnfLpKw.text: Not a local but know a few here in town. I love the quaint feel of this place and the food is amazing. Wether sitting at the bar for a meal a table tucked in the corner the service and food are great.

2ExYhqaBbCu-p5jeyunVyg.text: Before last night I would have always given Nora's a 5 star!  Last night something went terribly wrong.  I will go back again with the expectation that it was a BAD night.  I have been going for years.  I ALWAYS got the Baked Ziti until the past year I discovered the Crazy Alfredo.  If I'm going to splurge and have pasta, this is the dish I usually want.  But deciding between the two can be difficult.  Not anymore.  Last night I felt like red sauce so ordered the ziti which I just had in early Jan and they hadn't done THIS to it.  It's $13.95 and they reduced it to about a 1/3 the size.  I think I could have counted the number of macaroni in the (no more than) 3/4 in shallow dish about 5 inches in diameter.  Whaaaaaaaaaat are you doing?!  My companion order the Crazy Alfredo and it looked to be the usual dish/portion.  And he loved it!  You could always count on Nora's to be consistent in the past.  You never had to worry about what you would get but last night was far from the usual.  My ziti was always piping when it hit the table.  Last night I could eat it straight away.  We actually waited quite a while for our food.  After I got mine, I think it was because it had been sitting up on the line for awhile or they found some from the lunch hour to re-heat.  (A side note, Nora's, I was a little perturbed that after I told the busboy twice to leave the remaining bread on the table, that at some point while I was in conversation he came by the table and picked it up.  Trust me that you need to reiterate to your bus staff not to clear a table without ASKING the diner first.)  I will go back for the Crazy Alfredo (until they change that) and my second is now my first rated for Baked Ziti which really sucks because I love the mounds of ricotta on the top.  A highlight for me.  Please fix this situation so I can update my review!

BF5w-xPlDtuvwYkWMN6rGg.text: Fabulous food. I always look forward to eating here when in town!! The garlic bread is the best I have had. Great service and very clean.

dRoDxSziLKbQyybx0aFYHQ.text: The best Antipasto Salad!!! It's best to eat it at the restaurant instead of taking it home. If you take it home, the salad soaks a bit and will not be the same. Since it is a local favorite, be sure to call to reserve your seat. It is always packed.

3bV4vNBqfa93v1LGv04x-Q.text: If you are looking for a light, low cal, healthy option in Italian dining-go elsewhere-you won't find it at Nora's. The food is good in that carb laden, dripping in cheese and sauce way that is absolutely yummy to eat, but requires a double trip to the gym the next day to work off the guilt. Additionally, the portions are large so the overindulgence brings on the required nap afterward. One of the best lemon drop martinis in a long while, however my pizza was very good in flavor, but too heavy in crust and cheese-almost dripping-and while i favor a thicker crust-it was almost like eating a loaf of bread which was too much for my taste. Prices are right, service is prompt, taste is good, just will keep this for a very very occasional if the goal is to eat a bit lighter.

UVz7QKUz32PIA4sYF26FCw.text: Saw the great reviews here, but was disappointed. Meat sauce for my pasta was greasy, salad was very plain, service was fair...bar was very very noisy for a weeknight and you can here it very easily in the dining area. Location is in a grimy strip mall

XFEErGQzvI_Aw3jW5bggFQ.text: Oh, Nora's... A quasi-old Vegas hole in the wall. If you are not there by 5PM, consider yourself screwed. If you ARE there by 5pm, you can enjoy being somewhat screwed by waiting patrons rubbing their chest against your back while you are sitting at the bar, who are also being rubbed inappopriately by the patrons behind them. My party of three and I shared the gnocchi with pesto and the cheese ravioli with vodka sauce. It was ridiculously delicious, since pasta has a tendency to be boring. The house salad was hardly boring and the desserts (yay for my birthday) should be declared illegal by the FDA for being capable of jump-starting a myocardial infarction. We tasted the tiramisu and the chocolate molten cake... I am not a dessert person but these were worth trying. Save your mothers from preying on the waiters/barstaff like starved cougars and leave them at home.

fCugmyAnwdgEYG8f0DpxyQ.text: The 2007 recipient of the LVRJ's Reader's Choice award as the Best Undiscovered Restaurant and has a Zagat rating of 24, 18, 21. norascuisine.com This southern Italian restaurant is very popular and we encountered a long waiting line as we entered at 7PM, but we had secured advance reservations and were promptly seated. We shared a Caesar salad that was on the small side though the menu indicated it would serve 2-3. The salad itself was decent, but the croutons were soft and flavorless. The menu was the same as you would find in any Italian/American restaurant so my wife ordered the eggplant parmesan while I chose meatballs and spaghetti. Both dishes were satisfactory though typically over sauced and below expectations.

dGiNdIX3F2O8oz0n4Npf2Q.text: Honestly the best dinner I had in Vegas considering all the great restaurants in town.  I was in town for business and tired of eating on the strip, so 3 of my colleagues and I got this recommendation from a cocktail waitress at Aria... thanks Thea!  Local spot off the strip, great atmosphere, great service, and even better food.  We had to wait about 45 for a table, but definitely worth it and drinks helped kill the time.    I had the Chicken Marsala... excellent.  Someone else got "Crazy" Alfredo... super good and very popular dish.  Seriously, anything you order there would be good.  I would recommend this place to anyone and can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Excellent job Nora's... keep it up!

XRCtzGFz80bYU4IGvDUkfg.text: My father took me to dinner here tonight while visiting and it was truly a great Italian place! The shrimp scampi pasta was to die for! We also had the steak and arugula bruschetta which neither of us cared for really, way too oily and heavy.  But the dessert was my favorite, the bread pudding, no words can explain the deliciousness of it! Service was really great as well, I can't remember our servers name but he had red hair and such a warm and welcoming attitude and didn't make us feel rushed at all which was nice cause I know we were talking a lot as I don't get to see my dad as much so I truly appreciated his patience and continued happiness towards us throughout the meal. A little loud inside but overall really nice place!

nSfZPahsWJdn5THpGcj9EQ.text: I mean, it's not the best. But it's not the worst either. You can tell they have their customers on lock so I feel like they don't really train their staff to go above and beyond.   Food: I got the crazy alfredo which was pretty good. I liked the elements entailed to it such as the Jalepeno for an extra kick, bell peppers for texture and a hint of sweetness and sausage for a heightened flavor. Still, it wasn't anything impressive that would amount to a total of $20 something per plate. My girlfriend got the pasta with meat sauce but wasn't impressive as her dish mostly had cheese. Quite disappointing to say the least. At the end of the meal, we received a complimentary dessert in celebration of my birthday which was one of the most exceptional tiramisu I've ever tasted.   Service: it was okay. Nothing outstanding but for the type of restaurant they were, I expected a little bit more attention. Our server wasn't at all enthusiastic and made it seem like we were just another customer. Quite disappointing.   Ambiance: beautiful venue as this is their new location. I really felt like this restaurant belonged in summerlin or even the Strip. It was modern with a dash of classic.   Overall: I mean, I wouldn't be in a hurry to visit again. If you're a huge fan of Italian, I do suggest to give them a try but I wasn't too impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigattoni
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

TvfFMFDK9W3bU6L4wGF6AA.text: One of the first restaurants I tried since moving to Vegas and was not disappointed! The food is really good & not overpriced. They had live jazz (I forget which nights they do this) I believe it was a Friday night. The drinks & service were also great, can't wait to go back!

E8kr5TgC5NV6U-IJgl32wg.text: This place was so busy even in lunch time. But the wait was worth was it when my Chicken Milanese came. I love it! Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese 5/5

5usuKURfiAChoapoHCjQvg.text: Haven't been to Nora's since they moved locations so I was super excited to have a date night here. The food was good nothing to complain about. Our server was attentive for the first 5-10 mins and then a large party sat next to us. It was another servers table but his attention turned towards them. Being a server myself I understand having big parties but just because you have big parties with auto gratuity doesn't mean you forget about your other tables

6CJo-Rhva99HIUAqP2lFUA.text: Wanted to make a reservation for my moms birthday and we had a party of 9.. this place will not allow you to make a reservation from 6pm-8pm as they block out those times. Shame on you and I will not go there anymore.

xhU0aH4f8ZeDpQelBs1xFg.text: 9 times out of 10 this place will satisfy your Italian taste buds! May have a wait, however worth the wait!!

1lRnwjPm2tyKUxT0SDi6Xg.text: Absolutely fabulous food and service from Donald!  It's a must if you love Italian food.

QLuovo8s0QQsms0GF7JdOg.text: Beautiful ambience! Authentic Italian cuisine, great portions and even better prices. Can't wait to return. The steak and arugala bruschetta, boneless rib eye, fetuccini carbonara and veal were superb! Portions wete large enough to take home. My only disappointment was this morning I chewed on a few egg shells in my carbonara left overs. Hey, it happens. Will still return. Please note MAKE A RESERVATION. Luckily my husband did, despite it being a Monday night it was packed and there was a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

elLp5H5mNvqOKocRrc5GaQ.text: Food was fine. I noticed the server who took out the garage with his barehand without any gloves also boxed our left over food right after!!!!! No thanks!!

XU_Yg4wl0wfgRXwwtbZ9EA.text: Loved our experience! I made a reservation via opentable for my Fiance's birthday and it was fantastic. We came earlier than our reservation time since I read about some reviews regarding possible wait time. This definitely worked out in our favor since we were seated earlier than expected (thanks Jules!). Our server (Laura? I believe was her name), as well as the rest of the team (bussers and bev. servers) were on point when it came to our drinks being refilled, waiting on food, and removing finished dishes. We were given a table that was away from the crowd and loud noises which gave us more privacy. We'll definitely try the other side of the restaurant next time! As for the food, I loved their bread basket, perfectly seasoned and buttered. My fiance ate his entire dish of wild boar pasta dish (forgot the name), and my linguini with Manila clams was amazing (the dish was a perfect balance of seasoning and clams!). For our dessert, she brought over a complimentary birthday dessert. I didn't know it was going to be a Tiramisu (which I ended up eating because he doesn't like coffee), and we ordered the oreo ice cream dessert to go. Both of them were just the right amount of sweetness to end a great birthday for my boo.  Tipped more than 20% for a job well done, [side note: REMEMBER TO ALWAYS TIP YOUR SERVER(S)]. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2s3WQA1b709aFmGxegB6Iw.text: My wife and I really enjoy this place and the food they serve. While we did like the smaller feel of the older location we are glad they got a bigger place so it's easier to get in. I do like that they still give you a look at the kitchen rather than putting it begins closed doors.  The place was very busy on our last visit. The host and waiter were very apologetic for the wait. The funny thing is, there was no wait. I think maybe they felt like they weren't getting to us quickly enough because they were so busy, but that wasn't the case at all.   We will definitely return as it is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Vegas.

KX6gN2iuXvpWaJN3YLF4uA.text: I was craving spaghetti  for lunch and decided to order pick up from here. I got the spaghetti lunch special with meat sauce which is a little extra for price and added one meatball to it. It was affordable and the spaghetti was packed with flavor! The meat sauce was delicious ! It came with garlic bread and of course that was good. I would definitely come back here to try other dishes for my Italian fix.

5Zvkwzq4HYqEC7d1xI6dWw.text: Nora's is one of those places that is consistently good but somehow never on my radar unless I'm driving by- usually right after eating somewhere else. Luckily, a coworker insisted on dinner here so I finally got a chance to visit since their relocation, which puts their great food and attentive service (especially from Don!) in a suitably beautiful setting.  Started with a round of house salads, fresh with a great house dressing, plus their house garlic bread I raved about on my initial visit (spoiler alert: it's still amazing!). Tried the decadent carbonara, which I'll definitely be back for, but ultimately opted for my old standby, the Alla Nora (baked spaghetti topped with eggplant, meat sauce, and pesto) and was not disappointed. Kicked it up with a third course of chicken marsala and lamb shank, which was a huge, beautiful portion, perfectly cooked.  Might as well go big and have dessert after all that; the panna cotta topped with fresh berries was just sweet enough. I have no idea what witchcraft keeps me from thinking of Nora's when I want old-school carbs, but I'll be making a concentrated effort to visit more often.  NOTE: They seem even busier since moving, if that's even possible, and by 6PM on a weeknight there was a serious wait list. Reservations recommended, or snag a spot at the bar!
