Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken piccata, off menu,  $20, tiny portion

-W_ox8GkB0MP2sfUIPMvyw.text: We had the most exceptional service with Marla and our busboy Matt. Minor mishap was handled perfectly and the food was exceptional. Great experience.

jtyb-Iu4QoB2SEwaBgSO0g.text: First time here today, very excited to try Nora's and was let down. The lasagna was soggy and "pasty" it was not fresh and surely didn't taste good. When talking to the bus boy, and waitress, neither one brought the manager or tried to relieve the situation. Poor quality food paired with low status service, what a shame. Save your money and time.

uOw-b58MShMEBaWxhp8DBg.text: My first time here. I would describe the place as very airy and nice. The staff friendly. Started with Areci (?), which were cheese balls in red sauce, it was delicious. Had their linguini with clams, and I was impressed with the taste and amount of food. Also had their steak sandwich which was really good and cooked to order. I'm not too big on Italian cuisine at times but this place impressed me. Prices were also reasonable. Rest assured, I will be back.

VJBmW6zd5QPapF1aFMIQqg.text: Great experience at this restaurant. I enjoyed the vibe as soon as i walked in. Its a nice restaurant but not stuffy. Its cozy - and not too big, but also has accommodations for small gatherings or private dining as well as large dinners. I saw what appeared to be a private dining room and a large one - I was impressed. The service was excellent, so was the food. We were immediately given the warm garlic bread. O-M-G there is one word that comes to mind delicious ( with a capital D). We got the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer - loved it! The marinara that came with it was definitely tasty. The entrees we decided upon were Spaghetti lunch, the veal manicotti, the eggplant parmesan, and special rigatoni. For dessert we devoured the tiramisu and cannoli.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oer9ycpJnJXtRzLqLWHGUg.text: Highly recommend!  Food was delicious and very well served. My husband and I shared an antipasto salad and a baked rigatoni and an order of muscles and had more than enough.  We started off with some awesome cocktails, old fashioned for him, raspberry blossom for me.  Both were excellent.  Finished with a cappuccino and cannoli which is made in house, delicious!  And of course I cannot go without mentioning the excellent service by our waiter, Sebastiani.  We will most definitely visit again!

72_5-t2wSWEs4_PF1t8qPg.text: Go where the locals dine! And Nora's is where the locals dine...and in droves!!!  Nora's is a legit restaurant that has been serving huge plates of tasty pasta since 1991 ( that's a long time in Vegas land).   They have moved from their original strip mall location to a much larger free standing building. The new location is gorgeous with lovely wood floors , modern light fixtures, outside dinning ( at 105 degrees we opted out of that!), a very lovely large bar.  We did not have reservations and had to wait an hour...but it was worth it. My tip to you on this is to come in after the first rush around 7 and it should be less hectic.  Great appetizers: free garlic bread, wonderful done calamari, mozzarella sticks, a very solid Cesar salad ( somewhat pedestrian but okay).  The menu has something for everyone: great gnocchi, fantastic lasagna ( layered with light al dente  pasta, bechamel cream,  tomato sauce and rich cheese), hearty wild boar  pappardelle, lovely linguini with either shrimp scampi or salmon.....even their classic cheese pizza is pretty darn good.  The meat and fish dishes also looked fantastic although we did not partake.  Nice and extensive wine list ( nothing crazy but good solid pics). Two of us had a Chianti Classico and it was okay not great!  Service was impeccable: polite, efficient, and consistent. All used utensils were replaced with new. Water was filled consistently fast. Waiters checked back frequently to see how things were....and these guys are working lots of busy tables!!!!  Desserts looked great but we were too full.  I highly recommend Nora's for 2-10 people and feel you will have  a wonderful experience away from the strip.  Expect to pay $30 for an appetizer, a pasta dish and maybe a glass of wine....and for me from San Francisco that's a deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seriously this is the kids pizza enough Pizza for three people
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi - linguini, garlic &amp; oil, white wine
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Carcio  - tomato, artichokes, capers, linguini

0DY4y5-649ixSSJ3lyeIHg.text: BLAH. I wish I could give this a no star review. NOT Italian. Nothing fresh, dirty floors. Blahhhh this should be called American with pasta restaurant- ugh hate when a place says its Italian and it's not. I travel to Italy 4x a year .... I think it's safe to say I can understand Italian cooking far past penne with red sauce. Plus any Italian restaurant that's has "Alfredo" is clearly not Italian considering it's an American pasta dish. Booo

CIT-4EijcTrPun8inBcvcA.text: Never had a less than experience at Nora's.  The food is always yummy and consistent. We enjoy going on a Friday or Saturday about 9pm. Sit in the bar and they always have live entertainment. Intimate and enjoyable.

qzmy_zWPaAi4cKVma5Gg5Q.text: Great place to eat. Warning to people that enjoys Italian at chain restaurants. This peace will ruin all those places for you. The food is amazing here. It's always my first choice. I tried a few other well known Italian spots in town that has a reputation and Nora's still beats them out by a long shot. I have been to Nora's at least 40+ times already. Not once have I thought their food was inconsistent. Same great taste every time.  They are very busy so make sure you get reservations. For you guys out there looking to take a girl that likes Italian food, this is the spot. You are welcome.

o00ZKxWdbERuqs3EhuMa3g.text: Maybe with some of these people like Darcy ripping the restaurant up, there won't be such a huge line of people waiting to take their reservation.  I get it, you weren't treated like a superstar as you may have been before they moved, but you even acknowledged how great the food was, that the bartender was fantastic and even comped a round for you, but still give them 2 stars - napkins in the rest room weren't folded as they used to be, seriously, stop being such a snob you're at a busy restaurant with absolutely delicious food for very reasonable prices, best restaurant this side of the strip and finding stupid reasons to mark it down.  Sorry, I don't usually react this way, but this restaurant is my new favorite - moved here in January and have looked around for good food at reasonable prices and this is the one.  They get large parties all of the time and are swamped, all of the time.  So some of the waiters stand at the front, any good restaurant does that so they can overlook all of their tables to see if anyone is looking for help.  Apparently, you got a table that was busier than most, your waiter may have been waiting on one of the large tables and hadn't made their way out to you yet.  If you really think this is a two star restaurant then you definitely won't want to go back their again.  But...if you find yourself back there soon then you should update your review because you know their restaurant is so much better than any others in this area.  I know they're busy, I've waited for my food and service as well, but I'm out to dinner so I realize that's always a possibility.  Rather than having a restaurant that treats its customers like cattle and moves them in and out quickly, here you just sit back and enjoy yourself and the atmosphere and stop all of the phony pretentious attitude - missing a certain je ne sais quoi, come on, you're not at an upscale restaurant that charges a hundred + bill for a spaghetti dinner, if you were they'd have waiters tripping over each other!  Cheesecake Factory, seriously, I've eaten there twice and both times the food wasn't great and the service was ten times crazier then Nora's.  I dare you not to eat here anymore, we'll see how long you last before you try them again!

VHdbgequTobCXXaSS4ez8Q.text: Linguine and clams for me. The pasta was a little bit past al dente and on it's way to overcooked, and the clams too, I don't know, noticeable? Does that even make sense? "Noticeable" as in a little too much of a flavor, which makes you wonder how fresh it is... Also, I'm not used to parmesan cheese on my L&C.   Pasta with arrabbiata sauce for him. "Very bland," he says. He also kept reaching for the crushed red pepper, which should be unnecessary with an arrabbiata sauce.  It had been years since I've been to Nora's. I used to have such fond memories, but so far, nothing can top Parma as #1.

gbIRWQGRUbGIdmh06NgPGQ.text: Wow! Definitely among the best service I've had. But the food. I couldn't stop myself from desert after how Devine the calimari and veal parmesan was prepared. I couldn't wait to finish chewing so I could take another bite. I eventually started choking because I started swallowing whole thinking it would be a good idea.  Cannoli still leaves me speechless. The presentation hand in hand with the taste is more than imaginable. Being originally from Philadelphia and having a large portion of my family being Italian I was under the assumption I knew Italian food well. Don't tell ma but this place is some hidden competition.

nOuij2a8SWysFuEJS3AE3Q.text: Great Lunch Specials @ a good price. Great gourmet meals and special pasta dishes  special combinations .

-d6_dx--sIOliF6GkZ4hiw.text: New location is nice.  Much nicer than the original place however, it is overshadowed by the TERRIBLE service.  They greet you well in coming in but after that, the service took 2 hours to get lunch (and they were not even crowded).   The waiter was non-responsive or attentive and more interested about talking to his/her fellow co-workers.    Lastly, we had to request for our bill half way through the meal since we did not have any more time to waste for lunch and they had to manually take our credit card number down since their POS register was down.    Now I am concerned about credit card fraud.

wK9PPVVCUwm7dl0kkBgRlQ.text: Since my boyfriend and I moved to Vegas we've been in search of a good, decently priced Italian restaurant. After seeing all the amazing reviews for Nora's we decided to give it a shot. We really wanted to like it. But our search continues. We got there and immediately decided we should have scheduled a reservation. We waited almost an hour for a table, which we expected. I'm not complaining about this, it's just a fact. We got our table and ordered our food. And barely saw our server after that. Which would have been fine if the food had been as as good as we were expecting it to be, especially for the price. The complimentary garlic bread we got was okay, but it tasted a lot like the Texas Toast you buy in the freezer section at the grocery store.. My boyfriend ordered the Spaghetti with meatballs and I ordered the Chicken Alfredo. The spaghetti was pretty bland and tasted exactly like the can of Chef Boyardee we all ate as children. The Alfredo would have been okay but there was so much olive oil pooled at the bottom of the dish that it was hard to stomach.  As I said, we really wanted to like it, and if you like it that's great. But personally, I would never eat there again.

0b7w06iM87cL9xx4MFjUBA.text: I have been going to Nora's for over 10 years, I have eaten at most Italian restaurants in Vegas including Ferraro's was close by Nora's in the old days, and Piero's which has the best Osso bucco (I have not Nora's yet) The two are very good also, but Nora's is above them, it is a restaurant for locals, and they know it as it is always packed. I love the Crazy Alfred the best.  If you are in Vegas and want Italian you can not go wrong here.

Cl3NltMEFZKDsCJzSZTLtw.text: I ate lunch in the bar about 3:30 on 9/30/14: house salad, garlic bread, and spaghetti and meatball. The salad and bread were delicious. The spaghetti arrived in a puddle of water and overall, was tasteless.  I was not impressed; I can make better spaghetti. The waiter came across as arrogant, and was not very interested in customer service. Nora's has a good reputation in LV, but will lose it at this rate. Dinner staff is better.

tn_H322bFLRqcBMk8BfiBg.text: Always enjoy our meals at Nora's.  It is a Las Vegas favorite and institution. Lunch is a really good value and a lot quieter.  Place is always crowded and tends to be a bit noisy.  That said both my husband and I enjoy the food and recommend dining there.

o_Mh5yB8fOGn8xNZORtEWg.text: Had a dinner with my husband tonight and really liked the place. They were full of people on Sunday evening. The place was good for drinks too. Will definitely come again!

Q70LfSyPS4Iv_b4YtVfR3Q.text: WOW GREAT FOOD! First timer very impressed. Waitstaff friendly food was good. Prices were more then reasonable. Too bad it took me so long to find this place. I wish it was bigger so we could walk in and eat when ever we wanted . But reservations is the way. You must make them or you will wait. Possibly not eat.

QnG6SrcQfy2CpsEMwxiGfw.text: Great food, very good service and friendly atmosphere. The prices are more than fair.  The bread is amazing as is the spicy seafood pasta. My husband loved the linguine with calm and it was delicious. Definitely give it a try.

Ebuu_P93aLc_QNyZWjfmGw.text: I was excited to try out this place reading all the great reviews but we left kinda feeling like we overpaid for what we got. We came with the 3 kids 2 in highchairs and they seemed pretty family friendly. But I felt they seated us right in the middle of the bar area and with kids there just wasn't much wiggle room and felt out of place with singles and older couples drinking at the bar and trying to enjoy their night out. They did have an entire other side of the restaurant which would've been a better option to seat a party with kids.   As for the food it's was meh. My hubby loves Alfredo so he got the crazy Alfredo which he did eat it all but said there was too much going on with mostly sausage and peppers. I got the lasagna and we didn't finish it, and a white pizza which definitely lacked flavor, it was just crust, spinach, cheese, no fresh herbs or drizzle of olive oil which is common at other pizzerias on their white pizzas. The garlic bread had a ton of garlic, kids didn't like it but hey I like garlic so it was ok. Service was ok nothing worth noting just kinda blah. I also saw 2 other tables that sent food back, not sure if it was the flavor or just the wrong order. So yea I could say it's worth a try on date night but I would stick with OG which might have even been cheaper too.

ylKX5HVovPN9Y3RVj3sXtg.text: Everything was delicious! The cocktails to start were great-I had the something Mist? Bombay sapphire, strawberry, lemon, honey, and rosemary made for a unique and refreshing cocktail. My mother had a peach bellini which was AWESOME as well!   Everything we had for dinner was great-the steak and arugula bruschetta was great, thinly sliced steak on top of toasted garlic bread. For our entrees we had Frutti Di Mare in a spicy red sauce, veal parm, and a chicken dish similar to piccata with artichokes and capers. Everything was fantastic!   The service was great, especially the server assistant who helped me decide on a dish (the chicken carciofi-sp?) and it was delicious without being too overwhelming or heavy, thank you!!!

QnO8KsNNrGhsDIxlyLQRcA.text: Upgrade... Nora's delivers again. Their bar had some great mixologist creations and as always the meat sauce cannot be duplicated. We had a crew of 20 and they really took care of us. This is a Las Vegas classic place to eat home style Italian food. I will always come here when in town.

OvYx9WCsGOn4dVbZzkldXg.text: Excellent meal.  Excellent service from waiter nick and Anthony the busser. Very accommodating and personal.  Outside dining was great with the heaters.   Pizza was delicious.  Sauce was yummy.   Chunks of sweet tomatoes. Definitely will be back!

O5ZzMR-tGcWfJCdMGl0ueQ.text: Easy 5 stars...why?  Not only is it the best Italian I have had, it's also one of the best priced meals that I have enjoyed.  Atmosphere is nice enough for date night, but not too formal, where you have to get dressy or feel like you are going to break the bank.  Service was very friendly, and attentive...couldn't have asked for a better server.  Went with a good bottle of wine that the waitress recommended as well...win!  On to the food!  Garlic bread is good...very garlicy garlic bread lol.  It was good, but not mind blowing like some have said.  But good garlic bread nonetheless.  Started with the shrimp scampi...very good...wish the shrimp was seared a little more, but very tender and  the sauce was yum.  This was more expensive than both of the entress lol.  We went with the lasagna and the ziti...not only were they the best I have had, but they were both about $10 a plate!  Not even Olive Garden is that cheap...and OG is like Mcdonalds compared to the taste explosion that is Noras.  I don't know what they put in this food at Noras, but I am still thinking about it days later.  Portions were generous as well.    And lastly, tiramisu for dessert....very good.  Seems like you can't go wrong here.  I am actually looking forward to visiting again...I'd like to try some more of their seafood options!  If you are craving Italian, don't burn 3 times the amount of money anywhere near the strip...it is worth the drive or cab fare...believe it.

BXtUk0JoDt2rsaZDo0ayZw.text: Great food and fairly priced.  Really busy, even during middle of the week so don't come starving.  My only squawk is that the bartender that served us while we waited for a table was less than friendly.  Things got better once we go to the table and after we sat it was on.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine and clams

_R0lxvSDGJwEfFH14ERlAg.text: Gorgonzola rigatoni with chicken was pretty good a little bit strong on the Gorgonzola that's what my wife had I had the crazy chicken Alfredo stuff it was really good I definitely go back there everything is all a cart

PN9aNFGYAfdoSM-KwyLonQ.text: This would be a 5 Star review if Nora's hadn't removed Wild Boar from the menu when they moved to their new location.  We were told that the new kitchen was not conducive to the preparation of that dish.  I don't understand why they wouldn't be able to prepare this item.  It was amazing, rich, red, meat & sauce over pasta.  The flavor was phenomenal!  PLEASE bring it back, Nora's!  Update:  I was contacted by the manager and told they are still serving Wild Boar.  That's great news, I appreciated the response, and I have adjusted my stars to 5!

ayAuFyQGZZloV0NivwjAvg.text: Great hospitality and amazing Italian cuisine. It's a piece of Italy located in Las Vegas.

P_58NhEbfJvGGh1wLqnjUA.text: Wander off the strip it is well worth the ride. Food was great, service was incredible. Would go back anytime and probably will.

-ZvNoeLAhWmQ7sbWWsPEpg.text: A hidden gem in Las Vegas. I would give a 10.Food, service excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipastas
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizzas!

5Hdl9X3kVXyAm3_OxILKPw.text: This place is a little gem in a strip mall! Don't be fooled by the outside, go inside and you'll be impressed. The food is awesome! Best pizza in town! I love the house salad, as well as the antipasto salad. Try the Gorgonzola ribeye sandwich, it's great!

CSdu8GtcdVBRlhmkJupHgg.text: We were greeted and seated by host right away but in general Service was okay. I would say nothing special about their pizza and a actually it was very salty for my taste.  We also ordered calamari which was delicious but I wont able to say same for their chicken wings.

XQO20zfO4VX1O7t04gv8-w.text: The atmosphere is exciting. The drinks are great. The location is a hole in the wall. The gossip about the place is worthy. The food is absolutely Amazing. We have been coming here for many years and this is the first since I began yelping. I cannot say anything but make a reservation.

pne_9dPIlQUh09aI9uGNAA.text: I've only been to their new location once, but have been to their old one a couple times. I went for lunch with my boyfriend & after hearing such great reviews on the place we were excited to try it. Our waiter was very friendly & made some recommendations. We started off with the pork belly appetizer & he ordered the crazy alfredo & i the chicken piccata. We waited what seemed like a long time for the pork belly, then our server let us know the kitchen had messed up on it & was remaking it. When it came out, it was good though. Then we the food runner gave us our plates, my boyfriend had visual mushrooms in his dish, after he had specifically asked for no mushrooms to be on there. My dish was not even the one I ordered. The woman apologized & took them both back. When she returned everything was right. Our server asked what went wrong, but didn't seem to apologetic. Both dishes were delicious. I'll definitely be back to try more. My boyfriend agreed. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because 3 out of 3 dishes needed to be remade & nothing was taken off the bill. If even just a glass of wine or our appetizer was taken off it would have made it obvious that they valued our time and our satisfaction & wanted to ensure we came back. A place like Nora's seems like they would care about guests return

TDV4WO5LbyGGiTxXkPQ_dw.text: This place was recommended to us by a local and it did not disappoint. Excellant ambiance and food. Don't miss this place!

qvetF8CfSUDFSPB6lhkFQA.text: Go to Nora's.  You won't be disappointed.  You'll love the garlic bread and anything you order off the menu!

sjYKls_clM4QCDL0-hNy2w.text: My husband and I ate here last week it was my first time. The service was great and the garlic bread was very tasty. I ordered chicken Francese and it was very delicious. He got the pasta alla Nora. My chicken dish came with a side of spaghetti and the sauce was watery and there wasn't enough for all the noodles. And that could be just a preference thing but the sauce was definitely watery. I think maybe the noodles weren't drained well before they put the sauce on. But we will definitely be back!!!

PdyfYsJu_8AhXY7KJGOhMQ.text: Oh Nora's. You have long been my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. That was until today. I made an online reservation on March 20 for March 30 at 5:45pm. I called today, March 30, to see if I could change the time. I was told by the snarky hostess that I did not have a reservation. I was also told that I made it for a different day even though I have the email record of my reservation. I hung up to check my email, called the restaurant back, and got the manager. He found the reservation with no problem and confirmed that the time could not be changed. At this point I was a bit put out by the hostess's attitude and we decided to go somewhere else. I called back to cancel the reservation and got to talk to Miss Snarky once again. She was just as snarky as she was before but even more so. Should couldn't find the reservation once again, but finally did using my last name (she never asked me my last name when I called the first time). I thanked her very forcefully for her excellent customer service. Needless to say, you have lost our business for good now.

reiq0pBGuvIezyl70zrWeg.text: Upon reading my previous review, I was wrong. 4 stars isn't a high enough rating. 5 stars all the way. My favorite meal in Las Vegas, amazing seafood/pasta, great garlic bread, friendly service. I only wish they have shuttles to/from the strip, for those occasions when you don't have a rental car.   Definitely eat here.

oxVw98VXRW09Ri6-484obw.text: Excellent food great service will definitely recommend it to friends I will bring my guest from out of town here

VS-H5B1VYwj3ms5z7Enhhg.text: We love this restaurant! Great atmosphere and the best mom and pop food in Las Vegas. Some food is better than most you really should ask your waiter. Great pricing and great music on Fri & Sat evenings. The staff is O-K, not much to brag about. They just aren't overly friendly like most fun restaurants. They basically seat you, take your order and bring your food. But the food is worth it!!! Their chicken cacciatore is to die for. I have them replace the tomatoes with the sun dried and it is even better!!!

YLQzYs_IReMjOzwWu1FiMA.text: Favorite spot in Vegas for Italian food. Been coming here for over 20 years now. It's a great date spot or if you just want to have a family dinner. I order take out all the time. Love the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo it's by far my favorite dish. Staff is always polite and knowledgable.

vCsweV-lgGCD0PzB3hgyaw.text: Thanks to Yelp, found this wonderful restaurant. A must try when in Vegas! Freshly made pasta. So so good

3CaV8SEE1ngnx7FHsMPyLg.text: I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken.  I had it to go. The girl that took my order was very friendly. I picked up my food, it was ready as promised. It smelled good but the real test is in the taste.  I would give it an EXCELLENT! Next time I will ask for more sauce. This place is a MUST revisit! Hey, I know Italian food... I'm from Brooklyn! Lol

eucejT6u2NGPVAXoblpMhw.text: I just had the Melrose (linguine pesto with shrimp) excellent dinner here as always! And such friendly classy service.

VDTgu4AvW16vvNClwAGSRA.text: This Italian restaurant is off the strip in a small strip mall. What a great find! We ordered the Chef's Special (amazing dish with baked eggplant and the best seasonings; this was the best of the dishes); Chicken with fresh (I mean fresh cut/peeled artichokes), and the classic, deliciously made lasagne.  We had no reservations; the place was packed and we were still seated within 15-minutes. Efficient! Our server, Don, was excellent, he did everything right.

5RFJEP9OrN0crfN7ruYdrA.text: Amazing food, amazing service. This is one of the few Italian restaurants I will take my friends to. It's a hidden gem. I do recommend making a reservation ahead of time, just in case it's busy since I've always seen the place packed whether it's a week night or weekend. Personal fave is the Tortellini Alfredo with chicken. My family loves the Crazy Alfredo and traditional dishes like the Marsala, too.

hBXTJJWYLRye5KnGjN8Dcw.text: I had a very yummy pizza at Nora's tonight.  The crust was crisp and flaky.  The toppings were perfect with just the right amount of red sauce.  I got pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers, and onions on the pizza. All the toppings were solid.  They also gave me a complimentary basket of garlic bread, which was topped with actual minced garlic!  Very big fan!  Was reasonably priced at around 15 dollars for my 12 inch pizza!  Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary garlic bread at Nora&#39;s! Notice the real garlic!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 inch 4 topping pizza at Nora&#39;s for around 15 bucks!  Awesome crust and toppings!

L0FJJKJ73Z2_LBegulrv5w.text: Originally from NYC and living now in Henderson, I had a difficult time finding  "REAL ITALIAN FOOD"! Nora's reminds of back home where you have delicious Mom & Pop Italian restaurants. You can keep all the famous chef's trying to be Italian restaurants on the strip. Nora's is the best you'll get in this town.  I could smell the wonderful aromas as I write this. YUM!

KV2nUAhmMqquhlGIhW76wA.text: I went here for lunch and dinner within the same week. Food is delicious and service is impeccable. I really love the new location. I go to Carmine's usually but now I don't have to go the strip for clam linguine!!! Thank you!!

FoNoUQXXuV4LOjJ2PPbpNg.text: My boyfriend found this place on Yelp - we were looking for places a little further from the strip and less touristy. (Even though we ourselves were tourists, go figure!)   Made reservations and got there early so we could check out the bar for a pre-dinner martini.    The stoli lemon drop martini I got was in the top 5 lemon drops I have ever had (and this is coming from someone who has spent thirty minutes making a 'perfect' lemon drop martini for myself on more than one occasion).   The lemon slice they had in there was actually candied/seared  and I think that (along with the freshly hand-squeezed lemon juice) is what made it so delicious.   So they'd already won me over before we even got to our table.    The bartenders were courteous and prompt and humored us by taking our photo (twice because I looked fat in the first one haha).  For starters we ordered the calamari appetizer and caesar salad.  They also brought us a complimentary basket of garlic bread - which was delicious!  Lots of butter so it's gooey in the middle and crispy on the edges, just how i love it.   The salad was good solid standard caesar - nothing over the top or unique but very enjoyable.  It also came with more of the yummy garlic bread cut into crouton sized pieces on top - bonus!  The calamari was good - nice and crisp, not too greasy, and was a generous portion.  The dipping sauce they served with it (a caper infused marinara according to our server) is what makes this dish stand out.  It was NOM.    The wine selection was also pretty nice and the server did a great job of recommending pairings. We ended up with the La Giaretta Cab Franc which paired very well as it was able to hold up to the bold italian flavors we were eating.  Entrees:  I got the crazy alfredo, and it was as delicious as the portion was huge.  If you're a shrimp lover you may want to ask for extra shrimp because my serving only came with two.  That didn't bother me though because I feel like the sausage and sun dried tomatoes were the True stars of that dish and I actually felt like the shrimp didn't need to be there. (Borderline sacrilege but True!)   The sauce seems like  an alfredo with some marsala sauce mixed in... lending it a beautiful golden color and sending the flavor through the roof.     I highly recommend this dish.   The boyfriend wasn't as pleased with his, unfortunately.  The server told us the special was veal chop parmesan but we only heard 'veal chop' and envisioned something a little more pure and refined... so when we got a breaded cut of veal covered in red sauce and cheese we were a little disappointed.  Miscommunication aside, it was "good" and enjoyable but not great or anything to write home about.  I don't know about anyone else, but for me veal is such a rare, guilty pleasure that when I do eat it, I expect it to be damn good and also expect the chefs preparing it to treat it with due respect.  Unfortunately I don't feel this did justice to it.    Boyfriend says he was also shocked to see that the veal chop was $34 when we got the bill.  Completely out of line with the prices of the standard entrees printed in the menu which range from $9 to $22.   Service during the dinner had its highs and lows.  Our server for the most part was friendly, nice, easy to talk to, and gave great wine and desert wine pairing recommendations.   There was a rather long delay between our salad course and entree course.  The server explained there was some confusion in the kitchen.... yada yada he apologized and told us he'd be happy to give us a free dessert.   We were fine with that, not a huge deal as we had eaten something already and were enjoying the wine and the music.   But then there was the awkward moment (as I'm browsing the dessert menu looking at wines) when he snatched the menu out of my hand and set a piece of cheesecake in front of me telling me he'll save me the trouble, this is the best dessert they have.  This made me feel a little awkward as though he thought I was trying to take advantage of the situation and order something super expensive or something, which I wasn't.   Well, neither of us usually eat dessert so we accepted the cheesecake with thanks but without much enthusiasm and proceeded to get the menu back so we could order some dessert wine.  The wine he recommended me (to pair with the cheesecake) did in fact pair so well with the cheesecake that I ended up eating almost the entire piece, of which I had initially planned to take a few polite bites and leave it at that.      So all in all, despite the few hiccups, it was a very pleasant experience.  We had a great time and came away satisfied.  Our entrees were huge enough for us to share AND take home an abundance of left overs.   We'll be back next time we're in Vegas for sure and will definitely recommend to our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST LEMONDROP MARTINI EVER!  (Notice that the lemon slice is candied?)  YUM!  I&#39;m sure the Manhattan was good too.  :P
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pairing. Nice and full bodied which held up well to the bold Italian flavors.  Maybe a bit bitter for drinking on its own.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our half-destroyed appetizer and salad course...  Caesar was good, calamari was perfectly crispy, Garlic Bread = NOM

MJAa07YgPqIgVr_4SXxIuA.text: Nice, went here yesterday, my wife got the Crazy Alfredo and loved it.  Quiet, comfortable, good service!  Thank you!  I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. The people are great, fast service, excellent food, OK, this is Las Vegas and its supposed to be this way!  Too bad many other restaurants don't get it.  So, all you restaurant owners that want to see how its done RIGHT, check this place out.

TI4lfFnQaRreVH-ba9QADQ.text: Their lasagna is good. The bread sticks they give you are the best in Vegas. The house salad is  tangy and in a nice vinaigrette with mozzarella cheese. Nice cozy atmosphere and nice waiters. I'll be back. This place is always packed so you should make a reservation.

S6BzEv3Ku1IoeaxhxnHmIw.text: I met a friend, a Vegas local, at Nora's per her suggestion. It's very close to the Gold Coast where I usually stay (I'm a bingo addict) and away from all the Strip madness. The atmosphere is still great even if the neighborhood isn't all that nice.   The food is pretty good. Not the most fantastic stuff I've ever had, but I've enjoyed every dish I've had there. It's definitely better than Fiamma in MGM and about half the price. Vodka penne has been my favorite so far.   What really stands out are the cocktails. They have some interesting house cocktails on the menu that were really delicious. I have a decent knowledge of liquors thanks to my cocktail-enthusiast husband, but Nora's had a few things I've never heard of that were fun to try. I loved their Pimm's Cup --so refreshing during summer in the desert.  I just realized I've never had dessert here. Gotta go back on my next visit!

V-GS0t9Yo3-49W2zOdZLVw.text: This place has a nice vibe and feel to it. Garlic bread was amazing, super garlicky just how I like it. We also had the steak and arugula bruschetta and that was really delicious also.   I ordered the linguine and clam as my entree and this is where I was a bit disappointed. The sauce was bland and not garlicky enough for me and had some gritty stuff in the sauce.  All in all i would like to give this place another try.  Oh and free sangria with a checkin isnt all that bad.

xdoo9-iKXm_mBh0oGuAwrw.text: Food is good. Ordered the steak and arugula bruschetta to start and the taste was pretty bland, so skip that. For main course I got the linguine with red clam sauce, which was ok. Not enough clam taste, nor was it spicy enough. Friend got the chicken marsala, which was good. Maybe a little to sweet, but that's just my personal preference. Good service from Travis. He looked tired, but was very polite and always checked to make sure we were ok. Will definitely come back to try other dishes.

j49YyTE1SMnsdZL_nefqyA.text: This place has great food!  the pizza is the best in Las Vegas.  I took the family here last night after hearing multiple times how good the food is.  All I can say is if you have not tried this place you are missing out.

L9OMBOuu-6YlUmVGGakVGQ.text: Absolutely fantastic atmosphere, food, and service.  My boyfriend and I attempted to make a reservation, but we were advised that they were fully booked.  We decided to head in anyways and try our luck. They said it would be a 30-45 min wait.  It definitely didn't take as long as anticipated or maybe it did, but we found a seat at the bar and had some wonderful cocktails at the bar with a very intuitive bartender with glasses. We were informed that our table was ready in no time. It was a great evening the whole way through our meal. Our waiter informed us that it was his first evening serving and you would have never known. The service was impeccable and the food was phenomenal. I am Italian and I felt as though I was back at my grandmother's house having an authentic Italian meal. We had the calamari, chicken milanese, and gnocchi in red sauce with meatballs. DELICIOUS!  I would recommend this place to any and everyone!!! buon cibo e mangiare :)

YeLBVqQOp_Uuhwqfvk3xVw.text: I've been to Nora's years ago and it was ok, but my dining experience last night was perhaps the worst restaurant experience I've had in a LONG time.   Quick note about the ambiance. This location has WAAAAY too many tables crammed in. It's not intimate at all. It was loud and crowded. I had to shout to speak across the small table. This was an immediate turn off to me. They've clearly packed in as many tables as possible to maximize the number of guests that they can seat, however, the sacrifice is poor service and poor atmosphere.  Yesterday was my wife's birthday and we made reservations at 6:30pm. Her parents and her arrived at the restaurant on time and I arrived about 25 minutes later. They had already placed their order and there were some appetizers on the table when I got there. I have to say that the salad dressing had way too much vinegar in it for my taste. The calamari was good. The waiter came by to take my order. I ordered the rib-eye steak medium-well and substituted the fries for veggies. Nearly an hour later my steak comes out burnt to a crisp. I took one bite and flagged the waiter down to tell him that it was not edible. He takes it back and tells me that that's how they make a medium-well steak. I told him.."ok..make it medium-rare because I don't want a burnt piece of meat." I wait another 30 minutes for a new steak to come out. This replacement was much better but still burnt around the edges. It was odd to me because it had even thickness all around but the outside ring was way more done (brown) than the center (bleeding). I'm thinking perhaps this was frozen and not properly thawed prior to being cooked. So I ate the $30 steak and was not very impressed because it had almost no taste and I was not offered any sauce to compliment it. Also, the "veggies" that I got were literally a small cup with some poor excuse for broccoli, sauteed tomatoes, and mushrooms. At this point my wife and her parents have been done with their food and it's already in boxes. They ordered a couple of pasta dishes and they seemed pleased with the food but did not rave about it. We decide to get a couple desserts (canolli and cheesecake) and a couple of cappuccinos. The cappuccinos came out in about 5 minutes alone. We didn't want them to get cold, so we drank them. The cappuccinos were actually VERY good. I'm sure they have a fancy espresso machine in the back. Then about 15 minutes later the desserts came out. While they tasted good, it would've been a much better experience if I would've gotten my cappuccino with my dessert. Overall I was EXTREMELY disappointed with entire dining experience. My family and I will be avoiding Nora's in the future as a result of this experience. In Las Vegas there is so much competition for Italian food and this experience really turned me off to this place.  Edited to add that I would've liked it if the manager on duty would've stopped by to ask about our service because I would've given them an earful. My wife was against me going to find the manager myself to give feedback because it was her birthday dinner and she just wanted to leave.

YwENAC5dGbsUQEitdt3xaQ.text: This is a solid, neighborhood restaurant to visit if you are in the mood for some Italian food and great cokctails. I dare say that of all the local restaurants in town, this received the highest amount of locals. Othe rplaces in town are starting to attract tourists, but here it is guaranteed that 99% of the clientele is local. I like that. You can sit at the bar and have an amazing cocktail and chat up some of the regulars. When I go I usually order the clover club. They really have an amazing cocktail program, I highly suggesthaving a pre-dinner cocktail at the bar. The only thing I dislike is tha they have tv's at the bar, but othe rthan that a good time is guaranteed. Plus  in the evenings they have live music, which is nice.  I recommend coming here for a leisurely dinner. You start off the meal with a basket of garlic bread, super garlicky and super good. The calamari and arancini are both excellent appetizers. All os the pastas here are great. I have tried most of them, the pesto, primavera, lasagna, etc. My favorite is the pasta alla nora, which is pasta baked with an eggplant, pesto and meat sauce. OMG it is delish! I he tried their pizza once and I wasn't convinced. Stick to pastas and you will be happy.  No dinner here is complete without cannoli. I recommed you order it with pistachios only, rather than the chocolate chips which are not very good.   Oh, bonus if you check in on Yelp. You get a free glass of the house wine. Score!

VBLUXEN4nTQdjGR1G8NcZg.text: We came here for like 5 times before everything was awesome!. BUT las night we ate there 5 ppl and we ALL feeling sick and THROWING UP  all night long, we will probably go to UMC but you need to be carful from this place!! Maybe it's time for the health department to check this place!

UvHLjS4J5IYNsCNYw-g9LQ.text: Dined at Nora's tonight, recently moved within a few blocks of it. I knew it was popular so a few minutes wait for a seat at the bar didn't bother me. I was dining alone, Michelle was pleasant and attentive. Had two glasses of a Sauvignon Blanc which I felt was just about right for portion size and price. My (smaller) size Caesar Salad could have been a little bigger, and I like larger croutons than what they serve. However the extra taste of anchovy in the dressing was a welcomed treat. Too many Italian restaurants these days seem apprehensive to add a little of the salty goodness. The initial basket of garlic bread was too soft, and more of a "butter sponge," would have preferred some crispiness in it. I ordered the Linguini with white clams. Michelle paced the meal just right, it was served very hot, thank you! Pasta was a perfect al dente, sauce was very enjoyable with a nice balance of garlic, herbs, and butter. I requested a few slices of an alternate bread to finish the bottom of my bowl. A nice hot french style bread was brought and I preferred it way over the first serving. Did not partake of dessert, I rarely do after an Italian meal.    So glad to have this kind of quality restaurant in my neighborhood, don't have to drive, and park, at the Strip for a great meal. Plus I appreciate the neighborhood prices. Very lively atmosphere! Happy people all around and music at the right volume. I'll be back!

7eV3Wsclv5Lwncwo0UuhAg.text: This is by far the best Italian food in Vegas. They have the best selection and a great atmosphere. You can't go wrong when you eat here.

of-2puTBCBcyk1cb64YqrQ.text: OK, so I have this little problem: When I go to Nora's I obsess over the last meal and ALWAYS end up here AGAIN within 2-3 days for another round!  We bring out-of-town guests here and they love the ambiance and the food.  We always sit in the bar area and I never get a bad look when I'm there in jeans and sweatshirt (yes, sometimes when your tummy is yelling for Nora's you just go!)  Our favorites: 1. Antipasto Salad *Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes, topped with ham, provolone, and salame, in our homemade Italian dressing. -FOR REALLLLL.  Little pinwheels of meat and chesse?!  OMG-YUM! 2. Caesar Salad *Romaine Lettuce, topped with Italian croutons and Nora's own Caesar's dressing. -Just tastes better than your normal Caesar.  My husband swears by this one! 3. Cheese Ravioli w/ Vodka Sauce *Might sound plain, but this is the only entree I've ever gotten and its DELICIOUS! 4. Penne w/ Arrabiata sauce & sausage. *Husband LOVES this one.  The arrabiata sauce is fabulous- not too spicy, but more flavor then your regular red sauce.  They make their sausage in-house!  I'm hoping to one day venture out of the "ravioli box" and try one their pizza's or maybe some seafood?  But I love what get every time, that it's so hard to try something different!  They bring out yummy garlic bread (on the house) but the next round is $1.50.  NOTE: Make reservations on SATURDAY!!!  They get crazy busy, even at 5:00pm!  They have GREAT takeout (especially for lunch!)

FxCfqwj7JB4klu1ImFD78A.text: I am amazed that this little gem is in Las Vegas! We have come a long way from the typical, run of the mill, chain food restaurant. The restaurant is beautifully decorated, well lit and excellent for a private event, a date or a nice night out with friends or family. The exposed brick is breathtaking.We were seated right away. The waiter was very friendly and took special care to provide the most excellent service we have had in years.y husband and I agreed that of all the places we have tried in our four years of marriage, he was one of the two waiters that provided the most excellent customer service. Our busboy was also very friendly and between the both of them, our drinks were never empty and our plates were promptly provided. We ordered the calamari, which our waiter recommended we have with a spicy sauce..delicious. The kitchen worked hard to get our meal out fast, so fast in fact that it was pipping  hot when we received it. You can tell it was not just sitting around waiting on someone to notice it was ready like at most restaurants. The shrimp melrose was fragrant, creamy and perfectly cooked. A little in the more oily side with the pesto but I loved it! The spaghetti with meatballs my daughter ordered were delicious and my husbands fettuccine alfredo was so creamy and tasty! I highly recommend this place. All in all, with our appetizer, three meals, a few drinks and a to die for cheesecake, we spent about $100.00 not bad for a three course meal for three. We will certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Melrose...beautiful plating, delicious dish! Recommend.

hmHXCVmjHhayMmL1Pyr5Yw.text: I was there with my wife and a few friends on Saturday 4/22  Reservation was for 4:30pm and we were promptly seated by the very nice host. My first impression: The restaurant's decorative was warm and inviting. Just beautiful! After the "free" garlic bread, we ordered drinks and Cesare salad for everyone (5 adults). The salad was excellent. The garlic bread was so and so. I then ordered the veal chop with spaghetti on the side. My wife, the Crazy shrimp Alfredo. A pepperoni pizza for the kids(2). But anyway, I think, no, I am sure, this Italian restaurant is over-rated! My veal chop was super salty and I mean "salty" and so was my wife's Alfredo. These dinners aren't inexpensive by any means and they totally blew it. There was nothing special about this place, except for the nice looking layouts and nice atmosphere. I am not going to speak for my friends here. Oh well, maybe we were paying for just "being there". My friends told me to let the host know of my disappointment. But, nahhh!!! I just won't be back, even for free. 2 Stars are generous! But 5 Stars for the nice looking restaurant! Just for your info., I've been to a lot of nice Italian restaurants here in Vegas and elsewhere. So, I am no stranger to Italian foods. But this place was just...very average at best and way below average if you factor in their prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @Nora&#39;s

ioxSHypR85J3foT48qS_-Q.text: LOVE the new building and the food is ALWAYS wonderful. A couple of suggestions: invest in black napkins (white rubs off on dark clothing). Get your electrician to put a dimmer on the overhead lighting in the room w/the bar. It's too bright for the amazing atmosphere you have created. Really enjoy Nora's and wouldn't change a thing on their menu. It is always an enjoyable evening with friends. Will you bring back the live music?

60jqELY0DVC5WBb61QDQ2Q.text: We have been eating at Nora's since we moved to Las Vegas in 2005.  The old location was very cozy feeling.  The new location (just a few blocks away) is a more modern, trendy type place.  Our first visit to the new location was disappointing.  The noise level was just awful.  It was impossible to carry on a conversation.  They have since added things to muffle the noise and it's much better.  I think they still need to work on that, but it's better. As for the food.....Back in 2005 I tried Chicken Erbe Fini....(not sure of the spelling).  It's chicken, cooked in a ton of garlic and it was served in a bowl with their spaghetti.  I'm not a huge fan of chicken, but this was delicious.  At some point it was taken off the menu and I was now going to have to find something else to eat.  The server told me that I could still order it, the chef would still make it.   Last night we had dinner there with family and when I ordered my Chicken, the server said....ahhh, you must have been coming here for a while......it's been off the menu for at least 4 years.....not to worry.....we will still make it for you...and I was a happy diner!!! Thinking back over the years, whenever we have out of town company, we ALWAYS take them to Nora's.....and some of our friends ask if we can go there again when they come for another visit.  I can also say that of all the different people and food choices, we have NEVER had a bad meal.   I do have one little issue.  We had dinner there last night.  We always order the small house salad, no onions to share.  The lettuce last night tasted and even looked different.  It was much thicker and had a little different taste than the usual Romaine lettuce.  Our server checked and they said it was the same.....I don't know about that.    We all just wish we had more self-control when that darned garlic bread comes to the table.....YUM!

3TU9KsNvckoJN6jDT6mJiA.text: Nora's is my favorite restaurant.  I enjoy the ambiance, food, staff & service.  Every time I dine at Nora's I have a pleasing experience. My favorite dish is the lasagna- seriously the best lasagna I have ever had.  I also recommend the berry explosive cocktail- delicious.  The prices are reasonable and I find the location quirky and interesting.  I'd be lying if I said I wasn't nervous about them moving to a new location.  I'd also be lying however if I said I wasn't going to still patronize them.  They have a customer for life in me.  I highly recommend Nora's for all of your Italian favorites, date nights & special meals you want to share with special people.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna- my love
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Explosive Cocktail- the real deal here

Xb222BGhzq_gFXLasP9uEg.text: I m pretty confident I have been to a lot of good Italian restaurants in the past and I m so glad I found this one in Vegas. I will give 4.5 stars but well I can't. Tho it's a very nice atmosphere for dining with friends family or couples! Good service wonderful food I will say. Really love the lemon calms, almost the best I ever had, also pasta are yummy!! Only one thing is I don't think I really enjoy the entree of Italian restaurant, not only this one but most of the Italian I have been to... seems they just not really know how to cook steak... anyway definitely a to go place for me when I m craving Italian food. Make sure u make reservation as they are always packed.

bfMZHBByFChGb4PXHc6Imw.text: Went there the first time and food was pretty good and service was average.  Tried to go back, they told me to call ahead next time, 45 minute wait.  So next time I called ahead and they told me 1st come 1st serve.  So I go down and they tell 30 minute wait.  Offered for me to sit at the bar when they had several tables open.  Maybe I didn't look like a "Nora's customer".  Not going back again.

4emlXB9VropB8wl-NzH7aQ.text: Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! Eggplant Parmesan is great! Spinach pizza is awesome! Beautiful new location will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply delicious! Got a try! Beautiful new location will be back for sure.

vzUjjKISZ39sPsiiWuuhaA.text: Not a good night for these guys, usually much better experience.  Ordered for pick up.  Pasta fagioli had no pasta in it, wish I was kidding.  Pool of grease from the chicken wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grease overload from chicken wings.

Pjx-RyTjqV-meCf-YvUK2A.text: We came to find Nora's Cuisine through Yelp and the excellent reviews.  While the strip shopping center location is so-so, you forget about it once you're inside.  This place reminds you of your favorite local spot - a great diversion from the strip.  It's well decorated and the right side of the restaurant has an impressive bar and even live music.     Service was very efficient.  Everything was great, from ordering, getting our food, checking on us to having left overs boxed up.    The food is wonderful.  During two separate visits, we've tried the Veal Chop Parmesan, Shrimp Scampi, Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken and Baked Rigatoni - all portions were large and every dish was outstanding. The only small nit was that while the Shrimp were tasty and perfectly cooked, the sauce seemed to be missing something.    We will definitely return the next time we visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Rigatoni

yDjtGZHPgnSkH0JTHtl-9A.text: OMG!! Amazing amazing. The salmon picatta is literally to die for!! I havent stopped thinking about it since it hit my taste buds! Our server was awesome and we had a really good anniversary dinner!!

bE18k_bPyIJXLcdSeC_boQ.text: Every time I come to Vegas, I MUST have dinner here at least one night.  It helps if you call ahead of time and make a reservation

56WFuYtPyzCPIoFPURMujw.text: Fantastic!! Good size portions, even as a lunch entree. Nora's maintains high quality any day of the week. A treat for sure.

o6TTa4t611bjfAAc2GFVcQ.text: I met my friend Rachel and her hubs here for dinner on 12/20/15. I made a reservation for 4 people at 6:30 and we arrived right on time. Unfortunately for us, they made us wait for a bigger table because Rachel brought her son. I didn't think that it was necessary to make a reservation for 5 people because he's a toddler and sits in a high chair, but whatevs. We had to wait an additional 15-20 minutes to be seated because of this, so by the time we sat down I was hangry.   Our server was nice, but service was slow the whole time. We ordered drinks and then ordered our food. We didn't receive appetizers, salads or bread for *at least* 30 minutes. The bread was good, super garlicky and buttery. The salad was yummy, and I enjoyed the house Italian that came on top. Finally after what seemed like forever, our main courses came. I had the chicken parmesan with spaghetti alfredo, and my boyfriend had the baked rigatoni special and a side of meatballs. The baked rigatoni and the rigatoni special are separate entrees. The rigatoni special has meat and the baked rigatoni does not, but he asked if he could have both put together and they accommodated him. It looked so cheesy and delicious, but I was too busy enjoying my delicious cheesy chicken parm to even ask for a bite. He said it was amazing. The meatballs I tried and they were good, but a little cold on the inside. We all sat in silence for a good 15 minutes eating. We all agreed that it was a delicious meal and no one had any complaints.  Even after all that food, Rachel and I ordered the chocolate lava cake for dessert, because YOLO. The cake has to be ordered when you order your entrees, because they are made to order. This cake was nothing short of delicious. It came hot out of the oven, garnished with pistachio crumbs and a sweet vanilla sauce. When I dug into the cake, I got a spoonful of hot, creamy chocolate and it was divine. This cake was the perfect end cap to wonderful dinner with wonderful frands.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the cake. Noms
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate lava cake
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmesan

SL3Jo3ZbZ4ELyaBrGQVTwQ.text: Rushed to make kitchen close. Restaurant and bar are still full. Plenty of tickets working in the open kitchen. Sat at bar 9:56. Tried to get dinner menus from bartender. A languid tender finally hands us a cocktail menu. We ask for dinner. 3 minutes later after interrupting her digging through her purse behind POS we get an insincere "Ohhh, sorry the kitchen closes at 10." Last night they just left the phone off the hook b/c they were slammed. What's the point of locals' joints if you get treated like a meaningless outsider? The seating's great, but the lights are way too bright & cold. It's a reflection of the staffitude here. The new Nora'a could care less about hospitality; Therefore I can care less about it. Better off 10 mins. away eating proper Italian at a Batali joint or something...

npAJIzmfihchsoXyIlJiwQ.text: Recommended by a local.  Amazing food, great service! It's nice to get a little bit off the strip and enjoy a great meal that isn't extraordinarily expensive like every restaurant inside all the casinos.

Mv8Jd2ld41tRqFkiIniCzg.text: We have been going to Nora's at the old location for approximately 15 years. The food and service has always been very good. They have moved to a new location. The new building is very Italian in design with lots of parking. We were served our appetizer and salad quickly and then waited well over a half an hour for our main course. I ordered linguini with clam sauce and it was so salty, I was unable to eat any of it. My partner's chicken Parmesan was also very salty and he only ate 1/2. It took our server another 30 minutes to stop by to see how our meal was. We immediately asked for the check and expressed out disappointment in their service and quality of the inedible meal. Never to return

mneIdTV_2nRxvFc5b0TXdg.text: The food was good, nice atmosphere and a very popular place.  I would tell friends about and I would return to try something else on the menu.

90A-xyAt0rym-WB8LpiUaw.text: The new place is gorgeous , we had a big party and I tried several things . I really wasn't super excited about what I tasted , ambience is great , but food wasn't as good as I expected ?? I had cesar salad was ok , calamari was really good , antipasto salad was tasteless . Several other people ordered more main dishes and said they were ok , I would possibly go back again and order something different ....

8BRtV_XAvm6EcbGi3JqUTQ.text: YAAAAAAAASS!! I've been coming here for years. Probably since 2010? or prior. I love the atmosphere in this place, very cozy and romantic. My only compliant is the wait time is kind of LONG. And occasionally the chef is off. It's absolutely affordable and authentic in my opinion. The drinks are great too. Just typing this makes me want to go have dinner tonight. YUM!  PS MAKE SURE YOU MAKE A RESERVATION!

CHyz5CQlPYnOX7QStW-z6Q.text: In a single word: Spectacular.  Recommended as a great date night type of place, we visited Nora's on a Friday night. From the moment you walk in you realize the great vibe and upbeat atmosphere in this place. The beautiful decor, inviting patio, and cordial staff make a lasting first impression.  After only waiting for a few minutes, we were taken to our table and enjoyed some fresh Italian bread and olive oil. Our server was ridiculously attentive and really made us feel special and well taken care of throughout the night. His recommendations for the food and wine were on point, with every dish being freshly prepared and bursting with flavor. I will say that the Crazy Alfredo was great, but really lacking in the shrimp department (only ?!?).  At the end of it all, we had 4 glasses of wine, an appetizer, two main dishes, and two desserts (sorry, I do not remember all the names). The best part? It all came to $100 (not including tip).  I will keep this place in mind for the next time I want a romantic dinner with my better half.

L9DsO9cVmrXuH9agbs13dw.text: I have driven by this place several times and finally got a chance to have dinner here. Food was absolutely awesome, it was packed even on a Tuesday so definitely have to get here early but it is well worth it.

5OPScanG0xGa4dI9nJWnzA.text: We had good experience. Fresh food, good atmosphere, very clean and neat. We ll be back again.

LnmXLf1FG95NAyYICwfJyw.text: Loved the food, drinks, service and atmosphere.  Highly recommend without paying the high prices on the strips.  Will definitely come back when in town.

fhwW2MC9oP5sF3WXmz3sAg.text: Must try...was craving Italian food and wanted to find a place outside the strip before flying out... what a great find... amazing decor... great staff and even better great food for the price... everything we had there was cooked to perfection... the kids loved it as well... when we are back in Vegas will definitely going back to this place

cMQdpA0JvClsgFnKO1oo3w.text: Came for my son's birthday dinner.  First time.  Husband was thoroughly impressed.  He ordered the spaghetti and side of sausage.  I had the brazino which was perfectly cooked,  moist and crispy skin on both sides! Son had canneloni. The waiter surprised him with bday dessert off tiramisu. Great ambiance.  Best service. Deducting a star because we paid cash and waiter brought back $20 change instead of the $60 we were owed . When we brought it to his attention he didn't hesitate to give us the $40 immediately. Which made us think he was pocketing the $40. So go there and enjoy yourself and you'll have a great meal only make sure when the bill comes that it's correct and you get the proper change .

And they're have open kitchen here too you can see everything also nice full bar good drinks. Very nice service too. But they're not open table when I'm here. I have to wait 20-30 min but is ok.
