al6c72QyohTIn6H3agCLaA.text: Ordered a seafood pasta and pizza. Waited half hour, turned out they made wrong pizza. I came here because of the high rating but I was very disappointed. Pasta tasted okay. Will not come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ofEYs3zbb7Zt1eAmYiqE7w.text: Excellent service and food. Be sure to pre order molten chocolate cake when you are seated. Well worth the wait! We all got something different such as pasta, sea food and I convinced my youngest to order Oso Bucca which he did do and he loved it!

8icMuoFwy4OzDRpg5DzKag.text: This is probably one of my favorite local spots for Italian food. The food is delicious, the portions are big enough to take another meal or 2 home, the service is quick, and an awesome atmosphere.   Just recently checked out their newer location and it is so much better as before you had to wait 20-30 minutes before getting seated (even if you had a reservation). This last time my family and I went we were seated right away with our reservation and the space is much bigger. There is staff everywhere and they're very attentive no matter who's table it is!   The food portions are HUGE, but delicious and quite rich for those of you who plan to order their marinara sauce. They are accommodating to vegetarians as they have a couple dishes on the menu...  Wine selection is good, but prices are a slightly high. Always worth it for a good time, though and you can take the bottle home if you don't finish it.   Will definitely come here more often now that they have a bigger space!

iUSRiGmoMpMq0nE0TvlDvA.text: We had eaten at the old Nora's for years and loved the food, the service and prices.  However, we have visited the new Nora's several times since they have moved and been disappointed each and every time.  Either the order never got in or they forgot our food.  One of the times it sat on the warmer so long that there was a nasty film on my chicken marsala.  We thought at least they still made good pizza.  We ordered a large last night and the crust was burnt, hard and the the price was high.  We tried several times thinking that it would get better, but it hasn't so sorry to say that one of our best places to eat is off our list.  The ambience is great if that is what you consider important.

036kji5CJEEQo9Jzuqmm1g.text: We decided on Nora's for my daughters graduation celebration/  early birthday dinner. We made a reservation for 4pm, right when they opened. As soon as we walked in, we could tell it was a popular place, as there were many people already there. They seated us in a room that was by itself since we had a party of 8. We got our drink order in right away, but only half came when she brought them. It was all iced tea and water. We didnt get the rest of the tea for about 10-15 minutes. This set the tone for the rest of the service we received. The food was very good, although the marinara sauce was rather bland. I personally had the rib eye and thought it was cooked very well, but the seasoning was a tad salty. Not enough to ruin the steak though. We had a lovely time, they were very accommodating with everything we asked for. The reason I am giving it three stars is simply for the LACK  of service we received. We were told they would be right back for refills multiple times and with garlic bread and then they never came back. The waitress we had bordered on rude and it just put a damper on things a bit. I would go back for the food, but I'm not sure the service is worth the price.

JPij4UouWXr6mQlUbk3HbA.text: I just had a wonderful lunch.  My first time here and I got the $6.50 spaghetti lunch special (with meat sauce) and a Nora's salad.  The salad was ample, with lots and lots of roasted peppers marinated with garlic, just like I make at home, but rarely bother to do.  The pasta portion was fine for me, having started with a salad, but I would have been wishing for more if that was the only thing I had ordered.  The pasta was cooked perfectly, while the sauce was tomatoey goodness.  I soaked up every bit with the complimentary garlic bread.  The food came out quickly and the waiter kept my iced tea refilled.  I was surprised at  how nice the dining room was, with white tablecloths and big windows letting in the sunlight.  The quality of my experience was way above the price I paid.  I'm looking forward to returning with a friend and maybe sitting at the lovely bar.

1FBg9H0fTvGcCIwqlweLGg.text: It's decent but highly overated as I was expecting 5-star taste.

kqqoyPXoFSQlSnPyHILBCQ.text: We were in the area and Nora's was the only nice bar in the area.  When we walked in, there was a hostess and server in the front.  The hostess was working on the computer and the server was counting out her tips.  They both completely ignored us even though we were right in front of them.  It was kind of awkward how long the ignored us for.  We were asked to be seated outside because the weather was perfect.  We really liked the patio area - it's really nicely built.  The chairs were comfy for outdoor seating too.  I had a draft beer and wife had a cocktail from the menu.  It ended up being $20 for the two drinks.  I thought it was a bit over priced for a neighborhood restaurant for two drinks.

2p55WEwn2z-7YwGYQaGXNA.text: The food was the worst don't waste your time or money the only thing good was the sever

uaAErDlJJDuAOUac9zm6hw.text: Tried out this hidden gem the other day. It was busy on a Friday night, but we got seated on the patio right away. The service was good and everyone was friendly.   The calamari was a good appetizer. We also had the Crazy Alfredo, which was a very interesting (and delicious!) spin on the dish. We also had the Chicken Marsala - the marsala sauce was a bit too sweet for us (it had a strong "maple syrup" taste). It came with a side of pasta, with a simple marinara sauce that was not great. Even though it was a great atmosphere, the food was slightly underwhelming for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo

MckFaZ_FFWsCFCYUyzyWeg.text: By far the best Italian restaurant I've been to in a long time.  This place is great.  The service was perfect the food was amazing.  We loved the set up of the restaurant, ambiance and location.  It's conveniently located right off of Flamingo and Lindell with ample parking even for the busy Friday night that we went.   We were a little discouraged when we saw a lot of open seats and they said it may be 45-60 mins to be seated.  It only took 15 tho so no worries there.  They offer barside seating, huge dining rooms and a few private rooms.  Very cool.  As soon as your seated you'll receive some breadsticks (amazing).  Then we got our drinks (Stella, iced tea, water and wine with dinner).  We proceeded to get Pork loin, Salmon and some pasta.  Everything was great.  Everyone in our group enjoyed it thoroughly and we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the bread
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dusk at Nora&#39;s
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum

ZVcjqPqFD9n9NsjX4GXoKA.text: This is one of my favorite Italian places in town ! The ambience is very classy with live music playing the numerous times I've been here, definitely a great date spot. One of my favorite dishes, which is one of the more basic dishes, is the cheese tortellini with alfredo sauce. Oh and be sure to pre order the warm chocolate cake you won't be disappointed !!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9YAhNCqn6-FRxHb9CjEjSg.text: I am only giving the one star because I have to.  I must say the service was awful and the food was over cooked. I have a food blog and I must say that this was by far the worst Italian food I've had.  For my bill to be 80.00 u would think I would get better service and better quality of food. Yet we were stuck in a corner and ignored.

jI4z2UgRXck09pzePATa9w.text: So good! Best vodka sauce and Italian dressing I've had.

9mbWynuo5cAuOt9DwUv-qQ.text: My daughter, her friend, and I are on vacation in Vegas. We ate here yesterday and it was the BEST Italian food we have ever had! It was so good, we went back today and recommended it to a couple on the way back to the Venetian. We will NEVER visit Vegas again without a visit to Nora's!

ODkZGQN1ONbjlRKkVsb0-A.text: Nora's is absolutely delicious!!!! Make sure you get Bryce & Kasey!!! They're amazing!!!!! I could eat 30 pounds of the Broccoli Pasta! Locals favorite!

DQCk5vWrJNsBimP21TLS9Q.text: It's  a very good, non-touristy Italian food. I've been a number of times with different business folks and everyone agrees that it's the best Itailain in Las Vegas. I love the Gorgonzola chicken! Every food item I have been at the table for, has been a hit, so the menu is solid. This is a must go, whenever m in Las Vegas!

ImqiF-OEC4nVzAj-K8aBJg.text: The arancini (risotto balls) were excellent! I ordered the Frutti Di Mare which had generous amounts clams, shrimp, mussels and calamari over linguine pasta in a red sauce and it was exceptional! The serving size was a very generous portion and my unfinished portion came home in a take out. The service is both friendly and attentive. They also had live entertainment  (blues/jazz) which made the dining experience enjoyable. I definitely recommend this place and I feel their pricing is fair considering the portions.

x6sQj2Dhp6CNhLJIaP0PSg.text: Went on a surprisingly busy Tuesday night of the Election.  We had made reservations for 6:30 pm, but because we were a little bit hungrier than expected, we arrived at 6:00 pm.  Obviously, we were a bit too early so we waited for no longer than ten minutes to get seated for dinner.  Not a problem.  When we finally got the chance to sit down, we were immediately greeted by assistant waiters who eagerly got our drinks order.  Again, it was a busy Tuesday night so the wait for the drinks was a little bit longer but wasn't waaaay too long.  It gave us just enough time to say dinner prayers so we were thankful for that.  I ordered the Puttanesca as my entree and while it was deliciously hot and tasty, it was somewhat lacking the anchovies which I was looking forward to.  Mom ordered a Riesling from the wine collection and it was dynamite.  So good.  Ramon was our waiter and my goodness, what a terrific server.  He asked us first if we had any questions about the menu after we spent about ten minutes with the menu before he came over to take our order.  What a rare treat!  We are also grateful for the hostesses who accommodated us.  Forgive us for not remembering their names, but we do remember their faces.  We are coming back soon.

X-53zpo9V0V4ogoBzrNYIg.text: Pros: The food tasted good, prepared well. Service was good.  Cons: The dessert was frozen solid.  The caesar salad had a nice thick dressing and the croutons were great. The gnocchi were like little pillows, but the accompanying alfredo sauce had a weird, subtle seafood taste to it. The spaghetti was al dente, and had a nice herby marinara sauce. The cookies & cream tartufo was served frozen solid.

STQlptFB0dhMNRg0HtdNFQ.text: LOCAL HOT SPOT IN CRAZY VEGAS...... We're not touristy eaters. We always look for a place where locals go and thankfully we found Nora's. It's a short drive from the strip and worth it. We knew we were in the right place as soon as we walked in. The aromas and the live jazz music put a huge smile on my face. We shared Mussels Arrabiata (fantastic and spicy), my hubby had eggplant Parm and I had the Frutti di Mare. Now, as a native New Yorker and having been raised eating italian food I must tell you that this is the best Italian cooking west of NY and my Pops cooking that I have had. For me, our dinner at Nora's was a trip back home. The jazz music was awesome. It really did make a wonderful dinner - perfect. The wait staff was friendly, informative and attentive. They have a full bar with specialty cocktails - and a great Mixologist. I  wish we had a place like Noras in Sacramento. It's like having dinner with family.

_50CrtPpOXtgA2-jmfM8lw.text: Excellent Italian! Will not disappoint. Pasta cooked to perfection and sauce is very tasty. Will definitely return when back in Vegas.

uL_fWLmVvirGh0-NIU3c-w.text: This was fantastic!!! Best italian I've probably ever had. First, we had reservations at 7 and we were seated at about 710. We each had a glass of wine, we ordered the house salad regular size, and shared it(plenty big for 2 ppl) brushetta, and for our entree's I ordered the eggplant parm BEST I'VE EVER EVER EVER HAD!!! I always order eggplant parm anywhere we go that offers it..this one takes the cake! He ordered the gnocci(spelling?) In vodka sauce and requested it spicy.. he gave it a 10 and this is a man that gives everything a 8 that he likes.... we finished with the fresh out of the oven chocolate lava cake TO DIE FOR! The food came out with perfect timing one thing after another...cant wait to come back...see you next week Nora's!!!

-vIErs3cGv0XswpO1g4F9Q.text: We had a horrible experience here tonight. Our server was awful. I asked for lemon for our water twice and she never brought it. It took forever for her to take our order, and the three tables seated after us received their entrees before we did.  (We ordered two Spaghetti and one house salad- there were 3 of us.) When we mentioned that this did not seem right she told us she tried to get our food out as soon as possible. Tried? How does that make sense that all the tables seated around us after we were seated first received their entrees well before ours? Plus she brought out the salad first- which was supposed to be the entree for one of us so the other two were left waiting while one person ate their salad. Then of course the person with the salad was already finished by the time the other two even received their spaghetti. We were so irritated- it ruined the whole evening. Service was slow the entire time. We were ready and wanting to go- waiting for our check- when she brought out complimentary gelato. (We did not want dessert.) I'm sorry but free gelato and good food does not make up for terrible service. We will not be back.

uz7NiD6k8oFWcpFqRNlGaw.text: One of the best Italian restaurants anywhere. Don't miss Noras when in Vegas!  Awesome food, wines and service!  Try the "Crazy Alfredo"

RnbESid8rKTVYs65b2i-UA.text: When I refer people to Nora's they're a little taken aback, because of the location. But they're always impressed. The eggplant parm got me in the door. The tasty garlic bread & good service kept me going back. It's fairly easy to get in & out during lunchtime (a popular place for business lunches) & you can call orders in for pick up. The ambiance is kicked up a couple notches for dinnertime so you'll need reservations (quite nice for an intimate dinner).

XX1FIv418vaPnyE-ctivCg.text: I'm not a big fan of pizza but my husband is. He took me here the other day. I had the shrimp scampi and it was ok. I finally tried his pizza and I was like omg. I have never had pizza like this. Suffice to say I ate his food instead of mine. I'm not giving 4 stars because of the scampi but for the lack of service from our server. My brother in law joined us and was given a glass and of water. He started to nibble and the server saw that. He didn't bother to offer him some of his own settings to eat with. Thank goodness we had a fork that we didn't use. The biggest issue was when he was done eating he didn't have a napkin either to wipe his mouth and hands. Thank goodness he had his handkerchief, but still it was annoying he had to use it. It wouldn't have been necessary had the server given him his own napkin and settings.  Our server should have been more observant. It's all about the service. Just that little slip on the servers part caused Nora's to lose a star. I will be back for the pizza  and hopefully I will be able to update my review to 5 stars

F_dcUMRw-n726lO6fv03Rw.text: This is hands down my favorite locals spot for Italian!..everything is delicious and very reasonably priced!..I def recommend the Snow White pizza and the chocolate lava cake but you have to order it in advance as it take awhile to come out cuz it's made to order

t-l_CBim-RI8A9e6E0jMKQ.text: It was suggested we eat at this Italian restaurant. The staff was friendly, but by no means is this good Italian food. I had the eggplant parmegan and it was like mush. We had a family dinner of 12 and no one was raving about the food when we left. We are all Italians and know good food.  But..like I said...the service was good and I will give it 2 stars for this reason.

EVAaDHdshstHHFxW7L_Kqw.text: We just celebrated my friend's birthday there, and the food was delicious! Garlic bread was real good with chunks of garlic on the bread. I had the Chicken Carciofi, and it was real good. My daughter had the chicken parm, she said it was ok. It had way too much pasta, and not enough chicken. It didn't really look that good to me. We were a party of 11, and we had a semi-private room in the back, with a big round table. The staff was very attentive, and friendly. Coffee is Lavazza (my favorite). We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

A1WiOeCmKkh1oYo_EHxMVA.text: My friend and I came here after numerous people told us how great it was. They were packed so we decided to sit at the bar. The bartenders were super nice and welcoming. Rudy described to us a couple of his signature cocktails and we decided on the lemon thyme cocktail and a mango lemon gin cocktail. Next Rudy helped us pick our entree's and told us about a chicken piccata that wasn't even on the menu! So I got the chicken piccata and my friend got the chicken carciofi. Both dishes were amazing. We asked Ryan about the desserts they hand and he informed us that the cheesecake is made locally and was amazing, so we ordered that and he did not lie! I asked for some extra strawberry sauce and instead Rudy hand cut fresh strawberries for us! Over all Rudy and Ryan made the visit amazing! The food, the cocktails and dessert was beyond exceptional. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

qky15iqOGFfqb4_dkSEceg.text: This place is very good! I love chicken alfredo and like to try it nearly every Italian place I go and this place did not disappoint. The place is nice but gets packed as its such a good spot to eat so I recommend making a reservation. This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas or anywhere for that matter.

5_55Rd34ARidwadnIxz3zQ.text: We went there for dinner two times. The first time we went it was excellent!! It was a Friday at about 9pm. The service was terrific and I had ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and my husband ordered the lasagna. Both dishes were amazing! We loved it so much, we definitely wanted to go back. So the second time we went was on a Friday again, but this time it was about 6pm. I ordered the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and my husband ordered their special which was called crazy Alfredo. This time our waitress was okay, but seemed to be more interested in having a long conversation to the man sitting at the table next to us. The chicken fettuccine Alfredo was just okay this time, nothing special that made me want more. My husbands crazy Alfredo was not very good. There was still the tails attached to the shrimp which he had to remove and the shrimp flavor over powered the whole dish instead of complementing it. It was as if everything was cooked in the same pan with the shrimp. We were very disappointed this time. Maybe it was a different chef on the second visit because it just was not that good this time.

Pa0itgooDo61vI2uCOec8Q.text: Service has dropped off since the move but large numbers keep coming.   Food is great to make up for the service drop off.  Time will tell if owners care about customers and service.  It is a decision they need to make soon!  Bad habits are hard to change. Nicer location is not an excuse for a decline in service

N1WCDnpkFCnXegwiLlvrHA.text: I found this place after trying to go to some places that had terrible parking.  This place had a nice big parking lot and a heater outside to warm people as they entered the restaurant.  I didn't have a reservation but they still immediately seated me and service here was fantastic.  The waiter and busser was very attentive and nice.  I ordered the caprese salad, and Lasagna.  The caprese salad was different.  It had an actual salad with it instead of the normal, Mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, and basil with olive oil and basalmic vinegar.   They taste was very good and I would order this again the next time.  The garlic bread was wonderful.  Full of garlic and butter and very tasty.  First order is free with meal and second order they charge a small fee I think $2.  The meat lasagna was pretty tasty but little on the small side.  I guess it was ok because I was completely stuffed after the meal.  The bathroom was clean and interior decor was little old style.  Overall a good meal and would repeat visit here again.

j2YFP6wAxFXhtJgW9aoX6Q.text: Life changing, this is literally the best Italian I have ever had in my life. Garlic bread is addicting, spinach cannoli was fantastic and the breaded eggplant was to die for. There's live music, service was great, I would recommend this over anything at the strip for sure.

4FYDTuAo4RxeZz--90uSAw.text: Sorry I waited so long to try this place.  Worthy of the Best Of Vegas Awards.

_2vR1cQGxFiOapgv9UCbow.text: I'm giving my review based on our service today. I have heard amazing reviews about Nora's and gave it a try.  The service doesn't deserve a star!!!  We were originally seated at wobbly table and the Hostess kindly changed our seating with no hesitation. After waiting for water for 10 minutes our server came over ready to take our order and we still didn't have water at that time. After placing our wine order, I had to stop the waiter immediately to place an appetizer order. As we sat and talked we realized it's taking our order longer than anticipated. It finally came. Same thing with our food.  The waiter didn't ask if we would like anything or advised us of our food being up shortly(time frame) The waiter dropped our food off and didn't look back. Didn't ask if we needed anything. We had to ask for red pepper flakes for our pizza. We asked for water twice and received it once. Now, if someone buys a bottle of wine, isn't it just business sense to ask if they would like another bottle? (Increasing Nora's revenue/sales) Would you like dessert? I mean sell us!  We are there to dine and enjoy!!!  We wanted another bottle, we wanted to converse with our waiter, we wanted to eat until we were stuffed to the gills. Instead, we received a hurry up and eat. The food is great the service is HORRIBLE!!! I even asked the family behind me. The father wasn't happy as well.

Tj5l4-ob7gN5NIYg1OYjeQ.text: Great food but I'm from the west coast and don't like the crowded atmosphere of the New York style restaurant with the tables too close together.

xbMyJuVnkhvB1NuglYMYHw.text: Visited Nora's recently for my dad's birthday dinner. I really enjoyed Nora's. The service was outstanding the wait staff was very attentive. They also surprised my dad with a dessert for his birthday free of charge. I will only review the food I ate as everyone has different tastes. I had the brown butter shrimp for the appetizer. It was good but not quite as flavorful as I had hoped. The brown butter gravy dominated the dish. The shrimp however were cooked perfectly. For my main dish I had the Fettuccine Carbonara. I loved this dish! The pasta was cooked perfect. The sauce and ham were excellent together and was a very generous portion. Very comforting dish. The meal for 4 people including a few drinks was about $175 an incredible value in Vegas with out feeling cheap in any way. Well done!

Sn9N0aYEnNmPjJB9Rm1T6w.text: I've been coming here since I moved here in Las Vegas. 12 yrs. now. Every time I come the quality of the food have been excellent. I would recommend the ala Nora!!  Best Italian in town!

ZOQggzndVy81fIqWYIJ6Hg.text: The new location is beautiful! The hostesses were very helpful despite the place being extremely busy. The food is wonderful as always and Adam the bartender is better. He is attentive and very sweet.

HLD1v6FU2CnUEy5x1LD3YQ.text: Service pretty bad couldn't get a waiter to come to the table place was almost empty finally after 15 min had to waive one down then waited again . Food ok nothing great .

QrLxbc7C5KrimiktLhnBMw.text: Great customer service! This is only our 2nd time here and our server, Brice, could remember our entire order, including drinks and dessert, from our 1st visit a few weeks back and even where we sat - seriously impressive! He was training someone during our 2nd visit, but he didn't miss a beat. I think that attention to detail and customer service is what keeps this place buzzing, even during weekdays. I really liked their spaghetti and meatballs/mushrooms since I've been craving a replacement for SF's Emmy's Spaghetti Shack, but what really leaves me craving this place is the pistachio cannolis! There's an option to get half-chocolate and half-pistachio, but I definitely prefer the pistachio. We've sat in the kitchen area and although a lot of workers come in and out of there, I actually enjoyed seeing everyone seamlessly go through the dinner service. I'll definitely be back to indulge on a cheat day!

GfRf7xY6kjkN1IVLZ-uFfw.text: This was a dining experience.  The food was amazing, the ambience is old Vegas style.  The service was excellent and the portions were huge.  We were there for lunch and the restaurant was not too busy.  It seemed as if mostly locals ate there.  We are locals and have never dined here before.  They are opening at a new location soon and we're looking forward to dining there.  They are the real deal and the food is True authentic Italian.

RYhPHlH0Wb8fEBztvOguLQ.text: Nora's is the whole package!  It's a quaint, neighborhood, family restaurant.  There's butcher paper on the tables, the whole place is bustling and there is a 20 minute wait out the door.    Nora's serves up hot, chewy, buttery, garlicky bread to diners.  They offer an extensive wine list and tons of specialty cocktails.  Last night, my husband sampled the pilgrim's passion.  An alluring blend of gin, passion fruit, elderflower, mint and egg whites.  I had a HUGE glass of red sangria ($7.50).    We started with the gemberroni fritti.  Lightly dusted, fried plump shrimp with mixed greens, lemon wedges, and a zesty tomato caper sauce.  ($9.95).  A great way to start.  Next, we shared the alla nora ($9.50) and the fettucini carbonara ($12.50).  The alla nora is ground beef, eggplant and spaghetti baked with a crispy crust on top.  It's really good, and a heaping portion. The carbonara was as heart stopping as you'd imagine.  Creamy, dreamy, and delectable.    We finished our hearty meal with a tiramisu.  Light and creamy and perfect coffee flavor.  The tiramisu vanished but lots of leftovers to take home otherwise.    Nora's is simply unbeatable for the value, ambience, and flavor of Italian homestyle cuisine.  If you haven't been, you must.  Make a reservation!! They are always packed....the secret is out!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All Nora
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gamberroni fritti
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pilgrims passion and red sangria

Eql-Pny0xL3fPZZkzOVBNA.text: This place is amazing and delicious.  You do have to make reservations ahead of time because this place is busy.  Parking not so great and you make be parking in the street.  Beside those two things, service and food are great.

qKNbJlYqI2EEuwN-TbofvQ.text: Came here based on a friend's recommendation. Glad I did. Very good food and service. Doing a brisk business on a Wednesday night is a testament to their quality. I'll return.

88DtqvD_2dY2GKUMCIXh8A.text: Heard Nora's was the place to eat, but got their & soon realize they should've just changed their restaurant to "Reservations Only". & btw 2/12 Hrs is not 45Mins. I seen people been waiting patiently for hours but of course "Reservations" will be seated first. That's not really an issue. But the real issue is "Reservations" that had missed their time & show up late can still be seated ahead of Walk-Ins which makes 0 sense.

uigaWz59RA2dsMD9eIF4yA.text: You know when you go to a city and you want to know the secret spots only the locals know? Nora's Cuisine is that secret place! Forget the super fancy Italian restaurants at the strip that charge you so much that you might as well sell your blood to afford your next meal. Here at Nora's, the food tastes a hundred times more expensive than its price, the service is topnotch and friendly, the atmosphere is great, the bar is cozy and nice, and the occasional live music on its small stage is pleasing to the ears. What are you waiting for? Call Nora's now and reserve a table for tonight.

O0a7UEpHHdAYMbJZ21ZBpw.text: Underwhelming Italian restaurant. When I looked at the menu and the mid-range prices, I expected a cozy little gem. It is neither cozy nor gemmy. The atmosphere is as lackluster as the servers and food.  Rigatoni was highly recommended (over the lasagna) by the server. Pasta was chewy and dry due to the scant amount of sauce. As much as I love garlic, it's way over used...to the point of drowning out the flavors of any other spices or the meat. The ricotta survived the garlic tsunami only because it was in volcanic-sized dollops.  At $21 a person, for pasta and a beverage (no cocktails), I fail to understand the rave reviews. There are numerous and far better options in Vegas, several in that vicinity.

3Czfz_hCGlstKh_a-Y9gmw.text: Favorite dinner when I visited Las Vegas. So. good. Recommend the wild boar pasta.

sdxNtzDo45UdBCVC0ixhKg.text: We went here with a large party on New Year's eve and it was awesome.  I appreciated that they had their regular menu for New Years too. They even had some party favors.  The steak florentine was to die for.  Not a lot of restaurants know how to make it and they really hit the mark.  The service was exceptional!

73gCEAwexluidSm3U1pSsQ.text: This is a really good place for Italian. I bookmarked this based on reviews and bit does it live up to it. From the outside it looks small but when you get inside it's 3 rooms full of tables. There's a full bar so that helps if there's a wait.   I had the linguini with meat sauce and meatballs. It was pretty good. It's not the best I've had but it was definitely up there. My girl had the tortellini in Alfredo sauce. Now this. This is the one. There Alfredo sauce is booommbbbbbb. I actually opted to take my linguini home and help her finish hers. We had garlic bread complimentary with the meal. It was good garlic bread. Also had mozarella sticks....they were only aight tho.  Service is great. Portions are good. Prices are fair and the food is bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortellini in Alfredo sauce. Their Alfredo sauce is so good. Get anything with that sauce and you&#39;ll be good.
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with meat sauce and meatballs. Pretty good.

o3pGoDbNx1v1KeLCAoS4ng.text: Made reservations here for Sunday, Early dinner which I highly highly recommend ... 5:30pm. Every time I have dined here later than 6:30pm,  it is always extremely packed and there's usually a line out the door (people literally waiting in the parking lot). The parking lot is difficult to park at peak hours.  The food is always delicious. There were four of us and we split the large house salad ("serves 4-6 people"). I had an appetizer "Bruschetta Al Pomodoro with tomatoes, fresh herbs, olive oil ADD steak for my entree!!!! Yummy.   The bill for four of us came to (with four glasses of wine) $125. Not bad, I shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta add steak
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large house salad and Merlot

2RIthtg4gXNMSpbMCL2BRg.text: I hardly write a bad review but I think this restaurant definitely deserve the review and 2 stars... Here's what my boyfriend & I experienced while we we're here...  Made an 8:30pm reservations. Arrived at 8 which is early and we didn't mind waiting.  We checked-in at the front to let her know that we're there.  The table got ready at 8:15 but the lady keep calling the wrong name, first of all if you take down the name and we checked in providing the same name you figure she will get it right, but NO! She keep calling the wrong name so we ended up seated down at 9pm.  we sat down near the kitchen which is not bad as we witness the in and out of the waiters & servers. The waiter was nice and took our order and we trusted that he got all of our order right.  But NO! He forgot the most important order the "desert"   we got our first order which is an appetizer, it took 30min for it to arrive and when it did it was cold . The food was good but it was cold.  then our second order did not come until 30-45 min after the first course.  The second course was better, but what we didn't like is the manager. The Manager was standing by the kitchen watching his cooks, I have never seen a manager do that! most of the restaurant manager walks around and check people that are eating making sure that their customer is/are happy but not this one he was by far the most HORRIBLE MANAGER we have encountered and gives you an attitude (what the...) when you check your food, who does that!   If you want good Italian food then come here but be prepared on the bad service specially the MANAGER.  The 2 stars is for the food!  Also, did I mentioned that their food is not cheap, you figured that the money they charge they will give you a better service, NOT!  I will not comeback here ever again!!!

UgSo8X1LYKARa8OxCdlzwg.text: We came across this wonderful restaurant while visiting Vegas. The food was excellent and value for money. The staff are very friendly and professional, this is truly a hidden gem. We had the pizza and pasta dishes which were outstanding, make sure you leave room for dessert as the cheesecake and cannoli are the best ever. If you live in Vegas or just visiting make sure you eat at Nora's.

MOPAfYB1kXwYY6Hy3AJ6BA.text: First time at Nora`s, 3/12/18,,,our party of 4...I read the reviews first, & was a little apprehensive, seeing some of the bad ones....But none of them were True for us..For a Monday night, (6pm), the parking lot was full, so was expecting to wait for a few days, even with reservations, was seated in 5 minutes...:) The young waiters were very attentive, took the time to answer questions about the menu..The food came out within 20 minutes, & very hot.. :) Joe got the sea bass, & the whole fish was on the plate..he asked waiter if they could filet it, & it was done perfect within a few minutes..My cousin got the eggplant parm..,enough for two people, so 1/2 to go.. :) ...Dad got linguine/clams,,he loved it, clams perfect..I got lasagna, which was hot, enormous , & perfect...A little loud, but everything else made up for it..Just wish it was closer to our home here in Sun City, Summerlin...We can use a great Italian restaurant, with reasonable prices..I say that, cause we have one here, in Sun City, but while Nora`s lasagna is $14, "their" lasagna, is $23, & smaller..... NORA, how about a second location up here?, you would do quite well..

QDTUO_GxprnKzIYXZk84BA.text: Way Too Loud!  Service was Slow. First bottle of wine was bad, but they graciously replaced.  Food was good.  But not worthy of a return visit... Why when you can't hear a thing ?

CJx0NWl6ENkF_lRj797LxQ.text: I used to really love this place. Since they've moved to a bigger place and have hired a bigger staff, somehow they've gained this weird, shitty attitude. If you can't accommodate your customers with their large amount of extra seating you have, then hire a larger staff. Isn't that why you moved into a bigger building in the first place? For more business? I called around 7 pm on a Tuesday, was told it would be a 25-35 minute wait which I was not happy with but because I really love their food, I was willing to wait. I literally walked into the restaurant 5 minutes later and was told that it would then be an hour long wait due to their "reservations and walk-ins" coming in just recently. They don't accept reservations for less than an hour when you call but yet an hour wait is somehow acceptable to them. Sad.

5MTJLHxjMWi65brNK5rbxw.text: This place is VERY good! I lived in Italy for two years and the food at Nora's is definitely authentic!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sBpeWDebmtcXeZuV5gddSg.text: The best dining experience we have had by far! Friends referred us here and we are so happy we gave it a shot. Kara, our server, was the best!!! Thank you Kara. From the sangria to dinner to dessert , it was all amazing. The service was fantastic and fast. I can't brag enough about this place. It was amazing!!

8njeK06ZH5jBtTL3nD2elg.text: Excellent ambiance, live music selection from a college assemblage (jazz musicians), and not to mention the entrees. I just moved to Las Vegas and the same night my roommate took me here as a welcome to the Summerlin area. What a greeting! We didn't have a reservation, but he is somewhat of a regular, so upon speaking to Gaston (I childishly thought of the Little Mermaid-haha) he placed us at a table within 5 minutes even though people were waiting! Wow, I was impressed by the service! It's an intimate establishment that treats its loyal diners with reverence.  We ordered a mini vegetarian pizza, a starter salad, vodka gnocchi and Alfredo ravioli. Excellent portions and flavors. I'll definitely return to sample another dish...maybe with him again!

dcjjoPlVrcXgvAj-qLtOFg.text: My goodness soooo worth the trek from the Strip. My friend and I were debating whether to do this or have a celebrity chef Italian cuisine on the strip. So glad we chose this. It takes things back to the simplicity of good home made Italian food.   We had aranchini balls to start with which was very good. I had the Veal Chop special for my main and it was the best Veal Chop parm I have ever had.  We got there around 21:30 and the restaurant was still full on a weekday in Feb, but we were seated quickly.  Service was very friendly and efficient despite of it being busy. If your in the mood for excellent home made Italian comfort food this is highly recommended. I'm still drooling thinking of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Chop special

jip2eg6UdjryWQQUMvDgwQ.text: Went on a Monday night and it was packed! The food is delicious!!! The staff was very helpful making suggestions and explaining items when necessary. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Will definitely be back soon!!

U8V6XRRDfEiHiqDstjO2eQ.text: My CEO's wife recommend Nora's as a great place to get Italian food and boy did she hit the mark. We stayed at Palms so it was a quick and easy ride over to Nora's. It was $10 in a cab and the Uber ride was $8.  We ordered the Calamari was not good. It was really chewy and most likely frozen. Would not recommend it.   For dinner My boyfriend and I both ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and it was amazing. The garlic bread was also delicious. I mentioned in passing that we were in town for my boyfriends 30th birthday and the gave us tiramisu on the house. If you are looking for a reasonably priced Italian meal in Vegas, go to Nora's.

pndDYowI_BP8o4fy8tfMpA.text: Nora's is definitely an Italian spot you want to hit up if you're into Italian food and wanting to dine away from the strip. I got the Rigatoni special ($15) and my girlfriend got the Alla Nora ($12.50). Both prices and portions were perfect for what we paid. In fact, my dish was probably 60% meat if not more. The ratios for my dish was incredible and left me feeling beyond satisfied. Additionally, I might add that my girlfriend's dish had exquisitely fried and crispy mushrooms to compliment. Pro tip: don't build your own pasta unless you're willing to spend a lot more. You will get more off the original dishes if you do substitutions. 3 pieces of shrimp (literally 3 pieces only) is a $5 charge and 5 pieces is an $8 charge. To me, that's absurd for an establishment that's not necessarily upscale. To conclude, I would come back here and try another dish because I know I'd leave satisfied and pleased. However, I'd simply hope that the wait to be served isn't as long. There were probably 2 waiters in our section running around, while 5 other employees were cleaning tables together.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni special add broccoli. Incredibly generous meat portions.

YMAxyV_NzKSjuA_KQ1pLkw.text: Holy cow - last time I reviewed Nora's was 2008 ?!?! GF cravin' to-go Italian as we hibernate another weekend evening ( we are definitely way too ant-social these days )   I gotta believe I've been to Nora's at least 10 times since the last review so it gives you an idea how much I like the place.  What surprises me the most is the pricing - though I haven't been to Olive Garden in a long time I bet Nora's pricing is similar.  We went with the aracini rolls for an app, the crazy fettucini and spaghetti and meatballs for main event ( I was chastised for not getting a dessert .. next time ) - total cost $42 ( darn good value )   the food ?  gf felt the risotto rolls were "old" - I call BS on that - what do you want - make the risotto fresh, roll them up and put them in the fryer ?  she thought the oil might be old ...whatever, more for me !  the spaghetti and meatballs - above average - the balls might have been a little too dense ( ie no filler ) - sauce decent could have been a little thicker ( personal preference )   The crazy fettucini - your basic fettucini but they add sausage, chicken, shrimp and for a little bite - jalapeno's.  I liked it though maybe a little too much going on.  order came with garlic bread - my guess an entire head of garlic in one roll ! whew  pics attached  also, the place was packed when I picked up the order - Nora's continues to rock

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spaghetti/meatballs to go
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. arancini/risotto balls to go ( sauce separate )
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crazy fettucine to go - can u see the sausage, jalepenos shrimp, etc  ?

fM-qUOxbsU311ofrtpoytg.text: Great Food! I have never been disappointed in the food or the wait staff. Hopefully Nora's will pay more attention to their hostesses. They really shoulg get them uniforms and teach them how to be more polite and empathetic. It seems like these girls know they can say anything they want and get away with it.

p9qrxN6xyN94BeNt7IVgGA.text: Always impressed by the superb food and eloquent service staff. Nice mix of authentic dishes with innovative touches. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great meal and memorable experience. Save room for dessert! Thanks again to all the staff for yet another great dinner and congratulations on the new location. I will be back!

jc4ViEnq5gS5rr5QkMWKdg.text: I came here with my girlfriend on a date and we ordered the veal scallopini, Alfredo with chicken, garlic bread, 2 sangria's, and the tirimisu. We decided to take advantage of their buy one get one free sangria offer, which their sangria was really generous in amount and pretty strong. Their Alfredo was not bad too, the veal had a pepper white wine sauce that was pretty good. Im not a fan of places that make wine reduction sauces that you cant taste any wine in, but theirs was distinctive and good. The veal was soft, and it came with an extra spaghetti plate. The first garlic bread you order is free, and nothing tastes better than free food! The bread was soft and they use real ground garlic on it, unlike some cheapie places. We also preordered the chocolate cake because it takes 25 min to prepare, but our waiter forgot to put it in, and gave us the tirimisu for free which was really nice. It was really moist and had a lot of rum it.  The ambiance is finer-ish dining and had live music very resemblant of smooth Frank Sinatra. Parking was a little packed but still not impossible. Overall it was pretty good, i wouldnt mind returning again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5o9Uii0Y93Zur9j9oBJvVA.text: New location much too noisy. Sat at table for 4, and couldn't hear each other talk. Server didn't know who ordered which dish, so had to ask. That really is annoying. Pasta dish cold and lacking flavor. Old location was much better. Think twice before coming here.

wEud0c3_3jEpuycfWkcsWw.text: I was 100% dissatisfied with this establishment. My girlfriend and I went there tonight looking for good food, comfortable surroundings  and soft Italian music so I could woo my girl. Didn't happen. This entire eatery is all hard surfaced, causing major echoes. The tables are crammed. It is more like a cheep buffet,than an Italian restaurant. Food was good. The music was turned up over the noise, than the noise powered out the music. Not a good night. The old place was better. I willing find a different Italian place to do my wooing.

19bObIEbtKiLoSL3smDUaA.text: We first tried this place at the old location and loved it.  We love the new location even more.  Last night my husband and I had dinner at the new location.  We were impressed on how beautiful it is!!  What an improvement.   Service was good.   Our food was good, too.  I ordered the Melrose with shrimp.  The pasta was cooked to perfection, the texture of the sauce was on point, and despite lacking some salt, all the elements of this dish were working quite well together.  My only complaint was that the shrimp was horribly over cooked.  It also had no flavor.  I could see they were dry as soon as my utensil touched the shrimp.  No give!  Shrimp was tough and tasteless.  Tried two shrimp hoping maybe, just maybe there might be some "love" still left in one of them?  Nope.  I couldn't eat another shrimp. In fact, next time, I will just order this dish vegetarian style.  Yes, the dish was that good, I'd order again.  I complained and my server seemed annoyed and they did not discount the shrimp off of our bill.   Well other than that, Nora's is legit.  I would recommend this Italian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melrose with shrimp.  Very good except shrimp were horribly over cooked.  I&#39;d order it again, omit shrimp.

o7nfS2-DTqFZ0NJTLu8LTQ.text: I was visiting from California when I yelped for a good Italian Resturant .  Nora's came up and decided to try it.  I have to say it was the best decision !!  The food and service was excellent!  The restaurant  atmosphere is very welcoming .  Our server Sebastian was very professional and knowledgeable .  Loved the food especially the sausage, calamari and the  Ossobuco was absolutely amazing !  I can't wait to go back .    The tap water was super tasty!

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GFWcMoJIL9-TKTj2NJIN1A.text: Nora's Italian cuisine is a find in Las Vegas. I  went with everybody. I went with Amy, Larry, Cindy, and Paul. I got the 4 staggioni. Amy got the angel hair pasta. Larry got the lasagna. Cindy got the chicken Alfredo. And Paul got the lasagna. We got good food and great service!

o_GpFM5Z24qgwzKs22Z1lA.text: Wonderful service from the staff! Pair that with the excellent cuisine and you've got a winner. I've been to Nora's twice and will be sure to visit every time I visit Las Vegas.  On my first visit in April, the Veal Scallopini was perfect; tender and tasty.  So on our second trip in late October, I ordered it again. So much for experimenting!   But what made our dining experience far above any other was our server, Sebastiani. Truly, my husband and I were so impressed with his sincerity and lively personality that he raised the bar of waitstaff excellence.

jB0yPGk0LHFP9e6LIZYeIg.text: I called on two separate occasions to make a reservation for dinner and they offer a table at either 4pm or 9pm.  Who eats dinner at 4pm on a Wednesday night?  They make it sound like they are doing you a favor by letting you eat there. I will take my business elsewhere.

CI5pcEnKJwPmfmwhSfzojw.text: This is a great neighborhood gem. Everything here is good. The Crazy Alfredo is my favorite. They tend to be really busy and sometimes the hostess' can get into the weeds when it comes to seating people. But don't worry they'll get to you. It's worth the wait.   April 2017 Update This is based on the rude customer service the "hostess" gave my wife over the phone when she was confirming a dinner reservation. Here's a tip, if you're not nice to loyal customers you lose customers. We went to Capo's instead. Everyone there was lovely.

YuU0S_dl8uwdbtZJidfUSg.text: The five stars crazy Alfredo.  I brought my dad here. He is very picky. He cannot stop basting it is good it is good. I am so happy.   Love it. And will come back again when I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy yummy Alfredo

T5AnHjh6nBnSV_mSOONeGQ.text: Great place! There was also a live band which was a nice touch to my Italian meal.

8qMi9xX_8KufEOi-n8x_QA.text: I have to say it was a good one Good customer service  Grate taste of there food Love it  Very recommended this place to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jdFCFvXenFULWJx-_L0L9g.text: The dining area to the left of the entrance is super noisy. I wish that I had requested seating to the right (bar area), which seemed less utilized and therefore tolerable. This was my only complaint.  I made reservations for 4 at 9pm on a Monday night. No problems with being seated when we got there despite the packed house. Our apps included calamari, Italian hot wings and a Caesar salad. The calamari was decent but the side sauce and regular marinara was raved about by my dinner mates. The wings smelled quite spicy but enjoyable. The Caesar salad was delicious.  Two people ordered the Crazy Alfredo (one without pork, allergy). The modification had a noticeable color difference to the sauce but otherwise both dishes were said to be amazing. One ordered the Branzino, and WOW it looked so delicious! The entire plate was cleaned, even the arugula side (impressive for a man who would prefer to only eat meat/fish). Another ordered the shrimp scampi. The shrimp was said to be great but the pasta was okay.  Overall a great meal! I would come here again. I'd only want to be placed in an area where I can hear my dinner mates without all the noise.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari, wings and a Caesar salad nearly gone before I had the presence of mind to take a picture! Oh and yummy Moscow Mule!

FF6CRwrSWYuO6rMMjdHuJQ.text: Nora's is always good. The food is good service was good. I felt like having Italian so I went to Bogeys it's closer to me but unfortunately there closed, so I drove to nora's on a Thursday night and let me tell you it was packed had to wait but since I was by myself I sat at the bar. Norman the bartender was great (young) very professional and a good mixologist. I had veal cutlet parmesan and substituted my pasta for a ceasar salad the portions weren't large, but enough. I finished with some tiramisu, espresso and a little sambuca. All in all was a very satisfying meal. Personally I like the atmosphere in the old Nora's better, more quint this Nora's is very loud but the food is good. So. 4 stars because of the noise.

ly4tTgk4w2hI4oUjNBSkLA.text: Had lunch here a few weeks ago. We were sat in a private room that was being reset from an event. No one else was sat there, only us. We were ignored for a few minutes, as if no one knew who our server was. Then 3 people came to talk to us and take our order. Just weird. The last server approached the table when my friend was on the phone. We had been waiting for about 10 min, but apparently that was our problem. He stopped talking to pay attention to her and place his order. Appetizers took too long to come out, and by the time our entrees were ready, we had to leave for an appt. We had to ask a staff to find our server and get our check. We waited a few minutes and the server came to the table. Instead of being check ready, she made a comment about giving us a note explaining why we were late...what? Idk if that was her attempt at being funny, but she wasn't! Then she excused herself and went to get our check.  The whole experience was painful. I'll go to Capo's next time I crave Italian.

ydv3og8lvmYMBuAGFItoYA.text: Food was very good, but service was not up to what it should have been. Took a while for our table to get bread, although others seated after us got there's just fine. Drinks were also a bit slow in coming. Once we were done eating, my mom asked to have what was left of her entree doggie bagged. Upon finishing dessert and getting up to leave, we realized they had forgotten to do this. Will probably give them another try, but not wowed on our first visit.

px-i8eFWnrsJClTTRsJA7w.text: Food is awesome but service left a bad taste in my mouth. Been coming to Nora's since they were at the strip mall always crowed so use waiting BUT what I am not use to is after waiting for over an hour then watching people being called before me and my family not cool when they came after and I heard them tell them waiting was over 1 hour. So when I brought it to their attention the young lady up front in black acts dumb.  After this crappy service not sure I will be back in the future.

5xUE3azf7aoEsnmF08EMMA.text: Noras was amazing! From the drinks at the bar to apps and dinner then dessert and after dinner drinks everything was amazing. We always love the anti pasta. My husband had the frutti DeMare and I had veal Parm. Both were absolutely amazing. Our service was outstanding. Our waiter, Sebastian, was awesome. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and he made sure it was extra special. He suggested their peanut buttercup after dinner drink and omg it was sooo good. If you haven't been to Nora's

1Y4wKgvELdP4zHciYrH5xw.text: My wife and I frequented Nora's almost every time we visited Las Vegas over the past years, even at their previous location. Every meal we had at Nora's, except for the last two times we were there have been very good. However, my focus in this review is our visit on August 11, 2018. When our group of 5 arrived we only had a short wait, which was very acceptable, albeit the table we were seated at was in a lousy location.  Too much staff and customer traffic bumping into our chairs as they passed by.   On this visit 3 of the 5 meals, including my meal were "lousy". The three served meals were so salty and too highly seasoned. My meal was inedible. The Chicken Parmesan, which I had ordered many times during previous visits was so bad I had to stop after the first bite. Other meals including a salad and a mussel appetizer were also too salty. The waiter acknowledged the problem and brought me a replacement dinner, which were also inedible, for the exact same reason. My mouth was so irritated I could not taste anything after the first few bites of food.  About the only positive thing that took place was that the waiter tried to rectify the problem and did adjust the final bill accordingly. However, at no time did any manager make any attempt to come to the table to apologize or even acknowledge the problem, after much complaining on my part.  I am certain there were managers in the restaurant since it was a Saturday evening.  They just don't seem to care!  Nora's grew from a local restaurant in a small shopping center, where the food was always great to a large standalone building that appears to always to be filled to capacity.  However, the food has gone downhill along with the growth.  I doubt their management even cares, which they should.  I doubt I will ever eat there again, nor will several, of the relatives who were there with me.  4 out of the 5 in our party have eaten at Lorna's before and were also disappointed in the meal.  A very disappointing evening.

i1sJfIJr_titb3sw-WjVqQ.text: Have been really excited to try the new location. Used to be regulars at the old spot. To be honest it was such a letdown. Made reservations for 3 and a newborn. Got there 5 minutes before our reservation. Ended up waiting 20 minutes beyond our time.   They seated us in this back room with dreadful lighting. It was clearly a party room that they use for overflow on busy nights. No thanks. Terrible atmosphere and horrible lighting. The main dining and bar areas were so lively but this area was a total buzzkill.   The server we had was fairly nice when she approached us. We had a pregnant guest with us so decided not to have wine. As soon as we told her that she was MIA the entire meal. The busser essentially took care of us the entire meal. Food was mediocre at best.   Ordered the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce and Chicken Carciofi, with some appetizers. The vodka sauce was ok. Have had just as good out of the jar. The Carciofi was supposed to be a garlic wine sauce. Tasted like chicken stock and flour. There's too many Italian options around to go and have an experience like this.

vDmDHwHaup3zhRRYt49L4A.text: The hostess in the front got us seated in 30 minutes like promised no reservations. They allow reversations- highly recommended! Very busy! Patio was really comfortable in 105 degree weather. I had the crazy seafood alfredo with sausage,  spicy lost the taste of alfredo, lasagna was hot and cheesy, steamed clam a bit too buttery could not taste the wine. Ambience is rustic modern Italian can both be romantic and family friendly. Priced right for the food and service. Don was on point. Sangria potent and delicious. Can't wait to try dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu and Oreo

6ASBnO4-3NMon1ko4goWbQ.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in town! This place has everything I expect from a restaurant: beautiful building with a nice view, indoor and outdoor seating for when the weather is nice, variety of foods that are delicious and reasonably priced, and good service.  This time I booked a reservation. I arrived early and was still able to be seated right away. The waiters looked nice in their uniforms which added to the elegance of the restaurant.  The garlic bread sticks are tasty. I appreciate that they brought them out right away. After we ordered, the food came to our table in about 15 mins.  I had Veal Cannelloni alla Vodka that was delicious. I  enjoy everything I've eaten from here.

12yue61x5eYi0cKC0xd2Cw.text: really good local place. They apparently moved from a smaller place. Good idea. It was packed. I used open table and got a reservation. best idea. packed on a Saturday night. service staff was helpful and food was good. bus boy was always so fast. had the truffle fries, antipasti salad and "garbage" pasta..... that's not the name, but its the everything inside a pasta dish - pasta dish. it was very flavorful and lots of food. don't finish..take home... your belly will thank you the next day !

fIlFFhCqKj5McjQyxtbKrA.text: I was craving Italian food and I usually go Olive Garden and figure I try something different. I ordered their Crazy Alfredo since that's what the reviews said they're popular for and I ordered it to go. It also came with their signature garlic bread. It was $25 but it was a generous portion. My honest review of the pasta was that it had too much going on. There was jumbo shrimp chicken sausage mushroom tomatoes jalapenos. I wish there was more noodle and less of the other things. I got full less than half way through. But overall taste wise I give it 7/10. I still think Olive Garden shrimp Alfredo is better. But Nora's garlic bread I loved it! It was a nice size and it was crispy and garlicy. But I'm not too much in a rush to go back but it was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ArwS8_m5pcXNAtz-8sprw.text: First time trying Nora's after I just came back from Italy, and this place is amazing. Ordered the caprese salad, arancini, frutti di mare, and carbonara. Everything was comparable to what I had in Rome/Venice which is kind of crazy because I've been going back to my favorite Italian restaurants but they just haven't been as good. Service was really good too, unfortunately I can't remember our server's name. Definitely my new favorite Italian restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine carbonara was decent
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di mare, really good!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini, suuuper good!

HFWb0YMKzJVSmYHUHYxm3Q.text: This place is always a must in Las Vegas! They moved and son now runs an upscale Pizza place -Monzu-that is awesome also. Nora's has great appetizers and meals! Not americanized or chainy-type, but thoughtful preparation with a great mix of ingredients to capture full-flavor. Thank you and new location has beautiful wine area and casual bar, as well as indoor -outsoor-rooftop seating!

idn9XGQDeMlFTXPzP-9aHQ.text: This place is everything my friends told me it would be. My brother-in-laws and I enjoyed an early Sunday dinner at 4PM. BTW: Make reservations or eat early because by the time we were done dining, there was quite a wait. We ordered Boar meat pasta, Lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs. The Boar meat was quite salty, the spaghetti and meatballs were just above average, the Caesar salad was wonderful with the garlic bread and the lasagna was amazing with lots of cheese. I would have given it 5-stars but when I mentioned that the water glass had a chip in it and requested a new glass nothing was offered. I think, I will try the eggplant parmigiana next time. Great place for a romantic date.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LGbG02ppYBb0Gslkr9476g.text: This place has amazing food. Like all the other reviews say, it is worth making the trip to have dinner here.   The only opportunity they have is their waiting staff. They were not friendly at all, and seemed to be talking about the guests and making fun of them with the wait staff, which I found to be extremely unprofessional. We waited for an hour, which we were fine with, but they gave us no updates, and were constantly talking in a group with each other rather than helping the guests. We had luggage, which I think made us bump to the bottom of their 'wait' list. There were at least 3 other 2 person couples that came in after us and were seated before us, which was very frustrating.

OZ3gQ5JK9c3sRrIHvmZTzQ.text: Nora's Italian is wonderful.  We took the whole family on a Friday night with a reservation.  The waiter was patient and so attentive.  He really made it a great evening.  The food was amazing.  Love the garlic bread and shrimp scampi and that was just me.  The rest of my family was just as happy with what they each order.  Strongly recommend.

JNCRz_1ND9JOZtRszrd-pQ.text: Nora's is awesome!  Marla was our server and did an excellent job at recommendations.  Drinks were perfect and since we went there for my brothers birthday, a wonderful dessert was presented.  I had salmon and highly recommend!   Perfect spot to get away from all the noise of Vegas!  Thank you!

NtkHFTvwUNBcqRQK-bzFZA.text: Amazing Italian food. The service is on point, food cooked to perfection, and great ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Picatta!

DB9TjqXUhO5V-i0kf1Gqhw.text: I went with a dude.  We both had wine and pasta.   I thought it was weird that she took his order first and poured his wine first since typically ladies are served 1st.   The food was ok.  I'd probably go back and try my gorgonzola pasta dish again.  But I'm salty about the poor service (back service however VERY ATTENTIVE) And the guy I was with ....his shrimp was so chewy I couldn't eat it.

kLLV7eoGSsFOViHBftHktA.text: We love this place! It is a really good restaurant off the strip that is always with great service and amazing atmosphere!  Highly recommend to try any of the red wines they have and amazing selection!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kjpdgrATtstA_9ML_3dslg.text: Great Italian food! We had the rigatoni, Italian chicken wings and the pizza-- all were great. I would definitely recommend for a date or group. This place had great food and good wine selection! I'm glad I picked for my birthday dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-4Wmfp0oKh8QFLSopTWOBg.text: This place has prob the cheapest ingredients of any restaurant.  How does it get so packed ? Is it cause the prices are cheap and its built well? I dont get it.  Its packed during lunch and dinner.   I would never come back here. The alfredo sauce was so cheap. Alfredo is pretty hard to ruin. I really dont get why its so crowded.   Judge for yourself

HsYL-8wXVBFbPA0YLiE8WQ.text: Amazing. This place is legit. A hidden gem not too far off the strip. Garlic bread is great. 1st basket is free then $2.50 a basket.  The mozzarella sticks are a solid start. The bruschetta looked amazing. We had the shrimp scampi with linguini, the Chicken Parmigiana, and the 16oz ribeye. All 3 were the bomb. The steak may have been the best I have ever had period. The scampi was so buttery and garlicky it just melts in your mouth. The pasta was cooked perfect and the tomato sauce is excellent. The service was very attentive too.  Make a reservation if you are thinking ahead otherwise you will have a wait most likely.   I love the open kitchen too.

I4RiAa2SaNQkItoTs5BoGw.text: What a disgrace! Had a private room reserved for a year, arrive at 7:00 and room was taken by someone else. Now the manager who said he was here for eight years, funny never seen him before!, Was a complete asshole and has no customer skills! Never will send business or eat at this establishment ever again with this manager who said he has been there eight years! Thank you for ruining Christmas Eve dinner Adam!  P.S. The waiters and servers are awesome as usual! Thanks guys!  This is for you Adam:           Reservation;                            : an arrangement to have something (such as a hotel room) held for one's use!

ECK14GX_6AdEhfsQykIX9A.text: Came here for Dinner last week & had a great evening. Sat at the bar for a drink while waiting for an outside table to open up. First of all, WOW - what a cocktail menu!! I chose the Bourbon Rabbit - Basil Hayden's Bourbon, Strega, thyme, carrot & lemon juice. It was a very yummy refreshing summer cocktail with a balanced sweet from the carrot juice & spicy from the bourbon.   Can't wait to come back again, probably just to sit at the bar & try at least 3 more cocktails.

cXj4Z7dFXxPOSKXQlUK0Gw.text: I used to frequent Nora's before they moved down the block. This had been my first time back there since, and i was not disappointed.  The ambiance has certainly grown since Nora's humble beginnings. The new place is quite an eye catcher - spacious and cleverly decorated -  giving off hints of a New York ristorante. At times during certain nights, you can catch some live music, which adds to Nora's appeal. The food was just as tasty as i had remembered. This time i took my wife and daughter (it was their first time there) and they loved it. Everything about this place is a hit, and i absolutely love that feeling of home (NY) i still get here.
