Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peroni
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clammies

cUBuHwPLbDRQrIVyFRwC0w.text: Nora xx Pasta was too dry, with no taste. Sat in patio, too many flies. Waiter was very kind enough to return the pasta for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nora pasta?

BGWgSmoyAoINS-S-Qhq6-w.text: Finding this wondrous restaurant in Las Vegas was the highlight of my recent trip.  Though we had to wait over thirty minutes to get a table, it was more than worth it.  The food was absolutely delicious. The single salad was enough for two, the chicken parmigiana was an enormous portion that my partner smiled through as he ate every bite, and my chicken carciofo prepared carefully, featuring capers, artichokes and pasta. The service was professional and attentive and the restaurant is well run.

X0V38e693vDNq9gUN8aHCQ.text: We walked in on a Saturday evening around 6:00.  We saw that the place was packed but we went in to see how long the wait was.  We were quoted a 2.5-3 hour wait or we could sit outside on the heated patio.  Granted it was windy and cold outside but I really wanted to try their Chicken Marsala.  We decided to sit on the patio, all by ourselves.  It was cold even with the heater and we did sit out there for maybe 10 minutes before we were acknowledged.  But once we were acknowledged, service was good.  I started with the Pasta Fagioli Soup.  It was good but not super memorable.  The Chicken Marsala was really good.  Chicken was tender and the sauce was flavorful and had enough mushrooms.  My husband ordered his usual Chicken Parmesan.  He liked the flavor but said his chicken was a little tough.  Their garlic bread is amazing.  Like I said, our service was good and it was quiet outside until a large party with kids came outside to wait for their table.  The kids were screaming but the most annoying part was the loud, pompous man with them demanding his table inside.  He marched around like he owned the place.  Unfortunately, they finally got their table when we were ready to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Spaghetti
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala was so tasty
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Fagioli Soup

MIw-YX8WB_MmtDT4pQbw7Q.text: The food was really good and will be a returning customer. The one piece of advice I have for everyone is make sure to have reservations prior showing up. We were lucky and only had to wait for 50 minutes on a Saturday night during prime dinner hours

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Boar Pappardelle  Delicious

DrdzemQinmnD_tjBR9V0Dg.text: The reviews convinced me to try it.  I went with my husband and 2 kids, and arrived at 5:30 on a Saturday night.  They said it would be a 20 minute wait, but then 2 minutes later said a table was ready.  Not sure what that was about.    Anyway, we loved the Nora salad, and I got spaghetti with meatballs.  The sauce was delicious, a little on the salty side which I love, and also had a little spice which didn't bother my 6 year old at all.  My son got a 12" pepperoni pizza and ate 4 slices.  My husband got the clam sauce spaghetti which he liked.  It was an excellent deal and I will definitely be going back.

imjgXpoTBkmjbvarIvZRQg.text: I love this place.  The food is amazing.  We go here at least once a week.  My favorite is the Halibut dinner and I always have the red sangria.  Rudy is great (bartender.)

R8mqwqYv0ob37TgR4wIsFQ.text: 2 words... Osso Bucco. Best in town! Wait, best ever! I usually have to call to see if they're offering it for the night, but it's phenomenal! No joke. It's fantastic. I don't even like eating meat, and I will crave this dish! Antonio and Rudy behind the bar are amazing mixologists and have created some of the coolest cocktails I've ever had!

f540BNPcHmBH2Ccp8As1fQ.text: What a delightful surprise.  Don't miss out on this gem.  Easy to miss in a strip mall, but worth the trip.  Great food and wine.  Make a reservation.  A lot of people know about this wonderful restaurant.

lCNhcskmyAON4Tdj0QERlg.text: I took a local's word that this was a great place for Italian food-BIG MISTAKE.... If this is one of the best Vegas has to offer, they don't know anything about good Italian food. The "kitchen sink" alfredo was unlike anything I have ever tasted-and not in a good way. Unfortunately I invited 2 friend to go along. One had the gnocci (sp)-it was VERY "doughy". We were all very disappointed, I spent the rest of the night apologising to everyone for my poor choice.  AND CHARGING $1.75 FOR 2 SMALL HOT DOG BUNS CUT IN HALF FOR 4 PEOPLE??????? Had the runs the next day also. What a ripoff of a place. Bad, bad, bad

e1N26Y0xBuLipPIkSLx3mQ.text: I like the food and atmosphere at Nora's, and the prices aren't terrible. Their dishes are a good size and flavorful. I had a chicken dish the last time I went, which was delicious. I don't remember it's exact name, but it was one of the dishes not served with pasta. The sauce was fantastic. The desserts are good, too. I'd recommend coming her for Italian food that is not at a chain restaurant.

xF7uKQUu5BEMTEcAWxC43Q.text: We visited Nora's recently and found the food good but not spectacular. The vodka pasta is worth trying but on our visit the pork tenderloin was overcooked and too salty. The salad that came with our meal was surprisingly pedestrian and contained thick chunks of iceberg lettuce some with dirty, brown edges. This slip-up in quality at such a well-regarded establishment was very disappointing.

fcn5n0qtnBN6iUejYbCIMw.text: great food reasonably priced. if you don't want to pay $100 for a plate of spaghetti on the strip then this is the place for you!

fXe7_cx91i4_ct-6jq0EbA.text: What a great restaurant. This is definitely a 'local' gem and if you want to get some high quality Italian at a reasonable price while in LV definitely check out this place. Normally I don't rave about Italian places but this place is worth it. Good service, quality food, and nice atmosphere. Go here for a romantic dinner that won't empty your wallet.

DI5ILo4k3-Dl7kyzkaR95A.text: We love Nora's.  We've been eating here for many years, and it is our go-to spot for special occasions.  Nora's catered a 50th Anniversary party that we threw in our home, and everyone raved about the food.  Portions are more than generous, and the food quality is outstanding.

OshLczffo9rcRMvy7irCzQ.text: Another restaurant I like to bring my out of town guests and it never disappoints.  Food is great here and very reasonably priced.  They take reservations and it would be wise to make them since they are usually busy for dinner, especially on Fridays and Saturdays (closed on Sundays).

tSJ6umaSGTfEuPtUNRaIRg.text: I had VERY high hopes for this place when my husband and I made a reservation for Valentine's Day weekend...  I had heard great things about this restaurant and was hoping that I would finally be able to find an awesome Italian restaurant in Las Vegas... I was wrong.  Our garlic bread was pretty good as was are fried calamari, which was out to our table about 1 minute after we ordered it... which made me wonder why it was ready so fast.. Hmm...  I ordered eggplant parm and my husband had chicken parm... both were edible, but not all that amazing.  The sauce lacked any flavor whatsoever.    I'm an Italian from New York, so I guess you could say I'm bias.  So far, the best Italian food I've had in Las Vegas has been out of my own kitchen.

V7bECdb9y0Njzh8JXyI0IA.text: OMG! Italian food at its best! Okay, first i'm not the biggest fan of Italian food but this place is hands down the best. First, when you burn the top of your mouth off with the pasta (in my case the Fettuccini Alfredo w/chicken) it's served hot and with lots of chicken. Never had that happen at other Italian restaurants. I've come to Vegas every year and never heard of this place until Yelp found it for me. This is now my secret spot for Italian food now. The service was excellent, the server knew the menu and how the food was prepared extensively and the ambiance was nice and quiet. Others in my party had ordered the Eggplant Parmigiana, pasta and sausage and it all looked tasty. We will definitely return on our next visit!

R2Yrq-G2VG2pc3uH-xBpiA.text: Good authentic Italian at a reasonable price.  Will eat here again when we return to Vegas!

265GzSsTPGdlBRGwLg9ZSg.text: Good food nice atmosphere, Will come back to try more yummy stuff

1MU3eP1a3azWHZhkTnmt5g.text: Great italian restaurant. The antipesto salad is amazing. I also order the chicken herba fini which is also great. The prices are also amazing for a fine dining restaurant.  2 people can eat for under $30.

-4W3YSGiGkhbcmR_BnyXZw.text: As good as it gets! Daniel was awesome! Totally accomadating, made me a special dish of cooked veggies, tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese. Delish! Cool place

xHmLR5WSmltVG2LW0eZ4xw.text: Very disappointing.  I have been going to Nora's since '94.  It has slowly gone downhill from then.  I recently had a 8 pm appointment and took a date.  I checked in at 7:50 but wasn't seated until 8:25, and then right behind the hostess podium.  Good business, as usual, can bring a business down.  I'm done.

vfs0j3ahikq6ZPgxa9ajUg.text: We like to go here for Italian food in Vegas so we can afford good food when we visit!  Even when a mistake in our order was made, the server was quick and responsive in the remedy of the problem.  Fun atmosphere.

1y-oQyZ5z1wBNjQcyuTsPg.text: My food was good although I am no food expert and the prices were very reasonable. The place was full and I talked to two people at the bar who were locals and both were educated professionals who made a special effort to dine their regularly.

__XzW687WoHAypSb-75gnw.text: Good italian resto the restaurant is nicely and more of an upscale style bistro. The food is good, comparable to other good italian restaurant doesnt really have the extra oomph where i can say that they are better  than other italian resto's in the valley.

MZvPs8COWP-I7yQDyUORoA.text: Wow! Stopped in tonight for dinner and was very impressed. I was looking for a neighborhood place and this certainly was it. I was by myself, so sat in the bar and the bartenders, Angela (her doppelganger is Lea Michele)  and Rudy were great. Their menu recommendations were perfecto. Traveling by yourself can be a downer, especially when you are staying at the LVH.  It is nice to get off the strip and find a place with great food at decent prices. I will certainly make this a destination on future trips to Las Vegas.

ZR5l86qLUeWTVaMVy4ACyg.text: Have to downgrade this after an over-salted meal with my family. The garlic bread was especially funky and everything just seemed to taste off--a sign of staleness I believe. So this spot is 1 for 2 which is enough for me to try some other Italian places in town.

zfXZbtLBKiqBeTD05pjeSg.text: The best combo of food, service, and ambiance in Las Vegas.  Everything is good here and don't miss the specialty cocktails.  Great place for a great meal with family, friends, or business associates.

y73Y0moLpwnn31RaM9ZNsQ.text: Comfortable setting, good lighting, pleasant serving staff, special menu with very high quality meat and speciality salads. Great desserts and a rich variety of wines for sampling and enjoyment.  Definitely will return when seeking high quality foods, excellent service that is memorable. Older crowd that is mellow and happy.

8swCMX6Ak76aolBLa-Odmw.text: Nora's was suggested to me by a friend who has lived in Vegas for over 30 years. The thing about Nora's is everything on the menu tastes great. That includes the free Garlic bread. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is the food is a bit heavy but hell what Italian food isn't heavy. A must is the Tiramisu. Absolutely fantastic. On occasions there is a live band playing. Took my wife their for her birthday.

fC0WKz3DBQr6kvVG92MwuA.text: First thing that comes to mind is superb customer service. Two people assisted us. Will and ....darn. I forgot the other 1 but i remember their faces. Anyway, we ordered fried calamari and a salad as an appetizer. Fried calamari was good by itself. Not too salty. Just right and crunchy. No lemon or marinara sauce needed. Complimentary garlic bread came with it too which was really good. For my dinner entre I ordered the shrimp scampi which came with lingunie. The whole plate can fill you up without having an appetizer. We also ordered the cannoli for dessert. It's homemade with 100% riccotta cheese, bits of pistachio, and mini semi-sweet chocolate chips. I think the one at NOVE  is still the best I've ever tasted. Overall, a great Italian restaurant to dine in.

4BtHFpShUsrwPkaZOxmMHA.text: I honestly cannot see how this placed is reviewed so well. So, we came here after reviewing the reviews of my fellow yelpers and saw a good amount of people in the restaurant. We were served the complimentary one basket of garlic bread. If you want some more garlic bread, it's $1.50 per basket. It was ok. I ordered the lasagna and my bf ordered the "works" which is a mixture of sausage, jalepenos, shrimp, sun-dried tomatoes, and pasta. My lasagna was gross. It had pounds of cheese to mask the nasty flavor of the dish. I couldn't figure out what the flavor was sort of like nutmeg. The works dish was somewhat better. The shrimp was good and the sausage but seperate. All together it was rather nasty. Yes, its not expensive, but save your money its not worth it. We left very dissappointed.

A09LYW4Z0y1Ha74bYgG5fg.text: We had 5:30 reservations at Nora's Cuisine for dinner, for my birthday (11/17). Good thing too - by 6:00 it was packed! This is an Italian place on W Flamingo & Jones, in a strip mall. It gets very good reviews on yelp and TA, has reasonable prices and they do my favorite dish - Veal Marsala. I had signed up for email specials and had a coupon for 1 free appetizer and dessert and another coupon for 10% off. They accepted both coupons! The dining room is all tables and chairs with butcher paper topped white tablecloths. The entire ceiling is covered in trinacria (the 3-legged symbol on the Sicilian flag). Casual enough for jeans. The lady at the next table was also celebrating her birthday, today! Again, small world. She said I had to try the Berry Explosive - she was RIGHT! The food was the best Italian we've had in 20 years - I kid you not - I wish I could write a description of how it tastes besides saying OMG it was good!  Garlic Bread Arancini (4) for an appetizer Crazy Alfredo for hubby Veal Marsala for me Tiramisu for dessert Berry Explosive (I'm hooked - it went well with the meal too - go figure) Jack for hubby  The bill came to $49.00 - deal of the century for food & drink this good! I'll never come to LV again without eating at least one meal here.

NyabMiOEwJOJl2SHrSsK9w.text: The food is beyond excellent, and very decently priced.  If you come here get the cannoli!!! It's the best dessert you'll ever have.  Also ask for Nick, he's a great server and is very knowledgable about the menu!!

1-VGcVoBDJSpD3KzqbIpiQ.text: I guess I had high hopes when I finally had the time and reason to go to this restaurant,  I was thoroughly underwhelmed.  I have heard of Nora's Cuisine from tons of people.  They always say they are the best at Italian cuisine.  I for one as I said, was underwhelmed.  We had their garlic bread basket and all have to say is that it is definitely garlicky!  I am not sure if it's the an area that they're representing, but whatever it is, the food either was under seasoned or intentionaly just bland.  I ordered the Chicken Masala that came with a side of pasta with tomato sauce.  The Marsala was cooked very well and tasted awesome.  The side of pasta was another thing altogether.  The pasta was way too al dente!  The sauce lacked any seasoning.  It's like they opened a tomato sauce can and just put iton top of the undercooked pasta. My partner ordered the Chicken Parmigiana.  I don't know about you but I always associate parmigiana with a bread crusted, flattened chicken breast.  Apparently, that ain't so!  The chicken wasn't breaded at all.  He also has the same complaint about the tomato sauce: bland.  After a lackluster dinner, we opted to have the chocolate souffle which we ordered at the beginning of the meal.  I have to say, this concoction of chocolate souffle with vanilla sauce and pistachio was pure heaven.  But this dessert won't change my review of Nora's.    One other point of contention that this place needs to revise: their waiters just plain suck!  The waiter in charge of our drinks was very attentive, but the main waiter who took our order barely showed his face.  We had questions and he wasn't around.  When he was around and we asked why the chicken wasn't breaded for my partners' Parmigiana, all he said was, "I don't know.  Weird right?". I was baffled to say the least.  We finally got our answer by looking it up on Wikipedia.  I have to say, Nora's really FAILED to impress me.  For our 4 year 11 month anniversary(we're leaving Las Vegas and wanted a nice celebration in the city before we left), Nora's just didn't deliver the ambiance we were looking for.  They need to fix their wait staff and warn their customers on which area of Italy they are representing.

V99OU3Qn-hLffPwhcABXig.text: I've been going to this place since I was a kid and the food is amazing! It has a nice atmosphere as well.

RFPJkFQjGdEDXO-Td0L2wQ.text: Chicken Alfredo, Crazy Alfredo, Garlic bread, house salad and rigatoni special. Cannoli is he best.

Q-KHMT4Vv_lswgXkc-E4AQ.text: Even though I barely come to Vegas now, if I ever visit, I will definitely come here. Their calamari was delicious nice and crispy, so good. I loved the chicken marsala too. Everything about it was just perfect. The dessert here was unbelievable. Other desserts at chain Italian restaurants like Pasta Pomodoro and Macaroni and Grill are ok but these were awesome. The oreo ice cream was really unique and tiramisu, I could've just eaten a million slices of it. If you're visiting Vegas anytime soon, this is must to eat here.

aHKdj4-c-t6M-xaCraAGEQ.text: I think this is the hands down best italian place in Vegas. But you probably shouldn't take my word for it because I ALWAYS get the same thing here. The Frutti di Mare. Linguini topped with large portions of shrimp, calamari, mussels, clams... and a wonderful red sauce. I'm sure their other entrees are delectable if you don't like seafood. I would've given it 5 stars but the service is spotty since it's often so busy.

jXIj-lrZewb9UhKlA6xGlA.text: I was unsure about this place because of location but it was very good. The service was excellent! Food and pricing were good.

HbULuQWmCDdKTYiNA9rA5g.text: The food was absolutely fantastic. The service left a lot to be desired. We called a few weeks in advance to reserve for a party of 12 and we were told they had to split us up into two tables. This did not seem like a problem until we arrived and they seated us in separate rooms. We also tried to change our reservation as soon as they opened that day to add one more person and we were told we could not. So in order to have everyone fed, we had a table of 8 in one room, a table of four in the second room, and one person at the bar. At the table of 4, it took 20 minutes just to receive our salad but dinner went pretty easily after that. We took out time and enjoyed all the delicious flavors. When we were done and getting ready to pay the check for the entire party we found out that the table in the other room hadn't even received their entrees yet. At this point we had all been seated over an hour so I'm not sure what the hold up was. Thankfully we had scheduled two hours for dinner because we barely made it out at the two hour mark to get to a show after. I would come here again but I would never bring a party here.

hmEGWgcPEm4su-FitxKFmQ.text: Im a italian and live in Ct. And we are spoiled with our Italian eateries but been traveling to Vegas every year for 9 years now. My aunt who lives out in Vegas now brought us there and we were totally astonished. We make it to Nora's at least twice while we are there. The atmosphere and service are great. We always try to order something new and different each time we go and nobody has been disappointed. Even me who is a chef and is very weary about ordering pasta at a restaurant even though a simple dish to make can turn into a catastrophe with a poorly made sauce loves the baked ziti. I can go on and on but u get my drift. If you are in Vegas and you are looking for a great place to eat and drink this is the place. P.s Even my mother who wont eat anybody's sauce but her own loves this place and if you knew her you would really take that into consideration. Lol

50JVHVz1m3xhD242gfGQAw.text: This was a great YELP find.  In Vegas and we wanted to find an Italian Restaurant where we could get take-out.  So to YELP I looked and found Nora's.  The menu looked good so we ordered.  When I arrived to pick up my food, I was skeptical when I saw it was in a strip mall.  But once I walked through the doors, I felt like I was transported to a NYC Italian restaurant. From the checkerboard floor and exposed brick walls to the servers rushing around with plates of food, I was immediately excited for what I had found.  As I waited for my order, I was surprised at how busy this place was.  It appeared if you did not have a reservation, it would be a long wait.  It was fun watching this place move.  I even snapped some photos to show my wife back at the hotel.  It really did feel like I was somewhere else.  And the food was awesome!  We got the large (or huge) Antipasto salad, the penne with Gorgonzola sauce with chicken, penne with marinara and yummy meatballs, steak bruschetta, and some delicious garlic bread.  And the hostess to took my order and got me my food was really friendly and helpful.  5-stars...and this is from a guy who doesn't really like Italian.

ESwAFuq2o1YcAVwQ0Z4KJA.text: This place was packed and gave me the impression that we were in for a treat. However, the folks eating there must have been heavy smokers because their taste buds had to gone. That's right this place was a solid OK. I can't believe the yelp team couldn't identify average food! The salad was something you buy at the grocery store in a bag. As for the meatballs, it tasted as though they had been made 3 days ago and simply heated. They tasted old and manufactured like something you would eat at a potluck for retired people. The best part of the dinner was the wine. Bottom line, if you want a place that isn't going to break the bank and you are craving Fazoli's, go to Nora's on W. Flamingo. If you are looking for a good Italian meal on the west side . . . try Mastrioni's.

FtFJKXXHi4Y7_bT71ozeeQ.text: Great food, delicate taste but abundant plates, service was great and quick, just be ready to wait for dine inside, the place is great

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LqMDoKg2wfxac76ahbwX4A.text: Amazing food! Great service everytime! I appreciate good authentic Italian food which is hard to find.

mshSU88NkHZxCrUtkLR2jg.text: I haven't found another place quite like Nora's in Las Vegas. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. The service, food, and wine selection are all top notch. Perfect for any occasion really. I recommend making a reservation for dinner because they are always busy.

5rNLh06ahZPft5uQjmNCNA.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants in town, food wise. However, the service is mediocre. We visit the restaurant frequently and each time we leave quite disappointed. Depending on what you are looking for out of your dining experience this may or may not be the place for you. Wish they valued service as much as they did the quality of their food. Don't think we'll be back this time. Las Vegas has way too many Italian restaurants to offer to settle for bad service.

edASdi2iyKg9J8ElNZdkew.text: We have visited Nora's several times over many years when it was a storefront in a strip mall. We like the food and try to return whenever we come to Las Vegas. This time, we were very surprised by the new location and beauty of the new restaurant. But, the best part is that the food is every bit as good and the service is outstanding still. Our server, Sebastian, was very attentive and so were the assistants.  The carbonara has always been a favorite and was again. So for the lasagna and the rigatoni Gorgonzola. This will remain one of our favorite dining experiences in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQLk2KcPtC24KfH1cA3iMA.text: Not on the Strip or in Casino hotels.  Reservations a must. Busy every night.  Great wine list, friendly staff, everything is awesome, very flavorful.  Love their veal dishes, antipasto, tiramisu.  Very popular with locals who avoid Casino hotels and Strip restaurants.  Don't miss this place.

5dQEilMCK27sEeRrbj2dHQ.text: Wow!!!! What a great spot. If your In Vegas and wanting Italian then this is one of the spots you should check out. Excellent food for fantastic value. If your getting the quality of food Nora's is putting out on the strip then your paying much more for it. Great cocktails, entrees, and desert. Love Nora's. It's on my best list.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kentucky Garden. delicious!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Scaloppini

NYEQjAFetGnsvho9ICOQbA.text: Get the crazy Alfredo! It will change your life. I've eaten here countless times and it never disappoints.

A6icHNLhd_64yC6bVS6FRw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for some time now. Heard it is always busy and it certainly was last Thursday night. Had to detour to this place because Pizza Monzu was closed for the night due to a private party. I put my number on the wait list but went to the bar since there were a few seats open there. We ordered the...  5/5 Garlic Bread - This was so garlicky and I loved it. This is my kind of bread.  5/5 Nora's Lemon Drop - Well balanced and not too sweet. Nice touch from the sugared and flamed lemon slice.   5/5 Sicilian Mule - Great alternative to a Moscow Mule. Good Limoncello that they used made this Sicilian.  4/5 House Salad - Was usual, nothing special.  4/5 Grilled Octopus - Some pieces were a salt-bomb but mainly pretty good. I love me some good grilled octopus. The veges that came along with it was really good.  4/5 Crazy Alfredo - Really good flavors but I didn't care for the sausage, shrimp, or the pool of oil in the bottom of the dish. I liked the mushrooms and sundried tomatoes.   2/5 Tiramisu - Soggy and Gross! The texture was so off that I couldn't have more than a bite. I like it when it is smooth, creamy and melts in your mouth with good marscapone cheese and lightly soaked ladyfingers. This was nothing like that. It was heavily soaked. The liquid just burst out and was overwhelming. I would say one of the worst Tiramisu I've tasted.   The majority of the employees were nice and was working pretty diligently. The only really upsetting experience for me that night was that when I was ready for my pasta to be boxed up... They took it away and set it on their service counter at the bar for a good 5 minutes. That was cringingly disgusting and has to be some kind of health code violation because they were working above it and talking all over it. I watched them for the whole entire time. Their elbows were almost touching it and they were clearing up dirty dishes right above it. I was so grossed out and didn't want to take it home. I was trying to leave it behind but was reminded of it and just took it home to be courtesy. I'm not even going to bother risk eating all the germs from that leftover.

iZl19IqZ9gOrsI1p1hfoYQ.text: This is the second time we've been here while visiting Vegas. I highly recommend this place! The food is authentic Italian, absolutely delicious! The staff is very attentive and helpful.

EhRvZeylLMhu2Cbq2I1EGA.text: Dined with my family at Nora's for Father's Day! The food was wonderful with the exception of the steak arugula bruschetta and my cosmopolitan cocktail! My favorite dishes are the crazy alfredo, the antipasto, and the garlic bread! You must make reservations!

PQu--b9l-8GAdtcZ96IOFA.text: The service was ok. We had made a reservation for 6:45. We arrived on time, but still waited about 10 minutes to be seated.   The appetizer salad was family style, which was fine.  The pasta dishes were ok, they had some flavor, but it just wasn't amazing. It was adequate.  We also order a pizza which was the size of small dinner plate, but pricey.

wmj2_YgfsbKTh8uoO6MQMA.text: Great atmosphere and really busy, the noise level was pretty loud and we went on a Friday when there was no live music. We had reservations and a good thing as we probably would have had to wait. Food was really good, portions were large so we each brought home about half of our meals. We shared a small antipasto salad. We were celebrating a birthday so they brought a dessert to help us celebrate. Great service as my water cup was kept full and they packed up the leftovers. Food was delivered nice and hot and everything tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6UHlpHTjSNP7NE1JuhB37Q.text: Food was great! They were prepared for our party, before we got there. Service was amazing! Thank you so much. Definitely will be back :)

BxbLO13PQ1lIxdAz4aAnxg.text: The best Italian in Vegas. A little sad the original location shut down because the old school Vegas vibe was party of the atmosphere. That is all.

0tRf1H4dQrjU6lqmb3K9-A.text: My son absolutely loves pasta and I'd heard so many good things about this place, so I thought I'd bring him to try it. He just loved it! He had the chicken parmigiana which according to him was the best he's ever had. I ordered the fettuccini alfredo with chicken the best I've had in my life. Our appetizer was a simple order of mozzarella sticks, but the taste was anything but they were delicious not your normal cheap mozzarella sticks these were obviously made with quality cheese. The service was great our waiter, Anthony,  was always attentive to our needs and never let our sodas get to empty before asking I'd we needed a refill! The atmosphere inside is so nice and calm, they have music playing but not so loud that you can't talk very relaxing.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oXull7FkD_pkEqYEaYsZNg.text: Nora's was a staple in my family's culinary adventures for the past decade, but all that changed Thursday, January 31, 2019, when my car was vandalized.  Long story short, anyone visiting Nora's new location knows they didn't build the new property with guest parking in mind, so patrons have to park in the adjoining neighborhood, or at the offices across the street. This isn't just unnecessary and inconvenient (especially since Nora's isn't a fast casual, cheap eatery), but this can put patrons in a dangerous situation.   Anyone reading this review needs to understand WHY I am so upset about the situation, because life happens like it did to us. I am upset because of the WAY our situation was handled, and am upset that I even had to have this exchange with a Nora's in the first place. They truly made us feel like our patronage doesn't matter.  I am including photos of the damage to my car, and all the emails that occurred between management and myself.  If for some reason you can not see them here on YELP, feel free to go to my Instagram (ediblechaos) where I'll post everything in full.    One final thing, the owner emailing a final response telling me how right I was in two sentences only nailed down the insincerity we felt all week. It was like a husband admitting guilt to get his nagging wife to shut up. I would have rather heard radio silence.   Nora's has AMAZING food and we have always had fantastic service from their hourly employees. Maybe those in charge could take a lesson.   I post this to let people know this could happen to them when visiting Nora's, and this could be their response. Hopefully, that isn't the case for others in the future.

N_7Xt3JOEvxMqx6CDUFcIg.text: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere! Spinach & Farro salad was delicious. Wait staff was very friendly and attentive. Main dishes arrived piping hot and were very tasty. We had tiramisu for desert and it was light, but a little saturated for my preference. Overall excellent establishment!

pfzfT-WDzZzYdTOc4AssGg.text: Gluten free menu!! Took some of my friends from New York here from the food shown they enjoyed the food and service was above a five star!! Everyone's dinner was cooked perfected

g2SfoYb6I_Oqa3OkZFKryA.text: Incredible food and service. I am very picky about Italian food as nothing is as good as what I am used to. This is excellent.  Adam the manager was very accommodating.

2KUHj6vI3IZkAKDyjnFKdQ.text: Delicious Italian food! Expensive but soo worth it! Perfect for a romantic date night.. service is great.. definitely recommend!

DK7AZMLIxBz34Ml8mh7htg.text: Over the past month we have been lucky enough to have two of the best Italian meals of our lives. One at Lola and Giuseppe's in Columbus, OH (see review) and one at Nora's!  Service Overall very polished! We had a reservation on a Monday night and were seated about 10 minutes after our time. The place was packed!  We were promptly greeted by the server, and he was attentive throughout always refilling our soft drinks quickly. The meal was well-paced and not rushed nor slow. Fresh silverware was provided after each course - a small touch, but don't you hate going to a restaurant and being told to "keep your fork!" as if they only allow one per guest. A bus boy graciously packed our leftovers for us which we appreciated.   Ambiance  Sorry Lola, Nora wins here hands down. Modern upscale interior. Extremely classy. No booth seating, however, so when it's crowded it doesn't feel too intimate or private.    Food Truly exceptional.  Lola might have the slenderest advantage, but wow it's a close call. We started with two wonderful cocktails including a peach Bellini. Tasty and great presentation. We had some soft drinks too which were constantly refilled. We had arancini as an appetizer which was ok.  A bit mushy on the inside. Then a Caesar salad which was very good. Truly tasty dressing and fresh lettuce. The garlic bread was exceptional!  We had read on Yelp only one basket per table was allowed, but we asked for more which wasn't an issue at all (no charge). It would honestly be pretty gauche for a place like this to charge for more bread. Entrees were... amaze balls! Chicken Parmesan and pork fillet. Wow. Huge portions (see photos) and both were flavorful tasty meat. The pasta with the chicken was wonderfully al dente.  Very large portions (plenty leftover for both). For dessert a slice of spumoni (so so tasty and flavorful) and bread pudding. The bread pudding - wow!  Not like the typical dry bread but so soft and moist like a custard. Lola's is similar, so this must be an Italian style bread pudding. So delicious - you mustn't pass this up!!  Mojo Overall an outstanding place with great service and exceptional Italian food. Lola's might take a slight edge for its homey authentic atmosphere and overall taste, but if you aren't up for a trip to Ohio you must (really you MUST) eat at Nora's!!  Total bill for two cocktails, an appetizer and a salad, two entrees, and two desserts was about $100. Very reasonable for the quality of the food!

nxrxjtOKvhxN040vrV7RvA.text: A beautiful spot for a nice lovely date with my husband. We really enjoyed the food here. I was surprised by the size of the appetizer I ordered fried risotto balls and they can be a whole meal. They were delicious and the sauce is so exquisite. The place is nicely lit for a romantic evening and the atmosphere is great although I felt better being seated outside because it can get a bit too crowded inside. Our servers were great and they were constantly refilling our drinks and bread basket. Great service overall and food.

i734m_cNmqmY8JudaYbtzw.text: I've always loved Nora's... I truly have. Been coming for a long time. The food and service is always exceptional. But tonight an opportunity to deliver that service arose, and they really disappointed me. I came with my family for Mother's Day, the 4 of us. While waiting for our appetizers, a woman walking past our table fainted. My father jumped up and caught her while I called 911. The ambulance came and the EMTs had to set up a pop-up med center right next to our table- making my parents share a seat for about 30 minutes while they attended to her next to our feet. After the whole fiasco was over, we finished our dinner while the wait staff tried to avoid bringing up the situation. They were very sweet to us... but after our entire experience took a turn for the worse, I was shocked that nobody addressed the issue or even offered to take care of my moms glass of wine for the horrendous inconvenience. This is out of the restaurants control, I understand. But really, even though we smiled and brushed off the whole thing, it was in very bad taste for the management to completely ignore the whole thing as if nothing happened. I'm a forgiving fellow employee in the industry, but Nora's has lost my parents business.

lGQGdDXfi775a2yNA3Dj-g.text: I came here for my dad's birthday dinner on a Saturday evening. We had reservations so were seated within a few minutes. I wanted to sit on the patio but there wasn't any room because everyone else had the same idea. So, we got a nice seat by the window as a compromise. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. I got the Lemondrop Martini which was delicious. For my meal, I got the Chicken Parmesan which is one of my favorites. Everything tasted great and was made very well. I couldn't finish it sadly but it was delicious! The prices are high here but it is a more upscale restaurant so it's to be expected. It's a great place to come for special occasions!

Qc2EOXwOEXUfn1avfpCM0Q.text: We stopped here on our way to our honeymoon. We ate the cannelloni and it was fabulous ask for Nina service was great! They gave us a dessert for our wedding! We will be back!!

bgQGZwl4JQER7JDCpYj3nQ.text: Simply amazing, this was my one and only time dining at Nora's and it was fantastic to say the least. We met some close friends for dinner who happen to be locals of Las Vegas. They recommended this off the strip restaurant for a great Italian experience. I will definitely return in the future.

0OQPUIyd8fmLLQ5sCafbMA.text: Good food, great cocktails, ok service, don't go on a holiday.   We made reservation and took our mom to Nora's on mother's day. While we may come back in the future it will definitely not be on a holiday. They definitely added tables and overwhelmed the staff trying to get every penny out of the holiday they could. We touched elbows with the tables next to us and basically shared conversations. It also took 45 min for someone to bring water and ask us if we wanted drinks.   Food was good but not amazing. The desserts must have been made the day before to handle the holiday as they didn't taste fresh.    I think the only reason I would go back is because of their passion fruit mint julep. I tip my hat to their mixologist for making this Divine cocktail.

e7ZWkW09NMhDCehOblFOag.text: Nora's has been our go to restaurant since moving to Las Vegas last year. Everytime we would ask for a recommendation, they would suggest Nora's. And that's in a city full of great restaurants. We love the drinks and food and always take our out of town guests there when visiting.

y2HKRf0B0lj2QxtG1BWwMg.text: Antipasto is the best that I have ever had. I would return just for this.  Ribeye steak had a good flavor, but tough and chewy. Sad, because it wasn't cheap.

o5BkxXxkPEmNxwRqCuW5Ng.text: You are so beautiful to me. Can't you see? You're everything I hoped for, you're everything I need. You are so beautiful TO ME! I'm pretty sure this song was written about pasta. I mean how could it not be?   SO this is a Las Vegas gem! It's in a super random location but it's worth the drive anywhere you live. The inside of the restaurant is clean (although the bathroom sinks are kind of awkward - like they tried to be high tech but it didn't work really well...it's a sink/hand dryer combo) and they have a wall wine (so obvi I'm already a fan). Okay enough about the inside, time for the food.  We ordered: pomodoro bruschetta, crazy pasta, and frutti di mare (subbed with arriabiata (sp?) sauce). Everything was so delightfully delicious! The seafood in the frutti was perfectly cooked and the combination of all the flavors in the crazy pasta worked oddly well (I only had a bite of the crazy pasta but my mind went crazy - I'll have to order it next time).   The service was great! And big points to Nora's for having my favorite beer (Hitachino white ale)!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti Di Mare!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craaaaazzzzaayyy pasta

cFShe0SCOl-RD30vhl1JuA.text: Have been to Nora's 2x now an both times have been very good. The service an the food both outstanding. As soon as you walk in you notice the nice wine room with a huge variety of wine. The decode is nice an modern an it's very open. They have a lot of seating but beware on the weekends this place is packed. So if you can make a reservation. Th kitchen is open which I live as you can see everything being cooked an the smells coming from there make you even more hungry. They have great lunch specials an offer a wide variety of choices. The regular menu had amazing choices as well. I live how they bring you it garlic bread an take your drink order right away. For lunch on this day I had a regular house salad an added chicken to it needed some protein. An a cup of chicken soup. The salad was amazing an was very filling. An the soup just as good. Both just the right amount to fill you up. My husband had the sub which was great as well. The homemade chips are great as well as the fries an sauce. I will definitely go back again for lunch an even dinner. Can't wait to try more of the menu.

_WNKNHIp60A17jLbRbJg2g.text: What a find! We really enjoyed dining at Nora's. We had a few appetizers and a few entrees. We had the Calamari Fritti and Arancini for appetizers. Both were delicious. Eating the Arancini with the basil leaf was yummy. As for the entree, we had the Frutti di Mare, Fettuccine Carbonara, Chicken Parmigiana, and Grilled Branzino. All of the entrees were great. Suprised that the grilled branzino comes in as the whole fish; which is an added bonus. There Frutti di Mare was one of best I had. After chatting with our waiter, Sebastian, who by the way was pretty awesome; made the dining more lively. He was very attentive and accommodating. I would definitely and highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful Italian dining experience outside the Las Vegas Strip.

lgWnr1cBoC7EBjQ5wrVCgg.text: Lets remember 3/5=average, 4/5=above average, 5/5=amazing. I give this place a 4/5 came here friday April 28, 2017 Let break it down...  Overall experience 4/5 Reason being we had a 7:15pm dinner reservation, however did not get seated until after 8pm and waited another 20 minutes for bread and wine.  Our appetizers didn't get to us until almost 9pm.  Our server was Jessica...She was amazing.  The problem wasn't her it was the lack of policy the restaurant doesn't have in regards to large party payments.  Being a waitress prior I understand that a party of 10 w/separate checks will happen, but poor thing had two parties of 10 separate checks we witness as she served different receipt books.  So needless to say we understood how busy she was, but my gosh it's a friday night, couldn't the party arrange something else, or the restaurant have a rule.  Then the funny thing was, Jessica finally got to us and the other party interrupted in the middle of taking our order and pulled her back to the table.  Jessica was very kind and apologetic, but the restaurant owners should really put a stop to large party separate checks on friday/saturday nights.  Service 5/5 Jessica was very friendly and delightful, you would have never have known her chaos unless you witness it.  She never complained and never showed it on her face.  Food 4.5/5 In between above average and amazing.  Octopus was my favorite.  I love the jasper grilled items, great flavor.  Atmosphere 4/5 It is VERY loud inside if full.  Waiting area was very small and crowded with minimal sitting inside.  The decor is new and fresh, which looks great.  If in heels the floor is slick! BEWARE.  I will be excited to come back and enjoy the patio area under better weather.  We had a great evening and will return again!

kZkIJ3FfJUzTjp3PWPRYTQ.text: I originally started to frequent this place because of a friend that worked there as a hostess. Since, she has left but I still continue to come here and it is my first suggestion when planning a lunch/dinner outing. I can honestly say nothing as changed about the food or the service and I can rant and rave about this place for days at a time.  Thank you for your consistency!  This place is amazing, you will not be disappointed with anything on their menu.

5Z0gslQUvutTJ_GEe3Wv-w.text: I love Nora's!  The ambiance is great, the service is good and the food never fails me.  Go early as the place is popular!

ikbgOxRW6jKHh2wB6md5tQ.text: Holy moly. Buckle up for a ride on the tastebud train. This place was so good. I took my MIL and FIL to dinner here on a Friday night at 530. My 4 year old was with my hubby and I as well. We all had something different. Veal scalopini, osso bucco, alla nora, traditional spaghetti and red sauce with sausage. (The last for my picky 4 year old). I have never seen my 4 yr old eat so much food and want more of it. The waiters were very attentive to all the fork and knife dropping of this little guy and brushed it off as nothing. My MIL and FIL are used to "dining well" at upscale places and this pleased them very much- eve to say- they would love to come back again. I had the all nora and had enough left to take home and have for breakfast:) served with an over easy egg- voila! Delicious breakfast for the win!  We had the Oreo ice cream and panna cotta- get the panna cotta!!! Big enough to share even though you won't want to. This family owned restaurant is a gem. TIP: Go with 5 -6 friends and reserve the secluded spot in the front with your very own door to close for the most privacy!

CsVPvOKAphZq_CfEwY09sg.text: Came here for my anniversary. Friends recommended this restaurant and for living here for over 15 years, I'm not sure how I never heard of this place! It's amazing!!! Food is made when you order it and tastes sooooo good. The garlic bread alone got me reeled in! It is pretty busy, even with a reservation we had to wait a bit. This is a tourist spot. So if you're a local you will have to deal with 'that' crowd. Our waiter was beyond words (sorry the name escapes me), he could tell we were celebrating and gave us a complimentary dessert. He definitely went above and beyond in taking care of us, along with explaining everything and recommending a great dish. This is definitely a new restaurant to add to our date night rotation.

744r1flFSyBWrWOqBtShsg.text: The food was very good, the service was bad. I would come back though.  Our group of three came on a Monday night with a 7:45pm reservation. We arrived around 7:30 and were seated around 8:15. The place was packed!  As others have commented, the garlic bread is a nice touch. The waitress took our drink orders, two glasses of wine, and two diet cokes. The wine came in little carafes to pour in your glass. My friend had about 1/4 of her Sauvignon Blanc left when the waitress came and took it away without even asking. Only one of us was given a glass of water. About halfway through the entree, a waiter came and took our diet cokes (which were half full), ostensibly to refill them. He only brought one back.  Two of us ordered the Wild Boar Pappardelle and one ordered the eggplant parm. The egglplant parm portion was huge. Both dishes were really tasty and reasonably priced.   I also noticed the staff walking around the restaurant were acting as if patrons were in their way and would push past you if you were walking between tables.  Our waitress did ask if we wanted separate checks at the end and said it would be "very easy", which I thought was nice as most restaurants discourage this.

Ho3p1YeOVJPyJSA2wZp-Zg.text: If your looking for a classic old school Italian feel off the strip with a solid place that's been around a long time... Nora's meets that standard. Good for groups with affordable prices, big plates and staff that seem to look familiar time after time. I've been to Noras enough time I feel I can write a review based on consistency.  Things I continue to order are octopus (tender and a slight Mediterranean feel based on accompaniments), veal cannelloni, add sausage with anything, and vodka sauce.  Many of the dishes I've tried were good in their own right.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tMQJXY2B-OtcXH0srQ5FzQ.text: We were big fans of Nora's at the old location. It was local, warm and friendly, and really felt like a family owned business. While service was a bit hit-or-miss at times, the quality of the food more than made up for it, and when the staff made mistakes, management was always quick to offer compensation. We always felt we were going to a friend's house for lunch or dinner. And there was a definite Vegas "vibe" to the place; one could imagine the old-time mobsters having a meeting at the back table.  Alas, the new restaurant looks and feels like a chain restaurant. The decor and atmosphere are similar to any Macaroni Grill. With the exception of the music (jazz standards, very nice), the restaurant could be picked up and directly transported to any large city in North America. The mobsters, I'm sure, have found another Vegas haunt. The romance is gone.  The food remains pretty much the same, if you're lucky enough to have it delivered before it gets cold! The service is dreadful. My first experience was take-out. The pizza was brought out first, and the hostess informed me that she was waiting on the chicken. After about five minutes, I asked if the pizza shouldn't be held someplace to keep it warm while waiting for the chicken - "oh, we have no place to do that." REALLY? The pizza was cold before I got back to the car! And although apologies were offered by the front staff, but no mention of any compensation.  We went for lunch, and experienced more bad service: We had to hail a waiter to get water and drinks after 15 minutes of not being acknowledged. We ordered pizza and chicken again, and a regular house salad. The pizza was lukewarm. I guess the same thing happened that occurred with our take-out order. The server never even apologized for his lack of attention (nor did anyone else). And the bill came to eighty bucks for pizza, chicken piccata, salad and two glasses of wine ((which we had to order by intuition; a wine menu was never proffered).  It's a damned shame to see a cozy, friendly familiar place turn into a cookie cutter chain restaurant. I'm afraid we'll be looking for a new Italian "joint."

zRhrYfOfdHMlYBJ6vjjdjQ.text: They moved to the new building close by. we were trying to order to go but PHONE doesn't work! PHONE doesn't work! PHONE doesn't work!! when we spent 30 mins to drive there the hostess told us the wait time for to go is 45 mins, if your phone was working our wait time could be 0 min. I would think the first thing you do when you change location is to be sure customer can reach you by phone and the new address? NOPE. Neither on their website or Yelp.

oANNO7_IePEpfsi-19C6NA.text: We will absolutely be coming here every time we visit Vegas now.  The bread and olives provided were amazing. (I ate all of the olives myself. Once I started I couldn't stop). We had a caprese salad as a starter which wasn't exactly to my taste but that's fine. It was something new that I was trying. Then I had the spinach white pizza for my main course. It was incredible. The waiter was so helpful and guided me to the correct wine choice for myself. Then at the end of the meal he surprised me with a desert that I loved as well(: I left fat and happy. I can't wait to go back.

Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach white pizza with sun dried tomatoes.

wvMSx9iaryvKwnB_XRGaEQ.text: I got the "crazy alfredo" and let me tell you, it's the best chkn alfredo, with shrimp, and sausage, cmon now!!!! And the garlic toast with. Make you wanna slap yo mama.

MtCB2S7yRbgWsWYPjJY8TQ.text: I came here on the recommendations of friends. The place is modern and not old school vegas, which I prefer. Really? if you go to an Italian restaurant in Vegas don't you expect to run into a few former members of Capone's gang?  So I appreciated the live music on a Sunday night and was hopeful. But the lasagna was run of the mill and a frozen lasagna at Trader Joe's would have been just as good. My suggestion is to pass up this place because there are better alternatives.

I759E60iYgMGUp9kJ0YPqw.text: The food was amazing as always! We had an amazing dinner and service was just as great!! I only gave 4 stars because the table busers were awful and had attitudes
