2HIoc9m8PWRNutrHQ6mOZw.text: A noisy Italian joint with okay food. I was expecting much better. Daughter had sea bass, momma had eggplant parmigiana and  I had linguini with clams. It was just okay. Big disappointment.  Dessert was good. Tiramisu. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend this trendy restaurant.

fzotb1ewi-mpOjbWn--CTw.text: Anniversary Dinner November 7 Great Authentic Italian Cuisine  Great Service very friendly and attentive staff and waiter, conveniently made online reservations we were seated right away upon arrival. Tip-register online receive 15 dollars off birthday. Portions are big enough to share. Value- big portions, quality food, low prices Free Anniversary dessert so goood! Ambiance -1star located in strip mall away from vegas strip, Ceiling tiles needed attention, No music Friday night scheduled for Saturday, Sat in small table in the corner. Locals come in shorts casual atmosphere, felt overdressed.

FKpoi1yuxPRA73tBLpZf1w.text: Good Italian restaurant where it seems like locals actually eat. I had a veal chop parmigiana and it was great, a large chop nicely presented so the bone did not interfere. Also had good spinach sauteed with garlic. Service was professional yet friendly. A really nice break from The Strip.

T_aPxuFlHWDs1G14OqrJeg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for years.  In fact I went with a friend who has been several times and highly recommend Nora's.  I finally went and to say the service was 'meh' would be an understatement at best.  I'm not one for negative reviews unless the experience was really impacted, but in this case it was.  It was birthday dinner and the server brought me a piece of tiramisu after the lackluster pizza with no cheese that she didn't mention.  I thought well at least this is nice, a birthday desert.  She literally tosses the plate on the table, my mouth opens to say thanks, and she abruptly turns and meanders away.  The entire night was the same, ok food, unattentive service, not really pleased I wasted a birthday dinner with family and friends here.  Better places in Vegas where the servers actually look you in the eye and spend more than 10 secons at your table.  My friend who has been several times even commented on how off the service was.  Shame.

ncAaY7e-bkN_3E9BnCojfg.text: A taste of growing up in vegas. I remember their expansions and now see they are planning a relocation. Came with my parents for a quick lunch. A shared salad, house red, and spinach pizza later. I realized Nora's has always been consistent with their food. Will likely come back each time I visit vegas.

JEeMhYiCC87Y6qaU5tEJyw.text: Great food and environment, went for my anniversary and me and my wife loved it. We were recommended from a friend.

EXaszt7ku_0oaX7IHw4Sqg.text: Been coming here two to three times a month for a long while now.  Great Italian food and drinks, with very generous portions. The lady and I always tend to order appetizers along with our entrees and we've never been able to leave without a takeout box. Nice classic drinks too, especially their Negronis and Old Fashioned(s).   I've liked most items I've had here food wise, namely: the rib eye, salmon, branzino and the wild boar ragu pappardelle.   I highly recommended calling for reservations/waits for parties greater than two during dinner time. They are pretty busy on the regular and even with the lady and myself we've had waits and had to go to the bar (not like that's a bad thing though).

UjmwZrYsaYmVnW8LVRVnqw.text: Nice atmosphere off the strip. Great food and service .. loved the calamari and pregame alcoholic drinks .. entree was delicious also

eIiCCH6VLQWNCtY_iZg5LQ.text: Ordered a "To-Go" order for a business luncheon today.  VERY disappointed!  We ordered two Italian Subs and they did not include the dressing.  The sandwich was too dry to eat.  The Veal Milanese was to be served with tomato and a house salad.  They forgot to include the salad and tomato, so all we received was a fried piece of veal without anything else.  They completely forgot the Mozzarella Caprese, so one employee was without a lunch.  Only ONE order out of the FIVE was correct!!  They didn't include cutlery, napkins, etc.  Their lunch was just embarrassing.

rAyAyZXEesiS8LFIj91eWA.text: On our second go the service was once again top notch.  Our server (Don) was very friendly despite being rather busy with several large parties to attend to.  The wife had the baked rigatoni,  I had the Alfredo cabanara.  Before this, calamari with caper sauce (ecvellent). Her dish was tasty, mine was a bit too salty for my taste (thus the 4 star rating).  Other than that it was an enjoyable time.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fz5kepUnmpIXLQzeO789aA.text: I gave heard about Nora's for years but never made it. Boy I sure missed out. I loved everything about this place. The restaurant is beautiful it reminds me if a Napa Valley fine eatery. We order a Cesar salad for two and split a baked rigatoni. The portion are huge. Excellent. The garlic bread is very tasty. Come with a big appetite as I'm sure you will over eat. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu. Yum. Service was great. Reservations a must

Fgi96Kr_JwtrnJ2E1yY5VQ.text: Have been wanting to try Noras for quite some now to experience the hype it's known for. Food was absolutely delicious (was a little disappointed they were out of clams) however our sever (Erica I believe was she name) talked us into the mussels with the lemon prep and WOW! The energy gave of very welcoming and family oriented. We sat outside and watched numerous patrons and families keep coming in (even though it was Memorial Day and were closed an hour early) Noras seemed to keep welcoming all! My only reason for 4 stars was the service overall was slower than expected however we will return and keep the hype alive!

eyl-0QHbd5OcqpMdtq_ijA.text: I have been Dining @ Nora's since the 90's ( Nora & Geno were there daily ) . I just devoured another Excellent Pizza ! Hand tossed with Pepperoni & Sausage ..mmmmmm  Doesn't get any better. I usually take it to go.  If you are planning on Dining there, I would recommend Resevations ! especially Dinner. The Lasagna and other Pasta Dishes are Delicious. Not to mention the Fresh Hot Garlic Bread. Getting Hungry ??? Give this Hole in the Wall, Diamond in the Rough Italian Restaurant a shot, You will Not regret it.

rlP1csLlZ0CxZ3Mtgwt-rQ.text: Everyone has to go to Nora's.  The menu is very well rounded with different proteins and salads.   The tiramisu was the best I have ever Had.  I will being my family here when they visit  Las Vegas.

RX6B3Qe9O0DZ34gc0sI3GA.text: Nora's was recommend by a friend and I will never doubt her recommendations again. This place is amazing food was superb, the drinks were top notch, the price point was way below what the food is worth. Hope that doesn't change when they move into their new digs. I will definitely be returning sooner than later.

2jtqJhcdOBDgXmvHkgcM0g.text: Overall, my experience at Nora's was solid, and I plan on returning. A little detail, and I'll start with weaknesses because they were (in my opinion) not deal breakers:  -The hostess who sat us was kind of a brat. I don't want to say she was rude, because she wasn't necessarily rude.. They were super busy, so maybe she was just in the midst of something frustrating. Anyway, her attitude just came off as bratty.  -I thought our waiter was going to be the same because of how he answered a question I asked regarding a menu item, but he ended up warming up to us (once the rush died down). -The layout is NOT ideal. It is crowded and busy. We ended up getting completely blocked in because they had to put a couple tables together to seat a large group, so that was a little frustrating for us and for our waiter. (They are moving soon, so I am assuming this won't be an issue once they move.) -It took a while for our food (~40 minutes for baked rigatoni and chicken parm). As with all of the above, I figure this was because of how busy they were (we were there at 8 pm on a Sunday, btw--we were glad we made a reservation!) Like I mentioned, none of those are deal breakers for me, but they are the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 this time around.  Now for the good.... THE FOOD OMG. The garlic bread was awesome. The chicken parm was good my husband loved it, I'm just not a big fan, as the chicken doesn't typically have a lot of flavor and I'm weird like that). The baked rigatoni was fantastic. The meat sauce was just like I remember growing up with Italian family--you could tell that it was cooked right, because it had that brownish color that a good meat sauce gets. The ricotta on top of the rigatoni was AMAZING. Just good, good food.  We are excited to return once they move locations (honestly, maybe even before that).

G8f7txsSidAlZWxyUZTd_A.text: Made 7:30 PM reservations and had to wait until 7:48 to be seated after asking the hostess 3 times. Food has always been good but I was disappointed on service.

AMQB3FHofXZPFdAq2o7Atg.text: Reservations? No reservations? Call-in's, no call-in's? Hmmmm... So do we call before we come or should we just come? Who the hell would know with this confusing establishment.  Been here twice now and this Saturday night was my finale. Teenage hostess attitude is totally unacceptable, unbearable and downright snippy and rude. I called to make a reservation and the teenage 'Flo' like girl says Im sorry we don't take reservations. So I come to restaurant and find that I am asked if I have a reservation. WTF! I tell her no because when I called in they said they don't take them. She tells me that'll be 40 mins. My party of 4 waits 15 mins at which time we are seated in the raised cafe bar tables. Super uncomfortable and should be removed from this establishment. I know the diner hostess put us there on purpose lol. Food was mediocre at best, meat sauce was bitter and left me night time memoirs. Sausage links were stone cold and entrees were all luke warm. To top that off, the service was absent and it took an hour to receive our meals. Seriously folks....your food and your tude just isn't deserving of my gracing your establishment's presence. This is not New York, nor is this a real Italian joint, so do your patrons a favor and drop the attitude about which customers you care for and which one's you don't. We as customers could give a care less about who you want in your restaurant, so treat them all with top notch service, food and respect. Oh and PLEASE get rid of the 3 Applebees Girls you have tending to the hostess station. They are losing you business and loyal customers with their condescending tone, attitude and demeanor.

WBqIDYgjQ2MRTqt8LpTqrA.text: Soon as i walked in... i was excited to start grubbin! Just by looking at the place you can tell its a REAL italian restaurant plus they had a check-in offer for free sangria!  First came the garlic bread. The garlic bread was just how garlic bread should be... crispy, buttery, and full of garlic! it was soo good we ordered another (the 1st garlic bread is free then $1.50 for each additional).   For appetizers, we ordered the Steak & Arugula Bruschetta which was a good change from the usual tomato version. It had thin cuts of steak with arugula & vinaigrette on top of french bread.   But the reason for the 3 stars is because of the entrees. K.L. had ordered the Linguini & Clams which were so bland! Surprising since the bread was so flavorful. I had ordered the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce, which was so much better than the linguini, but i probably would not order again.  The service was great and the place did get slammed right after we walked in so i would like to give Nora's another try... and another free sangria.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free sangria with yelp check in
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Arugula Bruchetta

35lSHMxm99ETtry6f-MRsg.text: My family and I came here for the first time because the reviews were really good. We didn't have reservations and that wasn't a problem got seated within 15 minutes. The hostess was friendly when seating us. We waited about 5 minutes before being greeted by our server and asked if we were ready to order. We then told him it was our first time here and would like some recommendations, he wasn't very friendly and seemed to be rushed. We got the ceaser salad that was way over dressed and tasted like an overkill of anchovies, we couldn't eat it. My husband had the chicken Milanese and was very bland and lacked flavor. I had the lasagna it was just ok but the pasta was very mushy definitely wouldn't recommend. My kids had chicken parmesan it was the best one out of the three dishes, but the marinara sauce could definitely have a little more flavor and seasoning. Never really saw the server around until he dropped the check without offering dessert or asking if we wanted or needed anything else which I wanted dessert, but when someone drops the check it must be because you don't want us to spend anymore money or appreciate our business. This is a huge pet peeve of mine. I was watching the server next to us and he was amazing at interacting with his tables and recommending dishes with wine and constantly being visible to where if his tables needed anything he was on it. My husband and I had to ask his name it was Donald he was amazing keep up the good job. So if you do decide to go there ask for him he will give you better service and a better dining experience. I probably wouldn't go back for the food wasn't great and the lack of service that was provided and with so many other restaurants in Vegas I would rather spend my money at a restaurant with delicious food and can receive an unforgettable dining experience.

UkQ1svpPgguqrJRa7qtFBA.text: I've been here alot and I'll go back a lot more. The food is ridiculously good. I usually get some variety of veal. Old school atmosphere, too. My favorite.

ifyrUuEyxsVxU_2_C1D7xg.text: The service was excellent, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was very pleasant. We will return next time we are in town.

9nPkoJWbDshqq6dBs7zc4Q.text: I've been here a couple times and it's just what you want in an Italian restaurant. You feel like you are having dinner cooked by mom. I've had several pasta dishes here and you really can't go wrong. When I'm in Vegas, I try and go here.

xEzIB_duUFXlqBUU38j_zA.text: Two stars only for the food. The food was great, the service was TERRIBLE. They told us there was a two hour wait when we arrived even though there were empty tables everywhere. Then we went online while there made a reservation for the same time and was seated. The wait time is a lie. They always have empty seats. Then they told the couple behind us 45 and another couple was seated right away. They are completely selective. They also charge four dollars to change sauces. The experience was terrible, only the food made up for it.

kLd8kvZQJIJcRSrnLKJhcA.text: This was my first visit to Nora's and it did not disappoint. We sat outside on the patio and started with drinks and appetizers. The antipasto was delicious and so were the risotto balls. I had the spinach cannelloni, my one friend had the crazy Alfredo and the other shrimp scampi. They were all incredible with very large portions. Service was great too.

NeYj9Y1f7cD2Zw3CSivOug.text: AMAZING! Real, authentic, Italian dishes! Boyfriend was looking for a great place to spend Valentine's dinner and heard great reviews on Nora's. We shared calamari as an appetizer, which came with a tangy marinara sauce. Which was delicious. I had the Rigatoni Bolenese and Eric got the Crazy Alfredo. Both we DELICIOUS! I highly recommend Nora's that's looking for some amazing, REAL, Italian food!

iR4XrT4tOhODf9CiNVK71g.text: I DON"T UNDERSTAND WHAT EVERYONE IS REVIEWING.  This is the equivalent to average pizza place food.  Maybe the garlic bread was decent and someone else wrote favorably about the crazy alfredo -- But if you're in the mood for chicken parmigiana or eggplant parmigiana -- You will be wildly disappointed.  Chicken Parm - BLAND, FLAVORLESS CHICKEN, FLAVORLESS SAUCE/GRAVY, FAKE CHEESE (Not real mozzarella)  Eggplant Parm - TOTAL MUSH and hardly any flavor in sauce either, FAKE CHEESE  Do I really have to spend $$$$ to get decent Italian in Vegas??!!  :(

7Y6r85i6dgjZcjxgFE5mbQ.text: As I mentioned before, this is my favorite Italian restaurant.  Since it is on the other side of town, I rarely get to come here and I usually do so to celebrate my birthday every year.  The past couple of years have been awful.  I went this past weekend for my birthday dinner.  I had mentioned to them that last year they didn't have the warm chocolate cake, and I pre-ordered two of them and double checked to make sure it wouldn't be forgotten again this year. Sure enough, our waitress admitted she forgot to put in the order.  So we had to wait a long time after we were done eating dinner just so I could have the cake.  This wouldn't be a huge issue, except that the service was so awful and slow the entire time.  We were there almost 3 hours because it was so bad.  If the food weren't so good, I would never come back again.  Please hire better servers at this place!

gDBRyu7tPcP0EBnznVWKNg.text: First time at Nora's this past Saturday evening and have to say it was all I expected. Generous pours on the drinks, knowledgable servers and excellent food. Was surprised by the number of large groups including one of 20 in the main dining room. Not sure if that's the norm. A lot noisier than I expected, including multiple renditions of "Happy Birthday". If you're looking for an Italian experience that's a little more on the intimate side this place may not be for you. Otherwise, all was good except that our request for a table in the bar area which was made at the time of reservation two weeks prior was not honored. Hence, we were forced to dine among the groups.

JNpIALv5bb6focY_QGn8jQ.text: This was a great place to stop in while I was in Vegas. The chilli was banging. The service I got was top notch because my cousin ordered something they didn't have and she went next door and ordered it for her.. now that's service.   Even the two restaurants were connected, but still the hostess could have said, "no, we don't have that" but she extended her service far beyond the norm. That's great customer service. She certainly was worthy of a bigger tip!

Stry5K_ApRxVBHIga7ZBFA.text: In Vegas for a soccer tournament. My friend went there the night before and had nothing but good things to say. Due to the 45 min wait, we ordered to go. Had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, angel hair pasta with meat balls and Caesar salad. We kept it simple, I know but these simple dishes were outstanding with flavor and cooked to perfection. The taste was above average and I could tell the chefs put a lot of time and effort on these "simple" dishes. Home run for sure.

goR1dEFqbIZ9nsswu9q9Ew.text: Best Italian food I've had in years.  Reviews are spot on! The Veal and Salmon delicious. It's another must stop and pricing is very reasonable.   Thank you for experience

wlrhiSHHBljan0ec6ju0hw.text: I've been going to Nora's for a while now. I absolutely love the food I can not complain about the food but I do have to complain on the service. March I was making a reservation I call the day of for a 6 o'clock reservation, I show up at the restaurant and I tell them I have a reservation and the lady says "I'm sorry i don't have a reservation for that name. Are you sure you called ?" She calls over another lady and they start to talk and I pulled out my phone and show then the call and how long it was and I named the person I talked to. The ladies seemed bothered but they apologize and still sat us. After that our waiter was super nice. My dad asked if they had this dish call chicken piccata because it wasn't on the menu and the waiter was super kind and said he would ask the chef. Turns out the chef could and honestly it's one of the best things I've eaten there. I'm never disappointed in the food but always something with the costumer service. This recently happened where we were seated the waiter came greater took our drinks then we waited for about 20 mins and our waiter never came back we had to ask a buster to call him the busters are always super nice.

UHtc2EsvyWyVxOoG0Rd4mA.text: Delicious, delicious Italian. I bring friends here from out of town because the food is great and the service is good enough.  Note also the great craft cocktails.  They're underappreciated but quite good.

7EwaixpBlJ7rgLdvC3ZI7w.text: I was looking for a basic, reasonably priced low key place for dinner on a Tuesday night with a coworker.  He didn't have any suggestions, so Yelp to the rescue.  This place was great: good value for the cost.  The quality of the food was good for the price, portion size was good: generous without being crazy.  I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan, my coworker had another pasta dish, I don't remember which one, but it had a meat sauce.  We split a Caesar Salad.  Wine selection was fine: plenty of options, good prices.  We didn't have room for dessert, but it looked tasty.   The garlic bread is garlic-y and yummy.  The service was excellent on this surprising busy night (we didn't have reservations, but opted to be seated immediately over by the kitchen).  Water got refilled promptly, people came by often to ensure we didn't need anything (almost, but not quite, too often).  Overall, I'd recommend this place for anyone looking to get a good quality, reasonably priced meal off the strip.  It's not super trendy or fancy, just solid food and service in a relaxed atmosphere.  Edited to add: it's not a bad idea to get a reservation if you're planning ahead.  We were fine sitting off by the kitchen, but if it were even just a little busier, we'd likely have had to wait for a table.

vmv_OzafHohWLVtpitGybg.text: Exceptional evening at this unassuming spot way off the strip.  In the private room our group  enjoyed the white pizza, Caesar salad, veal Marsala, carbonara, chicken parm and cannelloni.  Service was spot one..not too intrusive, well timed and friendly without being obsequious.  Traditional Italian dine extremely well.

n94jmJPxJXg-lNgwv1tUjw.text: First time at this place, and it is so close to one of the offices im sure I will show up again. We will start from dessert (the end) and work our way forward. The cannoli they make there is very tasty, so much I would be happy just coming into this joint for cannoli and coffee.   I came during lunch so I took advantage of the lunch menu, and although when the dishes came out things looked small, they were far from it. It reminded me of strega nona and her endless pot of noodles. I ordered the spaghetti and meatball (1) for 5.99 and was truly satisfied.  The bread is tasty they bring out, nice and garlicky and full of butter. The server for our table was the bartender, she was very attentive and took care of us well.   The other people in the party ordered veal parm and baked ziti, everyone was happy. :)

hY_giQCWV2ts5vnUNgaeGw.text: Always loved this place. Everything is always amazing, and the wait staff is always friendly. If you're in the neighborhood, don't miss out on this opportunity.

rBqYvh3tobjC1aCeRRLfHg.text: Crazy Alfredo.  There is one thing on this menu that is incredibly delicious, and that is the "Crazy Alfredo". First off it is a massive portion, should be eaten by two people, or one really hungry person.  It also travels as a to go item pretty well.  It's a mix of jalapeno, chicken, sausage, cheese and a great alfredo sauce. Very flavorful.    if you are there for lunch during the week, they do a great Ribeye with salad lunch portion that has fantastic flavor as well at a great lunch price.

QDTGgIFckk67rfCSi37VCg.text: As good as it gets in Vegas.  They do a fabulous spaghetti & meatballs, which to me is always the True test of an Italian restaurant.  Great marinara, which they'll spice up with crushed red peppers if ya ask 'em.  The garlic bread is fantastic.  My wife's a veal lover, and she's never been dissappointed there, francaise, parm or special.  Oh yeah,  don't forget a cannoli.  Freshly filled to order.  Gotta quit ... making myself hungry.

Bdf133rfbayY014BmGYg1Q.text: My mom wanted to try an Italian place while we were in Vegas and we thought the reviews looked good. It doesn't look very fancy from the outside but we were very impressed by the time we left! I had the Crazy Alfredo and have wanted it for every meal since!  I would eat at Noras every time I go to Vegas!

cZibPFyPeCIG75wqGQJ1Pg.text: If you love Italian Food you'll love Nora's! We were a table of three, my sister had the Shrimp Scampi, my husband had the Alfredo Fettuccine w/Shrimp & I had the Angel Hair Pasta w/Meatballs & Marinara. Delicious! As a rule I'm not normally a Fettuccini fan but I liked it! Our server, Bernadette & the rest of the team were wonderful - very friendly & professional! Next time we plan to sit on the bar side...more cozy w/the game on for my husband! If you are in the area stop by Nora's Italian Cuisine you'll be glad you did!

_jIOGnKJ4gY6PUwRY4hKSA.text: What are people talking about with this place? We were looking for a yummy alternative to the overpriced and/or overrated restaurants on the Strip and thought yelp would steer us in the right direction...not this time. The menu looked appealing and the wait staff were very nice. Unfortunately, the food left something to be desired. I had the tortellini with vodka sauce, My Darling had the chicken marsala, and our friend had the capellini arabbiata. The pasta was not al dente nor was it properly drained which caused the sauce to be watery. My pasta verged on the soggy...the wine choices and prices were pretty good though. While the food was supposed to be "home-style" and not haute cuisine, it was still lacking because the flavors and quality were not there. Generally, the only thing that was noteworthy about the food was that the prices were reasonable.   This place takes cards. There is plenty of parking in the lot.

h5D53Un1-U1864o_aKQQng.text: Best Italian in Vegas, hands down! And the sangria is to die for! Ask for Bryce!

QwLrZ74AAp9wxwWz9oDdFw.text: Meh, They used to be better. Now the prices gone up slightly and the quality lessened. Even in their heyday they were only "As good as it gets in Vegas" but that's coming from someone who grew up on good Italian American Cuisine.

0PJxy8DFIIhD5BLvRbRYSA.text: Amazing food at great prices. This is a little hidden gem here in las vegas. A great place for a first date or as a weekly hangout!... 5 Stars!

n91itRxMIOPb3GB6hPf74g.text: BEST meal we had in Vegas!!!  We wanted to find an authentic Italian restaurant for dinner on Xmas Eve.  WE"RE ITALIAN and want soul food for the holiday!!!  WE ARE SO HAPPY we found Nora's!!!!!  Food is wonderful and AMPLE!  We shared a salad and 2 entrees and still had food to take home for Xmas morning!  If you are visiting Vegas - GET OFF THE STRIP and go for GREAT food at GREAT prices!!!  We will go to Nora's EVERY time we visit Vegas from now on!!!

dstzgOHAFF1jrYlrlnN24g.text: Friendly waiters, good music(the standards) of course. Love the garlic bread, ordered the mozzarella caprese, delish and fresh. The Angus rib eye was nice and fatty, and the crazy Alfredo was big and sloppy with lots of sausage flavor. For desert we got the chocolate cake,  it was rich and hot it was drizzled in butter vanilla sauce and crushed pistachio.

6sImrt1HBO3JsurqR0bpwA.text: The food was excellent with pasta which i would say was homemade. Was with a party of six and we all enjoyed of food vey much but the service was horrible. If you go there and like eggplant check it out. My five year old and her friend loved the pizza and both had 2 pieces and some pasta which is great for little ones. Might have givven it five stars but they really must work on their service issues. By the way make reservations if your going after 6pm...

qRPdK1Szlm2c8PPj4c5t2A.text: I haven't found anything on their menu that I don't like. Suggestion: don't miss the Arancini (it is the best that you will ever have).

27fO8SGKGJ4A7oXynsJzXw.text: Pros: Amazing food, large portion sizes, great service, well priced Cons: sometimes long waits  Overall: must try!

qam10FkhOWQv7ljKAkNK7A.text: Delicious italian food!! And you would think that it is more pricy because of the quality of the food and the atmosphere, but it is really cheap for what you get!! I am in love with the white pizza!!

yGqxLcPMIKo_T2rHpWqBaw.text: A bit overrated. We waited for 35 minutes to get a seat and another 30 minutes to get the food. I understand it gets crowded during the weekends. But a half an hour wait was a little ridiculous. Im talking simple to make pasta dishes. Appetizer we ordered was ok. Pasta was a bit on the salty side. Prices are reasonable though. The not so great part was the service. Would have been great if they followed up our order.

P4N_hPeYv3I6_7RbjBBU0Q.text: CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!!!! H.K.L.'s review was right!(make sure you order it as you sit down to dinner, and leave room for a taste!)  Great neighborhood joint, felt like a long island restaurant, run by an Italian family that cares. Casual setting with good food.  Nice wine selection and the prices were good.

mGLA6gW4aF0pQJAUZ27k3g.text: This always busy restaurant reinforced for us why it is always busy! The service was friendly and efficient- food was excellent- we had the pork bellies and Caesar Salad; ravioli Alfredo (garlic!) and seafood pasta- Sangiovese wine complimented all-

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels w Pasta
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu! Perfect!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli Alfredo

ToZpHMl9poDqpwCoj-dWNQ.text: Great neighborhood restaurant! They moved in to the new building last month in September. Their new location is just a block away from the old one, conveniently on W Flamingo Rd & Duneville. The two level restaurant is surrounded with lots of parking spaces! Luckily we don't need to leave because of not being able to park our cars. It happened before at their other location!  The new building has plenty of tables and seats. On the ground level, immediately on the right side, you can find the full liqueur bar with seats, and tables in the same area. From this room there is an entrance to the upstairs dining room (still waiting to be finished, as of last week), and also there is an entrance to the outdoor patio dining area. On the left side they have another dining room.  They've kept the open kitchen concept, so the restaurant stays very casual.  The menu also stayed the same!  I'm very pleased to find their lunch specials unchanged, with same prices as before. I think the complementary garlic bread taste even better, knowing that at the end of your meal you'll be getting the bill, and no surprises!  Our lunch experience was very pleasant. Our waiter ( sorry, I can't remember his name) from Italy, took his time to talk to us, served our drinks and meals, and made us feel very welcome in the brand new location. I specifically asked for my sandwich to be prepared, and I got it perfectly right.  Due to food allergy, my BF also had a special request to skip certain items from the salad. He got his meal absolutely perfect. Our drinks were refilled by the busboy. Both waiter and busboys were very attentive.  We tried other menu items many times before (of course at the other location), but we are looking forward to coming back to dine here again.  Perhaps to enjoy some live music someday!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can play Bocce balls outside ...
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Italian sausage (lunch portion)
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside seating area

hwGly_FS-M1-WLbJdCv_Cg.text: I got the chicken Marsala and it was good. My husband customized his pizza while my son got his own lunch special meatball sandwich. Everything was good! I just could not alter my side with salad so I had to order salad on the side. Nevertheless we enjoyed our lunch experience. Staff were all friendly as well.

G69yoahL2Cl08HhDXjqFFQ.text: I have been dying to go to Nora's again. Very disappointed!! My husband and I ordered the chicken parmigiana. Not so good, took two bites and didn't like it!! The server said the chef changed the breading and added mint to it. Ugh what a mistake. Did not order anything else, it was over by then couldn't eat! We brought family from NY and luckily their dish, Linguine with clam sauce, was good ( so she said). I don't think we'll be back any time soon! Since they moved food is not the same:(

cpOQvTfwQGagAhh3wdVQpQ.text: Nora's has definitely carried over it's tradition of high quality food and excellent service to the new location. The dining room is a beautiful mix of brick and stone with a nice balance of wall art. Comfortable seating at large tables is available throughout. The background music combined instrumentals and vocals was at the perfect volume with the dining room people chatter.  We were seated immediately as our arrival was ten minutes prior to the reservation time. Service was spot on efficient from ordering cocktails , maintaining the water glasses and removing the finished items. On this evening the dining room was at full capacity and our server Kenia followed up on our satisfaction as she made the rounds.  The bread basket contained wonderful garlic bread so soft and warm. Hard to resist. My entree was a whole Branzino that was perfectly grilled. Crispy skin and moist inside. One of the best I have tasted. The fish was stuffed with sliced lemon and a sprig of rosemary. A few pieces of lemon  for squeezing made the fish outstanding. The dish included  tender and tasty  arugula which was the perfect complement.  My wife ordered the chicken piccata which comes with a side of pasta. The chicken was tender and the lemon wine sauce provided the perfect balance. Also the capers did not over power the dish. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the tomato sauce was simply delicious. Both items were large enough to share or in this case to take home.   It is extremely difficult to pass up Tiramisu in a great Italian restaurant. In this case we agreed to share. The size was perfect for two people. The dessert did not disappoint. A nice combination of flavors and light on the alcohol.  Congratulation to the Mauro family on the beautiful larger location with spacious parking. Look forward to returning in day light to play bocce ball.

FREvF-61YvEX9FUUg7NLfw.text: Finally we went after hearing so many positive responses about this place. Great place, amazing food and superior customer service. Definitely will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing branzino

ojtwpgKatwkukKiERUpMZA.text: I came here for my birthday and had the crazy Alfredo i was definitely pleased, but i stole a couple bites from my friends dishes which whereI the regular chicken Alfredo and the melrose pasta dish and sadly they both where lacking flavor it's was so BLEND as someone who has a passion for cooking and my love for food I honestly thought it would be better. I have to give my honest opinion Olive Garden chicken Alfredo has way more flavor !!

zMokLI7sTz24GY94nyQ3vg.text: Nora's been a favorite place for Italian food for a lot of my friends and even my manager. The first time I had Nora's, I was not impressed but fast forward about two years after my first visit, I gave Nora's another try. I'm glad I gave Nora's another try because I've enjoyed every visit thereafter.   There will always be a wait at Nora's. Always. I would suggest for you to make reservations if you know you want to go and have dinner there. Sometimes, if they are backed up and running late.. you will still have to wait about 10-20 minutes even if you have a reservation.   The food is really good depending on what you order. Their pastas are amazing. I always order a pasta with arribiata sauce, al dente pasta, and extra spicy. I love how they put a lot of garlic flavor into it and they give you a good portion. I always have enough to bring home for lunch the next day. The one thing that I've tried and absolutely do not like is their chicken, which is what caused me to not go to Nora's after my first visit. I had ordered a chicken parm dish and it just did not speak to me. Therefore, it doesn't matter if you get a chicken parm or if you add chicken to your pasta (I tried that too). Their chicken is just not good. Their chicken is pretty hard and dry..very very dry. Even when I have it in my pasta with a sauce, it is still dry.   Nora's also gives you the first basket of their garlic bread for free. Complimentary on them. It's really really good. It's usually toasted nicely with tons of garlic and butter on it. It's so delicious. We tend to gobble that basket up!  As for the service, it seems pretty average to me, especially when they get busy.   Overall, definitely worth a try, worth a visit...worth several visits. It's also great for families and friends to dine together!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with arribiata sauce and sausage.

dafgpeREjnWEtKKUh7D3DA.text: I wish I could give this place 5 stars! The service and my food was AMAZING. I got gnocchi with meatballs in vodka sauce. My boyfriend ordered veal and it was not the best. I thought it was too tough but he still ate it. We'll definitely be back, just not going to order that dish again.

I2y09PMuIMCUEverVqA5XQ.text: I'm the type of person that when I go somewhere and they have something good, I stick to that item. My girlfriend has taken me here for my birthday for the third consecutive year and for the first two I've always gotten the shrimp scampi with linguini. Which in my opinion, may be the best in town. For my last birthday I decided to switch it up(not entirely sure why) so I got the wild boar pappardelle and I must say it was probably the best meal of my entire life. Hands down!! It was so well balanced I couldn't understand it. Noodles were perfectly cooked, boar was so tender and not dry. Honestly I haven't stopped thinking about it for the past 9 days! Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Boar Pappardelle 10/10

DnsxM-Ij1rp6yuQcMNdvCA.text: The atmosphere is perfect. The food was delicious. The best eggplant parmigiana I've had. Alex, the bartender, was on point. She never missed a beat even with the variety of specialty cocktails being ordered at a constant rate.

xEMAOy36x9gEo-BMiToP6A.text: Sooo goood. At this time my sister, my brother and I went for my birthday dinner. We had the ossobucco, lamb and carbonara. Everything was delicious. We come to Nora's every time we come to Vegas. This place never disappoints. I highly recommend.

mCQZNb4JPr86na0hB9cCJg.text: This guy at the bar saw my to go ordered pizza and asked me to write a review of how it was. I ordered the margherita pizza but did white sauce instead. Every bite was amazing and I'm very happy with my choice. The girl on the phone helped me a lot too with my decision.

TAOqxqYYxToQvYH3s5ZmBA.text: Great food with a classic Bistro feel have a dining room.  Been there twice and love their calamari appetizer. Their meal portions are adequate does the service staff could still use a little bit of training and being more attentive

xlfZEG58UaicFYbFx2aWtA.text: My boyfriend and I went the day before Valentine's Day. This was our second time and we knew that it would be busy. Our reservation was at 7:30pm - they told us they were running behind so we did not sit until 7:50pm. Our waiter came by about 10 minutes later and took our drink order  I ordered the Red Sangria. Our waters and my boyfriends soda were constantly being refilled which was nice. After our conversations, our food came (lasagna and chicken parm), but I realized my cocktail never arrived. After awhile he brought it by and said it was comped which was nice. Overall it was an alright visit and the food was tasty! Just be prepared for a slower speed of service since this place is always packed and busy with hungry people!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

knhVjdeeTuCsVzjB41jYTA.text: I am eating now at the new Nora's location , place is way too cold and the light is son bright, makes you feel very uncomfortable !!!!!! For is the same , people are yelling at the bar !!!! I liked the old location so much better .  very disappointing . I WOULDN't recommend it anymore !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F8YK2MQLrtpCJ0qv9I3pNw.text: Still a pretty good spot for lunch. Something has changed in the kitchen. Previously the ribeye sandwich was to die for, last time I ordered it the meat was subpar, the Gorgonzola sauce was piled on top instead of melted in the sandwich and not very good at all. I still love their antipasto and the piccata is very good.

LQbIl6wI2L4DQV_xyu1CXw.text: Love love love Nora's. Service is almost always great. Drinks great all food either myself my family or friends has tried over the years is great . Consistently a great restaurant for big parties or just the 2 of you, but make reservations or be prepared to wait or pull up a stool at the bar if you can get one.

fdgFlDrT-TvgKHIISxTIPA.text: Nora's is an exceptional place for dinner and some drinks. The food is amazing and their alcohol selection is very good. The setting is very chill and it's easy to spend a few hours relaxing enjoying some great food with friends.

KMvi89C1-cFAhDybokFwFA.text: One of the best resturaunts here in Las Vegas. Not only was our service phenomenonal...the food way delicious! Our servers name was Don. He was very kind and attentive. You could see the servers focusing on the customers with genuine smiles and care! I ordered the Crazy Alfredo and it was very good!  Loved the kick of jalpeno in the pasta. My hubby ordered Chicken parm and a pie to go, he was happy! It was our first time there and we were thoroughly impressed! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo (shrimp, Suasage, jalapeno and more yumminess)

Q8fAdelH0r-bWRQsSVcDJw.text: Great ambience! Very lively patrons because it a place you want to visit more than once. Service and food very friendly and very good. Prices are very reasonable. 4 course meal and drinks $82.  Best panna cotta ever. If you are looking for Italian take an uber or an easy 15 minute bus ride from the flamingo straight to their door.  You won't be disappointed. Make an online reservation. Waited 2 minutes to be seated. Nice.

JQWwRwGDGkXjLgm7QtFh5g.text: Went here for Valentines dinner. Great experience! Staff are nice..   Started off with comp garlic bread which was a little hard, and wine. Food came out about 30-35mins after which I thought was a long wait, but it was Valentines and busy, so didn't really mind.   We weren't really impressed with the food though. I had the lobster pasta, i thought it was bland. Not worth the money. I'd choose olive garden next time I crave for some italian.

OpzWXnFlgyCJB8r3l6XL7A.text: Eating in this old school Italian restaurant you will feel a thousand miles from the Las Vegas strip.  I had to try this local hangout before it moves a few blocks away.  The house salad with Italian dressing, and the linguini with white clam sauce is one of the best combos you will find this side of Italia.  If you are looking to get away from the lights of the Las Vegas Strip this Italian restaurant will make you feel at home.

QZAbpqEZMvpTpgLO9t2fug.text: This has to be one of the best Italian restaurant's in all of vegas... nice little hidden gem... food is exceptionally tasteful... service was excellent... definitely coming back and making this a regular stop... I was with 4 others who also shared the same... Nora's Rocks!!!

6DEFbCsSjcPl99hSzQWfEw.text: If you like to eat where the locals eat and have an amazing meal too, come here! Nora's is authentic Italian with a rustic vibe, great wine selection and the service was excellent.

zATBOZ7Mk0pM5pnilyJfyg.text: JFirst time visiting the new location. Busy and vibrant. As we walked in the the door the sweet aroma of garlic danced in the air. Calamari Fritti was perfectly cooked, golden and tender. We shared the Chicken Carciofi which was excellent! Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lRUZowKX2ef7XAjqx_9iUw.text: Great authentic Italian food. We started out with some bread, doused with garlic and butter. We got mussels arrabrita in spicy sauce and the promodoro bruschetta which was a bit too salty but both very delicious. I got linguini with clams which was spectacular and the red sauce was perfect. My boyfriend got the frutti de mare with angel hair and that the best dish there. Plenty of seafood and perfect sauce. I look forward to returning.

LqjHRmrcq1q4NYVa3rSBnw.text: Dined there for Valentine's Day . I understand Valentine's Day is a big dining out holiday but we had a show and they were already a half hour late for our reservation so we dined at the bar , which we would have clearly rather sat down and had a nice dinner but we were time crunched , and they were late . The manager thanked us but that was it . Our experience was not exceptional in any way and the manager was giving out free champagne to a lot of other people who they were also clearly running late on there reservations but we got nothing . We didn't even have time to have dessert because the food took so long . We had to ask them to bring us bread even though it seemed like everyone else just got some . It was just frustrating when you decide to spend a special day at a restaurant and receive just a bad experience all together .

VYq6hC6y0XAoIvdtw0kKmA.text: Great Italian food!!!  This might be our Italian Go To from now on!  Nora's looks like an Italian restaurant out of the movies... looks a lil Godfather-ish on the 'right hand' side complete with a bar and live music...  We were seated on the 'left hand' side - still very good - Appears that this side is suitable for large groups...  Onto the food... Wow!  We were on family night... this is how it went down:  First we noshed on the (free - 1st round is free) Garlic Bread... I loved that they sliced the bread very thinly - it did not fill me up... it is all in the slicing of the bread that made all the difference to me & my guys... We also had the Calamari as our appetizer (Yummy - full squid and all!)  Mom (Me): Gnocchi w Vodka Sauce w a glass of Annabella Cab Sav ;-) Geo: Pasta Alla Nora Lu: Baked Rigatoni  Everything was very tasty & True to Italian Cuisine.  I rarely every give 5 stars... this would apply especially because of the area that the restaurant is in... not the nicest... However, Nora's makes up for it!  Since, I love to review I am sharing this - even though I do not want All of Vegas there taking up my space... lol  It was quite busy, however, there was still room for more... It was a Tuesday... I would say that if you are going any other day, like say the weekend, call and make a reservation & give them at least an hour or more notice...  Salute! Cin Cin!  your constant companion,  ~deirdra

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo Tartufo!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Allá Nora
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Rigatoni

vBx3wptujsUSXrQAnmTEKA.text: It's date night with Hunnie Bunnie and she's stumped on where to go! I've been trying to go to NEW places so I Yelped Italian Restaurants and Nora's popped up. I checked the menu and they have Frutti Di Mare! Clams Shrimp Mussels Calamari with red sauce and fettuccine! I'm SOLD.  I started with a glass of Red Sangria which wasn't bad - it was actually in a BIG ASS wine glass AND it was pretty strong. They also have a Yelp check in offer for a free second glass so I tried the White but I didn't like it - our server replaced it with another red one for me. Great!  They serve complimentary garlic bread which is SUPER garlicky so OF COURSE I loved it.  We started with a House Salad which wasn't bad. I ordered the Frutti Di Mare - Our server asked if I liked spicy at all and I said Yes! Make it EXTRA spicy. I ordered Spaghetti and Meatballs for Hunnie Bunnie and he asked if I would like to just do a Side of Spaghetti and Meatballs? Yes for sure!  The side came out and was the perfect size for her with one giant meatball on top.  Mine came out and the seafood was fantastic - LOTS of calamari and BIG mussels and shrimp! It wasn't spicy though so I dumped red pepper flakes on it.  The server was great and Hunnie Bunnie also loved it because they have paper table covers so she colored all over it. We also had dessert: Oreo Tartufu. Cookies n cream ice cream in a chocolate shell. HB LOVED it.

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo tartufu
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di mare
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of spaghetti w/meatball - perfect kids size.

vy5_lmWOyy-uDwJiNhESyQ.text: Nora's used to be my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. It was a little jewel in a couple of store fronts. The place was adorable, the staff was great and the food was off the charts. It was one of my "go to" places on every trip to Las Vegas.  Fast forward one year: Nora's has built a multi-million new building 3 blocks east of their old location. It is state of the art and magnificent! What they left at the old location was good service and great food.  When we arrived, we encountered two young hostesses at the front desk with an aura of disdain and boredom. They told us there would be a 30 minute wait, or we could eat at the bar or on the patio. It was a beautiful evening, so we chose immediate seating at the patio. It was lovely on the patio.  We waited for about 20 minutes and flagged a passing waiter. He said our waiter was too busy, but he would try to take our order and pass it along. Yes this really happened. Another 30 minutes go by and we inquire about the status of our  dinner and drinks, the waiter apologizes and about 10 minutes  later our drinks arrive.  Our waiter finally shows up with Nora's signature garlic bread. It was cold and soggy, yeech! Then our dinner arrived, even worse! It was tepid, aesthetically unpleasing and cold. It was actually awful.  We then tried to find grated cheese for our pasta, but gave up after ten minutes, asked for a check and paid for our mostly un-eaten, disgraceful meal.  Nora has really gone from the Ritz to the pits. A sad excuse of a restaurant.   Please bring back the good old days when Nora was the best Italian restaraunt around. Today it is a pretty shell with awful food and worse service. It actually makes Olive Garden look appealing.

q91JHil_88qj_3GgwAn4gQ.text: First time back since they moved to the new building. Very nice location, better seating, better parking, nice and new. Service was still top shelf, we were treated well. Food still awesome. I have no complaints with the new location but have to admit, I did dig the "cool factor" of the old hole in the wall. Agree that they needed to upgrade and they did it well. Congrats on the transition. We will keep visiting as long as the food and service remains like it always has been. Tip, make a reservation. Still a busy place.

EQRHa0xyjtDyGQ8bBFp80A.text: Wow. All my years I've been eating on the strip...and here was this gem!  Everything we had was good! We had the crazy fettucini, aracini and oreo tartufo. All destroyed!  Portions are big so share! Make sure you have reservations because this place gets packed!

yF2UXz7jk4UsIWNFaMfsJw.text: I had dinner with my Family at Nora's on New Years Eva and the food was outstanding!  I had the Ouso Buca and I would recommend it to everyone.  Just think this place started at a one room pizza joint and is one of the best finds in Las Vegas.  Next time you are looking for great Italian food, go to Nora's...........

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna Absolutely wonderful!
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Also Buco Delicious!

nC_I1vinrlfbUgu0OkRT5Q.text: We were in the private room and everything was AMAZING!  There was enough food to feed an army and everything was delicious!  Service was top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal with Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The feast

ab2VRJgqkxzdS8QgEKBjdA.text: Excellent Italian food. Not on the Strip.  They get busy and always try to seat you at the bar.  Good red sauce (not too sweet) Tender meats.  Reasonable prices.  Good wine list.

mDLnCxfaf2y4iuQpE6mzxg.text: I wanted to see what all the hype was about with Nora's. We went around 5:30/6:00 on a Thursday night and it was pretty calm but right as we were seated tons of people started coming in. The service was great and our waiter Kenia was fabulous! She always checked on us and the bussers were constantly walking by checking on us too! The only downside was the wait time to actually get your food but it was well worth. The portions were pretty big and the quality is excellent! We ordered salad to share, Crazy Alfredo, & Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken. All of it was great! I can't wait to go back and check out more!

photos.caption: Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Alfredo
Photo of Nora's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken

VTsIjRj7ACzUhxv_Ce6XBw.text: Nora's is a traditional locals' favorite. I just went to the new location and I had a great dinner.  All the food was on point and the drinks were good as well. I ordered the grilled branzino and it was amazing. My husband ordered the ribeye steak and it was perfectly cooked and great taste. On top of great food, they had live entertainment which made the atmosphere amazing, just perfect to want to stay and hang out. Love this place!

FFONPnCRZALl1wBNcdibcQ.text: The food was good.  However our wait time to get it at lunch was over 30 minutes.  We asked a couple of times to check on our order and nobody ever got back to us.  It was a Monday afternoon around one o'clock and not that busy.  I don't have that long to sit there and wait for our meal to be delivered and then eat it.  I had the Alla Nora and my husband had the Rigatoni Special.  If you are on a time line for lunch then really avoid this place.

wph_aoIUyPFvs01Ub6WJPw.text: The food was good, the servers kept wanting to clear our table when we were not done yet. The patio overlooks the parking lot and could use a lattice barrier with pretty lighs to give it a better ambiance. Candle lights would be nice on the tables since they act like they are fine dining. I would go back.

4sMkMbJh3HWI3Za1S3ZWeQ.text: Been wanting to try out the new place since I saw the building going up ! Super excited about it ! Used to dine at Nora's small place all the time . Friend from work and I decided to go this past Thursday night at 8 pm. The place was packed . We went on a wait and decided to take seats at bar when they opened up . I'm not a crazy yelper so I will just share my honest opinion ...We work at a small Italian restaurant on the Strip but we love Nora's and we couldn't wait to try the food, as he's never eaten here. Food was awesome . We shared a white pizza , mussels , truffle fries and bruschetta appetizer . Food was on point , hot , fresh and the bill was only $46 . Pasta will be next time as we will return !!! We had such a good time, we sat at the bar and laughed, talked, watched the game,watched the hustle and bustle of the night... only low point was the younger male bartender . Rudest service I have had in a very long time. Never once said hi to us when we sat down . We had to ask for menus , ask to order , sat with piles of dirty dishes at the end is our meals , he asked me to move my purse so I would not hit his shaker cups, just plain nasty. Have us dirty looks all night . I mean we were dresses nice, we are polite , we work in the business , 20+ years for me and 35 + for my friend , we didn't ask for anything but menus and to order. The 2 female bartenders were busting their butts back there. When we first walked in to hostess desk , we put out name on the list and went to bar to get a drink, the dark hair bartender , young was super sweet and made one kick butt martini, probably one of the best I have ever had . Me and my friend actually talked about it for 2 days! It was perfectly crafted . So all and all , the experience was awesome , I will be back and I'm super excited about Nora's but thought the bartender should be aware that he should be a little nicer to his guests . I mean I know we can all have a bad day but it was almost uncomfortable sitting there at the bar for some reason with him . Anyways Nora's you guys ROCK!!!!$

PH33XAV6oerBiaKSx1LZ1Q.text: Never again..... 7PM Table for 4 this place was so loud that we had to yell at each other.  Forget a nice enjoyable meal here!  Food was terrible. Of the 4 dinners we ordered 2 were sent back and 2 were not eaten. The Rib Eye steak was ordered medium rare.  It came  45 mins. later "extra well-done"  I couldn't even cut it, tough as leather! 30 mins. later another one came and it was cooked perfect.  But, still very tough. Cheap grade of beef !! My friend ordered Clams and Linguine. Surprise she got 1/2 cup of pasta & 3 clams in a big bowl that was so super salty she couldn't eat it.  That was sent back too.  The waiter suggested she try the Octopus instead. That was interesting when it came to the table there were 5 tiny round pieces the size of a quarter, weird sauce and 1/2 cup of cooked green lettuce in the center. Again not-edible.. Next  came the no taste Osso Buco ( from a crock pot) and the grand finale was my husbands so called Lasagna. There were about 6 bites hidden under  2 inches of melted cheese on the top. What a total waste of money almost $ 200 for only 4 so called dinners ( we did not order drinks or anything else).  Talk about feeling ripped off! I have never written a review before but, I really feel that if you are considering trying to have dinner here DON'T do it.

8FFOY8UHIwoVFYmB-KKsvQ.text: By far one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas! Love the new location and the service is still amazing! Thank you for a wonderful holiday celebration dinner!

BVCM-Px8QEb9UrC7Pv246w.text: Really good Italian food. The antipasto was absolutely delicious and the garlic bread was good too. My husband had the pork tender loin and I had the veal scallopini, delicious. I used the Yelp coupon for a buy one glass of sangria and get one free, I wasn't wild about this though since I have had better. All in all it was a delicious diner and we will be back.

TrQkMpDrTNLnsENwFDJTAg.text: Finally made it here with the boyfriend. He ordered the Crazy Alfredo and i had the Melrose with chicken.  They give a basket of really good garlic bread..i loved it because i like garlic but for those of you who dont..beware it has a lot of garlic chunks.  The pastas were good. Not bad...but pricey considering pasta cost nothing to make at home...which i did this week.  I was able recreate the Melrose add chicken and shrimp and made it better.  Overall...it was good. The Oreo Tartufa was ridiculous.  Id go back just for that!!!

JzKriHKIp9Qw7kAdwF1EWA.text: Food is great! Portions got a lot smaller pasta is not that expensive!!! And service is soo slow and almost painful!!! Customer service is very below par!!! New place would be great if you changed these things.

FXJtPiCAHt2QCaqRQ6FpzQ.text: The new building and space is very nice, the food delicious, however the service left something to be desired. My friend and I recently had lunch and were treated with a warm welcome, however the more time we spent the more the team seemed to be confused about who should be doing what, we had 4 different people serve us and not in a timely manner in the end we asked for a dessert menu and decided not, not knowing how long it would take to get desert. Then being in the event industry we asked to see the event space upstairs, a young lady from the hostess desk showed us the space and was very curtious in the beginning however then forgot about us in the end with no warm goodbye wishes she just walked away. I haven't been to Nora's for a little awhile and the first time to the new building-maybe they are trying to get used to their new space. Wont be rushing back, a little disappointed. Especially since I recently recommend to someone based on previous experience.

08hNFgp7kuc9iPZ6Ukk2Hw.text: BEST ITALIAN EVER!!! I have been coming here for years. The Arancini is the best thing on the menu. I get it every time and it's always amazing. Absolutely the best Chicken Marsala - but ask for no marinara on the side pasta, that way you can mix the pasta with the chicken. I love this restaurant. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

_yA2dp1LGgMUqQ9PKAbAlw.text: I came here for a rehearsal dinner for my sister's wedding last May. I have thought about going back to this restaruant ever since. I absolutely loved everything. I was able to try a lot of different menu items since it was a large party and they served us pre selected random dishes.   The antipasta salad, so delicous!!! I would say the best I've had anywhere. All the yummy meats and cheese with a great dressing.  Next we had Eggplant parmesan, so good and the best dish was the Baked Ziti. I never ever order this at a restaraunt but I've been in search of one as amazing as Nora's ever since. I thought I had been missing out on this dish for years but nope just the one at Nora's. Last but not least, dessert was served tiramisu and canolis. The canoli was amazing! I definitely recommend this restaraunt and will probably be back every trip I make to Vegas.

aQTQeiTpSANG5KronGty7A.text: I wish I could star-rate a restaurants food, service, ambiance, etc, as individual parts of the whole experience. The ability to do this would drastically affect this review of Nora's.  The food tonight was good. Not excellent, but it had some high points (gnocci w/ vodka sauce, veal scallopinni). However, other items lacked flavor, or in the case of the chicken parm, fell apart all together.   The hostess and bar staff were great. They handled the dinner crowd very well. We had a drink while waiting for our table. Once it was ready we were promptly transferred to the dining room. This is where things went down hill fast. Our server was waiting on my wife and I, a party of 16, and 3-4 other tables. We noticed she had a busser (Justin) and 2 other food runners helping her with the party. All this assistance should have freed her up to provide atleast a bit of competent service to our table and those around us. In the hour and twenty minutes we were in the dining room we interacted with our waitress 4 times.  1. Placed order for 1st cocktails, appetizers, entrees. 2. Delivered 1st cocktails, ordered waters 3. Ordered 2nd cocktail because we hadn't recieved food. 4. Recieved check.   Notice it wasn't our server who delivered our second drink or our FOOD!!! She didn't approach our table until we requested our check through the busser. When she did approach the table she asked how everything was tasting. There were no plates on the table because we has finished our dinner 10 minutes before.  My wife and I have no idea what she was doing the whole time we were there. Her large party seemed to be cared for mainly by support staff such as the food runners and the busser.  Unfortunately I cannot rate the individual parts of this establishment separately, so they receive 2 stars based on the dismal performance of our server and lackluster food.  However Justin the busboy is a 5 star employee. He never stopped moving. He turned tables with absolute efficiency and was incredibly professional in dealing with the customers. We observed him distributing  plates and flatware to the large party. Everyone was handed items individually, with an excuse me and thank you when he had to reach the opposite side of the table. We laughed when we observed another employee simply walk up and place a handful of forks and a stack of plates at the end of the table, and walk away just expecting the head of the table to pass them out. Fantastic job tonight Justin, we appreciated your effort.

fi9ewD73gzqg4RY-FXD-8Q.text: Quick update... Nora's is still amazing. Just got some dinner tonight and had to update you all on how amazing Nora's is. Have had Nora's almost every week since I first tried it on my birthday in August. No, I'm not exaggerating... literally almost every week. If you haven't stopped in Nora's yet or if you live in the area and haven't had takeout yet... make sure you do.

--E6jeGp0LqLqedt9n2kJw.text: Wanted to eat somewhere off the strip. Just picked a random Italian place and was pleasantly surprised.   Wonderful food and great service.    Great place

hYRPsQheTQNMBdkcyBZl8A.text: No one ever answers the phone. I have tried several times. The food was awesome and I want to get it to take home and never can. Sucks, I wish they would fix that!

jr5bAiXI6EGZ-5ZmF_3Zew.text: I was impressed with everything....garlic bread, chicken Marsala, pizza and the bread pudding was absolutely awesome!  Good prices too. Can't wait to go back.

O_4llZs6xG2rd_i2swNtIQ.text: I found out about this place way back in 2003. I'm a huge fan of Italian food so when my husband and I got married in Las Vegas I asked the locals where the best Italian Restaurant was and they named Nora's. Our first dining experience there was in 11/03, we live in California and every chance we get to go to Las Vegas, we always make it a point to have lunch or dinner at Nora's. One year we took a trip to Texas to buy a car, so when we planned our route back to California, we stopped in town for dinner, since it was during the holiday season, Nora's wasn't open on the day we went so we stayed the night in Las Vegas just so that we could dine at Nora's the next day, that's how big a fan we are!  I have become adventurous and have tried many items on their menu, it never disappoints. This past August we took our 6-year-old super picky eater to dine at Nora's. She still talks about it today, her cheese pizza with pesto sauce was the best she's ever had. My only wish is that I either lived in Las Vegas or that Nora's would move to California

cL7tY7RUB5CGCv-KDRb8wA.text: From the moment we walked in, the experience was fantastic. The delicious food was only matched by the incredible service. Large portions of homemade food at a reasonable price. If you want True Italian, you want Nora's.

h0oyahW-DhCRSG_r3RAKGw.text: We ordered the calamari for an appetizer. It was good and big portions. Bread was very tasty. We order pasta with clams dish. It was good but a little on the salty side. I would go again, but try something different.

ad6fMSeKSjoOUh9WqEjlfA.text: Still the best after all these years.  Moved out of town for a few years and just got back, so we had to go to Nora's for dinner.  It was outstanding, Anthony has been there for 7 years now and continues to provide unparalleled service.  Mussel's were large, plump and delicious, and the pizza, wow, I am still enjoying it today for lunch.  I can't wait to go back.

oETwWl2B8PC_Fv8JNfrqwg.text: First time dining with Nora's. Boyfriend made a reservation for 2 at 8pm. We arrive and place was packed! But we experienced no problem with our reservation and was sat to our table right away.  Items we ordered were: -Sangria was good but not memorable. (Awesome that you get a free sangria with yelp check in). -Complimentary garlic bread was soooooo goooood!! Hot fresh crispy yet soft bread lightly buttered and seasoned with fresh bits of garlic. Very addicting. -Caesar salad was good but I've had better. Greens were bright green and crisp. Fresh baked homemade croutons as well as pieces of garlic bread. Dressing wasn't too heavy on salad. Just tossed perfect. -Calamari was okay to me but the sauce it was accompanied with was good.  -Cheese ravioli with vodka sauce. Generous portioned Raviolis were nice and fluffy. Tender when cut. Vodka sauce was full of flavor. -meatballs were an option to add to your pasta dish or as a side. They were delicious and tender as well.  -Oreo Tartufo as dessert. It was pretty much an Oreo ice cream chocolate truffle ball. Was a little hard to cut into as first. Might want to wait till it melts a bit more. It was alright, nothing spectacular.  As far as service goes, it was excellent!! Our server had a smile on his face from start to finish of service and was very friendly. All staff seemed friendly, even a couple of the chefs gave us a warm smile on the way out.   A place with smiling faces and warm welcomes as well as great food is a "go to" in my book! Will be back soon to try other items!

jCOHcvL9QWmicOCQFIIPxA.text: Great hidden spot in the valley if you are looking for a local Italian restaurant.  The entire family loved it.  First, we were served fresh garlic bread as an appetizer.  When I say fresh, I mean you can actually watch them make it in the kitchen when you walk in.  Second, the sauce is good, which is always important.  The spaghetti, Tomato & Basil, and my Veal Parm all were good because of the gravy.  In top off that, my veal was tender.  Finally, my wife had the Crazy Alfredo, which apparently was the highlight of dinner.  She talked about it all night.  I was happy with the service too.  Our waiter was patient with me taking time with the wine order.   I was also happy they took our leftovers and boxed then up for us, which is always a plus.  Will definitely be going back.
